MsgSummary: This is your first mission in Teos. One of the Beika Guards has asked you to hunt down a few of the {c1}Small Thief Monkeys{/c} that have attacked the village shops. You have to hunt down five {c1}Small Thief Monkeys{/c} and report back to the Beika Captain.
MsgComplete:
Welcome back. How have you fared against those {c1}Small Thief Monkeys{/c}? You look pretty tuckered out, but I can't deny your skill in battle.

Alright then, let me give you another mission to complete.
MsgTake:
Hey there, newcomer. Are you looking for a mission to hone your skill? I may have something that can help us both.

Lately there have been thieves wandering around the shops in the village, more frequently than they have in the past. It's no wonder the merchants have been so enraged over this situation. But having them take their anger out on us gets old. They act as if they're the only busy people around here.

Anyways, after a thorough investigation, it turns out the culprits were {c1}Small Thief Monkeys{/c}, so your first job is to track them down and give 'em a taste of steel. Once you finish this mission, report back to the Beika Captain, and he'll give you your next mission. Take care.
MsgWelcome: This is Beika, a Human village.
MsgIncomplete:
The thieves appeared again yesterday, so the sooner you act, the better.
Just focus on dealing with this problem for now and you'll be alright.

MsgSummary: The Beika Captain has asked you to hunt down the {c1}Foxes{/c} that are responsible for the disturbances. You have to report back to the Beika Captain after you've taken care of all five foxes.
MsgComplete:
Ah, I didn't anticipate so soon a return. You're brezing through these tasks far faster than I'd expected.

I will acknowledge that your skills are good enough. Congratulations, you have done an excellent job.
MsgTake:
I don't think you've quite shown me the extent of your abilities yet. This time, you'll be facing much stronger enemies.

Foxes living near Beika are very cunning, so it's not an easy task to deal with them. Recently, foxes have been sneaking into Beika every night and causing a lot of disturbances, like making a mess of our barns. Please get rid of these troublesome foxes and return with news of your success.
MsgWelcome: A newcomer, eh?  Well, I'm always glad to have an extra pair of hands around.
MsgIncomplete: Have you taken care of those foxes yet?
MsgResponse4: Have you taken care of the foxes?

MsgSummary: This is your first mission in Teos. One of the Aelbeageu Sentry has asked you to hunt down a few of the {c1}Small Thief Monkeys{/c} that attacked the village shops. You have to hunt down five {c1}Small Thief Monkeys{/c} and report back to the Aelbeageu Sentry leader.
MsgComplete:
You have made quick work of those pesky Thief Monkeys, and in doing so have done a great service for this village. You have my thanks.

In fact, I think I have another mission you'd be a good fit with.
MsgTake:
Welcome to Aelbeageu, the City of the Elves. You look like you've just begun your journey. If you're looking for a mission, I may have something to keep you busy.

Nowadays every shop in this village is suffering from thievery, and merchants are taking their rage out on us. Rumor has it that the shopkeepers are reluctant to even open shop, but can we blame them?

Anyway, we finally discovered who was behind these thefts. The culprits are the {c1}Small Thief Monkeys{/c}. Catching these monkeys will be your first mission. After you have finished this task, report back to the Aelbeageu Sentry leader. I'm sure he'll also have something you can busy your hands with. Take care.
MsgWelcome: This is the Elven village, Aelbeageu. Welcome.
MsgIncomplete: The thieves hit the shops again yesterday. It'd be in all our best interests if you acted quickly on this.
MsgResponse4: Hello there stranger, what can I do for you?

MsgSummary: The Aelbeageu Sentry leader has asked you to track down troublemaking {c1}Foxes{/c}. After you hunt down five {c1}Foxes{/c}, you must report back to the Aelbeageu Sentry-leader.
MsgComplete:
Animals are a part of nature, so it saddens me to hunt them down. However, this had to be done for the safety of the village.

You have shown a suitable level of skill in battle. Once again, I really appreciate what you've done for our village and its residents.
MsgTake:
I have a mission that will serve as a fine mark of your skills in battle.

The {c1}Foxes{/c} of Teos are very nimble; one of the most agile creatures in the forest. We are concerned that they will appear again tonight. Recently, they've been showing up in the temple and causing a lot of trouble.

Please return after you've thinned their numbers. I'll wait for you to return.
MsgWelcome: You're not from around here, are you? Welcome.
MsgIncomplete: Have you taken care of those foxes?
MsgResponse4: Have you taken care of those foxes?

MsgSummary: Find Billie's brother, {c2}Charlie Lake{/c}. Charlie is working in a barn outside of the East gate of the village.
MsgComplete:
Hmm...I don't think I recognize you. Is there something I can help you with?

Well, are you out to save the world and all that good stuff? If you don't mind, I could use your help.
MsgTake:
You'll find a barn to the east of the village. My brother is working there.

He's been in a weird sort of mood lately. He looks so depressed these days, I wonder what's happened. He always used to be such a cheerful guy, too. Can you try to figure out what's wrong with him?
MsgWelcome: You're not afraid of anything, are you? If you want to pass through here, you'll need my permission.
MsgIncomplete: What are you still doing here?
MsgResponse4: My brother is responsible for the security of Beika village. He's very brave; always says he's ready to face any kind of monster or beast.

MsgSummary: You must find the lost {c3}Stall Key{/c} and return it to Charlie. He's told you he lost the key near the {c1}Thief Monkeys{/c}. You should start by finding a {c1}Thief Monkey{/c}, because it's very likely they've stolen it. Thief Monkeys can be found right in front of the barn.
MsgComplete:
You've finally returned! I knew those damn Thief Monkeys stole it!

I'm going to return this to Uncle Lette right away. When I grow up, I want to be a hero that helps people, just like you. Once again, thank you, and good luck.
MsgTake:
Actually, I'm glad you came; there is something bothering me. My job is to feed these horses in this barn. Uncle Lette helps out in the barn a lot.

Perhaps that's why he trusted me with the Stall Key while he was away taking care of other business.

However, the truth is, I lost the key while I was playing in the field outside of the village. {c5}(Whining){/c} I can't find it anywhere. Come to think of it, there were a lot of monkeys roaming around in that field.
 
What am I going to do?! Please help me find that key. Otherwise, Uncle Lette will punish me and I'd lose his trust forever.
MsgWelcome: My brother is responsible for the security of Beika village. He's very brave; always says he's ready to face any kind of monster or beast.
MsgIncomplete: Did you find that key? I haven't been able to sleep at night since it's been gone. What am I going to say if he asks for the key back?
MsgResponse4: Did you find that key? I haven't been able to sleep at night since it's been gone. What am I going to say if he asks for the key back?

MsgSummary:
You have to find an Aelbeageu guard named {c2}Gion Usrite{/c}.
Gion is guarding the gateway of Aelbeageu, located to the northwest of the Aelbeageu Sentry leader.
MsgComplete: I don't recognize you - what brings you here, stranger? Ah, you've probably heard I'm in a little trouble and came to offer assistance, right?
MsgTake:
You ought to go to the village and meet more of the citizenry. Maybe you'll find someone needing help there. Since you're new and don't know exactly what to do, let me help you out.
 
There is an Aelbeageu guard named {c2}Gion Usrite{/c}. I hear he's been looking for someone to help him. Apparently, he's in some sort of trouble, I hope you can help him out.

Gion is posted at the Aelbeageu gateway. Why not go on down and find out if he can use your assistance?
MsgWelcome: Hello newcomer; pleased to make your acquaintence.
MsgIncomplete: Gion is a guard posted at the gateway of Aelbeageu, located to the northwest of here.
MsgResponse4: Hey, you wouldn't happen to have a relic or an ancient antique by any chance, would you?

MsgSummary: You have to find the {c3}Old Key{/c} Gion has misplaced. He said he lost it where the {c1}Treeshade Monkeys{/c} are. It is likely that a {c1}Treeshade Monkey{/c} took it, so start by pursuing that line of investigation. You can find them in the field in front of Aelbeageu.
MsgComplete:
Ah, thank you very much! You found my key safely.  Please, take this as a token of my gratitude.

I'd be very grateful if you could visit the village and help some of the residents with any problems they might have. I've heard Sonya and Tmic have a task that needs doing.  Why not pay them a visit later?
MsgTake:
{c5}(Voice full of anxiety){/c} Indeed, I've been looking for someone who can help me.

My hobby is to collect antique artifacts. A little while ago, I discovered a very precious-looking key. It captured my attention more than anything else. Ever since I found it, I have always kept it with me.

However, I accidently lost it a few days ago while I was patrolling the area a little ways away from the village. When I went back to search, I couldn't find it anywhere near that area. Since I lost that key I haven't been able to eat or sleep. Please; you must help me find that key!

I think I lost it when I was around the area where the {c1}Treeshade Monkeys{/c} reside.
There is a chance it'll be there, so try to sweep that area again.

Good luck to you!
MsgWelcome: Hey, you wouldn't happen to have a relic or an ancient antique by any chance, would you?
MsgIncomplete: Hey there.  Any luck finding that lost key yet?
MsgResponse4: Hey there.  Any luck finding that lost key yet?

MsgSummary: After obtaining five {c3}Durable Leather{/c} from the {c1}Field Boars{/c}, you have to give them to Kei. You can find Field Boar in the field to the Southeast of the village, near the Watch Tower.
MsgComplete:
Wow! You've already gathered them all? You're more skilled than you look!

Here, this is a reward for your accomplishment. I'll give you another mission later. 
Thank you. <Reward for Fighter, Defender><Reward for Priest>
MsgResponse1:
Wow! You've already gathered them all? You're more skilled than you look!

Here, have this gift, and be sure to take good care of it. I'll be sure to ask for your help again in the future.
MsgTake:
Hey, you! You seem to have a strong arm and a keen eye, so perhaps you can help me.

Recently, I've wanted to make at least one set of high quality armor. I'm still missing one crucial element to complete this masterpiece.  To make it I need {c3}Durable Leather{/c}. This can be acquired from the {c1}Field Boar{/c}. Without this leather, the final product won't meet my ideal standard of quality.

Of course, I could go find it by myself, but as you can see, I have to keep this shop open for the Villagers. All the customers would complain if I left my shop empty - you know how it goes.

That's why I'm asking you to do this for me. Don't worry about the reward, it'll be great!

I shall await your return.
MsgWelcome: A woman's mind is very deep.
MsgIncomplete: How goes your progress? I mean, how many {c1}Field Boar{/c} have you caught?
MsgResponse4: How goes your progress? I mean, how many {c1}Field Boar{/c} have you caught?

MsgSummary:
You have to kill {c1}WindTail Forest Wild Boars{/c} and take five {c3}Durable Leather{/c} to Sonya so she can use it to make Armor.
You can find a {c1}WindTail Forest Wild Boar{/c} in the field to the Southeast of Aelbeageu.
MsgComplete:
Ah, this is some good leather you've gathered for me.  Thanks.

Here, take this as a gift from me. You can use it as you see fit.

<Reward for Mage><Reward for Ranger, Archer>
MsgTake:
These days, I'm dying to make at least one set of high-quality armor. However, I'm missing a crucial ingredient I need to finish it. I want to go out and find this ingredient, but unfortunately, work keeps me too tied up to go anywhere.

{c5}(Staring at your face){/c} Customer, I'm really sorry to bother you, but could you possibly help me with this? All you have to do is find the {c1}WildTail Forest Wild Boars{/c} and return here with five {c3}Durable Leathers{/c}.

They're easy to find too! All you have to do is leave this village, and go down to the East. There, you should be able to spot the {c1}WildTail Forest Wild Boar{/c} pretty easily. You will be perfectly safe as long as you mind its tusks. A good rewrd awaits you upon your successful return, so go for it!
MsgWelcome: You are here to buy something? Then make it quick! Don't just take forever deciding.
MsgIncomplete: Hmm, have you collected everything already? Is that even possible?
MsgResponse4: Hmm, have you collected everything already? Is that even possible?

MsgSummary: You have to find the {c2}Botane Farm{/c} to the South of Beika, and talk to {c2}Noel{/c}, the head of the farm, when you arrive.
MsgComplete:
Greetings traveler, how are you doing? I'm a headman of this farm; Noel's my name. I'm a bit old, but I still feel young every time I meet someone new, haha!

Anyway I hope you rest well while you're here. Maybe you can help with a few chores, eh?  Haha!
MsgTake:
Are you traveling? Then I recommend you drop by our Botane Farm on your way!

The people there are nice, and you'll no doubt be impressed by the headman's kindness. I used to be a traveling merchant, but I was captivated by the residents of this village and decided to live here. Though, my job here can get somewhat trying at times. 

The headman will give you a warm welcome if you tell him you've met me. Well...he'd do the same for a total stranger too. Make sure you stop by our Botane Farm and find the headman {c2}Noel{/c}.
MsgWelcome: What're you looking fo,r friend?  We try to keep our shelves stocked, but sometimes that's difficult.
MsgIncomplete: Botane Farm isn't that far from here. You should stop by there if it's on your way.
MsgResponse4: Welcome to Botane Farm. My name is Noel; I'm the headman here.

MsgSummary: Jessica has given you a lunch to be delivered to {c2}Wilson{/c}. Wilson will be in the field just to the north of Jessica.
MsgComplete:
Hmm, this is from my daughter Jessica? Sure, of course I'll take it, but what's happened to my girl?

Really?! My daughter sprained her ankle? I'm sorry, I have to get home as quick as possible. Thank you very much! {c5}(Rushes off){/c}
MsgTake:
Hello, I'm really sorry to bother you. I know this is the first time I've meet you, but I have a favor to ask. My name is Jessica. 

I was about to leave to deliver a lunch to my dad, however I sprained my ankle while working a little while ago. Due to this swollen bruise, I can barely walk anymore. I don't think I can get there with my leg in this much pain.

I know if I don't take this to him, he'll end up skipping his meal. If it's okay with you, can you deliver this to my dad on my behalf? My dad is Wilson; he works in the field close to here. I really appreciate your help; I won't forget your kindness.
MsgWelcome: I love delivering lunch to my dad. He seems really busy lately.
MsgIncomplete: The lunch is going to get cold if you don't hurry up!
MsgResponse4: Did Harrie blame the weather again for not showing up? Well, looks like my friend is still lazy.

MsgSummary:
Joey asked you to punish a {c1}Field Boar{/c} for ruining the crops. After hunting down five Field Boars, you need to report back to Joey.
You can find Field Boars near the Tower where Joey is standing.
MsgComplete: I knew you could do this. Thanks!
MsgTake:
{c5}(Looking pleased){/c} Hey there...you look suitably heroic. Would you mind putting your superpowers to use helping me out with a little problem I have? 

Joey's my name; I live on Botane Farm not far from here. Why am I here, then??  Well, {c1}Field Boars{/c} broke into the farm several days ago, and the farm has been a complete mess ever since! They trampled on sprouts and dug up everything we worked so hard to plant!

Village guards are also too busy, so they said they can't help us. It was pretty fortunate that I ran into you right in our hour of need.  So how about it; will you help me out?
MsgWelcome: What can I get you, visitor? We have nearly everything!
MsgIncomplete: Please be careful, the Field Boar is a lot stronger than previous monsters you've encountered.
MsgResponse4: Well, I hope this quest doesn't BOAR you, haha.

MsgSummary: Wilson asked you to get rid of the {c1}Dwarf Bandits{/c}, who have been troublesome to village residents. You have to dispose of five dwarf bandits and report back to Wilson. You can find Dwarf Bandits around Antaraks Farm.
MsgComplete:
These Dwarves' brutality has diminished dramatically thanks to you.

Antaraks Farm has been through a lot due to those dwarf bandits; we've taken quite the beating. I hope you can help residents of Antaraks Farm. This is a reward for all of your help, thank you so much!
<Reward For Fighter, Defender><Reward For Priest>
MsgTake:
I've been dying to meet a hero like you to ask a favor of. Please listen to me if you have the time.

From time to time, Dwarven Bandits have been storming in the path around the farm. They have not only been attacking passing travelers, but also been stealing items and livestock from this village.

We also took measures against them like raising the fence or kindling torches, but they didn't work. These bandits don't seem to be afraid of us at all. That's why we need a strong hero like you! Please take care of these accursed Dwarf Bandits.
MsgWelcome: Did Harrie blame the weather again for not showing up? Well, looks like my friend is still lazy.
MsgIncomplete: Have you taken care of those bandits yet?
MsgResponse4: Have you taken care of those bandits yet?

MsgSummary:
Dispose of {c1}Bulbous Eyed Foxes{/c} that have made a mess of our woodpile.
Then collect ten {c3}Fox Tails{/c} and return to Chess.
You can find the Bulbous Eyed Foxes to the East of the village.
MsgComplete:
Heh heh heh...you showed those foxes a true taste of their own medicine!

Thank you, I own you one. I won't ask you to do the same thing twice. 
Here is your reward; I hope your journeys shall ever be merry.
MsgWelcome: Oh dear, This is too dangerous. You shouldn't come near me like that when you use a saw.
MsgIncomplete: Hey, did you send those foxes fleeing?
MsgResponse4: Hey, did you send those foxes fleeing

MsgSummary: You must return to Daniel after eliminating the Discus Sealakel Family that has been harassing travelers. You have to wipe out three {c1}Discus Sealakel Summoners{/c} and three {c1}Discus Sealakel Fighters{/c}. You will find them near the bridge to the East of Beika.
MsgComplete: Ah, well-done! I really appreciate your help. May Etain's blessing be upon you!
MsgTake:
I need the help of someone brave - do you think you could aid me?

The Elven Village of Aelbeageu is not far from Beika. Ever since the Elves made a sacred alliance with Humans, the exchange between two races has steadily grown. This established a friendly relationship between our village, Beika, and Aelbeageu. Now many people come and go for business and short trips between the two villages.

However, a number of ill omens have happened recently. Ruthless monsters are attacking innocent travelers around the bridge on the way to Aelbeageu, without any reason. I don't want any more travelers to be hurt, please help us settle this problem.
MsgWelcome: I pray that Etain will be always with you. The Goddess has guided our paths to cross.
MsgIncomplete: Have you finished what I asked of you?
MsgResponse4: Have you finished what I asked of you?

MsgSummary: The headman of Botane Farm wants you to find {c2}Timber{/c} in the Arbor Farm. Timber is a lumberjack in the Arbor Farm. Arbor Farm is a timber village located to the west of Botane Farm.
MsgComplete:
Ah, a new face! Welcome, traveler. You must be tired from a long trip; rest yourself here awhile.

So, you came up from Botane Farm, eh? So, you must have seen Mr. Noel.
Is he still as lively as always? I haven't seen that old man for years, haha! Anyway, welcome to Arbor Farm; pleased to meet'cha.

People here are always busy, and we're short-handed, so you'll have no problem finding a job here
MsgTake:
I heard you really helped Wilson out. As a headman of the village, I want to personally thank you for what you've done.

If you wanna take a look around other villages besides this one, why don't you stop by Arbor Farm once? You might find the place to your liking.

Go and find Timber once you arrive at Arbor Farm. Timber's always welcoming to strangers; he greets every new face like they're an old friend, y'know.
MsgWelcome: Welcome to Botane Farm. I'm a headman here; name's Noel.
MsgIncomplete: Haha...you look like you're up for staying here a little longer!
MsgResponse4: Timber knows everything when it comes to logging. If you want to know how to fell a tree, there's no better man to teach you.

MsgSummary:
We do not know exactly where {c2}Lotus{/c} is located. He left to find a 'Singing Tree', and now you must find Lotus.
You will hear singing on your way toward the northeast from the Fanselenon Institute. You have to search for the Big Tree. Just follow the singing, and hopefully you'll find Lotus near the tree.
MsgComplete:
Ah, did you come here to find me?

Please, you must help me! I'm truly in need of your aid!
MsgTake:
There is an old tree called the 'Singing Tree' to the Northeast of here, the Fanselenon Institute. This is a legend that even wandering minstrels once sang about. I'm guessing you've heard this tale at least once before, yes? 

As it is told, the 'Singing Tree' will sing a beautiful song for people who come near it, but those in whose minds evil lies will be harmed by the music. That's why no one here dares to go there, even though the story is as famous as any faerie's tale. A little while back, there was this guy named Lotus who said he wanted to seek out the Singing Tree - I think he was a few swords short of an armory, if you know what I mean.

He's been gone for quite a while now, and nobody has heard from him since he left. Well...that's what everybody expected. I even remember the day he left, because he kept going on about how he'd tell us all about the Singing Tree when he returned.

Anyway, Mulus of Aelbeageu has been worried about him and told me to find him no matter what happens, but I'm not particularly inclined to do it. Would you mind seeking out this wayward fool in my stead?

According to the legend, you can find the Singing Tree somewhere to the northeast of here. If this legend is correct, you may find it rather easily because you should be able to hear the tree Singing when you draw near it.
MsgWelcome: If you make a fuss, you might get the boot from this village, so be mind
MsgIncomplete: Have you managed finding that fool yet?
MsgResponse4: {c5}(Looking painful){/c} Help... I need help...

MsgSummary:
Lotus said he was paralyzed by the curse of Woods Spirit, Trine.

He said {c2}Narus{/c} the Alchemist would know how to dispel the curse, and has asked you to meet Narus in the Fanselenon Institute and explain what has happened to him. Now you have to return to {c2}Narus{/c}.
MsgComplete:
I'm quite busy, what's wrong? Ah, so you found Lotus?

..Trine laid a curse on him? Tisk tisk, What an fool.
MsgTake:
I...I'm frozen here due to the power of a curse! I was a fool to approach the 'Singing Tree' from the very beginning. There was no way the sacred spirits of the woods would take to a rowdy fellow like myself.

Well...I HAVE had time to think about my behavior, though. I want to go back home and visit Mr. Narus! If anyone would know how to remove this curse, it'd be him!

I know we just met, but I'm begging you, can you tell the Alchemist Narus from the Fanselenon Institute what happened to me? Please tell him I'm under the curse of Trine, the spirit of the woods. Ah, I hope he'll know how to dispell this curse, I'll await your good news - it's not like I could go anywhere else, anyway~
MsgWelcome: (Looking painful) Help.... I need help...
MsgIncomplete: Have you told Mr. Narus my story? What did he say?
MsgResponse4: You can ask me anything about Alchemy.

MsgSummary: You have to find ingredients for the medicine to remove Lotus's curse and bring them to Narus. The medicine requires ten {c3}Leaf Powders{/c} from the {c1}WindTail Forest Tree Guard Spirit{/c}. You can find WindTail Forest Tree Guard Spirits around the Fanselenon Institute.
MsgTake:
Trine, the spirit of the woods, is known for both her warmth and coldness. She values the 'Singing Tree' more than anyone else, and must have felt very irritated by Lotus's imprudent curiosity. 

He never heeded my advice before, yet now he's begging for my help? Ho ho, he must be very desperate indeed! Anyway, I will do my best, because this is my job.

First, I need ingredients in order to make this medicine. You have to get ten Leaf Powders from the {c1}WindTail Forest Tree Guard Spirit{/c}. Let me lend you my ability for a while, because you will need to refine these spirits.

{c5}(Narus casts a spell and you feel the warm spirit spread through your body as he places his finger on your forehead){/c} Ah, there we go. Now, go and refine their spirits and bring them back to me.
MsgWelcome: You can ask me anything about Alchemy.
MsgIncomplete: Do you have the materials I asked for?
MsgResponse4: Do you have the materials I asked for?

MsgSummary: You have to give medicine made by Narus to {c2}Lotus{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Oh, wow! Is this that medicine Narus made? Thank God, Now I go back home...!

Thank you, Thank you...!  Let me give you something as a token of my gratitude. No need to be shy; go on and pick what you want!

<Reward for Mage><Reward for Ranger><Reward for Archer>
MsgTake:
{c5}(holding out a vial){/c} Now, give this to Lotus. It will weaken the the hold of Trine's curse over him.

I diluted this medicine on purpose because Lotus didn't listen to my advice.

But...that's just between you and me. Don't talk about this to Lotus. Just tell him it can remove the curse, so he'll take it without complaints.
Anyway, after this is all over, Why don't you come back here and see me? I need someone to take care of something for me, and I think you'll work out nicely.
MsgWelcome: You can ask me anything about Alchemy.
MsgIncomplete: What, why are still here? Go on and take this medicine to Lotus.
MsgResponse4: (Looking painful) help....I need help...

MsgSummary:
After eliminating the Dwarves that occupied Keiroter Mine, collect 10 Copper Ores and give them to Mustin.
Once you capture a {c1}Keiroter worker{/c}, you can obtain the {c3}Copper Ore{/c}. You can find the Keiroter Mine north of the village.
MsgComplete:
Ah, you've done a fine job indeed. Look at all this high-quality copper you've brought.

You have my thanks, friend. Here - take this reward. Don't be modest - you deserve it.
MsgTake:
Our village is a miners' village. We dig up ore from Keiroter Mine, and just sell or process them to make a living. This village used to be quite the hectic place, always bustling with people. Shops were numerous, and traveling merchants were always peddling their wares in the streets.

However, those foul dwarves have stolen our mine from us. Thanks to them, our supply of ore has dwindled dramatically, and people who were once able to make a living have had to leave this area.
Unless we can dig up ore, all we can do is steal it. That's all we simple miners know. At this rate, though, it'll only be a matter of time before we become beggars.

I ask your help, traveler. Please get rid of these dwarven bastards in the Keiroter Mine and retreive some Copper. I beg you!
MsgWelcome: Leona is my neice. When I see her running her own shop, it fills me with pride!
MsgIncomplete: Did you bring some Copper back from the dwarves?
MsgResponse4: Did you bring some Copper back from the dwarves?

MsgSummary:
You have to get rid of {c2}10 Keiroter Miners{/c} and {c2}10 Keiroter Skilled Masters{/c}respectively.
Then return to Mustin again.
You can find the Keiroter Mine north of the village.
MsgComplete:
Hahaha! Those dwarven knaves can take their picks and shove 'em! Finally, We can mine the ore again without worry.

It's all thanks to you; couldn't have done it without your help! Now, use this wisely, and have an eventful journey!

<Reward for Defender><Reward for Fighter><Reward for Priest>
MsgTake:
You showed your incredible skill and bravery - I was truly impressed! I know this must sound shameless, but can I ask you one more favor? LIke the old saying goes, "If you're gonna be hanged for thievery, you might as well have stolen it all." I say now that we've got 'em tense, we ought to lay into those bastards and really wake them up.

Can you take care of some Dwarf Captains occupying that mine? If you do as good a job this time as last time, I will give you a useful weapon in exchange for your efforts. 
I'm counting on you!
MsgWelcome: Leona is my neice. When I see her running her own shop, it fills me with pride!
MsgIncomplete: Did you take some Copper back from Dwarves?
MsgResponse4: Did you take some Copper back from Dwarves?

MsgSummary: You have to obtain {c3}10 Bearskins{/c} and give them to Sharnie so that they can be used as Hunter items. You can find the {c1}WindTail Forest Brown Boar{/c} north of the Hunter Camp.
MsgComplete:
Ah, you returned. These are some fine leathers you've brought me. Thanks to you, I don't have to worry that we'll run short of items anymore. Thank you very much.

Here's a reward - I hope you'll find it useful. May Pantera's blessing be with you.<Reward for Ranger, Archer><Reward for Mage><Reward for Fighter, Defender>
MsgResponse1:
Ah, you returned. These are some fine leathers you've brought me. Thanks to you, I don't have to worry that we'll run short of items anymore. Thank you very much.

Here's a reward - I hope you'll find it useful. May Pantera's blessing be with you.
MsgResponse2:
Ah, you returned. These are some fine leathers you've brought me. Thanks to you, I don't have to worry that we'll run short of items anymore. Thank you very much.

Here's a reward - I hope you'll find it useful. May Pantera's blessing be with you.
MsgTake:
I'm a hunter, Sharnie's my name. I'm in charge of food, clothing, and shelter here.

Recently, many people have come here, so we are running out of items. There is no doubt we'll be in trouble in no time if things go on like this. If it's okay with you, could you help me?

All you have to do is just collect 10 Bearskins from the WindTail Forest Brown Boar. They are getting fierce these days, so you should be careful. I'll be waiting. May the luck of Pantera guide your footsteps.
MsgWelcome: My name is Sharnie, and I'm a hunter. May Pantera, God of the Hunt, be with you.
MsgIncomplete: Did you collect all the leathers I requested?
MsgResponse4: Did you collect all the leathers I requested?

MsgSummary:
You have to dispose of zombies hanging around Cornwell's Ruin. After that, you have to return to Alicia. Eliminate {c1}4 Cornwell Forest Zombies{/c} and {c1}4 Running Water Zombies.{/c}
You can find Cornwell's Ruin northeast of Alicia's location.
MsgComplete:
Thanks. You've done a wonderful job. I hope those destined for Etain's bosom need suffer no longer

This is a reward in exchange for your labor. Again, thank you.

<Reward for Ranger, Archer><Reward for Mage><Reward for Fighter, Defender>
MsgResponse1:
Thanks. You've done a wonderful job. I hope those destined for Etain's bosom need suffer no longer

This is a reward in exchange for your labor. Again, thank you.
MsgResponse2:
Thanks. You've done a wonderful job. I hope those destined for Etain's bosom need suffer no longer

This is a reward in exchange for your labor. Again, thank you.
MsgTake:
Have you ever heard of the legend of the Dianoia Clan? They are the cursed clan that summoned the evil spirit Sunting Manaburn to the world with a forbidden spell in the ancient days, and caused the war of blood.

After the war ended with the Elves victorious, the Dianoia Clan was in danger of extinction. They managed to escape to the PlusWooper Forest, but soon after, the place they were hiding was sealed off by Iudex. The Cornwell Temple was built above that very place.

However, as the war has dragged on, the supervision of the seal has been neglected, and its power has waned. As a result, evil spirits are welling up from the earth.

I think the zombies around Cornwell Ruins have some sort of connection to this. We have to stop evil spirits from escaping through the weakened seal. Please dispose of these zombies!
MsgWelcome: I can fulfill any task sincerely entrusted to me.
MsgIncomplete: Did you dispose of all the zombies?
MsgResponse4: Did you dispose of all the zombies?

MsgSummary:
You have to find {c3}5 Yellow Reagents{/c} and give them to Narus. You can get them the Yellow Reagent from the {c1}WindTail Forest Wood Spirites{/c}.
You will find the WindTail Forest Wood Sprites near the Fanselenon Institute.
MsgComplete:
Ah, thank you for your service. Finally I have everything I need. Then let's begin...

{c5}(Narus begins working by mixing several things){/c}
MsgTake:
Then let me tell you what I need you to do. There's one crucial element missing in the medicine I'm making. I usually take care of things myself, but I'm pressed for time, because someone needs this urgently.

The name of herb is...
no, It's too long and difficult to remember. It's just a Yellow Reagent. You can obtain it from the WindTail Forest Wood Spirites.

Please get it quickly . I'm counting on you.
MsgWelcome: You can ask me anything about Alchemy.
MsgIncomplete: How far is it? Its taking longer than expected.
MsgResponse4: How far is it? Its taking longer than expected.

MsgSummary:
You have to take the Yellow Regent made by Narus to {c2}Earl Blendy{/c} who is in the Hunters Camp.
You will find the Hunters Camp where Earl Blendy is to the northeast of the Fanselenon Institute. You have to be careful because the path to the Hunter Camp can be dangerous.
MsgComplete:
Ah, Narus has sent you here. Hmm, I have been waiting for this medicine. Finally, I can begin what I prepared..

..Surely you are not waiting for my detailed explanation, are you? I suppose you came here for the first time. Why don't you take a look around slowly? Take this as a sign of my gratitude for what you did. Farewell.
MsgTake:
Finished. You are still here? It appears you aren't busy at all. Then I have one more favor to ask.

Have you ever been the Hunters Camp before? Many Elf hunters, including a strong girl named Earl Blendy, are living there. Please go there and give her this vial to Earl. A little while ago, she asked me to do a job. I asked why she  would need a medicine like this. She just answered with a smile. Well, I have a rough idea of the reason, but I didn't question her anymore 'cos I was worried that I might hurt her delicate feelings.

So, you want me to tell you what this is? Hmm, It's just a theory, but it will be probably used to calm animals. Oh, dear! I have wasted too much time with this useless explanation. Earl will be waiting. Don't just stand there, leave at once...!
Oh, one more thing, you can use this Torin fruit in case of emergency.
MsgWelcome: You can ask me anything about Alchemy.
MsgIncomplete:
The path to the Hunters Camp is dangerous.
Take care.
MsgResponse4: Drats! Another failure. I have no idea what is wrong.

MsgSummary:
Tashy went to find his old friend, {c2}Kelten{/c}, and asked him if something happened.
Kelten is living alone in the island of Ezellin Lake surrounded by Keolloseu.
If you swim through Lake, you can get there easily. Look for Kelten near the windmill.
MsgComplete:
...Stranger, this is not a village. What are you doing here? Did you come to see me? Oh.

..Well, on second thought, there was something I need a hand with.
MsgTake:
These days, there is one thing that worries me...  Do you know what it is? I think something happened to my best friend, Kelten..!

Kelten used to be my co-worker. We were with the shipmaster, Mr.Mark. Of course Kelten hated him, haha. Now the shipmaster and I are still doing business here, but Kelten is living on the island by the lake.

Sometimes I stop by and give him things he might need, but I haven't gone there for a few days because I was too busy. I don't know why exactly, but I feel that there may be something wrong with,hmm..

He is very self concious. If you say I asked you to help him, he will decline your help. Just go there and ask him discreetly what has happened.
MsgWelcome: It's an honor to help the shipmaster like Mr.Mark! Pick up anything you want!
MsgIncomplete: eh, Didn't you leave yet?
MsgResponse4: I'm not going to talk to you, so just get lost..!

MsgSummary:
Kelen has asked you to find a stolen {c3}'something'{/c}. If you catch the Siracel, 
{c1}Delano{/c}, you can find it. You should give anything you obtain from Delano to Kelten.
Delano is hanging around the island with his followers.
MsgComplete:
Ah, I found the right place.  Good, good.

This is what I exchanged with Tashy when we met for the first time in the Pirates' Gang.  Now, I own his, and he owns mine.

Nothing is more precious than TRUE FRIENDSHIP to pirates! Remember this, matey!
MsgTake:
To tell the truth, a little while ago, I lost a certain 'something' I've been holding onto ever since I became a pirate.
To be more precise, it was stolen. And well...that's a pretty shameful thing for a pirate to let happen to him.

I have attempted to get it back several times, but I couldn't do it. My strength isn't what it used to be. Besides, his escorts are always following him around, so it's not easy at all. {c5}(after scanning from head to foot){/c} Well, you don't look too shrimpy to these 'ol eyes.

{c5}(in a pleading tone){/c}. Can you retrieve what I lost? I'm beggin' you. His name is Delano. He's a Siracel, and you can find 'im wandering around Ezellin Lake.
Just make sure to watch out for his loyal goons, y'hear?
MsgWelcome: Why am I bothering to talk with you? Get lost now, y'hear?
MsgIncomplete: Did you dispose of Delano? What happened to the thing I'm looking for?
MsgResponse4: Did you dispose of Delano? What happened to the thing I'm looking for?

MsgSummary: Kelten has asked you to deliver the letter to {c2}Tashy{/c}, who has probably been worried. Your mission is to return to Tashy in Keolloseu and deliver Kelten's letter.
MsgComplete:
Ah, you've finally arrived. How was he? {c5}(after receiving a letter){/c} Ah, it's Kelten's letter! I knew he'd recognize me.

He must be doing alright, considering he wrote a letter and gave it to you....thank God. If only I had less work, I would go meet with him in a jiffy.  Thanks for your help!

<Reward for Ranger, Archer><Reward for Priest, Mage><Reward for Fighter, Defender>
MsgTake:
{c5}(realizing you are about to leave){/c} Hey, did you find me because Tashy asked you to? Ah, you want to know how I could've guessed? Isn't it obvious, when you came to find me without even knowing who I was? Guys like Tashy often do things like this.

I'm fine, so tell him not to worry. He won't believe it, 'cause he worries too much, so take this letter from me along with you.

I appreciate your help in all of this. Fare thee well.
MsgWelcome: I'm not going to talk to you, so just get lost..!
MsgIncomplete: You're still here?
MsgResponse4: It's an honor to help a shipmaster like Mr.Mark! Pick up anything you want!

MsgSummary:
Timber the lumberjack has asked you to deliver a {c3}Box of Wood{/c} to a blacksmith, {c2}Duke{/c}. Keolloseu is the large village located in the middle of this area.
Duke is very shy, so he's hiding surreptitiously inside of a building. You will have to search for him.
MsgComplete:
H...hey, what are you doing here? {c5}(after looking at the box){/c} Ah, d...did you come here because you owe Timber a favor? Well then, you arrived just in time.

Well now...looks like you did a fine job. I'll give you some of the m....money I get from Timber. Here, take this.
MsgTake:
I appreciate what you have done thus far. Thanks to you, all the residents were able to regain their energy and go back to work again.

I acknowlege you're a trustworthy man, so I want you to deliver this to Duke the blacksmith, in Keolloseu. Duke and I have been business partners for a long time. Anyone who used the tree of Arbor won't ever forget it's superiority.

If you haven't been to Keolloseu before, I recommend going. It is a very lively village in the center of the Ereumana area. Please deliver this to Duke while you enjoy the beautiful scenery~
MsgWelcome: Ask Timber if you want to know how to chop down a tree. He knows better than anyone else, heh.
MsgIncomplete: Duke will be waiting. Please go to Keolloseu and deliver the box to him.
MsgResponse4: Who is this? Why did you come here?

MsgSummary:
Duke asked you to find {c3}7 Canines of Brown Bears{/c} so that they can be used to make a present for his wife. You can get the Canines of Brown Bears from {c1}Forest Ranger Brown Bears{/c}.
You can spot the Forest Ranger Brown Bear among the rocks on the left side of the Keolloseu north exit.
MsgTake:
If Timber sent you, I suppose I can trust you as well. Do you think you could do me a favor, if you have the time?
I need a presend for my wife, Eris. Our 5th wedding aniversary is coming up soon, so I want to do something nice for her so that we can ce...celebrate this day. She has been so good to me, I'm always thankful to her, but I a..am horrible at talking....

My wife went to the capital, and will come back in 15 days. I want to m...make one small ring, since I'm a fairly handy with craftwork and such.{c5}(Duke goes red and mumbles){/c}

So Please get me 7 canines of b....brown bears. You can obtain them from  Forest Ranger Brown Bears. I'm counting on you.
MsgWelcome: Who is this? What do you want?
MsgIncomplete: Is it too hard to find them?
MsgResponse4: Is it too hard to find them?

MsgSummary:
Look for a wolf, {c1}Lupers{/c}, that killed the Elf girl, Rosian. Dispose of it and give {c3}Skull_of_Lupers{/c} to Rosian's spirit.
You can find Lupers among the wolves if you go across the bridge beside the Beacon Mound.
MsgComplete:
This is the Skull of Lupers.  So, you killed that old wolf, huh? I really appreciate your help.

...I'm still sad because even with this, I can't come back to life again.
MsgTake:
There is nothing I can do because I already left the this world. However, I want revenge on that beast that killed me! Lupers..!

Please give that vile wolf, Lupers, a painful death..!
MsgWelcome: Who are you? This place is freezing...
MsgIncomplete: Did you kill Lupers?
MsgResponse4: Did you kill Lupers?

MsgSummary:
This is a favor for Priest Batan. 
Find a clown named {c2}Raudi{/c}, and listen to what he has to say about the box he's seen.
Raudi the Clown is living in the Beacon Mound near Cornwell's Ruin.
MsgComplete:
Huh-huh-ho! I'm Raudi the Clown; what can I do for yah?

Ah, you wanna know about that box, dont'cha now?
MsgTake:
Once, in the ancient times, there was a cursed family. Nobody remembers their exact name, but the reason their existence is still talked about is because of one of the mysterious scrolls they have kept for generations.

It holds a spell that can summon an evil soul. Because this spell requires a dangerous cost, even that family couldn't use it and had no choice but to simply store it in their safekeeping.

However, one sily human of that family used that spell for his own ends and vanished into thin air because of the curse of Etain. After that, Etain put that scroll into a box, sealed it off, and hid it somewhere in Teos.

Recently, one man described a box similar to the one in the tale. If it really is true, this is a BIG deal. This means the seal placed on the box has been weakened. We have to strengthen the seal again as fast as we can.

If possible, you should look for the guy who witnessed that box and listen to his story.
Find this box, if possible, and bring it to me. The name of this person is Raudie, and he is living in the Beacon Mound near Cornwell's Ruin.
I'm counting on you.
MsgWelcome: My name is Batan, a priest in the service of God. What has brought you here?
MsgIncomplete: This is very urgent. Please, move quickly.
MsgResponse4: I have both a happy story, and a sad story. Which would you hear first?

MsgTake:
Hmm, 
I was kidnapped once by a Goblin gang on my way to this village. Until then, I had thought that Goblins were only interested in shiny or glimmering things.

The people abducted with me were all killed. Apparently, they were not eaten, but used as a sacrifice for Goblins rituals. I succeeded in flattering them, and somehow survived. In the end, I managed to escape.

I saw that very box when the Goblins was performing the ritual. During the middle of ritual, they pulled it out and bowed down in front it.
One fellow who looked like a boss among the Goblins was carrying it.

We couldn't understand their bizarre language, but that fellow was called something like 'Buglar'. If you capture him, you'll likely be able to obtain the box. Then take care.
MsgWelcome: I have both a happy story, and a sad story. Which would you hear first?
MsgIncomplete: The name of the Goblin you're after is Buglar.
MsgResponse4: My name is Batan. What brought you here?

MsgSummary:
Batan received the requested box, but it's locked tightly. 
You have to find {c2}Jimm Royer{/c} and give this box to him, and he will make a key.
You can find Jimm Royer if you go southwest of Batan's location.
MsgComplete: Ah, a customer? What sort of key would you like made?
MsgTake:
{c5}(with an arduous look){/c} Hmph...this won't open easily at all. It's true the seal has been weakened considerably, but apparently the power of the scroll has been weakened as well.

We need to find a person able to make a key that can open this box. Please give this to Jimm Royer and ask for his help. He'll have no problem making a key that fits this lock.
Traveler, please deliver this box and my message to Jimm. I'm eagerly awaiting the result.
MsgWelcome: My name is Batan. What brought you here?
MsgIncomplete: I'll be waiting.
MsgResponse4: Hey there. I'm a locksmith by trade.

MsgSummary: We have to return to {c2}Batan{/c} with the {c3}Sealed_Ancient_Case{/c} and {c3}Elaborate Key{/c} made by Jimm.
MsgComplete:
You came back sooner than I expected. Very well, let's open it.

{c5}(Putting the key into a hole and giving the key a turn, the box opens with a screech.){/c} 

Ah, I can't help but admire Jimm Royer's skill. I intend to destroy this scroll.

Traveler, I was able to find the scroll with your help. Thank you. I hope you accept this small token of my gratitude. May Etain guide you throughout the rest of your journey.
MsgWelcome: I'm a locksmith.
MsgIncomplete: I already made a key. Take it to the priest and use it on the box.
MsgResponse4: My name is Batan. What brought you here?

MsgSummary:
Lord, Kail of Keolloseu asked you to discourage the Orcs. Dispose of {c1}7 GrimAxe Orc warriors{/c} and {c1}5 GrimAxe_Orc Sorcerors{/c} and return to Kail.
The Orcs are living together in groups both north and southwest of Keolloseu village.
MsgComplete:
May Dayfly's guidance always steer your path!

You did a really excellent job. Finally we regained the courage to fight again. Thank you, traveler. This is just a small token of my gratitude. Please accept it.
MsgTake:
Welcome. I often heard about your story from Mr. Daniel in Beika and Mr. Mulus in Aelbeogeu. They said you're talented and promising, so I have one favor to ask of you.

GrimAxe Orcs are living together in groups, destroying things both in the north and southwest forests of village. We should do something about this.
Hero, can you somehow discourage their efforts with your valor and strength?
MsgWelcome: I'm a local officer in Keolloseu, and a half-Elf. Kail is my name.
MsgIncomplete: Did you eliminate the Orc groups?
MsgResponse4: Did you eliminate the Orc groups?

MsgSummary: Coward asked you to teach a harsh lesson to the noisy Goblins located in the Rimus Vally. You should capture {c1}10 Stonepick Goblin Sentinels{/c} and {c1}10 Stonepick Goblin Chasers{/c} and return to Coward.
MsgComplete:
Oh, You have returned. Now I'll be able to sleep a bit more easily at night!
{c5}(With a worried look){/c} Hrmm...I know I ought to give you a reward, but as you know, a poor watchman like me doesn't have all that much money to his name.

I hope you'll be satisfied with this.
Take care~
MsgTake:
Excuse me, traveler. You look pretty competent, and I'd like your help with something.

If you head up toward the northwest a little bit from here, you can see a camp where brutal Goblins are living.

The fact is, those Goblins are making noise day and night, to the point where I can't live here any longer. If I were as talented as you, I would have cleaned their clocks a long time ago. But as you can see, I'm nothing but a useless watchman, so all I can do is tremble with fear.

Please give these violent monsters something to REALLY holler about - then maybe they'll shut up for good.
I will give you a suitable reward for your labor.
MsgWelcome: When I think about it, I lose sleep...
MsgIncomplete: Your reward will be large enough, so don't worry none.
MsgResponse4: Your reward will be large enough, so don't worry none.

MsgSummary:
Ernest wanted you to check why nobody delivered the firewood from Arbor Farm. You have to meet {c2}Eric{/c} and ask him about this.
You can find Arbor Farm by passing the Goblin camp north of the Beacon Mound.
MsgComplete: Do I know you? Who are you? What do you want? Ah, are you here on an errand from Ernest?
MsgTake:
Hello traveler. I don't know where you're going, but if you're not in a hurry, let me give you a task.

This is the place where we send up a signal if enemies attack, and the place where we watchers live. That's the reason it is very important. We always need a lot of firewood. We've always gotten firewood delivered from a timber village, 
however, I haven't heard from them since last week. I don't know what has happened. It should have been delivered before now. We have only a small amount of firewood left. It'll be bad if we don't have any firewood to use when the weather gets much colder.

Coward is not a type of guy I can discuss worries like this with because he's not a trustworthy person, so I think I'm very lucky to meet an outstanding warrior like you. I hope you can go to Arbor Farm and see what happened.

By the way, the lumberjack who delivers firewood is named Eric. You can ask him about this. I think you're up for it.
MsgWelcome: This is the Beacon Mound. We send up a signal if enemies attack.
MsgIncomplete: It's urgent.
MsgResponse4: You'll be in trouble if you fall asleep. You know what? It's happened to me from time to time, heh heh...

MsgSummary: Goblins have stolen the firewood that Eric was delivering. You can find {c3}Stolen_Woodpile{/c} if you kill the {c1}Stonepick Goblin Shamans{/c} in the Goblin camp. You have to return to Eric with as much firewood as you can carry within {c4}60 Minutes{/c}. You can find the Goblin camp in the {c2}Rimus Valley{/c}, located South of Arbor Farm.
MsgComplete: Umm, you did a fine job, but this is not enough wood. I think I'll have to chop and store more firewood in the warehouse. Thank you anyway, and take this for your troubles.
MsgResponse1:
Nice, this is perfect. Ah, here is your reward. I really appreciate your help.

Can you do me another favor?
MsgResponse2: Wow, this is excellent! You've brought so much wood we don't have any place to put it all! This should be enough to stop Mr. Ernest from worrying. Here is your reward!
MsgTake:
Yes, I'm Eric. I'm in charge of delivering firewood to the Beacon Mound. Do you want to know why I haven't made a delivery since last week? Hmm...

Goblins attacked me and broke my carriage, and they even stole my firewood while I was on my way to make a delivery last week! I was thinking I should retrieve the firewood that was stolen. According to your story, you need the wood urgently.

Then traveler, would you mind helping me now that you're already here? Can you go to the Goblin camp and take back the wood that they've stolen?

I'm sorry to say this, but you need to finish this within sixty minutes, since I have to leave to make another delivery soon.
MsgWelcome: You'll be in trouble if you fall asleep. But you know what? I've done it a couple of times, hahaha.
MsgIncomplete: You can find the firewood if you kill the Stonepick Goblin Shamans.
MsgResponse4: You can find the firewood if you kill the Stonepick Goblin Shamans.

MsgSummary: You have to deliver the firewood you collected to {c2}Ernest{/c} on Eric's behalf.
MsgComplete:
Hmm, I wasn't aware what had happened. I really appreciate your hard work. Unfortunately, the amount of firewood is not satisfactory. 

I can take care of it myself, thanks anyway.
MsgWelcome: You'll be in trouble if you fall asleep. But you know what? I've done it a couple of times, hahaha.
MsgIncomplete: Whoa. why are you still here?
MsgResponse4: This is the Beacon Mound. We send up a signal if the enemies attack.

MsgSummary: You have to deliver the firewood you collected to {c2}Ernest{/c} on Eric's behalf.
MsgComplete:
This is a small sign of my gratitude, please take this. I hope the rest of your journey will be safe.
<Reward for Ranger, Archer><Reward for Fighter, Defender><Reward for Mage, Priest>
MsgWelcome: You'll be in trouble if you fall asleep. You know what, though? I've done it a couple of times, ha ha.
MsgIncomplete: Whoa, why are you still hangin' around here?
MsgResponse4: This is the Beacon Mound. We send up a signal if the enemies attack.

MsgSummary: You have to search for a sample so that Dendron, an ecology researcher, can use it in his studies. You have to return to Dendron after killing {c1}Great Tree Haunting Ghosts{/c} and obtain five {c3}Soul Essences{/c}. You can find Great Tree Haunting Ghosts in the Unicorn Fons.
MsgComplete: Thanks. Finally I can study this. Here's a reward for your accomplishments, please keep it.
MsgTake:
Hey you, can you give me a hand? I'm Dendron. I'm studying the ecology of nature. If you aren't too busy, can you help me out with my research?

I figure you noticed that the war against the Union of Fury has been prolonged for some time. Because of this, the souls of nature that were being balanced by Etain's mercy are now transforming into something very bizarre. Consequently, we are facing a great danger now.

Recently, very unstable souls have been rampaging around this area. I think I need to find a sample and study it to find the solution. However, as you can see, I'm a mere scholar. I'm terrible at fighting!

Can you collect samples from the {c1}Great Tree Haunting Ghosts{/c} that are haunting this area? Once you capture them, you can obtain the Soul Essence. Please get some of their {c3}Soul Essences{/c}. I'm counting on you.
MsgWelcome: Humans are destroying nature. If the humans weren't here, Teos would be a much healthier place.
MsgIncomplete: Did you obtain the samples I asked for?
MsgResponse4: Did you obtain the samples I asked for?

MsgSummary:
Kill 5 {c1}Terrtier Tiarusas{/c1} and 5 {c1}Terrtier Direyasas{/c1} and go talk to Fylgien{/c} on the bridge in Stable Erde after.

Don't forget to remind him of my underwear!
MsgComplete: Yei wants his undies back? He said I could have them! Here's a bunch of gold for your trouble instead, because I'm not giving those purple babies back, they're mine you hear me?? Mine!
MsgTake:
What? You can't get through the jungle because there are velociraptors in the way? My best advice is to kill them, then you would be able to get  on with jungle life. I mean, those dinos aren't going to kill themselves, y'know?...

When you're done, could you let my ex-boyfriend, Fylgien know that he needs to give me back my purple underwear collection? He took them with him when he moved out.
MsgWelcome: I thought Jurassic Park fell off the side after the first movie, do you agree?
MsgIncomplete: Hard? Maybe you need the right elemental weapons to get through the fight. You can grab new ones easy in Silvaren these days.

MsgSummary: Scout Alicia has asked you to kill a zombie wandering around Cornwell's Ruin. You have to report any findings you receive from disposing of the {c1}Vicious Ancient Corpse{/c} to Alicia.
MsgComplete:
{c5}(Astonished by what you brought){/c} Quite remarkable! I figure what you brought should be stored in the Fanselenon Institute.

If you are pursuing more arduous training, you might want to hear the story about this piece...

I appreciate your help. Take care now!
MsgTake:
Cornwell's Ruin is the place where a hero, Spinterr Vios, defeated the Evil Spirit Sunting Manaburn and sealed off the remaining families. Even though we've kept the seal under control for some time, strange events have been reported during the recent war, because the supervision of the seal was neglected.

I'm a watcher dispatched to examine these kinds of things. There has been nothing particular to report to headquarters so far, however...

A little while ago, we discovered one zombie near the ruins. This particular zombie was emitting a very unique and ominous power compared to other zombies. I suppose it should be inspected by someone, but I can't leave my place empty for long because I'm on duty. Can you help me out? Please kill the Vicious Ancient Corpse and report anything you discover. I leave it in your hands.
MsgIncomplete: Have you eliminated the Vicious Ancient Corpse?
MsgResponse4: Have you eliminated the Vicious Ancient Corpse?

MsgSummary: You have to hunt down ten {c1}Gigantic Toads{/c} that are contaminating Ezellin Lake, and return to Cordelia. You can find the Gigantic Toads by the Lake.
MsgComplete:
Wow, you must've whooped them good; the lake seems to be returning to a better state. {c5}(Grin){/c} Thanks, you were a big help

This is something I caught on the end of my line a little while back.
I don't have much use for it, but perhaps you'll find use for it.
MsgTake:
Hi there! I'm a fisherman, Cordelia's my name. I make a living fishing in the Ezellin Lake - it's my only source of income, actually. {c5}(Grin){/c}
However, I've had a major problem recently! There are Gigantic Toads spitting awful poison everywhere around the lake. As a result, the lake has begun to become contaminated and it has become very difficult to catch fish here. 
Even if I do manage to catch a fish, chances are it'll be mutated and smells bad. You can't sell that sort of fish in the market!

I have been through a lot, so could you please take out these evil Gigantic Toads? If you do a good job, I'll give you a nice reward. I'll be waiting for your return.
MsgWelcome: I'm Cordelia the fisherman. You can ask me anything you wanna know about fishing.
MsgIncomplete: Did you whoop some toad butt?
MsgResponse4: Did you whoop some toad butt?

MsgSummary:
Siys has asked you to find {c3}Zimmer's lost fishing pole{/c}. 
Rumor has it a Sealakel called {c1}Dolama{/c} has stolen the fishing pole.
You can find Dolama near the lake located to the east of Keolloseu.
MsgComplete: Woah, that's Zimmer's fishing pole! {c5}(with a very excited look){/c} Zimmer will be very pleased to have this back! Thanks, thanks!
MsgTake:
Excuse me there. Can you do me a favor? Zimmer just hasn't been himself these days, ever since he lost his fishing pole.
 
Zimmer loved that fishing pole, but Dolama stole it! Zimmer told me to stay away from the scary Dolma, so I can't try to go getit back myself. I don't really know how to fight.

But Zimmer has always been nice to me, and I wanna find it, no matter what! Can you find Zimmer's fishing pole? If you find it, I'll give you something nice! Kill the nasty Dolama and find Zimmer's fishing pole no matter what!
MsgWelcome: I...I didn't do anything wrong...Zimmer is the only one that doesn't pick on me, so I like him~
MsgIncomplete: Dolama is scary and nasty! Be careful!
MsgResponse4: Dolama is scary and nasty! Be careful!

MsgSummary:
Adein told you his Ocarina was stolen by the fox named {c1}Renar{/c}. 
You have to kill Renar and give the {c3}Aedin's Ocarina{/c} back to Adein. You can find Renar among the Rough Hair Tailfoxes on the southwest side of Hunter Camp.
MsgComplete: Ah, I really feel fortunate that you helped out! I thought I would never find this! May God's grace shine on your path, like a sweet song! Upon my oath, I will dedicate to you the first song I make with the Ocarina! I really appreciate your help.
MsgTake:
Allow me to explain what has befallen me. I've lost the instrument that my master gave me as a gift. The culprit who stole the instrument is the Rough Hair Tailfox named Renar.

I had treated that fox kindly, because she seems to like people and has a certain sort of charm. But one day, she took my Ocarina and fled all of a sudden! Maybe she likes sparkling things. A few days ago, I managed to track her down and attempted to get my Ocarina back, but she was no longer the fox I had known. She bared her fangs, and tried to scratch me! In the end I just gave up and have been in emotional agony, not knowing what to do.
 
The Ocarina is an instrument that my master handed down, as his master had before him. If I cannot find it, how will I ever face my master again? I'm begging you, please retrieve my Ocarina from Renar!
MsgWelcome: The song of the common man can be as great as a hero's epic!
MsgIncomplete: Have you found my instrument?
MsgResponse4: Have you found my instrument?

MsgSummary: You have to get the {c3}Rare Gemstone{/c} from Gardenia and give it to guard {c2}Kal{/c}, in Keolloseu village. You can find Kal on the bridge located in the north gateway of Keolloseu.
MsgComplete: Wha...?  What's this all about now? A p...present?  For me?  Who would possibly...
MsgTake:
Can you do me one favor? A little while ago, I obtained this gemstone from someone I know. Every time I look at it from a different angle, it has a different color. That's totally amazing, right?

I want to give this fabulous stone to somebody as a present.  Do you happen to know a young guard named Kal in the Keolloseu? He's so kind and pure. Can you deliver this gemstone to him?

Don't forget to tell him it's a present from me! (grin)
MsgWelcome: I only sell rare things - you won't see stuff like this anywhere else.
MsgIncomplete: Oh, dear, Don't you think you should quickly get to the task if a lady asks you a favor?
MsgResponse4: My name is Kal, a defender of this village. I'll protect our town no matter what happens!

MsgSummary:
Kal wants you to give a gemstone to Annie as her birthday present. 
Make sure you give this gemstone to Annie in the village.
Annie is in front of a warehouse located northeast from the middle of the village. She is the younger of two twins.  Remember to pay attention to the differences between the two.
MsgComplete:
Who are you? Ah, a present from Kal? That's strange; I've known him for a long time, so he could've given this to me himself. In addition to that, I don't like gemstones.

I guess since it's a present, I'd better accept it gratefully anyway. I'll meet up with him later and tell him I received it. Anyway, thank you for your work!
MsgTake:
Is this from Mr. Gardenia? (looking nonplussed) I...I can't do this anymore. What am I gonna do? It's not good manners to give this back, but I don't need something like this...

(talking incoherently and suddenly) Hmm, maybe something like this would be more appreciated by women, right? If so, can you give this to Annie in the village? I'm her f...friend, and her birthday is just around the corner. I have been looking for a nice present, and I guess this gemstone will suit her very well.

(He blushes) I...I need to go to guard this village. I'm b...busy.... Do you think you could do this? Thank you. Ah, one more thing...be careful she is the  younger sister between the twins...! Don't get confused now!
MsgWelcome: Did you do it?
MsgIncomplete: Huh? What?
MsgResponse4: My name is Kal, a defender of this village. I'll protect our town no matter what happens!

MsgSummary: You need to find a violent Leopardess named {c1}Eolith{/c} and dispose of her, then return to Marcia with the {c3}Fur of Eolith{/c}. You can find Eolith among Leopardesses to the Northeast.
MsgComplete:
Is this Fur of Eolith? It has a unique color, and it feels a little different from the pelts of normal Leopardesses. The note said you have to take 'some of Eolith.' I guess this should do fine.

As a reward, I'll give you this item. If you sell it, you'll earn a lot of money. See you later!
MsgTake:
This time around, I think I'll need your help with something besides our usual ruin exploration. If you're not busy, can you give me a hand?

Leopardesses live near the ruins that have been falling into disrepair around this area. Normally, they are not social, so I was curious as to why they're living in groups like that, but I found out one day when I spotted one uniquely gigantic and strong looking Leopardess. I could feel that one was somehow influencing other Leopardesses.

So I researched that gigantic Leopardess, once, out of curiosity. It turned out that Leopardess was called 'Eolith' by elf hunters, and it causes trouble all the time. I heard it's an object of fear to many people. Most importantly, there is a bounty for Eolith's neck. Let's join forces and make money. Can you bring some kind of evidence after you've killed the Eolith? I'll get some detailed information about bounty in Keolloseu while you're working on that.
MsgWelcome: Welcome to Hunter Camp. I'm a hunter, my name is Orta.
MsgIncomplete: Have you gotten rid of the Eolith?
MsgResponse4: Have you gotten rid of the Eolith?

MsgSummary: This is a favor for Judice. You have to buy a boxful of grapes from {c2}Astin{/c} so that it can be used during the festival. You can find Astin in the small vineyard to the Southwest.
MsgComplete: Oh, a customer? So, how many grapes do you need?
MsgTake:
Something troublesome has happened to me, would you hear me out? The Monarchy Festival is about to begin. This is the most important festival for us humans. You can't imagine how busy it has been for past week, every day and night.

My job is to make wine for this festival. Grapes are supposed to be the most important thing in the festival. The problem is, I don't have any grapes left! I made only the two thirds of the wine I'm supposed to make.

What I'm asking you is; I'd like you to gather some grapes for me. There's a guy named Astin who I've known for a long time. The wine he makes, using grapes he cultivates, will be the best wine for the festival!
 
Please go to Mr. Astin and tell him that Judice needs a favor. Most importantly, please bring a boxful of grapes back with you. This money should be enough. I'll be waiting. {c5}(You receive a moneybag){/c}
MsgWelcome: Hello dear customer! Welcome~ I really like the ambiance of this village!
MsgIncomplete: Mr. Astin will be around the vineyard. Why don't you stop by there now?
MsgResponse4: Our grapes are the best! We even supply these to the capital, Apulune.

MsgSummary: You have been asked to kill the {c1}Edged Blade Horn Antelopes{/c} ruining Astin's vineyard. You must kill at least two Edged Blade Horn Antelopes within {c4}sixty minutes{/c}. After hunting the Antelopes, you must return to Astin. Make sure you're not late!
MsgComplete: Oh my, you returned much faster than I expected. I was just about to select grapes.
MsgResponse1: Amazing, you're right on time! I've selected good grapes and wrapped them tightly for you. You did a wonderful job by taking care of those Antelopes. Thanks.
MsgResponse2: Hmmm, you are a bit late. Was it too demanding to ask you to kill some Antelope? I think I've majorly overestimated your skills.
MsgTake:
A favor for Judice, eh? I guess I have no choice but to help her! Don't worry; I'll prepare the best grapes. Hmm, let's see...how's your fighting ability?

If you have skill enough, I have one favor to ask in exchange for these grapes. Lately, antelopes have been breaking into my vineyard and messing up my grapes. Even raising a fence was useless because they can burst through it with their massive horns.

Can you take them out with your fighting skills? I don't care how many antelopes you kill. Even killing just 2 of them would satisfy me. I'll be waiting with the best of the grapes.
MsgWelcome: Our grapes are the best! We even supply these to the capital, Apulune.
MsgIncomplete: Well, have you killed some Antelopes?
MsgResponse4: Well, have you killed some Antelopes?

MsgSummary:
Please get the {c3}Box of Unripe Grapes{/c} from Astin.
After that, you have to return to {c2]Judice{/c} in Keolloseu.
MsgComplete:
Oh my, you're right on time! How fortunte; I was beginning to worry you'd be late. I don't have to worry about the quality of the grapes, since Mr. Astin chose them himself.

{c5}(after opening the box and looking inside){/c} Aww...there are too many unripe grapes. Apparently, farming this year didn't go well, but we have no choice but to use these. You did a fine job~
MsgResponse1:
Oh, my, you are right on time! I was worried you'd be late. I don't have to worry about the quality of the grapes because they were chosen by Mr. Astin himself.

{c5}(After opening the box and looking inside){/c} Geez, there are too many unripe grapes in here. Apparently farming this year didn't go well, but we have no choice but to use these. {QuestResult2}
MsgWelcome: Our grapes are the best of all! We even supply these to the capital, Apulune~
MsgIncomplete:
Our grapes are the best! We even supply these to the capital, Apulune.{StartCarry}
What are you doing? Haven't you delivered the grapes? Hurry up!

MsgSummary: After getting rid of guards, you have to return to Kail.  You have to eliminate five {c1}Cloron's Goblins{/c} and three {c1}Cloron Patrolers{/c}. In order to find Cloron's Lair, you have to exit Keolloseu village and go down toward the Southeast.
MsgComplete: Excellent, that rumor was not wrong after all. Well, this is the reward for your first mission. I'll give you another mission after you catch your breath a bit.
MsgTake:
Come on in. I have heard about your accomplishment. I was told you take on any task regardless of how dangerous it is. Well then, how about the task I'm offering you this time?

If you exit this village and go down toward the Southeast, you will discover a gigantic dragon's lair. The name of dragon is Cloron, and it has lived for over 1,200 years. Originally, Cloron was the holy dragon that used to protect the area where the Elves' souls were woven together.
However, Sunting Manaburn, the god of another world, was jealous of the Goddess Etain and corrupted the spirit of the holy dragon with the evil magic. After that, this holy dragon turned into an atrocious beast.

Hmm, why don't you hear the rest of this story after you finish your mission? This mission can turn into a long journey, keep that in mind.

Your first mission is to dispose of Goblins and Patrollers protecting Cloron's Lair and return to me.
MsgWelcome: I'm a local official of Keolloseu and a half Elf; my name is Kail. Lately, I've been studying about Humans.
MsgIncomplete: Have you completed your mission?
MsgResponse4: Have you completed your mission?

MsgSummary:
You have to dispose of the guards protecting Cloron's Lair and return to Kail.
You have to get rid of three {c1}Cloron Orcs{/c} and three {c1}Cloron Gladiators/c}.
In order to find Cloron's Lair, you have to exit Keolloseu village and go down toward the Southeast.
MsgComplete:
You are doing an excellent job. How lucky I am to have a great hero such as yourself helping me with this.
Here, take this reward for your help. But, if you would, please consider another mission I have for you.
MsgTake:
In the end, the Elves' souls ended up being trapped by the power of the darkened Cloron. Even surrounding animals were changed by the evil power of this dragon and became violent creatures. Now, these animals are protecting the dragon's nest.

We're not strong enough to lift the curse of the Evil Spirit Sunting Manaburn; however, we can at least anticipate a way to weaken his powers.

Your second mission is to get rid of Cloron Orcs and Cloron Gladiators. These monsters will be stronger than those you've faced previously. Don't let your guard down for a second. I hope you'll come back safely with all the limbs you left with.
MsgWelcome: I'm a local official of Keolloseu and a half Elf; my name is Kail. Lately, I've been studying about Humans.
MsgIncomplete: Have you completed your mission?
MsgResponse4: Have you completed your mission?

MsgSummary: You have to get rid of guards around Cloron's Lair and return to Kail. You have to get rid of {c1}3 Cloron Ogres{/c} and {c1}3 Cloron Guards{/c}. In order to find Cloron's Lair, you have to exit the Keolloseu village and go down toward the Southeast.
MsgComplete:
You've done an amazing job so far! I think the power of the curse has been weakened a little thanks to your efforts.

From now on, I hope I can meet many more brave heroes like you. May the rest of your journey be safe, and thank you.
<Reward for Fighter, Defender><Reward for Mage, Priest><Reward for Ranger>
MsgTake:
There were many people who approached Cloron's Lair and tried to save the dragon from the evil magic, but not one of them has ever returned home due to the Cloron's Breath. These poor souls have been trapped there since their deaths.
 
We Elves are fighting to lift the curse laid upon Cloron. Please make your best endeavor, so that the deaths and efforts of many will not have been in vain.

Your last mission is to take down Orges and Guards. They are very strong, so stay sharp and do your best. May Etain's will give you strength!
MsgWelcome: I'm a local official of Keolloseu and a half Elf; my name is Kail. Lately, I've been studying about Humans.
MsgIncomplete: Have you completed your mission?
MsgResponse4: Have you completed your mission?

MsgSummary: Beard has asked you to take revenge for his dead friend, Matt. After disposing of three {c1}Ogre Hunters{/c}, you have to return to Beard. You can find the Ogre Hunters if you go down toward South Cloron Forest from Keolloseu village.
MsgComplete:
Finally Matt's soul will be able to rest in peace. Thank you; you're a true hero!

Here's a good reward for you. I hope you'll find it useful. Thanks again.
MsgTake:
Are you a hero? You're a hero, right? Please, you've gotta help me. My name is Beard. A little while ago, one of my best friends, Matt, went missing.

According to people who witnessed the scene from a distance, he was attacked by Ogres and dragged out somewhere. These eyewitnesses also added that he must surely have already been dead.

Actually, that's what I've started to believe too. Perhaps Matt is no longer living in this world. However, all I can do is grieve his death. My friend died unfairly and it's just sad that I can't do anything.

I have been looking for a hero who can strike back at those Ogres who deserve to be torn apart! Please get revenge for my friend Matt! I will give you a just reward for your deeds!
MsgWelcome: Well, what do you need? Don't ignore me just because I'm a seller of simple goods.
MsgIncomplete: How many Ogres have you slain so far?
MsgResponse4: How many Ogres have you slain so far?

MsgSummary: You have to find five {c3}Hearts of Orc{/c} and give them to the medicine merchant, Canere, in the Sia Maia. You can obtain the Heart of Orc if you go west a little away from Sia Maia.
MsgComplete: Ah, you remembered to bring everything! Fortunately, we're right on schedule. Thanks!
MsgTake:
Oh! You came here in the nick of time. Can I ask you one favor, hero? There is something I need delived to a person who brings medicine to me. For a person like me, this material is too tough to obtain, but talented young upstarts like you surely won't have a problem with it.

That material is the very Heart of Orc. All I know is that they are used to make a very special medicine. Can you bring some of them? I'll prepare a sufficient reward. I'll be waiting for news of your success!
MsgWelcome: Please buy a lot! This is a medicine made with Sia Maia's pure spirit.
MsgIncomplete: Hello there; did you bring all Hearts of Orc I asked for?
MsgResponse4: Hello there; did you bring all Hearts of Orc I asked for?

MsgSummary: You unexpectedly gained the {c3}Old Wanted List{/c}. You have to give this to a guard named {c2}Josh{/c} in Keolloseu.
MsgComplete: Hm? Right, this is a list I posted...do you want to give it a try?
MsgTake:
{c5}(While rummaging through the belongings of the felled Ogre hunter, you found some tattered paper. It looks like a Wanted List. You don't know which criminal is to be capture, but it was posted by a guard of Keolloseu named Josh.
He will answer your questions if you go to Keolloseu village and give it to him){/c}

MsgSummary:
The wanted criminal is an atrocious Ogre, {c1}Kaznil{/c}. You have to return to Josh with the {c3}Skull_of_Kaznil{/c}.
You can find Kaznil among some Ogres on your way south from Keolloseu.
MsgComplete: Wow, impressive! Did you really kill the atrocious Kaznil? You're amazing?! Thanks to you, people will have peace of mind for a while. That's some good 'ol fashioned heroism.
MsgTake:
The wanted criminal is an atrocious Ogre, Kaznil. There is a Ogre's den in the south. There have been so many victims, since recently, Ogres have been banding together in groups to attack travelers.

During a high-demand season, many people visit this village. And this season, many people have died from the ogres' attacks. As a result, we hear a lot of complaint about poor security. Now we have no choice but to make this wanted poster to get help killing these ogres.

The Ogres' boss, Kaznil is incredibly strong and brutal. There have been many people who tried to kill Kaznil, but none have survived. If it weren't for Kaznil, the Orges would be much less boistrous. But what of you? You know a Hero is not supposed to hold back...! Just bring his skull as evidence after you kill Kaznil.
MsgWelcome: Guarding is not an easy task, so don't underestimate me!
MsgIncomplete: Have you killed Kaznil?
MsgResponse4: Have you killed Kaznil?

MsgSummary:
Find the lord of Keolloseu, {c2}Kail{/c} with the {c3}Skull_of_Kaznil{/c}. You can find Kail in front of the Manor house located in the northwest of the village.

You'll receive a reward once you let {c2}Kail{/c} look at the {c3}Skull of Kaznil{/c}.
MsgComplete:
{c5}(Wearing a smile){/c}
Ah, so this is the skull of that atrocious Kaznil, right?
It was you who finished Kaznil!

A Hero should get what he deserves. I hope you'll accomplish even greater heroic deeds with this.
Farewell..!

<Reward for Fighter, Defender><Reward for Ranger, Archer><Reward for Mage, Priest>
MsgTake:
Looks like you're due for a reward now that you have accomplished something so great~ Why don't you go find the lord of our village, Mr Kail?

I've no doubt he'll have great praises for you, and a reward besides.
MsgWelcome: Guarding isn't an easy task; don't underestimate me!
MsgIncomplete: Did you find Mr Kail? He'll give you a reward, so don't delay.
MsgResponse4: I'm a local official in Keolloseu, Kail the half-elf.

MsgSummary:
Capture {c1}Isprit{/c}and take {c3}Soul of Isprit /c} to Pange in Unicorn Fons.
