You can find the Isprit among guard souls southeast of Cloron's Lair.
MsgComplete: Well done. traveler. I'll seal off this soul of Isprit. Here's a reward for your help. Thanks.
MsgTake:
Have you heard of the Isprit? Some said she used to be one of the spirits protecting the forest, and some said she used to be the young daughter of a human noble. Well...no one knows for sure. One thing that is clear, however, is that she is now a very dangerous soul, trying to take away innocent people's lives with surprise attacks. Her soul could have been captured by the evil power of the cursed dragon, Cloron...

Anyway, I should stop this troubled soul from rampaging around. In order to do this, I need your help. If you capture Ispirit and bring her soul to me, I'll seal it off. It's a solid plan.
MsgWelcome: You don't have to listen to what that damn Renne hag is saying!  She doesn't even know what Summoning magic is...
MsgIncomplete: Have you brought Isprit's soul?
MsgResponse4: Have you brought Isprit's soul?

MsgSummary:
This is your first mission in Teos. The Aridon Sentry has asked you to hunt {c1}Small Jaw Dappled Spiders{/c}. Dispose of 5 Small Jaw Dappled Spiders and return to Ardon Sentry.
You can find spiders easily nearby.
MsgComplete: All right, you have passed your first mission. I will give you another one.
MsgTake:
Newcomer, Good to see you. Whether you selected the path of a warrior or the path of a magician, you'll definitely make a big contribution to our union.

However, fighting requires a lot more than spirit.
Judging by your appearance, you don't have any combat experience yet.

Just begin with the Small Jaw Dappled Spider. They're rather weak compared to real enemies, but they'll be good enough for you to get a good feel for combat.
First, dispose of 5 of them, then return to me.
MsgWelcome: This is the Vail's village, Aridon. Welcome.
MsgIncomplete: How was your fight with the spiders?
MsgResponse4: How was your fight with the spiders?

MsgSummary:
The Aridon Sentry asked you to dispose of {c1}Rough Ground Tiny Wild Boars{/c} and return to report your result. 
You should return to the Ardon Security after hunting 5 Rough Ground Tiny Wild Boars.
You can find wild boars near the spiders.
MsgComplete: All right, apparently you have some basic talent. I hope you'll grow into an excellent warrior.
MsgTake:
This time, I want you to dispose of 5 Rough Ground Tiny Wild Boars.

Wild boars will be absurdly weak compared to those cunning and detestable enemies from the Alliance of Light, but at least they are more dangerous than the spiders you just dealt with.
I'm telling you, stay sharp.

This is just for testing your ability, so be careful not to die. After eliminating all wild boars, return to the Aridon Sentry in the village, not to me.
MsgWelcome: Hi, newcomer, welcome.
MsgIncomplete: How did you find the challenge of hunting those wild boars?
MsgResponse4: How did you find the challenge of hunting those wild boars?

MsgSummary: This is your first mission in Teos. The Suteron Sentry has asked you to hunt {c1}Small Jaw Dappled Spiders{/c} and return to report the results. You must dispose of 5 Small Jaw Dappled Spiders and find the Suteron Sentry.
MsgComplete: So, young warrior, did you dispose of any Small Jaw Dappled Spider? Hmm.
MsgTake:
Greetings young warrior, From now on, you must lend your strength to protect our base as one of the Nordein.

However, right now your strength is not enough. The most important thing is to experience a lot of battles.

The only enemies you can face right now are Small Jaw Dappled Spider or other weak monsters. After disposing of 5 spiders nearby, find the Suteron Sentry. He'll give you a new mission if you tell him what you've done.
MsgWelcome: This is Suteron, the village of the Nordein. Good to see you.
MsgIncomplete: You can find spiders easily nearby.

MsgSummary: The Suteron Sentry asked you to hunt {c1}5 Rough Ground Tiny Wild Boars{/c} and return to report your result. You must return to the Suteron Sentry after disposing of 5 Rough Ground Tiny Wild Boars.
MsgComplete: Excellent, you followed my instructions very well. I hope you'll become a great Nordein warrior, serving in the name of Kali, God of Destruction.
MsgTake:
If you don't have basic training, you will be useless regardless of how much power you have. Make sure you always remember this.

Well, this is the last mission of your basic training. Dispose of 5 Rough Ground Tiny Wild Boars and come back here. They can be dangerous; don't underestimate them.

Don't forget to return after you get rid of all of them.
MsgWelcome: Ah, a new face? Welcome, welcome.
MsgIncomplete: Did you dispose of all the wild boars?
MsgResponse4: Did you dispose of all the wild boars?

MsgSummary:
Grisel asked you to find the necessary materials to make some armor. You have to find the{c1}Hunter Larva{/c} and collect {c3}7 Shells of Larva{/c}. After that, you have to give them to Grisel.
You can find the Hunter Larva if you go down the hill outside the east gate of the village.
MsgComplete:
You have collected them all. Well done. This is the reward I promised. There should be a good amount of money there too. Don't be a stranger; stop by sometimes.

<Reward for Assassin><Reward for Pagan, Oracle>
MsgTake:
Ah, You came just at the right time. I need your help. 
My name is Grisel, and my job is mainly selling, but I occasionally make things too.

However, one customer ordered something new from me. I can make it, but I don't have the materials I need on hand.

The material I need is Hunter Larva Shells. I know they're not so difficult to obtain, but the problem is that I don't have enough time to collect them all. Can you get 7 Shells of Larva for me? I'll be waiting, so please come back once you collect them all.
MsgWelcome: If you're looking for something beautiful and functional, you've come to the right place.
MsgIncomplete: Have you gotten all the shells I need?
MsgResponse4: Have you gotten all the shells I need?

MsgSummary:
You have to hunt down {c3}Short Tail Black Pumas{/c} and {c3}collect 7 teeth{/c}.
Give them to Parphala.
You can find the Black Pumas if you go down the hill outside of the east gate of the village, then head south.
MsgComplete: Ah, you've returned much earlier than I expected. We've finished our job easily thanks to you. Here's a little something for your efforts; I'll be seein' you around~
MsgTake:
Hey there! If you're not too busy, can you help me out? My name is Parphala, second daughter of the Karniel family.

I'm doing this because my father ordered me to.
I'm just a lonely woman...so I hope a hero like you can help me out~

This task is simple enough. All you have to do is search for the necessary Tooth of Black Puma to make a sharp sword. The teeth of Short Tail Black Pumas will be good enough, and I think 7 will do just fine.
I'll be eagerly awaiting your return~
MsgWelcome: I'm only dealing with top-quality weapons, and the best always costs a little more, don't you think?
MsgIncomplete: Hmmm...did you collect the Teeth of Black Pumas as I asked?
MsgResponse4: Hmmm...did you collect the Teeth of Black Pumas as I asked?

MsgSummary:
You have to dispose of some {c1}Short Tail Black Pumas{/c} and collect the {c3}Teeth_of 5 Black Pumas{/c} and give them to a weapon merchant, Igel.
You can find a Short Tail Black Puma if you exit the gateway of the village and follow the route northwest.
MsgComplete:
Ah, these are strong teeth. Thanks. Take this reward first, and allow me to ask another favor of you. Wait here for a moment. 

{c5}(He moves his hand very busily as if he is wrapping the teeth you handed and other materials.){/c}
MsgTake:
Young warrior, if you have some time, can you help me?

A few days ago, I was asked for a favor - to find materials to make a weapon - from a blacksmith named Yaadin. However, I don't have enough time to find them all, so I need your help.

The materials I still need are the Teeth of 5 Short Tail Black Pumas. You may find Black Pumas in front of a village very easily. Remember, I'm counting on you.
MsgWelcome: Hmm? Did you need me for something?
MsgIncomplete: How about those teeth I requested?
MsgResponse4: How about those teeth I requested?

MsgSummary:
You have to deliver the materials you get from Igel to {c2}Yaadin{/c}.
Blacksmith Yaadin is in the store to the left of Igel's location.
MsgComplete:
What is this?{c5}(after looking at box){/c} Ah, you're running Igel's errand, right? Fine, tell him I received this and deliver this to Igel. I'll give you money later.

Well, this will be good enough for what you have done. If you've no more business here, then leave me be.
MsgWelcome: Hmm? Did you need me for something?
MsgIncomplete: Did you give Yaadin the things I sent with you?
MsgResponse4: If you're looking for Yaadin, you've found the right place. I'm the best blacksmith in town.

MsgSummary:
Ermel asked you to find ingredients for cooking. You have to find some {c1}Rough Ground Gigantic Wild Boars{/c} and collect {c3}7 Wild Boar Meats{/c}. 
In order to find the Rough Ground Gigantic Wild Boars, you have to exit the village and make your way toward the east Artlum Mine.
MsgComplete:
Did you get them all? {c5}(after confirming the meat){/c} This will make a good feast.

Ah, I'm not finished yet. There is one more thing I'd like you to do for me.
MsgTake:
Ah, I think you'll like this one. Do you want to know what the task is? It's quite simple. All you have to do is capture some Rough Ground Gigantic Wild Boar, slice off a piece of their fresh meat, and give it to me.

You have to make sure this meat will be fresh. No negligence, got it?

You can find wild boars very easily if you go east toward the Artlum Mine. Go ahead and find the fresh wild boar meat and return.
MsgWelcome: I'm Ermel. I only deal with fresh ingredients. Many orders are wailting to be finished.
MsgIncomplete: Did you collect the meat?
MsgResponse4: Did you collect the meat?

MsgSummary:
Ermel asked you to deliver the ingredients you have obtained to Album.
You can find Album in the inner part of Aridon.
MsgComplete:
What? {c5}(after looking at box){/c} ah, This might be the meat Ermel sent, right? These days, even this kind of wild boar meat is extremely rare, 'cause we've been sending stuff all over the place.

I can't believe she really found something like this. I knew there was something special about Ermel. Well, I'll give you this as a reward for what you have done. See you later, then!
MsgTake:
{c5}(giving you a box after putting meat inside and wrapping it){/c} 
Well, I'm finished. Just give this to Album. He'll be inside the village, so look for him carefully.

Album and I have been business partners for a long time. You don't have to tell him about this box; he'll know I sent it as soon as he looks at it. Of course, Album will give you a reward for what you have done.

Now run along before the meat spoils; Album doesn't like waiting.
MsgWelcome: I'm Ermel. I only deal with the freshest ingredients. Tons of orders are waiting to be finished.
MsgIncomplete: Album hates waiting. I think...I told you already. Didn't I?
MsgResponse4: Cooking is another form of art. Don't mistake just boiling some soup with REAL cooking.

MsgSummary:
Sezon asked you to get rid of Galluses that became a problem. You have to go back to Sezon after disposing of {c1}5 Man-eating Galluses{/c} and {c1}3 Steel Beak Galluses{/c}.
You can find Galluses around the Titan's Ruin on your way toward the northeast road from the Watch Tower.
MsgComplete:
All right, you did a fine job. Those disgusting Galluses, now they'll know to shut up. Even trivial things like those are rampaging around due to the long war.

Well, this is a reward. From now on, I'll pray to Kali, God of Destruction, that you'll grow up to be a great warrior. Farewell!
MsgTake:
Blarg; even weak monsters like this are beginning to be a nuisance! We've already been irked to the end of our wits due to the unfavorable condition of the front line. {c5}(looking at you suddenly after murmuring to himself){/c} Ah, I'm lucky. Can you do something for me?

I'm certain that these Galluses are out of their mind. These days, apprentice warriors who left for training have been discovered mutilated in the wilderness. We examined the wounds on the corpses, and in fitting with our fears, they matched with Galluses. I can't believe something like this could happen to us.

Go and dispose of those outrageous Galluses. They shouldn't be able to really kill you. After you finish the job, return to me and report your result.
MsgWelcome: I dislike fighting, so please do not make me angry.
MsgIncomplete: Did you finish off all Galluses?
MsgResponse4: Did you finish off all Galluses?

MsgSummary: You have to teach a harsh lesson to some {c1}Long Canine Black Pumas{/c} and obtain their meat as well. You have to collect {c3}5 Black Puma Meats{/c} and return to Tran again.
MsgComplete:
Ah, thanks. Your ability is really something, you know that?

Find the owner of the Factory, Daroga. I was told he's looking for a skilled warrior for a task.
MsgTake:
Warrior, can you do me a favor?

For several days, some animals have been messing up the charcoal I've been making. A few days later, I was supposed to send my charcoal off to supply villages and even the capital, but it was completely ruined and couldn't be delivered. Now we're in a serious fix.

Luckily, we finally found what was causing this last night. It turned out the culprits were Long Canine Black Pumas living around the gateway of the factory. Ruining our charcoal is totally unacceptable, and we have been running out of food as well. You came here just at the right time.

Please get rid of those Long Canine Black Pumas and bring me their meat as well. I'll be waiting.
MsgWelcome: If you want to make good charcoal, you need a fine tree first.
MsgIncomplete: Did you collect enough Black Puma Meat?
MsgResponse4: Did you collect enough Black Puma Meat?

MsgSummary:
Petunia asked you to capture {c1}Soldier Larva{/c} and find {c3}Poison of Larva{/c}.
Poison of Larvae can go stale easily, so you'll have to make sure you return to Petunia within 60 minutes. Be careful not to be late. You have to collect at least 5 Poisons of Larva and return.
You can find the Soldier Larva on your way west from the street vendor's location.
MsgComplete:
You're not supposed to come back without collecting all of them! What on earth am I supposed to do with these little things?

Maybe I have to give you a reward because you've done something, but I'm telling you, if you wanna keep doing business with me, you can't pull something like this.
MsgResponse1: Ah, Did you collect them all? Hmm...not as fresh as they could be, but they're not stale either. I suppose I can send this. You did a fine job, take this. Farewell~
MsgResponse2:
Hey! Don't you remember what I said? I emphasized you should be careful, because they can go stale very easily! Probably just a couple of these are still usable...

I guess I still have to give you a reward, even though you did a crappy job.
MsgTake:
Hey! Hey you! There's some urgent business I need to take care of.
Can you help me?

All you have to do is search for ingredients needed for the medicine I sell. 
The person who makes the medicine for me asked me to look for these. You'll discover a beast called Soldier Larva a short distance to the west. Please capture them and give me the poison they contain.

The Poison of Larva can go stale quickly, so you have to make sure you bring it within 60 minutes. You have to bring at least 5 Poisons of Larva. Of course, you can even capture even 10 Poisons of Larva, if you want.
MsgWelcome: I deal with a variety of medicines. If you need something, you can buy it from me for the prices listed here.
MsgIncomplete: No time to dilly-dally. Did you bring them all?
MsgResponse4: No time to dilly-dally. Did you bring them all?

MsgSummary:
Daroga asked you to get rid of the DoomFire HellTooth Family.
You have to finish {c1}3 DoomFire HellTooth Sentinels{/c} and {c1}3 DoomFire HellTooth Warriors{/c} in the northern ruined site and return to Daroga.
MsgComplete: You seem to be talented like Tran said. I have to ask you a favor that might be very difficult.
MsgTake:
You're the one Tran has been talking about? Then I, Daroga, have something to ask of you.

These days we have been suffering from the DoomFire HellTooth Family. Rumor has it they have been abandoned even by their own clan due to their unpredictable recklessness and violence.

Anyway, the damage is far greater than you can imagine. These annoying HellTeeth are injuring our customers who came to the charcoal factory and our residents who are leaving for safer, distant places. You name it; under these conditions, how can I just stay here and ignore their unbearable behavior?

You have to help me, warrior. Please go to the ruined site they are inhabiting and dispose of the Sentinels and Warriors first. They are straight  north of here.
I suppose reducing their numbers will be a top priority.
MsgWelcome: We have to prepare all charcoal in advance today so that we can use it tomorrow. This is no time to be messing around!
MsgIncomplete: Did you take care of everything I asked?
MsgResponse4: Did you take care of everything I asked?

MsgSummary:
You have to dispose of the bosses of the DoomFire HellTooth Family. Defeat 5 DoomFire HellTooth Heroes and return to the owner of the factory, Daroga.
You can find DoomFire HellTooth Heroes around the DoomFire HellTooth Sentinels and DoomFire HellTooth Warriors.
MsgComplete: Excellent. You've done an incredible thing for our little village. Take this token of my gratitude.
MsgTake:
Now you should be able to finish their bosses. The DoomFire HellTooth Family has more than one strong boss. Apparently, several bosses of considerable power are ruling their family. It's no wonder they can't follow one boss with that foul temper.

You have to find bosses very carefully, since they have almost the same appearance as other members of the family. These bosses...if you get rid of 5 or 6 of them, the DoomFire Hellteeth will definitely lose their will to fight.

Once their power has been weakened, these residents can take care of the rest of them.
I'm counting on you!
MsgWelcome: We have to prepare all of our charcoal in advance today so that we can use it tomorrow. This is no time to dilly-dally!
MsgIncomplete: Did you get rid of the bosses?
MsgResponse4: Did you get rid of the bosses?

MsgSummary:
Nosh asked you to find {c2}Aatz{/c} in the Frotainer Charcoal Factory and help him.
The Frotainer Charcoal Factory is located west of Suteron Village.
MsgComplete:
What? Someone sent you? Ah, you must be talking about Nosh in Suteron~

I'm lucky, because I desperately needed someone to help me.
MsgTake:
I usually make products with materials I have gained from Aatz, living in the Frotainer Charcoal Factory, but apparently he's in trouble these days. I was told it is very difficult to find ore due to kobolts ruling the mine.

I need someone who can help me. Can you go there and help Aatz? The Frotainer Charcoal Factory is not far from here, so you'll have no problem finding it as long as you follow the route. I'll be waiting for the good news.
MsgWelcome: I know how to make an axe with a keen-edged blade. Want to learn how? Then pay up, haha!
MsgIncomplete: Aatz is the charcoal burner in the Frotainer Charcoal Factory. Look for him carefully.
MsgResponse4: I'm a charcoal burner, name's Aatz! What do you want?

MsgSummary: You have to eliminate the Kobolts and collect ore in the Artlum Mine that the Kobolts are controlling. The {c3}Artlum Mine{/c} is located to the west of the village. You have to find five {c2}Iron Ores{/c} from {c1}WedgeRock Kobolt Worker{/c} and give them to Aatz.
MsgComplete:
Did you find them? Thank you, {c5}(observing ironstones){/c} just as I expected, the iron in the Artlum Mine is fabulous. It's a sad thing that Kobolts are controlling a mine this good.

Thanks to you, I managed to get some good Iron Ore. I've gotta pay you back with something. Which of these would you like?
<Reward for Warrior><Reward for Guardian><Reward for Hunter>
MsgTake:
The {c3}Artlum Mine{/c} is in the near our village, but the place is full of foul Kobolts. This is how it's been since we discovered the mines. Whoever needs the ore should be ready for a good fight with the Kobolts. After that, you're free to collect ore.

Well, there's no need to question your ability because you are the one Nosh sent, right? Can you bring five {c2}Iron Ores{/c} after finishing the Kobolts? I'll be waiting.
MsgWelcome: I'm a charcoal burner, name's Aatz! What do you want?
MsgIncomplete: Have you obtained any Iron Ore yet?
MsgResponse4: Have you obtained any Iron Ore yet?

MsgSummary: The Blood Lab President, Armilla asked you to find the lord of Gliter, {c2}Garter{/c}. You can find Garter in the official residence located in the center of Gliter.
MsgComplete:
A stranger, is this your first time visiting?

Oh, you heard about me from Ms. Armilla? It's an honor that a beautiful woman like her still remembers me. I'm a lord, Garter Saitron. Welcome to Gliter. If it's jobs you're looking for, just check around.

See you later.
MsgTake:
You've been staying here for a long time. Are you bored? Perhaps it's time to move on.

Perhaps you ought to try your luck in a larger town, like Gliter. In a place like that, you can meet more people and find jobs a lot more easily, right?

Once you arrive, you'd do well to meet and familiarize yourself with lord Garter. He'll come in handy in many ways. 
Anyway, no time for delays; you'd best get moving.
MsgWelcome: Lesta has been giving me a lot of help. I really want to research his blood.
MsgIncomplete: You're still here?
MsgResponse4: I'm a local official of this village, Garter's the name. How are you doing?

MsgSummary: The priest of Gliter, Muo, asked you to find a {c2}Pauke{/c} in the Panakeia Lab, the Vail's alchemy research place. You can find the Panakeia Lab  northwest of Gliter.
MsgComplete:
The priest of Gliter, Muo, asked you to find a {c2}Pauke{/c} in the Panakeia Lab, Vail's alchemy research place. You can find the Panakeia Lab  Northwest of Gliter.
QuestResult1}
...somebody said you need to come here? Who's this Muo person you speak of?

{c5}(Thinks for a moment){/c} Wait, it's that pervert of an old man in Gliter, right? Well, I made a medicine for him once before. I can't believe he said he is a friend of mine. {c5}{c5}(With a darkened look){/c} You're not a person like him, are you? For both our sakes, I hope not.

Now I'm so busy, don't have time to spare. Why don't you stop by here sometime later? Have fun, I have to go now.
MsgWelcome: {c5}(Giggle){/c} My name is Muo, Do you really need my help?
MsgIncomplete: Are you still here? My, aren't you the slow one. {c5}(Giggle){/c}
MsgResponse4: Be modest. If you're ready to learn, I'll teach you.

MsgSummary:
Dratt hopes you'll give him a hand killing the Stonepeg Goblin Family. First, you have to finish killing ten {c1}Stonepeg Goblin Fighters{/c} and return to Dratt.
You can find the Goblins' base a little ways away from Dratt's location.
MsgComplete: Good job. Now that we've gotten rid of some of the annoying monsters, it's time to focus on a full scale attack.
MsgTake:
According to the reports of our Scouts, Goblins seem to be organized, more than I thought they were capable of. I'd better nip it in the bud before their influence becomes greater.

Can you help me to take care of some of these Goblins? Let's begin with fighters. Get rid of ten of them for me.
MsgWelcome: I can handle any kind of mission.
MsgIncomplete: Have you taken care of any Goblins?
MsgResponse4: Have you returned with all Goblins slain?

MsgSummary: You have to dispose of five {c1}StonePeg Goblin Warriors{/c} and three {c1}Stonepeg Goblin Clan Leaders{/c} and report back to Dratt. You'll find the Goblins' base right near Dratt's location.
MsgComplete: All Right, you've done a fine job. Now all you have to do now is take down their boss.
MsgTake:
This time, you will face the warriors and clan leaders.  They will be similar in power to most bosses. Not to scare you; I just wanted to let you know so you could prepare accordingly and exercise caution.

However, you shouldn't have any problems facing them with the skill you have shown thus far. After you complete your mission, report back to me. Don't forget this!
MsgWelcome: I can handle any kind of mission.
MsgIncomplete: Have you taken care of any Goblins?
MsgResponse4: Have you taken care of any Goblins?

MsgSummary:
This is your last mission. After killing the boss of the StonePeg Goblin Family,{c1}Jardo{/c}, you have to report back to Dratt with Jardo's head.
You'll find the Goblins' base right near Dratt's location.
MsgComplete:
You've disposed of Jardo safely! Thanks to you, I managed to complete my mission safely. Don't worry. I'll report your great victory to Mosen. You have my thanks, warrior. 
<Reward for Oracle, Pagan><Reward for Assassin><Reward for Warrior, Guardian>
MsgResponse1: You've disposed of Jardo safely! Thanks to you, I managed to complete my mission safely. Don't worry. I'll report your great victory to Mosen. You have my thanks, warrior.
MsgResponse2: You've disposed of Jardo safely! Thanks to you, I managed to complete my mission safely. Don't worry. I'll report your great victory to Mosen. You have my thanks, warrior.
MsgTake:
Okay, they must be weakened by now. Finally, we can kill the boss Goblin.

The name of boss leading the StonePeg Goblin Family is Jardo. He may look fairly similar to other Goblins, but his power is a lot greater than the others. He usually stays with other Goblins to scout their surroundings.

After you dispose of Jardo, bring his head as evidence. Goblins will have no choice but to stop their evil deeds if we hang up that head by the roadside. Good luck, warrior.
MsgWelcome: I can handle any kind of mission.
MsgIncomplete: Have you killed Jardo?
MsgResponse4: Have you killed Jardo?

MsgSummary: Sasru asked you to take care of the Kobolt boss, {c1}Gril{/c}, and find the {c2}Ashes of Roman{/c}. Gril is a very powerful monster. You'd better fight him with a team, instead of trying on your own. Whatever you receive when disposing of Gril, you have to hand over to Sasru. You can find Gril deep inside of the Artlum Mine.
MsgComplete:
Ah, these are the Ashes of Roman...

You fulfilled your promise with Sasru, thank you warrior. Undoubtedly Roman will be thankful to you as well.
<Reward for Warrior, Guardian><Reward for Hunter><Reward for Pagan, Oracle>
MsgResponse1:
Ah, these are the Ashes of Roman...

You fulfilled your promise with Sasru, thank you warrior. Undoubtedly Roman will be thankful to you as well.
MsgResponse2:
Ah, these are the Ashes of Roman...

You fulfilled your promise with Sasru, thank you warrior. Undoubtedly Roman will be thankful to you as well.
MsgTake:
The name of Kobolt boss is {c1}Gril{/c}. He is the most notorious monster, and the most vicious of them all. This is definitely the monster responsible for the incident with my friend.

His flesh must have rotted away by now, but I have to at least collect his ashes to lay him to rest. Please go and dispose of Gril and bring the Ashes of Roman to me. This is the final favor I have to ask of you.
MsgWelcome: Ah, customer. Is this what you are looking for? Or perhaps that? Well, pick up anything you need!
MsgIncomplete: Is it over? Have you finished off Gril?
MsgResponse4: Is it over? Have you finished off Gril?

MsgSummary:
Beki asked you to collect Gallus feathers, so that she can make a fan with them. You have to kill the {c1}Edged Blade Feather Gallus{/c} and collect {c3}Feathers of Gallus{/c}. Collect as many feathers as you can and report back to Beki within {c4}sixty minutes{/c}. 

You have to make sure you're not late. You can find the Edged Blade Feather Gallus to the West of the village.
MsgComplete: Well, this is ok. I'll give you a reward, but I should have asked someone more fit for the job.
MsgResponse1: This is quite good.  I'm a good judge of character, as always. This'll definitely make a suitable payment, right?
MsgResponse2: Oh dear. This is far better than my expectation. Thank you very much, I'd like to give you a satisfactory reward.
MsgTake:
These days, Gallus feathers are the most sought after necessity, desired by all noblewomen that take part in social meetings. There are plenty of things we can make with this feather, but the best of all is a fan.

That burning red color, you can't imagine how beautiful it is! I would feel like I was the Holy Mother Narsilriel if I had it.

However, a few days ago, I lost that feather fan! I have no idea who stole it, but a new fan will no doubt make up for it if it's of better quality. 

Please bring me feathers from the Gallus. I need enough feathers to make a good quality fan. I hate waiting, so please return with the feathers within sixty minutes.
MsgWelcome: Hey, do you want to play with me?
MsgIncomplete: I hate waiting. Do you have the feathers yet?
MsgResponse4: I hate waiting. Do you have the feathers yet?

MsgSummary:
You have to find the necessary ingredients, and give them to Ratina so she can make an Ancient Reagent. 
You have to kill some {c1}Black Claw Succubus{/c} and collect five{c3}Cores of Succubus{/c} and give them to Ratina.
You can find the Black Claw Succubus in the east area outside of the village.
MsgComplete:
Thanks! Now all that's left is making the reagent. Let's give it a try shall we? Actually this could get dangerous, so please stand back.

{c5}(It appears she is mixing a variety of ingredients and making a medicine.){/c}
MsgTake:
A few days ago, I obtained the recipe for a very rare reagent. This document has lost its color and is aged as well, so it is possible ancient people used this a long time ago...

The name of the reagent is Acophon. This means 'Remedy for Love', according to my studies. I have had a hard time deciphering its meaning because the part including how to use it has been almost effaced. Perhaps someone could have taken advantage of this medicine to alter the course of someone's love.

I'm so lucky that I found this because I've already received tons of letters requesting to make a special medicine like this! The problem is now I've run out of Succubus Cores. I need five Succubus Cores for the recipe
MsgWelcome: Is there any medicine you want made? Maybe I can give you a hand..
MsgIncomplete: You're taking a lot longer than I expected; how much longer do I have to wait?
MsgResponse4: You're taking a lot longer than I expected; how much longer do I have to wait?

MsgSummary: You have to deliver this complete reagent to Pren in the liquid medicine shop. Pren is in front of the liquid medicine shop located in the north corner of the village.
MsgComplete:
What is that? A Reagent made by Ratina? Ah, she's still doing whatever she pleases. I had never imagined she would really make this...

Well, it might come in handy sometime, I better take this now... Well, the money is....
<Get this done after you receive it in person. Well done.><Can you give this to Ratina?>
MsgTake:
Wow, I'm finished! {c5}(Holding up a reagent in front of his eyes){/c} Looks like it's done. There was someone who asked me to bring them a medicine like this. Now I can sell it to him! Can you do me another favor?

{c5}(Holding out the reagent){/c} All you have to do is deliver this to Pren, who runs the medicine shop. I mentioned this to him casually, but I made this one as a test, so I can't promise that it will be good.
MsgWelcome: Is there any medicine you want to make? Do you want my help?
MsgIncomplete: Oh, you're still here?
MsgResponse4: What happened?`

MsgSummary: You have to receive a letter of recommendation from Proelium Orderly of Fury and give this to {c2}Ledire{/c}. Gliter is the village in the middle of this area. You can find Ledre in front of Portal Tower.
MsgComplete: Ah, this is a letter of recommendation from an orderly. Are you going to leave for Proelium Frontier and apply to fight on the battlefield? If that's your aim, I'll send you there.
MsgTake:
Proelium Island is the first battlefield you'll goto once you apply to the Alliance of Fury. Battle is constantly in progress there with the hateful Humans and Elves.

Sufficient battle expertise in this area will work to your advantage in the D-Water Borderland, which is the front line against enemies. If you are lucky, maybe you'll obtain a Lapis in the Proelium Island. 

If you want to leave for Proelium Frontier and fight on the battlefield, you have to find Ledire in Gliter with this letter of recommendation. He'll open the Portal of Proelium for you. Please survive no matter what happens, and let's meet again. Take care.
MsgWelcome: I'm an orderly from the Paroutian Fotress. We are recruiting warriors who will fight on the blood-stained battlefield.
MsgIncomplete: Just go and find Ladire in Gliter with that letter of recommendation.
MsgResponse4: I'm Ledire. Do you need a transport? Just use this portal.

MsgSummary: You have to give the moneybag Pren gave you as as payment for the reagent to Ratina.
MsgComplete:
You have to give Ratina the money bag that Pren gave you to pay for the Reagent.
 {QuestResult1}
Good to hear that Pren received it safely; you did a fine job. Is this the money? {c5}(After counting money){/c} Well, this is exactly the same amount of money as usual. She could have sent a little more than that, y'think.

Who does she plan to use the medicine on? Didn't she tell you?  Needless to say, it must be Sei, haha. Thanks for your help; here's your reward. I hope we meet again.
MsgTake:
{c5}(Holding out the moneybag){/c} I made a calculation and put enough money inside, so she will get the same amount of money as all our past deals. If it isn't enough, tell her to come and receive it in person, I'll even throw in this Lans fruit.
 
{c5}(You receive a moneybag from Pren){/c}
MsgWelcome: What's up?
MsgIncomplete: Wait, why are you still here?
MsgResponse4: Is there any medicine you want to make? Do you want me to help you?

MsgSummary:
Pakar asked you to supply food to Venatio Camp which has been suffering from a lack of food. You have to kill some {c1}Round Horn Buffalo{/c} and {c1}Crazyeye Gray Bear{/c} and give seven pieces of Buffalo Meat and seven pieces of Bear Meat to Pakar.

You can find Round Horn Buffalo and Crazyeye Gray Bear to the West of camp.
MsgComplete:
Are you finished already? Your hunting skill is better than I thought. The meat still looks fresh as well; this is a good sign!

Thanks, I owe you one. This is just a token of my gratitude.
MsgTake:
Right now, our camp's food storages are running low. I don't understand why. The number of people hasn't increased at all. {c5}(Scratching his head){/c} Well, whether or not we understand, the problem remains.

Anyway, my mission is to supply food to camp when food is low.  When the Captain found that the food had run out, he was outraged, and said I have to supply the necessary food to the camp before the day is done. If you're not too busy, can you please help me?

I need fresh Buffalo Meat and Bear Meat. You can find them if you hunt Round Horn Buffalo and Crazyeye Gray Bear.  Give me seven of each, then I can find and supply the rest.
MsgWelcome: Hunting is exhausting, but also fun. You'll see once you try it.
MsgIncomplete: Have you found all the food I've requested?
MsgResponse4: Have you found all the food I've requested?

MsgSummary:
You have to search for blood at the cost of ruining the Kaput's sample. You have to kill some {c1}Archane{/c} and find seven {c2}Bloods of Archane{/c} within sixty minutes and return to Kaput within the alloted time.

If you head West from the lab and turn Northwest at the crossroads, keep following this route until you find the {c1}Archane Guardians{/c} around the Vruion Forest hill.
MsgComplete:
Have you collected them all?

{c5}(After looking at a bottle of blood){/c} What is this? When did I tell you to collect the Archane Guardian's blood?
MsgTake:
{c5}(Showing nervousness){/c}  Didn't you hear me? I'm in the middle of some very important research, so tell me later...Oh?!

{c5}(The test tube Kaput was holding fell down to ground and was broken to pieces!! Kaput looks stupefied for a moment and glares at you.){/c}

What the heck are you doing?! You messed up the sample that I didn't get a chance to look at! Now you can go and find me another sample, you idiot!

Kill Archane and bring me its blood! I don't care what you put the blood in. I'll only wait for sixty minutes; you should collect as many as you can, no matter what.
MsgWelcome: I just discovered unknown compounds in the blood... I'm a bit confused, please wait until later.
MsgIncomplete: Do you really have time to chit-chat?
MsgResponse4: Do you really have time to chit-chat?

MsgSummary:
You brought the wrong blood sample. Kill the {c1}Archane Disorderly{/c} and collect seven {c2}Rotten Bloods of Archane{/c} and give them to Kaput within sixty minutes. Don't be late!

Deep in the Vruion Forest, Northwest of the Lab, you can find plenty of Archane Guardians and Disorderlies.
MsgComplete:
This time you didn't screw up, right?

{c5}(After looking at a bottle of blood){/c} Hmm, okay. This is definitely Disorderly blood.

Well done. Now take this and go about your business.
MsgTake:
Guardians are lowly servant Archane. Why on earth would I need to study that blood?!
What I need is the Archane Disorderlies' blood. You have to listen carefully if you want to accomplish your mission! Go and find the right one. I'll await your return for sixty minutes.
MsgWelcome: I just discovered the unknown bloods components. I'm a bit confused, please wait until later.
MsgIncomplete: If you have the time to talk to me, you have the time to collect one more sample!
MsgResponse4: If you have the time to talk to me, you have the time to collect one more sample!

MsgSummary:
Rachio Pisum asked you to collect an ornament of HellTooth. You have to dispatch {c1}DoomFire HellTooth Fighters{/c} and collect {c3}Ornaments of HellTooth{/c} and return to Rachio with them. You have to collect at least five.
You can find Doomfire HellTooth Fighters at the roadside leading toward Herba Farm to the West.
MsgComplete:
You've brought a lot less then I had expected.

Ah, I'm not trying to blame you. This is my reward, so take it. Thanks.
MsgResponse1: Oh, you've brought them. {c5}(Looking at an ornament){/c} It looks unshapely. Well, it is natural because uncivilized Helltooths are using this. I appreciate for your help. This is the reward I promised, so take it. Best of luck on your journeys.
MsgResponse2:
You've brought a lot, but I missed an important appointment while waiting for your return.

Ah, I don't blame you. This is the reward I'm giving you. Take it, with my thanks.
MsgTake: What I'm interested in is the Ornament of HellTooth. According to my investigation, it has magical power. That's why I'm sure it will sell for a lot of money. {c5}(With a wicked smile){/c} If you find it, I'll give you a very nice reward. Please remember, I can only make a profit if you bring me more than five.
MsgWelcome: This is just a street vendor, but the quality of the items here are nice. We sometimes even supply items to the stronghold.
MsgIncomplete: Did you find me those ornaments?
MsgResponse4: Did you find me those ornaments?

MsgSummary:
You have to find a thief who stole Ahera's belongings during the night and punish him. Judging by the footprints, it is likely that the Steel Teeth Gray Wolf had something to do with it.
Get rid of ten {c1}Steel Teeth Gray Wolves{/c} and report to Ahera. You can find wolves near the street vendor.
MsgComplete: That stuff was already broken when you discovered it? I feel better now that I know you've punished them. Perhaps anyone thinking of stealing something from me will think twice now. I must give you something nice.<Reward for Pagan><Reward for Oracle><Reward for Assassin>
MsgTake:
{c5}(With vexation){/c}  I'm frustrated! My stuff disappeared during the night! The shipment we received yesterday was stolen overnight.

It must be the Steel Teeth Gray Wolf's wrongdoings again, judging by the footprints left behind. I don't understand why they keep stealing items that are useless to them.

{c5}(Clapping all of a sudden as though she came up with something){/c} Aha, all right. You're a hero, right? Can you give me a hand? There is nothing we can do about what's already gone, but please punish them so that they'll think twice before stealing again.

Perhaps they'll feel threatened and will be more cautious from now on if you get rid of some of them. If you get this job done well, I'll give a good reward.
MsgWelcome: Don't touch anything if you're broke. These are all expensive items.
MsgIncomplete: Have you punished those wolves?
MsgResponse4: Have you punished those wolves?

MsgSummary:
Armilla, the president of the Arteria Blood Lab, wants you to confirm if Lestat still remembers what she had requested. You have to find Lestat and give him the {c1}Letter of Armilla{/c}.
You can find Lestat's House to the East of the lab.
MsgComplete: Hello customer, welcome. What brings you to my dwelling?
MsgTake:
There you are, right on time. I have been looking for someone who can run an errand for me. I think you're the right person. Why? Call it intuition. {c5}(Grin){/c} It's simple, so don't worry too much about it.

There is a vampire with an ancient name, Restat Cardia, not far from here. Oh, don't be afraid, he's a gentle vampire. He's been interested in what we're doing in our lab, and he's one of my best friends as well.

A few days ago, I asked him to find a sample for new research, but I haven't heard any news since. All our researchers are immersed in their work, so I can't send them to find out what has gone wrong. I figure you can handle this task, right?

Well, please visit the Restat's House with this letter. Ah, one more thing, he isn't too fond of people with bad manners, so be careful your blood doesn't get sucked on accident.
MsgWelcome: Restat has been helping me a lot; I want to study his blood.
MsgIncomplete: I suppose Lestat's house isn't that easy to locate. Have you found it yet?
MsgResponse4: Ah, I went to the lab again yesterday, Armeilla was still gorgeous.

MsgSummary:
You have to kill an Archane named {c1}Pinote{/c} and obtain the {c3}Blood of Pinote{/c}. After that, you have to report back to Lestat.
If you go straight toward Arteria Blood Lab from Lestat's House and keep following the route toward northwest, you can find Pinote among Archane Guardians and Archane Disorderlies on the hill.
MsgComplete:
Did you find it? {c5}(Smelling the fragrance after opening the bottle){/c}  Wow, such an unbearable blood smell, this must be what cursed existence is like.

Even I hate blood like this. Here's the reward for you.
MsgTake:
{c5}(After reading a letter){/c} hmm, You must be the messenger Armilla sent. Right, let me think, I simply forgot a favor she asked of me. What was it... Ahhh, yes, it was about Pinote, correct?

{c5}(Beaming){/c} Are you asking who Pinote is? It's the name of a cursed Archane woman. She used to be a common woman of the Vail clan. However, she became crazed and cursed the goddess because the person she was in love with chose the path of God's servant.

As a result, the wrath of Etain devastated her with a curse that turned her into a bizarre creature. This is the story, there is nothing special about this. I don't know why, but It seems Armilla is very curious about her blood. She always has been a unique character. That's one of the reasons I like her.

Well, it's not going to be so easy, but please kill Pinote and bring me some of her blood. She will most likely put up a fight, be careful so you don't get hurt.
MsgWelcome: I went to a lab again yesterday, Armilla was still gorgeous.
MsgIncomplete: Have you captured Pinote safely?
MsgResponse4: Have you captured Pinote safely?

MsgSummary: You have to return to {c2}Armilla{/c} with Blood of Pinote. You have to deliver the {c3}Letter of Lestat{/c} and the {c3}Blood of Pinote{/c} to Armilla.
MsgComplete:
Ah, you've finally returned with it. {c5}(After reading the letter){/c} 

Haha, such a venomous person, he can really be a freak sometimes. Anyways, thanks for the blood...you have done well. Is this reward good enough? Either way, it'll have to do.  Farewell!
MsgTake:
Well, now that we've obtained what Armilla needs, delivering it is the only task left, right? Make sure you don't drop it and break it. Please be careful when you handle this. Use this Rilan in case of emergency.

Also, can you take this letter I wrote and give it to her? Take care.
MsgWelcome: Ah, I went to the lab again yesterday and Armilla was still gorgeous.
MsgIncomplete: Haven't you left to meet Armilla yet?
MsgResponse4: Lestat has been helping me a lot. I want to study his blood.

MsgSummary:
Muo asked you to examine what has happened to the document he sent to Garter. You have to find a lord, {c2}Garter{/c}.
You can find Garter in the official residence in the middle of the village.
MsgComplete:
What's going on?

{c5}(as though annoyed after hearing the story){/c} ah, Are you talking about the document Muo sent? What a pity...
MsgTake:
Ah you're right on time! I have one favor to ask you, so hear me out. I realized that a dreadful plan was already underway.

There's a certain ruin not far from the town of Gliter. I was told that groups of people who are worshipping the nameless god out there have been performing a bloody ritual...! In addition, rumor has it these groups are even planning to rebel. This is a really big deal!

Therefore, a few days ago, I sent a message I wrote to a lord of this city, Garter, but I haven't heard any answer from him so far. I don't know what has gone wrong either. 
Please go there and find Garter and tell me what is going on!
MsgWelcome: (giggle) My name is Muo. Do you really need my help?
MsgIncomplete: Did you ask Garter about it?
MsgResponse4: I'm a local officer of this village, Garter. What's up?

MsgSummary:
Garter asked you to get rid of ancient evil spirits. You have to dispose of 7 Ancient God Believers and 7 Ancient God Worshipers and go back to Garter.
You can find the ruin to the west of Gliter.
MsgComplete:
Oh, You finally returned. I'm sure your labor will give scholars' historical research great help. Ha ha. well,  I'll give a message to Muo separately, so don't worry about that.

Well, This is a reward I promised. I hope you'll grow up as a great warrior...!
MsgTake:
Of course I already have read that document, but unfortunately it is nothing but Muo's excessive obsession. Originally Muo is used to say everything big, and his morbid obsession with Etain is pretty deep. I even wonder how that guy became the god's servant. heh.

However, apart from Muo's report, that ancient ruin is the place where scholars are primarily interested in. According to the remark of scholars who went there to investigate, it is not easy task to approach the ruin due to ancient evil spirit wandering about.

Ah, all right, you seem to have a great skill. Could you handle those evil spirits in the ruin for us scholars? I promise I'll give you a sufficient reward. Fine, I'm counting on you..!
MsgWelcome: I'm a local officer of this village, Garter. What can I do for you??
MsgIncomplete: Did you get rid of evil spirits in the ruin?
MsgResponse4: Did you get rid of evil spirits in the ruin?

MsgSummary:
You have to kill BlackSkull members damaging the farm and collect {c3}BlackSkull Mark {/c}as evidence. All you have to do is kill either {c1}BlackSkull Skeleton Soldier{/c} or {c1}BlackSkull Succubus{/c}.
You can find the BlackSkull Family on your way north of the farm. You have to collect 10 BlackSkull Marks and give them to Zaite.
MsgComplete:
Hmm...It seems you have finished off a good number of them, considering the marks you have collected. Thank you, and this is what I have to offer.

Well done, friend. This is a reward, so keep it. May the Goddess bless you. <Reward for Warrior, Guardian><Reward for Hunter><Reward for Oracle, Pagan>
MsgTake:
Strange people have been wandering around the farm since several days ago, so I asked some hunters who stop by the Venatio Camp occasionally to investigate. It turns out the name of the group is 'Blackskull'.

The longer the war gets, the more we see strange things. I hope they won't damage our farm anymore. Perhaps that's wishful thinking, though.

There have been a lot of accidents such as getting robbed or farms broken into during the last few days. There was something like a black piece of cloth on the ground all the time where accidents happened. I don't know if they dropped it either by mistake or on purpose, but I don't think they are dumb like elves. Anyway, we have to get rid of them regardless of whether they are dumb or not, so long as they keep damaging our farms.

I want you to help me. Go to their base and dispose of them properly, then collect their mark as evidence. Show them what a true nightmare is!
MsgWelcome: I'm a superintendent of this farm. Be careful not to hurt our cattle and just look around.
MsgIncomplete: Did you complete the request I asked before?
MsgResponse4: Did you complete the request I asked before?

MsgSummary:
Patser asked you to find necessary ingredients for his research. You have to capture {c1}Crow Swamp Frog{/c} and collect 10 Sacks of Poison and give them to Patser.
You can find the Crow Swamp Frog in the swamp east of the lab.
MsgComplete:
Did you collect them all? I will attempt to mix them here. It can be dangerous, so please give me some space.

{c5}(Patser mixes ingredients inside the test tube he was holding. A moment later, Patser gives a sigh...){/c}
MsgTake:
I'm developing a medicine that might help in the war against the Elves. It is a tasteless, deadly poison that can be mixed into food. There are still several things missing from this mixture.

Can you find them for me? They are not too difficult of ingredients to get, so don't worry. There are several kinds of frogs living to the east of this lab. There is one frog named Crow Swamp Frog among them. If you capture one, you can obtain the Sack of Poison. Just collect 10 of them and give them to me.
MsgWelcome: Do you want to learn the basic drilling first? You'd better keep building your skill!
MsgIncomplete: Are you doing what I asked of you?
MsgResponse4: Are you doing what I asked of you?

MsgSummary:
Patser asked you to find necessary ingredients for his research. 
You have to capture Crow Swamp Big Jar Frog and collect 10 Rotten Sacks of Poison and give them to Patser.
You can find the Crow Swamp Big Jar Frog in the swamp northeast of the lab.
MsgComplete:
That's right, This is what I'm looking for.

{c5}(After mixing ingredients into the test tube he was holding up and waiting for a while, soon with a smile of satisfaction){/c} (grin) Using this concoction on the elves is the only thing left.

Ah, I'll give you this handsome reward. Fare thee well.
MsgTake:
Oh my...this is the wrong ingredient. I must have mistaken it with something else. How could I be so insane?! Could you do an old alchemist a last favor and seek the correct ingredients again, kind soldier?

This time, capture the Crow Swamp Big Jar Frog northeast of a lab. Then we'll find something called the Rotten Sack of Poison. That's the correct ingredient for the poison I'm trying to make.
All you have to get is just 10 of them. I will start creating a new reagent while you are out seeking the items. This Torin Nut will help heal your health when you need it. Now let's get this project started!
MsgWelcome: Do you want to learn basic drilling first?
MsgIncomplete: Are you doing what I asked of you?
MsgResponse4: Are you doing what I asked of you?

MsgSummary:
Kunnel asked you to find {c2}Derkan{/c} in the Frovaton Vill.
You can find the Frovaton Vill if you follow the western route from the Hunting Camp.
MsgComplete: {c5}(Scratching his                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           head){/c}I also want to return, but I have...a certain situation.
MsgTake:
Are you a traveler? Then can you do me a favor? A little while ago, Mr.Tuirtum gave one errand to Derkan, a hunter of our camp, asking him go to the Frovaton Vill.
However, I haven't heard any information from him even though he should have returned here a long time ago. As you can guess, I have a mountain of things I want to ask him. I have no idea what's caused him so much delay. Can you stop by the Frovation Vill and check it out?
MsgWelcome: This is the Venatio Camp. Our job is to capture monsters and give them to farms.
MsgIncomplete: You haven't found Derkan yet?
MsgResponse4: I'm a hunter, Derkan. I came here to capture one strong Tatoramo and bring it back with me.

MsgSummary:
You have to get rid of BlackSkull members on behalf of Derkan and return. Abandoned Kobolts from their family are heard to be the center of BlackSkull family.
After disposing of 5 BlackSkull Kobolt Soldiers and 3 BlackSkull Kobolt Warriors, return to Derkan.
MsgComplete:
Oh, You're back earlier than I expected. The more battle experience you get, the better. Ha ha..!

{c5}(Suddenly nonplussed, reducing his voice while laughing){/c} My worries are gone thanks to you. This is one of my most cherished items, but I'll give it to you as a gift. Grow up to be a strong warrior who can make a great contribution to our union.
MsgTake:
What Tuirtum requested has already been done. Delivering one Tatoramo is quite simple. The butcher, Slot, may have already chopped up the Tatoramo I delivered and sold it to somewhere as cooking ingredient. By the way, the reason I can't return is....

{c5}(Suddenly lowering his voice and whispering){/c} I took on a favor from the head of the farm, Zaite. It seems the members of BlackSkull family have been roaming around the farm and causing a lot of trouble. He wanted someone to wipe them out...

I don't like fighting with dirty monsters like them, but it's not easy to decline his request, so can you help me?

Excellent. I need you to go there, eliminate them, and return. I heard abandoned kobolts are close with the BlackSkull family.  Perhaps all you need to do is get rid of kobolts primarily. Fight well, warrior; I'll be waiting.
MsgWelcome: I'm a hunter, Derkan. I came here to capture one strong Tatoramo and bring it back with me.
MsgIncomplete: Did you manage to capture some of the BlackSkull family?
MsgResponse4: Did you manage to capture some of the BlackSkull family?

MsgSummary:
You have to obtain the sample for Chrichika's new mutation study. You have to capture the 
Mutated Arachne Watcher, obtain 7 Fluid Specimens, and give them to Chrichika.
You can find the Mutated Arachne Watcher northeast of the institute.
MsgComplete:
{c5}(With sparkling eyes){/c} Did you find them? Ah, superb... You've found them as I requested. I'll begin the full-scale experiment with this!

Here's some money for your labor. Thanks again!
MsgTake:
This time of year is really appropriate for research. The flow of nature is twisted and numerous mutations constantly come into existence.

What, war? Ah~It's none of my business, so I don't care. I rather like war because I can do a variety of research~ Now, I was just about to begin the research on the new mutation.

That's where you come in. Can you get the necessary materials for my project? I need the fluid specimen of Mutated Arachne Watcher. I don't need too many of them. Around 7 will be sufficient.

I don't like waiting, so make it quick if possible. Take care now~
MsgWelcome: Ah-HA! You came here to learn alchemy, right? Right?
MsgIncomplete: How is the sample collection coming along?
MsgResponse4: How is the sample collection coming along?

MsgSummary:
Chrichika asked you to take the fluid specimen and go to Pauke and let him examine it.
It is important that you keep Chrichika's request a secret. Also, you must make this look like you are doing it at your own behest.
MsgComplete:
I'm in the middle of the experiment, so if you want to impart some trivial matter, tell me later...
{c5}(after looking at specimen){/c} What? What is this? Is this what you found?
MsgTake:
Haven't you helped me before? Great! If you aren't too busy, allow me to ask for your assistance again.

I'm studing that ingredient you brought last time, but I discovered one component I'm unable to know whatsoever. I rummaged through all kinds of books thoroughly, but I couldn't find a component like this anywhere. Maybe this is because it is a mutation. I'm supposed to be delighted as a reseArcher, but I don't have the knowledge to analyze this component yet. 

I feel so mortified, but I have no choice but to ask Pauke. Well...at least you're doing a little better than me here. I'm not going to ask him in person for anything. Go there...casually, show this specimen, and ask him what it is. You must never let him realize that this a favor for the great Chrichika, got it?
{c5}(You receive a fluid specimen){/c}
MsgWelcome: Ah, so you've come here to learn alchemy, is that it?
MsgIncomplete: Why are you still here? Get going and find him, before he suspects something!
MsgResponse4: Once you are ready to learn, I'll teach you.

MsgSummary:
You have to find the necessary ingredients and give them to Pauke to find out their component. You have to obtain the 5 Fluids of {c1}Mutated Arachne Combater{/c} and 5 Fluids of {c1}Mutated Arachne Berserk{/c}and return to Pauke.
You can find the Mutated Arachne Combater and Mutated Arachne Berserk northeast of the lab.
MsgComplete:
It seems you've brought what I need. Well then, it's time to begin this experiment.

{c5}(Pauke performs the unprecedented experiment with tools prepared in advance. After a long wait, smoke curls up from the test tube mixed up with body fluids and soon go down again){/c}
MsgTake:
Hmmm...perhaps this will be the fluid of the Mutated Arachne. Do you want me to examine its blood fluid content? You must have heard I'm the most outstanding alchemist in this Panakeia Lab. Well, I surely won't deny those rumors! Let me take a look at it...

{c5}(For a while he rummages documents next to him and picks up one of them and studies its contents carefully){/c} Hmm, I think we can figure it out unexpectedly though a rather simple experiment. I need some ingredients. Can you obtain them? I'm hoping you're up to handling it; it's your request, after all.

All right, bring a proper amount of Fluid of Mutated Arachne Combater and Fluid of Mutated Arachne Berserk. If you find them, you'll know what you have been curious about, so hurry up.
MsgWelcome: Once you are ready to learn, I'll teach you.
MsgIncomplete: Did you bring everything I needed?
MsgResponse4: Did you bring everything I needed?

MsgSummary: Pauke asks you to keep the {c3}Scrolled Document{/c} that includes the result of experiment and leaves it with you. You have to return to Chrichika with it.
MsgComplete:
At last you've returned! I have been waiting for you! Did you identify the component?

{c5}(receiving the document having the result of study){/c} Wonderful~ Ho ho ho, that foolish Pauke~ I've invented a new poison and sent it to the forefront.

Thanks to your help, my career is now even more illustrious! This is the reward I'm offering. Use it wisely. Good-bye~
MsgTake:
{c5}(holding up the test tube and looking at it){/c} Oh-ho, this is it...this is surely a fascinating discovery.

I guess we can make use of this medicine in the war against elves very effectively once we make a successful toxin using this component. As you know, nobody comes close to the Vail Clan when it comes to Alchemy. Developing a deadly poison will assist us and be a great contribution to victory in the war.

{c5}(thoughtful for a moment and writing something down to the scrolled document and handing it over){/c} Well, I want you to keep this for a while. There is nobody I can trust in this lab, so it will be dangerous if I have this.

I feel rather relieved because you are an outsider. If I have no work to do sooner or later, I will have tasks for you so please don't go anywhere for a while.
MsgWelcome: Once you are ready to learn, I'll teach you.
MsgIncomplete: Is there still something else you want to talk to me about?
MsgResponse4: Ah, so you've come here to learn alchemy, is that it?

MsgSummary:
You must receive the letter that has Garter's signature and give it to Tuirtum in the hunting camp.
Venatio Camp is the Deatheater's hunting camp northeast of Gliter.
MsgComplete:
Hey traveler, what's this all about?

{c5}(after looking at the letter){/c} Is this Garter's signature? Why is he sending me this?
MsgTake:
The war against the Alliance of Light continues on. I suppose it'll never end until either us or the Elves are completely annihilated. Perhaps that's why our main forces are on the forefront.

Well, this area is under my conrol. There's one thing I need from a mercenary like you. Don't worry about the reward - it will be much better than you think. Do you want to give it a try?

Then first, find Tuirtum in the Venatio Camp and give him this letter. He's an old friend of mine, and if you show him that letter, he'll let you know what you have to do. Go on now; don't delay.
MsgWelcome: I'm Garter, a local official of this village. What do you want?
MsgIncomplete: Tuirtum is in the Venatio Camp northeast of here.
MsgResponse4: Welcome to the Venatio Camp. Our job is to capture monsters and give them to farms.

MsgSummary: You have to dispose of {c1}10 Ancient God Curse Witches{/c} around the Realm of Death, Death Weaver, northeast of Reikeuseu and return to Tuirtum again.
MsgComplete: Hmm, well done. Now on to your second mission.
MsgTake:
Garter said I'm his friend?

{c5}(sneering){/c}  I swear to Kali, he and I have never even fought on the same battefield.
Actually, I have my doubts he actually served in the military. Isn't he kind of weak? Well, the whole Vail clan is typically weaker than us, after all...

Apparently Garter put you in a hard spot by luring you with money. If it were me, I would have ignored an imposter's favor like that, but you're already here, so I suppose you probably have no choice but to take this on. 

{c5}(looking at the letter){/c} Well, here's what it says. 'There are monsters rampaging near the Realm of Death, so I want them finished.' Here's hoping you get rid of those Ancient God Curse Witches and return. When you do, I'll let you know your next mission. Don't try to deal with them all together; take 'em out one by one.
MsgWelcome: This is the Venatio Camp. Our job is to capture monsters and give them to farms.
MsgIncomplete: Did you dispose of all Ancient God Curse Witches?
MsgResponse4: Did you dispose of all Ancient God Curse Witches?

MsgSummary: You have to dispose of {c1}10 Black Hand Succubuses{/c} around Death Weaver, the Realm of Death, northeast of Reikeuseu and return to Tuirtum again.
MsgComplete: Well now, you've got some remarkable talent. I've got a final mission for you.
MsgTake:
Hmm...for the second mission...{c5}(after looking at the letter){/c} take down Black Hand Succubi.

Succubi are evil creatures. If you're not careful, you can be controlled by their black temptation. There have been men whose spirits were totally captivated by these evil creatures. Some of the survivors went insane because they couldn't forget the pleasure.

Anyway, maybe I'm worrying too much; you've got the power to eliminate Ancient God Curse Witches. Please take care of them at once!
MsgWelcome: This is the Venatio Camp. Our job is to capture monsters and give them to farms.
MsgIncomplete: Have you slain all of the Black Hand Succubi?
MsgResponse4: Have you slain all of the Black Hand Succubi?

MsgSummary: You have to dispose of {c1}7 NightMare Charge Soldiers{/c} and {c1}5 NightMare Bodyguards{/c} around the Realm of Death, Death Weaver, northeast of Reikeuseu and return to Tuirtum again.
MsgComplete:
Finally, it's over! You did a great job. This is a small reward to encourage you to become a greater warrior. Take this, in addition to whatever reward Garter has for you.

What you have done has been a great help to the people living in this area. It's time for you to go receive Garter's reward. {c5}(he writes down a letter.){/c}<Reward for Warrior, Guardian><Reward for Assassin, Hunter><Reward for Oracle, Pagan>
MsgTake:
If you see this through, you'll get a reward from Garter, so don't lose your spirit. Your last mission is to take down NightMare Charge Soldiers and NightMare Bodyguards.

Nightmares are quick and quite powerful. Make sure you stay sharp when you meet them in combat. In addition, they are more ferocious than ever these days. According to some Vail, this is because the resurrection of Fantasma is about to begin, but that's not our concern - it involves their responsibility for choices they made in the past....

Anyway, your mission is over once you finish these nightmares, so keep yourself strong and make a strong finish.
MsgWelcome: This is the Venatio Camp. Our job is to capture monsters and give them to farms.
MsgIncomplete: Have you dealt cold death to all the Nightmares?
MsgResponse4: Have you dealt cold death to all the Nightmares?

MsgSummary: You have to take a Letter from Tuirtum regarding your mission performance to a lord of Gliter, {c2}Garter{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Welcome back. Was it as difficult as I assumed? I knew you wouldn't have any problems accomplishing the mission with your power.

{c5}(after looking at a letter){/c} hmm, Tuirtum wrote down many details. He didn't treat you poorly, did he? Haha, fine...this is my reward for your mission. It should be large enough. I look forward to seeing you again.
MsgTake:
{c5}(giving you a scribbled letter){/c} Well, take this and give it to Garter. I've taken care to describe your accomplishments to prove what you've done, and signed it myself.

That fellow Garter is very sly, so I'm a little worried about whether he will give you a sufficient reward for your labor. You've done a wonderful job so far, so take care.
MsgWelcome: This is the Venatio Camp. Our job is to capture monsters and give them to farms.
MsgIncomplete: Garter will be waiting. Go and get the reward you deserve.
MsgResponse4: I'm Garter, a local official of this village. What is this all about?

MsgSummary: Ophen, the priest of Yemetis Temple, asked you to take care of vipers. You have to get rid of {c1}7 Viper Fortunetellers{/c} and {c1}7 Viper Spellbinders{/c} and return to Ophen.
MsgComplete:
Hmm...judging by the scent of blood wafting from you, I can tell you have undergone many bloody battles already.

Your pain has been rewarded by the blessing of Etain and the Holy Mother Narsilriel. This must remunerate you for your labor, correct? Then fare thee well.
MsgTake:
A while ago, I heard news of a troubling sort. Apparently, the vipers have begun to scheme. 

You can find marsh vipers northeast from here. According to followers who pass by that district on the way to this shrine, they witnessed vipers occasionally calling out to a nameless god and performing a ritual.

It doesn't surprise me that evil creatures like those vipers are performing a ritual. Many followers have already been assailed by the vipers; you can tell that they're not on our side. 

Warrior, I charge you with punishing these evil creatures in the name of Etain and the Holy Mother Narsilriel.
MsgWelcome: Glory to the great Vail's mother, Narsilriel and Eclipsiss!
MsgIncomplete: Have you dealt our retribution to the vipers?
MsgResponse4: Have you dealt our retribution to the vipers?

MsgSummary: The alchemist Pokale of Panakeia Lab told you to find the leader of Yemitis Temple, Hamus. You can find the Yemetis Temple if you keep following the route toward east from the lab.
MsgComplete:
May the blessings of Etain and Narsilriel be upon you. Welcome to Yemetis Temple. What brought you here?

Ah, are you here because you heard about Pokale's story? I am on good terms with her.
Because you come recommended by her, I feel I can trust you. Unfortunately, we don't have any jobs for you to do at the moment.

You can always return later to check. Get some rest and begin your journey again.
MsgTake:
Have you ever been Yemetis Temple before? We Vail worship the Holy Father Etain and the Holy Mother Narsilriel. 

The Yemetis Temple was also founded in an early age. It was built in an isolated place, so disbelievers do not taint the atmosphere. That's why the Yemetis Temple has always maintained a religious atmosphere.

Do you want to find a job there? If so, you should seek out the leader of temple, Hamus.
MsgWelcome: Do you need a stronger medicine? You'd better be careful not to become addicted.
MsgIncomplete: You didn't go to the temple yet, did you?
MsgResponse4: We, the Vail, are a noble race chosen by God. The Virgin Narsilriel will ever be with you.

MsgSummary:
Zea asked you to find the {c3}Scale of Asina{/c} from the viper boss, Asina. You have to capture {c1}Asina{/c} and go back to Zea with a Scale of Asina.
You can find Asina among Viper Fortunetellers and Viper Spellbinders if you exit the temple and go up northeast.
MsgComplete:
Ah, Did you bring it? Excellent! Now I can make a fortune out of this! Let's see, among the total bounty on Asina, your share of the reward will be...

{c5}(after calculating for a while){/c} This should do nicely. Now, going to a public office is the only thing left. I'll stop by there when I go to the village next time. Thanks!

<Reward for Oracle, Pagan><Reward for Assassin><Reward for Warrior, Guardian>
MsgTake:
It's too difficult to work these days, what with the war going on. Everybody is busy fighting on the battlefiled, learning combat skills and magic and things of that sort.
I can hardly find people who are willing to come and learn a trade from me. I've gotta make a living too, so this is not good, really.

So I've been searching for infomation about bounties, and y'know what? I discovered something very nice! I suppose you already noticed there are vipers wandering around here. There is one boss viper named Asina among them. If you capture it and give the scale of Asina to some kind of a public office as evidence, you'll get a bounty as a reward. That's great news, ain't it?

Please help me out. I gave you information, so this is where you come in. Please capture Asina and get that scale. Maybe I can divide the bounty into two equal portions! How about it? Now go; capture Asina and bring its scale. Someone else might capture it before us, so you'd better hurry up.
MsgWelcome: I can broaden your mind. Do you want to learn?
MsgIncomplete: Did you bring the scale of Asina?
MsgResponse4: Did you bring the scale of Asina?

MsgSummary:
You've been told that {c2}Billie Lake{/c} needs assistance with something. Go find out what he needs a hand with.
Billie is a guard protecting the Watch Tower of the village.
MsgComplete: How have you been enjoying your stay in the village? Ah, you heard I'm looking for someone to help me? In that case I'm glad you're here.
MsgTake:
Well, now that you've finished warming up, it's time for you to go to the village and help people out. Since this is your first time and you don't know what to do, let me give you a head start.

Look around for a guard called Billie. Apparently he's looking for someone who can help him. As you know, doing a guard's job is very exhausting, so you don't always have time to do other things. Perhaps you can assist him.
MsgWelcome: Welcome, newcomer.
MsgIncomplete: Have you found Billie yet? Try looking past the east gate.
MsgResponse4: You're not afraid of anything are you? If you want to pass through here, you'll need my permission.

MsgSummary:
Mellie asked you to kill the {c1}Bulbuous Eye Foxes{/c} that broke into the institute and caused a big ruckus. You have to hunt seven Bulbuous Eye Foxes and report to Mellie.

You can find the Bulbuous Eye Fox to the Northeast of Fanselenon Institute.
MsgComplete: I was able to focus on just my research quietly for a while. I feel sorry for the innocent foxes, but the war needs to end soon. Thank you again; I wish you a pleasant journey.
MsgTake:
This is Fanselenon Institute, always on the cutting edge of research on Summoning magic and soul collection. I can confidently say the research done here is among the most importnant Elven scholarship being done today.

However, the problem is there have been a lot of small troubles that keep occurring, so none of the reseArchers can focus on their research, not to mention me. Bulbuous Eye Foxes keep coming inside the institute and causing a ruckus. You'd never imagine how ridiculously wild they were, jumping around here and there, messing everything up.

They used to be nice, but as the years go by, I feel like the animals of Teos are becoming more wild.
{c5}(With a sad voice){/c} Perhaps it is because of this never-ending war. Could you force the Bulbuous Eye Foxes to calm down? I need your help.
MsgWelcome: Are you curious about soul collection? I can teach you a bit about it.
MsgIncomplete: Have you been able to take care of the Bulbuous Eye Foxes?
MsgResponse4: Have you been able to take care of the Bulbuous Eye Foxes?

MsgSummary:
Mellie of Fanselenon Institute told you to find {c2}Pico Blendy{/c} in the hunter camp. Pico is an Elf girl, and younger sister of Earl Blendy, the eldest sister in the camp.

You can find the hunter camp if you head Northeast of the Institute.  Look for a peculiar looking tree.
MsgComplete:
We have a newcomer in the hunter camp! Greetings! My name is Pico Blendy, and Earl Blendy here is my sister.

You must have met my sister Mellie. I miss her, how was she? If she can trust you, so can I. If I need someone's help, I will let you know. Have a good day; I'm sure I'll see you later!
MsgTake:
You must be the one who helped me before, right? I'm delighted to see you again.

If you intend to leave and continue traveling around, I hope you'll drop by Earl Blendy's hunting camp sometime. A few elven hunters are living there; I was told they are always busy and shorthanded as well. If you go there, you'll definitely find things you can help with.

Once you go to a hunter camp, you may meet a girl named Pico. She's Earl's sister, a real cutie. She's very kind to people too, so you'll may end up taking a liking to her too. Anyway, take care.
MsgWelcome: Are you curious about soul collection? I can teach you a bit about it.
MsgIncomplete: Have you stopped by the hunter camp yet?
MsgResponse4: Earl's sister is simply an amazing person.

MsgSummary:
Carter of the Arbor Farm told you to find {c2}Mustin{/c} in the Antaraks Farm. Mustin is a miner at Antaraks Farm.

Antaraks Farm is a mining village. You can find Antaraks Farm easily - just follow the route to the North of Arbor Farm.
MsgComplete:
Who are you?

Ah, Carter told you to visit here, did he? I get the feeling your a trustworthy one, aye. Nice to meet you - you're very brave to come to a dark village like this on your own.

Actually, we've been looking for someone to help us. Would you be willing to give us a hand? Get some rest first and hopefully you can help us with our problem when you're not busy. I'll see you later.
MsgTake:
You must be the person Timber has been talking about! You don't actually look that strong, but I suppose I should stop judging people by their appearance, ha ha!

Are you going to be leaving this village soon? If so, I suggest you set your course toward Antaraks Farm. The Miners living there are definitely the "can-do" sort, but I was told they're in trouble due to Dwarves recently. They'll definitely welcome you if you end up going that way.

If you do stop there in your travels, find a person named Mustin. He's an acquaintence of mine, so if you tell him about me, at least they should trust you.
MsgWelcome: Make sure to grind your axe blade often. It's no good if you have nothing to defend yourself with when you come down the mountain.
MsgIncomplete: You're still around? Hope you're enjoying your stay. Don't forget, if you stop by Antaraks Farm, look for Mustin.
MsgResponse4: Leona is my niece. I feel proud whenever I see her taking good care of her shop.

MsgSummary: Noei asked you to find the lost {c3}Engagement Ring of Noei{/c}. He said it is very likely he lost it near the Vertex Kip, the small castle Northeast of Karis Castle. It is also very possible that a {c1}Vagabond Ruin Wolf{/c} ate it somehow, so you'll have to check it out.
MsgComplete:
This is the Ring I received from the lovely Ann! Thank you so much!

I know it's not a lot of money, but I want to give you something for your services. Please keep it. Thank you so much!
MsgTake:
Oh my god! What am I supposed to do? Hey, you, can you do me a favor? My name is Noei Mecerun. I've lived here for three years. No, wait; that's not what I meant to say.

I have a fiance in my hometown; Ann is her name. I promised to go back and marry her after the war is over. We even exchanged rings as a token of our promise. The ring was as dear as my life, but...

I must have dropped it somewhere during the last battle when our troops were being withdrawn. I've tried to return there to look for it several times, but you know, I'm not allowed to leave my post unattended. 

I'm begging you. I think I dropped it near the Vertex Kip. There is a slight chance it was eaten by wolves!
MsgWelcome: I lost something very significant to me. Perhaps I lost it during the battle...what am I going to do?
MsgIncomplete: Have you found my engagement ring yet?
MsgResponse4: Have you found my engagement ring yet?

MsgSummary:
Priest Yel has asked you to go to Selune's Ruins and finish off some warriors cursed by a spell. You have to eliminate ten {c1}Selune Rotten Bone Warriors{/c} and report to Yel.

You can find Selune's Ruin to the Southeast of Karis Castle.
MsgComplete: You've done a good job, but this is only the beginning.
MsgTake:
We humans have a complex history surrounding religion. The Deities' Religion is a religion for respecting and serving Goddess Etain with great sincerity, but this doesn't necessarily mean we deny the existence of other gods. After we had been carried to this continent of Teos by a mysterious power, we realized there are many gods that exist in the world.

Originally, we used to have a lot of temples here dedicated to a variety of gods; of course, most of them have been destroyed due to the war. There is one temple in this area dedicated to a god named Selune. However, a little while ago, we discovered that evil power was sneaking out of this area, so we investigated this area to find out what was going on. It turned out skeleton corpses had been brought back to life and were attacking people without any warning.

Perhaps this kind of thing happened due to the evil spell of Deatheaters or the Vail. Above all, minimizing the damage will be the most important thing. Could you go and take care of the warriors first?
MsgWelcome: I'm Yel, a priest. You may speak to me of whatever you'd like.
MsgIncomplete: Have you gotten rid of all the skeletal warriors?
MsgResponse4: Have you gotten rid of all the skeletal warriors?

MsgSummary:
Priest Yel asked you to go to Selune's Ruins to take care of magicians cursed by a spell. You have to eliminate ten {c1}Selune Rotten Bone Magician{/c} and return to Yel.
You can find Selune's Ruins to the Southeast of Karis Castle.
