MsgComplete:
Good, good; you've returned. That wasn't so demanding, was it?

I've got one more favor. Take a moment to catch your breath, then I'll tell you.
MsgTake:
Perhaps they must have been people who used to serve Selune when they were living. Because of the war they just disappeared into the ground along with the collapse of temple. Considering we have to kill souls that should already be at rest, as a follower of God it makes me sad. I have nothing to say except the fact all these tragedies were brought on by the war.

Reducing the number of them a little bit more seems to be top priority as of now. This time, please get rid of magicians.
MsgWelcome: I'm Yel, a priest. You may speak to me of whatever you'd like.
MsgIncomplete: Have you gotten rid of all the magicians?
MsgResponse4: Have you gotten rid of all the magicians?

MsgSummary:
Priest Yel asked you to go to Selune's Ruins to take care of commanders cursed by a spell. You have to eliminate ten {c1}Selune Rotten Bone Commanders{/c} and return to Yel.

You can find Selune's Ruins to the Southeast of Karis Castle.
MsgComplete:
You've done a wonderful job. Thanks to your efforts, I'm sure other travelers will be safer as well.

This is only a small reward, but please keep it, and may Etain guide your path.
MsgTake:
Deatheaters and the Vail are truly practicioners of evil. How can they manipulate the dead with a spell?  We've since proven these are their true actions. The thorough investigation finished a little while ago!

In order to lift this spell, magicians and summonors of our Elven clan are studying together, but I don't think it will be that easy. It saddens me, but we have to minimize damage until they find a method, so could you do this one more time? Please get rid of some commanders and return here.
MsgWelcome: I'm Yel, a priest. You may speak to me of whatever you'd like.
MsgIncomplete: Did you destroy all the commanders?
MsgResponse4: Did you destroy all the commanders?

MsgSummary:
You have to kill three {c1}members of the Union of Fury{/c} and return to lord Tania.
It doesn't matter if you kill Vail or Deatheaters.
MsgComplete:
What a superb performance! You proved our worries to be for nothing. I think the morale of our allaiance will be higher from now on.

This is a small reward for your valor; hopefully you'll have a use for it. I hope to often see you in the forefront of the battle. Take care.
MsgTake:
The war against the Union of Fury is getting fiercer as time goes on. The destiny of our entire alliance depends on this war, so you also have to do your best in this war as both a member of the alliance and a self-made warrior.

I don't know how much battle experience you've accumulated, but I hope your skills are good enough to accomplish this mission I'm about to give you.

One of the most crucial things in the war is to lower the morale of enemies! Therefore, all you have to do now is reduce the number of members of the Union of Fury. Kill as many as you can - go and annihilate the evil Vail and disgusting Deatheaters, then return triumphant!
MsgWelcome: My name is Tania, a local official. How are things going?
MsgIncomplete: Etain's blessing will protect you on the battlefield all the time. Don't worry, just go and fight!
MsgResponse4: Etain's blessing will protect you on the battlefield all the time. Don't worry, just go and fight!

MsgSummary:
You have to kill three {c1}members of the Union of Fury{/c} and return to lord Tania.
It doesn't matter if you kill Vail or Deatheaters.
MsgComplete:

MsgIncomplete: Etain's blessing will protect you on the battlefield. Don't worry, just go and fight!
MsgResponse4: Etain's blessing will protect you on the battlefield. Don't worry, just go and fight!

MsgSummary:
You have to kill five {c1}members of the Union of Fury{/c} and return to lord Tania.
It doesn't matter if you kill Vail or Deatheaters.
MsgComplete:
What a superb performance! You proved that we were worried over nothing. Well done! The moral of our Alliance will be higher from now on.

This is a small reward for your labor. I hope you find it useful. I hope I will always see you in the forefront of the battle. Take care.
MsgTake:
The war against the Union of Fury is getting fiercer as time goes on. The destiny of our entire alliance depends on this war, so you also have to do your best in the coming battles as both a member of the alliance and a self-made warrior.

This is a small reward for your labor. I hope you find it useful. I hope I will always see you in the forefront of the battle. Take care.

MsgIncomplete: Etain's blessing will protect you on the battlefield. Don't worry, just go and fight!
MsgResponse4: Etain's blessing will protect you on the battlefield. Don't worry, just go and fight!

MsgSummary: Cider asked you to deliver medicine to {c2}George Pilluon{/c}. George is a human soldier standing next to the weapon merchant inside the west gate of the Castle.
MsgComplete:
What? {c5}(Feeling awkward after looking at a medicine){/c} Er...isn't this the medicine I requested from Cider, by any chance? Oh dear...what was she thinking, handing something like this to a woman?

What? What medicine is this? Heh...well...I don't think you should know what this is. My girlfriend said I was falling asleep too quickly, so I asked Cider to mix something to keep me up.

Thanks anyway, though. This is for your trouble. Good bye!
MsgTake:
If you're not too busy, can you give this to George? I'm asking you this because you're a woman. Men are too hasty you know, they often forget as soon as you ask them to do something.

I made this potion on special order as a favor for George. Please get it to him as quick as you can. Oh, wait, wait! I nearly forgot to tell you, George is one of the soldiers training inside of the stronghold, okay? I'm counting on you!
MsgWelcome: Wow, what a handsome hero you are. Grab anything you like and I'll give it to you at a discount.
MsgIncomplete: Oh my! Haven't you gotten that potion to him yet?
MsgResponse4: You have business with me? Then show me the money, honey.

MsgSummary:
The Vail Commander, Konn, asked you to get rid of the Redlight Clan Orc that keep attacking his soldiers. You have to dispose of ten {c1}Redlight Clan Orc Fighters{/c} and return to Konn.

Redlight Clan Orcs are living to the Northwest of Raigo Castle.
MsgComplete: Finished already? Good - here is your next mission.
MsgTake:
As you know, we're already busy enough because of the fighting with the Elves and Humans, but now even trivial things like this are becoming a nuisance! {c5}(After squinting at you){/c} You look like you can fight pretty well. If you've got nothing to do now, how about taking care of this?

These days we are being attacked by Redlight Clan Orcs! Every time our soldiers finish the battle and come back with their bodies battered and their energy exhausted, these orcs always appear and attack us from behind. If terrible things like this keep occurring, I'll be the very person that gets reprimanded from the superior office. Damn it!

Now go and capture those annoying orcs! Get rid of their fighters first!
MsgWelcome: Do you have business with me? Well...what is it?
MsgIncomplete: Have you gotten rid of all the fighters?
MsgResponse4: Have you gotten rid of all the fighters?

MsgSummary:
The Vail Commander, Konn, asked you to get rid of the Redlight Clan Orcs that keep attacking his soldiers. You have to dispose of ten {c1}Redlight Clan Orc Sorcerors{/c} and return to Konn.

Redlight Clan Orcs are living to the Northwest of Raigo Castle.
MsgComplete: Heh heh...by now, their numbers should have been greatly thinned. All right, this is your last mission.
MsgTake:
These damn orcs keep casting these annoying spells. What do they think they are, Elves? Every time we fight them, chanting a spell here, casting a curse there!

{c5}(Having a dry cough){/c} Ahem...of course there are plenty of competent magicians among our Vail soldiers, but these attacks take us by surprise on our way back from an exhausting battle. What are they supposed to do? Competence can be hindered by weariness and inattention, you understand.

There is nothing those dumb Deatheaters can do about this. I know they can cast spells, but all they do is talk. Anyways, this gives you a reason to reduce the number of their sorcerers.
MsgWelcome: Do you have business with me? Well...what is it?
MsgIncomplete: Have you gotten rid of all the sorcerers?
MsgResponse4: Have you gotten rid of all the sorcerers?

MsgSummary:
The Vail Commander, Konn, asked you to get rid of the Redlight Clan Orcs that keep attacking his soldiers. You have to dispose of ten {c1}Redlight Clan Orc Leaders{/c} and return to Konn.

Redlight Clan Orcs are living to the Northwest of Raigo Castle.
MsgComplete: Well done! Your skill is incredible. If Konn Karso is satisfied, you can walk with your head held high, ha ha ha! Take this as just compensation for your battles. May we meet again.
MsgTake:
Those Orc monsters apparently also have some leaders and direction now, seeing that they move around in groups. It seems that the stronger ones among them are acting as leaders.

Once we finish off their leaders, their power will be considerably diminished. Then we don't have to worry about the war problems for a while, and we can probably manage to find the time to prepare for their next attack. Well, this is your last mission from me - go and get rid of those loathsome Orc leaders.
MsgWelcome: Do you have business with me? Well...what is it?
MsgIncomplete: Have you gotten rid of all the leaders?
MsgResponse4: Have you gotten rid of all the leaders?

MsgSummary: An apprentice warrior, Gennu, asked you to find a lost weapon. He said a {c1}Redlight Clan Orc Disorderly{/c} headed toward the northwest with his weapon. It seems a little far, but you'd better find a weapon for the heartbroken Gennu.
MsgComplete:
You found it! Wow...you really have a fighting spirit that understands a warrior's pride. I'll never forget your kindness.

Here, take this as a reward. I owe you many thanks.
MsgTake:
Can you help me? I've lost my weapon. I was attacked by a Redlight Orc when I was training alone away from the stronghold. I know...I'm ashamed as a warrior to admit to losing my weapon, but I need help.

Do you think you find my weapon? The Redlight Clan Orc Disorderly stole my weapon and escaped to the west. Please find it - I don't know what I'll do without it.
MsgWelcome: I lost my weapon by mistake. Can you retrieve it?
MsgIncomplete: Have you found my weapon?
MsgResponse4: Have you found my weapon?

MsgSummary: You must get rid of three {c1}members of the Alliance of Light{/c} and return to Commander Seno. It doesn't matter whether you kill Elves or Humans.
MsgComplete:
Hmm...apparently, I'm still a fine judge of character. You did an outstanding job! Thanks to you, the morale of the troops has steadily increased.

I'll give you this as a reward. I hope you'll find it useful. I hope to see you fighting bravely on the field with our seasoned troops. Farewell, and may we meet again!
MsgTake:
This tedious war seems to have no end in sight. It's true that plenty of soldiers are becoming weary one by one, but I'm a commander - I can't reveal weakness, or the spirit of those under my command could be shaken.

However, these days, more and more soldiers are leaving. Alas, I know many of them are from the Vail nobility and unaccustomed to war, but somehow I need to find a way to raise the morale of all our troops even a bit.

(Scanning from head to foot) Judging by your appearance, you've experienced some real battles. Please, can you help me? I think we'd better reduce their number by as many as we can. Please dispose of those flowery elves and stupid humans and report back to me!
MsgWelcome: Do you want to talk with me? Not with Konn Karso? I'm surprised.
MsgIncomplete: Are you well? The morale of all our troops is up thanks to you.
MsgResponse4: Are you well? The morale of all our troops is up thanks to you.

MsgSummary: You must get rid of three {c1}members of the Alliance of Light{/c} and return to Commander Seno. It doesn't matter whether you kill Elves or Humans.
MsgComplete:
Hmm...apparently, I'm still a fine judge of character. You did an outstanding job! Thanks to you, the morale of the troops has steadily increased.

I'll give you this as a reward. I hope you'll find it useful. I hope to see you fighting bravely on the field with our seasoned troops. Farewell, and may we meet again!
MsgTake:
This tedious war seems to have no end in sight. It's true that plenty of soldiers are becoming weary one by one, but I'm a commander - I can't reveal weakness, or the spirit of those under my command could be shaken.

However, these days, more and more soldiers are leaving. Alas, I know many of them are from the Vail nobility and unaccustomed to war, but somehow I need to find a way to raise the morale of all our troops even a bit.

(Scanning from head to foot) Judging by your appearance, you've experienced some real battles. Please, can you help me? I think we'd better reduce their number by as many as we can. Please dispose of those flowery elves and stupid humans and report back to me!
MsgWelcome: Do you want to talk with me? Not with Konn Karso? I'm surprised.
MsgIncomplete: Are you well? The morale of all our troops is up thanks to you.
MsgResponse4: Are you well? The morale of all our troops is up thanks to you.

MsgSummary: You must get rid of three {c1}members of the Alliance of Light{/c} and return to Commander Seno. It doesn't matter whether you kill Elves or Humans.
MsgComplete:
Hmm...apparently, I'm still a fine judge of character. You did an outstanding job! Thanks to you, the morale of the troops has steadily increased.

I'll give you this as a reward. I hope you'll find it useful. I hope to see you fighting bravely on the field with our seasoned troops. Farewell, and may we meet again!
MsgTake:
This tedious war seems to have no end in sight. It's true that plenty of soldiers are becoming weary one by one, but I'm a commander - I can't reveal weakness, or the spirit of those under my command could be shaken.

However, these days, more and more soldiers are leaving. Alas, I know many of them are from the Vail nobility and unaccustomed to war, but somehow I need to find a way to raise the morale of all our troops even a bit.

(Scanning from head to foot) Judging by your appearance, you've experienced some real battles. Please, can you help me? I think we'd better reduce their number by as many as we can. Please dispose of those flowery elves and stupid humans and report back to me!
MsgWelcome: Do you want to talk with me? Not with Konn Karso? I'm surprised.
MsgIncomplete: Are you well? The morale of all our troops is up thanks to you.
MsgResponse4: Are you well? The morale of all our troops is up thanks to you.

MsgSummary: You must get rid of three {c1}members of the Alliance of Light{/c} and return to Commander Seno. It doesn't matter whether you kill Elves or Humans.
MsgComplete:
Hmm...apparently, I'm still a fine judge of character. You did an outstanding job! Thanks to you, the morale of the troops has steadily increased.

I'll give you this as a reward. I hope you'll find it useful. I hope to see you fighting bravely on the field with our seasoned troops. Farewell, and may we meet again!
MsgTake:
This tedious war seems to have no end in sight. It's true that plenty of soldiers are becoming weary one by one, but I'm a commander - I can't reveal weakness, or the spirit of those under my command could be shaken.

However, these days, more and more soldiers are leaving. Alas, I know many of them are from the Vail nobility and unaccustomed to war, but somehow I need to find a way to raise the morale of all our troops even a bit.

(Scanning from head to foot) Judging by your appearance, you've experienced some real battles. Please, can you help me? I think we'd better reduce their number by as many as we can. Please dispose of those flowery elves and stupid humans and report back to me!
MsgWelcome: Do you want to talk with me? Not with Konn Karso? I'm surprised.
MsgIncomplete: Are you well? The morale of all our troops is up thanks to you.
MsgResponse4: Are you well? The morale of all our troops is up thanks to you.

I'll give you this as a reward. I hope you'll find it useful. I hope to see you fighting bravely on the field with our seasoned troops. Farewell, and may we meet again!

(Scanning from head to foot) Judging by your appearance, you've experienced some real battles. Please, can you help me? I think we'd better reduce their number by as many as we can. Please dispose of those flowery elves and stupid humans and report back to me!

MsgIncomplete: Are you well? The morale of all our troops is up thanks to you.
MsgResponse4: Are you well? The morale of all our troops is up thanks to you.

MsgComplete:
Hmm...apparently, I'm still a fine judge of character. You did an outstanding job! Thanks to you, the morale of the troops has steadily increased.

I'll give you this as a reward. I hope you'll find it useful. I hope to see you fighting bravely on the field with our seasoned troops. Farewell, and may we meet again!
MsgTake:
This tedious war seems to have no end in sight. It's true that plenty of soldiers are becoming weary one by one, but I'm a commander - I can't reveal weakness, or the spirit of those under my command could be shaken.

However, these days, more and more soldiers are leaving. Alas, I know many of them are from the Vail nobility and unaccustomed to war, but somehow I need to find a way to raise the morale of all our troops even a bit.

(Scanning from head to foot) Judging by your appearance, you've experienced some real battles. Please, can you help me? I think we'd better reduce their number by as many as we can. Please dispose of those flowery elves and stupid humans and report back to me!
MsgWelcome: Do you want to talk with me? Not with Konn Karso? I'm surprised.
MsgIncomplete: Are you well? The morale of all our troops is up thanks to you.
MsgResponse4: Are you well? The morale of all our troops is up thanks to you.

MsgSummary: Linni asked you to deliver the {c3}Secret Medicine of Linni{/c} to {c2}Jann Aneliy{/c}. Jann, a supervisor of construction, is with Deatheater workers northwest of Raigo Castle.
MsgComplete:
Ah, It must be the medicine I requested from Linni you have there. Hmm...you're sure you haven't tasted it on your way here, eh?

I don't think you need this yet, so don't worry about it. An old man like Konn will need this. Here's payment for your errand.
MsgTake:
Great warrior, can you give this to Jann? I'm asking you this because you're a man. Actually...I had a bad experience because I asked a woman before; that's why I no longer want women to handle delivering my medicine.

I made this medicine on special order as a favor to Jann. This is a medicine for men, but don't think about trying it out of curiosity on your way to her. I don't think you need this type of medicine, anyway.

Ah, Jann is a Vail woman working with Deatheater workers outside of this castle. Don't forget to say I sent this, and tell her I will need the normal amount of money.
MsgWelcome: Ah~ a customer? Just tell me if there's anything you need. I don't only deal in items, ho ho hoooo~
MsgIncomplete: Did you give her the medicine?
MsgResponse4: What are you?

MsgSummary: You have to go to the battlefield by using a portal next to Londa Marshal. Once you get there, you should try to find Chrio Goodman and listen to his story.
MsgComplete:
Are you a newcomer? Well met, warrior. I'm already worried because the Vail and Deatheater presence is getting more menacing around here.

I want to see you penetrate into the fortress of the enemy right now, but...haha. I'm just kidding. Now that you've come, you might well need time to adjust to the new environment. Let me ask you a few things.
MsgTake:
The place you are about to go is the Alliance of Light Fortress, Delphinian Fotress, located on Proelium Island. Standing face to face with the Union of Fury Fortress in the same area, there's tension enough in the air to choke a man.

If you get on this portal next to me, you can move to Delphinian Fotress, our frontier stronghold. Once you go there, you should meet Uncle Chrio and listen to what's going on there. Good luck..!
MsgWelcome: I'm Londa. Where do you want to go?
MsgIncomplete: Didn't you leave yet? Just go inside this portal.
MsgResponse4: Which one do you need?

MsgSummary: You have to go to the battlefield by using a portal next to Ledire Bis. Once you get there, you should try to find Mins and listen to her story.
MsgComplete:
Is this your first time here, warrior? Well met indeed. I'm already worried because Elves and Humans are getting more violent these days.

Go as soon as you can, and rid our land of those vile Elves and Humans! Go right now and sweep away those detestable Elves and Humans...!
MsgTake:
Recently I heard they are very short-handed in the frontier. You can go to Paroutian Fotress, our frontier stronghold, if you use this portal next to me.

Once you get there, make sure you meet Mins and listen to the story about the situation there. I hope you have a safe journey.
MsgWelcome: I'm Ledire. Tell me what you want.
MsgIncomplete: Didn't you leave yet? Just go inside this portal.
MsgResponse4: Are you looking for something?

MsgSummary:
A guard, Jurogiya, told you to find Nosh and ask him if you can do anything for him.
Nosh is in Suteron Village.
MsgComplete: A Customer? Ah, You heard about me from Jurogiya. Great, Let's cut to the chase.
MsgTake:
Are you looking for a job? Then let me tell you one thing. The weapon manufacturer Nosh is looking for someone who can help him. Why don't you go and find him?

You can find him down in Suteron Village.
MsgWelcome: A sword for a sword - that's the rule of the warrior.
MsgIncomplete: Did you find Nosh? He's under this hill.
MsgResponse4: I know how to put a sharp edge on your sword. If you want to learn, pay up.

MsgSummary:
Sasru said that Roman, a friend of his, was dead. Sasru said there is a high chance that Kobolts had slain him and asked you to collect the evidence. You have to capture {c11}WedgeRock Kobolt Guard{/c} and find the {c3}Keepsake from Roman{/c}.
You can find Kobolts in the Artlum Mine.
MsgComplete:
{c5}(after looking at the keepsake){/c} As....as expected, it was those filthy Kobolts who did it!

I'll show them what cold revenge is like! You've gotta help me, warrior!
MsgTake:
Roman was one of my best friends. Truly, he was a dignified Nordein warrior, but he said he wanted to set out on a journey for a while.
A few days ago, he was found as a wretched, headless corpse!

{c5}(Grinding his teeth){/c} Only those dirty Kobolts are capable of doing things like this.
You have to find the evidence that will prove they killed my friend. There must be some kind of keepsake still around, if they really killed him. I'm counting on you!
MsgWelcome: Ah, a visitor. Is this what you're looking for? How about that one? well, pick up anything you find interesting.
MsgIncomplete: Did you find the Keepsake from Roman?
MsgResponse4: Did you find the Keepsake from Roman?

MsgSummary:
Sasru said you have to diminish the power of Kobolts first. You have to kill {c1}7 WedgeRock Kobolt Fighters{/c} and return to Sasru again.
You can find some WedgeRock Kobolt Fighters inside of the Artlum Mine.
MsgComplete: Great! Now you're ready to attack the bosses of those blasted Kobolts.
MsgTake:
Now we've got to reduce their power. They are mere weaklings, but if they attack together, they will be difficult to deal with.

Fighters are a core of their power, so we can weaken them to some extent if we get rid of them. They are not strong, but you'd better fight them carefully, since they're deep inside the mine. Take care, then!
MsgWelcome: Ah, a visitor. Is this what you're looking for? How about that one? well, pick up anything you find interesting.
MsgIncomplete: Did you dispose of all of those Kobolts?
MsgResponse4: Did you dispose of all of those Kobolts?

MsgSummary:
A guard, Limpers, said you can get a new job if you find the priest {c2}Mosen Kiesto{/c}.
You can find Mosen in front of the temple in the middle of village.
MsgComplete: Have you come here seeking something? Ah...yes, I'm the priest Mosen. I was looking for someone who can help me.
MsgTake:
Novice warrior, are you looking for a new job? You're not supposed to saunter about like that if you're looking for a job. (giggle)

If you feel bored, why don't you find the priest Mosen in the village? I heard he needs someone who can assist him. If you have time to waste like this, why don't you find him?
MsgWelcome: Another amatuer rolled in from out in the boondocks, eh?
MsgIncomplete: Are you still here? YOU LAZY COW?! (giggle)
MsgResponse4: As long as the goddess protects us, no misfortune shall befall us.

MsgSummary:
Mosen asked you to find a Deatheater scouter, Dratt. In order to find Dratt, you have to find a guard at the Arteria Blood Lab, {c2}Meson Ordo{/c} and ask him Dratt's exact location.
You can find the Arteria Blood Lab very easily if you exit the village and follow the route straight.
MsgComplete: Sir Mosen sent you here? Ah! I'm sure he sent you here because of Dratt.
MsgTake:
What I'm going to ask is not difficult. Just find the scout, Dratt, who was dispatched to the StonePeg Golin Clan district. I let him handle a job involving the StonePeg Clan, but it seems he's having a hard time. First, if you ask his location from Meson Ordo, the guard of Arteria Blood Lab, he should be able to tell you Dratt's whereabouts.

I figure he may be doing his job very well, but you know...as people get older, we start worrying more about things, haha. Looks like I'm counting on you, then.
MsgWelcome: So long as the goddess protects us, we won't meet with misfortune.
MsgIncomplete: Are you still here?
MsgResponse4: I can handle any mission assigned to me.

MsgSummary:
You have to receive a {c3}Box of Ripe Grapes{/c} from Astin and give it to Judies
in Keolloseu.
MsgComplete:
Oh! You're right on time! Works out well for me too. I was worried that you'd be late. We don't have to worry about the quality, because Mr. Astin grew these grapes himself~

{c5}(after opening the box){/c} Ahh, the fragrance is wonderful. Mr. Astin's grapes are always the best~ Now I don't have to worry about the festival preparation too much. Thanks; you did a good job~
MsgTake: Please give this box to Judies. This year's grapes have a fabulous fragrance - anyone would shit bricks after trying them! Don't forget to give my regards to her, too. I'll see ya 'round. {c5}(You receive a Box_of_Ripe_Grapes){/c}
MsgWelcome: Our grapes are always the best! We even sell them to the capital, Apulune.
MsgIncomplete: Judies will be waiting, so head on back with those grapes.
MsgResponse4: Customer! Come on in~ Really, I love the ambience of this village!

MsgSummary:
You have to receive a {c3} Box of Ripe Grapes {/c} from Astin and give it to Judies
in Keolloseu.
MsgComplete:
Oh! You're right on time! Works out well for me too. I was worried that you'd be late. We don't have to worry about the quality, because Mr. Astin grew these grapes himself~

{c5}(after opening the box){/c} Ahh, the fragrance is wonderful. Mr. Astin's grapes are always the best~ Now I don't have to worry about the festival preparation too much. Thanks; you did a good job~
MsgTake: Please give this box to Judies. This year's grapes have a fabulous fragrance - anyone would shit bricks after trying them! Don't forget to give my regards to her, too. I'll see ya 'round. {c5}(You receive a Box_of_Ripe_Grapes){/c}
MsgWelcome: Our grapes are always the best! We even sell them to the capital, Apulune.
MsgIncomplete: Judies will be waiting, so head on back with those grapes.
MsgResponse4: Customer! Come on in~ Really, I love the ambience of this village!

MsgSummary:
The guard working in the Watch Tower, Teron, gave you this job so that you can accumulate some battle experience. You have to take care of 3 Rough Hair Antelopes and return to Teron.
You can find Rough Hair Antelope easily near the Watch Tower.
MsgComplete: Looks like you're more skilled than I gave you credit for. Fine, I'll give you another job.
MsgTake:
People have a tendency to not give enough respect to guards! They make it a habit of saying all we have do is just stand with one stupid spear all day long. What a ridiculous claim.

...Looking at you, you don't seem to have a lot of battle experience. Why don't you help me and put some polish on your skills at the same time?

The task I'm asking is simple enough: just take down some violent antelopes. There's something strange about them, though, because they used to be ordinary antelope that just enjoyed eating grass. Since when did they become no better than monsters?
Can you believe it?
Anyway, please kill about 3 antelopes and come visit me again.
MsgWelcome: Doing a guard's job is damn hard! Don't underestimate me!
MsgIncomplete: Did you get rid of as many Rough Hair Antelopes as I requested?
MsgResponse4: Did you get rid of as much Rough Hair Antelopes as I requested?

MsgSummary: The guard, Teron, asked you to get rid of some {c1}Blunt Teeth Wolves{/c} attacking kids in the village. You have to dispose of 3 Blunt Teeth Wolves and return to Teron.
MsgComplete:
Looks like you're back after finishing 'em all off.
Thanks; you've been a big help.

I treated you overly formally thus far, but I didn't mean to aggravate. I guess I was just feeling dissatisfied due to high demands on the job lately. Everybody has their moments, y'know.

Keep on training and mastering your skills.
MsgTake:
This time, it won't be so easy. These Blunt Teeth Wolves are really sticking in my craw. They've caused a shitload of problems, what with attacking kids in the village.

These bastards are violent to the core. Every time they see people, they pounce on them. They'll be very different from antelopes, so you'd best approach with caution - preferably already attacking.

Get rid of about 3 Blunt Teeth Wolves and come see me again.
MsgWelcome: Doing a guard job is damn hard! Don't underestimate me!
MsgIncomplete: Did you get rid of as many Blunt Teeth Wolves as I requested?
MsgResponse4: Did you get rid of as many Blunt Teeth Wolves as I requested?

MsgSummary:
Raumo asked you to get rid of the {c1}WindTail Forest Antelope{/c} as one way of maintaining the public security of the village. You have to get rid of 5 WindTail Forest Antelope and return to Raumo.
You can find the WindTail Forest Antelope easily near the tower where Raumo is standing.
MsgComplete: You have done well. You make it seem effortless. Sit a little while and catch your breath, then I've got another task for you.
MsgTake:
The Elves were originally the clan that maintained the balance of nature, but I have a feeling that...that very balance has been broken ever since the war began in this world.
The fact that meek animals are getting more and more violent points to this as well. Because of this, the status of public security in this village, Aelbeageu, is getting worse as well. It saddens me, but we have no choice but to take the risk of small sacrifice in order to calm down these animals.

Please take care of about 5 WindTail Forest Antelope and come back to me again.
MsgWelcome: May Frozen Seer guide your path!
MsgIncomplete: Did you get rid of as many WindTail Forest Antelopes as I requested?
MsgResponse4: Did you get rid of as many WindTail Forest Antelopes as I requested?

MsgSummary:
Raumo asked you to go to {c2}Verna{/c}, who is on dury in the Watch Tower near the bridge, and help her. You have to find Verna and hand her Raumo's Letter.
You can find the Watch Tower where Verna is on duty near the bridge west of Aelbeageu.
MsgComplete: Wait a minute, who are you? {c5}(Receives Raumo's Letter){/c} Ah, I gotcha. You've come here through Raumo's introduction. I'm thankful for his kindness.
MsgTake:
Verna is a colleague I respect. She is on duty in the Watch Tower in front of a bridge a little way from Beika, the human village. I heard that area is also notorious for public security, with travelers suddenly attacked by the Sealakel family and other such happenings.

Could you go to Verna and give her some help this time? Please keep this letter so that you can prove your identity to her.
I hope you have a safe trip.
MsgWelcome: May Frozen Seer guide your path!
MsgIncomplete: Haven't you set out to see Verna yet?
MsgResponse4: May Dayfly protect you. I'm Verna, a guard.

MsgSummary:
The guard, Verna, asked you to finish off several monsters in order to weaken the power of the Discus Sealakel family. You have to eliminate {c1}Discus Sealakel Warriors{/c}, collect {c3}7 Scales of Sealakel{/c}, and give them to Verna.
You can find Discus Sealakel Warriors if you cross the bridge west from Verna's Watch Tower.
MsgComplete:
How'd you do with those Sealakels? Looks like you finished 'em off,
seeing as how you've got the scales with you. I'm glad to see you back mostly unharmed.
MsgTake:
Lately, this area has been terrorized by the Discus Sealakel family. Even though the Elves try to secure this area, the Sealakels have incredible speed, so they attack travelers passing through here in the blink of an eye and steal their belongings.

It'll be a big help to us if we have one more person to help out, even someone like you who just got here. Please help us repel the power of those damned Sealakels.

It is our top priority to reduce the number of the most violent and principal warriors among their entire family in the battle. Please return to me after you elimininate a considerable number of Discus Sealakel warriors. Additionally, I hope you'll bring the scales peeled from their neck as evidence of your kills.
MsgWelcome: May Dayfly protect you. I'm Verna, a guard.
MsgIncomplete: Did you give hell to those Discus Sealakel Warriors?
MsgResponse4: Did you give hell to those Discus Sealakel Warriors?

MsgSummary:
The chief of guards, Leon, told you he wants to test you in order to know your potential as a fighter. You have to get rid of {c1}5 Discus Sealakel Warriors{/c} and return to Leon to report your results.
You can find the Discus Sealakel Warriors near the bridge east of Beika.
MsgComplete: Lookin' good there - you returned without mucn in the way of injuries. I feel relieved; it's been a while since I met a warrior with some real skill like you.
MsgTake:
Did you choose the fighter's path? Great, excellent choice.
Fighter is a profession that focuses on inflicting the most powerful attacks on enemies, especially in melee combat. Not only can you handle almost every weapon you'd like, but you can use a wide range of flamboyant skills too. That's why Fighters are called the "Crimson Blossoms" on the battlefield.

I want to test your potential. Surely your sword isn't just for show, eh! I want'cha to go out and dispose of about 5 Discus Sealakel Warriors and report back to me. If you can't handle simple things like this, maybe you're not ready for the title of "Fighter," don't you think?
MsgWelcome: I'm Leon Squallheart, You...look quite familiar. Have we met each other on the battlefiled before? Eh...whatever.
MsgIncomplete: Do you actually have time to spare? I suppose you've already eliminated the Discus Sealakel Warriors like I asked, right?
MsgResponse4: Do you actually have time to spare? I suppose you've already eliminated the Discus Sealakel Warriors like I asked, right?

MsgSummary: Leon is about to give you a weapon as a present. You have to select one from among three weapons. Once you select one weapon, you can't change it again, so you should consider this very carefully before you decide which one you'd like.
MsgComplete:
Have you decided which weapon you're going to use? If you're a fighter, you can handle all three of them skillfully, so don't worry too much. It's true, though, that if you select one weapon and constantly train with it, you'll definitely be more effective with that type of weapon.

This is a small present I want to give you to celebrate your start as a fighter, so don't feel burdened and just feel free to keep it. Finally, don't forget your dignity as a fighter. Once a member of the Alliance of Light, you're always a member, regardless of which weapon you use.

I wish you good luck in war. May the God of War guide your path!
<Two-Handed Sword><Dual Sword><Spear>
MsgTake:
Whoever decides to follow the fighter's path should keep this legendary hero in mind. He is Sir Meteor Stardust, the most magnificient hero among humans, who was the youngest warrior in history to earn his place on the list of Royal Knights. His name and presence has made enemies on the battlefield tremble with fear.

By following his footsteps, I hope you'll also grow up as an outstanding fighter who will increase the power of the Alliance of Light. I'll give you one weapon as a present to celebrate your start.

Decide among Two-handed Sword, Dual Sword, and Spear. If you refer to the skill options you can learn now, it will help you decide which one best suits you. Once you decide your weapon, you can't change it again, so please consider this carefully before you make your choice.

After you make a decision, talk to me again.
MsgWelcome: I'm Leon Squallheart, You...look quite familiar. Have we met each other on the battlefiled before? Eh...whatever.

MsgSummary: The chief of guards, Leon, is about to test you in order to see how much potential you have as a Defender. You have to get rid of five {c1}Discus Sealakel Warriors{/c} and report your results back to Leon. You can find the Discus Sealakel Warriors near the bridge east of Beika.
MsgComplete: Congratulations are in order. As a member of the Alliance of Light, I'm happy to see the ranks increase with strong Defenders.
MsgTake:
Good to see you. My name is Leon, Beika's chief of guards. You have chosen a Defender's path. That is excellent. You could say that the Defender is the most solid class for humans.

I assume you already know that the Alliance of Light and the Union of Fury are engaged in an intense battle even at this moment. Defenders are very important, becoming tanks for our allies. I know you're still nothing but an amateur now, but once you train harder, you will become a member of the knights in the capital someday and fight against the Vail and Deatheaters on the battlefield.

Before I tell you more, I want to test you in order to know how much potential you possess. {c5}(Thoughtful for a moment){/c} I want you to kill five Discus Sealakel Warriors and come back. If you can't handle simple things like this, you can't call yourself a defender.
MsgWelcome: I'm Leon Squallheart, You...look quite familiar. Have we met each other on the battlefiled before? Eh...whatever.
MsgIncomplete: Do you actually have time to spare? I suppose you've already eliminated the Discus Sealakel Warriors like I asked, right?
MsgResponse4: Oh, do you even have time to waste like this? I suppose you already have eliminated Discus Sealakel Warrior, right?

MsgSummary: Leon is about to give you a weapon as a present. You have to select one from among three weapons. Once you select one weapon, you can't change it again, so you should consider this very carefully before you make your choice.
MsgComplete:
Have you decided which weapon you're going to use? If you're a Defender, you can handle all three of them skillfully, so don't worry too much. It's true if you select one weapon and constantly train with it, you'll definitely be more effective with that weapon.

This is a small present I can give you to celebrate your start as a Defender, so don't feel burdened and just feel free to keep it. Finally, don't forget your dignity as a Defender. Once a member of the Alliance of Light, always a member, regardless of which weapon you use.
<One-handed Sword><One-handed Heavy Weapon><Two-handed Heavy Weapon>
MsgTake:
Luckily, your ability is much better than I thought. You seem to have a basic Defender's potential. From now on, increasing your potential is up to you.

If you're a Defender, you should have a self-sacrificing spirit, always considering your allies' lives before your own on the battlefield. Keep this principle close to your heart in battle.

I want to give you one present to celebrate your start as a Defender.  Choose from among a One-handed Sword, Two-handed Heavy Weapon, and Two-handed Heavy Weapon.

If you refer to the skill options you can learn now, it will help you decide which one best suits your preferred style of combat. Once you decide your weapon, you can't change it again, so please consider this carefully before you choose one.

After you've thought it over and decided, talk with me again.
MsgWelcome: I'm Leon Squallheart, You...look quite familiar. Have we met each other on the battlefiled before? Eh...whatever.

MsgSummary: Daniel told you to find the {c2}Priest of Water{/c} in Beika. You can find the Priest of Water in the west corner of village after you descend from the hill that the temple is located on.
MsgComplete: May Etain bless you, new Priest. Have you heard about water magic?
MsgTake:
Ah, so you're a new Priest, are you? Welcome to the acolyte's path. I hope you continue to grow and become a great Priest like the first bishop of the Deities Religion, Medis Holygate.

Priests of the Deities Religion can also use elemental magic along with their unique ability, healing magic. It's a magic elemental attack; the element we use is water.

The Preist of Water is now staying in Beika; he will tell you a more detailed story. Please go and visit him.
MsgWelcome: I hope Etain's blessing will be with you always. Our Goddess must have guided you all the way to me.
MsgIncomplete: Didn't you leave to find the Priest of Water yet?

MsgSummary:
The Priest of Water has asked you to hunt {c1}Thief Boar{/c} because these posses the fire element, so you can vanquish them with your water elemental magic. You have to hunt five Thief Boars and return to the Priest of Water.
You can find the Thief Boar near the Arbor Farm.
MsgComplete:
Well done. Now that you've had that experience, I figure you understand a little bit more about how elemental magic works. As a note to remember, non-elemental magic has no extra effect against elemental beasts.

You'll learn a lot of things as you accumulate experience from now on. I hope you'll grow up to be a wonderful Priest that can help friends on the battlefield.

This is a small present to celebrate your start as a Priest, so please use it on your journey. May Etain guide your path.
MsgTake:
There are 4 elements that exist in Teos. These are Earth, Wind, Water, and Fire. Among these, Preists can use water.

The water element forms part of a cycle, in which water is weak against the earth, but displays very powerful effects against fire.

I think experiencing this first-hand is far more effective than listening me yammer on, so I'd like you to go and hunt animals that possess the fire element. Thief Boar will be a good start. After hunting five of them, return to me.
MsgWelcome: I'm a Priest of the Deities Religion; we study water magic.
MsgIncomplete: Did you kill as many Thief Boars as I told you to?
MsgResponse4: Did you kill as many Thief Boars as I told you to?

MsgSummary:
Hoss asked you to punish the {c3}Thief Monkeys{/c} that messed up his shop. You have to hunt the Thief Monkeys and return to Hoss within {c4}sixty minutes{/c}, so don't be late. You have to hunt at least five of them.
You can find Thief Monkeys north of the village.
MsgComplete: You should have punished them more severely! Maybe I should have given you enough time to get the job done properly. Here is your reward for what you have done. You can go about your business.
MsgResponse1: Well, at least you did your job, but you didn't give those Boars a good enough beating to really satisfy me. Here is your reward.
MsgResponse2:
Oh, you let them experience a real nightmare! Well done! Those rascals wont even think about coming near this village for a while, ha ha ha!
Here's a reward, though I dunno if it's enough to repay you for your work. Call on me again anytime.
MsgTake:
Hey there. If you have nothing to do, can you help an elder in need?

There are a lot of Thief Monkeys living near our village. You'd never imagine how much trouble they've caused around here. It's giving me a hernia just thinking of it. You know what? From time to time, they even hang around and make funny noises, harassing people that pass by. And that's not even the worst of it.

One day, while I left my shop to meet with my granddaughter for a while, these monkeys came down to village and made a mess of everything! Now I've got nothing I can sell in my shop because of what they've done, so you can't imagine my loss!

Monkey or no, I say we let these vandals take the heat! Swing hard and beat some sense into those Theif Monkeys so that they'll think twice about doing this anymore. Beatdown at least 5 of them. Of course you can capture more than that, but remember you've gotta come back within 60 minutes.
MsgWelcome: Take a look around if you're interested in buying something. Just don't try to haggle me down; prices aren't negotiable.
MsgIncomplete: Did you whoop the sorry asses of those Thief Monkeys?
MsgResponse4: Did you whoop the sorry asses of those Thief Monkeys?

MsgSummary:
The Grocery dealer, Tmic, asked you to punish {c1}Treeshade Monkeys{/c} that messed up his shop. You have to hunt Treeshade Monkeys and return to Tmic within {c4}60 minutes{/c} without delay. You have to hunt at least 5 of them.
You can find Treeshade Monkey near the village.
MsgComplete:
Sweeter, warmer...
Don't mind me, I'm crazy. Thanks for the help. Here's your BOOTY!
MsgResponse1:
...oh just a tad more...just an itsy-bitsy smidgen!
Don't mind me, I'm crazy. Thanks for the help. Here's your BOOTY!
MsgResponse2:
Wow, you really whooped some monkey ass!
Don't mind me, I'm crazy. Thanks for the help. Here's your BOOTY!
MsgTake:
What am I supposed to do? Even though you've come, I can't sell you any items. Actually, I'm in trouble now. You wouldn't happen to want to hear about it, would you?

A little while ago, I had to make a trip outside the village, so I left the shop unattended for a while. I didn't anything would happen...but those damn Treeshade Monkeys wrecked my entire shop!

I don't think I'll be able to do business for a while; sorry for the trouble.

I have a huge favor to ask. Can you go and beat the seven shades of crap outa those monkeys? Of course, you can hunt more than 5, but don't forget to come back within 60 minutes.
MsgWelcome: Hehe...what are you looking for? This? Or that? What? You're distracted? Sorry!
MsgIncomplete: You done whooped the ass of them Treeshade Monkeys yet?
MsgResponse4: You done whooped the ass of them Treeshade Monkeys yet?

MsgSummary: {c1}Grimaxe Orc Sorceror{/c} is in the {c0}Grimaxe Orc Base Camp{/c} northwest of Keolloseu.
MsgComplete:
I really appreciate your kindness. Thanks to you, many people, including me, will be able to come and go from Keolloseu without worry. This is just a small amount of money, but you've done a lot; you deserve it. Thank you very much.

Ah, I told your story to {c2}Benjamin Dover{/c}, a defense item merchant. Apparently, he wants to get your help too. Anyway, good luck on your future endeavors, and thank you again.
MsgTake:
Who the heck are you? And what the hell do you want? Oh - you want your weapon fixed? Can't you see I'm injured?

Actually, we were attacked by {c1}Grimaxe Orc Sorcerors{/c} on our way back home from Beika with weapons I had taken orders for. I managed to escape but...most of the other workers died, and I lost all the weapons and armor I had taken orders for. I'm still trembling thinking about how screwed I am.

There are plenty of merchants buying and selling stuff delivered to {c0}Keolloseu{/c} besides me. Could you get rid of {c1}Grimaxe Orc Sorcerors{/c} for these people? Evidently you'll receive an excellent reward. I'll be waiting then.
MsgIncomplete:
I pray no one else has injuries like mine.

{c1}Grimaxe Orc Sorcerors{/c} should be in the {c0}Grimaxe Orc Base Camp{/c} northwest of Keolloseu.

QuestName: Vagabond Big Brown Bear Mopping-up Operation
MsgSummary: {c1}Vagabond Big Brown Bears{/c} will be in the {c0}PlusWooper Forest{/c} northwest of Keolloseu.
MsgComplete: HELL YEAH! I knew you could do it. Now I can make my defense items again without worry. I've gotta keep my end of the bargain too. I'll give you a defense item made with my secret skill.<Reward for Fighter, Defender><Reward for Ranger, Archer><Reward for Priest, Mage>
MsgResponse1: HELL YEAH! I knew you could do it. Now I can make my defense item again without worry. I've gotta keep my end of the bargain too. I'll give you a defense item made with my secret skill.
MsgResponse2: HELL YEAH! I knew you could do it. Now I can make my defense item again without worry. I've gotta keep my end of the bargain too. I'll give you a defense item made with my secret skill.
MsgTake:
You must be the soldier I was supposed to meet. I'm a defense item merchant, {c2}Benjamin Dover{/c}. I heard about you from {c2}Duke Dephill{/c}, and I thought he was blownin' smoke, but now that I see you, I'm certain you can help me. Would you be willing?

This is a secret, but I'm using trees from the PlusWooper Forest to heat a brazier I'm using to craft my wares. Firewood made from trees of PlusWooper Forest burn hot and long, so that wood is perfect for heating a brazier and maintaining high temperatures. Unfortunately, I was attacked by {c1}Vagabond Big Brown Bears{/c} on my way back home with my latest load of wood. Apparently they're guarding the trees now... As you can see, this makes it a royal pain to gather my firewood. According to what I heard, many travelers passing through that area have been injured by their attacks too. Do you think you can help me give 'em a beatdown?

If you help me, I will give you a fantastic defense item; show ya my skill isn't just an idle boast. Anyway, I'm countin' on you.
MsgIncomplete: My only hope is that the secret of my crafting technique doesn't spread far and wide. Anyway, those {c1}Vagabond Big Brown Bears{/c} will be in the {c0}PlusWooper Forest{/c} northwest of Keolloseu.

MsgSummary:
The chief of guards, Berca, said she wants to test your potential as an Archer. You have to get rid of 5 Discus Sealakel Wizards and return to Berca to report your result.
You can find a Discus Sealakel Wizard if you cross the bridge toward west from Berca's Watch Tower.
MsgComplete: Ah, you're finally back. You did an excellent job. As a member of the Alliance of Light, I'm happy to see that we're finally getting some Archer candidates worth talking about.
MsgTake:
Greetings! I'm Berca, the chief of guards in Aelbeageu. You have chosen an Archer's path. Excellent choice.
Archer is a profession that specializes in dealing high damage with long-range weaponry, so you'll learn to use bows and crossbows. In addition, you can even use skills that can damage every enemy around you.

I want to test whether you have the potential to be a great Archer or not. I suppose this isn't your first battle, right? Please dispose of about 5 Discus Sealakel Wizards and come back to report your result. I'll be waiting.
MsgWelcome: May Dayfly protect you always. I'm Berca, the chief of guards.
MsgIncomplete: Did you get rid of those Discus Sealakel Wizards?
MsgResponse4: Did you get rid of those Discus Sealakel Wizards?

MsgSummary: Berca is about to give you a weapon as a present. You have to select one of two weapons. Once you select one weapon, you can't receive the other choice, so you should consider this very carefully before you make your decision.
MsgComplete:
Did you decide which weapon you're going to use? Then take a weapon according to your preference. I hope your actions will make a contribution to the victory of the Alliance of Light regardless of which weapon you choose.

Good luck in the war. May Pantera, God of the Hunt, guide your path!
<Bow><Crossbow>
MsgTake:
Whoever decides to follow the Archer's path should remember this name. She was a leader of the best Archer force, the Pantera's Eye brigade, and performed a series of brilliant exploits during the second war as well. Her name is Arushien SilenceRain. 

I was told her attack wasn't the strongest, but enemies were so afraid of her that they even referred to her bow as the Judgement of Pantera.  I'll give you one present to celebrate your start as an Archer.

Choose between bow and crossbow. Once you decide your weapon, you can't change what I'll give you, so please consider this carefully before you make your choice.

After you've given it some thought, come back and see me.
MsgWelcome: May Dayfly protect you always. I'm Berca, the chief of guards.

MsgSummary:
Anar wants to test your potential skill as a Ranger. You have to get rid of {c1}5 Discus Sealakel Wizards{/c} and return to Anar to report your result.
You can find the Discus Sealakel Wizard near the bridge west of Aelbeageu.
MsgComplete: Ah, you're back, and a fine job you've done of it, it seems. As a member of the Alliance of Light, I'm happy to see some of our newer members take interest in the path of the Ranger.
MsgTake:
Hello! I'm a Ranger, Anar. You have chosen a Ranger's path - an excellent choice, if I say so myself.

Ranger is a profession that focuses on damaging an enemy with greater speed than anyone else. In addition, you can barrel across the battlefield going full-bore, dashing from foe to foe.

I've been dispatched here to evaluate the potential of warriors who visit this place to become a Ranger, by order of the Ranger Force commander, Raumo. 
I want to test whether you've got what it takes to become a great Ranger. I suppose this is not your first battle, right? Please dispose of about 5 Discus Sealakel Wizards and come back to report your result. I'll be waiting.
MsgWelcome: May Frozen Seer always protect you.
MsgIncomplete: Did you get rid of those Discus Sealakel Wizards?
MsgResponse4: Did you get rid of those Discus Sealakel Wizards?

MsgSummary: Anar is about to give you a weapon as a present. You have to select one of two weapons. Once you select one weapon, you can't change it again, so you should consider carefully before making your decision.
MsgComplete:
Did you decide which weapon you're going to use? If so, then you can make your choice anytime. I hope your actions will contribute to the victory of the Alliance of Light regardless of which weapon you choose.

I wish you good luck on the battlefield. May the Watcher-God, Frozen Seer, guide your path!
<Reverse sword><Knuckle>
MsgTake:
The person who faced our fated enemy, the Vail, for the first time was the captain of Kite Force, Aetos. Unfortunately, he was killed during that historical first battle with Vail, but he was undoubtedly the finest Ranger of the era.

The achievements of Aetos still remain as some of the most significant in history. I hope you'll also grow up as a brilliant Ranger like Aetos by increasing your ability. I'll give you a present to celebrate your start as a Ranger.

Choose between a reverse sword and knuckle. Once you decide on your weapon, you can't change it again, so please consider this carefully before you make your choice.

After you've given it some thought, come back and see me.
MsgWelcome: May Frozen Seer guide your path!

MsgSummary: Mulus, a Priest of Aelbeageu, said you have to choose one of three magic paths. You have to choose one path among earth, wind, or fire. Once you select your element, you can't change it again, so you should consider this very carefully before you make your decision.
MsgComplete:
Each element reacts to and interacts with the other elements in a circular pattern. You'll certainly go on to learn more about how the element you choose interacts with the others.
All branches of magic have formidable destructive power once a caster's level is high enough. It's not an exaggeration to say that the Elves' magic ability is the best on the continent.

If you choose one branch of magic, you can't hear the specific explanation about other magics, so you should be careful. Which path of magic do you want to choose?
<Earth Magic><Wind Magic><Fire Magic>
MsgTake:
Welcome, O seeker of the Mage's path. I figure a basic explanation would be a good place to start.

Mages are Elves who are studying the magic of nature. Most of them have more outstanding potential than elves originally having excellent magic ability. I can feel you also have a wonderful potential.

The types of attack magic Mages can use are three. They are earth magic, wind magic, and fire magic. Would you like to receive training after you choose one of them? After you've given it some thought and considered your options, come to see me again.
MsgWelcome: Sorry, I must've been dozing off, heh! I'm Mulus, follower of Etain's path. How are things going?

MsgSummary:
You have chosen to train in the study of earth magic. Mulus said you have to find {c2}Cemen{/c} in the Fanselenon Institute.
The Fanselenon Institute is the Elven summoning magic complex south of Aelbeageu.
MsgComplete:
Welcome! I smell the scent of a new mage! Did you decide to follow the path of earth magic? That's a rock-solid choice.

At first, earth magic seems less strong than other branches of magic, but the deeper you delve into your study and training, the more marvelous its power reveals itself to be.
MsgTake:
Earth is a benevolent mother of all nature, but once enraged, it can split and splinter, and even swallow entire creatures. You have chosen to study earth magic - good, good.

Find Cemen, a summoner of earth, in the Fanselenon Institute. She will give you a more extensive explanation about earth magic.
MsgWelcome: Sorry, I must've been dozing off, heh! I'm Mulus, follower of Etain's path. How are things going?
MsgIncomplete: Haven't you left to visit Cemen, the summoner of earth? She should be at the Fanselenon Institute.
MsgResponse4: Ereumana is the blessed earth. I figure that's thanks to Etain's protection.

MsgSummary:
Cemen, the summoner of earth, asked you to hunt {c1}Windtail Forest Antelope {/c} possessing the water element with your earth element magic. You have to hunt 5 Windtail Forest Antelopes and return to Cemen.
You can find the Windtail Forest Antelope northeast of Fanselenon Institute.
MsgComplete:
Well done! I figure you now have a better understanding about what elemental magic is. Just keep in mind, though, that nonelemental magic has no effect against elemental animals and monsters.

You'll gradually accumulate a lot of knowledge as you gain experience bit by bit from now on. I hope you'll grow to be a wonderful mage who can help friends on the battlefield.

This is a small present to celebrate your start as a mage, so please keep it. May Etain guide your path.
MsgTake:
The magic that exists in Teos is largely divided up into 4 elements. These are Earth, Wind, Water, and Fire. Among these, a Mage can use earth, wind, and fire spells.

The earth element is part of the elemental cycle, and is weak against the wind element, but displays strong effect against the water element.

I suppose you can use spells like "Magic Roots" at your current level. Not only can this magic cause damage to your opponents, but it will also borrow the spirit of earth and bind your opponent's feet. 

A few hours of experience will be more beneficial than hearing me lecture on and on, so I'd like you to go and use your earth magic to hunt some creatures possessing the water element. Windtail Forest Antelope will be good enough for you to test your skills on. After hunting 5 of them, return to me.
MsgWelcome: Ereumana is the blessed earth. I figure that's thanks to Etain's protection.
MsgIncomplete: Did you capture as many Windtail Forest Antelopes as I told you?
MsgResponse4: Did you capture as many Windtail Forest Antelopes as I told you?

MsgSummary:
You have chosen to train in the study of wind magic. Mulus said you have to find {c2}Sure{/c} in the Fanselenon Institute.
The Fanselenon Institute is the Elven summoning magic complex south of Aelbeageu.
MsgComplete:
Welcome. Looks like a new Mage just blew in! Did you decide to follow the path of wind magic? It should be a breeze for someone like you. Get it?

The outstanding aspect of wind magic compared to other branches of magic is the quickness. The casting time of wind magic is just like the speed of wind!
MsgTake:
Wind is the warm breath of the Goddess, but once enraged, it turns into a howling gale, unleashing torment on fools. You have chosen to study the way of wind magic. May you prosper in it.

Find Sure, a summoner of wind, in the Fanselenon Institute. She will explain the nuances of wind magic to you in greater detail.
MsgWelcome: Sorry, I must've been dozing off, heh! I'm Mulus, follower of Etain's path. How are things going?
MsgIncomplete: Haven't you left to meet Sure, the wind summoner of Fanselenon Institute?
MsgResponse4: Hi there. I'm Sure, always learning the ways of the wind.  What's that?  Am I sure I'm Sure? Of course, silly.

MsgSummary:
{c2}Sure{/c} told you to hunt the {c1}Bulbuous Eye Fox{/c} possessing the earth element with your wind elemental magic and return. You have to hunt {c1}5 Bulbuous Eye Foxes{/c} and return to {c2}Sure{/c}.
You can find the Bulbuous Eye Fox northeast of the Fanselenon Institute.
MsgComplete:
Well done! I'm figuring that now you understand a little more about how the elements interact. To add a bit to that, take note that nonelemental magic has no effect against elemental enemies.

It might sound complicated now, but you'll learn a lot of it naturally just through experience. I hope you'll become a wonderful mage who can help friends on the battlefield.

This is a small present to celebrate your start as a mage, so please keep it. May Etain guide your path.
MsgTake:
There are 4 elements that make up the majority of magic in Teos. These are Earth, Wind, Water, and Fire. Among these, a mage can use earth, wind, and fire magic.

The wind element is part of the elemental cycle, and is weak against the fire element, but displays strong effect against the earth element.

I suppose you can use spells like "Sonic Volt" at your current level. The power of this magic is rather weak, but the casting time is incredibly fast, like the wind itself. This factor can be quite useful when you are in danger.

Getting out there in the field will teach you a lot faster than just my lecture, so now go and hunt animals possessing the earth element with your wind magic. Bulbuous Eye Foxes will be good enough for you to get a feel for it. After hunting 5 of them, return to me.
MsgWelcome: I'm learning the ways of the wind.
MsgIncomplete: Did you capture as many Bulbuous Eye Foxes as I told you?
MsgResponse4: Did you capture as many Bulbuous Eye Foxes as I told you?

MsgSummary:
You have chosen to train in the study of fire magic. Mulus said you have to find {c2}Wure{/c} in the Fanselenon Institute.
The Fanselenon Institute is the Elven summoning magic complex south of Aelbeageu.
MsgComplete:
Welcome, newbie mage! Did you decide to follow the path of fire magic? I can see you're just burning to get started!

Fire magic looks so cool, and the power is unmatched in any other branches of magic. The true path of magic has to be something like this, full of explosions, right?, Ha ha...I'm just kidding; don't take it all so seriously.
MsgTake:
Fire is a force that embodies destructive power, turning things into handfuls of ash in seconds. That kind of power certainly has an allure, doesn't it?

Find Wure, a summoner of fire, in the Fanselenon Institute. He will give you a more detailed explanation of what fire magic is all about.
MsgWelcome: Sorry, I must've been dozing off, heh! I'm Mulus, follower of Etain's path. How are things going?
MsgIncomplete: You haven't left yet to visit Wure the fire summoner? You can fidn him in the Fanselenon Institute.
MsgResponse4: Hey there mysterious visitor! I'm Wure, a summoner of fire. Looking to turn up the heat?

MsgSummary:
Wure told you to hunt the {c1}Windtail Forest Wild Boar{/c} by explioting their weakness to fire elements and return. You have to hunt 5 Windtail Forest Wild Boars and return to Wure.
You can find the Windtail Forest Wild Boar northeast of the Fanselenon Institute.
MsgComplete:
Well done! I think you now know the foundations of how elemental magic interacts and . If I may make an additional remark, nonelemental magic has no effect agaiinst elemental animals.

A lot of this knowledge will come naturally as you take to the battlefield against enemies. I hope you'll grow as a wonderful mage who can help friends on the battlefield.

This is a small present to celebrate your start as a mage, so please keep it. May Etain guide your path.
MsgTake:
There are 4 elements that make up the majority of spells that exst here in Teos. These are Earth, Wind, Water, and Fire. 
Among them, a Mage can use earth, wind, and fire magics.

The fire element is part of the elemental cycle, so basically the fire element is weak against the water element, but displays strong effects against the wind element.

I suppose you can use spells like "Fire Ball" at your current level. 
The power of this magic will be the highest among magics within the same level. 
A downside to this powerful magic is that the casting time tends to be longer than for other magics.

But don't just take MY word for it - go test it for yourself! I'd like you to take your fire magic and hunt down creatures possessing the wind element with your fire magic. Windtail Forest Wild Boars will be good enough for you to try your skill out. After hunting 5 of them, come back and see me.
MsgWelcome: Welcome, traveler. I'm Wure, a summoner of fire. Anything I can help ya with?
MsgIncomplete: Did you capture as many Windtail Forest Wild Boars as I told you?
MsgResponse4: Did you capture as many Windtail Forest Wild Boars as I told you?

MsgSummary:
Raumo told you to find {c2}Cemen{/c} in the Fanselenon Institute. Cemen is an Elven summoner in the Fanselenon Institute.
You can find the Fanselenon Institute if you follow the route south from Aelbeageu.
MsgComplete:
Welcome to the Fanselenon Institute, traveler.

I'm guessing you heard about us from Raumo and came here. He is very busy himself, going from one place to another for the peace of the village. He must be busy, but he sent a person like you for us. I really appreciate his kindness.

Fanselenon is a place for scholars studying the workings of magic and the supernatural, but there are a lot of things going on these days. Maybe it's because of this neverending war. Tell ya what - if a job comes up, I'll let you know when you're around again.
See ya later!
MsgTake:
If you go down toward the south a bit from Aelbeageu, you will arrive at Fanselenon, the institute of Elven scholars. It's an institute with a long and prestigious history, as well as an important spot that makes a great contribution to increasing our understanding of magic.

However, Fanselenon is no exception when it comes to being impacted by the natural imbalance caused by the war.
As I've heard, there are a lot of projects and studies being run these days. I hope you can go to Fanselenon and give them some help.

Please find a summoner named Cemen in the Fanselenon Institute. He's an old friend of mine, so he'll greet you with a warm heart. 
Have a safe journey.
MsgWelcome: Haven't set out for Fanselenon yet, eh?
MsgIncomplete: Haven't set out for Fanselenon yet, eh?
MsgResponse4: Ereumana is the blessed earth. I figure that's thanks to Etain's protection.

MsgSummary:
You have to get rid of some {c1}Thief Boars{/c} and collect {c3}Broken Wooden Dolls{/c} and return to Karen. You have to collect at least 5 of them and return within {c4}60 minutes{/c}.
You can find Thief Boars east of the village.
MsgComplete:
This is all you've collected? What, are you sleeping on the job?!
I will give you a reward, but I'm not going to ask you for help from now on.
MsgResponse1:
Ah, you've collected quite a bit, actually. After I fix the broken part, I'll put them inside a box and wrap it up. I figure that ought to be okay.

Thanks to you, I'll be able to suppy this without delay. I'm sure I'll have another job for you soon~
MsgTake:
I'm a wood carver who makes a living by making and selling many kinds of products. I like practical products, but I sometimes make ornaments like dolls for nobles.

A little while ago, I got an order from one noble family in the capital. They wanted me to make some ornamental dolls. The amount of work it took was way larger than I expected, so I managed to meet their demand only by staying up all night for several days. However...

Just a while ago, I found that the box I put the dolls inside was broken; just a complete mess. Of course, the dolls inside box were also broken.

It turned out a Thief Boar was to blame. Please capture these boars and retrieve the broken wooden dolls. I have no choice but to fix them because I have no time to make new ones. Please return with at least 5 of them within 60 minutes.
MsgWelcome: A lot of things are made from trees, more than you probably think.
MsgIncomplete: Have you found many of my Broken Wooden Dolls?
MsgResponse4: Have you found many of my Broken Wooden Dolls?

MsgSummary:
Pico asked you to punish some wolves that became violent. You need to get rid of 7 Windtail Forest Small Ear Wolves and return to Pico.
You can find Windtail Forest Small Ear Wolves near the hunter camp.
MsgComplete:
Did you punish wolves? Ah, thanks. Killing animals make me sad, but sister Earl said we have no choice. Many tragedies are happening because of this war.

I hope the war will be over soon, so other people won't feel so sad.
I appreciate your help so much.
MsgTake:
These days, the wolves living near the camp have become very violent.
The wolves of Teos were originally wise beings, so they used to be loved by Elves.
Now, though, they're nothing but monsters attacking innocent travelers.

Sisters Earl, Orta, Sharnie are all worried about them. Originally, hunters loved animals more than anybody else.
It seems Windtail Forest Small Ear Wolves haver become the most violent. Can I ask you a favor? Please punish these wolves a little bit...so that they're not allowed to carry on in their ways unchecked.
MsgWelcome: Earl is really an amazing person. She's my real sister.
MsgIncomplete: Did you punish those Windtail Forest Small Ear Wolves?
MsgResponse4: Did you punish those Windtail Forest Small Ear Wolves?

MsgSummary:
Earl told you to meet {c2}Kail{/c}, the lord of Keolloseu. You have to deliver Earl's Letter to the lord of Keolloseu, Kail.
Keolloseu is a large village in the center of Ereumana, and you can find a lord, Kail, north of village.
MsgComplete:
{c5}(after reading a letter){/c} Hunter Earl Blendy. I heard about her good personality and ability already. According to this letter, you have helped her and her friends a lot. You must be stronger than you look.
I would like to give you job, especially since you've come bearing a letter from Earl. Unfortunately there is nothing I need help with just now. I'll call you later if something comes up.
Why don't you take a look around this village in the meantime? You have a lot of things to see because this is the largest village in the Ereumana region. Maybe you can help people out if they need your help~ See you later, then.
MsgTake:
I think you ought to head to Keolloseu. I wrote a letter about what you have done for us. Please find Kail, the lord of Keolloseu, and give this letter to him. Although he is a half elf, he is smart and rational, or so I've heard.
I figure you have finished everything you can do here, so it'd be best to travel around the world a little bit more. May Pantera's luck be with you on your journey.
MsgIncomplete: Did you meet lord Kail?

MsgSummary: Alicia gave you a letter about information she found out and asked you to deliver it to Kail. You have to deliver the {c3}Letter_of_Alicia{/c} to the lord of Keolloseu, {c2}Kail{/c}. It seems you'll hear the hidden story.
MsgComplete:
What happended? {c5}(astonished after reading a letter){/c} Soul Piece of Lihar?
I never expect this.

Lihar was the first Archion who contributed to that cursed family, when the Dianoia family let St. Evil Spirit descend onto this land. He played lots of major roles such as leading other people to St. Evil Spirit. However, in the end, the wrath of the St. Evil Spirit cursed his soul, which was broken into pieces because he coveted the power of God. The story of his death is also quite a tale. The piece you found is his Soul Piece.

His reckless behavior was insolent, but it's lamentable that he can't rest in peace even after his death because his soul was shattered so badly. His soul has been scattered like this throughout Teos. Thanks for bringing such good infomation. You helped me a lot..Thanks.

<Reward for Ranger, Archer><Reward for Mage>
MsgTake:
Ah, I didn't recognize you. Sorry 'bout that. Your name is already well-known throughtout the Keolloseu's district. I think I can ask you a favor.

{c5}(giving you a letter){/c} This is a letter about the Soul Piece you just brought. Please give this to Kail, the lord of Keolloseu. You will hear the detailed story from a lord. I'm counting on you. See you later!
MsgWelcome: I will fullfill my mission no matther what happens.
MsgIncomplete: The person this letter is addressed to is Kail, a lord of Keolloseu. Please find him now.
MsgResponse4: I'm Kail, a local official of Keolloseu.

MsgSummary: You have to find {c2}Londa{/c} in Keolloseu with a letter of recommendation from the Proelium Orderly of Light.
MsgComplete:
Ah, this is a letter of recommendation from the orderly. 
You're planning to leave for Proelium Frontier and apply to join the war? 
I'll send you there.
MsgTake:
Proelium Island is the battlefield you will go to first once you apply to join the Alliance of Light. The intense battle against our enemies is still in progress.

Once you accumulate enough battle experience here, you'll become a great help in the D-Water Borderland, the front lines against our enemies. Also, on Proelium Island, you might obtain a Lapis, a stone possessing a mysterious power.

If your intent is to leave for Proelium Frontier and apply to join the war, find Londa in Keolloseu with this letter of recommendation. She will open the portal to Proelium. I expect you to do your best.
MsgWelcome: I'm an orderly from Delphinian Fotress. I'm recruiting brave warriors who are willing to go to the battlefield.
MsgIncomplete: Didn't you leave for the battlefield yet?
MsgResponse4: I'm Londa. You have to go to the battlefield by using the portal next to me.

MsgSummary:
A guard in Keolloseu, Roke, asked you to get rid of Swordtail Sealakels attacking the villagers. You have to get rid of {c1}5 Swordtail Sealakel Sentinels{/c} and {c1}5 Swordtail Sealakel Wizards{/c} and return to Roke.
You can find Swordtail Sealakels northeast of Keolloseu village.
MsgComplete: You finally came back! Did you kill some Swordtail Sealakels? Excellent! You're as reliable as the rumors said. Thanks again; you were a great help.
MsgTake:
Ah, I've heard a lot about you. You take on even the most difficult tasks, don't you? Do you think you could spare some time for me?

A little while ago, bizarre looking fellas have been seen near Ezellin Lake and have been causing trouble. They look like a fish...but kinda like human fighters too. That's why we've been calling them 'Swordtail Sealakel' in the human language. 
But what they do...it's enough to drive one to madness and unbridled hatred.

They kidnap children, then release some of them seemingly at random. But that's only part of it. Every time they see women, they just take them away regardless of age, social status, married or unmarried. Everyone is up in arms about them, but there are too many, so our guards couldn't handle them.

Hero, can you help us? Cutting down some of them might put some rational fear in their hearts.
MsgWelcome: Are you from the village? You look familiar.
MsgIncomplete: Did you kill some Swordtail Sealakels?
MsgResponse4: Did you kill some Swordtail Sealakels?

MsgSummary: Roke told you that you might get some information if you give the {c3}Old Piece of Paper{/c} you found to the priest, Batan. Go let Batan see the Old Piece of Paper.
MsgComplete:
What do you want? {c5}(looking at the piece of paper you brought){/c} This appears to be very old paper. Hmm...let's see, what do we have here?

{c5}(unable to hide his astonishment){/c} Oh, my goodness! Unless my eyes deceive me, this must be a page from a book written by Justin Windwalker, a great sage who lived a hundred years ago! His terrible handwriting is very noticeable. It's marvelous that an old document like this still exists. Perhaps this must be owed to his magic power.

Justin Windwalker, was a great wizard; the first human to earn the title. He was a rare talent as a human, also well-versed in Elven magic. I was told he left only few of his books behind, and most of them disappeared.
I can't believe I'm holding something as rare as this!

I really appreciate your hard work. Thanks to you, a historical treasure has been preserved.
May Etain guide your future...
<Reward for Fighter, Defender><Reward for Priest>
MsgTake:
Hmm? What is that Piece of Paper? You obtained it during you fight with Swordtail Sealakels, eh?

{c5}(thoughtful for a moment){/c} Perhaps the priest Batan will know something about them. Old documents like this are a longtime interest of his.

I figure you'll at least hear a useful story if you let him see this Piece of Paper. Why don't you pay him a visit?
MsgWelcome: Are you from the village? You look familiar.
MsgIncomplete: A priest named Batan is inside the village. Look for him carefully.
MsgResponse4: My name is Batan. How can I help you?

MsgSummary: Curni in Keolloseu said the Elf girl, {c2}Rosian{/c}, is like a sister, and has been missing for several days. You have to look for Rosian. Curni said Rosian used to go to the dilapidated beacon mound near the bridge to the north of the village.
MsgComplete:
Sister Curni is looking for me... Alas, she would be very sad if she realized I'm such a mess...

Thanks for finding me... Can I ask for favor?
MsgTake:
I have one sister, named Rosian. She is not my real sister, but my best friend's sister. Since the time my friend died on the battlefield, I have been staying with Rosian.

By the way, a little while ago, Rosian said she was going outside of village to play, so I let her go, but she hasn't come back yet... I asked the guards to find her, but I shouldn't have bothered; they're so lazy! That's why I'm asking for your help.
Please find Rosian...!

Rosian used to play in the dilapidated beacon mound north of village. Please look around that area carefully.
MsgWelcome: Ah, no, no...I failed to create it again. I have no idea what went wrong this time.
MsgIncomplete:
Where is Rosian?
Did you find her?
MsgResponse4:
Who are you? 
Oh...this place is freezing.

MsgSummary:
Rosian asked you to deliver a faded pendent to Curni. 
You should return to Curni with the pendent.
MsgComplete:
{c5}(looking at a pendent){/c} This is Rosian's pendent. Did you find her?

Oh my god...! She was dead...  How can a good girl like her die?

{c5}(with a sad voice){/c} I have to go and care for her soul by myself. Thank you for letting me know.
MsgTake:
