{c5}(holding out a pendent){/c} Please take this. If you give this to sister Curni, it will prove that you met me.

...Nothing has changed even though I was avenged. Am I going to stay here forever? Ah...

Please tell sister Curni that I love her. 
Thank you.
{c5}(You receive a faded pendent.){/c}
MsgWelcome:
Who are you? 
Oh...this place is freezing.
MsgIncomplete: She'll be waiting. Now...
MsgResponse4: Ah, no, no...I failed to create it again. I have no idea what went wrong this time.

MsgSummary:
You have to get rid of {c1}3 Ogre Patrolers{/c} and return to Beard.
You can find the Ogre Patrolers if you go south to Cloron forest from Keolloseu village.
MsgComplete:
Thanks. You're really somethin', hero!

I hope you'll accept this little reward. Maybe it'll be useful for you on your travels, eh?
MsgTake:
Your skill is a lot greater than most of the folks I see come through here. Can I ask you a favor?

There are a lot of patrolers among the Ogres that are really dangerous for anyone on the road. If you get rid of these patrolers and take revenge for Matt, merchants like us will be able to work without worry.

Please, slay those Ogre Patrolers!
MsgWelcome: Well, see anything you need? Don't ignore my wares just 'cause I'm a seller of miscellaneous goods~
MsgIncomplete: Did you get rid of those disgusting Ogres?
MsgResponse4: Did you get rid of those disgusting Ogres?

MsgSummary: Guard Aridon told you to find {c2}Parphala Karniel{/c} in the village and find some work you can help with.
MsgComplete:
hmmm, customer...

Oh my! Are you here to help me? {c5}(suddenly with a vivacious face){/c} Welcome!
MsgTake:
Well, now that you've finished warming up, it's time for you to go to the village and help people out. If this is your first time and you don't know what to do, let me tell you one thing.

Why don't you find a girl named Parphala? Apparently she's looking for someone who can help her. She has been brought up in an overly affluent family and might need your help. She is running a weapon shop, so keep an eye out for her.

Take care.
MsgWelcome: A new face? Glad to see you!
MsgIncomplete: Are you still here?
MsgResponse4:
I'm only selling high quality weapons, so you need to pay for this.  
Dont'cha think?

MsgSummary: A Suteron Guard told you to find {c2}Igel{/c} in the village and find work you can help with.
MsgComplete: A customer? What? You came here to help me?
MsgTake:
Well, now that you finished warming up, it's time for you to go to the village and help people out. If this is your first time and you don't know what to do, let me give you a tip.
You should go find the weapons dealer named Igel. Apparently, he's looking for someone who can help him. Well, so long!
MsgWelcome: Nice to meet you, new warrior!
MsgIncomplete: You're still here?
MsgResponse4: What did you call me?

MsgSummary:
The chief of guards, Jorr, is about to test you in order to see how much potential you have as an Assassin. You have to get rid of {c1}5 Poisonous Web Spiders{/c} and return to Jorr and report your result.
You can find the Poisonous Web Spiders on the west route to Vruion Forest.
MsgComplete: Fine, Good job. As a member of the Union of Fury, I'm happy to see a new generation of Vail rise to the shadowy profession of the Assassin.
MsgTake:
Hello! I'm the chief of the guards, Jorr. You have chosen an Assassin's path. You can really make a killing, so I'm told.

Assassin is a profession focused on maximizing the effectiveness of your attacks, as well as having an attack speed superior to anyone else's. In addition, you can speed across the battlefield to strike first, or leave enemies in the dust.

I want to test your potential to see whether or not you could become a great Assassin. I suppose this is not your first battle, right? Please dispose of 5 Poisonous Web Spiders and come back to report your result. I'll be waiting.
MsgWelcome: You, a warrior? Let's see whose sword is longer.
MsgIncomplete: Did you get rid of those Poisonous Web Spiders?
MsgResponse4: Did you get rid of those Poisonous Web Spiders?

MsgSummary: Jorr is about to give you a weapon as a present. You have to select one of three weapons. Once you select one weapon, you can't choose another, so you should consider this very carefully before you make your decision.
MsgComplete:
Did you decide which weapon you're going to use? Then go ahead and take the weapon that fits how you'd like to fight. Your actions will make a contribution to the victory of the Vail regardless of which weapon you choose.

I wish you good luck in the war. May God of Watch Frozen Seer guide your path!

<Reverse Sword><Dagger><Knuckle>
MsgTake:
The person who faced our fated  enemy, the Elves for the first time was the captain of Jackal Force, Tsakali. He was known as the best Assassin of that era. In the first historical battle against Elves, the way he annihilated enemies set an example for the generations of Assassins that would follow.

Thanks to Tsakali's actions, we Vail managed to gain the advantage during the first war. I hope you'll also grow up as a brilliant Assassin like Tsakali. I'll give you a gift to celebrate your start as an Assassin.

Choose between a reverse sword, knuckle, or dagger. Once you decide your weapon, you can't change it again, so please consider this carefully before you make your choice.

Please take some time to consider you choice, and return to me when you have decided.
MsgWelcome: You, a warrior? Let's see whose sword is longer.

MsgSummary:
Karantoss, the chief of guards, is about to test you in order to see how much potential you have as a Warrior. You have to get rid of {c1}5 DoomFire HellTooth Fighters{/c} and return to Karantoss to report your result.
You can find the DoomFire HellTooth Fighters in the ruined site northwest of here.
MsgComplete: Ah, splendid work. You have returned with nary an injury. I feel refreshed seeing such a promising Warrior standing before me; someone who can become a terror of the battlefield.
MsgTake:
You have chosen a warrior's path. You'll be a cut above the rest!
Warrior is a profession focused on delivering the most powerful attacks to enemies, especially in melee combat. Not only will you be able to use almost every type of weapon as you please, but you can make use of a wide range of flamboyant skills. That's why the Warrior is called the "Crimson Blossom" on the battlefield.

I want to test your potential to see whether you've got what it takes to become a brilliant Warrior. Surely your sword isn't there just for show, right? Prove it by going out and disposing of about 5 DoomFire HellTooth Fighters and report back to me. 
If you can't handle simple things like this, you can't call yourself a Warrior, and that's a fact.
MsgWelcome: Don't dawdle away - keep training to become a force of nature! You're a member of the Union of Fury!
MsgIncomplete: Did you kill as many DoomFire HellTooth Fighters as I asked of you?
MsgResponse4: Did you kill as many DoomFire HellTooth Fighters as I asked of you?

MsgSummary: Karantoss is about to bestow a weapon upon you as a gift. You have to select one of three weapons. You can use them all, but you should consider how you like to fight before you make your decision.
MsgComplete:
Did you decide which weapon you're going to use? If you're a warrior, you can handle three of them all skillfully, so don't worry too much. But if you select one weapon and get used to using it with constant training, it'll definitely be more effective than always trading off between several weapons.

I pray for your triumph on the battlefield. May the God of Destruction, Kali, guide your path!

<Two-Handed Axe><Dual Axe><Spear>
MsgTake:
The most crucial principle to us, the Nordein, is that "Only the strong survive." Every Nordein is a real warrior who would gladly engage in mortal battle against Tyrannus. 

I hope you'll grow up to be a great warrior who can challenge Tyrannus to a grand one-on-one duel someday. I'll give you a weapon as a present to celebrate the beginning of your journey.  

Decide between a Two-Handed Axe, Dual Axe and Spear. If you look at the skills you can learn for each weapon, it will help you decide which one best fits the way you like to fight. Once you decide on a weapon, you can't get another one from me, so please consider carefully before you choose.  

Let me know when you have decided.
MsgWelcome: Don't spend your time in idleness.  Do your best to become unstoppable and crush the enemies of the Union of Fury.

MsgSummary:
Karantoss, the chief of guards, wishes to test you to see how much potential you have as a Guardian. You have to slay {c1}5 DoomFire HellTooth Fighters{/c} and report to Karantoss.
You can find the DoomFire HellTooth Fighters in the ruined site to the northwest.
MsgComplete: Looks like the results are pretty good. As a member of the Union of Fury, I'm glad to see more up-and-coming Guardians in our ranks.
MsgTake:
Greetings! I'm Karantoss, the chief of the guards in Suteron. You have chosen a Guardian's path, and that's a choice you can really defend! Guardians are necessary as shields and defenders for their comrades in the war.

Before I tell you more, I want to test you to know how much potential you possess.  I think you should kill 5 DoomFire HellTooth Fighters and then return to me. If you can't take care of yourself in small things, how could you hope to protect the lives of your comrades?
MsgWelcome: Don't waste your time in idleness.  Do your best to become an unkillable force, then fight bravely for the Union of Fury.
MsgIncomplete: Did you slay as many DoomFire HellTooth Fighters as I asked you to?
MsgResponse4: Did you slay as many DoomFire HellTooth Fighters as I asked you to?

MsgSummary: Karantoss is about to give you a weapon as a present. You have to select one of three weapons. Once you select one weapon, you can't choose another, so you should consider this very carefully before you make your decision.
MsgComplete:
Did you decide which weapon you're going to use? Then go ahead and take the weapon that fits how you'd like to fight. Your actions will make a contribution to the victory of the Vail regardless of  which weapon you choose.

I wish you good fortune in your battles to come. May the God of Destruction, Kali, guide your path!
<One-handed Axe><One-Handed Heavy Weapon><Two-Handed Heavy Weapon>
MsgTake:
The most crucial principle to us, the Nordein, is that "Only the strong survive." Every Nordein is a battler at heart, who would gladly engage in mortal battle against Tyrannus. 

I hope you'll grow up to be a superb Guardian who can defend your allies and earn the blessing of Tyrannus. I'll give you a weapon as a present to celebrate the beginning of your journey.  

Decide between a One-handed Axe, One-handed Heavy Weapon, or Two-Handed Heavy Weapon. If you look at the skills you can learn for each weapon, it will help you decide which best fits your fighting style. Once you decide on a weapon, you can't switch, so please consider carefully before you choose.  

Let me know when you've decided.
MsgWelcome: Don't dawdle.  Do your best to strengthen yourself each day, to contribute to the glory of the Union of Fury.

MsgSummary: A priest, Mosen, told you to find an {c2}Oracle of Water{/c} in Aridon.
MsgComplete: Etain and the Holy Mother Narsilriel will guide your path. It seems you have recently started on the path of the Oracle. Are you here to hear about the magic of water?
MsgTake:
Welcome to the path of the Oracle, young learner. I hope that you follow in the footsteps of Elais Crauly, the founder of Darkness Heart, and become a renowned Oracle.

The Oracles of Darkness Heart can use a branch elemental magic besides their unique healing magic - they specialize in the element of water.

The Oracle of Water in the village will be able to explain more to you if you pay her a visit.
MsgWelcome: Misfortune will never come near us as long as the Goddess protects us.
MsgIncomplete: Didn't you try to find Oracle of Water yet?
MsgResponse4: I'm an Oracle who is studying the element of water. Welcome.

MsgSummary:
The Oracle of water asked you to use your water-elemental magic to hunt Long Canine Black Pumas, which are aligned with the fire element.  You have to hunt {c1}5 Long Canine Black Pumas{/c} and return to the Oracle of Water.
You can find Long Canine Black Puma near a crossroads if you go east toward the Artlum Mine outside of the village.
MsgComplete:
Well done. I figure you now possess a better understanding of the workings of elemental magic. Additionally, you'll find that nonelemental magic has no effect against elemental creatures.

As you participate in more battles, there's a lot you'll learn just through experience. I hope you'll grow up to be a wonderful Oracle who can help all Vail soldiers on the battlefield. 

This is a small present to celebrate your start as an Oracle, so please make good use of it. Farewell.
MsgTake:
There are 4 elements that comprise the majority of magic in Teos: Earth, Wind, Water, and Fire.  Oracles specialize in the element of water.

The water element is part of the elemental cycle, and is weak against the earth element, but has a strong effect against the fire element.

Learning it through your own action will be more useful than a hundred lectures, so I'd like you to go and hunt animals possessing the fire element with your water magic.  Long Canine Black Pumas should prove sufficient for this purpose. After you've hunted 5 of them, return to me.
MsgWelcome: I'm an Oracle who is studying the element of water. Welcome.
MsgIncomplete: Did you get rid of those Long Canine Black Pumas?
MsgResponse4: Did you get rid of those Long Canine Black Pumas?

MsgSummary:
The Grocery dealer, Kisera, asked you to take action against the {c1}Hunter Larvae{/c} that messed up his shop. You have to hunt Hunter Larvae and return to Kisera within {c4}60 minutes{/c} without delay. You must kill at least 5 of them. 
You can find Hunter Larvae if you go down the hill outside of the east gate of the village and follow the descending western path.
MsgComplete:
Hrm...this is...less than I was expecting.
Never mind, it's nothing. Thanks anyway.  You can keep the reward, I suppose...
MsgResponse1:
Well, that's more than I was expecting. That's good, right? 
Oh, don't mind me; just thinking out loud. Thanks again; here's a little somethin' I saved for you. Farewell.
MsgResponse2:
Wow! Thank you! I don't think those suckers can mess up my shop again now. Thanks! 
Here, take this reward - you've really earned it! Hope to see you 'round again!
MsgTake:
Oh man... what am I gonna do now? You're here to buy goods, obviously, but I don't have anything to sell right now. Actually, my store's in a bit of trouble right now. Care to hear my story? 

Okay, so a little while back, I had to make a trip outside the village, so I left my shop vacant for a while. I thought nothing would happen, but you know what? Some Hunter Larvae came and stole or broke almost everything in the shop!

I won't be able to do business for a while. It's gonna take a long time to recover from this.

Actually, I have a favor... could you repay those Hunter Larva for all the grief they've giten me? Go strike down at least 5, if you could. Of course you can hunt more than 5, but don't forget to come back within 60 minutes!
MsgWelcome: Welcome to Kisera's general store!
MsgIncomplete: Did you take care of those damn Hunter Larvae?
MsgResponse4: Did you take care of those damn Hunter Larvae?

MsgSummary:
The Grocery dealer, Denvie, asked you to punish some {c1}Hunter Larvae{/c} that messed up his shop. You have to hunt Hunter Larvae and return to Kisera within {c4}60 minutes{/c}. You must hunt at least 5 of them.
You can find the Hunter Larva if you exit the gateway of village and follow the northwest route.
MsgComplete: You should have laid into those bastards way more! Maybe I should have given you more time to get the job done. This reward will be good enough for what you've done. Now go and tend to your own business.
MsgResponse1: Well, I can't say you didn't do what I asked, but...I'm not satisfied with the results. How's this reward?  Okay with you? I'll see you later, then.
MsgResponse2:
Oh, you showed them a real nightmare! Well done! Now those bastards won't think of putting one inch of their carcasses inside this village! Hahaha! 
Thanks... here's a reward; hopefully it's enough for the excellent work you've done. Call on me anytime!
MsgTake:
Hey hey! If you've got nothing to do right now, I could use your help.

As I'm sure you've seen, there are a lot of Hunter Larvae living near our village. You can't imagine how much trouble they have caused to my shop. They are often hanging around making noises, threatening passers-by...but at least those actions were tolerable.

But one day, when I left my shop to make a delivery, they came down to the village and trashed my entire shop! Due to those Hunter Larvae, I barely have anything left I can even sell! 

Please punish those wretched monsters so that they won't do this anymore!  At least 5 of them need to die for this outrage. Of course, more than that is fine too, but remember to return within 60 minutes!
MsgWelcome: Ugh, what is it? When did you get here? What do you want?
MsgIncomplete: Did you really lay into those damn Hunter Larvae?
MsgResponse4: Did you really lay into those damn Hunter Larvae?

MsgSummary: You have to collect {c3}6 Mallets{/c} and give them to Yaadin.
MsgComplete: Thanks, these mallets don't look so bad. Now I can retain my pride and dignity! Oh, and if you go to {c4}Aridon{/c}, you will find my old friend, {c2}Karna Kiesto{/c}, there. It seems something serious also happened there. If you stop by {/c4}Aridon{/c}, can you give her some help? Anyway, I'd better get back to work; I should be pretty busy from now on.
MsgTake:
I'm going to go crazy. I've got tons of work to do, but I'm running out tools to fix things with. The process isn't supposed to take this long. Hey...judging by your looks, you know how to fight, right? Can you help me? The materials we blacksmiths need were raided by monsters while being transported from {c4}Aridon{/c} to {c4}Suteron{/c}, so I ended up never receiving my shipment. Well, I could always delay my orders indefinitely until the tools and materials come in...but my pride and dignity as a blacksmith would never allow that to happen.

The most urgently needed tools right now are hammers for the blacksmiths at our forge. Can you somehow track a few down? I was told the {c1}Ruined Ghosts{/c} east of {c4}Aridon{/c} carry an old style of blacksmith's hammer that we could still use. Please bring some, if you're able. I'll give you a handsome reward.
MsgIncomplete: You can find the {c1}Ruined Ghosts{/c} if you go straight toward the east from {c4}Aridon{/c}.

MsgSummary: You have to slay {c1}25 Vagabond Corpses{/c} and report your deed to {c2}Karna Kiesto{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Thank you, really! Thanks to you, the guy in charge of supplying goods will be brought to his senses. I'm the type of guy who always keeps his promises. You'll receive a nice reward. Just take it! 
I'm telling you, thank you very much! Feel free to accept it.  
<Reward for Warrior, Guardian><Reward for Assassin, Hunter><Reward for Pagan, Oracle>
MsgResponse1:
Thank you, really! Thanks to you, the guy in charge of supplying goods will be brought to his senses. I'm the type of guy who always keeps his promises. You'll receive a nice reward. Just take it! 
I'm telling you, thank you very much! Feel free to accept it.
MsgResponse2:
Thank you, really! Thanks to you, the guy in charge of supplying goods will be brought to his senses. I'm the type of guy who always keeps his promises. You'll receive a nice reward. Just take it! 
I'm telling you, thank you very much! Feel free to accept it.
MsgTake:
Hmm, so you heard about me from {c2}Yaadin{/c}? That boy looks dumb sometimes, but he's actually got a good head on his shoulders. I guess {c2}Yaadin{/c} probably already told you about the supply goods problem that happened in {c4}Suteron{/c}, but there's another problem, one centered here. The new guy who was assigned to supply goods this time took a real beating from the {c1} Vagabond Corpses{/c}, and after that he's claimed that he can't do this anymore. That moron's got no balls at all... I  gave him a pretty good scolding, but he's never come to his senses. 

That's why I'm telling you this. Can you get rid of some {c1}Vagabond Corpses{/c} by any chance? If he realizes we can somehow fight against them, I'm betting he'll straighten himself up and get back to work as usual. I'll give you a handsome reward, so don't worry. I'm different from {c2}Yaadin{/c}, so I can give you a straightforward reward. Good. Then I'm counting on you.

MsgSummary:
The chief of guards, Karantoss, said she wants to test your potential as a Hunter. You have to get rid of {c1}5 DoomFire HellTooth Sentinels{/c} and return to Karantoss to report your result.
You can find the DoomFire HellTooth Sentinel in the ruined site northwest.
MsgComplete: You're back. Well done! As a member of the Nordein, I'm happy to see an increase in the number of Hunters with high potential.
MsgTake:
Nice to meet you. I'm Karantoss, the chief of the guards in Suteron.  You have chosen a Hunter's path - an excellent goal to shoot for.
Hunter is a profession in which you can cause great damage to enemies from a distance with a long range weapon, so you can handle a bow and a spear at will. In addition, you can even use skills that cause damage to every enemy in the area. 

I want to see how much potential you will have as a Hunter. I suppose this is not your first battle, right?  Then, I'd like you to dispose of 5 DoomFire HellTooth Sentinels and come back to report your result. I'll be waiting.
MsgWelcome: Don't dawdle.  Increase in strength and courage each day, so that you may bring glory to the Union of Fury.
MsgIncomplete: Did you kill as many DoomFire HellTooth Sentinels as I told you to?
MsgResponse4: Did you kill as many DoomFire HellTooth Sentinels as I told you to?

MsgSummary: Karantoss is about to give you a weapon as a present. You have to select one of three weapons. Once you choose, you can't have another, so you should consider this very carefully before you make your decision.
MsgComplete:
Did you decide which weapon you're going to use? Then go ahead and take the weapon that fits how you'd like to fight. Your actions will make a contribution to the victory of the Vail regardless of  which weapon you choose.

I wish you good luck in war. May Pantera, God of the Hunt, bless your undertakings.

<Dual Axe><Throw Weapon><Bow>
MsgTake:
The most crucial principle to us, the Nordein, is that  "Only the strong survive." Within the heart of each Nordein is a fighting spirit that won't be trodden underfoot by any foe.

I hope you'll become a great Hunter, able to strike down your enemies while remaining in safety. I'll give you a weapon as a present to celebrate the beginning of your journey.  

You can choose a Dual Axe, Throwing Weapon, or Bow. If you look at the skills you can learn for each weapon, it will help you decide which one fits your combative style best. Once you've decided, though, you can't switch, so please consider carefully before you choose.  

Let me know when you have reached a decision.
MsgWelcome: Be smart about how you spend your time.  Strive each day to better yourself, to aid in the efforts of the Union of Fury.

MsgSummary: Mosen, the Priest of Aridon, said you have to choose one of three branches of magic. You must choose to study the magic of earth, wind, or fire. Once you select one element, you can't change it, so you should consider this very carefully before you decide on which path to take.
MsgComplete:
The elements earth, wind, fire, and water interact with each other in a cycle. You can learn the details about the relationships of the element you choose. 

All these elemental magics have formidable destructive power once they reach a certain level. The Elves may hold themselves to be the best magic-users on the continent, but that would be because they've underestimated us.

Once you make your choice of branch of elemental magic, you can't hear the specific explanations about the other elements, so you should be careful. Which path do you want to choose?

<Earth Magic><Wind Magic><Fire Magic>
MsgTake:
You have chosen a Pagan's path. Welcome. I figure I could give you a little advice.

Pagans are Vail who are studying the manipulation of natural forces through magic. Most Pagans represent the best among the magically-skilled Vail, though all Vail have some capacity for magic. I can feel that you have the potential to be great!

Mages can use three types of elemental magic. They are earth magic, wind magic, and fire magic. Do you think you're ready to choose a branch of magic and learn its nuances? Let me know after you've given some more consideration to the path you'd like to take.
MsgWelcome: As long as the Goddess protects us, misfortune will pass over us.

MsgSummary: You have chosen to study earth magic. Mosen said you have to find the {c2}Pagan of Earth{/c} in Aridon.
MsgComplete:
Greetings, young Pagan. Have you decided to study earth magic? It's a rock-solid choice!

Earth magic may not seem as strong as the other elements at first, but the more extensively you train, the more hidden power the earth will reveal to you.
MsgTake:
Due to the endless war, blood soaked the earth like rain, and the earth drank that blood and swallowed the wrath of the fallen souls.
You have chosen the magic of the earth. Be proud! 

Find the Pagan of Earth in the village. She will explain in detail the basics of earth magic.
MsgWelcome: As long as the Goddess protects us, misfortune shall pass over us.
MsgIncomplete: Haven't you sought out the Pagan of Earth yet?
MsgResponse4: Greetings. I'm a Pagan who is studying earth magic.

MsgSummary:
The Pagan of Earth asked you to hunt some {c1}Mountain Shadow Gray Wolves{/c}, who possess the water element, with your earth magic. You have to hunt 5 Mountain Shadow Gray Wolves and return to the Pagan of Earth.
You can find Mountain Shadow Gray Wolves if you exit the village and follow the route toward the Arteria Blood Lab in the northwest.
MsgComplete:
Well done. I figure that now you understand the workings of elemental magic a bit better than before. Also, keep in mind that nonelemental magic has no effect against elemental monsters and animals.

As you participate in more battles, there's a lot you'll learn just through experience. I hope you'll grow up to be a mighty Pagan whose magic devastates all enemies and leads the Vail to victory.


This is a small present to celebrate your start as a Pagan, so please make good use of it.  Farewell.
MsgTake:
There are 4 elements that comprise the majority of magic in Teos: Earth, Wind, Water, and Fire. Among them, a Pagan can specialize in earth, wind, and fire magic.

The earth element is part of the elemental cycle, and is weak against wind, but strong against water.  

At your current level, I suppose you can use skills like "Magic Roots".  Not only can this magic cause damage to your opponents, but it will also channel the spirit of the earth to bind your opponents.  

Learning it through your own action will be more useful than a hundred lectures, so I'd like you to go and hunt animals possessing the water element with your earth magic. Mountain Shadow Gray Wolves should prove good for this. After you've hunted 5 of them, return to me.



There are 4 elements that comprise the majority of magic in Teos: Earth, Wind, Water, and Fire.  Oracles specialize in the element of water.

The water element is part of the elemental cycle, and is weak against the earth element, but has a strong effect against the fire element.

Learning it through your own action will be more useful than a hundred lectures, so I'd like you to go and hunt animals possessing the fire element with your water magic.  Long Canine Black Pumas should prove sufficient for this purpose. After you've hunted 5 of them, return to me.
MsgWelcome: Greetings. I'm a Pagan who is studying earth magic.
MsgIncomplete: Did you kill all the wolves I asked you to?
MsgResponse4: Did you kill all the wolves I asked you to?

MsgSummary: You have chosen to study wind magic. Mosen said you have to find {c2}Pagan of Wind{/c} in Aridon.
MsgComplete:
Greetings, young Pagan. Has your spirit led you to follow the path of wind magic? The choice must have been a breeze to make!

The best aspect of wind magic compared to other elements is its quickness. The casting time of wind magic is as fast as a howling gale.
MsgTake:
The wrath of the Goddess is as fierce and as sharp as a strong wind, and those fit to be punished will have no place to hide. You have chosen to pursue the path of wind - a noble line of magic.

Find the Pagan of Wind in the village. She will explain in detail the basics of wind magic.
MsgWelcome: As long as the Goddess protects us, misfortune shall pass over us.
MsgIncomplete: Haven't you sought out the Pagan of Wind yet?
MsgResponse4: Greetings. I'm a Pagan who is studying wind magic.

MsgSummary:
The Pagan of Wind told you to hunt some {c1}Mountain Ridge Gray Wolves{/c}, which possess the earth element, with your wind magic. You have to hunt 5 Mountain Ridge Gray Wolves and return to the Pagan of Wind.
You can find Mountain Ridge Gray Wolves if you exit the village and follow the route northwest toward the Arteria Blood Lab.
MsgComplete:
Well done. I figure that now you understand the workings of elemental magic a bit better than before. Also, keep in mind that nonelemental magic has no effect against elemental monsters and animals.

As you participate in more battles, there's a lot you'll learn just through experience. I hope you'll grow up to be a mighty Pagan whose magic devastates all enemies and leads the Vail to victory. 

This is a small present to celebrate your start as a Pagan, so please make good use of it. Farewell.
MsgTake:
There are 4 elements that comprise the majority of magic in Teos: Earth, Wind, Water, and Fire. Among them, a Pagan can use  earth, wind, and fire magic.

The wind element is part of the elemental cycle, and is weak against fire, but strong against earth.  

At your current level, I suppose you can use skills like "Sonic Volt".  The power of this spell is comparatively weaker, but the casting time is incredibly fast, driven by the wrath of the wind.  It can be quite effective when you're stuck in a tough spot.

Learning it through your own action will be more useful than a hundred lectures, so I'd like you to go and hunt animals possessing the earth element with your wind magic. Mountain Ridge Gray Wolves will be good enough for you. After you've hunted 5 of them, return to me.
MsgWelcome: I'm a Pagan studying wind magic. Welcome.
MsgIncomplete: Did you kill all the wolves I told you to?
MsgResponse4: Did you kill all the wolves I told you to?

MsgSummary:
You have chosen to study fire magic. Mosen said you have to find the {c2}Pagan of Fire
{/c} in Aridon.
MsgComplete:
Welcome, young Pagan. Have you decided to study fire magic? I can see the passion burning in your eyes!

Fire magic puts on a spectacular show and deals tremendous damage. Such dazzling magic like this must hold the path to ultimate power!  Mwahahaha! ...Hey, I was just kidding. I'm kidding! Why so serious?
MsgTake:
Fire is the kind of element that has a destructive power which can turn most anything to ashes in seconds. There's nothing foolish about desiring unrivaled power. 

Find the Pagan of Fire in the village. He will explain in detail the basics of fire magic.
MsgWelcome: As long as the Goddess protects us, misfortune shall pass over us.
MsgIncomplete: Haven't you sought out the Pagan of Fire yet?
MsgResponse4: Greetings. I'm a Pagan who is studying fire magic.

MsgSummary:
The Pagan of Fire told you to hunt some {c1}Rough Ground Gigantic Wild Boars{/c}, who possess the wind element, with your fire magic. You have to hunt 5 Rough Ground Gigantic Wild Boars and return to the Pagan of Fire.
You can find Rough Ground Gigantic Wild Boars if you exit the village and follow the route northwest toward the Arteria Blood Lab.
MsgComplete:
Well done. I figure that now you understand the workings of elemental magic a bit better than before. Also, keep in mind that nonelemental magic has no effect against elemental monsters and animals.

As you participate in more battles, there's a lot you'll learn just through experience. I hope you'll grow up to be a mighty Pagan whose magic devastates all enemies and leads the Vail to victory. 

This is a small present to celebrate your start as a Pagan, so please make good use of it. Farewell.
MsgTake:
There are 4 elements that comprise the majority of magic in Teo: Earth, Wind, Water, and Fire. Among them, a Pagan can specialize in earth, wind, and fire magic.

The fire element is part of the elemental cycle, and is weak against water, but strong against wind. 

At your current level, I suppose you can use skills like "Fire Ball". The casting times of Fire spells are longer than those of the other elements, but of the branches, fire magic has the highest raw power. 

Learning it through your own action will be more useful than a hundred lectures, so now go and hunt animals possessing the wind element with your fire magic. Rough Ground Gigantic Wild Boars should fry nicely in your flames. After you've hunted 5 of them, return to me.
MsgWelcome: Greetings. I'm a Pagan studyin' fire magic.
MsgIncomplete: Did you kill all the boars I told you to?
MsgResponse4: Did you kill all the boars I told you to?

MsgSummary:
Soltu, a security guard of Herba, proposed that you get rid of animals roaming around the village. You have to get rid of 7 DoomFire HellTooth Hunters and return to Soltu.
You can find the DoomFire HellTooth Hunter if you go down toward the east outside the village.
MsgComplete: Wow, you're really somethin' else! Good job!
MsgTake:
Welcome to Herba Farm! You're lucky you're a Nordein. If you were one of them wicked Vail, I wouldn't let'cha set one bloomin' foot in this village! 

I, Soltu, am the security guard of this village. I'm protecting Herba village all by myself here. I'm one of the few, the proud...the only!  

You know, I have my own rule that even travelers should show some gratitude for the security of this village, and I just so happen to have a job you could do for me. 

How about you...go and dispose of some DoomFire HellTooth Hunters wandering around the village!
MsgWelcome: I'm Soltu, the security guard of Herba Farm. I'm protecting the village from danger!
MsgIncomplete: I'm Soltu, the security guard of Herba Farm. I'm protecting the village from danger!
MsgResponse4: Did you finish off all DoomFire HellTooth Hunters I asked?

MsgSummary: The security guard, Soltu, asked you to get rid of some DoomFire HellTooth Fighters and then return to him. You can find the DoomFire HellTooth Fighters if you go down from the village toward the east.
MsgComplete:
Great job! Your mad skillz make the Nordein proud! You're the kind of person I'd like to see more of. You can stay in this village as long as you like!

You'll find other things to do if you walk around and talk to people. You worked really hard, so take a breather - you've earned it!
MsgTake:
These monsters will be stronger than the ones from before. I want you to put the kibosh on some DoomFire HellTooth Fighters! They're more violent and powerful than the Hunters, so you've gotta be on your guard. 

I hope you come back safely!
MsgWelcome: I'm Soltu, the security guard of Herba Farm. I'm protecting the village from danger!
MsgIncomplete: How'd you do with moppin' up those DoomFire HellTooth Fighters?
MsgResponse4: How'd you do with moppin' up those DoomFire HellTooth Fighters?

MsgSummary:
The medicine merchant, Pel, asked you to bring one ingredient for the secret medicine she's making. The ingredient is the Molar Fragments of wild boars. You have to hunt Big Grinding Teeth Wild Boar, and collect 10 Molar Fragments, then return to Pel.
You can find the Big Grinding Teeth Wild Boar northwest from a street vendor.
MsgComplete:
Oh, thank you. I'm lucky that you're so kind. 

Do you happen to know a Mr. Muo? Could I...could I ask you...a favor? Oh, what can I do...
MsgTake:
Oh, one...I need one more...but what can I do? I'm gonna die if I just wander around rashly... I was the only...only vampire...who survived that war... 

I don't...don't want to die...but the medicine... I have to make the medicine...medicine for him... He is my only... 

{c5}(Her face is pale, and after wringing her hands, she manages to calm down.){/c}

Vail... you are a Vail, but you don't look too frightening, so please help me...  Molar...need 10 Molar Fragments...don't ask why... Please...
MsgWelcome: Please buy some medicine... if you don't need it, well, I guess you don't have to...
MsgIncomplete: Molar... Molar Fragments?
MsgResponse4: Molar... Molar Fragments?

MsgSummary: Pel gave you the secret medicine she created and asked you to give it to {c2}Muo Jenisys{/c}. You have to give the Pel's Secret Medicine to Muo.
MsgComplete:
Oh, Pel's Secret Medicine! Give it to me now! {c5}(He snatches the medicine from you.){/c} Haha, thanks. She's dumb, but she comes in quite handy.  (Giggles.)

Hey, didn't you notice she's pretty strange? She's really a hoot! I was told that she was captured by vampires before, but somehow she escaped.  She must have been hypnotized or something, because she really believes that she's the last vampire who survived the Vampirit War. (Giggles.)

Oh, I wish I could see Vampire Queen Mago just once. According to what I've heard, her beauty and sexiness equaled Etain's... I wish I could fill an attractive body with her sealed soul and touch it with my two hands.  There's nothing that'd be more arousing that that~

Ah, right, you worked hard to bring this medicine. Take this and go.  (Giggles.)
MsgTake:
Oh, you know Mr. Muo? Ah, this is great! 

Mr. Muo is the only person who can protect me... He is really kind. I made this medicine for him...I'm happy that I could give him something... 

{c5}(Giving you the medicine){/c} Please... please give this to Mr. Muo. I can't go away from here...I'd die if I wandered around rashly... Oh, oh, nothing... Just take that medicine to Mr. Muo, please...
MsgWelcome: Please buy some medicine... if you don't need it, well, I guess you don't have to...
MsgIncomplete: Did you find Mr. Muo yet?
MsgResponse4: Hello, you can call me Muo. Do you need anything?

MsgSummary:
The Defense item merchant, Zidden, asked you to bring some material so that he can make a defensive item. The material is Shell of Larva. You have to battle some Hunter Larva and collect 5 Shells of Larva and return to Zidden.
You can find the Hunter Larva if you exit the village and follow the route northwest.
MsgComplete:
Nice! Even though you're new at this, you brought some pretty good Larva Shells. Thanks to you, I don't have to worry about whether or not I'll make my deadline for that order.

This is the reward I promised. Nordein never break their promises. Thanks again, and take care.

<Reward for Warrior, Guardian><Reward for Hunter>
MsgTake:
I'm lucky, because it's not something of low quality... I need to ask you a favor.

I'm a merchant, but occasionally I make things myself. A little while ago, I had an order for more materials, but I realized that I was fresh out. The deadline is just around the corner, and I can't leave the shop unattended, so I'm in a tight spot here.

Can you bring some material for me? I'll give you a good reward, just kill some Hunter Larva and give me their Larva Shells. I'll be waiting.
MsgWelcome: Huh? Surely you didn't come here to ruin my shop, did you?
MsgIncomplete: Did you obtain all the Shells of Larva I asked for?
MsgResponse4: Did you obtain all the Shells of Larva I asked for?

MsgSummary: Molniya seems to be in love with Jurogiya without having his love in return. You have to deliver the {c3}Letter of Molniya{/c} to {c2}Jurogiya{/c}.
MsgComplete:
What's up? {c5}(After reading the letter, he sighs.){/c} Argh, Molniya again? This is getting old now. I don't know how many times she's done this. It would make things a lot easier if she just let me go... 

I can give her a reply, but it wouldn't be the answer she's looking for. Do you still need my reply anyway? 

<Yes, I'll get an answer and return to Molniya.><My errand is finished. I don't care about her anymore, so tell me something new.>
MsgTake:
Hey you! Come here! 

You're not busy right now, right? Right? I can totally tell just by looking at you! Don't try to make it look like you're busy! There's something you can do for me.

Do you know Jurogiya? Well, it doesn't matter whether you know him or not. Everybody will point you in his direction if you ask for the nicest and bravest guard in Suteron~ {c5}(She gives you a letter.){/c} Please give this to Jurogiya, and make sure you get his heartfelt reply and come back to tell me all about it!

Don't do anything stupid, okay?!
MsgWelcome: Doesn't Jurogiya know how I feel? He can be such an idiot sometimes... *sigh*
MsgIncomplete: Why are you still here, you lazy bum?
MsgResponse4: A sword for a sword - that's the warrior's rule.

MsgSummary: You have to receive the Reply of Jurogiya and return to Molniya, who is waiting for a letter.
MsgComplete:
Did you get a reply? Hand it over!

{c5}(After snatching the letter and reading it){/c} What is this? This is exactly the same as the other 329 letters I've gotten from him! Why does he always have to reject me like this? Ugh!

Hohoho...you've misjudged me, Jurogiya! I'm never gonna give you up, and I'm never gonna let you down! I'll win your heart~ Well, I'm done, so I don't have any more need of you.
MsgWelcome: A sword for a sword - that's the warrior's rule.
MsgIncomplete: Did you give my answer to her?
MsgResponse4: Doesn't Jurogiya know how I feel? He can be such an idiot sometimes... *sigh*

MsgSummary:
Jurogiya said he needs your help carrying out the order from Rogers. You have to get rid of {c3}5 Short Tail Black Pumas{/c} and return.
You can find Short Tail Black Pumas if you exit the village and follow the northwest route.
MsgComplete:
Did you finish already? Damn, you've got some skills! You'll be a great warrior, no doubt about it.

This is my token of gratitude, so go on and take it. I hope we can meet each other again someday. See you later, then. 

<Reward for Warrior, Guardian><Reward for Hunter>
MsgTake:
Hmm, that's fine. It'd be rude if I sent the same reply to Molniya every time, right?

I'm lucky because I've been looking for someone who can help me. These days, Short Tail Black Pumas are wandering around the village and attacking all the animals we can use as food, so what little food we can get from around the village has been diminishing. That's why Rogers ordered me to get rid of some Black Pumas. But...there are too many, so I can't handle them all myself. 

You said you'd lend a hand? I'm grateful. Just slay about 5 of them; no need to go wild. I can take care of the rest of them. I'm counting on you, then.
MsgWelcome: A sword for a sword - that's the warrior's rule.
MsgIncomplete: How's it coming with clearing out those Black Pumas?
MsgResponse4: How's it coming with clearing out those Black Pumas?

MsgSummary: The grocery dealer, Kisera, proposed that you go find Blue and help him. Blue had a bad fight with his girlfriend, Rose, so things are very tense between them. Find Blue and ask him if there is anything you can do.
MsgComplete:
I'm not in the mood to talk to you right now, so get lost. Oh, wait...Kisera sent you here? She doesn't have to worry about me... It's not a big deal...

Okay, well...actually, I made a terrible mistake this time...
MsgTake:
Rose and Blue were arguing again! They don't ever seem to get sick of fighting! They do this nearly once a week.  It's a wonder they haven't broken up already.  

By the way, it seems like their fight was a lot worse this time. Rose would have accepted Blue's apology if this had been the same as all the other times... Blue must've screwed up big-time.  

Can you go to Blue quietly and ask him what happened? I have a feeling someone else should be involved with their fighting this time so they can make up, hehe.
MsgWelcome: Welcome to Kisera's general store!
MsgIncomplete: Hey, did you go talk to Blue yet?
MsgResponse4: Did you happen to see a plain-looking girl named Rose? Where on earth did she go? *sigh*

MsgSummary:
Blue said he lost a ring he intended to give to his girlfriend, Rose. The culprit is Rough Ground Tiny Wild Boar. You have to slay the Rough Ground Tiny Wild Boar and obtain Rose's Ring, then return. 
You can find the Rough Ground Tiny Wild Boar in the vacant lot where the Aridon guard is standing.
MsgComplete:
Ah, you brought it! This ring is totally what I've been looking for! There's not even a scratch on it... I knew valuable things like this were special.

Well, now I have to give this to Rose and apologize. I'm sure she's still pretty upset. I wonder how I could approach her...
MsgTake:
Rose's birthday is coming up. I wanted to give her a special present this time, so I ordered a ring from a famous craftsman in the capital. I really got her excited, but then...I lost it.

I must have dropped it somewhere while I was hanging around the village and Wild Boars suddenly attacked me. They were Rough Ground Tiny Wild Boars... There's a great chance that one of them ate it, so I have to hunt them and check them out... 

Could... could you help me? I know I threw a fit earlier, but I suppose it was my fault. I want to apologize right now. Please help me find the ring!
MsgWelcome: Did you happen to see a plain-looking girl named Rose? Where on earth did she go? *sigh*
MsgIncomplete: Did you find the ring? Did one of those wild boars eat it?
MsgResponse4: I don't want to see Blue's face until he admits that it was his fault. *sigh*

MsgSummary: Blue asked you to hand the retrieved ring to Rose on his behalf. You can find Rose inside of the village.
MsgComplete:
I'm not in the mood to talk right now! Just go away... {c5}(After looking at a ring){/c} Oh? Is this my ring by any chance? It looks very similar to the one Blue described... Is it really true? 

Oh, I'm so glad you found this! You don't know how disappointed I've felt since he said he lost it. But you somehow found it! Awesome! 

Well, I finally have my ring, so I'll just forgive him now. Who else would like someone like Blue besides me? I appreciate all the effort you've given! See you later! 

<Reward for Assassin><Reward for Oracle, Pagan>
MsgTake:
I'm sorry, but can you do me a favor one more time? Please hand this to Rose. She must be very upset now, so it would make matters worse if I went to her in person...

She'll cool down once she sees this ring. After that, I'll go and apologize. I'm certain this will work.

Please help me one more time, since you've already helped this much. I'll explain the whole thing to Kisera later. I hope you'll have some good news for me later.
MsgWelcome: Did you happen to see a plain-looking girl named Rose? Where on earth did she go? *sigh*
MsgIncomplete: Did you give the ring to Rose?
MsgResponse4: I don't want to see Blue's face until he admits that it was his fault! Hmph...

MsgSummary:
Sant asked you to punish the monsters that messed up his street vending stall. You have to hunt 7 Short Hair Black Pumas and go back to Sant.
You can find Short Hair Black Pumas west of the street vendor.
MsgComplete:
Your body really reeks of blood. I can see you don't do anything halfway!

This is the reward that I promised. Is this all right? Thanks then, take care! 

<Reward for Warrior><Reward for Guardian><Reward for Hunter>
MsgTake:
I'm really upset now.

All I did was take a short trip into the village, but while I was gone, Black Pumas messed up my wares - and that stuff is all expensive! 

Can you fight? If you can, go and take down some Short Hair Black Pumas! If you do this for me, I'll give you a handsome reward. Forward!
MsgWelcome: All I'm selling are expensive items. You'd better not buy the cheapest stuff.
MsgIncomplete: Did you slay the Black Pumas yet?
MsgResponse4: Did you slay the Black Pumas yet?

MsgSummary:
Londo asked you to find goods which he will supply to a lab. You have to hunt the {c1}Short Hair Black Puma{/c} and collect {c3}10 Hearts of Black Puma{/c} and return to Londo.
You can find the Short Hair Black Puma west of a street vendor.
MsgComplete:
Oh, awesome! Your skill is amazing! Now I can start supplying these as one of the items I carry. Wonderful job! 

You worked very hard, so I need to give you a reward. If I need anything else, I'll let'cha know next time you're around!
MsgTake:
Hey, you. Can you do me a favor? 

You know, I'm very interested in magic despite the fact I'm a Nordein. That's why the Vail don't dislike me - they're very inclined toward magic, you know. I want to learn magic too, but I can't do that yet.

Instead, I can find materials they need. One material is called Heart of Black Puma. They said they can make some kind of medicine with it that will make them more powerful. They promised to give me some of that medicine once they've made it! 

The problem is that I need to obtain a lot more than you think, so it's too difficult a task to do all by myself. Can you help me? Good, just find 10 and give them to me.
MsgWelcome: I sell almost all kinds of items! Look around carefully and pick what you want!
MsgIncomplete: Did you obtain any Hearts of Black Puma?
MsgResponse4: Did you obtain any Hearts of Black Puma?

MsgSummary:
Boseb needs your help clearing out animals that have been causing a ruckus near the camp. You have to hunt 5 Dust Storm Buffaloes and 5 Gigantic Gray Bears and return to Boseb.
You can find Buffaloes and Bears near the camp.
MsgComplete:
Hmm, you've got skill, I'll give you that. I figure I can give you this reward without regrets, haha! 

Judging by your looks, you could be the next one to become as well-known as Tyrannus... Of course, that's just my take, heh. Anyway, well done!
MsgTake:
Lately, it seems like the monsters just want to flex their muscle and cause disorder! Even my hunting has been disturbed. I feel that it's necessary that I clean up this mess. So, do you want to join me?

A strong Nordein will be good for this job! We know how to fight power with power! Hahaha! 

Go out and take care of 5 Dust Storm Buffaloes and 5 Gigantic Gray Bears. I'm leaving them to you because they are the most aggravating ones. Do a good job, and don't let me down!
MsgWelcome: Hey, did you also come here to kill Tatoramo? They're pretty tough, so you'd better be careful.
MsgIncomplete: How did your fighting with the Buffaloes and Bears go?
MsgResponse4: How did your fighting with the Buffaloes and Bears go?

MsgSummary: It seems Boseb developed a high opinion of you. Giving you a letter of recommendation, he told you to find Tuirtum, a captain of the camp. You have to find Tuirtum with the Letter of Boseb.
MsgComplete:
Hmm, so it's a letter from Boseb, is it? It says here that you're a great warrior who possesses potential enough to become a Tyrannus. I believe this because this is a Letter of Boseb.

Basically, Tyrannus is a title representing both a head of the Nordein and the most powerful person. Only one Nordein has had this title in the past.

Back then, the Fire Dragon Flame Storm had abused the Nordein for several years. A Nordein named Tyrannus defeated this dragon, which even the ruling class had no way to cope with. In addition, he challenged the highest leader to a duel of accession. In the end, he won the fight, and became the highest leader. Ever since then, even to this day, everybody has referred to the highest head of the Nordein as Tyrannus, to honor him. 

Since you also have the potential, continue to make your best endeavors and gather enough power to attain the position of Tyrannus. Until then, make every effort a heartfelt one.

<Reward for Warrior/Guardian><Reward for Hunter><Reward for Pagan/Oracle>
MsgTake:
Ah, your power is absolutely stunning, just like the rumors say. I'm sorry I didn't realize who you were. I nearly passed you off as one of those riffraff. I apologize.

Your ability drove me to write a letter of recommendation. {c5}(Holds out a letter of recommendation.){/c} Now here's what to do: find Tuirtum, a captain of the camp. He will tell you a story that can inspire you to new heights!
MsgWelcome: Hey, did you also come here to hunt Tatoramo? They're pretty tough, so you'd better be careful.
MsgIncomplete: Did you meet a captain called Tuirtum?
MsgResponse4: This is the Venatio Camp. Our job is to capture monsters and give them to farms.

MsgSummary:
Ray asked you to find something Beki lost. The culprit is the Rough Gray Hair Wolf.
You have to kill some {c1}Rough Gray Hair Wolves{/c} and obtain the {c3}Bracelet of Beki{/c}, then go back to Ray.
You can find Rough Gray Hair Wolves out the north gate of Gliter.
MsgTake:
Can you help me? It's urgent!

My lover, Beki, lost her bracelet a little while ago! She was attacked on her way back home from another village and managed to escape, but she lost her bracelet. 

That bracelet was an unbelievably expensive one - you could practically purchase a manor with it. So understandably, she's been inconsolable.  

I was told the monsters that attacked her were Rough Gray Hair Wolves. Please hunt them and bring Beki's Bracelet back; I implore you!
MsgWelcome: Don't bother me. I have to find Beki right now.
MsgIncomplete: The bracelet... have you found Beki's bracelet yet?
MsgResponse4: The bracelet... have you found Beki's bracelet yet?

MsgSummary: Ray asked you to deliver his letter and a bracelet to Beki. You should deliver the {c3}Bracelet of Beki{/c} and the {c3}Letter of Ray{/c} to Beki. You can find her in the residence located in the middle of the village.
MsgComplete:
Oh my! This is my bracelet! Where did you find this? I was really depressed because I lost it. I feel so fortunate!

{c5}(After looking at the letter, she frowns.){/c} What? This is a letter from Ray. Did Ray let you do this? I see... Really, what's wrong with this guy? Now I feel annoyed...
MsgTake:
Well, now I want you to give this to its owner, along with this letter. 

I hope Beki will be excited... I'm looking forward to hearing the good news!
MsgWelcome: Don't bother me. I have to find Beki!
MsgIncomplete: Did you do what I asked you?
MsgResponse4: Aha, don't you want to play with me?

MsgSummary: Beki seemed to be annoyed by Ray's courtship. She kept her bracelet and gave Ray's Letter back to you. You have to go back to {c2}Ray Haste{/c} with the letter.
MsgComplete:
Ah...so Beki was playin' it like that, huh? Well, it doesn't matter. I don't think she told you what's really on her mind. She's just...embarassed! Yeah, embarassed of her true feelings for me!

I have to meet her in person next time; I'm worried about her. Is she cheating on me with that sneaky bastard Garter?!

Thanks for being a good sport about it anyway. Here's a little somethin' for ya.
MsgTake:
Thanks for this ring. I'll give you a reward for your trouble. But I don't need his letter. I don't want to read it either. Give this back to that idiot, and don't forget to tell him to "never ever do this again!" 

All right, when you're done, just go. *sigh*
MsgWelcome: Aha, don't you want to play with me?
MsgIncomplete: What, why are you still here?
MsgResponse4: Don't bother me. I have to find Beki.

MsgSummary:
An alchemist named Hannen wondered why the errand girl hasn't come back. You have to go to Herba Farm and find {c2}Iote{/c} and give her Hannen's Letter.
You can find Herba Farm south of the Lab.
MsgComplete: Oh my goodness, you must be the person Hannen sent! What am I going to do? I couldn't collect as many herbs as he wanted...
MsgTake:
All right... can you do me a favor? A little while ago, I sent an errand girl to Herba Farm. I told her bring back some herbs, but I haven't gotten any news ever since. I'm wondering if something happened to her.

Take this letter and find an alchemist named Iote at Herba Farm. If you see her, tell her I'd like her to come back right now.
MsgWelcome: An errand girl is a little late... I need to send someone to find her.
MsgIncomplete: Did you find the Iote the errand-girl?
MsgResponse4: I'm Iote from the Panakeia Lab. I came here to gather some herbs.

MsgSummary: Iote gave you the {c1}Bunch of Herbs{/c} she has collected so far, and told you to let Hannen know what has happened to her. You have to deliver Iote's story to Hannen with the Bunch of Herbs.
MsgComplete:
Oh, these are herbs from Herba Farm. {c5}(After listening to your story){/c} Hmm, so that's what's been going on. How strange. I haven't had any problems doing business with Herba Farm so far. Well, this can't be good... Iote is obviously having a hard time. She said she can handle this, but... 

Thanks for your help. Keep this. I hope I can see you again sometime.
MsgTake:
The villagers said they couldn't harvest as many herbs as they expected this year because of the exceptionally bad weather, so they were reluctant to give me as many herbs as we wanted in the first place.

I'm constantly trying to persuade them to give me more, but I don't think it will be so easy. It would make things a whole lot easier if I somehow persuade the obstinate headman, Etum... I'd better give it a try, though.

Please give these herbs I have collected so far to Hannen. He must need them urgently, seeing as he sent you all the way here. Tell him my story.
MsgWelcome: I'm Iote from the Panakeia Lab. I came here to gather herbs.
MsgIncomplete: Did you give Mr. Hannen the herbs?
MsgResponse4: I'm Iote from the Panakeia Lab. I came here to gather herbs.

MsgSummary:
Pauke asked you to find buffalo meat that he needs for ongoing research. You have to hunt some {c1}Crow Swamp Buffalo{/c} and collect {c3}10 Buffalo Meats{/c} and return to Pauke.
You can find Crow Swamp Buffalo north of the Lab.
MsgComplete:
You're later than I expected. Don't tell me you're gettin' slow, eh? Well, at least you got plenty of meat. Just for you, I'll let it slide this time, but don't expect to get paid next time if you just roll along like this.

Well, take this. Now go on and take care of your own business.
MsgTake:
These days, I'm studying animals and other creatures. As the war continues, more mutated creatures keep appearing. I assume I can find something revolutionary we can utilize in the war if I keep researching mutated creatures.

The animal I want to study right now is a Crow Swamp Buffalo. This is a kind of mutated buffalo. If you get near them, they will emit an awful odor like that of rotten blood. I'm wondering how the buffalo does that. What I'd like you to do is, go and kill a Crow Swamp Buffalo and bring me some of its meat. I need a specimen for research. Be quick about it, too.
MsgWelcome: Be modest. If you're willing to learn, I can teach you.
MsgIncomplete: Did you obtain as many buffalo meats as I asked you to?
MsgResponse4: Did you obtain as many buffalo meats as I asked you to?

MsgSummary: You have to unalive 8 {c}Karision Big Tongs Larva{/c} and 8 {c}Karision Desert Poison Larva{/c} in Deep Desert 1.
MsgComplete: I may not get my doggo back, but at least he's in pup heaven knowing I didn't let his demise go unavenged. Thank you, kind stranger.
MsgTake:
...so we were camping in the desert and I woke up to find my cousin and dog missing. I followed the trail of shredded clothes and dog fur that led to these monsters. Seething with vengeful anger, I attacked them with the first thing I could pull out of my pocket, a half-chewed piece of beef jerky.
Needless to say I barely escaped with my life. I hated my cousin, our mothers made us go camping together but I loved that dog! Avenge him for me!
MsgIncomplete: Squash dem bugs! Do it!

MsgSummary:
Lamia, the medicine merchant, told you to find the president of Arteria Blood Lab, named Armilla.
You can go to the Arteria Blood Lab if you exit the village and follow the route northeast.
MsgComplete:
What brought you to this lab? Oh, Lamia told you to come here? Heheh, nice to meet you. Lamia is one of my best friends...in many ways, you know. Heheh. 

Welcome to the Arteria Blood Lab.
MsgTake:
Brave traveler, don't you think it's time for you to leave Aridon and explore other places? I think you've got the power and ability to do that now. 

Why don't you drop by Arteria Blood Lab? They conduct research on disorders of the blood, and are in the process of studying Vails' genetic diseases and their various blood-related conditions. Go and find the president, Armilla. I know her well.

Good luck on your journey, brave traveler.
MsgWelcome: Come on in. Which medicine are you looking for?
MsgIncomplete: You're still in the village?
MsgResponse4: Restat has been helping me a lot. I'd really love to study his blood...

MsgSummary: Armilla, the president of Arteria Blood Lab, told you to find a researcher named Kaput if you'd like to undertake another task. You can find Kaput inside of the Lab.
MsgComplete:
{c5}(Kaput, concentrating on his work, does not notice you.){/c}

Oh, how fascinating...I didn't realize there were components like this in here... I hadn't predicted these results. I guess I need to do a new study...
MsgTake:
If you're looking for a job, I'm sorry; I don't have anything in particular I need done right now.

However, you may find something to do if you go to my researchers. Why don't you find Kaput? I know he's very busy these days.

One more thing. You have to be very careful when you say something to him. He's a rather sensitive man, you know. Heheh.
MsgWelcome: Restat has been helping me a lot. I'd really love to study his blood...
MsgIncomplete: Did you find Kaput yet?
MsgResponse4: I detected what the unknown blood's components were just now. I feel confused, so talk to me later.

MsgSummary: A Raigo orderly from the D-Water Borderland gave you an Orderly's Letter, and told you to meet a commander, {c2}Konn Karso{/c}. You have to cross to the D-Water Borderland and find Konn in the Raigo Castle.
MsgComplete:
This appears to be a Letter from an Orderly I dispatched to the area... Are you a warrior come to fight for the victory of the Vail? Welcome, haha.

Don't forget, this place is a very dangerous battlefield, so keep a sharp eye out. Show them everything you've got and annihilate all of those vicious Elves and stupid Humans! 
Only cowards will turn their back on enemies to save their lives. Keep this in mind!
MsgTake:
Hey you! Do you want to commit to the war against the Alliance of Light? I'm afraid we're dipping into the youths to send 'em to the battlefield these days... 

Both the Union of Fury and the Alliance of Light have constructed fortresses in the D-Water Borderland, and the fighting between us is getting fiercer. I assume we are currently one step ahead of our adversaries, but our situation is getting worse considering that Elves and Humans are constantly increasing in number. The tide of the battle is about to turn in their favor now.

If you've come with the intent of going to battle, your destination is Raigo Castle, the fortress of the Union of Fury. You'll want to meet Konn Karso, the Vail Commander, and give him this letter of recommendation. and let him know you'd like to participate in the battles that are sure to come.
MsgWelcome: How do you do? I'm an orderly from Raigo Castle of D-Water Borderland.
MsgIncomplete: Didn't you leave for the D-Water Borderland yet?
MsgResponse4: Hmm... do you have business with me? Well, it's a bit dull right now, so tell me about what you've been up to.

MsgSummary:
Chrio proposed that you warm up by hunting atrocious monsters in preparation for the upcoming battles.
Your first opponents are {c1}Poisonous Mist Zombies{/c}. You have to get rid of 5 Poisonous Mist Zombies and return to Chrio.
You can find Poisonous Mist Zombies to the southeast of Iron Blood outside the fortress.
MsgComplete: Oh, great job. You're more powerful than I thought. You've had a lot of fighting experience already, haven't you?
MsgTake:
On Proelium Island, you should constantly keep on your toes while hunting. Who knows if the Vail and Nordein would attack you from behind out of nowhere? I saw many people ambushed like that. You'd better be careful.

Oh, that's right - since you're here for the first time, why don't you get rid of monsters nearby the fortress and warm up your body at the same time? This might help you out, you know. Supposedly you can prepare for the upcoming battle against enemies with this kind of training. 

Maybe you can handle a monster like Poisonous Mist Zombies easily. Dispose of them appropriately and return to me.
MsgWelcome: Which one do you need?
MsgIncomplete: Did you get rid of all the Poisonous Mist Zombies?
MsgResponse4: Did you get rid of all the Poisonous Mist Zombies?

MsgSummary:
This is your second warmup in Proelium Frontier. This time, you have to take care of 5 Leopardess Adventurers and return to Chrio.
You can find Leopardess Adventurers in Iron Blood, north of the fortress.
MsgComplete:
Wow, you're really something else. I feel lucky, you know. The more people like you we have here, the more the morale improves, haha.

Now I assume you've finished warming up somewhat. You can help other people, or you can lay siege to the enemy's fortress right now. It all depends on what you're feelin' up for.

Take care then!
MsgTake:
This time you'd better practice on stronger monsters than Zombies. I recommend seeing how you fare against Leopardess Adventurers. They can be a little tricky to fight because they're not only strong, but nimble as well.

Deal with them however you think most efficient, then come see me again. I hope you'll return safely.
MsgWelcome: Which one do you need?
MsgIncomplete: Did you get rid of all the Leopardess Adventurers?
MsgResponse4: Did you get rid of all the Leopardess Adventurers?

MsgSummary: Mins proposed that you warm up by hunting the dangerous monsters near the fortress. Your first opponents are the {c1}Mercenary Arachne{/c}. You have to get rid of 5 Mercenary Arachnes and return to Mins.
MsgComplete: Well, you're not a bad hand at this whole combat business, but the outcome should've been quite the natural result, seeing as how you came to the battlefield to fight! If you couldn't handle them, it would be rather ridiculous indeed!
MsgTake:
This is a bloody place, this battlefield... If you take your eyes off your surroundings for even a second, Elves and Humans will come out of nowhere and slit your neck! I saw many people ambushed like that. If you don't want to die, you need to know how to keep your guard up.

How about sweeping away violent monsters near the fortress for a warmup? It'll give you a sense of the lay of the land.

Perhaps Mercenary Arachnes will be appropriate for you to train on. Deal with them efficiently, then come back to see me.
MsgWelcome: Are you looking for something?
MsgIncomplete: Did you get rid of all the Mercenary Arachnes?
MsgResponse4: Did you get rid of all the Mercenary Arachnes?

MsgSummary: This is your second warmup in Proelium Frontier. This time, you have to take care of {c1}5 Durable Leather Wild Boars{/c} and return to Mins.
MsgComplete:
Well, looks like you're the real deal.

Now I assume you've finished warming up somewhat. Why don't you help a few others get familiar with this place? Otherwise, if you're feeling like storming the enemy's fortress, feel free to do that too.
Don't forget to watch your back, or you'll be putting yourself in danger.
MsgTake:
This time you'd better practice on much stronger monsters than Arachnes. Try to kill Durable Leather Wild Boars. Admittedly, they're a little rough to deal with - they've got brute strength on their side, and they're surprisingly quick on their feet.

Please dispose of them with the best methods you know. I hope you return safely, then. Remember to come back alive, of course.
MsgWelcome: Are you looking for something?
MsgIncomplete: Is there something you're looking for?
MsgResponse4: Is there something you're looking for?

MsgSummary: Ian, the warehouse keeper, asked for your help in eliminating aggravating bears on Proelium Island. You should get rid of {c1}3 Rake Claw Large Bears{/c} and {c1}3 Mountain Ridge Large Brown Bears{/c}, and go back to Ian.
MsgComplete:
Wow! Like Chrio said, you're certainly something else. Now that you took care of them, those bears better know their place! Thanks!

Here's a reward to recognize your accomplishments. Please lend your aid to the Vail and Nordein.
MsgTake:
You must be the person Chrio has been talking about, right? If you're looking for a job, there's something you can do for me. 

Bears on Proelium Island are way more violent than bears in the continent. They sometimes attack people passing by and gnaw apart their bodies. It keeps me awake at night just thinking of their brutality.

Whether we like it or not, I figure an all-out bear hunt is what we need. You think you could kick off the "festivities"? If you have the skill that Chrio mentioned, I figure that I can trust this job to you.

Rake Claw Large Bears and Mountain Ridge Large Brown Bears are the most ferocious bears. Begin the hunt, and return safely!
MsgWelcome: Is there something you want to deposit?
MsgIncomplete: Did you kill all the Rake Claw Large Bears and Mountain Ridge Large Brown Bears I asked for?
MsgResponse4: Did you kill all the Rake Claw Large Bears and Mountain Ridge Large Brown Bears I asked for?

MsgSummary: Nasia, the warehouse keeper, asked for your help in eliminating aggravating bears on Proelium Island. You have to get rid of {c1}3 Rake Claw Large Bears{/c} and {c1}3 Mountain Ridge Large Brown Bears{/c}, then go back to Nasia.
MsgComplete:
Well, you survived long enough to return - there's gotta be some skill in you. You sure whooped some sense into those bears, huh? They won't dare to attack us for quite some time. 

Here's a reward for your labor. Now, what you did to those bears, do to the Humans and Elves every time you encounter them!
MsgTake:
You must be the person Mins has been talking about, right? You look like you've got some free time on your hands. If you've got nothing else to do, I've got a worthwhile task that needs doing.

Bears on Proelium Island are way more violent than the bears from the continent. They sometimes attack people passing by and gnaw apart their bodies. They come in handy sometimes though...like when they finish off those sickening, disgusting Humans and Elves. But the problem is that our Vail soldiers are killed from time to time as well.

Whether we like it or not, I feel it's necessary that we punish these stupid bears. Go and show them what you've got. If you're as skillful as Chrio mentioned, I suppose you won't drop dead. 

Rake Claw Large Bears and Mountain Ridge Large Brown Bears are the most troublesome bears. Take care of those, then report back to me!
MsgWelcome: When are you heading out?
MsgIncomplete: Did you kill all the Rake Claw Large Bears and Mountain Ridge Large Brown Bears?
MsgResponse4: Did you kill all the Rake Claw Large Bears and Mountain Ridge Large Brown Bears?

MsgSummary: The blacksmith, Ru, promised to give you a good reward if you get rid of {c1}3 Soldiers of the Union of Fury{/c} and return. It doesn't matter whether you kill Vail or Nordein troops.
MsgComplete:
Great! Excellent work. You might feel that what you've done is insignificant, but it's the value of each individual's contributions that add to the great victory of the Alliance of Light.  That's the way to think about it!

I'll give you this as a reward. I hope you find it useful. See you again then, brave friend!
MsgTake:
Have you adjusted to life here on the frontier yet? Once you have, it's time to prepare to fight against the Vail!

Proelium Island is a very important strategic point to us, the Alliance of Light. If we use the Delphinian Fortress as our supply route and make a push toward the north, it will be a piece of cake to penetrate through to Iris, the Vail capital. Of course, they're obviously not stupid, so they constructed their own fortress in the north and are securing that area now.

In order to take that fortress, it is crucial that we kill on-sight all the soldiers from the Union of Fury regardless of whether they are Vail or Nordein. Sounds cruel, eh? Hey, there's no sympathy to enemies on the battlefield whatsoever, so deal with it! 

Annihilate those villainous Union of Fury soldiers. Then I'll give you something very nice. Leave none alive!
MsgWelcome: Did you come here to fix something?
MsgIncomplete: Did you kill some soldiers yet?
MsgResponse4: Did you kill some soldiers yet?

MsgSummary: The blacksmith, Ru, promised to give you a good reward if you got rid of {c1}3 soldiers of the Union of Fury{/c} and return. It doesn't matter whether you kill Vail or Nordein troops.
MsgComplete:
Great! Excellent work. You might feel that what you've done is insignificant, but it's the value of each individual's contributions that add to the great victory of the Alliance of Light.  That's the way to think about it!

I'll give you this as a reward. I hope you find it useful. See you again then, brave friend!

Annihilate those villainous Union of Fury soldiers. Then I'll give you something very nice. Leave none alive!
MsgWelcome: Did you come here to fix something?
MsgIncomplete: Did you kill some soldiers?
MsgResponse4: Did you kill some soldiers?

MsgSummary: The blacksmith, Dertin, promised to give you a good reward if you get rid of {c1}3 soldiers of the Alliance of Light{/c} and return. It doesn't matter whether you kill Elves or Humans.
MsgComplete:
Ah, excellent! You may think that what you've done makes no difference in the greater scheme of things, but every accomplishment by a soldier of the Union of Fury contributes to a goal far more grand than any of us could accomplish individually.

Take this reward, as a sign of your victories. I hope you find it useful, and I hope to see you victorious again!
MsgTake:
The reason we built a fortress on this tiny island, Proelium Island, is because it's a very important location for the war, since we can arrive at Iris, the Vail capital, incredibly quickly via this island.

That's why the Alliance of Light built a fortress in the southern regions of the island sooner than we did. They must have intended to utilize this place as a supply route. However, we're not foolish enough to just sit and let them do whatever they want, so the Paroutian Fortress was built here to block any potential advances of the Alliance of Light. 

That's why protecting this fortress is so important. The best defense is a strong offense. We must relentlessly kill all those serving in the Alliance of Light whenever we run across them - it will teach them to reconsider their advances. Go and show them your might - I'll give you a good reward for taking them down.
MsgWelcome: If you have something to fix, let me see it.
MsgIncomplete: Did you kill some soldiers?
MsgResponse4: Did you kill some soldiers?

MsgSummary: The blacksmith, Dertin, promised to give you a good reward if you get rid of {c1}3 soldiers of the Alliance of Light{/c} and return. It doesn't matter whether you kill Elves or Humans.
MsgComplete:
Ah, excellent! You may think that what you've done makes no difference in the greater scheme of things, but every accomplishment by a soldier of the Union of Fury contributes to a goal far more grand than any of us could accomplish individually.

Take this reward, as a sign of your victories. I hope you find it useful, and I hope to see you victorious again!

MsgSummary: The blacksmith, Dertin, promised to give you a good reward if you get rid of {c1}5 soldiers of the Alliance of Light{/c} and return. It doesn't matter whether you kill Elves or Humans.
MsgComplete:
Ah, excellent! You may think that what you've done makes no difference in the greater scheme of things, but every accomplishment by a soldier of the Union of Fury contributes to a goal far more grand than any of us could accomplish individually.

Take this reward, as a sign of your victories. I hope you find it useful, and I hope to see you victorious again!
MsgTake:
The reason we built a fortress on this tiny island, Proelium Island, is because it's a very important location for the war, since we can arrive at Iris, the Vail capital, incredibly quickly via this island.

That's why the Alliance of Light built a fortress in the southern regions of the island sooner than we did. They must have intended to utilize this place as a supply route. However, we're not foolish enough to just sit and let them do whatever they want, so the Paroutian Fortress was built here to block any potential advances of the Alliance of Light. 

That's why protecting this fortress is so important. The best defense is a strong offense. We must relentlessly kill all those serving in the Alliance of Light whenever we run across them - it will teach them to reconsider their advances. Go and show them your might - I'll give you a good reward for taking them down.
MsgWelcome: If you have something to fix, let me see it.
MsgIncomplete: Did you kill some soldiers?
MsgResponse4: Did you kill some soldiers?

MsgSummary: The blacksmith, Dertin, promised to give you a good reward if you get rid of {c1}5 soldiers of the Alliance of Light{/c} and return. It doesn't matter whether you kill Elves or Humans.
MsgComplete:
Ah, excellent! You may think that what you've done makes no difference in the greater scheme of things, but every accomplishment by a soldier of the Union of Fury contributes to a goal far more grand than any of us could accomplish individually.

Take this reward, as a sign of your victories. I hope you find it useful, and I hope to see you victorious again!

That's why protecting this fortress is so important. The best defense is a strong offense. We must relentlessly kill all those serving in the Alliance of Light whenever we run across them - it will teach them to reconsider their advances. Go and show them your might - I'll give you a good reward for taking them down.
MsgWelcome: If you have something to fix, let me see it.
MsgIncomplete: Did you kill some soldiers?
MsgResponse4: Did you kill some soldiers?

MsgComplete:
Ah, excellent! You may think that what you've done makes no difference in the greater scheme of things, but every accomplishment by a soldier of the Union of Fury contributes to a goal far more grand than any of us could accomplish individually.

Take this reward, as a sign of your victories. I hope you find it useful, and I hope to see you victorious again!
MsgTake:
The reason we built a fortress on this tiny island, Proelium Island, is because it's a very important location for the war, since we can arrive at Iris, the Vail capital, incredibly quickly via this island.

That's why the Alliance of Light built a fortress in the southern regions of the island sooner than we did. They must have intended to utilize this place as a supply route. However, we're not foolish enough to just sit and let them do whatever they want, so the Paroutian Fortress was built here to block any potential advances of the Alliance of Light. 

That's why protecting this fortress is so important. The best defense is a strong offense. We must relentlessly kill all those serving in the Alliance of Light whenever we run across them - it will teach them to reconsider their advances.
