Go and show them your might - I'll give you a good reward for taking them down.
MsgWelcome: If you have something to fix, let me see it.
MsgIncomplete: Did you kill some soldiers?
MsgResponse4: Did you kill some soldiers?

MsgSummary: The blacksmith, Ru, asked you to take care of Succubi seducing Alliance of Light soldiers. You have to hunt {c1}5 Frost Breath Succubi{/c} and return to Ru.
MsgComplete:
Ah, looks like you laid those Succubi to rest! Good thing you're willing to take up all the hard missions. Thanks to you, our soldiers won't be a bunch of working stiffs.

Well, here's a reward for doing your duty to kick their booty. May Etain always give you protection on the battlefield!
MsgTake:
It's kind of embarrassing to have to bring this up, but it's for the good of the entire Alliance of Light. I'm willing to bring the shame upon myself in order to get this out in the open

There are creatures called Succubi inhabiting this island, but the problem is that these creatures are, well... 

{c5}(After a long hesitation){/c} There is a rumor - just hearsay, mind you - that these creatures are seducing the soldiers. Oh my goodness, I can't believe I just said that! Anyway, when these male soldiers are tormented by a succubus, they become possessed. They always look as if they're captivated by something, day and night. This is an enormous problem in a war like this, where every single soldier is precious! 

We need to stop those succubi, so go out and penetrate their defenses!
MsgWelcome: Are you here to fix something?
MsgIncomplete: Was it hard to lay those evil Succubi to rest?
MsgResponse4: Was it hard to lay those evil Succubi to rest?

MsgSummary: The blacksmith, Dertin, asked you to take care of Succubi captivating Union of Fury soldiers. You have to hunt {c1}5 Frost Breath Succubi{/c} and return to Dertin.
MsgComplete: Ah, great! It was a shot in the dark, but you were just the one to ask about this situation. Here's a reward. I apprecaite all the hard work you've done for the Union, and I wish you success in your battles to come.
MsgTake:
Hmm...you're right on time.  Y'see...there's this problem we need to address...

These days, we've noticed a trend of male Vail soldiers not returning to the fortress. Therefore, we investigated to find out what was going on... As it turns out, they had been cursed by their "interactions" with the Succubi. 

Basically, Succubi are creatures who feed off the energies of males. Physically, they're not even that strong. I guess Vail men must be more hard-up than I thought, to fall so easily for such an obvious cheap shot of sex appeal.

I don't have any personal grudges, but I don't want this kind of loss to plague our Union any longer. That's why I'm telling you this secret. I want you to take care of the Succubi.
MsgWelcome: If you got something to fix, let me see it.
MsgIncomplete: How many of those Succubi have you finished off?
MsgResponse4: How many of those Succubi have you finished off?

MsgSummary: Chrio asked you to get rid of a pack of violent wolves that has been hurting young soldiers. You have to hunt the {c1}Maneating Wolves{/c} within {c4}60 minutes{/c} and return to Chrio without delay. You should kill at least 5.
MsgComplete: Hmm, good. But if you were going to do this, it would have been much better if you had killed a few more. Oh well...I guess you did your best with your skill, anyway. Thanks.
MsgResponse1: Oh, good work. They must have given you a pretty rough time. But you've proved to me that you're trustworthy, beyond a doubt.
MsgResponse2: Thank the Goddess. It took so long, so I was beginning to get worried about you. Well done! Thanks to you, I won't have to worry about thost blasted wolves for the time being, and the soldiers will have one less thing to fear on patrols.
MsgTake:
Good to see you. I've got a job for you, if you're feelin' up to it. I think we need to thin out the wolf population.

There are many soldiers who come to fight at the Delphinian Fortress on Proelium Island. Most of them are adults like you, but sometimes kids as young as 15 years old come to the front lines. They come here mostly because of their poor financial circumstances. I feel sad when I see them trudging toward the battlefield.

Lately, these young soldiers have started to fall to monsters' sudden attacks more often than being downed on the battlefield. They came to a dangerous place like this to make money, but their lives were just ended in vain. Is that how a life should be spent? 

I'm assigning you this job because I trust you more than anyone else. Please, at least thin the pack of those maneating wolves; kill at least 5. It would be better if you killed more than 5, but make sure you come back here within 60 minutes.
MsgWelcome: Which one do you need?
MsgIncomplete: Did you thin out those maneating wolves?
MsgResponse4: Did you thin out those maneating wolves?

MsgSummary: Mins asked you to get rid of some annoying HellTeeth. You have to get rid of at least 5 {c1}Vagabond HellTooth Fighters{/c} within {c4}60 minutes{/c} and return to Mins without delay.
MsgComplete: Well, this is enough. You did a good job.
MsgResponse1: Hmm, you got quite a few. Well done. This will be reward enough for you, I think. So long!
MsgResponse2: Oh ho! You're a real go-getter, aren't you? Great, this will make our hunting a whole lot easier. You did a wonderful job. I'll give you plenty of rewards.
MsgTake:
Good to see you. I've got a job I think you'd be particularly suited for.

The life here can be very stressful to soldiers, but for merchants like me, this place can get a bit dull, so I go hunting with other merchants to take the edge off the slow times. However, these days even my hobby has been disturbed by those annoying HellTeeth... 

The foolish HellTeeth can't do much, and they put up a shoddy fight. But they always ruin our hunting by scaring away the animals every time we hunt them. Maybe they have no idea what they're doing, but their behavior not only ruins my leisure time, it also offends my sensibilities, that an animal could be that dumb and have its species survive that long.

I'll give you this job because I trust your sure-killing ability. Can you take care of those annoying Vagabond HellTooth Fighters? You have to kill at least 5. The more you kill, the better, but make sure you come back here within 60 minutes.
MsgWelcome: Is there something you're looking for?
MsgIncomplete: Did you take care of the Vagabond HellTooth Fighters?
MsgResponse4: Did you take care of the Vagabond HellTooth Fighters?

MsgSummary: Chrio asked for your help. You have to get rid of {c1}3 Red Flag Skull Adjutants{/c} and {c1}2 Red Flag Skull Heroes{/c} and report back to Chrio.
MsgComplete: Awesome performance! I need to send this message to our forces right now. You made a big contribution for the Alliance of Light! Thank you!
MsgTake:
It's already hard enough for us to fight with the Vail and Nordein here, but there is another enemy we have to face here too... 

This group called the Red Flag Clan seems to be more intelligent than other creatures. Our soldiers who went to war have been attacked by this group and suffered serious damage many times. I thought they were nothing to worry about, but I was wrong. We need to do something about this.

I have already heard about your outstanding skill. Can you go and take care of their leaders? I bet that once their leaders are gone, the rest of their forces will be greatly weakened. After that, maybe it'll be possible to deal with them all in one try. Well, I look forward to your good news then.
MsgWelcome: Which one do you need?
MsgIncomplete: Did you get rid of all the Red Flag Skull Adjutants and Red Flag Skull Heroes?
MsgResponse4: Did you get rid of all the Red Flag Skull Adjutants and Red Flag Skull Heroes?

MsgSummary: Mins asked for your help. You have to get rid of {c1}3 Red Flag Skull Adjutants{/c} and {c1}2 Red Flag Skull Heroes{/c} and report back to him.
MsgComplete: Ah, outstanding work! I need to send this message to headquarters. Keep up the the good work on the front lines!
MsgTake:
Ah, so you're the one who everyone's been talking about lately. Interested in knowing why you're such a common topic of conversation? They say you can handle missions very well without any mistakes. 

There are monsters from a group called the Red Flag Clan. I guess some smart monsters formed this clan by themselves during the war. When I first heard about it, I didn't give 'em much thought, but I was told they keep disturbing us whenever we're fighting with the Alliance of Light. What a nuisance! 

If you're the kind of ace I've heard you are, it'll be a piece of cake to get rid of their leaders. Go and cut off their heads. We should nip this nuisance in the bud.
MsgWelcome: Is there anything in particular you're looking for?
MsgIncomplete: Did you get rid of all the Red Flag Skull Adjutants and Red Flag Skull Heroes?
MsgResponse4: Did you get rid of all the Red Flag Skull Adjutants and Red Flag Skull Heroes?

MsgSummary: Dratt is at the entrance of Vruion Forest. You can find this place if you follow the route straight toward the west from the Arteria Blood Lab. Find {c2}Dratt{/c}.
MsgComplete: What, Mr. Mosen is worried about me? I'm flattered, really. However, worrying about a Nordein is really...not necessary.
MsgTake: Dratt is probably camping out and keeping a close eye on the StonePeg Clan at the entrance of Vruion Forest, a little ways west from here. If you go west, you'll come upon a crossroad. From there, you should follow the route and go straight. Eventually, you'll reach the Vruion Forest. Well, don't let me keep you; get a move on.
MsgIncomplete: You still hangin' around here?

MsgSummary: The chief of guards, Berca, told you to find {c2}Raumo{/c}. Raumo is looking for someone he can send to the Fanselenon Institute.
MsgComplete:
Ah, you're back. Was Berca's task too difficult? It couldn't have been easy, but you helped her willingly; that's very sporting of you. Thanks to you, the security in Aelbeageu now can work without worry.
Can you do something else for us, perchance? I'm actually looking for someone I can send to the Fanselenon Institute.
MsgTake: You have finished what I requested, so you can go back to Raumo now. He said he's looking for someone who can help work in the Fanselenon Institute. Looks like he's expecting you to come now.
MsgIncomplete: You ought to meet Raumo.

MsgSummary: You can meet {c2}Radeon{/c}in the vestiges of ancient buildings if you go straight to the northwest of the Arteria Blood Lab.
MsgComplete: Did Quion send you here?
MsgTake:
Customer, can you do me a favor by any chance? I promise it won't be that difficult. I'm just hoping you can help my friend, Radeon.
He is now a watcher in the Vruion Forest, and his job is to eliminate the Crazy Breath Wild Boars and the Chaser Kobolts, who have been contaminated by curses, in the north stretch of the forest. Lately, his work has left him looking exhausted. Please help him.
MsgIncomplete: Radeon will be in the northern area of the Vruion Forest. Please lend him your aid.

MsgSummary: You have to perform Radeon's daily tasks for him so that he can take a rest. You have to get rid of {c1}5 Crazy Breath Wild Boars{/c} and {c1}5 Chaser Kobolts{/c} and return to Radeon.
MsgComplete: Ah, you worked hard. I can't say I had a perfect rest, but I'm feeling a lot better now. I hope you have a good friend who's there for you when you need them.
MsgTake:
Duiminas, our ancestor, made the stupidest mistake in history. They accidently turned a knife against the Creator, Etain. In the end, Duiminas' knife drew his own blood as well, and the world was contaminated by the blood the Goddess shed. Today, you can still see the repercussions in the curse that lays heavy on the Wild Boars and Kobolts that I have to kill here each day. I guess I have a good friend, seeing as how you came here.
 
I'm going to take a rest for a while, so please get rid of the Crazy Breath Wild Boars and the Chaser Kobolts in my stead. Killing 5 of each would be dandy. I think it will give me plenty of time to rest. I'm counting on you, then.
MsgIncomplete: Take it easy. The more time you take to do this, the longer I can rest.
MsgResponse4: Take it easy. The more time you take to do this, the longer I can rest.

MsgSummary: The chief of guards, Kunta, asked you to get rid of {c1}Poisonous Web Spiders{/c} which keep causing harm to those who go near Titan's Ruin. You have to go to Titan's Ruin and hunt 7 Poisonous Web Spiders and return to Kunta.
MsgComplete: You did a wonderful job. Let us celebrate our glory as Nordein, and fight for the great Tyrannus. I hope you'll distinguish yourself in combat.
MsgTake:
Titan is known as a low-class god among ancient Gods called Telaiosis. Titan is a famous god, known even by folks like me who've only studied the martial arts. That's why many Vail scholars visit Titan's Ruin. But here's the problem: the more visitors we have, the more accidents that occur. Personally, I don't care whether a Vail bites it here and there, but we formed a Union and an order from our superiors commands us to respect the Vail, so we have no choice but to help secure their safety during their research. The most common accident that befalls frail Vail scholars is when they're bitten to death by Poisonous Web Spiders.
The solution is very simple - all you have to do is to go and kill these Spiders whenever you see them. Kill about 7 of them and return to me. The reward will be waiting for you once you come back.
MsgIncomplete: Stay alert out there. Poison is something that even our Nordein strength can't shrug off.
MsgResponse4: Stay alert out there. Poison is something that even our Nordein strength can't shrug off.

MsgSummary:
You have to take care of {c1}7 Bulbous Eye Foxes{/c} and go back to Helen.
You can find the Bulbous Eye Foxes east of the village.
MsgComplete:
Oh my, you sure returned quickly! Well done. This is my reward. Now, at least for a while, I'll be able to sleep without the noise from those annoying foxes, heh!
Oops, I nearly forgot... I have to go and get dinner ready. See you, traveler, and thanks again!
MsgTake:
Argh, those foxes are howling and barking again. Could someone shut those foxes up?!  

Hey there traveler...you don't seem to be too busy at the moment. Would you happen to be interested in taking care of a fox problem? You can't imagine how noisy they are every night. I lay awake all night, and I can't work the next day, and this vicious cycle continues. Our villagers' job is to chop wood. If they can't sleep, how can you expect them to have the strength to work?

A bunch of strong men gathered and attempted to hunt them all down, but they were so fast! Nothing has worked against those foxes, they just nimbly escape every time. You look like you're a seasoned-enough fighter. Also, you're young, so you've got a mind like a steel trap, right? It will be a piece of cake for you to catch foxes like these. Hehe, I'm counting on you!
MsgIncomplete: This place is still noisy. Are you doing your job?
MsgResponse4: This place is still noisy. Are you doing your job?

MsgSummary: Something flashed into your memory. Narus once told you to return so he could give you a job. You have to return to {c2}Narus {/c} in the Fanselenon Institute.
MsgComplete:
What? You finally returned. Why on earth did it take so long to deliver one medicine? Tsk...I don't want to scold you, so I'll stop my sermon.

I suppose you still remember something I told you before, right? Good, good; obviously you're at least smarter than Narus.
MsgIncomplete: Ahhhh~ You're still attached to me... but no, we couldn't...

MsgSummary: Pede asked you to dispose of wild boars that devoured the Institute's supply of emergency food. You have to eliminate 7 Windtail Forest Large Brown Boars and return to Pede. You can find Windtail Forest Large Brown Boars northeast of the Fanselenon Institute.
MsgComplete:
Thank you very much. You did a very hard job without complaint. I feel at peace, knowing that those poor starting boars will never go hungry again...now that they're dead and buried.

This is a reward for what you have done. Do you plan to stay at the Institute a little bit more? I hope you'll have a good time of it.
<Reward for Ranger, Archer><Reward for Mage, Priest>
MsgTake:
Traveler, it's kind of embarrassing to ask you something like this, but...I'm a mere merchant whose only real skill is selling things, so I'm gonna have to borrow your assistance, 'cause this is a job that's gonna require power.

As you can see, we have a lot of residents in this Institute. It is not an easy task to gather enough food to eat, so the Keolloseu and Aelbeageu villages send us food sometimes. That gives us the sustenance we need to live here. A while back, though, a small problem cropped up.  

Apparently, the wild boars that live in groups northeast of this Institute came down here last night to find something to eat. They ate a ton of our emergency reserves, and that puts us in a tight spot. I feel sorry that they couldn't find anything to eat in the area they are inhabiting and had to come down here... but we're not just gonna act like nothing happened.

It makes me sad, but we have no choice but to kill the starving wild boars. I'll be punished for taking away innocent animals' lives, but can you do this for me? I'm begging you...
MsgIncomplete: Did you get rid of as many Windtail Forest Large Brown Boars as I requested?
MsgResponse4: Did you get rid of as many Windtail Forest Large Brown Boars as I requested?

MsgSummary: The beginner carpenter, Slo, asked you to find his brother, {c3}Sant{/c}, in the Frotainer Village. You can meet Sant near the street vendor at the north end of Titan's Ruin.
MsgComplete: My brother sent you here? Hmm, now that you mention it, I haven't heard from my brother in quite some time.
MsgTake: I have a brother named Sant. He is now running a small shop in the northern end of Titan's Ruin, but I haven't heard from him lately. I wonder what's going on with him. We haven't met up with each other a lot, but at least he had been in touch with me. Can you go and find out what happened to my brother?
MsgIncomplete: Well, I don't think anything serious happened to him, but I'm still concerned.

MsgSummary: Naad asked you to get rid of wood sprites. You have to get rid of 5 Windtail Forest Wood sprites and 5 Windtail Forest Guard Wood Sprites each and return to Naad. You can find wood sprites near the Institute and above the western hill.
MsgComplete: Looks like you came back without a scratch. {c5}(Grins){/c} I knew you'd handle this well. Thanks for helping us protect the Institute. This is a reward for what you have done. I hope this will satisfy you. May the Goddess protect you always.
MsgTake:
Hmm, if you don't want to learn about soul collection, it's okay. Forcing knowledge on others isn't a good habit, so I'll give up. However, you look like you're good at fighting, so I want to ask you something. Can I make a request of you?

There are wood sprites living near the Institute and above the western hill. At first glance, they look like very beautiful women. The truth is, you'll rarely encounter creatures as violent and cruel as these sprites. I have frequently heard that several nobles fascinated by their appearance raised them as ornaments, but eventually they were killed by them instead.

So far, wood sprites have seldom attacked the Institute, but considering their nature, there's no harm in being cautious. I think that taking the offensive will be our best defense. Do you know what I mean? Yeah, that's what I'm talking about. Go and get rid of a sufficient number of wood sprites, then return to me.
MsgIncomplete: Did you get rid of some wood sprites?
MsgResponse4: Did you get rid of some wood sprites?

MsgSummary: Leto asked for your help in reducing the number of brown bears, whose numbers have swelled recently. You have to get rid of 7 Windtail Forest Brown Bears and return to Leto. You can find the Windtail Forest Brown Bear near the Hunter camp.
MsgComplete:
I see you have hunted as many brown bears as I requested. I really appreciate your help; here's a reward for your hard work. Now you can go. I hope I can see you again.
May the God of the Hunt, Pantera, protect you.
MsgTake:
What Elven Hunters are doing is rather different from what other clans' Hunters are doing. I assume you know this pretty well, being an Elf yourself. Nowadays, Elven Hunters like us here try to maintain the balance between ourselves and the creatures that have been transformed by the long war. Of course, Etain loves every creature she created, but each Hunter has a different animal they are partial to. For instance, Brakion loves snakes, and Lesa has a special affection for creatures with wings.  

For me, the brown bear looks adorable. I really love furry animals with innocent natures. So I had to make a difficult decision. Have you seen several brown bears near the camp? Didn't you notice something strange? Yes, the number of brown bears is increasing rapidly. I don't know exactly why yet, but I'm starting to worry that other creatures who are related to the brown bears will feel the bad influence soon. 

I feel really sad, but this is an Elven Hunter's responsibility. Can you help me? Please hunt 7 brown bears and return to me. This will help me a lot. I'm counting on you, then.
MsgIncomplete: Did you hunt the brown bears?
MsgResponse4: Did you hunt the brown bears?

MsgSummary: Larry in Gliter asked you to find Rachio to know how the business he invested in is doing. You can find Rachio near the Escaton Ruin if you follow the route toward the west.
MsgComplete: Ah! Did Larry send you here? Great. I was just hoping some help would arrive.
MsgTake: If you exit the west gate of Gliter and follow the route, you will find a group running a small market near the Escaton Ruin.  Among them is Rachio, who told me he'd discovered something that has enough value to invest in. I'm interested in what Rachio is talking about, so I'm investing in it a little. Now please help Rachio so that he can acquire it. He'll know what you're talking about if you say I sent you.
MsgIncomplete: You haven't left yet? I hope I get a return on my investment sooner rather than later.

MsgSummary: Londo asked you to give her regards to a guard called Rnal Libelus. You can find Rnal Libelus right next to the building in the center of Gliter.
MsgComplete: Hmm, Londo? Who's that? The name sounds familiar, but...anyway, don't think about making a fuss in Gliter.
MsgTake: Hey you, why don't you go to Gliter now? I don't think the jobs around here will really suit you anymore. If you go there, can you give my regards to a guard, Rnal Libelus? As far as I know, he's the strongest and most valorous warrior among the Vail. Knowing him will help you out considerably.
MsgIncomplete: There's nothing useful here anymore.

MsgSummary: Orta asked you to calm down foxes that became violent. You have to get rid of {c1}8 Rough Hair Tailfoxes{/c} and return to Orta in the Hunter camp. You can find the Rough Hair Tailfoxes in the west field of the Hunter camp.
MsgComplete:
Wasn't it difficult? I was was a bit worried, but it makes me glad to see that you've returned safely. Thanks. I'll take care of the rest myself. 
I hope Pantera will always bring good fortune your way.
MsgTake:
Ah, I'm lucky. I was looking for someone who can help me. If you are not busy, can you do me a favor?

I'm a Hunter taking care of the foxes. Foxes in Teos are just as sweet as the warm spring breeze. They are smart and apt to obey people...but as the war against the Union of Fury drags on, foxes, like other animals, seem to have been influenced. They have become noticeably more, so they ignore whatever Hunters say and randomly attack travelers passing by, as well as other things they shouldn't be attacking.

Now I think it's time to teach these foxes that lost their sweet nature a lesson, so can you help me? Hunting about 8 of them ought to drive the point home. Reducing the number of foxes as soon as possible is our top priority right now, so proceeding will be no problem for me, once you take out 8 foxes. I'll be waiting.
MsgIncomplete: Did you finish fox hunting?
MsgResponse4: Did you finish fox hunting?

MsgSummary: A wandering artist, Gelda, asked you to help her friend, Adein, who is in trouble. You have to find Adein, who is an artist staying in the Hunter camp.
MsgComplete: Who is this? Ah, you heard Gelda's story! Goddess bless her kind heart! I feel really lucky that you came here to help me...
MsgTake:
Before I make a song for you, can you give me some help? I have a friend who is in trouble, and I think you can help him.

His name is Adein. He's an amateur bard who obtained his first instrument only a little while ago. However, I was told he's now in trouble due to something related to that very instrument. Go get the story from him. If it's okay with you, can you give him some help?
MsgIncomplete: Did you find Adein?

MsgSummary: {c2}Kail{/c} told you to receive a reward that an archer can use from {c2}Letus Nilson{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Ah, it was you who killed the monsters near Cloron's Lair, right? I was already really curious about you. 
Ah, Mr. Kail said I had a reward for you, right? 
Great! I prepared something to give to you in case I met you. Hold on, please...

{c5}(Letus looks for something.){/c} 

Here it is! Take this.
This is the bow I adore the most among all the bows I have collected. I'll give this special bow to you. I look forward to great things from you, both now and in the future.
MsgTake:
Oh, I forgot, I didn't prepare a good reward for archers.
Oh, I don't want to bother you, but can you tell Letus I sent you and you want a reward?

I know Letus has a hobby of collecting good bows. She will give you a weapon suitable for you.
MsgWelcome: I'm Kail, Half-Elf and a local official of Keolloseu, and I'm half Elf. These days I'm studying the Human race.
MsgIncomplete: I'm Kail, a Half-Elf local official of Keolloseu, and I'm half Elf. These days I'm studying the Human race.

MsgSummary:
Capture {c1}Fedion Antelope{/c}, obtain {c3}5 Horns_of_antelope{/c} and return to Drunca.
You can find Fedion Antelope if you exit the village and follow the route towards the northwest.
MsgComplete: Wow, this is a neatly sliced horn. I guess you're not not just some amateur. You've been a great help; Now I can leave as scheduled. Here's your reward. Thanks.
MsgTake:
When you travel, you have to bring a weapon you can use to protect yourself. Heck, it's more important than any other item you might bring because you never know when bandits might come out of nowhere and attack you. But dammit, my favorite knife - the one I've had for years - broke after I fought with an Orc during my last journey. Hideous creatures, Orcs. Their skin is blunt and hard like steel. It's too bothersome to visit Doltin for him to fix it, so I'm gonna take care of this myself.

Oh, hey... do you think you could get me several antelope horns? I should be able to use them to fix my knife...or at least replace the broken parts. Hey, that could actually work!  I'll make a new knife, then I don't have to bother mending my broken knife. Oh, by the way, those antelope are a lot more violent than they look, so you'd better be careful. I'll give you a reward once you return.
MsgIncomplete: Did you collect all the antelope horns I need?
MsgResponse4: Did you collect all the antelope horns I need?

MsgSummary:
You have to hunt 10 Fedion Thief Monkeys and return to Claret in the farm.
You can find the Fedion Thief Monkey north of the village.
MsgComplete: Thanks so much! Let's see those monkeys try to come back and monkey around now!
MsgTake:
Nice to meet you, I'm Claret. I'm the owner of the local winery, where we make top quality wine using the grapes from the local farms. I personally inspect the grapes we have harvested and remove the ones that don't meet my standard of quality. Unfortunately, I have a new job these days... 
Recently, some of the crates we put grapes in have been smashed open overnight. We lost half a day's work because the grapes got crushed and dirty.  I wanted to figure out what's going on so I stood guard last night. Do you know what it was? Those damn Fedion Monkeys living above the farm did it! Lucky thing I was armed... I got to wallop them a bit. 
But now I have to clean up the mess those monkeys made, so I'm quite busy. Do you think you could help me out? Thanks, go and show them what a real nightmare is like!
MsgIncomplete: Did you get rid of those blasted Thief Monkeys?
MsgResponse4: Did you get rid of those blasted Thief Monkeys?

MsgSummary: You have to dispose of StoneHammer {c1}Dwarf Defense Guards{/c}, collect {c3}10 Dwarf Weapons{/c} and report back to Duster, the head man of Haldeck Farm. You can find Stonehammer Dwarves southeast of the farm.
MsgComplete: Good job. Hey, I could use some muscle like you around here...
MsgTake:
The relationship between Dwarves and Humans is as bad as the feelings between Elves and Orcs. Dwarves took advantage of a time when humans devoted themsElves to the war against the Union of Fury and laid claim to most of the mines humans were developing. Humans have fought against the Dwarves ever since. There are always exceptions, and among the Dwarves there is one unique Dwarf clan that maintains a good relationship with humans: the Silverhawk clan. Even though they are Dwarves, they are true friends, and they know what justice and righteousness are. Farin Silverhawk, a dwarf in the Silverhawk clan, is a good customer and stays at the farm. 

Not too long ago, I heard a rumor from another dwarf friend. Stonehammer Dwarves occupying the mine below our farm are planning to invade the village. These Stonehammer Dwarves have the worst relationship with the Silverhawk clan. Personally, I feel that an offense is the best defense. 

It would be absurd to think you could take down all the dwarves by yourself. Let's start by with binding their hands, y'know what I mean? I mean I want you to dispose of StoneHammer Dwarf Defense Guards and steal their weapons.
MsgIncomplete: Did you steal some of those Dwarves' weapons?
MsgResponse4: Did you steal some of those Dwarves' weapons?

MsgSummary:
You have to get rid of 5 StoneHammer Dwarf Miners and 5 StoneHammer Dwarf Skilled Masters and return to Duster of the Haldeck Farm.
You can find StoneHammer Dwarves southeast of the farm.
MsgComplete: My thanks for the excellent work, adventurer. You were a big help!
MsgTake:
Now that their hands are empty, they've gotta be pretty bewildered. Now is the best time to reduce their numbers, when they're scattered and unarmed. If we want to act, we should act swiftly and decisively.

Dispose of 5 StoneHammer Dwarf Miners and StoneHammer Dwarf Skilled Masters each and come back to me.
MsgIncomplete: Did you dispose of those StoneHammer Dwarves?
MsgResponse4: Did you dispose of those StoneHammer Dwarves?

MsgSummary: Drunca is trying to find out what's behind a rumor about Daisy, who works in the pub. You have to find Daisy's grandpa, the headman {c2}Duster{/c}, and listen to the story.
MsgComplete: Did Mr. Drunca ask you to do this? That rumor about Daisy? Hmm...
MsgTake:
Daisy is a hostess working in the pub. She's not only cheerful and bright, but also attentive in her job. I'm always so thankful that she's around.
However, there is a rumor goin' around about her these days. I hate rumors, but I have to know what's going on. The farm headman, Duster, is her grandpa. Please find Duster and look into it.
MsgIncomplete: Did you find Mr. Duster?

MsgSummary: The headman, Duster, asked you to get rid of {c1}5 Fedion Angry Nose Wild Boars{/c} that have been ruining the field. You can find Fedion Angry Nose Wild Boars south of the farm.
MsgComplete: These things are never easy, but I guess I should tell you. Now, I'm only gonna tell you becase it's Drunca who sent you. Actually, I thought I might go to Drunca and tell him myself, but things are so crazy around here...
MsgTake: If you want to hear the story, I need your help first. This is a prime time to harvest crops from our fields. But things are not going well because of the wild boars. I'd be grateful if you got rid of 5 Fedion Angry Nose Wild Boars for me.
MsgIncomplete: Did you get rid of those Fedion Angry Nose Wild Boars?
MsgResponse4: Did you get rid of those Fedion Angry Nose Wild Boars?

MsgSummary: You have to return to {c2}Drunca{/c} and tell him of Duster's story.
MsgComplete: Ah, did you find out the truth? Alright...I'm prepared to hear it.  {c5}(after listening to a whole story, he seems surprised.){/c} Wow. That wasn't at all what I expected. There must be more than one rumor floating around...
MsgTake:
Ok, about the rumor. Daisy...my daughter didn't give birth to Daisy. She doesn't have even one drop of my blood. I found her abandoned in a nearby glen, wrapped in a baby blanket. I felt so sorry for her, so I brought her home and raised her...  

There was a note with her that read 'I will come and find her someday'. I still have that note, and... well, it seems as though Daisy's real mother is going to return now.  But I don't think I can let her go! Daisy is my everything, the apple of my eye! 
Well...I guess the rumor is out. I hope Drunca won't treat Daisy differently after he learns the truth. *sigh* Well, I told you this because I hope Drunca isn't like that. 
I'm sure he's waiting, so go there and tell him my story.
MsgIncomplete: Have you told Drunca my story yet?

MsgSummary: You have to deliver a Drunca's Letter to {c2}Daisy{/c} working at a pub.
MsgComplete:
Hello! Welcome to the Pub! Are you thirsty? No? You have a something to give me?
{c5}(after reading the letter, Daisy's face goes pale.){/c}
This...this letter...
I knew I'd get a letter like this someday.
MsgTake: I have no choice. I didn't want to do this, but I have get to the bottom of this. Mr. Duster doesn't seem to know the rumor I know yet. {c5}(handing you a letter){/c} This is a letter to Daisy. Can you go to the pub and give this to her?
MsgIncomplete: Did you hand Daisy the letter I gave you?

MsgSummary: You should go to a {c2}Arktuis Village{/c} with Daisy's Letter and a her late mother's picture. You just might find someone who knows about Daisy's mother there.
MsgComplete: What's up? Are you looking for someone? What's this letter? {c5}(Tbon reads the letter, with eyes wide in astonishment){/c} Th...this... Hey, how is it possible you know this woman? How?!
MsgTake:
This rumor is totally ridiculous. I can endure silly rumors and gossip, but this is insulting! My late mother was NOT some whore! I had intended to figure out the truth on my own, before I got this note from Mr. Drunca. I have got to clear my mother from this false accusation! 
I learned that my late mother's birthplace was a seashore village, Arktuis Village, west of here. Here are a letter I wrote and a picture of my mother. I am sorry to bother you, but could you find someone who knows something about my mom in Arktuis Village and find out what kind of person she really was? I hope you will...and that you'll bring me some reassurance. I'll be waiting. Please...
MsgIncomplete: Did you find your way to Arktuis Village?

MsgSummary: Luckily the rumor Daisy has been worried about turned out to be false. Now go back to Haldeck Farm and deliver the story Tbon told you to {c2}Daisy{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Ah, I have been waiting for you! Did you find something?  {c5}(after hearing the story, her face brightens){/c} I knew it wasn't true! Oh, thank the Goddess. Now I can clear my mother of these false accusations. I'd like to give something to the person who set all this straight. Oh? He doesn't want to be known? Oh well. 
Thank you so much for all your work and traveling on my behalf. This is too small to be a real reward, but I hope you keep it. I really appreciate your help.
MsgTake:
{c5}(after reading a Daisy's Letter){/c} This girl is looking for her mother? Haldeck Farm? What on earth is this...? This woman...I...she... She used to be my wife! She and a stranger from somewhere else fell in love.  After five years of marriage, she left me.  They ran away with each other. Yes, I understand now. Haldeck Farm was the place where they escaped to... And what's this...they had a baby?
{c5}(after looking into the letter again){/c} Wait, what the heck is this?, 'whore'? That's just wrong! I'll kill anyone who says that!  She couldn't help who she fell in love with! ...even if it wasn't her husband. I nearly died from grief when she left. You can't imagine how much I was shocked when they ran away together, but no one has the right to say things like this! 
Now you go to this girl claiming to be her daughter and you tell her the truth. Tell her that her mother was a woman in love. You tell her that nasty rumor isn't the truth, but please don't tell her who I am. I have no idea why she is asking these questions now...now that her mother is dead. {c5}(his eyes well up){/c} If you're done with me, just be gone.
MsgIncomplete: You are not busy at all, are you? Why are you still here? Why won't you help?

MsgSummary: You have to deliver a Daisy's Letter to {c2}Drunca{/c}.
MsgTake: Oh! I almost forgot, Mr. Drunca also wanted to know the truth about this rumor. Let me get all this down. {c5}(after writing a short letter, she hands it to you){/c} Please give this to Mr. Drunca. I'm sure he's waiting. Please do this one last favor for me.
MsgIncomplete: Did you deliver my letter to Mr. Drunca?

MsgSummary: You have to capture a Sealakel named {c1}Madfisher{/c} in lake nearest to Nell's location and bring back an {c3}Ear of Madfisher{/c}.
MsgComplete: Hmm, is this is a Madfisher Ear? This ain't how their ears used to look. This looks like you removed it from a creature that's been dead for a few days. {c5}(frowing){/c} Ewww...gangrene...
MsgTake:
Greetings. I'm Nell Watersaga, I'm in the Willieoseu district for the water analysis. It's vitally important that we, as humans, keep track of our impact on our environment. Even the tiniest variation can have a lasting impact on nature. And we see seem to have some unexplained variations in the water lately. 
There are many bodies of water in the Willieoseu district. The lakes and waterways have been providing nutrition not only to people, but also to the forest trees and creatures living in this district. But recently, I've been tracking some contaminants in the lakes, things we haven't seen before. As a result, the quality of our water has degraded dramatically. Even more evidence of this is found in some of the creatures that live right on the water's edge... they have become violent and act strangely. 

I intend to capture these warped creatures and collect some specimens. This way, I can figure out what has been contaminating the lake. Can you help me? Please capture a Sealakel called "Madfisher" from the nearest lake and bring some part of its body. I'll be waiting.
MsgIncomplete: Did you capture the Madfisher?
MsgResponse4: Did you capture the Madfisher?

MsgSummary: You have to capture the antelope named {c1}Madhorn{/c} in the lake north of Nell and obtain a {c3}Fur of Madhorn{/c}, then give it to Nell.
MsgComplete: Is this the Madhorn Fur I was wanting? Hmm...it looks to have some notable discoloration. {c5}(after smelling it){/c} Oh my gawd! It reeks too... This will work for my research. You did a fine job.
MsgTake:
This poor Sealakel must have spent a lot of time in the water, never knowing that the water was contaminated. Was it violent? Sealakel never used to be so cruel, but looking at its transformed ear, I can easily discern its violent nature. Hmm... 
Do you think might head up toward the lake opposite to where Madfisher was? You'll find the antelope called Madhorn there. I'm certain they have also been influenced by the contaminated water. Please capture that antelope and bring back whatever you obtain.
MsgIncomplete: Did you capture the Madhorn?
MsgResponse4: Did you capture the Madhorn?

MsgSummary: The harpy named Madwing is inhabiting in the Saierfons lake in the west of Willieoseu. You have to capture the Madwing and obtain the Feathers of Harpy and give them to Nell.
MsgComplete: Are these really Harpy Feathers? Oh wow, I bet plucking a live chicken inside your house would be preferable to this. So, that lake is not so different from the rest, eh. Well, I have enough specimens now to proceed with my research. Thank you for your help.
MsgTake:
Oh, this poor antelope... I never realized how bad the water has been contaminated!  And we're drinking this water too! The source of this trouble cannot be natural, as this lake has been contaminated to the same degree as the last one. This makes me think that the Vail poisoned the lakes. Why are you looking at me like that? I don't think my conclusion is totally without merit.  I only hope that we can find out the cause soon. If we collect as many specimens as we can and study them, we should figure this out more quickly. 

Well, I'm afraid this might be a little longer than the previous trips. The big lake named Saierfons in the west of Willieoseu is next. I'm very concerned because there is a village near the lake and the people there use this lake. I hope the extent of the contamination is not as serious as I'm thinking, but considering two previous cases, it is very likely... Please get there quickly and find the harpy named Madwing. Please capture it and bring back what you obtain.
MsgIncomplete: Did you capture the Madwing?
MsgResponse4: Did you capture the Madwing?

MsgSummary:
You have to capture the Dwarf named {c1}Brud{/c} and obtain a {c3}Wine of Claret{/c} and give it to Claret.
You can find Brud in the StoneHammer Village southeast of village.
MsgComplete: Oh, thank the Goddess, you found it! Oh dear, was this all that was left? The wine is too good for me to give up, but I suppose that's it. We'll be more careful about not only monkeys, but also dwarves with expensive taste and no money. I appreciate your work, thank you!
MsgTake:
A little while ago, something occurred to me. I was so focused on the monkeys crushing my grapes that I wasn't thinking of all the possibilities. And now a box of wine has been stolen! The monkeys couldn't do that. I don't think uncle Kenneth has the time to deal with this all by himself. I'd better hire someone to stand guard. Anyway, what's more important is that a box full of my top quality wine is gone! In addition, I beleive the culprit is... the Dwarves! 

Makes sense, doesn't it? Dwarves do like alcohol... Oh dear, a dwarf drinking wine! I never thought they had that much class... imagine a gruff Dwarf luxuriously reclining with a glass of wine in its hand. Oh, sorry, I'm going off on tangents here. Well, I have to admit, at least they have excellent taste: they chose one of the best among so many boxes. 

Well, wine snob or not, they didn't pay for it! I'm not going to sit here and pretend nothing happened. Still... dwarves are awfully fond of alcohol...imagine if I could gain them as customers!  Oh, I'm doing it again, aren't I? Anyway, it's very likely they drank most of the wine already, but we've gotta do what we can.

The dwarf who stole it is so stupid, he dropped a letter with his signature as he stole away. That Dwarf's name is Brud. Please find Brud and whatever is left of my wine!
MsgIncomplete: Did you find my wine?
MsgResponse4: Did you find my wine?

MsgSummary: You have to take down {c1}Crom Stonehammer{/c}, obtain the {c3}Plans of StoneHammer{/c} and give it to Farin Silverhawk. You can find Crom Stonehammer in the Stonehammer Mine.
MsgComplete: {c5}(laughing broadly){/c} Hahahaha...! Good, very good!! I'll treat you to a cold tankard of beer someday! A Dwarf never forgets a promise...nor a beer. Now those Stonehammer scoundrels will be at a loss for the time being. You did an excellent job, I appeciate it.
MsgTake:
I am called Farin Silverhawk and I'm from the Silverhawk clan. I came to Haldeck Farm to keep my eye on the Stonehammer clan. We, the Silverhawk clan, formed a union with humans, but not the other dwarves. Those Stonehammer villains are very bad-tempered and are likely to invade us at any time. This small village can be devastated very easily, so standing guard is unavoidable. 

I got an important bit of information a little while ago from Duster; honestly, I have no idea where that old man gets these stories.  He said that the newest chief of the Stonehammer clan is planning to invade the Haldeck Farm! The devil's name is Crom. I've been looking forward to taking care of this villain for some time now, gwahaha! The problem is, my hammer was broken when I was fighting with Orcs last week and I haven't been able to get it fixed.

That's why I'm telling you this. My friend, can you sneak into the stonehammer mine, get rid of Crom, and steal the invasion plans for me? I know your skills are no match for mine, but I guess I'll have to trust you on this one! I wish you good luck in your fight!
MsgIncomplete: Did you take down Crom and get the plans yet?
MsgResponse4: Did you take down Crom and get the plans yet?

MsgSummary: You have to get a letter inquiring after Agatha's health from Duster and deliver it to Agatha. If you keep following the western route from Haldech Farm, you can find Arktuis Village at the seashore. Agatha is a warehouse keeper of the village.
MsgComplete:
Hmm? Who are you? You don't look familiar, are you an outsider? {c5}(after receiving a letter){/c} Aha, you're running an errand for old man Duster, eh? He could come here and talk to me in person if he wanted to, that silly old coot. Well, actually, both he and I are quite old. Nowadays, I don't walk around too much because of my arthritis, so I guess I can't blame him for not coming. Anyway, thanks for his letter. I can take care of the reply, so don't worry about it.

Hey, this is your first time in the village, right? Oh, good! Hey, I was looking for someone to run an errand for me. All the young guys in this village are all so lazy, those damn loafers! But you're looking for a job, right? Then help this old woman out.
MsgTake:
Youngster, if you're on your way out of the village, can you do me a favor? If you go to the west, you will find a village on the seashore called Arktuis Village. It used to be crowded with people, but the place is practically a ghost town now. You'd better keep your peepers open when you arrive there... Ah, I nearly forgot to ask you my favor! I must be gettin' old!

{c5}(handing you a letter){/c} Please give this letter to an older lady named Agatha living in Arktuis Village. There is nothing special about this letter. It's just a short letter inquiring after her health. The older I get, the more difficult it is for me to get out there. So, we write letters back and forth these days.  Please make sure she gets my letter. Plus, y'know, you can find a lot of jobs there... I mean, if you are looking for a job. I wish you a safe journey, youngster!
MsgIncomplete: Did you get that letter to Agatha?

MsgSummary:
You have to capture {c1}Crazy Crying Gargoyles{/c}, collect {c3}7 Congealed Magic Stones{/c}, and give them to the Elven magician, Creath.
You can find the Crazy Crying Gargoyles near Creath's house.
MsgComplete: Hmmm. {c5}(after examining a fragment for a long time){/c} It appears to be a stone fragment possessing similar qualities to my magic stone. It is now clear there is some kind of relationship between Gargoyles and magic stones. This is compelling evidence...{c5}(giving you a reward){/c} You did good work.  And hey, sorry about that whole "clicking" thing.
MsgTake:
Hey! Did you just CLICK on me?  What the hell? Who do you think you are, coming around here, clicking on anyone at your leisure?! How rude! I should click you for a while, see how you like it!

Wait, don't run away. I'm looking for someone who will do something for me. Don't run away from me, just come here. I won't click on you, I promise.

I'm studying that stone in front of my house. Do you want to know what it is? It is a magic stone, enchanted by the ancient letter inscribed on it. I thought the magic in that stone was sealed. But by studying it, I beleive that it is still influencing the creatures nearby. It seems to have seriously effected the gargoyles living nearby. My guess is that the violent disposition of gargoyles is being governed by this magic stone.

Of course this is still just my theory. In order to prove this theory, I need evidence that can support the theory. If my theory is correct, we can find the material evidence from the gargoyles. This is the part where I need your help. Could you bring me what you obtain after you capture a few Crazy Crying Gargoyles? 
I guarantee you will get a reward. And I won't click you. What do you say? Do you want to try?
MsgIncomplete: What is it with you and the clicking? Get to work!
MsgResponse4: Stop clicking on me! Do some work, you slacker.

MsgSummary: You have to capture a Fedion Golem Trainer and give an obtained Broken Piece of Stone to {c2}Creath{/c}, an Elven magician. Creath is living alone in his magician's house.
MsgComplete: {c5}(staring fixedly at you){/c} ...Is your hobby disturbing someone else's meditation? If so, you're too cruel! What is wrong with you? Why would you click on a person absorbed in meditation? Hmm?
MsgTake: {c5}(There are illegible letters engraved on the small stone fragment. That little boy, Pierre Weber, who you met in Haldeck, flashes into your memory. He said... 'There is a strange Elf living outside of village.' You think this stone fragment might help the 'strange Elf'. It might be a good idea for you to give it to him.){/c}

MsgSummary:
You have to hunt the {c1}Fedion Magic Golem{/c} and collect {c3}5 Pieces of Magic Stone{/c} and give them to Creath.
You can find the Fedion Magic Golem north of Creath's house.
MsgComplete: Hmm, is this all you collected? I guess clicking on golems isn't as easy as clicking old Elves, eh? Well, this will be good enough for the experiment. Well done. {c5}(after counting money and putting it inside a small pouch, he hands it to you){/c} Your reward. Now go. I hope you give up on your mad tendencies to impulsively click on people.
MsgTake:
{c5}(glaring at you){/c}I had just nearly remembered how to write an ancient rune... a particularly difficult one, and now I forgot it again thanks to you and your clicking. {c5}(exhaling a sigh){/c} Why have you come... you and your clicking? Hmm, what's this?

{c5}(examining the stone fragment for a long time){/c} ...Hmm, interesting. This writing seems to be similar to the engravings on the magic stone I'm studying. Where did you find this? Hey, can you get some more similar to this? Once you do, I'll pretend that I have acceptted your apology for disturbing my meditation. Oh fine, I'll give you a reward too. I'll be waiting.
MsgIncomplete: Quit clicking and get working!
MsgResponse4: Will you stop clicking me and get the job done??

MsgSummary: You have to deliver a Fruit Box to {c2}Vanessa{/c} at the pub on behalf of Agatha.
MsgComplete: Welcome to the pub! {c5}(looking at a fruits box){/c} Oh, Grammy Agatha sent this? This is so thoughtful. I was just thinking about making a fruit wine... how did she know? Your timing couldn't be better. Please tell grandma I'm really grateful! Oof, this is really heavy. You must have lost 5 pounds in sweat lugging this over here. Thanks. Please stop by for a cup of wine after it matures!
MsgTake:
{c5}(pointing at a box next to her){/c} This is fruit that Duster, that old man, sent a few days ago. He packed it to overflowing because, according to him, this was the best crop all year. Fruit gives me gas, so I won't eat it. I'd intended to get the fruit to Vanessa so she can make fruit wine.

The problem is, this box is incredibly heavy. There is no way an old woman like me can deal with it... but an energetic youngster like yourself could hanlde this errand easily! 

Vanessa is the girl working at the pub. The pub is not far from here, really. Please take this and give it to Vanessa. I know she wants to make some fruit wine, so she'll like this for sure. Don't forget to tell her I sent it! I'm counting on you.
MsgIncomplete: Did you get that fruit box to Vanessa?

MsgSummary: Listen to what the owner of the pub, Vanessa, is talking about and find the headman of Arktuis Village, {c2}Claude{/c}.
MsgComplete: Did you hear about me from Vanessa? This is great news; we desperately need help from travelers who know a thing or two about fighting, such as yourself. Boy, do I have a job for you!
MsgTake:
You figured this lovely seaside town would be crowded with people, didn't you? Well traveler, you're considerably out of touch, aren't you? Yes, this village used to be much better. There were days when this place was full of people passing through all the time. But, as you can see, now there's nothing but villagers here. We rarely have any visitors from the outside anymore. 
Nowadays, this place is pretty lonely. Well, I don't care if there are many customers or not. I just hope a cup of rum at this small shop can be a comfort to villagers in times of hardship, and a sweet rest to travelers who stumble into this lonesome village.

Oh, my bad. I didn't mean to bore you with a longwinded, dull story. You must have dozed off there.

{c5}(Vanessa is beautiful and has an unbelievably fascinating smile){/c}
If you are a traveler, I assume you're looking for a job, right? Unfortunately, I have no money to pass out, but the headman, Claude will likely have some kind of job he can give you. He lives alone in the house above, so find him when you have time. But for now, your glass is empty. I'd be happy to fill it... but if you are not going to drink anymore, why don't you go and find Claude now?
MsgIncomplete: Did you find Mr. Claude?

QuestName: Wyverns, Eggs, and the Water's Edge
MsgSummary:
You have to hunt {c1}Maelstorm Wyvern{/c}, collect {c3}5 Wyvern Eggs{/c}, and give them to the headman, Claude.
You were told wyverns appear frequently on the seashore a short way from the village.
MsgComplete: Ah, the Wyvern Eggs. What's this sticky stuff on the eggs? Eww. Anyway, breaking these eggs will give us some time to fight back. Thanks, traveler. Is this a good reward? {c5}(You can feel the moneybag is heavy.){/c} Feel free to swing by again. Bon voyage~
MsgTake:
The reason why this village has been so devastated is that wyverns constantly attack the village. Many people lost their families due to the wyverns. I'm one of those people. I lost my wife and daughter because of those disgusting monsters...{c5}(looks melancholy for a moment){/c} Most of the villagers have left due to the sorrow and fear. And visitors, well...people from the outside don't come here too often anymore. The rest of our people are fighting against the wyverns, but it's a losing battle. We're fishermen and sailors, not warriors. 

That's why we desperately need help from people like you. Will you help us? I figure this is the kind of thing you might be good at.

The place where wyverns appear most frequently is the seashore, a short way off from the village. Please capture a mother wyvern and bring back some Wyvern Eggs. I hope that breaking these eggs will delay their reproduction speed considerably. That should buy us some time to fight. I guarantee your reward will not be dissapointing. I'm counting on you!
MsgIncomplete: Did you bring some Wyvern Eggs?
MsgResponse4: Did you bring some Wyvern Eggs?

MsgSummary: You have to buy a medicine from Rochen as Salmon's errand.
MsgComplete: Come on in, are you a customer? {c5}(after listening to the story about Salmon's favor, slightly frowning){/c} Mr. Salmon? I don't sell my stuff to him...
MsgTake:
You there. You seem to have plenty of time on your hands. Can you do me a favor?

There's a certain medicine that I need. Please go to Rochen and buy it for me. You need money? I'll give you some cash. {c5}(You receive a moneybag.){/c} This is my medicine. I need it, so please come back soon.
MsgIncomplete: Did you buy the medicine I requested?

MsgSummary: You have to give a medicine you bought from Rosen to {c2}Salmon{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Ah, Thanks. Did Rochen nag you? That girl is too young to be so damned serious. How will she ever attract a husband? I'm really worried about her. 

All she does all day long is daydream or lecture her customers. She is a kind woman, but no one wants to hear her self-righteous blatherings. We all just let it go in one ear and out at the other.

Poor Rochen.  Anyway, thanks. I'll call you later if something comes up.
MsgTake:
But you are not Mr. Salmon, so I can't confirm that he will receive it. It's not right or fair. Besides, he likely doesn't need this. He's a devious one, he is. I'm sure that Mr. Salmon would have no problem catching fish with his forked tongue instead of a fishing pole. He can be so dishonest... but I know he won't let up. Please, just buy whatever he requested and tell him to use other shops from now on. I'll never ever sell anything to him again. 

Browse what I'm selling, you'll find what he requested. Please buy it and give it to Mr. Salmon, then take care. I hope you'll not come here on his behalf again.
MsgIncomplete: You already obtained the medicine you need. Why don't you just go?

MsgSummary: Find the lonely {c2}Oten{/c}, the maker of the leaflet. You can find him somewhere inside of Arktuis Village.
MsgComplete:
My request led you to come here! However, before we proceed, there is one thing I'm curious about... Are you single or seeing someone? Don't laugh, this is a very important matter to me.
<I'm single...struggling against the loneliness just like you.><I'm seeing someone. My life is at the climax of the happiness.>
MsgTake:
{c5}(There is one leaflet written in clumsy handwritting on the noticeboard){/c} "Lonely, cold breezes blow across this village and across my heart. The emptiness I feel inside matches the desolation of this village. This tiny existence has no purpose...but to find YOU. So now I write my dreams on this piece of paper. Find me and you will find comfort with another. Heal my lonely heart and I will reward you.
Signed : Lonely Oten"

MsgSummary: You have to decide one among three women lonely Oten is interested in order to arrange a match between this woman and him. The three women are: a woman who looks kind, a woman most glamorous, and a woman who looks healthy. You have to make a {c4}firm decision{/c} and tell him.
MsgComplete:
Ah, did you make a decision? Then which woman...?

<A woman who looks kind><A glamorous woman><A woman who looks healthy>
MsgTake:
I'm so lucky. You're in the same situation! You can fully understand my loneliness, right? The weather is getting colder, I have no one to warm my heart. How tragic it is! Since early times, a person living alone has been unable to feel real happiness, but two people living together can taste real happiness and experience the golden age of life... 

Oh dear, I'm talking nonsense. Sorry. My request is just to find a girl who suits me well. Every time I'm in front of women, I get tongue-tied and my face goes red.... Luckily, there are 3 women I'm currently interested in. Please pick one of them. I hope you pick the girl of my heart's true wish.

The three women are; a woman who looks kind, a woman most glamorous, and a woman who looks healthy. Consider this for a while. After you make a decision about which one you'll meet, come see me again.

MsgSummary: You have to get rid of {c1}3 Grimaxe Orc Thieves{/c} who messed up the leaflet lonely Oten put on the noticeboard at the entrance of the village and return to Oten.
MsgComplete: It's already over? And you didn't get hurt, either. I thought you'd at least lose a limb! ...No, nothing... You must be very powerful. Fine, I'll give you a reward now that you completed my favor. Now... please go and leave me to my solitude.
MsgTake:
...You must be happy. I don't mean to be, but I feel a bit jealous! It is not easy to request this of a person like you... but I will give you a job. 

There is a noticeboard on which I put a leaflet at the entrance of village. These days, there are Orcs rampaging around the entrance of village, so not only do people get hurt, but also a very precious leaflet on that noticeboard is being torn apart frequently. Every time this happens, I have to compose my message all over again. You know...relive the pain of my lonliness. It's not as easy as it might sound. 

...so please get rid of these Orcs. Can you do this? I know you are seeing someone, and I wouldn't want that someone to feel as lonely as I do...{c5}(he looks cross and mumbles to himself){/c} Anyway, you have to do this! Help me!
MsgIncomplete: Did you get rid of those mean Orcs?
MsgResponse4: Did you get rid of those mean Orcs?

MsgSummary: You made a decision to arrange match between Oten and a kind girl. Get the letter from Oten and give it to the kind {c2}Rosen{/c}. You can find her near the warehouse keeper, Agatha.
MsgComplete: What brought you here? Is there something you need? Oh, really? You brought a letter for me? I wonder what kind of letter it is... {c5}(carefully opening the letter, she reads it.){/c}
MsgTake:
I do like a kind woman. Yes, I agree. The most important thing about a woman is a kind heart. 
You have an excellent view of womanhood. You are very wise.

Rosen is a kind woman. She works with the warehouse keeper, Agatha. She's always standing near Agatha whenever I see her. Hmm, if she is Agatha's granddaughter, I might be worried. I hope she will not nag me like Agatha does.

Please hand my letter to her. I hope you come back with a good answer. I'll be waiting.
MsgIncomplete: Did you hand my letter to her? What did she say?

MsgSummary: You have to hand a Rosen's Letter to lonely {c2}Oten{/c}.
MsgTake:
{c5}(after reading the letter completely){/c} I'm really flattered that he likes me. A relationship...hmm.  Then I would like to ask him for a favor. I just want to know if he is trustworthy or not.

I think the most important thing about a man is sincerity. I think he should be kind enough to help people in trouble too, so what I want to ask of him is... I have a job which requires me to go to Haldech Farm. This job is to buy a crate of olive oil from Olio, running the oil factory. It is very far away from here and I have to carry the heavy box back. This is too stressful, so I was thinking about hiring someone to help. 

{c5}(handing you a letter){/c} If you don't mind, can you ask him to do this for me? Tell him if he is sincere enough to do this task, I'll be happy to date him.
MsgIncomplete: Did you hand my letter to Oten?

MsgSummary:
You decided to arrange match between Oten and a glamorous woman. Get lonely Oten's letter and take it to the glamorous {c2}Rotico{/c}.
You can find her at the pub Vanessa runs.
MsgComplete: Come on in, what would you like to order? {c5}(looking at a letter){/c} Hmm? A letter for me? Haha, my charm never disappoints me! Let me take a look.
MsgTake:
I do like a glamorous woman. The most important thing about woman is a beautiful face and a hot body. You have a manly view of womanhood. I like your taste.

A glamorous woman is working at Vanessa's pub. I have seen her whenever I go to the pub. Do you think she is a Vanessa's sister?  It doesn't matter who she is as long as she is beautiful.

Please hand my letter to her. I hope you return with good news. I'll be waiting~
MsgIncomplete: Did you hand my letter to her? What did she say?

MsgSummary: Glamorous Rotico turned down lonely Oten's courtship. You have to return to lonely {c2}Oten{/c} and tell the story.
MsgComplete:
You came back! You have good news, right?

{c5}(after listening to the story, he looks disappointed){/c} I'm not surprised. I assumed she'd prefer a beefy type of guy. Hmm, well then...{c5}(clenching his fist){/c} I know how to deal with a situation like this! I'm sorry but can I ask you one more thing? I know the secret of how to win her heart!
MsgTake:
{c5}(after reading a whole letter, she sighs){/c} This man, Oten? I have seen him a couple of times at the shop, but I'm sorry, I am not remotely attracted to him. I'm not interested in a skinny guy like him. {c5}(with a soft voice){/c} To be blunt, how can a man like him satify a woman like me?

I like an attractive, muscular man who can captivate my heart and hold me tight. You know, someone who can give me super satisfaction. That's why I'm turning him down. I feel sort of bad, but the heart wants what it wants and I won't settle.
MsgIncomplete: Didn't I tell you I'm not interested?

MsgSummary: You have to get rid of {c1}Swordtail Sealakel Wizards{/c}, collect {c3}5 Eyes of Sealakel{/c} and give them to the glamorous woman as a present. You can find Swordtail Sealakel Wizards on the seashore south of the village.
MsgComplete: Oh, my. Weren't you just in here a little while ago? Hey, I told you that I couldn't like a skinny little man like...hmm? What is this? A present from him?
MsgTake:
There are plenty of medicines for activating sexual functions in this world, but even without that kind of medicine, we can get a similar effect from our environment too. You'd call it...a folk remedy, I suppose. Anyway, this kind of thing can have a better effect than medicine somethimes. 

I heard this story from a peddler passing by the village. According to him, boiled Sealakel's eye is the best! So, I'm planning to obtain it and give it to her as a present. Of course, I know nothing about handling weapons or stuff like that, so I'll leave this part up to you, my hero. Ha ha~

If you go down a bit south of the village, you'll find Sealakels along the seashore. Please obtain enough Eyes of Sealakel and give them to her as a present from me. I look forward to good news from you.
MsgIncomplete: Did you give her those Sealakel Eyes yet?

MsgSummary: You have to deliver a Letter of Rotico to lonely {c2}Oten{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Did you give those Sealakel Eyes? What did she say? {c5}(after reading a note, with a satisfied look){/c} I knew it! Women are weak in the face of a thoughtfully-presented gift! Ah, this worked very well. Being well-informed in advance really paid off!
I appreciate your hard work. I hope you will be satisfied with this reward. I'll look for you if something comes up again.
MsgTake:
What in the world is this? These are Sealakel Eyes, aren't they? And they're very fresh, too. I'm sure they'll be wonderful if I boil them. {c5}(with a gentle smile){/c} He got me a very rare thing. He seems like much better person than he looks.

Well, I'll take this most gracious present. Please take him this note, and tell him I'd like to see him...at least, I'd like to meet him in my spare moments from the busy pub.
MsgIncomplete: Are you still here?

MsgSummary:
You decided to arrange match between Oten and the healthy woman. Take lonely Oten's letter to the healthy {c2}Laura{/c}.
You can find her near Mr. Bonito on the beach.
MsgComplete: Did you come for fresh fish? Hmm? A letter for me? I didn't think anybody would bring a letter for me...{c5}(she rips open the letter and reads it.){/c}
MsgTake:
I do like a healthy woman, don't I? Yes. The most important thing about a woman is her health. She must be able to handle housework promptly and give birth to babies without any problems! 
You have a discerning view of womanhood. You are wise.

A healthy woman is working with the fisherman, Mr. Salmon. When night falls, Mr. Salmon's ship will return and she'll be there.

Please hand my letter to her. I hope you come back with good news. I'll be waiting.
MsgIncomplete: Didn't you go back yet?

MsgSummary: You have to give the muscle-building food the healthy woman gave you to cheer up lonely {c2}Oten{c2}.
MsgTake:
...this is a courtship letter, isn't it? {c5}(exhaling a sigh){/c} what can I do? I already have a someone in mind, and it's not Oten. I'm sorry, but I'm going to pretend like I didn't hear anything. 

You want to know who I like? Fine, I'll tell you. He is a blacksmith, Mr. Doltin. Tan skin and muscles... He is absolutely gorgeous. I shudder at the mere thought of his body. Real men ought to have muscles. Every man who doesn't make an effort to work their muscles is committing a sin of omission!

Oh, I know who Oten is! I have seen him a couple of times somewhere, but, oh my, he's way too skinny. {c5}(with a concerned voice){/c} I'm afraid no woman will be ever interested in a person like him. You know, I have some muscle building food... I might not like Oten, but if he takes this, some other woman might. Please give this to him. I reject his advances, but I hope he takes this present.
MsgIncomplete: Did you give him the stuff I gave you?

MsgSummary: The drunkard Wilon you met in the village asked you to bring liquor. You have to find {c2}Adam{/c} working at the pub.
MsgComplete: Ah, a customer~ Please take a seat. I'll be right with you. Hmm? Whose favor? {c5}(frowning slightly){/c} Wilon is at his wit's end. I'm really worried about the poor guy.
MsgTake:
{c5}(mumbles something to himself continuously){/c} Luggage...I got no ship to unload luggage off of... Why doesn't even one ship -hiccup- come to... the harbor...? I ate lunch and I'm waitin' now....Hiccup! If I got paid -hiccup- I said I'll stand at the bar... drink at the pub... get nice and plastered tonight! ...I get it, those annoying -hiccup- disgusting wyverns...wyverns destroyed all ships! Destroyed my luggage... killed my daily wage!

{c5}(raising his head and glaring at you){/c} ...What? Who are you?! Hiccup- you're a greenhorn.  Wet behind the... No, dry behind the ears! -hiccup- Don't glare at me like that...! 
You wanna help? Run and bring me my liquor! Chop chop! With lightning speed! -hiccup-  
Adam...Adam; rebuke him! That dude took my liquor -hiccup- my liquor!
MsgIncomplete: You bastard -hiccup- are you still here?!!

MsgSummary: You have to capture a {c1}Saierfons Watcher{/c}, obtain {c3}3 Tears of Beholder{/c}, and give them to Adam. The Saierfons Watcher is inhabiting near the Saierfons Lake north of the village.
MsgComplete: Ah, you have returned. You didn't get hurt, did you? I was worried about you. I thought I might have asked too much of you, but you came back safely. Poor Wilon, I hope he sobers up and comes to his senses.
MsgTake:
He needs to sober up, but if I don't give him liquor, he'll just come here and mess up everything. I have no choice. Oh man, we have only one bottle of Lajarr left. It's Wilon's favorite. I guess I'll have to make a new one... Hey, can you bring the ingredients for Lajarr instead of taking my last bottle? I wanna take care of the local bruddahs, but we have to do our business too. 

We can obtain all ingredients for Lajarr on our own very easily except one ingredient. It's a poison called 'Tears of Beholder.' You can obtain this if you hunt the Saierfons Watcher that inhabit the Saierfons Lake. I used to get this stuff on my own, but I'm way too busy now. And the creatures around the lake, including the Saierfons Watcher, have gotten nastier. So please be careful. 

Please could you bring back 3 Tears of Beholder? This poison has a pretty high concentration, so this amount will be good enough to make about 15 full bottles. I already dipped the water out of the lake and stored it, so all I have to do is dilute that ingredient with the water and mix it with other ingredients and distill it. I'll be waiting.
MsgIncomplete: Did you bring all Tears of Beholders?
MsgResponse4: Did you bring all Tears of Beholders?

MsgSummary: You have to deliver a {c3}Lajarr{/c} Adam gave you to{c2}Wilon{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Drink!! Give me a drink! -hiccup!- {c5}(snatching the Lajarr with a trembling hand){/c} Why did it take so long? You -hicuup!- hate me, don't you!
{c5}(Wilon uncorks bottle and gulps. He listens to you tell him Adam's story then waves and looks annoyed){/c} Don't disturb me while I'm drinking!  Go away! Just disappear. -hiccup- What's the big deal? Just one bottle of liquor... -hiccup- I don't care about Adam or Vanessa...! I'm going to keep drinking my booze. -hiccup- Just go away!
MsgTake:
You brought good quality ingredients. I figure I can create fine Lajarr with this. Thank you very much. Ah, the reward. Yeah, you won't get a reward from Wilon, so I will give you his share as well.

Well, please give this Lajarr to Wilon. He'll be pretty impatient by now. Of course he'll be waiting for the booze, not for you. Please tell him Vanessa and I are very concerned about him, and he should stop drinking and think about getting a new job. Vanessa still needs workers... well, I don't know if he will listen or not. Anyway thanks.
MsgIncomplete: Did you get that Lajarr to Wilon?
MsgResponse4: Did you get that Lajarr to Wilon?

MsgSummary:
Adam told you to find Matilda, a medicine merchant, in the seashore market and deliver a message to her. 
The White Sand Harbor is located in the far south of the village.
MsgComplete:
Come on in. How can I help you? Oh, Adam sent you? How diligent he is... He sends someone here once a week. His earnestness is truly admirable, but, I don't think I can give him the answer he is looking for. {c5}(Smiling){/c} Do you want to take him back a {c5}Letter from Matilda{/c}? Or, will you do me a favor instead? It is your decision... 

<I have to keep the promise. I'll take your reply and go back.><I feel comfortable now that I see your smile. I'll do the favor you ask of me.>
MsgTake:
Hey, have you ever stopped by the White Sand Harbor over there to the south? You can meet dozens of people and see hundreds of items! Of course, the most stunning thing you'll see is Ms. Matilda. 

Ms. Matilda is a girl selling handmade medicines at the seashore market. She is so amazingly sweet and kind to everybody. Not to mention how lovely she is. That's why everybody calls her 'Kind Matilda.' To be honest, I don't think you'll find a guy who isn't in love with Matilda. She is so attractive, and sweet, and kind, and...

Anyway... Can... Will you find Ms. Matilda and deliver message to her? I'm so busy with work at the pub that I can't visit her. I hope you deliver my message, and return with a kind reply. I'm counting on you.
MsgIncomplete: Did you deliver my message to Ms. Matilda?

MsgSummary: You have to take the {c5}Letter from Matilda{/c} and give it to {c2}Adam{/c} in Arktuis Village.
MsgComplete:
Oh! You have come back far earlier than I expected!
{c5}(he reads the letter and lets out a sigh){/c} It didn't work...again. Oh my sweet Matilda. The distance that seperates our hearts is shorter than she thinks...
But! {c5}(clenching his fist){/c} I don't know the meaning of 'quit'! This time may have been the 97th, but maybe she will give in to my dogged determination the 98th, or 99th time! 

Don't look glum! I will persevere! Let's cheer up!

I'll get someone else to keep delivering my messages until I can see her myself. I'm so thankful for what you have done. I wish you safe travels.
MsgTake:
You value the promises you make as much as your life. Your earnestness is admirable. That means I must also answer honestly.
{c5}(writing down a short letter and handing it to you){/c} This is my reply to Mr. Adam. My guess is that he'll be expecting its contents, since it certainly isn't the first time he's seen it. Please tell him that I would like to have a person like Mr. Adam in my life, but we're too busy, and too far apart. I feel bad that I must refuse him... and... and I hope that he meets someone who's right for him.

Honest and devoted adventurer, I hope you always keep such a beautiful outlook in life. Farewell.
MsgIncomplete: Did you deliver my letter to Mr. Adam?

MsgSummary: You have to capture {c1}Willieoseu Leopard{/c} and collect {c3}3 Leopard Livers{/c}, very effective for maintaining one's skin's elasticity, and give them to Matilda. You can find the Willieoseu Leopard near the Goblin habitat east of the market.
MsgComplete:
You found it!  And...wow, that certainly looks (and smells) very fresh. Your hunting skills are excellent. I can't find even one scratch on this liver. I really appreciate your work.
Now, I'd better worry about the perfect recipe too. I don't want to waste this wonderful ingredient. I look forward to seeing you again, thank you.
MsgTake:
You never turn down people asking favors, do you? You're so kind. I'll give Mr. Adam a reply by a different method, so you don't need to worry.

Once a woman gets older than 30 years, she has to watch for lines on her face. Oh, the trials of being a woman! I'm very careful with my skin. What I'm really worried about is the elasticity of my skin. It used to be that, if I pressed my cheek, it would bounce back beautifully. Not so anymore.

So I checked for remedies. I found that the liver of the Willieoseu Leopard is highly effective for restoring skin elasticity. I was thinking that I'd ask this favor of someone who came to help. I'm very lucky that you came along when you did. Can you capture a leopard and bring back a fresh liver? I'll give you a reward.
MsgIncomplete: A woman's skin is a liver-die situation~
MsgResponse4: A woman's skin is a liver-die situation~

MsgSummary:
You have to get rid of {c1}5 Swordtail Sealakel Fighters{/c} and return to Bonito.
{c1}Swordtail Sealakel Family{/c} is inhabiting the southern seashore.
MsgComplete: Oh, yes! You've returned. Given you don't have even one scratch on your body, those Sealakel rascals were just a piece of cake, weren't they? Hu hu, Great!
MsgTake:
Fishermen like us eke out a living day by day by catching fish. However, these days the misbehavior of those rascally Sealakels is just too much. They're driving me crazy~

Maybe they are fighting for their territory or whatever, but they frequently attack fishing boats randomly, so we can't even catch one fish. We just barely escape with our lives. This happens almost every day! They are absolutely fierce and arbitrarily violent, so it is not an easy task to cope with them. In addition, we are already in trouble. We villagers almost quit our business due to that annoying wyvern. If we can't fish either, it would be a devastating blow to our livelihoods.

Judging by your look, you don't seem like an ordinary traveler. You to be pretty good in a fight. That's why I'm asking this of you. Can you please lay into those Sealakel rascals? Please beat up the Swordtail Sealakel Fighters; they the fiercest and most violent of the bunch.
MsgIncomplete: Did you tear up those Sealakels and have them for dinner, eh?
MsgResponse4: Did you tear up those Sealakels and have them for dinner, eh?

MsgSummary:
You have to get rid of {c1}5 Swordtail Sealakel Disorderlies{/c}? and return to {c2}Bonito{/c}.
The {c1}Swordtail Sealakel Family{/c} is inhabiting the southern seashore.
MsgComplete:
Thank the Goddess, you returned safely again! I don't know how to thank you.
Actually a little while ago, I got one important piece of information and I've been wanting to let you know about it. As it turns out, we've tracked down the Sealakels' boss!
MsgTake:
Actually, I thought about asking you to sweep away all the Sealakels at once, but I didn't know how much power you have. so what you have done was just a simple test. It appears that I must have underestimated you. I apologize, hu hu.

If you have power enough to take care of them so easily like that, it will be a piece of cake for you to take down several Disorderlies.
