Everybody working as fishermen in the village feels thankful for what you have done. Although we can't make a dash at their base directly like you, don't forget we're cheering you up from behind.

It is very likely that Sealakel Disorderlies will be more fierce and violent than ever this time, so you should keep your eyes wide open. you know...if you get a serious injury from this, I pray that Etain will keep her eyes on your fighting.
MsgIncomplete: Did you get rid of some Sealakel Disorderlies?
MsgResponse4: Did you get rid of some Sealakel Disorderlies?

MsgSummary:
You have to get rid of the Swordtail Sealakel Family's boss ,{c1}Elder Dempnun{/c}, and return to {c2}Bonito{/c}.
You can find the {c1}Elder Dempnun{/c} inside of the Sealakels' habitat.
MsgComplete:
You finished Dempnun off?
HaHaHaHa~{c5}(after laughing broadly){/c}

Really thank you!
I'll never forget what you have done for our village.
Thanks to you, many people's lives have been saved , and now they'll be able to do fishing safely.
I appreciate your help again on behalf of them.
This is a token of our mind,,please accept it...!
MsgTake:
I was told the name of boss is Dempnun.
Although this Sealakel is not more than a mere fish, it has considerably high intelligence and control compared to other Sealakels.

In addition, sometimes travelers passing by are possessed and killed by its unknown ability and become Sealakel food.
I guess that explains bizarrely eaten corpses discovered near the seashore these few weeks. Indeed, these accidents have happened due to this monster... It has done it....!

Anyway, disposing of this Dempnun ASAP will be a great boon to fishers, other villagers, and travelers.
Surely you also think so, don't you?
Please let us borrow your power for the last time!
MsgIncomplete: Did you dispose of Dempnun?
MsgResponse4: Did you dispose of Dempnun?

MsgSummary: You have to receive a Letter from Claude and deliver it to a weapon merchant, Craig, in the seashore market. You can find the seashore market inside the forest if you follow the route toward south from the village.
MsgComplete: Did you come here to buy something? {c5}(after looking at a letter){/c} Ah, Mr. Claude sent you here, right? I guess I can trust your skill now that he recommended you for this job. What you have to do is simple.
MsgTake:
Ah, You made a timely appearance. I have been looking for a person who will deliver a letter to the seashore market. I guess you are trustworthy enough to handle this.

The person who will receive a letter is a weapon merchant, Craig. He used to be very quiet and seldom asked a favor of anyone, so I wonder what is going on. He wanted me to introduce a skillful mercenary to him without spreading a rumor. I was thinking you might be the right person to do this considering what you have done for us before.

Well, go to the seashore market with my letter of introduction. I'm afraid you have to walk a bit. The market is inside the forest, so be careful not to go past it. Find Craig and give him a letter of introduction. Then he'll let you know what you're supposed to do. Take care~
MsgIncomplete: Did you deliver my letter to Craig?
MsgResponse4: Did you deliver my letter to Craig?

MsgSummary: You have get rid of a {c1}RockShovel Goblin Digger{/c} and collect {c3}Antique Jars{/c}. You have to give the Antique Jars you have collected to Kirby within {c4}60 minutes{/c}. You have to collect at least 5 Antique Jars. RockShovel Goblins inhabit the forest east of the market.
MsgComplete: Hmm...there are fewer than I was hoping for. I wonder how many curios we have among these. I'm hoping for a lucky break~
MsgResponse1: Not too few, but not a lot here. You should have tried much harder~ At any rate, I wish I could get something useful~
MsgResponse2: Whoa! You just brought a ton of....oops, my voice was too loud~ Anyway, you did an excellent job~
MsgTake:
Welcome to our market~ This is the first time you've been to White Sand Harbor, right? This place is very famous for the most lively trade activity in the area. This is the place where you fan find almost anything you're lookin' for, and the place where the vendors will go the extra mile to find what the customer is looking for. This place is none other than White Sand Harbor~ I'm Kirby, a member of the union shop in this market. My job is to clean up files related to items. Oops, I said too much? Ha ha~ 

I nearly forgot. Now that you've come, I wonder if I can ask you one thing I have been pondering. Actually, I received some very good information a little while ago.

{c5}(Kirby is constantly blabbing out something, constantly noisy and talkative. You make a decision to just ignore him, but suddenly one word catches your attention.){/c}

...I was told those antique jars are sold at an incredibly expensive prices! I don't know exactly, but I guess you'll be sitting on a cushion stuffed with money right away once you sell several items verified as curios. This is the dream of all mankind, right? I'm talking about having so much wealth it becomes useless! {c5}(quietly){/c} Now keep it under your hat; this is the top secret I obtained through some shady means, so don't spread this rumor as you please, ya got it? Well, please go now and capture RockShovel Goblins and collect Antique Jars. You've only got 60 minutes, so please bring as many as possible within that timeframe.
MsgIncomplete: How many antique jars have you collected?
MsgResponse4: How many antique jars have you collected?

MsgSummary: Kirby told you to let a grocery dealer,{c2}Carlo{/c}, see antiques for appraisal.
MsgComplete: Are you a customer? Is there anything you're looking for? Hmm...what is this? It doesn't seem to be some kind of toy, Did you come to have it appraised? Let me see it.
MsgIncomplete: Did you let Old Man Carlo see the goods?

MsgSummary: Carlo said there are no curios at all among the antiques you collected. Go back to {c2}Kirby{/c} and deliver the message to him.
MsgComplete: Aww, there was no curios among them at all? {c5}(exhaling a sigh){/c} How disappointing...I have no choice, I'll ask someone else to do this next time. I'd better give an appraisal payment to Carlo next time. Ah, I nearly forgot. I know there were no curios at all. However, you worked so hard to capture Goblins, so I have to give you a reward~This will be okay, right? I hope you have a good journey.
MsgTake:
{c5}(after examining goods attentively, with a look implying you're pathetic){/c} Tut tut...Why did you bring this to me? There's nothing worthwhile here. These are all inferior goods.

How dare you bring these ugly, cracked, cheapo immitations before my discerning eye? Well, you can haul this load of junk back to Kirby. I performed my service, so tell him I'll come to claim my appraiser's fee later.
MsgIncomplete: Ah, just go.

MsgSummary: Kirby told you to let a grocery dealer, {c2}Carlo{/c}, see the antiques for appraisal.
MsgComplete: Are you a customer? Is there anything you're looking for? Hmm...what is it? It doesn't seem to be some kind of toy - did you come to have it appraised? Let me see it.
MsgIncomplete: Did you let Carlo see the goods?

MsgSummary: As a result of Carlo's appraisal, 5 curios have been discovered among the antiques. Carlo said he will take one as a fee for appraisal and asked you to give the other 4 to {c2}Kirby{/c}.
MsgComplete: You're back~ How many curios were there? Whoa~ FIVE? Ah, Mr. Carlo took one as an appraisal payment. Well, that's fair enough, because I can earn a lot of money by selling this. I'd better go to the antique market sometime next week. Thanks for your labor~
MsgTake:
{c5}(examining antiques you brought attentively){/c} This one's good...and this one...hmm.. You've got 5 nice pieces here. Just toss the rest. They're just trash; don't bother getting attached to them. {c5}(staring at you blankly){/c} Well, whatever you want.

Anyway, those 5 there have value among them in the antique market. I'll take one of them as an appraisal payment. Take the rest and give them back to Kirby. Where did that guy get this information, anyway? Is that an awkward question? Heh heh...I know he got word of it through some shady sources. Why do you look so puzzled? You're a pure-hearted one, eh?

Although they are curios, I'm afraid they're not super-rare valuables that'll fetch the highest prices. I'm guessing Kirby will over-react with excitement and dream about sitting on his cushion of money again.
MsgIncomplete: If you're done with me, you can take your leave.

MsgSummary: Kirby told you to let a grocery dealer,{c2}Carlo{/c}, see the antiques for appraisal.
MsgComplete: Are you a customer? Is there anything you're looking for? Hmm...what is it? It doesn't seem to be some kind of toy - did you come to have it appraised? Let me see it.
MsgIncomplete: Did you let Carlo see the goods?

MsgSummary: As a result of Carlo's appraisal, 5 curios have been discovered among the antiques. Carlo said he will take one as a fee for appraisal and asked you to give the other 4 to {c2}Kirby{/c}.
MsgComplete: You're back~ How many curios were there? Whoa~ FIVE? Ah, Mr. Carlo took one as an appraisal payment. Well, that's fair enough, because I can earn a lot of money by selling this. I'd better go to the antique market sometime next week. Thanks for your labor~
MsgTake:
{c5}(examining antiques you brought attentively){/c} This one's good...and this one...hmm.. You've got 5 nice pieces here. Just toss the rest. They're just trash; don't bother getting attached to them. {c5}(staring at you blankly){/c} Well, whatever you want.

Anyway, those 5 there have value among them in the antique market. I'll take one of them as an appraisal payment. Take the rest and give them back to Kirby. Where did that guy get this information, anyway? Is that an awkward question? Heh heh...I know he got word of it through some shady sources. Why do you look so puzzled? You're a pure-hearted one, eh?

Although they are curios, I'm afraid they're not super-rare valuables that'll fetch the highest prices. I'm guessing Kirby will over-react with excitement and dream about sitting on his cushion of money again.
MsgIncomplete: If you're done with me, you can take your leave.

MsgSummary: You have to get rid of {c1}5 RockShovel Goblin Butchers{/c} and return to Arnold the blacksmith in the seashore market. The habitat of RockShovel Goblins is the forest east of the market.
MsgComplete: Hey there, traveler. I thought you were just one of those vagabond mercenaries, but I guess that was just my first impression. I should have noticed your skill via the well-worn weapon you're lugging around~ Wahahaha~~ {c5}(Arnold laughs broadly){/c}
MsgTake:
You know what? I can simply overlook people who have their weapon fixed on credit due to lack of money. I can put it down to an account and collect my fee later. Sometimes I can sell weapons for nothing delightedly if the buyer really has nothing to pay with. These things are not important in our life. The most important thing is that there shouldn't be any people suffering for no reason at all.

RockShovel Goblin Butchers...these monsters keep torturing travelers who come to buy goods or just visit our market without any reason! You can't imagine how vicious and violent they are. I don't even want to recall all the horror stories about them. Anyway, these days, once I close up shop for the day, I spend most of my time hunting down those reeking, foul goblins.

However, it is too demanding to handle them all by myself. I'm totally an amateur when it comes to combat. All I can do is just beat one or two of them at a time. I guess it'd be more reliable for me to trust a vagabond mercenary like you rather than soldiers working for the government... I'll be waiting for your good news.
MsgIncomplete: Did you get rid of those Goblin scoundrels?
MsgResponse4: Did you get rid of those Goblin scoundrels?

MsgSummary: You have to dispose of {c1}3 RockShovel Goblin Bodyguards{/c} and a {c1}RockShovel Goblin Subboss{/c} and return to Arnold the blacksmith. The habitat of the RockShovel Goblin family is the forest east of the market.
MsgComplete: You've returned! You disposed of the subboss and the bodyguards following him around? Good, good; well done~ Actually, I also found out the name of the Goblins' head boss right before you came back. That's why I've been eagerly awaiting your return.
MsgTake:
Actually, you can simply say that those Goblin scoundrels are kinda like small children. All you've gotta do is scare them a bit, and they'll cut outa there like nothin'. I figure I can let you handle more demanding monsters, in light of your skill.

Goblins seem to live in some sort of rudimentary social groups like us humans. Perhaps there will be bosses commanding their followers. According to what I've observed so far while fighting them, I'm guessing one boss and several sub-bosses below him exist. Because I haven't figure out who's their boss yet, I'd like you to go there and take out one sub-boss. It seems this sub-boss always moves with his bodyguards protecting him. I'm afraid you'll have to take them all out if you wanna take out even one.

I wish you good luck in fighting again. I'll continue to fight monsters near the market and collect information about the boss.
MsgIncomplete: Did you get rid of the Sub-boss and his bodyguards?
MsgResponse4: Did you get rid of the Sub-boss and his bodyguards?

MsgSummary: You have to eliminate the boss of the RockShovel Goblin Family, {c1}Kerlark{/c}, and return to Arnold the blacksmith in the seashore market with the {c3}Head of Kerlark{/c}. The habitat of RockShovel Goblins is the forest east of the market.
MsgComplete:
This is the head of Kerlark! Excellent work! You have been a great help to me, to the folks in the market, and to the many travelers. The world would be a much brighter place fi we had more people like you; you know, someone who can help people who are in a tight spot.
This is small, but this reward is all I have. Please accept it~ I wish you the best in your travels.
MsgTake:
The name was...hmm what was it again? Ah, cripes, I forgot it. Gimme a second, there was a paper that I wrote down the name on... {c5}(after rummaging around a worktable for a long time, he finally discovers a piece of paper.){/c} Here it is...the name was...yes, Kerlark! It's sure a Goblin-sounding name, huh? Bleah...why does a mere Goblin have such a difficult name? Anyway....

I guess the misbehavior of Goblins will disappear for a while once we eliminate this Kerlark. Yeah...why don't you cut off its head and bring it to me after you get rid of Kerlark? If I drive a stake into the ground near the place where Goblins are living and hang his head on it, it will serve as quite the deterrant to goblins, don't you think? Wahahahaha~

...I can't help but think I've been infected with the cruelty of the Deatheaters as the war is getting longer and longer. Well, there'll be nothing more useful than a boss's corpse as a threat to monsters. Go and get rid of Kerlark, then bring its head to me!
MsgIncomplete: Did you take care of Kerlark?
MsgResponse4: Did you take care of Kerlark?

MsgSummary:
You have to get rid of {c1}10 Blackbeard Fighters{/c} and return to Craig, a defense item merchant in White Sand Harbor.
You can find the Blackbeard Clan in the ruined village located on the seashore south of village.
MsgComplete: You didn't seem to get even one scar on your body. I think I'd better express my gratitude to Claude, since he sent an excellent mercenary. Were you able to guess how strong their forces are? I hope you found them easy enough that I can give you a second request. This time, I'll give you a few more specifics about the reason why I'm requesting something like this of you.
MsgTake:
{c5}(with a hard voice without any feeling){/c} You will find the ruined seashore village if you go toward south a bit from here. It used to be quite a boisterous village, but now it's just a den of pirates.

This is my first request. Please go there and take down about 10 Blackbeard Fighters. It will be good enough to check out their power and get you warmed up. I'll give you more details once you do that and return safely. I'm counting on you.
MsgIncomplete: Did you swab the deck with those pirates?
MsgResponse4: Did you swab the deck with those pirates?

MsgSummary:
You have to go to the den of the Blackbeard Clan and get rid of Chief Mate {c1}Kuluny{/c}, Carpenter {c1}Jepito{/c}, and Helmsman {c1}Greed{/c}.
After that, you have to go back to Craig with keepsakes taken from their corpses.
MsgComplete:
Kuluny's Compass, Jepito's Hammer, and Greed's Baton...looks like you really did get everything I requested. I may have more requests along this line for you...{c5}(He mumbles half to himself){/c} I wonder how much my sin can be cleansed by this...

The reward for my request will be one of items you returned to me. I can guarantee they're all good quality pieces, since I made them all myself. You can make use of each of three items very effectively. Consider carefully, and select one. <Kuluny's Compass - wear as a Necklace that raises Luck slightly><Jepito's Hammer - a One-Handed Heavy Weapon that slightly raises Dex><Greed's Baton - a Dual Sword that slightly raises Strength>
MsgTake:
There was one Harbor village named White Sand. This place used to be lively, full of traders and people who looked active and cheerful. They were so generous, all the people seemed as if they were members of one family regardless of whether they were customer or dealer. They shared both sad and happy times together.

{c5}(Craig pauses for a moment, then resumes){/c} However, since pirates of the Blackbeard Clan appeared in the village, everything has disappeared. Those relentless knaves pillaged and teased and killed people virtually unchecked. To become a pirate king? That's bullshit. In order to sit on the throne of the pirate king, they even steal the belongings of the weak. It's more like the throne of the pirate king never existed from the first place!

Mercenary, you should know that the task I'm going to ask you is "vengeance." No words can replace what was lost. I want to take revenge for all the people in White Sand village who died. I hope you finish this job I couldn't handle by myself before.
MsgIncomplete: Did you take down Kuluny, Jepito, and Greed?
MsgResponse4: Did you take down Kuluny, Jepito, and Greed?

MsgSummary: You should go to the den of the pirate clan and give a {c3}Shining Ruby{/c} obtained from a {c1}treasure box{/c} to a medicine merchant named Matilda in the seashore market.
MsgComplete:
Oh my goodness, this ruby is emitting a really beautiful, bright sparkle! I've been dying to own something like this! It will lose its value if a dirty pirate clan has it in their grubby paws. Well, this is a reward for what you have done. I'm satisfied, so you may go.

What now? Are you saying...stealing stuff like this is unjust? Hohoho...do you forget who stole this thing in the first place? Don't try to preach to other people. Gotta look at your own faults. A gemstone only shines when with a beauty, they say. This ruby has finally found the place where it should belong. Nothing more, nothing less. Hoho... {c5}(Matilda turns around with a satisfied smile.){/c}
MsgTake:
You, have very kind-looking eyes. You doesn't seem to be the sort of person who will reject people's favors, even if it's your first time meeting them. It's true, isn't it? Oh, you're willing to help me? I'm so grateful~ You're really kind. I'll never forget your warm heart~

My favor is very simple. All you have to do is just bring one thing. This might be in the Harbor village being occupied by the Blackbeard Clan. No, it's not stealing~ That's just not the right word for it here. Think of it more like...stealth obtaining and delivery! Surely you're not afraid of pirates? I hope not, ho ho~

Just go there and find a box that you think includes a treasure. It is likely that deck hands and slaves are securing that area. be careful.. If you find a box, break into it and give me what you obtain from inside of the box....I don't know exactly which box holds what I'm looking for, so make sure you check out all boxes~
MsgIncomplete: Did you discover a treasure?
MsgResponse4: Did you discover a treasure?

MsgSummary:
Aiden asked you to go to his hometown, White Sand Harbor, and look for his fiancee.
You have to find a {c2}Aiden's Fiancee{/c}.
MsgComplete: Who are you? Wait...Aiden is looking for me? Alas... {c5}(She exhales a sigh with a sad look){/c}
MsgTake:
Ah, I'm not a person doing a business here. Are you also going back to your birthplace, by any chance? You look like a mercenary as well...am I right? Ha ha~ My name is Aiden. I'm now going back to my hometown - I've been wanting to return, but I haven't gotten back in over ten years! My hometown is the seashore village not far from here~

Arktuis? No, no; my hometown isn't a small village like that The White Sand harbor village is my hometown~ The place that is always busy with small and large ships anchored at the harbor and people of all shapes and size~ Ah, my imagination already paints such a vivid picture for me! Besides, I'm really missing my fiancee, Carry; I haven't seen her for a long time. She must be even more beautiful now than back then~

...By the way, I heard some stories from the market that've bothered me a bit. There are some people talking about village being burnt down, pirates, and things like these. I was eavesdropping on a conversation when I picked up these nuggets of info, so I couldn't ask more specifically. I don't think this is true, but if it is... Hey, I'll give you a reward, so can you go to a village and check out the rumor on my behalf? Meanwhile, I will prepare for a present for Carry. I'll be around here, waiting for good news.
MsgIncomplete: Did you find my fiancee? How is she?

MsgSummary: You heard White Sand Harbor was destroyed and many people - including Aiden's fiancee - were killed by Blackbeard Clan. The spirit of Aiden's fiancee asked you to deliver an Engagement Ring to {c2}Aiden{/c}.
MsgComplete: {c5}(after giving her a ring and delivering her a story){/c}
MsgTake:
As you can see, I'm already dead. Aiden wants to investigate this rumor? Yes, the rumor is true. For him, and for me, this is the sad truth. It has already been so long since White Sand Harbor, the hometown he's missed so much, was occupied by Blackbeard Clan. Everyone was killed, almost without exception. And...really horrible thing happened to the women, regardless of their age.  Those pirates; "human" is too good a term for the likes of them!{c5}(shaking like a leaf){/c} I still remember the name of that bastard who did it to me. The scoundrels who appeared to be his lackeys called him 'Sneaky.' Sneaky...Sneaky...! However, I'm the one who died, and Sneaky was the one who lived. In the end, I have nothing to do except wander around like this.

But I'm glad to know that Aiden has returned safely... Perhaps I was able to remain here in order to meet Aiden. {c5}(holding out a ring){/c} Please give this to Aiden. If you tell him my story, he'll probably believe it. That is an engagement ring he gave me on the day he left. He promised me he'd propose to me officially once he comes back. Now , I guess it's a promise he won't be able to keep...

Maybe he'll think of revenge..Please tell him something like that means nothing, so he needs to worry about his own health and body first. And tell him...I love him, and I hope we will meet again in the next world and form a connection.
MsgIncomplete: {c5}(She shakes her head with a sad face.){/c}

MsgSummary: Aiden asked you to get rid of a pirate of Blackbeard Clan, {c1}Mean Sneaky{/c}, who killed his fiancee, and bring {c3}Sneaky's Head{/c}.
MsgComplete:
This...is Sneaky's head...{c5}(after looking at the head silently for a long time){/c} Thank you. I'll give you plenty of reward. This is half of the money I earned during my journey. I think I have to consider a bit longer what I'll do with this head.
I'm not sure what to feel. I succeeded in revenge, but should I go back? Oh, Carry... {c5}Aiden turns around and covers his face with two hands and begins to shed tears.){/c} *sob*
MsgTake:
This...this is a ring I gave to Carry? Something happened to her? A...are the rumors I've been hearing about the village true?

{c5}(Aiden begins wailing all of a sudden like a crazy person){/c} I didn't want to believe it...! You can't imagine how much I had been missing my hometown... How can this...how?!

{c5}(with a voice full of wrath){/c} Pirates? The pirate who killed my Carry...his name is Sneaky, right? Sneaky...Sneaky...
Fine, mercenary. I'll ask you one more favor. Please find this Sneaky...take his life, then take his head. I want to clearly see how he looks! I know that I could hardly get revenge with my level of skill. That's why I'm asking for your help. Please kill Sneaky and bring his head to me no matter what happens!
MsgIncomplete: Did you get rid of Mean Sneaky? Have you brought back the bastard's head?
MsgResponse4: Did you get rid of Mean Sneaky? Have you brought back the bastard's head?

MsgSummary:
You have to get rid of {c1}5 Frost Woods Killers{/c} attacking travelers and return to a scouter, Nerdin.
You can find Frost Woods Killers at the end of the north Frost Woods and on your way toward the Willieoseu Central Beacon Mound.
MsgComplete:
Thanks. I just heard that those people owe their lives to you, hero. I really appreciate what you have done.

..What? You say you discovered zombies striking violently at you in the woods? No...it can't be...!
MsgTake:
I'm really sorry to say this right on our first meeting, but can you do me a favor?

I'm Nerdin, one of scouters dispatched to the Willieoseu district. My other job is to deliver instructions or information from the commitee to Silvaren and that sort of thing. However, these days, there is something I need to take care of urgently although this is a bit different from my job. I want to ask you to handle this.

I was told that travelers passing near the Frost Woods southeast of the beacon mound have recently been  attacked indiscriminately and have lost their lives. According to the eyewitnesses who survived, the culprit is Frost Woods Killers. People's lives depend on me, so I can't waste even  a single moment. Unfortunately, however, I can't vacate my position for a long time. Please help me. Please go to the Frost Woods and stop what those killers are doing.
MsgIncomplete: Did you get rid of those Frost Wood Killers?
MsgResponse4: Did you get rid of those Frost Wood Killers?

MsgSummary:
You have to capture {c1}Frost Woods Zombies{/c} and collect {c3}3 Bloody_Bones{/c} and deliver them to a female priest, Faruma.
You can find Frost Woods Zombies at the end of the north Frost Woods and on your way toward the Willieoseu Central Beacon Mound.
MsgComplete: {c5}(after listening to the whole story){/c} Hmm...that's why you have collected these and brought them to me. I get it. We'd better take care of things like this as soon as possible. I want to express my gratitude to Nerdin. Please hand over the Bloody Bones you have collected. I'll figure out the solution sooner rather than later. May Etain continuously bless your path. Farewell.
MsgTake:
I guess it was in the middle of second war against the Union of Fury. There was a vicious magician living in the Frost Woods at that time. I was told he manipulated the memory of people who entered the woods at will. Once he was fed up with them, he made people turn into zombies and tossed them into woods here and there and let them attack people who entered the woods. It was really horrible. In the end, that magician was killed by the arrow of the hero Arushien, and his corpse was broken into pieces and scattered all over the woods. At least this was what l thought till I heard your story.

Apparently, his elimination had soem flaw in its execution. The zombies you saw appear to be the evidence that the power of this now-dead magician is being restored bit by bit. Those horrible things should not happen again! I'm sorry, but I want you to do me a favor one more time. Can you get rid of zombies and give what you obtain to Faruma, a female priest in Silvaren? I'm certain Faruma will figure out the solution.
MsgIncomplete: How's your zombie extermination coming?

MsgSummary: Aiden's Fiancee asked you to get rid of people who died and turned into zombies. You have to eliminate {c1}3 White Sand Resident Corpses{/c} and {c1}3 White Sand Gloogy Girls{/c} and return to Aiden's Fiancee. They are hanging around the forest southwest of White Sand Harbor.
MsgComplete: Ah, you returned? What am I gonna do? There's something I didn't know before. Those people...I realized that just killing them again was useless.
MsgTake:
You talked to me! You, can you see me? I think I met someone like you a little while ago. Is it my imagination? I'm not sure... Judging by your outfit, you look like a mercenary. If you're not busy, can you do me a favor? That is, if you're okay with doing something for the deceased...

The place where I used to live was White Sand Harbor. It wasn't so big, but that place was always overflowing with the warmth of people's hearts...until the pirate clan invaded and devastated the entire village. Those bastards destroyed everything - houses, stores, and people's lives. No one survived. They just tossed corpses into the forest beside the village randomly. It was so cruel...

But something sadder happened. Dead people turned into zombies. I'm the only person who narrowly escaped this phenomenon. Maybe it's because of my strong hope. The people who became zombies forget all they had known, and they are now hurting innocent people passing by indiscriminately... When I see them, I feel like my heart is torn apart, but I don't have the power to stop them...so I'm begging you, please allow them to rest in peace once again, so that those who died in such terrible circumstances won't commit any more crimes themsElves.
MsgIncomplete: Did you deal with all the zombies that I requested?
MsgResponse4: Did you deal with all the zombies that I requested?

MsgSummary:
A fiancee of Aiden asked you to capture the {c1}Soul Extorter{/c} and collect {c3}Detained-Spirits{/c}.
You can find the Soul Extorter in the forest southwest of White Sand Harbor. You have to collect as many souls as possible within {c4}60 minutes{/c}. You have to collect at least 5.
MsgComplete: Thank you. I can handle this from now on...borrowing your strength makes me feel a bit guilty.
MsgResponse1: You brought many more than I was expecting. Thanks. Er...actually, can I ask you one more thing?
MsgTake:
I realized the reason why people can't free themsElves from the state of zombification was that their soul was eaten by someone else despite the fact that you offered them a chance to die again...and this someone was the Soul Extorter living in this forest.

If we capture the Soul Extorter and save their caged souls, maybe those people can't rise from dead, but they'll no longer do horrible things again. I guess...saving souls from Soul Extorter will be your new mission, according to the skill you've displayed previously.
Everybody has their limit, so don't try to handle things too far beyond your ability. It doesn't mean I underestimate you. What I want to tell you is that Soul Extorter isn't an easy enemy....{c5}(holding out a bluish glass bottle){/c} This is a bottle you can put souls inside. Once you obtain souls, you have to put them here quickly before they escape.

Rumor has it that if Soul Extorter devours a soul and you delay too much, it can digest the soul, causing it to disappear completely. Then, that soul is finished...there is no way we can save it whatsoever. That's why I hope you can save as many souls as possible in this short time. Good luck!
MsgIncomplete: Did you suck the souls back out of the Soul Extorter?
MsgResponse4: Did you suck the souls back out of the Soul Extorter?

MsgSummary: You have to receive a bottle fraught with souls from Aiden's Fiancee and give it to {c2}Lindellea{/c}, a female priest in Silvaren. Silvaren is an village of Elvnen women village southeast of Willieoseu.
MsgComplete: {c5}(after receiving a glass bottle and listening to the story, with a dark face){/c} I already heard Carry and the village met a tragic ending. That kind girl...is still worried about others even after her death? Yes...I know, I'll make sure I purify these souls and hold a solemn soul funeral. Thanks for doing this for Carry. May the Goddess bless your warm heart.
MsgTake:
All that I can do now is finished. The rest depends on trust and love. I'm already dead, but...anyway, please give this to him.

Have you ever gone to Silvaren before? It's a village of Elven women. If you go there, there will be female priests working in the holy place enshrining the Goddess. Please find a female priest named Lindellea and give this to her. I figure she will know what to do if you say this is from Carry in White Sand. Lindellea is both a preist and an excellent summoner; she will definitely know what to do.

The effect of that bottle will wear off soon, so if you delay too much, it might give a bad influence to the souls inside of the bottle. So please find Silvaren as soon as you can and give it to Lindellea. Thank you for all your wonderful help. May the Goddess guard and guide you.
MsgIncomplete: Did you give the bottle of souls to Lindellea?

MsgSummary: Roader asked you to capture {c1}Wilieoseu Harpy Illusionists{/c} and one {c3}Glowing Harpy Feather{/c}. You can find Wilieoseu Harpy Illusionists in the field southeast of Beacon Mound.
MsgComplete:
Wow! You found it! It was difficult, wasn't it? I really appreciate your efforts - thanks to you, I don't have to worry about my credibility. Hahaha!
Ah, I almost forget. I have to give you a good reward. You're a fighter, so I guess you might need a weapon or defense item, right? If you want, I can write down a letter of recommendation to the merchants of Silvaren. Well, which one do you need more, a weapon or a defense item?
<Defense Item><Weapon Item>
MsgTake:
Hello~ You're a new customer, I see~ I'm Roader, a storyteller merchant. If you're not busy by any chance, please look at items later, let me convince you to do me a small favor~

There are Harpies amid the creatures that live in Teos. They look so cute, but their nature is totally terrible and violent. Any men who witnesses a Harpy for the first time stop to look at it with a gaping mouth,  ten to one~ Hunters also hunt harpies so that perverted nobles can use them as pets. Well, as you can see, whoever treats a harpy as a pet eventually winds up as an awful corpse

Ah, I don't want to raise a harpy, either~ What I need is a Glowing_Feather you can obtain from harpy. This is a very rare thing, so there is even a rumor only 1 out of 100 harpies has this. Usually I don't even think about obtaining it, because it is too difficult to get. However, one noble personally I know very well asked me to find it. I can't go and capture a harpy because I'm running the business. That's why I'm asking for your help.
MsgIncomplete: It's not easy to obtain, but I'll give you a sizeable reward, so don't give up~
MsgResponse4: It's not easy to obtain, but I'll give you a sizeable reward, so don't give up~

MsgSummary: You have chosen a defense item. You have to find {c2}Andantea{/c}, a defense item merchant, in Silvaren and give her Roader's Letter. You can find Silvaren, the Elves' village if you cross the bridge toward south from the Beacon Mound.
MsgComplete:
Oh, a customer; nice to meet you! I'm Andantea. {c5}(after looking at Roader's Letter){/c} Aha, that's it. How is Roader? He is a really funny guy, isn't he? Ho ho~
Defense item...hm, I know I can make it easily with stuff I have now, but...
MsgTake:
Are you looking for a defense item? Okay~ Then I will write down a letter of recommendation
to Andantea, a defense item merchant from Silvaren.
{c5}(Roader writes down a letter and hold it out to you){/c}
Well, all you have to do is give this to Andantea. Maybe she will let you run a small errand in order to make a defense item, so I want you to know that in advance. However, it shouldn't be that rough, compared to my errand, haha~
MsgIncomplete: Didn't you leave to visit Andantea yet?

MsgSummary: You have to capture a {c1}Willieoseu Canine Wolf{/c} and collect {c3}5 Durable Leathers{/c} and give them to Andantea. You can find the Willieoseu Canine Wolf near the forest northeast of Silvaren.
MsgComplete:
Ah, you've returned. Let's see what you have...Whoa, you have collected really good quality leathers. I have a critical eye for material, so why don't we work together as of now? Hu hu~ I was just kidding~
Meanwhile, I have prepared a defense item for you. Here you go, I hope you like it~ I think you already paid the fee for that item by doing my errand. I hope you're able to fight bravely when you use it.

<For Fighter/Defender><For Mage/Priest><For Archer/Ranger>
MsgTake:
I guess I'll run out of leather if I make a defense item for you. It has been a while since I went out to collect leather, but I also can't just let you go empty-handed. Hmm...

Ah, how about this? While I make a defense item for you, you go and find some leather for me! The Durable Leather is the most useful material we can get in this area when it comes to making a defense item. It is light and you feel comfortable when you equip it. It is so durable that it's nearly flaw-free. Its durability is quite great, so it will not be easily worn out and become useless. Plus, I don't mean to brag or anything, but a piece I make will be useful for a long time, heh heh!

About 5 leathers should be good enough to cover a shortage or emergency. You'll be able to obtain the highest quality leather from the Willieoseu Canine Wolves. Please be careful so that you don't get hurt from wolves. In the meantime, I'll make a defense item and wait for you~
MsgIncomplete: Did you collect at least five Durable Leathers?
MsgResponse4: Did you collect at least five Durable Leathers?

QuestName: The Offense is the Best Defense(1)
MsgSummary: You have chosen a weapon. You have to find {c2}Larsen Druimos{/c}, a weapon merchant, in Silvaren with Roader's Letter. You can find the Elven village of Silvaren if you cross the bridge toward south from the Beacon Mound.
MsgComplete:
Welcome, customer. Larsen's the name. My mother, who has been yearning for the hero, Arushien, gave me my name. Of course, I really respect Arushien too. {c5}(after looking at Roader's Letter){/c} Aha, that's it. Mr. Roader recommended you...
Hmm...I know I can make a weapon easily with stuff I have now, but there is a small problem.
MsgTake:
Are you looking for a weapon? Okay~ Then let me write down a letter of recommendation
to Larsen, a weapon merchant of Silvaren.
{c5}(Roader writes down a letter and hold it out to you){/c}
Well, all you have to do is give this to Larsen. Maybe she'll let you run a small errand in order to make a weapon, so I wanted you to know this in advance. However, it will be not that difficult compared to what I asked of you, hahaha~
MsgIncomplete: Didn't you go to meat with Larsen yet?

MsgSummary: You have to capture {c1}Eldain Woods Sealakel Fighters{/c}, collect {c3}5 Sealakel Spines{/c}, and give them to Larsen. You can find the Eldain Woods Sealakel Fighter in the Eldain Woods southeast of Silvaren.
MsgComplete:
You have come back very quickly~ How about those Spines? Oh, you've brought some good quality spines! Looks like you have a variety of talents in addition to fighting~ If it's possible, I want to give you another chance...huhuhu~
Meanwhile, I have prepared for a weapon for you. Here you go; I hope you like it~ I think you already paid the fee for the weapon by doing my errand. I hope you use it to fight bravely~

<For Fighter/Defender/Archer><For Mage/Priest><For Ranger>
MsgTake:
I guess I'll run out of the materials I have if I make a weapon for you. It has been quite a while since I went out to collect materials, but I also can't just let a person who brought a Letter_of_Roader go empty-handed....hmm..

Ah, How about this? While I make a weapon for you, how about you go and find a material on my behalf?. The Sealakel Spines are the material I use the most frequently in this area amid materials I can get. Not only it is the material I can process very easily, but also it is the best when it comes to sharpness. Plus, the most importantly, I can guarantee they will be useful for a quite long time once I made it with my hand~

About 5 Sealakel Spines will be good enough to give me materials in case of a sudden shortage. You'll be able to obtain the highest quality spines from the Eldain Woods Sealakel Fighter. Please be careful so that you don't get hurt. In the meantime, I'll make a weapon and wait for you~
MsgIncomplete: Did you collect all the Sealakel Spines?
MsgResponse4: Did you collect all the Sealakel Spines?

MsgSummary: Vecernya, a watchman of Beacon Mound, asked you to find an archaeologist, {c2}Basaltes{/c}, and ask for his help. You can find Basaltes if you follow the route toward northeast from the Beacon Mound.
MsgComplete: Traveler? What brought you here? {c5}(after listening to your story){/c} Ah, Vecernya sent you here. I have already been waiting for her help. I know you aren't someone I have been waiting for, but I will ask you to do this now since your abilities don't seem too  off.
MsgTake:
Oops, you're the one who isnt' busy. Ah, sorry...did I offend you? I have a habit of saying things very directly, hehe.

Well, don't mind my greeting too much~ Actually, I was looking for someone who can do something urgent for me. That's why I have been examining people passing by carefully and I called to you hastily because I thought you were the right person to take on the job. I hope you'll understand my thought process~

Anyway, this is what I had in mind. If you go toward north a bit from here, you'll find several people who gather together. They are people studying ruins nearby. One of those people, Basaltes, asked for my help. He said it is a difficult problem, and he looked desperate. I really want to run there right now and help him, but this area is on the alert for enemies, so I can't vacate my position and leave Roader, who can't fight, by himself...y'know what I mean?
MsgIncomplete: Didn't you leave to visit Mr. Basaltes yet?

MsgSummary:
The archeologist, Basaltes, asked you to take care of the Golems' Boss, Lordrock.
You have to get rid of {c1}Lordrock{/c} and {c1}2 Lordrock's Guardians{/c} and return to Basaltes. You can find Lordrock among the golems.
MsgComplete:
I just heard the investigators' report: Lordrock fell to your might! This is just what I was hoping for. Thanks to your actions, I think further damage to the ruins will be prevented. I'd better express my gratitude to Vecernya later. Here; take this reward with you.
I hope I can meet you again sometime.
MsgTake:
I'm Basaltes, the leader of 'The Two Towers' ruin investigation. It feels like a long time since I started this investigation...

These days, we're in big trouble. That's because the ruin we are now investigating keeps getting damaged by Golems. At the time we started the investigation, this never happened. But a little while back, the Golems started becoming more violent. We thought this had happened because the ruin had been influenced by an unknown power, so we investigated that area. However, it turned out there was no connection between the two. In the end,, we have no choice but to guess something unidentified is changing the nature of golems.

There is one entity among the Golems which has a remarkable movement. We researchers decided to dub this entity 'Lordrock.' We're not sure whether this Lordrock is commanding other golems or not. I'm certain that, at the least, Lordrock is influencing other golems' movement considerably. I figure if we can get rid of Lordrock, the damage the golems cause to the ruins will diminish dramatically. I want you to take care of this. It wnt' be easy though - those damned gargoyles always following him around like attendants. I trust you can handle this because Vecernya sent you here.
MsgIncomplete: Have you taken a chip or two out of 'ol Lordrock?
MsgResponse4: Have you taken a chip or two out of 'ol Lordrock?

MsgSummary: You were told that if you get rid of {c1}Manurna{/c} the Harpy Leader and give {c3}Manurna's Head{/c} to Sairaamil, an elder of Silvaren, you'll receive a bounty.
MsgComplete: Ah, you captured Manurna! A great thanks to you. I wish harpies living in the Willieoseu forest take time to reflect on their own behavior a little bit because of her death. This is a token of gratitude, as I promised. May Etain be ever at your side.
MsgIncomplete: Wanted List! -Manurna/Doraphos
MsgResponse4: Wanted List! -Manurna/Doraphos

MsgSummary: You were told that if you get rid of {c1}Doraphos{/c} the Golem Boss and give the {c3}Head of Doraphos{/c} to Sairaamil, an elder of Silvaren, you'll receive a bounty.
MsgComplete: Splendid, you captured Doraphos! You readily handled that dangerous mission. I must give my respect to uncommon bravery like yours. This is a token of my gratitude, as I promised. May Etain guide your future.
MsgIncomplete: Wanted List! -Manurna/Doraphos
MsgResponse4: Wanted List! -Manurna/Doraphos

MsgSummary: You were told that if you get rid of {c1}Subcaptain Turbako{/c} of the Blackbeard Clan and give the {c3}Head of Turbako{/c} to Claude, you'll receive a bounty.
MsgComplete:
Did you bring the Head of Turbako? Oh, you really disposed of that vicious knave? I was starting to get worried because it had been a long time since I put the wanted list on the board, so I figured there was nobody who could take care of this dangerous killer. You did a wonderful job, though. You've got some brilliance in you~
Well, this is the bounty I promised. I hope you do a lot of things for people living in the Willieoseu. See you 'round!
MsgTake:
{c5}(A Wornout leaflet crispy with salt due to being subjected to a furious sea wind. Contents are as follows.){/c} 
All travelers and mercenaries are requested to take notice!

There is currently a notorious pirate clan - the Blackbeard Clan - that has taken up port in the ruined White Sand Harbor southwest of Willieoseu. Their vile deeds even include setting the entire village to flames! After that, people's rage has risen sky-high against their evil, robbery, and murder of travelers for no reason.

Amid them, Subcaptain Turbako is well-known as the most notoriously vicious, mean, and brutal of them all. I'm offerin' the bounty of 65000 gold to anyone who can bring me his head! If someone sneaks into the place where the Blackbeard Clan is now staying, cuts off Turbako's head, and brings it to me, I'll appeciate his service enormously and offer the great bounty I mentioned. Get to it, landlubbers and sea-dogs alike!
MsgIncomplete: Wanted List! -Subcaptain Turbako

MsgSummary:
Silvaren's weapon merchant, Larsen, asked you to buy arrows from Goldihen, a bow merchant at the marktet across the river.
You have to give a moneybag you got from Larsen to Goldihen.
MsgComplete: Come on in~ Ah, are you here to buy arrows for Larsen? Oh dear...it looks like I'm out of the kind she usually buys. I think I need to make new ones. Now that you're here, would you mind doing one thing for me?
MsgTake:
Greetings. I'm Larsen. The place where I was born and grew up was the capital, Serius, but I have yearned for Arushien. That's why I came to this place, Silvaren. Haven't you heard about Arushien? Arushien was a woman known as "the Elves' Second Hero" together with Spinterr. During the second war, her bow was called 'The Judgement of Pantera'; she embodied the terror of death to enemies and was elected as 'the commander of the Pantera Eye Force' - the first time a woman had ever held the position. Silvaren was the village she built for women who lost their husbands. Women who came to Silvaren in order to follow her path and be a warrior have increased considerably. Of course, I'm the one of them.

Usually I'm running my business in order to make a living, but I'm practicing with my bow every time I'm not busy. However, many of my arrows have been broken and become useless, apparently due to too much archery practice, so I was about to go to buy some more. Ah, if you're not busy, could you buy arrows on my behalf? All you have to do is cross the bridge and buy some arrows from Goldihen in the market. {c5}(giving you a moneybag){/c} This will be enough money...I think. Anyway, I'll be waiting~
MsgIncomplete: Did you buy arrows from Goldihen?

MsgSummary: You have to capture a {c1}Frost Woods Gargoyle{/c} and collet {c3}10 Gargoyle Talons{/c}, then give them to Goldihen, a bow merchant. You can find Frost Woods Gargoyles in the forest west of the market.
MsgComplete: Ah, your timing couldn't have been better~ Let me see...{c5}(after looking at talons you have collected){/c} These look way better than young and dead gargoyles' talons. Excellent; you have my thanks.
MsgTake:
In order to make a new weapon, I need a variety of materials. Light, strong wood for shafts, feathers I'll attach to the arrow, and so forth. Hmm, right, I can ask you to bring the necessary material for making the arrowheads. Of all the materials I collect, this one is the trickiest to get. The material I'm talking about is Gargoyle Talons.

Please hunt down some Frost Woods Gargoyles and cut off the Gargoyle Talons and bring them to me. It is the cheapiest and easiest thing I can use as a material for practice arrowheads...but I have been having a hard time obtaining them lately. I'm a merchant, not a warrior, so I used to collect talons from young gargoyles and dead gargoyles. It's also kind of troublesome, in that the amount of talons was naturally very small. Ah, anyway, it gave me quite the headche. You can't imagine how happy I am now that you've come along to help me!

While you gather those talons, I'd better get other materials. Be careful not to be injured by the Gargoyles. Don't try to over-exert yourself!
MsgIncomplete: How's it coming with collecting those Gargoyle Talons?
MsgResponse4: How's it coming with collecting those Gargoyle Talons?

MsgSummary: You have to send {c3}Goldihen's Letter{/c} to {c2}Larsen{/c}, a weapon merchant of Silvaren.
MsgComplete:
What about those arrows? Did you just come back empty-handed? {c5}(after receiving Goldihen's Letter and reading it){/c} Ah, I got it, The arrows ran out. That's why it took so long. Did Goldihen give you a reward for obtaining a material separately? What's that? You didn't receive it? I knew it...she's very forgetful~
I'll give you a reward instead as a token of gratitude~ I'm sure I'll need your help again someday too.
MsgTake:
Well, I prepared all the materials I need to make more arrows. It's time for me to make 'em on a large scale! Hmm...I guess it will take about a week until I make the amount Larsen needs. Since she's paid in advance, can you go and tell Larsen she has to wait a week? Ah, you'd better take a letter. Wait here a minute.

{c5}(writing down a letter quickly and holding it out){/c} Here you go, I scribble it down roughly, so all you have to do is give it to Larsen. I guess she has to take a break for a week because she doesn't have any arrows. Well, maybe it'd be good for her to take a break for a little while. Ho ho ho! When I finish making arrows, I will contact Larsen separately. You did a good job~
MsgIncomplete: Did you send my letter to Larsen?

MsgSummary:
You have to get rid of some {c1}Maitreyan Legionary Soldiesr{/c}, collect {c3}5 Plans of Maitreyan{/c}, and give them to an elder of Silvaren, Sairaamil.
You can find Maitreyan Legionary Soldiers near the Maitreyan Orc Base Camp north of Silvaren.
MsgComplete: You have returned. You did a good job. You weren't wounded, by any chance, were you? {c5}(exhaling a sigh of relief){/c} Thank the goddess. {c5}(looking at what you have collected){/c} Hmm...these must be the plan instructions that individual soldiers carry.
MsgTake:
Perhaps this letter includes only a small portion of the plan, judging by the very brief contents of letter.
Now that we realize the Orcs of Maitreyan are up to something, we'd better collect more a lot of information. In order to do it, we need someone who will infiltrate their base and steal information. Traveler, if you don't mind, would you take this risk for our sake? I promise we'll never forget your help - there'll be a reward for you later.

Then first, I need you to bring things which might prove to be clues to their plan from legionary soldiers protecting the area surrounding Maitreyan. I know Orcs have a very specific martial hierarchy. Perhaps even legionary soldiers almost equal in rank to low class soldiers will carry brief instructions about their plan. It's just my hunch, but in this urgent situation, securing even one tiny clue will prove crucial.

We need to proceed with this as soon as possible. Please make haste, traveler.
MsgIncomplete: Did you obtain any clues from the legionary soldiers?
MsgResponse4: Did you obtain any clues from the legionary soldiers?

MsgSummary:
When you handed an {c3}Enveloped Letter{/c} to Vecernya in the beacon mound, she told you to deliver it to an elder of Silvaren, Sairaamil.
You have to give the Enveloped Letter to Sairaamil.
MsgComplete:
Etain be merciful! What is the matter, traveler? Vecernya sent this? A letter from Orcs...?

{c5}(after reading a letter, Sairaamil's complextion darkens.){/c} It is difficult to interpret a whole letter, but looking at just the stamp on the seal, I can see how important the contents of this letter are. Did you obtain this? Much thanks go to you, then; this is crucial knowledge for us.
MsgTake:
I have a strong feeling that we Elves will greatly appreciate what you have done someday. Chances are, Orcs are planning something that might prove a serious threat to Elves. After Etain was killed by her creator, the relationship between Orcs and Elves has been one of mutual enmity. It's always natural for Elves to assume the Orcs are up to something, unless it turns out this is a love letter written from a male Orc...

Oh dear...what's wrong with me? That introduction was entirely too long. {c5}(mumbling half to herself){/c} This is something really urgent, but how quickly should we act upon it? I have to reflect on this sincerely. Well, please deliver this to an elder of Silvaren, Sairaamil. 
Please don't take this lightly because of my rambling; I just want to put an emphasis on this one more time. This is really a serious matter, so please, go without delay!
MsgIncomplete: Did you deliver the letter to Sairaamil?

MsgSummary: You have to give a {c3}Plan of Maitreyan{/c} to a female priest, {c2}Parma{/c}, and ask for an interpretation.
MsgComplete:
What's up? I'm a little bit busy. I have to read a book I didn't finish yesterday. What's this? I haven't seen this type of paper before. Wait...the Orcs' secret plans?!

{c5}(looking at a plan notes closely){/c} Well, it's definitely the Orcish tongue. Hmm...it's kind of an ancient language...bah, this isn't the time to explain it. It must be pretty urgent if Sairaamil asked for this. All right, give it to me.
MsgTake:
In order to intepret these plan notes, I think we'll have to rely on Parma's knowledge. She is both a female priest of Etain and a linguist possessing an erudite knowledge about numerous languages. Her intelligence often becomes enormous benefit to us. Perhaps, this is the time when we need it most.

{c5}(giving you the plan notes){/c} I figure she'll definitely interpret these plan notes perfectly. She will accept to do this delightedly if you say this is a favor from Sairaamil. Please give this to Parma now.
MsgIncomplete: Did you get those Maitreyan plans to Parma?

MsgSummary: You have to give the Maitreyan Plans that Parma translated to Sairaamil.
MsgComplete:
You have returned much earlier than I thought. {c5}(receiving the translated plan notes){/c} 
It is very fortunate a competent person like Parma is in our midst. She did the hard work, now all we have to do is throw a deadly attack at the Orcs on this base.
MsgIncomplete: Did you give the translated note to an elder?

MsgSummary:
You have to get rid of {c1}Cruel{/c}, commander-in-chief of the Maitreyan Orc Corps and give the {c3}Head of Cruel{/c} to an elder of Silvaren, Sairaamil.
You can find Cruel inside of the Maitreyan Orc Base Camp.
MsgComplete:
This is the Head of Cruel! It looks very ugly and smells horrible - it's like something that's been rotting a while. I'm sure this is the right head, but...didn't you happen to get hurt while fighting with this guy?
I feel relieved that the damage was negligible. I'd better let the village soldiers hang its head on a long stake to ward off any further militant behavior on the part of the Orcs.

I really appreciate your help. If you hadn't obtained that Enveloped Letter and given it to Vecernya in the first place, we might be fighting with those ugly Orc clans right about now.
This is a reward that I and all the sisters of Silvaren put our heart into. I hope you'll be delighted with it. May Etain and Arushien protect your future.
MsgTake:
{c5}(after reading the translated plan note){/c} The signature written here seems to be the name of orc who is overseeing the execution of this plan. I guess a modifier attached in front indicates this guy's rank within corps. Hmm...'Cruel', that's how it reads. I guess this orc called Cruel is sort of the commander-in-chief commanding this plan. Granted, he is not a 
commander-in-chief, but that means he must have considerable influence within the corps, considering he has enough status to writing his signature on an instruction distributed to legionary soldiers.

As you may have heard, offense is the best defense. Now that we know the Orcs' plan in advance, I think we have to dispose of this Orc called Cruel in order to prevent this battle from breaking out. Traveler, this is the most important and dangerous favor, and the last I will ask. Please sneak into the very depth of the Maitreyan Orc Base, and dispose of Cruel, then cut off his head and bring it to me.  Once you bring his head, I'll drive in a long pike and hang his head on it so that the Maitreyan Orcs can see it clearly. If they see it, those dirty, stupid clans will realize that planning to attack us is an exercise in futility.
MsgIncomplete: Did you get rid of Cruel?
MsgResponse4: Did you get rid of Cruel?

MsgSummary: You have to receive {c3}Luine's Letter{/c} and give it to Vecernya, who works as a watcher in the beacon mound. You can find the beacon mound if you cross the river from Silvaren.
MsgComplete:
Hey, you look rather familiar.  Have we met recently? Well, I'm not good at remembering people's faces, but that's not important. Anyway, meeting someone I didn't know before is always amusing~

Oh, you brought a letter from Luine~ You're a very welcome visitor~ I was already hoping to stop by Silvaren soon. This is great..{c5}(Vecernya rips open the letter){/c}
MsgTake:
May Etain guide your path- I'm Luine, a female priest protecting the sanctuary of Silvaren. Actually, I called you because I just want to know about how a good friend of mine is doing in life.

Vecernya is working as a watcher in the beacon mound you can find across the river from here. This kid originally had a very energetic and optimistic personality, but...according to rumor these days, unidentified strange creatures have appeared near the beacon mound. Of course Vecernya is a ranger of considerable ability, but as her friend, I worry for her safety all the same.

I have a duty to protect this sanctuary as a priest, so I can't just vacate my position. That's why I want you to give my letter to Vecernya on my behalf. Is it possible? Ah, thank you. I'm counting on you then!
MsgIncomplete: Did you find Vecernya?

MsgSummary: You have to get rid of {c1}Eldain Woods Pixies{/c} and obtain {c3}5 Broken Pieces of Stone{/c}, then give them to Parma, a female priest of Silvaren.
MsgComplete: Aren't these just Broken Pieces of Stone? Ah, wait. There seems to be something written here. Sorry, I was about to think you were an idiot who couldn't handle this kind of task. The inscriptions seem like some kind of ancient lettering.... {c5}(Parma examines words written on a Broken Piece of Stone){/c}
MsgTake:
Hi, I'm Parma. I'm a female priest protecting the sanctuary, as well as a linguist and ecology researcher. Haha...those credentials sound like a mouthful, huh? I'd better think about a shorter greeting to use next time. You already look so tired after just being introduced.

Judging by the looks of you, you're the mercenary who's been traveling around helping people and making money, right? Then why don't you help me too? It's not too difficult. Have you ever seen a pixie before? It will be easier to explain this if you've traded blows with one of them pixies before....ah, you have? Great! I mean...not great for you, but good for this request!

Eldain Woods east of Silvaren is a place where many pixies used to live. I know there are some Sealakels too...but let's ignore that disgusting clan; I don't even want to think about them. Unlike their appearance, pixies are very cunning and cruel creatures. However, they've hardly ever harmed people unnecessarily. I know there were a couple of peculiar pixies among them, but attacking travelers passing by in groups was a very rare occurrence. However, recently, this kind of accident has been growing in frequency.

It is my conjecture, but it is likely there is a certain pixie exercising her considerable influence over all the pixies living in the Eldain Woods and driving them to hatred against humans. I can't fathom why a pixie like that would keep coming into being. I guess in the overall hierarchy, she might be like a queen to them.  I need information about that 'queen' pixie. Could you go and capture pixies and bring me some kind of clue? I'm counting on you.
MsgIncomplete: Did you obtain anything from the pixies?
MsgResponse4: Did you obtain anything from the pixies?

MsgSummary: You have to take out the pixie queen {c1}Ezolob{/c}, who is manipulating Eldain Pixies, and obtain a {c3}Red Pebble{/c}, then give that to Parma.
MsgComplete:
Ah, you have returned. That means you must have disposed of Ezolob safely, correct? What did you obtain from her? {c5}(after looking at the stone){/c} This stone is a fabulous red color, just like Ruby's Ore has. Perhaps this is a stone possessed by Ezolob's magical enchantment. Is the spell still intact after Ezolob died? hmm, I guess I'll have to conduct a more thorough investigation later.

Thanks. I like how you handle things. I will give you a plenty of reward, so be sure to drop by and help me out when you're free.
MsgTake:
Ezolob'? That's what it says. I have never imagined pixies knew how to use ancient words. I'm guessing this is something's name... I've got feeling this may be the name of a queen pixie. What do you think?

The art of placing something with one's name engraved into an entity to wield control over them...it is a very old and evil art I did not think was still practiced. (frowning) Really, Ezolob must be an evil pixie, just like the Vail. If she understands the Elven tongue, she will know how merciless my judgment can be. Anyway, now that we know that the name of this controller of pixies is 'Ezolob', all we have to do now is take her down to stop her from doing whatever she pleases.

If she is a pixie who even knows how to use magical enchantments written with ancient words, Ezolob will not be the same as other pixies. I mean, she will be more difficult to cope with than other pixies, but she shouldn't be that difficult to fight, either. Even if Ezolob proves difficult, you'll certainly have an easier time with her than against the spiritual kings in the Elemental Cave. Well, I trust your ability, so I hope you go to Ezolob and bring back whatever it is you find on her.
MsgIncomplete: Did you take out Ezolob? I wonder what you've obtained.
MsgResponse4: Did you take out Ezolob? I wonder what you've obtained.

MsgSummary: You have to get rid of {c1}5 Maitreyan Woods Guards{/c} and return to priest Kubex Allter. You can find Maitreyan Woods Guards in the forest near the Maitreyan Orc Base Camp in the north.
MsgComplete: Well done. Every creature has an innate value to the Goddess, but meager creatures who forget their place and rampage around arrogantly deserve the judgment they receive in the name of Goddess.
MsgTake:
I pray the Goddess always protects Her children. Greetings, I'm a priest, Kubex Allter, dispatched from the Deities Religion's central parish. The reason why I left the capital Apulune and came to this distant place is to accomplish the mission the parish gave to me. My mission is to find a hero who will get rid of heretics - Maitreyan Orcs who have been extending their power in the center of Willieoseu. 

I was told Orcs worship their king as God. This is ridiculous. It's not someting that can be overlooked by people of the Deities Religion, who serve only the Goddess Etain! In addition, they are trying to build an empire for only Orcs by gathering together various Orc clans that are scattered around. Their center of operations seems to be the very Maitreyan Orc Base Camp north of here. Also, I've heard a rumor they're buying over other clans living in the forest, in addition to their Orcish allies. I don't know exactly if Shaiyawoods are actually threatened or controlled by them, but I was told they are brutally killing people who are trying to enter the Maitreyan camp!

Maybe the fact I met a hero like you so fast clearly shows the goddess is helping us. Please, hero, help me and get rid of those heretical Orcs. I hope you take care of Shiayawood and first take out those Maitreyan Woods Guards who've been massacring innocent people.
MsgIncomplete: Did you take care of the Maitreyan Woods Guards?
MsgResponse4: Did you take care of the Maitreyan Woods Guards?

MsgSummary:
You have to get rid of {c1}5 Maitreyan Priests{/c} and {c1}5 Maitreyan God's Servants{/c} and return to priest Kubex Allter.
You can find Maitreyan Priests and God's Servants in the Maitreyan Orc Base Camp to the north.
MsgComplete:
Hmm...I can smell the stench of Orcs' blood all over your body. It must have been a rough fight, no doubt. I feel relieved now that you've come back without major injuries.

By collecting information while you were undertaking your mission, I finally found out who is conrolling the Orcs. His name is Bashtark.
MsgTake:
In order to take care of this mission quickly and effectively, it's best to attack their center directly. I think it might be a good idea to sneak deep into the the Maitreyan camp and take out many of their chieftans. Perhaps you may find priests and god-servants performing their unholy rites. This time, please get rid of them and return. Chances are soldiers are guarding that area, so you should be careful.

I'll collect as much information as I can while you handle this mission. I may be able to get some tips from several contacts of mine. I don't yet know who is controling the Orcs. Finding their name will be my job. I wish you success and a safe return.
MsgIncomplete: Did you get rid of the Maitreyan Priests and God's Servants?
MsgResponse4: Did you get rid of the Maitreyan Priests and God's Servants?

MsgSummary:
You have to get rid of {c1}Bashtark{/c}, the ruler of the heretics, and obtain a {c3}Necklace of Bashtark{/c}. Then, give it to priest Kubex Allter.
You can find Bashtark inside of the Maitreyan Orc Base Camp to the north.
MsgComplete:
Praise be to the Goddess! You got rid of Bashtark and returned whole! The grace of the Goddess will be with you, the victor in this arduous battle!

{c5}(receiving the  necklace you obtained){/c} This is Bashtark's necklace, hmm? Now that we deposed the leader of the Maitreyan Orcs, it will take a long time for them to gather their strength again. Thank you very much, hero. This is a reward from our religion to the hero who willingly accomplished the dangerous mission. Thank you again. May Etain guard your footsteps!
MsgTake:
"Bashtark," eh? It is an ugly name, fitting for a ruler of corrupt and heretical Orcs. According to the informations I have collected, this guy has a necklace which is enchanted with a marvelous power, and he is ruling other Orcs with the power of this necklace. If you can get rid of Bashtark and steal the necklace he possesses, the Orcs will be scattered like sheep without a shepherd, and can marshall no force strong enough to be a threat.

Hero, the battle against Bashtark will be totally different from any other fights you have experienced so far. This time, you may even be putting your life on the line. I know it is dangerous, but I'm asking for your help because I strongly believe the Goddess led me to meet you. Please get rid of Bashtark, the leader of the heretics, for the sake of all people who serve the Goddess.
MsgIncomplete: Did you get rid of Bashtark?
MsgResponse4: Did you get rid of Bashtark?

MsgSummary: You have to get rid of as many {C1}Ancient Ruin Destroyers{/c} as you can within {c4}60 minutes{/c} and return to Rolin Silverhawk without delay. You have to get rid of at least 5.
MsgComplete: Oh, I thought you had some battle experience. Is this all you got? I'll give you a reward because I'm a man of my word, but...don't think you'll get paid with this level of skill somewhere else. I'm giving you this advice because you're a young friend. Just keep it in mind.
MsgResponse1: This is quite satisfactory. Good job, buddy. I guess this won't be too bad as a reward for what you have done. I hope you'll keep accumulating a lot of experience, my friend.
MsgResponse2: Oh, you've got MAD SKILLZ, bro! I'm always a good judge of character, haha~ I'll give you a sufficient reward! I hope someone like you continues to help people who are in trouble. Take care on your adventures!
MsgTake:
Hey there, warrior! Well...even if you're not a warrior, it's okay as long as you're good at combat in whatever profession you practice. Excellent, I have a rewarding job in store for you that I hope you'll be a good fit for!

I'm Rolin Silverhawk, a ruin investigator of the Silverhawk clan. Investigating the ruins which remain from ancient times is a job I've invested my whole life in. I travel to many plaes in Teos and discover historical vestiges and restore them to the way they looked in their heyday, and what I'm doing now is the same thing. However, the big problem occurred while I was undertaking this mission...

As you can see, these ruins here are too damaged. I doubt we can guess which age these belong to, and I uncertain whether we can correctly restore the form of the original based on what's left intact. Even still, the existing vestiges are messed up by those annoying landers who keep popping up out of nowhere! I know they are ignorantly strong and totally useless, but they're messing up and trampling ruins which might retain hundreds of years of history. I can't stand this anymore!

Right now, I feel like I just want to destroy them all by my own hand, but I'm already busy enough as it is because I have to investigate ruins which remain undamaged. (coughing dryly) It doesn't mean I don't have the ability to fight against those landers. Please don't get me wrong. Could you get rid of those ignorantly strong landers a little bit more? I hope you take care of as many as possible. If you get your job done, come back to me. I'll gladly pay a good reward if you take them out!
MsgIncomplete: How many of those annoying landers did you kill?
MsgResponse4: How many of those annoying landers did you kill?

MsgSummary:
You have to get rid of {c1}Elaste Gargoyles{/c} and collect {c3}5 Blue Pebbles{/c} and give them to Ciderosa.
You can find Elaste Gargoyles in the Elaste Forest north of Ciderosa's location.
MsgComplete: Is this...a piece of stone? I guess we'd misinterpret this as a gemstone if we looked at this blue sparkle from a distance. This is the most beautiful light I have ever seen. I can't believe we found this on a gargoyle... Maybe this is the source of their power. Of course, we'll get some exact information after we perform some actual research on it.
MsgTake:
You can discover creatures possessing abnormally stong power in this Elaste Forest. Some of them are completely new creatures we haven't seen before, and some who used to have a mild nature has turned into very different creatures who now possess a violent nature for reasons we don't fully understand. Ever since the war against the Vail began, we have witnessed this kind of transformation from creatures living in the forest. Of course, research is still in progress in order to find out the exact reason.

I'm also doing reseach about this, and the creatures I'm studying as research objects this time are Gargoyle and Stonegolems. These two creatures are new entities we hadn't seen in the Elaste Forest before the war began. In addition, these creatures have incredible destructive power compared to native creatures of the forest, so they are both important research objects and the evil things you ought to destroy as soon as possible.

Let's begin with Gargoyles first. Can you destroy Elaste Gargoyles and bring me what you obtain from them so that I can progress the research? It's like a two-birds-with-one-stone solution because you get rid of gargoyles and hone your fighting skill, and I obtain the research specimen. I'll be waiting.
MsgIncomplete: What did you obtain from the Gargoyles?
MsgResponse4: What did you obtain from the Gargoyles?

MsgSummary:
You have to get rid of {c1}Elaste Stone Golems{/c} and collect {c3}5 Yellow Pebbles{/c} and give them to Ciderosa.
You can find Elaste Stone Golems in the Elaste Forest north of Ciderosa's location.
MsgComplete:
Ooooh, this time it's is a stone sparkling with a yellow color. Interesting, I can't believe what we have obtained from two creatures is a stone sparkling with a particular color. If we discover which component of stone generates the color, we'll definitely find out the truth about the source of power gargoyles and stonegolems possess.

I appreciate your help both for collecting research specimens and taking care of those violent creatures. You have been a great help. It may not be much, but please take this token of my gratitude. I'll pray to the goddess that you have a safe journey.
MsgTake:
Now that you got rid of those gargoyles and obtained the specimens, you'll face the stonegolem this time. Like gargoyles, stone golems also have abnormally strong power and are prone to violence. You have to be more careful when you face them. Of course, considering how well you dealt with those gargoyles, maybe it won't be all that difficult for you.

Just like last time, please collect what you obtain after you get rid of stonegolems and bring them to me. Meanwhile, I'll examine these stones you have collected from gargoyles with my methods.
MsgIncomplete: What did you obtain from the stone golems?
MsgResponse4: What did you obtain from the stone golems?

MsgSummary:
You have to take care of {c1}5 Willieoseu Nepentheses{/c} and return to Vecernya, a beacon mound watcher.
You can find Willieoseu Nepentheses near the beacon mound easily.
MsgComplete:
Oh~ You have returned. Were they a little tricky to fight? Well, I don't think it was too bad if you could take on these numbers. Nephenteses are not creatures similar to wolves passing by. I appreciate the help you've given us. Luine let me meet a good person. If I visit the Silvaren, I'll talk you up to people as best I can~
Ah, this is the reward I promised. Is this okay? Then take care; may Etain protect you~!
MsgTake:
What does it mean? 'Unidentified Strange Creature'...ahah, Nepenthes, It's true I feel annoyed because of the kids these days. In the past, all I had to do was think about travelers passing by, but these days I have to consider travelers and these kids at the same time.

I don't know exactly, but it appears Nepentheses are maturing by absorbing the spirit of the trees around them. Actually, the trees they are inhabiting are all bone-dry and twisted. We are already suffering from a headache because many creatures are messing up the nature of Willieoseu randomely, and these kids are doing the same thing. We Elves can't stand for this anymore. Like other Elves, I'm a philanthropist who loves all living things, but these things are really horrible.

That's why I'm elminating Nephentes whenever I find them these days, but...the problem is that they're quite speedy at reproducing, so their number has increased pretty quickly for a short period of time. I guess it's too demanding an undertaking for just me. But now that you're already here, why don't you help me and get rid of Nepheneses? Judging by your look, you probably have considerable experience in battle, ho ho~ If you do this job well, you'll receive a good reward. Alright? Good~ I'm counting on you.
MsgIncomplete: How about those Nephenteses? Is it too demanding to capture them?
MsgResponse4: How about those Nephenteses? Is it too demanding to capture them?

MsgSummary: A watcher, Vecernya asked you to capture an Orc.  Find one that looks like a chump, then jump him from behind and bring anything in his bag back to Vecernya.
MsgComplete: I'm not good at the Orcish language, so it's not easy to interpret a whole letter, but... I don't think this letter includes something important just judging by these sentences in the middle. So...hm...I mean, it doesn't seem to be a letter inquiring about the Orcs' health or something like that.
MsgTake:
There is something fishy about the Orcs' movement.
I figure something's up...but I need the evidence in order to know the exact truth.
As far as I know, some of them are conveying a message. Please capture one of them and bring him to me, would you?

MsgSummary:
You must deliver the important documents regarding Velikian to the chief of Fotamion Watch Tower, {c2}Bosnal{/c}.
You can find the Keuraijen district by following the route toward the north.
MsgComplete:
What is this all about? {c5}(receiving a document and listening to the whole story){/c} Hmmmm, so that's what happened. Thank you for this news, even though it weighs heavy on us all. What happened to Velikian is a tremendous loss to us all; how will I ever tell his fiancee, Artesia?
This is a small reward, but please take it.
MsgTake:
Alas, Etain didn't... abandon... me...!! Hey, please...don't...deny me...my last request. (gurgle) (cough!)
(This man seems to have sustained some serious injuries. You doubt he will live much longer.)
I'm... Velikian, an officer of the Gliter Guardsmen. A little while ago...I received an order from...my lord, Garter Saitron in Gliter...to deliver...an important document...to...Chief Bosnal in the Fotamion Watch Tower. (cough!) I was on my way to...Keuraijen... However, unexpectedly...I was ambushed by monsters... Please give... (cough!) (cough!) this document...to Bonal...I implore you.
{c5}(He holds out a document, cluthced in his hand and drenched in his own blood.){/c} Ah... arrr...  Artesia...  my love...{c5}(He exhales his final breath and slumps over dead.){/c}

MsgSummary:
Angelma, a defense item merchant, asked you to hunt an {c1}Araky Woods Larva{/c} and collect {c3}7 Shells of Araki Larva{/c}.
You can find Araky Woods Larvas in the marsh near the Watch Tower.
