MsgComplete: Well done. I figure we can finish what Bosnal requested by the deadline. Well, this is the reward I promised. See you again.
MsgTake:
I'm making all the defensive items for the guards in the Watch Tower. I'm not so busy because there aren't that many guards. However, a few days ago, Bosnal, chief of the guards, came in and urgently asked me to make a defensive item because defense items are running out. This kind of favor is not that difficult for a competent person like me...

{c5}(Angelma hesitating for a while){/c} But, that being said...there is nothing I can do about the lack of materials. Unlike other skilled masters, the special thing about the defensive items I'm making now used to be the fact that I added Larva Shells from this area to the defensive items, but I've run clean out of them. Could you collect some Shells of Larva for me? I'll give you a worthwhile reward.  How about it?
MsgWelcome: Did you find something useful? I think I can give you something useful, whether it be goods or informative stories.
MsgIncomplete: Ack, looks like we're pressed for time already...
MsgResponse4: Did you find something useful? I think I can give you something useful, whether it be goods or informative stories.

MsgSummary:
Vellacis, the poison researcher, asked you to bring Frog Poisons for research.
You have to hunt {c1}Araky Woods Frogs{/c} near the marsh and give {c3}10 Frog Poisons{/c} to Vellacis.
MsgComplete:
Well done. I guess I can make much better poison than the poison Salpion will make. I guess I need your help for one more thing once we finish the research on this poison.
Well this is a small token of my favor I'm giving to you. May Etain guide your path.
MsgTake: Poison is a really valuable and fascinating thing that deserves to be research. It could have a deadly effect, or even a beneficial effect, depending on who is using it. I'm researching a poison like this. There are creatures possessing a good poison we can research near the Fotamion Watch Tower. This place is perfect for research. I'm paying attention to the poisonous frog that inhabits this area. Could you bring 10 Frog Poisons to me?
MsgIncomplete: Why is it taking so long?
MsgResponse4: Why is it taking so long?

MsgSummary:
The chief of guards, Bosnal, asked you to find {c2}Kalinas{/c}, the leader, in the Watch Tower situated on the Mores Woods.
You can find the watch tower of Mores Woods by the roadside if you follow the route toward northeast.
MsgComplete: Did Bosnal send you here? Hm, Okay. He's a keen judge of character. I'll leave this up to you.
MsgTake:
We are always exposed to vicious monsters. Protecting people from monsters is the day-in, day-out work of guards like me.
Mores Woods isn't far from here. They have excellent guards that I trust more than anybody else, keeping an eye on monsters looking for a chance to attack us on the edge of the forest.
By the way, these days Kalinas, the leader of Watch Tower, asked for my help because she finds the movement of monsters rather alarming. Do you think you could help us out with this?
MsgIncomplete: You haven't departed yet? Go now. They will need your help.

MsgSummary:
The leader of Mores Woods, Kalinas, asked you to capture 10 Mores Pixies, which have been acting strange lately.
You can find Mores Pixies if you enter the center of Mores Woods.
MsgComplete: You handled that quite quickly - I'm impressed! But don't relax yet, because this isn't over!
MsgTake:
Well let's get this started. These days, the movement of pixies in Mores Woods is very alarming. There is nothing certain yet, but we can see very clearly they are increasing in power. These pixies are a very cunning clan, so it is very dangerous to us to let them acquire more power. I think we need to handle this pressing matter first.
Please take out a good number of pixies. With your skill, I'll bet you could hew down 10 of them, even. Good luck.
MsgIncomplete: If the pixies grow stronger as a group, they'll soon be beyond something we're capable of handling, so make haste!
MsgResponse4: If the pixies grow stronger as a group, they'll soon be beyond something we're capable of handling, so make haste!

MsgSummary:
The leader of Mores Woods Watch Tower, Kalinas, asked you to capture {c1}5 Mores Elite Pixies{/c}, whose recent behavior has caused some alarm.
You can find Mores Elite Pixies if you enter the center of Mores Woods.
MsgComplete: Great! Now there's just one remaining thing to fret about...
MsgTake:
Thanks to your actions, I guess we narrowly escaped a serious situation. However, we haven't hit 'em hard enough yet, so we can't afford to be careless.
According to my observation, the pixies seem to be constructing a very organized command system. Just like a pyramid, there might be a pixie at the top, leading members below. In order to debilitate the power of the pixies, it's in our best interest to take down a pixie on the top directly, but the problem is, we don't have any reliable information yet.
First, we'd better attack leading pixie members and damage their command system, making the leader easier to flush out. This time, what you have to do is to Assassinate the Mores Woods Elite Pixies that are actually leading pixie members. I suppose 3-- no, 5 will deal a huge blow to their command structure. good luck, then!
MsgIncomplete: Did you leave yet? Surely your peanut wasn't shriveled due to fear, right?
MsgResponse4: Did you leave yet? Surely your peanut wasn't shriveled due to fear, right?

MsgSummary:
The leader of Mores Woods Watch Tower, Kalinas, asked you to get rid of the pixies' Queen, {c1}Equiria{/c}, and bring the {c3}Head of Equiria{/c} back with you.
You can find Equiria among the pixie groups if you enter the center of Mores Woods.
MsgComplete: Ha ha ha!! Well done. Your bravery and skill will be known to all the Union of Fury. This is a small present I'm giving to you. Let's meet on the battlefield as friends. When we meet the Alliance of Light, we will knock them all down!
MsgTake:
We've nearly come to the finish of our campaign. The commanding pixies that stirred the others to violence are no longer a threat. However, if we don't finish this job completely, it will be worse than if we had done nothing.
Now that the leading members have died, the pixies' Queen, Equiria, has finally reveals herself directly. This is a golden opportunity to take down Equiria. If we lose this chance, all we have done so far will be for nothing, like I said before. Well! Go and eliminate Equiria and bring her head to me.
MsgIncomplete: This will be a piece of cake with skills like yours. Do not be afraid. Just go, and do what needs to be done.
MsgResponse4: This will be a piece of cake with skills like yours. Do not be afraid. Just go, and do what needs to be done.

MsgSummary:
The leader of Mores Woods Watch Tower, Kalinas, told you {c2}Vellacis{/c} in Fotamion Watch Tower is looking for you.
Find Vellacis in Fotamion Watch Tower.
MsgComplete: Ah, Kalinas sent you here? I actually asked a long time ago, but...well, anyway you're here now. You must have an intention to help me, right?
MsgTake:
While you were gone getting rid of Equiria, Vellacis sent a message from Fotamion Watch Tower. She said she completed her study of the specimen of poison and needs someone who will give it to her friend, Salpion. When I heard the reward is very nice, you suddenly came to mind.
How about this? Do you want to take on? Go to Fotamion Watch Tower and tell her I sent you.
MsgIncomplete: Unexpectedly, it seemed quite urgent. You'd better hurry up.

MsgSummary:
The poison researcher, Vellacis of Fotamion Watch Tower, asked you to deliver a poisonous chemical compound to {c2}Salpion{/c} in the Araky Woods Watch Tower.
Find Salpion in Araky Woods Watch Tower.
You can find the Araky Woods Watch Tower if you follow the route straight toward the north.
MsgComplete: Hmm? Vellacis sent you here? {c5}(receiving a Poison Frog chemical compound){/c} This is? Ah! Her research must've finally had a successful result. Thanks for delivering this.
MsgTake:
A little while ago, I researched the poison of Araky Woods Poison Frogs, and achieved an unexpected accomplishment. Someone who is completely ignorant of poison like you would probably have no idea what I'm talking about if I explained it, so let me cut to the chase.
I'd like to let Salpion, who's researching the poison of the Poisonous Spider in Araky Woods, know what I've accomplished about Poison Frog I have obtained. He is famous as an excellent poison researcher. Please deliver this Poison Frog chemical compound to Salpion in the Araky Woods Watch Tower.
MsgIncomplete: If you delay, I don't know what will happen. Hurry up!

MsgSummary:
The watcher of Mores Woods, Narutus, asked you to hunt down fierce animals in Mores Woods near the Watch Tower.
You have to hunt {c1}5 Mores Galluses{/c} and {c1}5 Mores Gray Wolves{/c} and return to Narutus.
MsgComplete: You've really got some skill to be proud of. Well done! I suppose we will be safe for a while. Let me handle the rest.
MsgTake:
Recently, the fierce animals of Mores Woods are getting more and more violent. So far, fierce animals have never come down near the Watch Tower, but now they are making frequent appearances on the roadside of this area and taking travelers by surprise. You can't imagine how much we have suffered due to this.
Now we are short-handed and we have to do something to prevent any more deaths. Would you help me? Then please go to Mores Woods and take out 5 Mores Galluses and 5 Mores Gray Wolves.
MsgIncomplete: We have no time to hesitate. Go now!
MsgResponse4: We have no time to hesitate. Go now!

MsgSummary:
The watcher of Mores Woods Watch Tower, Blair, asked you to hunt down {c1}Mores Frogs{/c}, who are croaking noisily near the Watch Tower.
You have to hunt 10 Mores Frogs and return to Blair.
MsgComplete: Ah, much better. Good job. This is just a little something to show my appreciation.
MsgTake:
{c5}(staring at you blankly with bloodshot eyes){/c} The watcher's life is too hard on me in this Watch Tower. I can't even take a break due to those annoying frogs! Croaking and croaking and croaking...the croaking noise of those frogs... I can't stand itanymore. I want...I wanna capture them all, stick a straw up their backside, and  blow them up until they explode!
Please capture at least 10 of those bothersome frogs so that I can finally sleep. I bet they'll be quiet while you're out looking for them. Oh, the irony!
MsgIncomplete: I have to get some peaceful rest or I'll go craaaaazy! Please, go get 'em!
MsgResponse4: I have to get some peaceful rest or I'll go craaaaazy! Please, go get 'em!

MsgSummary:
Salpion, the poison researcher, asked you to hunt {c1}Araky Woods Wolf Spiders{/c} and bring {c3}10 Wolf Spider Poisons{/c} you can get from them.
You can find Araky Wolf Spiders in the Araky Woods (obviously!).
MsgComplete: Well done. Now we can move on to the next step.
MsgTake:
The poison frog chemical compound that Vellacis's research distilled is a remarkable accomplishment. It gives me an excellent motivation to make another push in my own research.
The poison I'm studying now is a deadly poison of spiders; however, these spiders are too hazardous, so it's not easy to obtain material. That's why my research hasn't shown much improvement lately. When my research has been completed, I expect the attack power of Assassins and Hunters will increase enormously. What do you think? Do you want to aid me in my research?
First of all, let's begin with the basics. All you have to do is bring 10 Araky Woods Wolf Spider Poisons. This poison is absolutely hazardous, so be very careful with it, lest you move up your rendezvous with Syeeric, the God of Death.
MsgIncomplete: Handle with care. The poison of Wolf Spider is very hazardous.
MsgResponse4: Handle with care. The poison of Wolf Spider is very hazardous.

MsgSummary: Salpion needs the {c3}Aconite{/c} to strengthen the deadly poison of the Wolf Spiders. You have to take down {c1}Poison Scyther{/c} in order to get this aconite, and give the aconite she possesses to Salpion.
MsgComplete: You worked hard. Now I think the completion of my research is finally in sight. I'm dying to let the Alliance of Light taste this poison. Ha ha ha!!
MsgTake:
I don't foresee any problems with me extracting the toxins from the Wolf Spider Poison you brought. However, I predict that the poison extrated won't be potent enough just by itself. In order to make such a poison, we need a vital catalyst that will be added to the Spider poison. There is a plant called aconite in these Araky Woods. The problem is, wolf spiders are always securing that area so that we can't dig up the aconite. The Poison Scyther is a very sly Arachne.
Could you get rid of the Poison Scyther and bring the aconite she owns to me?
MsgIncomplete: Watch out. The scythe that Poison Scyther is wielding has been saturated with an extremely hazardous poison.
MsgResponse4: Watch out. The scythe that Poison Scyther is wielding has been saturated with an extremely hazardous poison.

MsgSummary: Salpion asked you to give a poison he made on his own, the Wolf Spider Compound, to {c2}Wis{/c}, a weapon merchant in Starfumos Village. You can find Starfumos Village if you follow the route toward the north.
MsgComplete: Hmm? What? Ah, Salpion sent you here? {c5}(His voice is resonant.){/c} There must have been a breakthrough in his research! Okay, I'll extend my help to him. I'll contact Salpion, so you may go now.
MsgTake: The poison I made is of a very high quality, just as planned. The only thing we need to do is perform a clinical demonstration. I'm dying to set up an experiment this ASAP.  Could you give this Wolf Spider Compound I made to Wis in Starfumos Village? He used to be a very famous soldier in the past; however, he had no choice but to leave the army due to damage to his hearing he sustained during a battle. However, there is a soldier in active service among his friends. I want to make an experimental poisoning through him. If he knows I sent you, he will promptly respond.
MsgIncomplete: Isn't it over yet? I want to know the result!

MsgSummary:
The leader of watcher in the Araky Woods Watch Tower, Zigupel, asked you to annihilate Arachnes occupying the Araky Woods.
You have to hunt {c1}5 Araky Woods Arachne Warriors{/c} and {c1}5 Araky Woods Arachne Fighters{/c} and return to Zigupel.
MsgComplete: Well done! It you a much shorter time than I expected. I'm very satisfied with you. Well, now the only thing you have to do is get rid of Kapentiel.
MsgTake:
A little while ago, one member of our team was murdered brutally in Araky Woods. The culprit turned out to be Archnes currently occupying the Araky Woods. But this is not the first time it happened. Was it fifth? No, sixth! I have no idea why this accident has happened, but the one thing I know is that we can't just let this happen anymore. I mean, we cannot just overlook what the Arachnes are doing in Araky Woods.
It turns out that Archnes live in an organized social hierarchy based on the current ruler, Kapentiel. I just want to eliminate this Kapentiel and annihilate Arachnes right now, but it isn't a good idea considering the damage we'll also suffer. First of all, I think we need to clean up the surroundings one by one.
Will you help me so that I can annihilate these Arachnes? Then, please take care of 5 Araky Woods Arachne Warriors and 5 Araky Woods Arachne Fighters. I will let you know more after you return.
MsgIncomplete: Haven't left yet? You're not afraid of spiders, are you?
MsgResponse4: Haven't left yet? You're not afraid of spiders, are you?

MsgSummary:
The leader of Araky Woods Watch Tower, Zigupel, asked you to get rid of the ruler of Arachnes, Kapentiel, who is occupying the Araky Woods.
You have to get rid of {c1}Kapentiel{/c} and return to the Zigupel with the {c3}Head of Kapentiel{/c}.
MsgComplete: Hahaha. I feel relieved. The day has finally come to be avenged for the miserable deaths of my men and my friends. Thank you, friend. Your name will spread far and wide through the Union of Fury.
MsgTake:
Well, it's time. It's time for you to let the Arachnes know who truly owns this earth beneath our feet. I'll not bother you with a long talk. Please return after you get rid of the ruler of Arachnes, Kapentiel, and the Guardians protecting him.
Be sure to bring the Head of Kapentiel to me no matter what happens. I'll get revenge upon him on behalf of all the people sacrificed so far.
MsgIncomplete: Are you scared?
MsgResponse4: Are you scared?

MsgSummary:
An information collector, Kloxe, among watchers in Araky Woods Watch Tower asked you to bring encoded information from their patroller in order to reveal the plans of the Siverpick Goblin Clan.
You have to obtain as many passwords as you can from {c1}Silverpick Goblin Patrollers{/c} within {c4}60 minutes{/c} and give them to Kloxe.
You can find the Silverpick Goblin Patroler if you head northwest of the Watch Tower.
MsgComplete: Hmm... I have to decipher this to notice their plan. I don't know what will happen. Please wait for a moment.
MsgResponse1: This is quite a large amount. I don't think I'll have any problem deciphering a password with this. Well done. Just wait a moment, please.
MsgTake:
Do you know about the Silverpick Goblins? Silverpick Goblins are the goblin clan with the most military might of all clans inhabiting this area. In addition, the society's system is very well organized and they have very wonderful solidarity. However, the problem is, they are watching for an opportunity to attack us with this solidarity. This is all the information we have. For a while now, we watchers have been trying to gather their information, but it wasn't that easy at all.
We are now trying to get rid of many Silverpick Goblin Patrollers and gather any information we can obtain from them. The problem is, there are too many, so we are having a hard time now. What I want to request to you is to bring as many passwords as possible from Silverpick Goblin Patroller. One more thing, they are sly enough to change their password every 60 minutes.
Please keep this in mind. The password becomes useless after 60 minutes pass.
MsgIncomplete: Time is ticking. Please move as fast as you can.
MsgResponse4: Time is ticking. Please move as fast as you can.

MsgSummary:
An information collector, Kloxe, among watchers in Araky Woods Watch Tower asked you to reduce their manpower in case of war against the Silverpick Goblin Clan.
You have to get rid of 7 Silverpick Goblin Warriors, the basic footsoldiers of {c1}Silverpick Clan{/c}, and return to Kloxe.
MsgComplete: Well done. Thanks to your excellent ablility, things are going very well. Anyway, there's no time like the present - let's start the next mission.
MsgTake:
Because you have collected a lot of passwords, I succeed in deciphering some of them. From now on, war against the Silverpick Clan is a possibility we'll have to assume. First of all, I already let other watchers know about this, so don't worry. Base on a decoded password, I'm hoping you can reduce their manpower a little.
The first target is Silverpick Goblin Warriors. They are incredibly violent, and possess power like that of a fierce beast. We can never just ignore them because of their small size. Please get rid of 7 of them. Other watchers are also taking care of them now, so you don't need to overexert yourself.
MsgIncomplete: This is about reducing the most basic unit in war: manpower. Please, make haste.
MsgResponse4: This is about reducing the most basic unit in war: manpower. Please, make haste.

MsgSummary:
An information collector among watchers in Araky Woods Watch Tower named Kloxe asked you to check out the information you obtained from Silverpick Goblin Clan.
You have to check out whether {c1}Siverpick Goblin Sentinels{/c} are actually gathering together or not according to the information in the password, and get rid of 10, then return to Kloxe.
MsgComplete: Well done. {c5}(You listen to the story.){/c} I knew something was wrong with the information. Hmmm...I guess I'll no longer need to receive help from you. This is small, but I wanted to give you a reward for what you have done. Goodbye.
MsgTake:
First, I succeeded in decoding the password, but the problem is I'm not sure about its accuracy. According to the information in a password, the military forces composed of Siverpick Goblin Sentinels seem to be gathering together now. Like I said, this information is not accurate one hundred percent, but I guess this is worth checking out.
Please Assassinate 10 Siverpick Goblin Sentinels and return to me to report the situation.
MsgIncomplete: Validating the accuracy of this information is very important. Hurry up.
MsgResponse4: Validating the accuracy of this information is very important. Hurry up.

MsgSummary: An information collector among the watchers in Araky Woods Watch Tower named Kloxe asked you to get rid of the Intrepidman {c1}SholserBlock{/c}, the right-hand man of the leader, Ballakashi, and bring the {c3}Head of SholserBlock{/c} for the war against the Silverpick Goblin Clan. After you get the job done, return to Kloxe.
MsgComplete: Well done. Thanks to your excellent ability, things are going very well. Well, no use in delaying; let's start the next mission.
MsgTake: According to information received from the password, the leader of Silverpick clan is Ballakashi, and the person called the "right arm of Ballakashi" is SholserBlock called an Intrepidman. Also, his men, Silverpick Goblin Fighters seem more elite than the average warrior. This SholserBlock will be our second target!
MsgIncomplete: SholserBlock is not an easy enemy to fight. Please be careful.
MsgResponse4: SholserBlock is not an easy enemy to fight. Please be careful.

MsgSummary: An information collector among watchers in Araky Woods Watch Tower named Kloxe asked you to get rid of the {c1}Necromancer Dulrahan{/c}, left-hand man of the leader, Ballakashi, and bring the {c3}Head of Dulrahan{/c} for the war against the Silverpick Goblin Clan. After you get the job done, return to Kloxe.
MsgComplete: You did an excellent job. Now, I suppose it's not a stretch to say that the chance for victory lies with us!
MsgTake: I was told that the Silverpick clan is composed of 3 branches that are very well organized. The power structure of the Silverpick clan is as follows: first, the leader Ballakashi, second the head of the combat group, the Intrepidman SholserBlock you eliminated, and finally the head of shaman group and left arm of Ballakashi, Necromancer Dulrahan. If you succeed in eliminating the Necromancer Dulrahan this time, it will deal a huge blow to Ballakashi and his forces. Please get rid of Necromancer Dulrahan and the Silverpick Goblin Shamans protecting him and return to me. Please bring us the Head of Dulrahan no matter what happens.
MsgIncomplete: Watch out. I was told that Dulrahan's spells are very powerful.
MsgResponse4: Watch out. I was told that Dulrahan's spells are very powerful.

MsgSummary: An information collector among watchers in Araky Woods Watch Tower named Kloxe asked you to get rid of the leader, Ballakashi, in order to bring an end to the war against the Silverpick Goblin clan. After you get the job done, return to Kloxe.
MsgComplete: Finally, the conflict against the Silverpick clan is over. There are still minions that remain, so we can't say we completely eradicated them all, but I guess they'll no longer rampage around this area. I greatly appreciate your help, in the name of Etain.
MsgTake:
The leader, Ballakashi, is the only one left. I figure he must be lonely now, so we'd better send him to meet his fallen compatriots as soon as possible. Hahahaha!
But it's not a smart move to underestimate his abilities. He became the leader because he has the best ability of all the Silverpick Clan Warriors.
Now is the time to kill Ballakashi and put and end to this conflict.
MsgIncomplete: It's time to finish this conflict.
MsgResponse4: It's time to finish this conflict.

MsgSummary:
Jina in Starfumos Village asked you to find 'it', Jina put in a request to Daile earlier, but has not heard back since then.
You can find {c2}Daile{/c} inside of Starfumos Village. Find the 'it' Jina requested and pay for it, then bring it back to her.
MsgComplete: Ah! Jina sent you. I'm also making an effort to prepare what she requested, but about 'it'...it's not easy for me to obtain the necessary materials to make a good contraceptive. I sometimes went out on a search for the material, but...
MsgTake:
Ahaha! This is no small undertaking. A real necessity for serving customers just ran out. A little while ago, I ordered more from Daile because I thought it was going to run out soon, but I haven't heard anything from Daile ever since. Then, this morning, I realized I had none left. 
I'm full of entrepreneurial spirit in this business-oriented world. I've been doing this to earn money for a while and I'm confident in my own abilities. Anyway, in order to do it well, I can't afford to neglect my personal well-being. That's why this is a problem: without this thing, I can't do much work tonight. Also, if a patron comes in, it's not easy for me to turn them down just because I don't have one, but it involves a lot of risk if I 'do it' without 'it.' Well, this is just my vain attempt to appeal to you, a random passerby, for sympathy...
Ah!! (Clapping) Can you really help me? Can you check out what happened to Daile, and bring 'it'? I'll give you a payment here that you can give to Daile! If you bring 'it', I'll give you a 'special service'... How about that?
MsgIncomplete: Make it quick, if you can. I've got work tonight, and I've gotta be ready~!

MsgSummary:
Daile in Starfumos Village asked you to get a material to make 'it', the thing Jina requested.
You have to capture {c1}Keuraijen Sawteeth Wild Bears{/c}, which you can find near the village, and obtain as many {c3}Guts of Sawteeth Wild Bears{/c} as possible within {c4}60 minutes{/c}.
MsgComplete: This is good enough. Just wait a little bit; it shouldn't take to long to whip this up.
MsgResponse1: Hmm, this isn't good enough, but I have no choice. I don't have much time left, so I'd better do my best to make even a few and send them along.
MsgTake:
What am I supposed to do? I know what it's like to work without 'it' because I was also in that business before. Hey! If Jina can't get 'it' before she goes to work, you can't expect to receive her 'special service', either - and you don't want to miss the 'special service!' Wait, I know...why don't you help me and bring the material I need to make 'it', and I'll give to Jina? Of course, I'll give you plenty of reward for your hard work.
The material is simple. Please gather as many Guts of Sawteeth Wild Bears as possible in the limited time we've got!
MsgIncomplete: Hurry up. It's almost time for Jina to get to work!
MsgResponse4: Hurry up. It's almost time for Jina to get to work!

MsgSummary: Daile in Starfumos Village asked you to deliver 'it' to Jina. Return to {c2}Jina{/c} with 'it.'
MsgComplete: Ah! Thank the Goddess! You're really a lifesaver~ I'll give you my 'special service' just like I promised~
MsgTake: Well, I finished making it. Go on and give this to Jina right away. Haha...I guess you want to receive a service too, right? {c5}(smile){/c} Then hurry up!
MsgIncomplete: Well, come on, you've gotta go faster.

MsgSummary: Daile in Starfumos Village asked you to deliver 'it' to Jina. Return to {c2}Jina{/c} with 'it.'
MsgComplete: Ah! There are fewer here than I was hoping for, but it's okay - I appreciate the favor all the same. Well, I'd better get ready for work. See ya~
MsgTake: Well, I finished making it. Give this to Jina right now. There isn't as much here as there ought to be, but I'll make the rest and send them to her later.
MsgIncomplete: Well, come on, you've gotta go faster.

MsgSummary: Receive 'special service' from Jina.
MsgComplete: Mmm...aaaaaah! {c5}(About ten minutes later... I feel like I'm on the border of a dream...my consciousness is fading away leaving me in a sea of pure sensuality; the pleasure is so sublime that a shudder ripples through my entire body.){/c} Well, how was it? Did it satisfy all your longings? I'll see you around; be sure to look me up whenever you're in town~!
MsgIncomplete: Hey there~ Well, I don't wanna keep you waiting; let's get started~

MsgSummary: Find Kroll, who is working as a fisherman on the Aidion ferry.
MsgComplete: Hmm? Filia? I'm really grateful to you! I said what I said, not really expecting to receive help... Anyway, I'm happy that someone is willing to lend a hand.
MsgTake: A fisherman named Kroll on the Aidion Ferry is a very nice Deatheater. He always provides good quality fish; however, these last few days, he's been so busy that he felt he was going to faint due to the request from the Tower of Blood. He wanted me to send someone to help him. Do you think you can help him out?
MsgIncomplete: Nothin' sounds finer than eating one of Kroll's fresh-caught fish right about now.

MsgSummary:
A fisherman named Kroll asked you to bring 10 {c3}Bloodsucking Wolf Meats{/c} and 10 {c3}Larva Claws{/c} in order to fill the order for groceries he received from the Tower of Blood.
You have to hunt {c1}Keuraijen Bloodsucking Wolves{/c} and {c1}Keuraijen Larva{/c} and give Kroll the items he needs.
MsgComplete: Oh! That's fantastic. I'm certain these will meet the demand.
MsgTake:
I guess you got a rough idea of the story from Filia, but I guess you don't really know all the details, so let me tell you about it. A few days ago, I took a food supply order from Solidum, a manager of the Tower of Blood. The amount I was asked to supply this time was way bigger than the amount I'm used to supplying... But I accepted his order anyway, because he's the major source of my income.
However, this amount is more than I can handle by myself.  The list of items I'd like you to bring to me is this: 10 Bloodsucking Wolf Meats and 10 Larva Claws. These are exactly what you have to bring to me. I can handle the rest. Well, go on and give it your best!
MsgIncomplete: The delivery date is just around the corner. I hope you can finish in time.
MsgResponse4: The delivery date is just around the corner. I hope you can finish in time.

MsgSummary: A fisherman named Kroll asked you to deliver the grocery order for the Tower of Blood to {c2}Solidum{/c}, a manager of the Tower of Blood. Deliver the items to a manager, Solidum in Tower of Blood.
MsgComplete: Hmm? This looks like the items we ordered from Kroll, but you're not a familiar face 'round these parts. Well, it's no problem to me so long as you're delivering what we need.
MsgTake: Well now, it looks like delivering these supplies is the only thing left. Of course, I'd like to make the delivery myself, but I've got tons of work that I've already delayed too long on. I have no choice. I hope you can help me. Please deliver this to the Tower of Blood in the northwest. All you have to do is just hand off the shipment to Solidum, a manager. Take care, then!
MsgIncomplete: Are you still here? Groceries will go stale if you take too long, so hurry up!

MsgSummary: The manager of the Tower of Blood, Solidum, asked you to give the payment for the groceries to {c2}Kroll{/c}. Deliver the payment to Kroll on the Aidion ferry.
MsgComplete: Hmm, well done. See you again, traveler.
MsgTake: Well, this is the amount I owe Kroll. Please give it to him, and tell him I look forward to doing business with him again.
MsgIncomplete: Hmm? What's up?

MsgSummary:
The god's servant, Yulmus asked you to find an officer in the Aumeros Army, {c2}Balse{/c}, whom he knows very well.
You can find Balse in the Aumeros Army Fort if you follow the route toward the east and go past the Aidion Neckria Temple.
MsgComplete: Did Yulmus send you? Heh...what an interloper he is. He must still be mulling over the complaint I made ht
MsgTake: You can find Balse in the Aumeros Army Fort. He is a Deatheater whom I know very well. When I saw him a little while ago, he seemed to be worried about a problem that occurred in the base camp. Do you think you could go to the Aumeros Army Fort and help him?
MsgIncomplete: I hope everything goes well for Balse.

MsgSummary:
Spatha in Starfumos Village let you know about the path of discipline so that you can be a true warrior and told you to find a prophet, {c2}Kalamus{/c}.
You can see his house if you follow the route toward the south from the village and take the east road of Araky Woods.
MsgComplete: Hmm. I can see that the burning fighting spirit that flows like iron in your veins has led you here, to me.
MsgTake:
If the instinct of destruction envelops your body, you already have the makings of a warrior. However, I suppose you already know that just a burning instinct of fighting and destruction alone cannot make you a true warrior. In order to be a true warrior, you must train yourself with rigorous discipline.
I want you to find the prophet Kalamus and give him this letter. You must receive the mandate from him and develop your power to fight against the disciples that will come before you. Keep in mind that this discipline is just a beginning, and start now. May Etain's will guide your future.
MsgIncomplete: Hmm? You haven't started out yet?

MsgSummary: A prophet, Kalamus, gave you the mandate which lets you begin the first trial of discipline as a warrior. In order to be a true warrior, you have to give a {c3}Fragment of Ruin{/c} that the goblin {c1}Bulta{/c} owns to Kalamus.
MsgComplete: You have finished the first trial safely. Congratulations! The material you brought will grant great power to you after you finish the last trial of discipline in the future. Now start the training again. Then, when the time of the second trial of discipline approaches, I'll find you again. Until then, I wish for the ray of hope to shine on your future.
MsgTake:
If you can't control the destruction and chaos that boils in your blood, you cannot follow the path of a true warrior. In the past, Tyrannus, the head of Deatheaters, tested his power, proved it, and showed off his thundering reputation as a powerful warrior. As you know, as a result of dealing wisely with the trials in his life, he produced an ineffaceable, magnificent achievement in the history of the Deatheaters. It is a pinnacle that all who are trying to be a warrior like him will never ever reach only through simple efforts.
However, looking at your star, I can see you have enough potential. From now on, I'll let you know the first trial of discipline your destiny has chosen for you. You have to obtain something several monsters that have been living throughout the west side of Keuraijen possess.
Bring a Fragment of Ruin owned by a goblin called Bulta to me. This will be the first trial you must endure for the sake of further discipline!
MsgIncomplete: Do not fear the future.
MsgResponse4: Do not fear the future.

MsgSummary:
Faruma in Starfumos Village let you know the path of discipline to be a true Guardian, and told you to find a prophet, {c2}Kalamus{/c}.
You can see his house if you follow the route toward the south from the village and take the east road of Araky Woods.
MsgComplete: Ah, the follower of Dayfly...I knew you would seek me out.
MsgTake: It's time for you to become an even stronger Guardian. However, in order to do so, you'll require a lot of training and discipline. There is a prophet named Kalamus in this Keuraijen District. Find him. He will let you know the ordeals you must undergo and barriers you must overcome in order for you to walk path of the great Guardian. Well, take this and find him.
MsgIncomplete: Hmm? You haven't started out yet?

QuestName: The Path of the Iron Wall (1) <Epic>
MsgSummary: A prophet, Kalamus, gave you the mandate which lets you begin the first trial of discipline as a Guardian. In order to be a Guardian with the immovability of an iron wall, you have to give a {c3}Thornshield{/c} owned by the goblin {c1}Kalragu{/c} to Kalamus.
MsgComplete: The follower of Dayfly possesses the will of iron wall - never forget that. To the very last, maintain that will and that pride. When you have grown further, I'll find you again. May Etain guide your future.
MsgTake:
As a follower of God of Protection and Defense, Dayfly, the trials of discipline you're going to undergo will make you much stronger. The small ordeals I'll give you from now on will be just a beginning; however, in the end, it can eradicate the willpower of the weak.
However, if you overcome all these ordeals, the powerful strength of Dayfly will be poured out into your body. Well, time continues to tick by, so I'll deliver the first mandate of Dayfly to you. Come back to me with a Thornshield that the Goblin Kalragu possesses, and prove your strong will, as immovable as an iron wall.
MsgIncomplete: Hmm? You haven't started out yet?
MsgResponse4: Hmm? You haven't started out yet?

MsgSummary: Fillimaris in Starfumos Village let you know the path of discipline to be a true Guardian, and told you to find a prophet, {c2}Kalamus{/c}. You can see his house if you follow the route toward the south from the village and take the east road of Araky Woods.
MsgComplete: Ah...a follower of the God of Shadow, Crisis. I knew you'd come to me.
MsgTake:
Do you want to master more magnificent powers, or do you want to have a normal life and die in vain, fated to be remembered by no one? If you want to gain more magnificent powers, you have to overcome the huge ordeal that will spread out before you. Do you know that?
If you want, I'll give you the opportunity to face the ordeal of Crisis, the God of Shadow. Do you want to go for it? If you feel you're up to it, seek out the prophet Kalamus and give him this.
MsgIncomplete: Hmm? You haven't started out yet?

MsgSummary: A prophet, Kalamus, gave you the mandate which lets you begin the first trial of discipline as an Assassin. In order to be a true Assassin with incredibly quick movements and reflexes, you have to capture a wolf, {c1}Antaran{/c} and give the {c3}Heart of Antaran{/c} to Kalamus.
MsgComplete: Follower of Crisis, omnipresent God of Shadow, don't lose the quick movement you have displayed. Once your development has progresse suitably, I'll find you again. May Etain guide your future.
MsgTake: As a follower of the God of Shadow, these trials of discipline you'll undergo will lead you much closer to Crisis. From now on, the small trials I'll give to you on behalf of Crisis might just be a warm-up, but in the end, it is possible for it to steal away everything you have. However, if you overcome all ordeals, the mighty power of Crisis will be with you. Well, time is of the essence, so I'll deliver the first mandate of Crisis to you. Capture the swift wolf Antaran and prove your quickness, then bring a Heart of Antaran to me.
MsgIncomplete: Hmm? You haven't started out yet?
MsgResponse4: Hmm? You haven't started out yet?

MsgSummary: Arucutul in Starfumos Village let you know the mandate of Pantera so that you can be born again as a mighty Hunter and told you to find a prophet, {c2}Kalamus{/c}. You can see his house if you follow the route toward south from the village and take the east road of Araky Woods.
MsgComplete: Ah...follower of Pantera, I knew you'd seek me out.
MsgTake:
Only a prepared Hunter will keep their neck safe from the fangs of the enemy. This high-degree of concentration is like an instinct to Hunters who reach this level. At your will, your weapon can penetrate an enemy's heart almost instantaneously. But first, you have to accept the discipline of the mandate Pantera is giving you.
Find the prophet Kalamus and give him this letter. He'll give you the mandate of Pantera.
MsgIncomplete: Hmm? You haven't started out yet?

MsgSummary: A prophet, Kalamus, gave you the mandate which lets you begin the first trial of discipline as a Hunter. In order to be a Hunter with a high degree of concentration, you have to capture a Gallus, {c1}Kioshyas{/c} and give a {c3}Feather of Concentration{/c} to Kalamus.
MsgComplete: O follower of Pantera, God of the Hunt, I hope you will know Pantera's favor and finish all your ordeals safely. Once you have grown in your skill, I'll find you again. May Etain guide your future.
MsgTake: The God of the Hunt, Pantera, is a mercurial man. If you can gain his blessing, you'll deliver a deathblow to the enemies you're aiming at; if not, he will distract your concentration. It is a foregone conclusion that the ordeal he'll give to you will be also mercurial and tough. However, once you overcome all ordeals Pantera sets before you, the mighty power of Pantera will be with you. Here, then, is the first mandate Pantera has given to you. Hunt a Gallus called Kioshyas and bring one unique Feather of Concentration to me. Gallus always keep a wary eye out, so you might need a high degree concentration to be successful.
MsgIncomplete: Hmm? You haven't started out yet?
MsgResponse4: Hmm? You haven't started out yet?

MsgSummary: Venekis in Starfumos Village told you of the path of discipline so that you can be born again as a mighty Pagan, and told you to find a prophet, {c2}Kalamus{/c}. You can see his house if you follow the route toward the south from the village and take the east road of Araky Woods.
MsgComplete: The child of the God of Magic, Mystra...I knew you'd come to me.
MsgTake:
There is an element at work in the foundation of all magics. Magic used without understanding this element is like trying to grasp a cloud to hold in your hands. If you want to grow to be a more powerful Pagan, you need the understanding of such an element. However, what is more important is to understand the existence of the God of Magic, Mystra and the mandate of his deputy, the God of Knowledge Foliteia. Without receiving this mandate, you won't be able to awaken to the hidden power of magic.

Find the prophet Kalamus and give him this letter. He'll let you know the mandate that will open the way to this higher path.
MsgIncomplete: Hmm? Didn't you start yet?

MsgSummary: A prophet, Kalamus, gave you the mandate which lets you begin the first trial of discipline as a Pagan. Capture a pixie, {c1}Ezella{/c} and give an {c3}Element of Magic{/c} to Kalamus.
MsgComplete: Child of abandoned Mystra, I hope you will finish all of Foliteia's ordeals safely and gain the power of the mighty elements. Once you increase in wisdom and power, I'll find you again. May Etain guide your future.
MsgTake:
Long ago when the God of Magic, Mystra, lost her body due to the rebellion of Duiminas, she withdrew her power from which magic flowed and no longer paid attention to this continent. However, the God of Knowledge, Foliteia, who is a Mystra's child and the only one who didn't lose his body - he allowed people on this continent to learn several elemental lines of magic. That was the start of the system of magic we now practice. However, the magic we can use is actually very limited. What we can use now is only magic dependent on elements...we have no way to use that shining magic that existed in the past. We are lucky, though, because the God of Knowledge, Foliteia is willing to let us know more of the ancient knowledge though the constant mandate.
I'll deliver the first mandate of Foliteia to you. Among the pixies, there is a pixie named Ezella. Get rid of that pixie and bring to me the element of magic.
MsgIncomplete: Hmm? You haven't started out yet?
MsgResponse4: Hmm? You haven't started out yet?

MsgSummary: Roricaen in Starfumos Village let you know the path of discipline so that you can be born again as a brilliant Oracle, and told you to find a prophet, {c2}Kalamus{/c}. You can see his house if you follow the route toward the south from the village and take the east road of Araky Woods.
MsgComplete: The servant of Etain...I knew you'd come to me in time.
MsgTake:
All Oracles convey the knowledge of Urbus, God of Equality, as well as Etain's Blessing. If you don't have patience and faith, you will not be able to grow strong as an Oracle. In order to convey Etain's blessing to you, soon the mandate will come down from Urbus, the God of Equality.
You must now seek out a prophet named Kalamus and give him this letter. He'll let you know the mandate that will open up your road to the future.
MsgIncomplete: Didn't head out yet? You'd better get moving.

MsgSummary: A prophet, Kalamus, gave you the mandate which lets you begin the first trial of discipline as an Oracle. In order to fulfill the mandate Urbus gave to you, capture an arachne called {c1}Karashien{/c} and give the {c3}Crystal of Patience{/c} to Kalamus.
MsgComplete: Servant of Etain, I pray you'll finish the ordeal of patience Urbus has laid before you, and that the blessing of Etain will shine everywhere once again.  Once you have grown further, I'll find you again. May the hand of Etain lead you toward the future.
MsgTake:
The God of Equality, Urbus, used to be a god who helped everyone to live peacefully and equally without disputes, on behalf of Etain, the ancient Goddess. He used to be a god who made an effort so that everybody could enjoy the blessing of Etain without any exception, and gave up his everything and endured. Thanks to him, the ancient times were peaceful ones. However, 7 disasters from another world shattered that peaceful era. The reason why we still can enjoy the blessing of Etain is due to the patience of Urbus.
Well, allow me to deliver the first mandate of Urbus. There is an arachne named Karashien. Hunt her and bring the Crystal of Patience to me.
MsgIncomplete: Hmm? You haven't started out yet?
MsgResponse4: Hmm? You haven't started out yet?

MsgSummary:
Officer Balse in Aumeros Army Fort asked you to bring 10 black leopard skins from Keuraijen Black Leopards for the repair work.
You have to follow the westward route from the Army Fort. When you find the bridge, you have to head south. Then you'll find a Keuraijen Black Leopard easily.
MsgComplete: Well done. Take this reward, though it be small, as a token of my favor.  I'll see you around, then.
MsgTake:
Recently, the Aumeros Army has been facing a lot of enemies. Elves from Alliance of Light have infiltrated into the east, and the HellTooth family, our old enemy, is seeking an oppurtunity to attack us in the south. Also, the Sealakel family is threatening us in the north. Therefore, we have no shortage of places that need to be repaired here at the fort.
That's why we need many, many black leopard skins. Now we are receiving help from many legionary soldiers, but we're always short-handed. I know you can't stay here forever, so all I want you to do is capture some Keuraijen Black Leopards and bring about 10 of their skins to me. You'll find black leopards without too much trouble if you head toward the southwest.
MsgIncomplete: Why is it taking so long? I'd really like to finish this repair work before nightfall.
MsgResponse4: Why is it taking so long? I'd really like to finish this repair work before nightfall.

MsgSummary:
Mudro, a soldier on kitchen duty in the Aumeros Army, asked you to hunt Keuraijen Bison and Keuraijen Antelope and bring 10 of each type of meat.
You can find antelope and bison if you follow the route from the Fort's western gate and head toward the north.
MsgComplete: Great! They ought to drop a couple of my demerits for this! Here's a little something for you too.
MsgTake:
Our army has too many enemies: Elves, Sealakels, HellTeeth - you name it, we're probably fightin' it. That's why resources are used up too quickly. The food situation in particular is getting worse and worse. We can't support all our units with just our limited allotment of resources anymore, so it's come time for us to hunt animals direct. I guess we need to hunt antelope and bison nearby to meet the soldiers' demand for meat. Of course, soldiers want to eat Tatoramo meat, but we have no choice, right?
Could you hunt some Keuraijen Bison and Keuraijen Antelope around this area and bring 10 of each type of meat to me? I'll make it worth your while, of course. This army isn't lacking money; it lacks food. Hahaha.
MsgIncomplete: The Legionary Soldiers' lunch time is coming up, so hurry if you can.
MsgResponse4: The Legionary Soldiers' lunch time is coming up, so hurry if you can.

MsgSummary: Lakto, an officer of the Aumeros Army asked you to get rid of {c1}7 DemonStone Troll Low Class Mercenaries{/c} and {c1}4 DemonStone HellTooth Trainers{/c}. If you follow the route south from the Army Fort, you can find the forces of the Demonstone Clan.
MsgComplete: Well done. Let's get our next sortie ready right away - we have the upper hand!
MsgTake: We are now keeping three forces in check and defending this area stubbornly against enemies. We are always living under the cloud of crises and threats. I'm in charge of the campaigns against the Demonstone Clan, a group from the HellTooth family, an old enemy of the Nordein. They have a quite a strong fighting force, based on the power of their chief, Talund DemonStone. Now I don't think they will attack us in a straightforward manner, but... What if those Elves and Sealakels make a joint strike against us?  It's a worst-case scenario. We can't guarantee our victory no matter how mighty warriors we Nordeins have. Therefore, Ornun, a chief of the army, commanded me to implement maneuvers to debilitate the Demonstone clan. However, we are short-handed, so I need your help. They are using Trolls as their slaves. Go and dispose of 7 DemonStone Troll Low Class Mercenaries and 4 DemonStone HellTooth Trainers and report back to me.
MsgIncomplete: Hurry up. There's not much time left to implement the next maneuver.
MsgResponse4: Hurry up. There's not much time left to implement the next maneuver.

MsgSummary: Lakto, an officer of the Aumeros Army, asked you to get rid of {c1}3 DemonStone HellTooth Low Class Warriors{/c} and {c1}6 DemonStone Troll High Class Mercenaries{/c}. If you follow the route south from the Army Fort, you can find the forces of the Demonstone Clan.
MsgComplete: Well-done. While you were gone, we received some unexpected intelligence reports, so I feel we need to modify our next maneuver promptly.
MsgTake:
Troll Mercenaries and Helltooth Trainers are more like a punching bag for warming up. However, their principal forces consist of Demonstone Low Class Warriors and Demonstone High Class Mercenaries. Unless you reduce their numbers, we can't reach the final objective I'm envisioning.
This time around, please get rid of 3 Demonstone Low Class Warriors and 6 Demonstone High Class Warriors.
MsgIncomplete: Hurry up. I haven't got much time left to implement the next maneuver.
MsgResponse4: Hurry up. I haven't got much time left to implement the next maneuver.

MsgSummary: Lakto, an officer of the Aumeros Army, asked you to destroy the {c1}priest's box{/c} from the DemonStone HellTooth Priest of the Demonstone Clan and bring the {c3}Plans of DemonStone{/c}, detailing their plot, to him. If you follow the route south from the Army Fort, you can find the forces of the Demonstone Clan.
MsgComplete: Hmm...this is it, eh? They have been plotting with the Sealakels. This is the tip-off I've been looking for.
MsgTake: According to the information I just received, Talund the clan chief and clan Priests are planning something. I don't know exactly what kind of plot it is, but I was told that the priests are storing some kind of parchment detailing their plot inside a box. This is urgent. I need you to infiltrate the Demonstone Clan base, destroy the Priests' Box, and bring the Plans of DemonStone that detail their plot to me.
MsgIncomplete: Pick up the pace; this is an urgent situation here!
MsgResponse4: Pick up the pace; this is an urgent situation here!

MsgSummary: Lakto, an officer of Aumeros Army, asked you to take care of {c1}Talund Demonstone{/c}. You have to get rid of him and return to Larkto with the Head of Talund. If you follow the route south from the Army Fort, you can find the forces of the Demonstone Clan.
MsgComplete: Well done. Now you can leave us to eradicate them. May Etain protect you.
MsgTake: This is an urgent situation. According to this document you brought, the Demonstone Clan signed a pact to attack our base together with the Sealakels. However, now that Talund noticed the fact that we stole this document, it's very possible that they'll invade us very soon in order not to give us any time to marshall a defense. In order to make this work, we have to take the initiative. We need to assassinate Talund Demonstone and shake up the leading members so that we can see their plans go up in smoke. Please, go there and take out Talund Demonstone, and return safely if possible.
MsgIncomplete: This is a tense situation. I pray that our battle plans do not go awry.
MsgResponse4: This is a tense situation. I pray that our battle plans do not go awry.

MsgSummary:
Balse, an officer of the Aumeros Army, asked you to take care of the Seaclad Sealakel clan who approached their territory most closely. Get rid of 7 Seaclad Sealakel Guards and 7 Seaclad Sealakel Hunters and return to Balse.
If you follow the route east from the Army Fort and then head north, you can find the Seaclad Sealakel Clan's forces.
MsgComplete: Well done. Perhaps we can safely say that we blunted their edge, so to speak. However, their main divisions are still intact.
MsgTake:
The Seaclad Sealakel family situated to the northeast of the base was not a native monster. They were originally monsters who used to inhabit the coral island of Maelstrom Coast.
Well, it is not important. What matters the most is they are now threatening us. Currently, the Seaclad Clan is right under our noses. We have to attend to the most urgent matters first. Please get rid of 7 Seaclad Sealakel Guards and 7 Seaclad Sealakel Hunters who are encroaching on our territory.
MsgIncomplete: We can no longer let their forces grow unchecked.
MsgResponse4: We can no longer let their forces grow unchecked.

MsgSummary:
Balse, an officer of Aumeros Army, asked you to take care of the {c1}Seaclad Sealakel Warriors{/c} and {c1}Seaclad Sealakel Summoners{/c} and bring 6 of their {c3}skulls{/c} to him.
If you follow the route east from the Army Fort and then head north, you can find the Seaclad Sealakel Clan's forces.
MsgComplete: Well done. You perform well for a freelancer, I must say.
MsgTake: From now on, we need to keep the main forces of the Seaclad family in check. Their intelligence is not good enough to remember the fact we blunted their edge, so we have to give them such a beatdown that it'll even be burned into their goldfish-like memories. Please take out some Seaclad Sealakel Warriors and Seaclad Sealakel Summoners and collect six of their skulls.
MsgIncomplete: We can no longer allow their power to grow unchecked.
MsgResponse4: We can no longer allow their power to grow unchecked.

MsgSummary:
Balse, an officer of the Aumeros Army, asked you to take care of the {c1}Seaclad Sealakel Fighters{/c} and {c1}Seaclad Sealakel Priests{/c}, and bring 3 of their {c3}skulls{/c} to him.
If you follow the route east from the Army Fort and then head north, you can find the Seaclad Sealakel Clan's forces.
MsgComplete: Just you wait, Sealakels...I'll give you the worst memories you've ever had!  Worse than Sealakel High School!
MsgTake: This time, I'd like you to dispose of some Seaclad Sealakel Fighters and a Seaclad Sealakel Priests and collect their 3 skulls respectively. Keep up the good work.
MsgIncomplete: We can't let their growth go unchecked anymore.
MsgResponse4: We can't let their growth go unchecked anymore.

MsgSummary:
Balse, an officer of the Aumeros Army, asked you to get rid of the lord of the Seaclad Sealakel, {c1}Xaduk{/c} and bring a {c3}Head of Xaduk{/c}.
If you follow the route east from the Army Fort and then head north, you can find the Seaclad Sealakel Clan's forces.
MsgComplete: Well done. I hope this teaches them their lesson - don't mess with the Aumeros Army!
MsgTake: I made an ornament from the Skulls of the Seaclad family you've been bringing me and sent it to their leader, Lord Xaduk. Perhaps the great Lord Xaduk of the Seaclad family may be feeling rather irrational and furious right now, unable to think straight. I guess eliminating Xaduk now won't be as difficult. Go to the camp once more and assassinate Xaduk, then return to me with his head!
MsgIncomplete: Have you brought Xaduk's head?
MsgResponse4: Have you brought Xaduk's head?

MsgSummary:
It seems Balse, an officer of the Aumeros Army, wants you to get rid of Solturas, a Guardian of the Seaclad Sealakels. In light of his hesitation to ask for your help, this enemy seems to be very powerful. Don't try this alone - recruit friends and allies to help you.
You can find Solturas deep within of force of Seaclad Sealakel family if you follow the western route from the Army Fort.
MsgComplete: I can't believe this! You achieved an amazing deed that's gonna make you a hero. You finished off Solturas... Just wait, I'll prepare the best reward the Aumeros Army has ever bestowed!
MsgTake:
Because you got rid of Lord Xaduk, the Seaclad family is in chaos, but the chaos is not as intense as we had hoped. According to the info gathered from our reconaissance, the Lord Xaduk was more like their mental support, so we just imagined the Seaclad family would collapse like a house of cards and scatter if we got rid of Xaduk. However, that was a miscalculation on my part.
It turned out there is a Guardian even more imposing than Xaduk. Unless you dispose of this Guardian of the Seaclads, a gigantic hydra named Solturas, I figure their threat will continue unabated. If only we could get rid of Solturas....
MsgIncomplete: If you intend to confront Solturas, don't go there alone. You're almost guaranteed to meet a quick death.
MsgResponse4: If you intend to confront Solturas, don't go there alone. You're almost guaranteed to meet a quick death.

MsgSummary:
Ornun, a chief of the Aumeros Army, asked you to get rid of {c1}5 Greenbare Elf Rangers{/c} and {c1}5 Greenbare Elf Archers{/c}.
If you exit the northeast gate of the Army Fort and follow the eastward route, you can find the Greenbare Base.
MsgComplete: It seems your skill is considerable; more than I'd guessed at first.
MsgTake: As the war drags out longer and longer, just like like us in the Union of Fury, the Alliance of Light is secretly starting to gain more and more "friendly faces" inside the sphere of our influence. Those elves of Greenbare Base are a good example. If they spy out the Keuraijen district and constantly convey information to the Alliance of Light, I'm afraid we can't display a strong show of our forces on the front line due to the danger of the rear. We have already held them back several times before, but they always seem to be recruiting more men. You have to stop them from continuing their recruitment drive. Please take care of their main force, 5 Greenbare Elf Rangers and 5 Greenbare Elf Archers.
MsgIncomplete: Move out now, and put a stop to this.
MsgResponse4: Move out now, and put a stop to this.

MsgSummary:
Ornun, a chief of the Aumeros Army, asked you to bring a {c3}Scroll of Elf Magic{/c} the Elven magicians possess, in order to find out the secret of Elven magic.
If you follow the eastern route and go southeast at a crossroads, you can find the Mage's Box in the Greenbare Base.
MsgComplete: Huh!? What are all these squiggly lines and shapes? It'd take a magician just to read this gibberish! I'd better hand this document over to the Vail and let them figure this out.
MsgTake:
Well, you've clearly shown me you've got the skills. This time, I'm interested in discovering a secret the Elves are hiding. As you know, the magic of the Elves operates on a different foundation from what the Vail in our Union use. Our informant witnessed that they're storing this magical document inside a box. If we get to know their secret, we can get a solid advantage in every battle!
Well, good luck. Go and destroy that box the Elven magicians are holding onto and bring that secret Scroll of Elf Magic to me.
MsgIncomplete: Well, get a move on - I'm curious to see that scroll!
MsgResponse4: Well, get a move on - I'm curious to see that scroll!

MsgSummary:
Ornun, a chief of the Aumeros Army, asked you to get rid of {c1}Ashalra Nightrunner{/c}, a commander of Greenbare base and bring the {c3}Weapon of Ashalra{/c}.
If you follow the eastern route and go southeast at a crossroads, you can find Ashalra Nightrunner inside the Greenbare Base.
MsgComplete: Good job. I've gotta tip my hat...er, my helm, to your skill.
MsgTake:
Ashalra Nightrunner, who commands the Greenbare base, is definitely an excellent commander. I have faced her several times before, but her skill was a match for any Nordein warrior. I know she is our enemy, but also can't deny that she deserves respect.  In the end, though, an enemy is nothing but an enemy. We can't help but have a difficult time due to her presence here.
Please, send her to Etain's side, so that she can't intimidate us anymore. If you succeed in defeating her, please bring her weapon rather than cutting off her head, to honor her.
MsgIncomplete: Killing Ashalra is an unfortunate thing, but the deed needs to be done.
MsgResponse4: Killing Ashalra is an unfortunate thing, but the deed needs to be done.

MsgSummary: Rakunda, a chief of the Aumeros Army, asked you to find a Dragon Hunter called {c2}Dragonbane{/c} in the Watch Tower of the Ruber Chaos district. If you go straight toward the south, you'll find the Ruber Chaos Watch Tower.
MsgComplete: You heard I need someone who can help me? I may be getting on in years, but I'm still an active Dragon Hunter! My dignity isn't so weak that I need help!
MsgTake:
There is a strong Nordein called a Dragon Hunter, who goes by the name of Dragonbane. He's not strong enough to take down a mighty high dragon, but he is very famous to us Nordein for hunting a dragon.
I was told he is looking for someone who will help him with a task. Go there - this could be a good opportunity for you to earn the title of Dragon Hunter.
MsgIncomplete: Being a Dragon Hunter...it's like a grand dream from when we were in our youth...

MsgSummary: Arctural, a chief of the Aumeros Army, told you to find the headman of Aruma Village, {c2}Gadanya{/c}. If you go straight toward the north along the route, you can find Aruma Village.
MsgComplete: Here, I'll tell you the reason I've been looking for you.
MsgTake: If you follow the route toward the north, you'll find Aruma Village. Find Gadanya, the headman of the village. He's looking for you.
MsgIncomplete: I don't know why he's looking for you; you should go yourself and find out.

MsgSummary: The owner of a butcher's shop, Traky, asked you to capture {c1}Gigas Wild Boars{/c} and {c1}Gigas Tatoramos{/c} and bring 5 of each of their meats in order to turn the tides of the food shortage situation. You can find wild boars and tatoramos easily if you exit the village and look around the surrounding area.
MsgComplete: Thanks. I know it ain't much, but here's a little something for helping me out.
MsgTake: This has really become a big issue. As the war goes on and on, many Hunters also keep heading out to the battlefield, so the food situation is getting worse. At least this area is a bit better than other places thanks to Warune, but it doesn't mean we have a good food situation. So, do you think you could help us out? Could you capture some Gigas Wild Boars and Gigas Tatoramos and bring me their meat?
MsgIncomplete: Stronger than the growling of the wild is the growling of my stomach!
MsgResponse4: Stronger than the growling of the wild is the growling of my stomach!

MsgSummary: Serko, a Hunter of Aruma Village, asked you to get rid of 7 Gigas Goblin Hunters that have been disturbing the hunting in the area. You can find Gigas Goblin Hunters easily if you exit the village and look around the surrounding area.
MsgComplete: Thanks. We'll all be much better off for it, I'm sure.
MsgTake:
Gaaaah!! These days I'm having so much trouble catching any fish, thanks to those Goblin hunters. {c5}(He screams in an absolute excitement.){/c} We were already taxing our limits because the demand for food has gone up so much, but I can't even hunt anything with those Goblins running around disturbing everything. We just end up in pointless fights with them all the time.
Can you dispose of those Goblins for me?
MsgIncomplete: Take 'em all out; that's what I want!
MsgResponse4: Take 'em all out; that's what I want!

MsgSummary: Indika, a weapon merchant of Aruma Village, asked you to collect 7 Soulstones, materials used for making a weapon. You can obtain a {c3}Soulstone{/c} from {c1}Gigas Stone Golems{/c}. You can find golems around the north of village.
MsgComplete: Much thanks, friend. This is just my little way of saying thanks; take it.
MsgTake:
I add a special material to the weapons I'm making, which separates them from the weapons made by other weapon-makers. My special ingredient is a stone called a Soulstone, which I get from Stonegolem. I just got an order, so I was trying to make several weapons, but I just realized I'm totally out of Soulstones.
I've heard people mention you quite a bit. Do you think you could do me a favor and bring me 7 Soulstones?
MsgIncomplete: The faster you bring me those stones, the faster I can craft that weapon order.
MsgResponse4: The faster you bring me those stones, the faster I can craft that weapon order.

MsgSummary: Maltimo, a defense item merchant of Aruma Village, asked you to collect 7 Sian Crystals. You can obtain a Sian Crystal from {c1}Gigas Beholders{/c}. You can find Beholders around the south of village.
MsgComplete: Oh! Thanks. Well. This is a small token of my heart. Take it.
MsgTake: The armor I'm making is a special type. My special ingredient is a material called a Sian Crystal, taken from Gigas Beholders. If I crush a Sian Crystal, dissolve it in water, and apply it as a plaster to a piece of armor, it becomes very resilient. They sell so well that, as you can see, I don't have any Sian Crystals left! I've heard the stories going around about you, and I was wondering if you could bring me 7 Sian Crystals...
MsgIncomplete: The faster we can get this done, the better.
MsgResponse4: The faster we can get this done, the better.

MsgSummary: Gadanya, a headman of Aruma Village, asked you to go to Aulen in order to maintain the safety of Gigas Swamp, which has become increasingly dangerous due to the presence of a Viper named Kilian. You can find {c2}Aulen{/c} near the swamp if you exit the village and make your way west.
MsgComplete: Hush! Keep quiet! {c5}(looks right and left quickly.){/c} This place is dangerous.
MsgTake:
The Kilian of Arma Village is a very aggressive and cunning viper. Even the surrounding monsters rally around this cunning viper. However, there is another viper, named Aulen, who seems to have fallen in love with Kilian. We approached her by pretending to help her and in the meantime, keep our eyes on the movement of Kilian and the monsters following him around. Their recent movement seems to indicate that Kilian has nearly succeeded in uniting the forces of surrounding monsters.
I can't overlook what they're doing anymore. Please go and see Aulen. Obtain the information from Aulen and find Kilian's weak point.
MsgIncomplete: Hurry up. We don't have much time.

MsgSummary:
A Viper of Gigas Swamp asked you to get rid of {c1}5 Gigas Swamp Watchers{/c} and {c1}5 Seaclad Sealakel Looters{/c} and report your result to Gadanya.
You have to hunt them in Gigas Swamp and return to Gadanya in Arma Village.
MsgComplete: Well done. Now that we blunted the power of Kilian's allies, Kilian will be in doubt.
MsgTake: Kilian succeeded in gathering all Sealakels and Beholders in the surrounding area together, but this union is not perfect and they is naturally some discord. It's not incorrect to say that the collaboration doesn't even technically exist right now. Like what Gadanya said, if we don't do anything about this now, their discord might actually melt away soon. Now, we have to eliminate these allies one by one. First, take care of 5 Gigas Swamp Watchers and 5 Seaclad Sealakel Looters and return to Gadanya to report your result. Plus, tell Gadanya not to forget what he promised to me.
MsgIncomplete: We'll be at a disadvantage if we give them much time.

MsgSummary: Gadanya asked you to dispose of {c1}Kilian{/c} and bring the {c3}Head of Kilian{/c} to him. Take care of Kilian in Gigas Swamp and return to Gadanya in Arma Village.
MsgComplete: Good job. I suppose we don't have to worry about them for the time being. I'd better deliver this head to Aulen as promised. We Nordein never break our promises, even with monsters.
MsgTake: In this situation, if you take out Kilian, I suspect the collaboration between vipers and the other monsters will totally disintigrate. Take out of Kilian and bring his head to me.
MsgIncomplete: Get in quickly, do what you must, then get out as quickly as possible.
MsgResponse4: Get in quickly, do what you must, then get out as quickly as possible.

MsgSummary:
Abet asked you to find {c2}Warune Beastblood{/c}, who needs help. 
Follow the route westward from the village and go to Warune's Hunter camp.
MsgComplete: You come by way of Abet's introduction? Fine! Let's see the kind of skill you can muster!
MsgTake: If you head westward from Arma Village, you'll find a Hunters' Camp where Hunters are living together. The leader of that encampment, Warune Beastblood, is having a hard time due to Goblins, so he's looking for someone who will help take out that menace.
MsgIncomplete: If you think you can help him out, go and pay him a visit.

MsgSummary:
A Hunter named Sankaritar asked you to capture several {c1}Ballas Tatoramos{/c} and bring {c3}7 Tatoramo meats{/c}.
You can find the Tatoramos near the camp.
MsgComplete: Very good, you've certainly impressed me with your skills. Do you think you could do one more thing for me?
MsgTake: Wow; I'm always amazed by how tasty Tatoramo meat is! Ballas Tatoramo meat is the best - it's not chewy, but smooth and succulent. That's why we got tons of orders, even if the price is expensive. Anyway, I'm sorry to bother you, but could you hunt Ballas Tatoramos and bring 7 Tatoramo meats while I take a rest? Don't worry - meat-hunters always give a good CUT of the profit! Hahaha!
MsgIncomplete: Watch out. Tatoramos look mild, but they're far from weak.
MsgResponse4: Watch out. Tatoramos look mild, but they're far from weak.

MsgSummary: A Hunter named Sankaritar asked you to capture {c1}Uruger Tatoramos{/c} and bring {c3}7 Tatoramo Skins{/c}. You can find the Tatoramos near the camp.
MsgComplete: Good. Good. Well, this is a reward to you. Take care.
MsgTake:
Tatoramos don't just have delicious meat, their skin is really useful too. Uruger Tatoramo skin is as sturdy as iron, so we have a rush of orders. It's good to have business booming, but we've got no time to catch a breather.
And...I'm sorry to trouble you for this, but could you hunt a few Uruger Tatoramos and bring 7 Tatoramo Skins to me? I'll give you a satisfying reward for your troubles.
MsgIncomplete: Watch out. Tatoramos look mild, but they're far from weak.
MsgResponse4: Watch out. Tatoramos look mild, but they're far from weak.

MsgSummary:
Warune Beastblood asked you to bring as many {c3}Hunter Ornaments{/c} as possible from the most basic {c1}WoodWedge Goblin Hunter{/c} within {c4}60 minutes{/c}.
You can find Goblins easily if you head south of the camp.
MsgComplete: Hmm...it seems as though our information is really limited.
MsgResponse1: Hmm...I can hardly figure this out.
MsgTake:
The WoodWedge clan possessing a sphere of influence in this area used to be monsters without much of a violent nature, but since a little while back, I can tell they've been up to something. It appears some sort of plan is in progress based around a clan chief named Kazuinashi. I need solid information as to what on earth they're cooking up.
I was told that the WoodWedge clan imbues their ornaments with important information by using a particular type of spell. The lowest rank of WoodWedge infantry are the WoodWedge Goblin Hunters.
Please steal their ornaments and bring them to me. The more, the better, and keep in mind that I don't have much time.
MsgIncomplete: Time is ticking, hurry up.
MsgResponse4: Time is ticking, hurry up.

MsgSummary:
Warune Beastblood asked you to bring {c3}5 Ornaments of Samurai{/c} from {c1}WoodWedge Goblin Samurai{/c} in order to obtain information from the WoodWedge Clan.
You can find Goblins easily if you go toward south of camp.
MsgComplete: Hmm...well, now I'm at least starting to grasp the general idea, more or less.
MsgTake: As I suspected, the information a Hunter has access to doesn't amount to much. All I found out was a word like a Kalcuel. I need real info - I need the cold, hard facts of the matter. Please bring just 5 ornaments of the Goblin Samurai of WoodWedge Clan. I suspect that this time, you'll probably uncover much better information.  At leat, that's what I'm hoping for.
MsgIncomplete: When devising a strategy, every second counts.
MsgResponse4: When devising a strategy, every second counts.

MsgSummary:
Warune Beastblood asked you to bring {c3}5 Ornaments of Trainees{/c} from {c1}Woodwedge Goblin Trainees{/c} in order to obtain information on the WoodWedge Clan.
You can find goblins easily if you head south of the camp.
MsgComplete: Hmm...I'm starting to believe I can't obtain the information I'm after. It's all right. I'll let other Hunters dig into this. Thanks for your help all the same.
MsgTake: I couldn't figure out anything from the Ornaments of Hunters you brought. This time, I need to collect information from WoodWedge Goblin Trainees. Please bring just 7 Trainee Ornaments. I'm hoping to find some information of substance this time around.
MsgIncomplete: Time's ticking, so get a move on.
MsgResponse4: Time's ticking, so get a move on.

QuestName: The Magic Box of WoodWedge Clan
MsgSummary:
Warune Beastblood asked you to bring {c3}Gigantism Order Sheet{/c} from a {c1}magic box{/c} in order to understand the spell WoodWedge clan is performing.
You can find magic boxes in the center of the Goblin encampment.
MsgComplete: You did a fine job. I don't think we'll be able to avoid clashing with these Goblins, though.
MsgTake: This time, I actually got some information we can act on. The Goblins seem to be performing a certain ancient spell. I guess this is some sort of ritual in which they summon a gigantic goblin they believe to be their god. It appears there is information entitled 'Gigantism Order Sheet' on the ornament you obtained. I'd like you to check out whether or not it really exists.
MsgIncomplete: Let's pick up the pace - the sooner we know, the better.
MsgResponse4: Let's pick up the pace - the sooner we know, the better.

MsgSummary: Warune Beastblood asked you to assassinate the great prophet {c1}Kazuinashi{/c} in order to stop the WoodWedge Clan from casting a summoning spell, and bring back an {c3}Ornament of Kazuinashi{/c}.
MsgComplete: Damn, just our luck - Kalcuel was summoned already!
MsgTake: I've got a firm grasp of this Goblin conspiracy now. If we just leave them alone like this, we might lose our entire hunting ground. I think we need to get rid of Kazuinashi, a chief and prophet of the clan, before Kalcuel is summoned. The time is drawing near. I only pray that the ritual to summon Kalcuel has not yet begun. Please take out Kazuinashi and bring his ornament to me.
MsgIncomplete: You can think of this as "killing for prophet."
MsgResponse4: You can think of this as "killing for prophet."

MsgSummary:
Warune Beastblood asked you to get rid of the {c1}Enormous Kalcuel{/c} the WoodWedge Clan summoned, and bring the {c3}Head of Kalcuel{/c} back to the camp. It's best to gather friends for this mission - it's dangerous to tackle Kalcuel alone.
If you head eastward along the river from the WoodWedge Goblins' habitat, you will find the Kalcuel alone.
MsgComplete: Ah! Thanks be to the Goddess. {c5}(Exhales a sigh of relief.){/c} You did an excellent job, and did us Hunters a great favor. May Etain guide your path!
MsgTake: Looks like we have no choice now. Go and gather as many allies as you can, and unite your strength to take down Kalcuel. I'm fairly certain it hasn't been long since he was summoned, so I doubt his true power has fully materialized. Go, and may Etain guard your life.
MsgIncomplete: Size matters not - defeat him you must.
MsgResponse4: Size matters not - defeat him you must.

QuestName: The Call of Urtas, the Great Oracle
MsgSummary:
A Hunter, Spike, told you Urtas, the Great Oracle in Aidion Neckria, is looking for you.
Go to Aidion Neckria and find Urtas.
MsgComplete: May Etain guide your path...The reason why I have been looking for you is grave matter happened to Aidion Neckria.
MsgTake: Ah, I have a message for you.  I have lately come from Aidion Neckria, and knowing my destination, the great oracle Urtas sent word with me that he urgently wishes to speak with you.  Go now, and seek him out.
MsgIncomplete: I could see the quiet desperation in his eyes. Something must be terribly amiss...
MsgResponse4: I could see the quiet desperation in his eyes. Something must be terribly amiss...

MsgSummary: A Hunter named Zest informed you that the Meteora North Fort is holding a recruitment drive. Find a secretary, {c2}Tenor{/c} in Meteora North Fort.
MsgComplete: What brought you here? Ah! You wanna apply for the army, right?
MsgTake: I was told Meteora North Fort is recruiting people. I wish I could go there, but I can't leave this place. Why don't you go there, though? Your fighting skill is excellent; they could really use someone like you on the battlefield. Just find Tenor the secretary; he takes care of the enlistments.
MsgIncomplete: Go on now, give it a shot - you'll never know if you never try!

MsgSummary:
Razum, a chief of guards, asked you to get rid of {c1}7 White Lion Warriors{/c} and return.
You can find the White Lion Base easily if you follow the road to the west.
MsgComplete: Well done. Credit where credit is due - your skills are very keen.
MsgTake:
We're now in a series of military engagements with the White Lion Army, a human force belonging to the Alliance of Light. They are constantly infiltrating here through Esphelaya mountain range, so we're considerably short of manpower right now. If our defenses here are penetrated, those disgusting Alliance of Light pansies will instantly be able to push through as far as the capital, Iris. Obvioiusly, that's not something we can allow to happen.
Please go thin out the number of warriors, the main forces of the White Lion Base, so that we can buy some time. About 7 will be good enough for this sortie. While you do your job, I'll have our troops regroup and regain their energy.
MsgIncomplete: Make haste - each moment spent in idleness wears down our chance of success.
MsgResponse4: Make haste - each moment spent in idleness wears down our chance of success.

MsgSummary:
Razum, a chief of guards, asked you to get rid of {c1}5 White Lion Priests{/c} and return.
You can find the White Lion Base easily if you follow the route toward the west.
MsgComplete: Well done. I have to pay my respect to your considerable skill.
MsgTake: The human priests seem to serve the same role as our Oracles. Most of the manpower of the White Lion Army is supported by those priests.
