If they fight together with the warriors, their battle potential increases dramatically. Can you take care of this one too? We don't have a lot of time to do this. Please take out about 5 White Lion Priests.
MsgIncomplete: Time is of the essence here.
MsgResponse4: Time is of the essence here.

MsgSummary:
Razum, a chief of guards, asked you to get rid of a {c1}Commander of White Lion Base, Willian Rigun{/c} and return with the Head of William.
You can find Commander Willian Rigun within the White Lion Base.
MsgComplete: Well done. Because of your skill, we'll have no more trouble from that commander.
MsgTake: It's time to display our true power. However, Willian Rigun, a Commander of the White Lion Army, is a tough nut to crack. While you are fighting, I hope you're able to take out Commander Rigun. I hope to see you return safely, bearing the head of William Rigun.
MsgIncomplete: You have to hurry if you want to get a head in life.
MsgResponse4: You have to hurry if you want to get a head in life.

QuestName: The Secret of Silence Doom Temple
MsgSummary: Tenor, secretary, asked you whether you have the intention of challenging the mysterious power of Silence Doom Temple situated to the west of the Fort.
MsgComplete: If you made up your mind, I'll let you know what you have to do from now.
MsgTake:
The ancient Silence Doom Temple situated to the west of this place is enveloped by an unknown power. If only we, the Union of Fury, could possess this unknown power, it would doubtless afford us a great advantage.
However, there are ancient Guardians securing the temple. There are very formidable beings, so consider whether you feel you're up to it, then come talk with me again.

MsgSummary: Tenor, a secretary, asked you to get rid of ancient devils {c1}Ultosian{/c} and {c1}Baral{/c} in order to destroy the Aristera district in Silence Doom Temple situated to the west of the Fort. You can find Ultosian and Baral in the west area if you enter Silence Doom Temple.
MsgComplete: I hope we've been able to diminish the power of the ancient devils in the Silence Doom district. Now, let us start the next phase of the plan quickly.
MsgTake:
Silence Doom Temple largely consists of 3 parts, guarded by no less than 5 ancient devils. Eliminating these devils is the only way to discover the power of the temple. However, in light of the "disappointing results" of several of our previous attempts, we reached to a conclusion that this is not a good idea.
After that, we discovered some information related to Silence Doom in the some ancient documents. We can only eliminate the threat if we destroy the 3 parts one by one in the correct order.
I'll let you know how to proceed, so listen carefully and do things in the order I'm about to give you.
First, what you have to destroy is the Aristera district. Ancient devils called Ultosian and Baral are securing this place. Get rid of those two and return to me. Once you return, I'll let you know the second thing that must be done.
MsgIncomplete: These are powerful enemies we're dealing with. Stay sharp out there.
MsgResponse4: These are powerful enemies we're dealing with. Stay sharp out there.

MsgSummary: Tenor, a secretary, asked you to get rid of ancient devils, {c1}Quvellea{/c} and {c1}Lympros{/c} in order to destroy the Dexia district in Silence Doom Temple situated to the west of the Fort. You can find Quvellea and Lympros in the right-side area if you enter Silence Doom Temple.
MsgComplete: The power of Silence Doom Temple's ancient devil guardians is greatly waning. There's just one more area to go before their power is vanquished entirely.
MsgTake: This time, you must destroy the Dexia district. The ancient devils called Quvellea and Lympros guard this area with their infernal might. Destroy these two fiends, then return to me.
MsgIncomplete: These are powerful enemies we're dealing with. Stay sharp out there.
MsgResponse4: These are powerful enemies we're dealing with. Stay sharp out there.

MsgSummary:
Tenor, a secretary, asked you to get rid of the Deicide, {c1}Absalras{/c}, in the center of Silence Doom Temple to the west of the Fort.
You can find Absalras in the center of Silence Doom Temple.
MsgComplete: We don't yet know how to lift the curse of Silence Doom Temple, but we'll come to a much greater understanding of the ancient era thanks to you. May Etain guard your path.
MsgTake: Have you ever heard of "Deicide" before? Deicide is the act of killing a god. In the past, Duiminases, proud of killing their mother Etain, called their act "deicide." It is the pinnacle of arrogance. However, this arrogance brought about the destruction of a continent as well as the wrath of the goddess. People say that Silence Doom Temple retains the power of the arrogant Duiminas who aspired to deicide, and these arrogant Duiminases were brought back to life as devils, because of the goddess's curse. That legend exists - it is the devil Absalras who resides in the center of temple. Now that Absalras is left alone, please confront and defeat him.
MsgIncomplete: These are powerful enemies we're dealing with. Stay sharp out there.
MsgResponse4: These are powerful enemies we're dealing with. Stay sharp out there.

MsgSummary:
A Dragon Hunter named Dragonbane asked you to hunt {c1}Dragon Dens Hatchlings{/c} and bring {c3}7 Hatchling Skins{/c}.
You can find Dragon Dens Hatchlings easily to the north of the Watch Tower.
MsgComplete: Hmmm...you're really a Hunter at heart, eh? Why don't you become a Dragon Hunter? Hahaha! I was just a kidding, y'know.
MsgTake: A variety of materials we take from dragon clans are used for imbuing things we make with formidable power. Even when processed roughly, the skin and bone of even adolescent dragons contain a lot of power. However, the problem is, unless Tyrannus was somehow resurrected, it'd be impossible to take on fully-matured dragons. That's why we hunt young hatchlings or wyverns, a sub-class of dragon, instead. First, simply hunt hatchlings and bring 7 Hatchling Skins.
MsgIncomplete: A dragon hatchling is still a dragon. Don't underestimate them and get careless.
MsgResponse4: A dragon hatchling is still a dragon. Don't underestimate them and get careless.

MsgSummary:
A Dragon Hunter named Dragonbane asked you to hunt {c1}Tiny Horn Wyverns{/c} and bring {c3}7 Horns of Wyvern{/c}.
You can find Tiny Horn Wyverns easily north of the Watch Tower.
MsgComplete: Great! You're very skilled at hunting. If that's the case, I've got a more demanding job all lined up for you!
MsgTake: This time, I want you to bring me something from wyverns. Tiny Horn Wyverns are provide one of the premier materials from Dragon Dens.  With that in mind, I'd like you to hunt some Tiny Horn Wyverns and bring me 7 Horns of Wyvern.
MsgIncomplete: Wyverns have a wild nature that's unpredictable. You'd better be careful.
MsgResponse4: Wyverns have a wild nature that's unpredictable. You'd better be careful.

MsgSummary: A Dragon Hunter named Dragonbane asked you to find the DragonRock and bring {c3}Dragon Hearts{/c}. You can find the DragonRock on the top of DragonDens northwest of Watch Tower.
MsgComplete: (You've found a DragonRock)
MsgTake: A "Dragon Heart" isn't some figurative term - it's actually the heart of a dragon, taken during the period of adolescence. The older the dragon gets, the better quality of the Dragon Heart. No one has ever captured dragons at an adolescence stage except Tyrannus, so we obtain dragon hearts from the fossils of old dragons. This dragon den itself is formed from the fossil of dragons. That's why we discovered dragon hearts quite frequently there. Go to the top of dragon den and bring some dragon hearts from DragonRock.
MsgIncomplete: Keep on the lookout. Dragon Tooth Warriors inhabit the area, and may be prowling around.
MsgResponse4: Keep on the lookout. Dragon Tooth Warriors inhabit the area, and may be prowling around.

MsgSummary: Go back to {c2}Dragonbane{/c} with the {C3}Dragon Hearts{/c} you have collected from DragonRock.
MsgComplete: Oh; quite a nice job you've done. It must have been very difficult to find these. Here, take this; just a small gift to say thanks to you.
MsgTake: There is a strange ray of light twinkling from one spot on the DragonRock. You chip away the shining spot carefully...
MsgWelcome: The rock looks very hard...and somewhat suspicious.
MsgIncomplete: The rock looks very hard...and somewhat suspicious.
MsgResponse4: The rock looks very hard...and somewhat suspicious.

QuestName: The Power Source of the Dragon Tooth Warriors
MsgSummary:
Tultan, an assistant of the Dragon Hunter, asked you to collect {c3}Crimson Bones{/c} and {c3}Scarlet Bones{/c}, which you can get from {c1}Dragon Tooth Knights{/c} and {c1}Dragon Tooth Magicians{/c}.
Please hunt Dragon Tooth Knights and Dragon Tooth Magicians, which you can find in the Dragon Den district, and give 5 Crimson Bones and 5 Scarlet Bones to Tultan.
MsgComplete: Well done. Allow me to compensate you a little for your efforts.
MsgTake: I'm different from the Dragon Band, so I'm more interested in materials from Dragon Tooth Warriors. I was told Dragon Tooth Warriors are a sort of Golem made from the enchanted teeth of a grown dragon, so their health and mana are very high. Such Dragon Tooth Warriors inhabit Dragon Dens here. Of course, they are incredibly violent because there is no dragon to control them. What I'm interested in is Crimson Bones and Scarlet Bones, which you can obtain from Dragon Tooth Knights and Dragon Tooth Magicians. Five of each should fulfill the need quite nicely.
MsgIncomplete: Why does it seem to be taking so long, anyway?
MsgResponse4: Why does it seem to be taking so long, anyway?

MsgSummary: Get rid of Hawl Katsuran and report back to Parutus. You can find Hawl Katsuran inside of Dragon Tooth Warrior group at the Dragons Dens.
MsgComplete: Well done. Now we can enjoy peace of mind for a while.
MsgTake: We Watchers of Ruber Chaos Watch Fort are keeping our eyes on vampires of Ruber Chaos. We can't even take a break because of the rumor their Queen Mago is about to resurrect, but, the commander of Dragon Tooth Warriors, Hawl Katsuran, noticed it, and he is constantly intimidating us. One misfortune seems to follow another like sun follows rain. Once we get rid of Hawl Katsuran, things will be probably much easier for us. At our current level of manpower, we just can't afford to deal with him. Once you get rid of Hawl Katsuran, I'll give a big reward.
MsgIncomplete: Please take him out as soon as you can. It's too dangerous to leave him alive.
MsgResponse4: Please take him out as soon as you can. It's too dangerous to leave him alive.

MsgSummary:
The medicine merchant, Prisien Shainstone, has asked you to check out whether the medicine she gave {c2}Riplis Greenbird{/c} was effective.
You have to follow the route south from Silvaren and go to the Adellia district.
MsgComplete:
Ah! Are you talking about that ointment Prisien gave to me? Its effect was unbelievable. 
I just sent someone I know to say thanks for the great medicine. You and he must have passed each other and not even known it!
MsgTake:
Near Meia Forest, at the entrance of Adellia district south of Silvaren, is the Watch Tower.  In this Watch Tower, there is a ranger named Riplis Greenbird who watches for monsters from the forest and offers help to travelers.  A little while ago, he bought an ointment from me and I can't help but wonder how effective it was for him.
Please go to Meia Forest and ask Riplis Greenbird whether that medicine did as well as I hoped it would.
MsgIncomplete: It is okay for you to take it at your own pace, but don't forget what I've asked you to do.

MsgSummary:
Riplis Greenbird asked you to get rid of {c1}5 Copper Peg Goblin Watchers{/c} and {c1}5 Copper Peg Goblin Stonethrowing Soldiers{/c}.
You can find the habitat of the Copper Peg Clan if you go southwest from the Watch Tower.
MsgComplete: You did an excellent job. You must've struck fear into their very hearts!  May Etain guide your path.
MsgTake:
The reason why I needed the ointment was because the Goblins of the Copper Peg Clan tried to invade. I got this injury when a Goblin threw a stone at me. It wasn't a bad enough injury to endanger my life, but if it had struck even one inch lower, I might have been on my way to Atsilut. Of course, it would be an honor to belong to Atsilut after I die, but it's too early for me to go there now.
In order to keep that kind of misfortune from befalling us, we've got to let them experience a real nightmare. We need to let them know that none of their number will survive if they stand against Alliance of Light! Take out 5 Copper Peg Goblin Watchers and 5 Copper Peg Goblin Stonethrowing Soldiers. We'll show them our power.
MsgIncomplete: For the honor and dignity of the Alliance of Light!
MsgResponse4: For the honor and dignity of the Alliance of Light!

MsgSummary:
Blinel Starbreeze a ranger asked you to get rid of Chief of Clan, {c1}Moraishi{/c} in order to prevent the Copper Peg Clan from invading.
You can find Moraishi among the Goblin group if you go southwest from Watch Tower.
MsgComplete: Well done. Now this place will finally know peace.  May Etain's protection and Dayfly's blessing be with you.
MsgTake:
There is a goblin clan called Copper Peg not far from here. They're an attrocious and cunning lot. A little while ago, they took this place by surprise and even dared to inflict a wound on a ranger, Riplis Greenbird. Other rangers thought that simply reducing the number of goblins would be good enough, but now I highly doubt it. I'm pretty sure this kind of incident will be repeated continuously unless we get rid of their Chief.
Their chief is a goblin called Moraish. He is a dangerous being, much larger than the other goblins and very smart, to the point of being able to use powerful magic. Please get rid of this Moraish for the safety of the Alliance of Light.
MsgIncomplete: Moraish is a dangerous being. I hope his blade will not cleave you in two.
MsgResponse4: Moraish is a dangerous being. I hope his blade will not cleave you in two.

MsgSummary: You have to find {c2}Ures{/c}, a high class summoner of Uresis Lab. You can find Uresis Lab if you go southwest from the Watch Tower.
MsgComplete: Ah ha!  Welcome, I've been waiting for you.
MsgTake: A little while ago, I met Ures, a high class summoner of Uresis Summoning Spell Lab in Huigronn Stronghold. He said that lately, something happened to his research and asked me a favor, face full of anxiety.  "You're in a place where you get to see so many travelers pass by. If you find someone who can help me, could you send them over here?"  Now that I look at you, you seem just right for the job. Why don't you head over there? Uresis Lab is located near the Rapaltien Coast south of here.
MsgIncomplete: Ures is looking forward to meeting with you. Why don't you go over there right now?

MsgSummary:
Ures in the Uresis Summoning Spell Lab asked you to find his stolen research material. Some {c1}Sumatra Sealakel Shamans{/c} will carry the {c3}Research Data of Ures{/c}.
You'll find Shamans of the Sealakel clan near the Luminas Waterfall.
MsgComplete: Oh my! Thank god you were able to bring this back safely. I want to thank you from the bottom of my heart; please accept this.
MsgTake:
I guess you already know we Elves are making an effort to develop nature through spirits. I'm doing research on maximizing the power of spirits. A little while ago, however, important research data disappeared while I vacated my position for a while. As a result of asking around here and there, I realized one of the Shamans of the Sealakel community on the coast, the Sumatra Clan, took it away.
I hope you will bring back my research data from those Sumatra Sealakel shamans.
MsgIncomplete: I hope the research data hasn't been damaged.
MsgResponse4: I hope the research data hasn't been damaged.

MsgSummary: A weapon merchant of the Summoning Spell Lab, Litos Ner, asked you to bring 7 scales from {c1}Sumatra Sealakel Summoners{/c}. You can find summoners easily on the beach in front of the lab.
MsgComplete: Wow, nice! You brought in some high quality scales; good stuff all around. Hake, take this and treat yourself to some good beer on me.
MsgTake: You know...the Sumatra Sealakel Clan has taken to hanging around in front of the Summoning Spell Lab. Anyway...I'm not good at beating around the bush, so let me say it straight: the Sumatra Sealakel Summoners of that clan have absolutely fabulous scales. Can you bring me just 7 of their scales? I'll give you a big reward, don't worry.  How does that sound?
MsgIncomplete: Be careful!  If any of the scales is damaged, it'll come out of your reward money...
MsgResponse4: Be careful!  If any of the scales is damaged, it'll come out of your reward money...

MsgSummary:
{c2}Ures{/c}, the head of Uresis lab, asked you to take care of the Copper Peg Family of Goblins.
You have to hunt {c1}10 Copper Peg Goblin Looters and 10 Copper Peg Goblin Warriors{/c} and return to {c2}Ures{/c}.
You can find the habitat of the Copper Peg Family if you go northeast of the lab.
MsgComplete:
You beat the tar outta that Copper Peg family?   Many thanks; I guess we can investigate without worry for the time being.
Soron must be feeling thankful too. There are many wild monsters around this area besides the Copper Peg Family.  Please be careful.
Of course, with your skills, you've probably got nothing to be worried about, heh!
MsgTake:
This place, Uresis Lab, is committed to researching the resuscitation of the Adellia continent, which is devastated by continued war.
In order to do this, we need a variety of data about the ecology of this district, so Soron or I leave for investigations every once in a while. However, something has impeded our investigation recently.
I'm not saying life is perfect.  Problems have cropped up every once in a while, but it's different now.
The problem is that the Copper Peg Family of Goblins is getting more and more violent as time goes by.

Every time Soron and I leave the labs for a bit, they break in here and mess up everything and tear up important documents, not to mention disturbing our investigation in progress.
I asked for help from the guards in Huigronn Stronghold, but I still don't know whether they will answer. I'm tired of waiting now.
That's why I'm asking for your help, traveler.
I hope you can take care of this Copper Peg problem.
Are you feeling up to it?
MsgWelcome: This place, Uresis Lab, is committed to researching the resuscitation of the Adellia continent devastated by continued war.
MsgIncomplete:
Goblins are awful.
This clan thinks hurting people is a normal thing.
MsgResponse4:
Goblins are awful.
This clan thinks hurting people is a normal thing.

MsgSummary:
{c2}Soron of Uresis Lab asked you to stop the Sealakels from causing trouble.
You have to hunt {c1}10 Sumatra Sealakel Watchers and 10 Sumatra Sealakel Warriors{/c} and return to Soron.
You can find Sealakels on the seashore west of the lab.
MsgComplete:
These past few days, the disturbance of Sealakels has diminished remarkably. It's all thanks to your help. I figure I can go back to my research in a quiet atmosphere for the time being.
I really appreciate your help.  Thanks again.
MsgTake:
Ah, Greetings.
I heard about what you've done for Mr. Ures.
Thanks to you, we have been able to proceed with our investigation without the disturbance of Goblins. I really appreciate your help.
{c5}(Soron bows his head deeply){/c}
However, I'm really sorry, but I have one more favor I'd really like to ask of you.
I suppose Mr. Ures has already told you this, but goblins are not the only ones disturbing our research.

{c5}(pointing out toward the coast west of lab){/c}
The Sumatra Sealakels have gathered here, at Rapaltien Coast. The Sumatra Sealakel family is a very aggressive, large, and violent family compared to other Sealakels.
To put it more specifically, they strike terror into people's hearts by taking the lab by surprise, or they announce their existence by howling with an echoing noise all night long. It would be absurd if I had to move because of them.
I feel really bad, but in order create a quiet atmosphere suitable to research, we have no choice but to attempt to reduce the number of these Sealakels. I want to borrow your strength one more time. I'm counting on you.
MsgWelcome:
Ah, Greetings.
I heard about what you have done for Mr. Ures.
MsgIncomplete: Sealakels make a bizarre noise, even during fighting. It never sounds nice.
MsgResponse4: Sealakels make a bizarre noise, even during fighting. It never sounds nice.

MsgSummary: You discovered a corpse of a male elf, {c2}Leterr{/c}, near the place where Sealakels live. You have to deliver a {c3}letter and a phial{/c} you discovered on his corpse to Soron.
MsgTake:
{c5}(You discovered amid the Sealakels the corpse of a male elf who apparently died not long ago. Considering the gnawed marks made by sharp teeth and claws, skin flaked with stray scales, and the salty smell, he seems to have been killed by Sealakels.
In order to find something to help identify who he was, you go through his personal effects carefully and discover a piece of a letter and a phial containing a violet liquid.
The salutation 'To Sir Soron' has been hastily scribbled on the letter.
Perhaps it seems to refer to the low-class summoner, Soron, in the Uresis Lab. You have the feeling you have to deliver the letter and phial to him.){/c}
MsgWelcome: {c(5)}(It seems you can learn no more just from searching him.){/c}
MsgIncomplete: {c(5)}(It seems you can learn no more just from searching him.){/c}
MsgResponse4: Uresis Lab is committed to researching the resuscitation of the Adellia continent devastated by continued war.

MsgSummary: You have to dispose of {c1}7 Sumatra Sealakel Priests and a boss, Spisus{/c} and return to Soron in the lab.
MsgComplete:
You've finished your job and returned safely.
We are lucky. Now the Sumatra Sealakel family can't run around doing whatever it wants.
You know, it'll be a major loss for the Sealakels if their Boss is taken out too.  I know Leterr would be grateful to you, too.
May Etain guide your future. <For Fighter/Defender><For Ranger/Archer><For Mage/Priest>
MsgTake:
I can't believe the Sealakels killed him.
Alas, poor Leterr.  We lost a really great person.

{c5}(wiping the corners of his eyes slightly) {/c}
Taking care of his soul will be my job.
However, I don't have the power to prevent something like this from happening again.
Traveler, I hope you can help me again with that same concerned heart which brought me the letter from Leterr.  Could you get rid of those Sealakels before tragedies like Leterr's death happen again?
I thought all they did was make noises and be a nuisance, but I was wrong.
Sealakels are turning into more and more dangerous creatures.

Fortunately, I guess Leterr figured out the name of Sealakel commanding the Sumatra Sealakel family before his death.  According to this letter, Spisus is the name of their leader. If this boss is gone, the Sealakels will run about in utter confusion for a while - at least, so I hope.  Please get rid of Spisus and his followers.
MsgWelcome: Sealakels are not only violent, but also cunning.
MsgIncomplete:
You'll be in danger if you don't remain on guard.
Sealakels are not only violent, but also cunning.
MsgResponse4:
You'll be in danger if you don't remain on guard.
Sealakels are not only violent, but also cunning.

MsgSummary:
You have to capture {c1}Edged Blade Wind Harpy Summoners{/c} and collect {c3}15 Wings of Harpy{/c} and give them to a defense item merchant, {c2}Lote{/c}.
You can find Edged Blade Wind Harpies easily if you follow the south route from the lab toward Huigronn Stronghold.
MsgComplete:
Ah, you finally back; good to see you.
No, I don't mean you're late.
I was a bit nervous because the customer who placed the order urged me to make it quickly.
Trust is the basis of business, so I try my hardest never to miss a deadline.   Haha!
MsgTake:
Recently I've been making defense items to send to Huigronn Stronghold.
What I primarily make is defense equipment for Mages or Priests, and many special materials are used, rather than normal leather or metal.
The wings of a pixie or a harpy are the easiest to get.
The other materials are made via summoning spells.  It's hard, especially if you know nothing of summoning spells.  Haha.

However, this time, because of all these rush orders, I don't think we've collected enough materials.
If you're not busy, can you help me?
If you exit this lab, there are Edged Blade Wind Harpies living on the field.
I hope you'll capture a summoner among them and bring its wing.
Summoners have very beautiful and excellent quality wings compared to warriors.
I guess about 15 will be all right.
I hope you'll bring them while I'm working on the rest.
MsgWelcome: The wings of a harpy are light yet strong, and also very durable.
MsgIncomplete: The wings of a harpy are light yet strong, and also very durable.
MsgResponse4: The wings of a harpy are light yet strong, and also very durable.

MsgSummary: You have to receive an {c3}Armor Box{/c} from {c2}Lote{/c} and deliver it to a defense item merchant, {c2}Narke{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Customer? Oh my. Did you bring goods? {c5}(receiving the defense box){/c}  Ah, these must 
be the defensive items I requested from Lote.
I thought this was taking too long, so I sent demands several times... It apparently worked, didn't it?
I'm also in the middle of crafting, so the amount of material is not so deficient. I'll get the finished goods, first. Good job.
MsgTake:
You have been having a hard time collecting materials...
I'll ask for one more thing.
{c5}(handing you a box){/c} This is a box including finished defense items.
The customer who ordered it must be quite urgent, considering I even received follow-up demands.
Actually it's very rare for the Huigronn Stronghold to place an order directly with me, so I don't know exactly but...
I'd better send finished products first despite the fact they I haven't finished everything yet.

The person I have to send them to is a defense item merchant named Narke.
I hope you deliver it to him. He'll probably give you a reward for the delivery separately.
I have to finish the rest of the order now, so take that on ahead. Have a good trip~
MsgWelcome: Did you deliver goods I requested?
MsgIncomplete: Did you deliver goods I requested?
MsgResponse4:
Today's just as busy as usual...
I wonder how Nomion can be so easygoing every day, tut-tut!

MsgSummary:
You have to capture {c1}South Wind Harpies{/c} and collect {c3}10 Fine Feathers of Harpy{/c}, then give them to a defense item merchant named {c2}Narke{/c}.
You can find the {c1}South Wind Harpy{/c} near the Silvana Lakeside if you exit the east gateway of the Stronghold and follow the route, then take the left-hand fork.
MsgComplete:
Oh, you came back much sooner than I expected.  It must be so easy.
{c5}(receiving the wings you have collected){/c}
Ah, I can see these have a totally different color and feel. Maybe I can see whether these have a really nice quality or not once I make a defense item with them.
Thanks~
MsgTake:
(holding you about to go) 
Hey, you're not busy, are you?
Then I guess you can help me out too.

We used to hunt Edged Blade Wind Harpies fairly far off in order to get harpy wings in this area. You know...gotta have the best quality.
But we found a much better area a little while back.
As it turns out, the wings we can get from South Wind Harpies near Silvana Lakeside are even better.
I was told they look exactly the same as other wings, but once you capture one and peel off its wings, the difference is totally obvious.
I'm the one of the people who enjoys using harpy wings, so I try to know a lot about them.
However, I'm not good at hunting, so I hope you can get those wings of harpies on my behalf.
It's not that difficult, is it? Just bring about 10 to test it out.
MsgWelcome:
Today's just as busy as usual...
I wonder how Nomion can be so easygoing every day, tut-tut!
MsgIncomplete: I was told the harpies near the Silvana Lakeside are really wild. Be careful.
MsgResponse4: I was told the harpies near the Silvana Lakeside are really wild. Be careful.

MsgSummary: You were told Arvea Feller's Town was occupied by Orcs. {c2}Coper{/c} asked you to to find {c2}Jason{/c}, the head of Fellers, in Arvea Feller's Town.
MsgComplete:
Who are you?
{c5}(after a listening to a story){/c} Ah, Coper asked you to help us?
I'm so grateful. We just pretended like nothing happened, but we've been searching for a person who will help us.
I feel so fortune we've met someone like you.
MsgTake:
Hey, if you're not busy, could you do me a favor?
A little while ago, I heard a bad news from a traveler who stopped by here.
If you go south from here, there is a small town called Arvea Feller's Town. The thing is, I heard it's been occupied by Orcs!
I figure you already know what a horrible and dreadful clan Orcs are, especilly to those who must often travel. There are very few people living in that town, and there are old people who live there too. I'm really worried about these people.

We need someone who can help them, but...a blacksmith like me certainly doesn't have the chops for it. That's why I'm asking for your help.
I hope you go there and listen to their story and help them out.
Looking at your weapon, I can see you're more than just an ordinary person.
That's the true meaning of justice - using a weapon to protect the rights of those who cannot protect themselves.

Find Arvea Feller's Town.
Go and meet Jason, head of Fellers and listen to their story in detail, and help them.
MsgWelcome: Beware of the Orcs occupying the town. They will try to attack everybody they encounter.
MsgIncomplete: Beware of the Orcs occupying the town. They will try to attack everybody they encounter.
MsgResponse4: Welcome to Arvea Feller's Town~ This is a small town, but take a full rest.

MsgSummary:
You have to find and break a WarEdge Clan Box and obtain Plans of WarEdge, then give it to Tehan, a chief of guilds in the Marduke Miner's Town.
You can find the WarEdge Clan Box among orcs in the southwest.
MsgTake:
Yes, Right.
Like Coper said, this town, Arvea Feller's Town was occupied by WarEdge Orcs.
They didn't kill us yet, I don't know why, Maybe they are trying work us to the bone, but we never know when they'll suddenly change their mind and turn their axes against us.
Living life like this every day is like standing on thin ice....

I came up with an idea to ask for help in case I eet someone like you.
Most people in this town are old and our numbers are few, so we can't recklessly take a stand against the Orcs.
However, if someone lets the outside world know of our situation, then maybe we can expect some backup.
I hope you can accomplish this.
Mr. Coper sent you here...that means I can trust you, right?

Right, as far as I know...
It seems Orcs received a plan note from headquarter situated somewhere else and now store it inside a box. Please break that box and obtain the plans, then give them to Tehan in Marduke Miner's Town. The mine is very close to this place, so you'll find it very easily except for potential Orcish disturbances. I heard Tehan organized guards and they're fighting with Dwarves.
I hope that the guards will give us some help too. I'll be waiting...!
MsgWelcome: I'm sure the Orcs are protecting a WarEdge Clan box. Search for it carefully!
MsgIncomplete: I'm sure the Orcs are protecting a WarEdge Clan box. Search for it carefully!
MsgResponse4:
Watch out, This area is dangerous.
What brought you to a dangerous place like this?

MsgSummary: You have to give the {c3}Plans of WarEdge{/c} to a lord, {c2}Monokeros{/c}, and deliver {c2}Tehan{/c}'s story to him.
MsgComplete:
Oh? Is it urgent enough that you would seek me out?
{c5}(Monokeros receives a note, listens to the story, and nods){/c}
Ah...so that's what happened.
Yes, you certainly came here in a hurry.
MsgTake:
{c5}(after listening to the whole story){/c}
..This is it. Jason asked for support forces. More recently, I also realized the number of armed Orcs has increased by leaps and bounds recently, so I was just starting to get worried about what's been going on.
I really appreciate you bringing this news to me.

But...we really can't spare the backup forces Jason is waiting for, sadly. We organized guards ourselves, but they aren't even remotely enough to deal with the dwarves.
Moreover, according to this plan note, WarEdge orcs occupying that area seem to be planning to own this mine and Huigronn Stronghold, in addition to Feller's Town. Unfortunately, I don't think I'm the right person to help Jason. It's beyond my ability.
But luckily, I can direct you to someone who's perfect for this job.

There is a lord named Monokeros; he's both a lord who controls the entire Adellia district and a Castellan of Huigronn Stronghold. I've also been looking for a person I can send to the stronghold in order to request backup forces to fight against the Dwarves.
All right, can you go and report the situation in Feller's Town and ours to a lord?
{c5}(handing you a plan note){/c} This will be good evidence, so you'd better submit it to a lord. Even though he can't send support forces immediately, I guess at least they'll have time to prepare for troops. Well, best get movin' quickly!
MsgWelcome: This entire district is under control of Lord Monokeros. He should know of this.
MsgIncomplete: This entire district is under control of Lord Monokeros. He should know of this.
MsgResponse4: I'm Monokeros, a Castellan of Huigronn Stronghold. What news brings you here, traveler?

MsgSummary: You have to get rid of {c1}10 WarEdge Orc Legionary Soldiers and 10 Burning Stone Dwarf Watchers{/c} and return to lord {c2}Monokeros{/c}.
MsgComplete:
What an amazing warrior! You've returned without so much as a scar!
Well done. As I promised, take this reward for your actions of bravery.
I'm planning to send out all of our forces to strike back at the very hearts of our enemies - you need not worry anymore.
I'll send a message to Jason and Tehan separately. Thanks.
MsgTake:
Adelia has been suffering from problems both large and small after the earth was devastated and all kinds of monsters appeared with the onset of the war. Dwarves have stubbornly coveted and attacked mines owned by humans, and Orcs, who constantly profane the natural world Etain created, are the clan the Elves detest the most.
I've heard the Grimaxe clan is acquiring influence in Ereumana, and now the WarEdge clan...how dare they set their sights on Huigronn Stronghold. What foolish monsters; no better than beasts. I need to make them regret even intending to do it!

I'll issue the order to mobilize a punitive force.
I'd better take care of these greedy Dwarves coveting for mine as well as waredge clan orcs all at once. Before that, I'll give you a chance if you want to perform a meritorious deed. Perhaps this will be their warning before all-out annihilation.
I guess you're strong enough to deal with mere Dwarves and Orcs, right?
Good, good. Go and dispose of as many as you please. If you return safely, I'll give you a fine reward!
MsgWelcome: Adelia has been suffering from problems both large and small after the earth was devastated and all kinds of monsters appeared with the onset of the war.
MsgIncomplete:
When it comes to a single-handed sudden attack, the faster you move, the better.
The more time you delay, the lesser effective your strike will be.
MsgResponse4:
When it comes to a single-handed sudden attack, the faster you move, the better.
The more time you delay, the lesser effective your strike will be.

MsgSummary: You have to defeat {c1}Burning Stone Dwarf Workers{/c} and {c1}Burning Stone Dwarf Skilled Master{/c} and collect {c3}10 Iron Ores{/c} and {c3}10 Adamars Ores{/c} and return to Erte.
MsgComplete:
You have returned safely!
{c5}(receiving ores){/c}
...We're lucky, this is good...!
Thank you very much. Actually, I received a harsh reprimand because I put a stranger into a dangerous situation with those vicious dwarves.

I'll let Tehan know what you have done for us. Like me, I'm sure he'll be very thankful.
Thanks to you, I figure I can be punctual this time. Take care!
MsgTake:
Ah, you're not busy at the moment? Great! Why not give us a hand?

Marduke Miner's Town has been famous for high quality steel and excellent-quality Adamars for a long time.

There has been an incredible amount of people who have ventured here to earn money.
However, miners like us have been in trouble since the burning stone Dwarves stole half of the mine. The area they claimed for themselves was a place that contains a rich vein of ore.
What's worse, apparently they're not satisfied with what they stole, because these greedy monsters attack us at random in order to steal the rest of mine.
Our supply of ore keeps decreasing, and Dwarves keep rampaging about...we're having a really hard time these days.

A few days later, I have to send a shipment of ore to Sidelos Refinery...
We can't meet the demand within the deadline under these conditions. We don't have any safe places where we can mine the ore.

So what I think would work is...please go and steal ores from dwarves!
{c5}(grinning){/c} We're still the real owners of the mine, so there's nothing wrong with this, right?
MsgWelcome: Marduke Miner's Town has been famous for high quality steel and excellent-quality Adamars for a long time.
MsgIncomplete: Those annoying Dwarves...I wish they'd just disappear. How's getting that ore coming along?
MsgResponse4: Those annoying Dwarves...I wish they'd just disappear. How's getting that ore coming along?

MsgSummary: A merchant named {c2}Edd{/c} asked you to deliver his story to the lord of Presya Manor, {c2}Eisen{/c}.
MsgComplete:
I see...Edd was attacked suddenly by the Black Breath Gang.
He was lucky to survive the ordeal, though.
One's life is more valuable than simple goods, after all.
I'll send someone to see Edd separately and tell him to just come without worrying.
At any rate, now I have to do something about this Black Breath Gang....
MsgTake:
Are you on your way to Presya Manor by any chance? If so, would you deliver my story to lord Eisen? On the road, I lost the goods I was carrying in a sudden attack by brigands calling themselves the Black Breath Gang.

I'll stay here and wait for word on whether they might be able to help me receive my stolen goods.
I know it's a bother to you, but please do this for me.
All you have to do is deliver my story to lord Eisen. It's just a simple task of delivery.
Anyway, I'm counting on you.
MsgWelcome: Did you deliver my story to lord Eisen?
MsgIncomplete: Did you deliver my story to lord Eisen?
MsgResponse4: I'm the lord of Presya Manor, Eisen. What brought you to this manor?

MsgSummary:
You have to get rid of {c1}5 Black Breath Thieves and 5 Black Breath Pickpockets{/c} and return to lord {c2}Eisen{/c} of Presya Manor.
You can find the hidden Black Breath Gang if you exit the manor heading north and go toward the northeast.
MsgComplete:
Were they easy enough to deal with? You have returned safely, so I guess they weren't too troublesome.
If that's the case, then let's start decreasing their influence and number on a larger scale.
MsgTake:
Reports about violence committed against peddlers like Edd and travelers on the road are becoming more and more numerous these days.
I should have looked into this matter much earlier.
I'd better find out the effective solution sooner, rather than later.

If you don't mind, I'd like to borrow your aid, for the sake of annihilating the Black Breath Gang.
This will be a good chance for you to gain battle experience if you're preparing for the battle against the Union of Fury. Your actions will alleviate the concerns of the residents, and you'll have a chance to improve your fighting skills. So...what do you think?

If you agree with me, I hope you just begin by figuring out how much skill the Black Breath Gang possesses. All you have to do is take care of a decent number of Black Breath Thieves and Black Breath Pickpockets.
I pray the Goddess will watch over you...
MsgWelcome: I'm Eisen, the lord of Presya Manor. What brought you to this manor?
MsgIncomplete: The Black Breath Gang doesn't seem to be just a group of simple thieves. What's their purpose?
MsgResponse4: The Black Breath Gang doesn't seem to be just a group of simple thieves. What's their purpose?

MsgSummary:
You have to hunt {c1}Black Breath Chasers{/c} and collect  {c3}Codes of BlackBreath{/c} and return to a lord of Presya Manor, {c2}Eisen{/c} within {c4}60 minutes{/c}.
You can find their camp south of Silvana Lakeside if you exit the south entrance of Presya Manor and go down along that route.
MsgComplete: You've worked hard, but unfortunately, it will be difficult for us to decipher a password with this amount. I'd better ask for someone else's help. This must have been too demanding for you to deal with. Thanks for what you have done; I'll see you later.
MsgResponse1: Ah, you've obtained a considerable amount. It's very fortunate you didn't get caught by them. This will be good enough for me to decipher the password.
MsgTake:
I guess we need to figure out their identity clearly first. There are a lot of rumors floating around about them, such as that they're a community of deserters from the war, or that they're rebel forces dissatisfied with king, but nobody knows exactly what kind of group they are.

According to someone who escaped after he was captured by them, they are using a password system, and ones who know the current password are the Black Breath Chasers. 
He also said the order from headquarters seems to be encoded within a password. This is just a small clue, but it might be a good idea to begin by collecting this information. Please capture these Chasers and collect as many passwords as you can. If you stay there too long, you could be caught, so please get the job done within 60 minutes and return to me. Be careful.
MsgWelcome: I'm Eisen, the lord of Presya Manor. What brought you to this manor?
MsgIncomplete: How many passwords have you obtained from the Black Breath Gang?
MsgResponse4: How many passwords have you obtained from the Black Breath Gang?

MsgSummary: {c2}Eisen{/c} asked you to find a fisherman named {c2}Beluto{/c} near the lake outside of Presya Manor and give him a Code of BlackBreath.
MsgTake:
However, in order to decipher a password completely, we need a help from someone who knows the command system of the Black Breath Gang.
While you were collecting passwords, I investigated this secretly, and discovered the surprising fact that Beluto is somehow involved with the Black Breath Gang.
Beluto is a fisherman near the lake outside the manor.
And to think, all this time I thought he was just a clumsy fisherman...
It is something I never expected.
Well, people sometimes wondered why he needed such strong muscles just for fishing...

I guess it won't be so easy getting information from him, considering he never speaks about his past and has been hiding his identity.
I suppose Beluto might say a little bit if you tell him that this is a favor to me.
We must get information from him!
{c5}(holding out a password he brought){/c} Please meet Mr.Beluto at once, and show him this.
MsgWelcome: Did you find Beluto?
MsgIncomplete: Did you find Beluto?
MsgResponse4: I'm just a fisherman. You don't wanna hear my boring fishing tales, do you?

MsgSummary: You have to get rid of {c1}10 BlackMaul Dwarf Workers and 10 BlackMaul Dwarf Skilled Masters{/c} and return to {c2}Edel{/c} a lord's daughter.
MsgComplete:
Did you handle your job successfully?
Ah, thanks the Goddess.
I bet we can stop Dwarves from mining ore as they please, at least for the time being.
You did a good job.
MsgTake:
These days my dad seems very upset because two problems, the Dwarven miners and the Black Breath Gang, popped up just at the same time.
I want to help my dad.
I'm his daughter, so what he's concerned about, I'm concerned about too.
I've heard a lot of stories about you. Your skills really make you stand out, don't they?
Everybody has been talking about you. They said you know how to take care of things, and that you're very trustworthy as well. I also heard about you from someone I can trust, so I figure I can trust you.

BlackMaul Dwarves are occupying the BlackMaul Mine located east of the stronghold.
You already know that Dwarves and Humans can never truly be friends. I don't have to explain it, right? If we own the BlackMaul mine they currently possess, we'll be able to obtain good quality ore from there. That ore can be sent to Huigronn Stronhold or other such places and provide resources for the troops of the Alliance of Light.
{c5}(Smiling slightly){/c}
Of course, this is a long-term plan I came up with alone. What I'm going to ask for is very simple. All you have to do is disturb the Dwarves so that they can't mine ore without worry. Please take out the workers and skilled masters. Good luck!
MsgWelcome:
These days, the Black Breath Gang is proving to be such a headache.
My dad is also worried about them.
MsgIncomplete:
We can't coexist with the Dwarves.
We have to reduce their impact and influence here as much as we can.
MsgResponse4:
We can't coexist with the Dwarves.
We have to reduce their impact and influence here as much as we can.

MsgSummary: {c2}Edel{/c} asked you to find the chief of the miner's guild, {c2}Tehan{/c}, and help him.
MsgComplete:
I think I saw you once before...Why did you come here again? Lord Eisen of Presya Manor sent you here?
{c5}(clicking his tongue){/c} Wow...he really send someone to help fast..
MsgTake:
I'll give you one more task.
I heard Marduke Miner's Town is also in trouble because a portion of the mine was occupied by Dwarves. My dad already received a letter requesting help, but he said he was too busy taking care of the problems with the Black Breath Gang, so he couldn't do too much about it.
I told him you are a very trustworthy person. Then he said you came just at the right time and he wants you to go there and give them some help.

Go to Marduke Mine and find the chief of the Miner's guild, Tehan.
He is in charge of that place.
If you listen to the whole story from Tehan, he'll give you a hand.
May the Goddess guide your path.
MsgWelcome: Did you meet Tehan in Marduke Miner's Town?
MsgIncomplete: Did you meet Tehan in Marduke Miner's Town?
MsgResponse4: Watch out, this area is dangerous! What brought you here?

MsgSummary: You have to get rid of {c1}10 Burning Stone Dwarf Supervisers and Serin Burning Stone{/c} and return to a chief of mine guild, {c2}Tehan{/c}.
MsgComplete:
You got rid of Serin Burning Stone?
Haha! Good riddance to them and great praise to you!
I'm really grateful that Eisen chose to send you here. Those Dwarves lost their boss, so they'll be scattered and disorganized for a while, at least until they have a new boss.
It's a job well done, I say.
Here's the reward I promised, so pick something you need. See you later~<For Fight/Defender><For Ranger/Archer><For Mage/Priest>
MsgTake:
I requested backup forces like...a million years ago. Why is it that you only appear now?!
Well, the lord of Huigronn Stronghold, Monokeros, already sent reinforcements here once, so we were safe for the time being.
At that time, we focused on taking care of the Orcs ocuppying Arvea Feller's Town rather than the dwarves, so I took care of several small ones and didn't touch the rest. Listen...I was upset a few minutes ago, yeah, but on second thought, Eisen did sent you here at a really opportune time.

We need an excellent assassin to inflict a powerful damage upon the leading members of the Dwarves.
I asked for help from all the mercenaries who passed through, but I haven't yet found a person who seemed truly capable.
I hope you're up to handling this.
Could you find and dispose of Burning Stone Dwarf Supervisors and their chief, Serin Burning Stone, then return to me?
If you meet with success, I'll give you a good reward, I promise!
MsgWelcome: Watch out, this area is dangerous. What brought you here?
MsgIncomplete: Dwarves handle weapons just like they make them: very well. Overconfidence can be dangerous..
MsgResponse4: Dwarves handle weapons just like they make them: very well. Overconfidence can be dangerous..

MsgSummary:
You have to get rid of {c1}Proll Burning Stone{/c} and return to {c2}Gralyn{/c}.
You can find the {c1}Proll Burning Stone{/c} among Dwarf Skiled Masters in the Burningstone mine.
MsgComplete:
Haha~ Well done. That Proll knave...I guess I'll get to know who the REAL master is if I go to the next life.
Thanks again, young'un. You ain't half bad.
Thanks to you, I was able to pay off my old scores completely~ Oh...the town?
Oh, yes, protecting a town is also important. I feel like a bear that's been living in my stomach for ten years has finally been digested. Haha~
MsgTake:
Hey~ I heard about you from Erte - You punished those knaves from the Burning Stone clan very harshly and stole their ore so that they can't work?
Hahaha~ Good, good!
For a young'un, you sure have some skill.
Fine, fine; Gralyn here's got a job for ya.

There is a guy named Proll Burningstone among the Burningstone Dwarves.
This guy's a pretty good hand when it comes to making weapons. Of course, it's nothing compared to my skill, though. Probably eight out of ten of those Burningstone knaves must be using weapons made by this guy.
That means the longer this guy lives, the more losses we living in this town will suffer!
At least if we dispose of this Proll guy, we can buy some time until someone with skills like his crops up again.
You know what I mean, young fellow?
Good. Now go and get rid of Proll Burningstone and come back to me.
MsgWelcome:
You don't like Tehan, either?
Right. The guy's a total goober.
MsgIncomplete: That Proll bastard must be wandering around under the pretence of 'supervising.' Look for him carefully!
MsgResponse4: That Proll bastard must be wandering around under the pretence of 'supervising.' Look for him carefully!

MsgSummary:
You should take care of {c1}10 Black Breath Grave Diggers{/c} and return to Earane.
You can find them near the Rankesian Hilly Land.
MsgComplete:
Good.
You have come back a little eariler than I expected. I take it that you've improved your skill, just like Beluto expected.
MsgTake:
Beluto the fisherman - does this name ring any bells? I got a letter from him.
It reads 'A little while ago, I tested their skill, and they're improving a lot faster than I thought. If Eisen can't find an appropriate person again, perhaps they'll be willing to take on a mission for you.
Looks like Beluto's expectation was correct, haha~

I'd better test you to find out whether your skill really has improved or not.
I'm the type of guy who can't trust anything until I see it with my eyes~
You should be strong enough to face off with members of the Black Breath Gang directly. Their base is near the Rankesian Hilly Land. You should be able to find out their exact location through scouting.
Go out on a scouting mission and take care of the appropriate number of Black Breath Grave Diggers and return to me.
If you survive, finish this job, and return safely, I'll trust that you have a satisfactory skill.
Good luck..!
MsgWelcome: I guess it's time to see this guy Beluto the fisherman has been talking about...
MsgIncomplete:
No time to dilly-dally.
Go and take care of this job, then return.
MsgResponse4:
No time to dilly-dally.
Go and take care of this job, then return.

MsgSummary: {c2}Earane{/c} told you to find {c2}Elliot{/c} who's in charge of a supply at Argartes Supply Base.
MsgComplete:
Earane sent you here?
So...she hired a mercenary. That's interesting.
You want to stay at this base and take care of the Black Breath Gang? Hmmm...
MsgTake:
Finding the exact location of the Black Breath Gang's main base is truly deserving of admiration. 
Beluto has been an excellent judge of characters all this time. Now I'll bet you'll have no problems facing them on equal ground.
This job will not only help test your skill against cunning fighters, but also give you a good reputation in the people's eyes, as well as alleviate their concern.

Find Elliot in Argartes Supply Base.
According to what you have found, the base of the Black Breath Gang will be near the Supply Base, so I suppose carrying out the attack from there will be much faster.
If you tell Elliot you came on my recommendation, he'll certainly allow you to stay there. Take care.
May the Goddess of Luck, Pantera, guide your path!
MsgWelcome:
Elliot is a fussy person.
If you idle away, you'll be punished.
MsgIncomplete:
Elliot is a fussy person.
If you idle away, you'll be punished.
MsgResponse4:
Elliot is a fussy person.
If you idle away, you'll be punished.

MsgSummary: You have to take care of {c1}15 Black Breath Mountain Guards and 10 Black Breath Bandits{/c} and return to {c2}Elliot{/c}, a supply manager.
MsgComplete:
You have done well. Your skills are the real deal.
Looks like Earane found us a good mercenary. If you one day grow sick of the mercenary's life, you can come visit me anytime.
You'll be welcomed, haha. You can leave the rest of the full-scale subjugation to us. It was good workin' with you.
MsgTake:
We also don't know how to handle the Black Breath Gang.
We've got a lot of enemies to fight besides these bandits.

According to our investigation, the Black Breath Gang still seems to be moving only in this area.
However, in light of the energy they've put into their recent activity, it'll be only a matter of time before they expand their influence to other areas...
We have to nip them in the bud before that happens. I hope you'll hold nothing back when you take care of those Black Breath Mountain Guards and Black Breath Bandits.

I bet Earane sent you to me because she wants me to give you a reward if you fulfill your job wonderfully, and because she enjoys watching such things play out. I figure you must be aware of the fact that mercenaries are only paid based on how much they work.
You're the one Earane sent, so I'll not question your skill needlessly.
Instead, you'd better take care of the job as soon as possible because I don't have the intention to provide a bed and a meal for someone who remains idle.
MsgWelcome:
Why is this taking so long?
We need to take care of them before the Black Breath Gang moves on a large scale!
MsgIncomplete:
Why is this taking so long?
We need to take care of them before Black Breath Gang moves on a large scale!
MsgResponse4:
Why is this taking so long?
We need to take care of them before Black Breath Gang moves on a large scale!

MsgSummary: {c2}Elliot{/c} told you to find the commander of Au Bird Force Base Camp, {c2}Nierdel{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Elliot sent you here?
Then you must be the 'competent mercenary' I requested.
Fine. Let me tell you what you have to do now.
MsgTake:
I've been looking for you.
There is another place that needs a competent mercenary like you.
That place is a base of the Alliance of Light called Au Bird Force Base Camp. You can find if you go west from here. 
The commander of that place, Nierdel, asked me to find a 'a competent person.'
I guess this will be the kind of work we need in order to face the Primomum Army...
If we go there, we can see exactly what kind of work it will be. The reward he gives will be sizeable, of course, because he's a commander.
That'll be the least of your worries.
You could even be killed by the Deatheaters, so I don't think he will be stingy.
Oops! Did I say something wrong? Hohoho...

If you've made up your mind, leave now. Commander Nierdel hates waiting as much as I do.
High-class people can't stand this more than others. Go to Au Bird Force Base Camp and find Commander Nierdel. Good luck, mercenary.
MsgWelcome: You can find the Au Bird Force Base Camp if you go straight toward the west. Go now.
MsgIncomplete: You can find the Au Bird Force Base Camp if you go straight toward the west. Go now.
MsgResponse4: I'm Nierdel Xiphos, a commander of Au Bird Force Base Camp. What do you want from me?

MsgSummary: You have to get rid of {c1}10 Primomum High Class Warriors and 10 Primomum Deputy Commanders{/c} and return to {c2}Nierdel{/c}, a commander of Au Bird Force's Base.
MsgComplete:
I just received a report that the Primomum forces suffered a notable loss in a sudden attack.
Apparently you have taken care of your job very well. That's very pleasing to know.
Now, I'll let you know what your next job will be.
MsgTake:
I'm Nierdel Xiphos, a commander-in-chief of the Au Bird Force Base Camp.
Currently, our army is confronted with a Deatheater army, the Primomum Force in the south, and neither is willing to carelessly risk a first attack.

However, if this lull continues, not only does the morale of our troops decrease, but we also might lose the initiative of battle in a crucial moment.
Moreover, a little while ago, we received a report that the Primomum Force is organizing their forces in order to create an all-out war.
Therefore, we wanted to hire a competent mercenary to scatter their soldiers, in order to take the initiative of the battle from them before their attack. That's why Elliot sent you here.

First, sneak into the Primomum force and disrupt their sense of order by getting rid of some of their soldiers. Aiming at High Class Warriors and Deputy Commanders will be the most effective.
Once you get the job done, please withdraw silently and return to me to report the result.
MsgWelcome: Welcome to the Au Bird Force.
MsgIncomplete: Were you successful in carrying out our request?
MsgResponse4: Were you successful in carrying out our request?

MsgSummary: You have to get rid of {c1}3 Primomum Squad Leaders and a commander, Krotum{/c} and return to {c2}Nierdel{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Excellent. You accomplished the mission successfully. Your actions will prove an integral part of the Alliance of Light's victory here.
Now I guess it's time to fight with the Primomum force in a full-scale battle.
I hope this reward will be enough for what you have done. Farewell.
I pray that Dayfly's sword and Etain's blessing protect you...!<Power of DEX><Power of LUC>
MsgTake:
This mission is both important and dangerous. You'll be putting your life on the line here, no doubt. If you're just a mercenary who's in it for the money, there are easier ways to earn your keep. However, I'll trust you as a person who wants to put an end to this long-lasting war with a victory for the Alliance of Light. Even if you're a mercenary, you're still with us in purpose. That's why I'm leaving this mission up to you.

Now that the atmosphere of their forces is distracted, it's time to attack the leading members.
I want you to kill Krotum, a commander of the Primomum Army, and return.
There will be squad leaders escorting him, so you'll have to take them down too.
I don't mean to question your skill, but if you feel it's too difficult for you to accomplish this mission alone, you can lead a team of trustworthy friends. What matters the most is the perfect success of this mission, after all.
Don't worry; even if you go with your friends, the reward you'll receive will be the same, so don't let that influence your decision.

If the outcome is great, I promise I'll pay a reward equally as great.

It's time to go. You have to finish this mission promptly, before they rearrange their forces...
MsgWelcome: Welcome to the Au Bird Force.
MsgIncomplete: I'd like to see this mission finished promptly, so get on it.
MsgResponse4: I'd like to see this mission finished promptly, so get on it.

MsgSummary:
You have to get rid of {c1}10 WarEdge Orc Shamans and 10 WarEdge Orc Warriors{/c} and return to {c2}Asteon{/c} the grocery dealer.
You can find the camp of the WarEdge Orc Clan if you head north of the force's base.
MsgComplete:
Seeing as you've returned safely, you must have carried out my request. Wonderful!
I hope you feel satisfied with this reward. I guess Nierdel will no longer worry about Orcs for a while.
Thanks. I pray that Etain guides your future.
MsgTake:
Actually I'm not a merchant.
I have followed commander Nierdel in the capacity of her attendant.
As you can see, I'm making and selling ornaments because I've got some talent when it comes to craft-work, but my main duty is to look after Miss Nierdel on this wild battlefield.

Since she was a child, she has never shown any signs of letting up...

These days, however, she looks very exhausted. Maybe it's because of something else bothering her besides the Primomum Army...
According to what I heard from the adjutants, it's because the WarEdge Clan Orcs are starting to set up camp to the northeast of our base.
They also said that these Orcs are definitely a weaker clan, but if they begin gathering together like that, they will be tough to deal with.

I want to alleviate the cares troubling Miss Nierdel's heart.
Can you cooperate with me?
I'll give you a good reward. Please go to the Orcs' camp and do some damage to their forces.
MsgWelcome: Actually, I'm not a merchant.
MsgIncomplete: Did you accomplish the task I asked of you?
MsgResponse4: Did you accomplish the task I asked of you?

MsgSummary:
You have to get rid of {c1}10 BlackMaul Dwarf Explorers and 10 Burning Stone Dwarf Explorers{/c} and return to {c2}Duin Silverhawk{/c}, a blacksmith.
You can find these dwarves northwest of the force's base.
MsgComplete:
Oh my...! I was about to finish up my job and leave, but you came back so fast.
So you already finished the job, so I don't have to go there, right?
You are amazing..!
Hahaha, I'll listen to your story~ Sometimes old people like me have something to learn from the younger generation. Well done!
MsgTake:
We, the Silverhawk Clan, are always being watched by other Dwarf clans because we are the only Dwarves who have allied with the humans.
The Blackmaul and Burningstone clan wandering around the outskirts of the base have their eyes on us too.

Those scoundrels occupied mines in Adellia and caused trouble to the humans there...
How dare they call themselves 'explorers!' That's pretty presumptuous of them. A little while ago, I heard it all very clearly from a dwarf who was captured as a captive in the base. Judging by their looks, they're nothing but spies.

I can't believe we live in a day and age when cheap spies call themselves 'explorers.'  
They're really defaming the reputation of a real explorer. I can't just overlook this ridiculous happening, as a Dwarf who used to dream of being an explorer!
I'd better punish them harshly!
You think so too, right? Fine~
I'll let them recover their senses.
I'll finish what I'm doing now and follow you right away, so just go there before me, and give 'em a swift kick to the back of the head!
MsgWelcome: You're not supposed to ignore an elder's advice! If you've got any sense of propriety, keep this in mind.
MsgIncomplete: How are you doing? I'll follow you soon.
MsgResponse4: How are you doing? I'll follow you soon.

MsgSummary:
You have to get rid of {c1}10 Lipiluss High Class Warriors and 10 Lipiluss Low Class Warriors{/c} and return to {c2}Ermiss{/c}.
You can find Low Class Warriors and High Class Warriors to the northeast of Lipiluss Town.
MsgComplete: Well done, but unfortunately, I figure this job is bigger than disposing of Chaos Elves.
MsgTake:
Aquilus Tor, located on the southernmost part of the Adellia district, was the place where the Dianoia family summoned the God of another world, Sunting Manaburn, in Teos calendar 1109.
It is the dimensional gate he used to come to Teos from another world.
Sunting Manaburn instantly destroyed the Elven force that existed in the Borderland, and the fight against the God of another world dragged on for over 100 years.
Everyone was drinking from the bitter cup of imminent defeat.
At that time when the world seemed as though it was about to come to an end, what saved us was a unparalleled hero named Spinterr Vios. With abilities that were unimaginably magnificent, perhaps even above mortals, he banished the Dianoia family to Cornwell's Ruin and cut off the head of the God of another world, sealing him off in the rift from whence he came. I came to know this after he died and went to Atsilut's side, but Spinterr Vios was the incarnation of hero god, Dayfly.

After he sealed off Sunting Manaburn, nothing has happened to Aquilus Tor for a long time, as though that place was being protected by magic... However, a while ago, suspicious forces were discovered nearby.
Through the result of research, it turned out they were Chaos Elves who betrayed the Elves during the war against Sunting Manaburn...
It is also possible they are trying to resurrect the God of Another World again.
Before their force grows, we have to stop them. I ask that you go and take them out.
MsgWelcome: Bow to the mother of all magics, Mystra! The more we learn about magic, the more profound do its intricacies become.
MsgIncomplete: Chaos Elves are staying in the abandoned Lipiluss Town.
MsgResponse4: Chaos elves are staying in the abandoned Lipiluss Town.

MsgSummary: You have to get rid of {c1}10 Aquilus Tor Succubi and 10 Aquilus Tor Beholders{/c} and return to {c2}Ermiss{/c}, a chief magician.
MsgComplete: Good, good. While you were taking care of those Succubi and Beholders, I have discovered a new fact during my research. Now, I guess there's one more thing you can take care of.
MsgTake:
There are many creatures inhabiting the area around the Aquilus Tor.
However, I've received reports that they are becoming more violent than before.
I also heard about accidents, like sometimes soldiers scouting that area are frequently attacked all of a sudden and killed - things of this sort.
Perhaps chaos elves already took some kind of measure about Aquilus Tor, and that led the dormant dimensional gate awakening bit by bit, and this is influencing the creatures in the area. 

I'll work on my own to develop a way to stop chaos elves from planning to resurrect the God of Another World in Teos once again.
Could you take down some of the creatures around Aquilus Tor?
I guess you need to pay the most attention to the rampaging Succubi and Beholders.
MsgWelcome: Bow to the mother of all magics, Mystra! The more we learn about magic, the more profound do its intricacies become.
MsgIncomplete: Did you finish the task I requested?
MsgResponse4: Did you finish the task I requested?

MsgSummary:
You have to get rid of {c1}3 Aquilus Tor Iron Golems and the Iron Golem boss, Moraz{/c}, then return to {c2}Ermiss{/c}, a chief magician.
You can find {c1}Moraz{/c} among the Iron Golems.
MsgComplete:
Ah, you have returned safely.
Now that you have dealt with 'Moraz', the chaos elves will have to focus on their research for a while in order to recreate a golem similar to that.
Well done. I guess I have to make a decision about the next plan in my conference with commander Nierdel.
I pray the wisdom of Mystra always saves you from predicaments.
<Power of RES><Power of WIS>
MsgTake:
I guess you have seen the Iron Golems near the Aquilus Tor.
I thought they were just faliures some unknown magician simply abandoned there.
But now, I believe they were created by chaos elves.
I suppose they'll be the first ones who will become golems, in the event their ritual succeeds and Sunting Manaburn is resurrected through Aquilus Tor.
Also it is very likely there is a golem possessing high intelligence who controls the other golems, acting as their boss.
Plainly speaking, we can simply think of this as a small army composed of Golems.

...I'll leave the job of taking care of them up to you.
Taking care of the boss golem is our top priority.
The name of boss golem is 'Moraz.' It means 'Strong man' in an abandoned Elvish dialect. If you want to fight with Moraz, you have to get rid of the surrounding golems escorting him as well. I think you'll handle this very well, considering the skill you've shown so far.
If you make a mistake, you could get crushed by the golems, so I figure it'd be a good idea if you went out with a group of friends whose skills you trust. May Etain protect you and your friends.
MsgWelcome: Bow to the mother of all magics, Mystra! The more we learn about magic, the more profound do its intricacies become.
MsgIncomplete: Did you destroy the boss of the golems?
MsgResponse4: Did you destroy the boss of the golems?

MsgSummary: You have to get rid of {c1}10 NkelSaw Goblin Warriors and 10 NikelSaw Goblin Shamans{/c} and return to a watcher, {c2}Cecyan Cruise{/c}.
MsgComplete:
You have come back much earlier than I thought. Kaizeric and I were prepared and were about to leave.
Thanks to your actions, I guess it will be a lot easier to take care of the job. Thanks. If we finish this punitive mission, I'll try to report your actions to headquarter as well.
MsgTake:
So...we meet again
Do you remember that I mentioned I'd submit a draft about the Nikelsaw Goblins to headquarter before? That draft was passed through, and the watchers in this Watch Tower recently received orders for a punitive mission.
'Before full-scale punitive forces arrive, stir up the goblins and reduce their morale' was the order. As you can see, though,
there are only me and Kaizeric.
That's why we need a competent person like you. I figure your skill was proved already by the job I requested before. Please do your best in this punitive mission.

What you have to do is just take care of the watchers and shamans scouting around this area.
Kaizeric and I will also join you at the appropriate time.
MsgWelcome: What's up? If you don't have any business with me, don't talk to me.
MsgIncomplete: Goblins are more sly than you think. Be careful not to fall prey to an ambush.
MsgResponse4: Goblins are more sly than you think. Be careful not to fall prey to an ambush.

MsgSummary: A watcher, {c2}Kaizeric{/c}, asked you to go to Temple of Flame and meet a God's Servant, Sir {c2}Aulos{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Kaizeric sent you here?
Ah, he's a sincere watcher, he is. I never expected he'd send a person who'll take care of thing so fast like this.
MsgTake:
Good to see you again.
Could you do me a favor again like you helped us before?
I sent the corps order of Hecates Force you obtained before to a God's servant, Sir Aulos in Temple of Flame.
Sir Aulos said he will report the contents of that order to headquarters. A little while ago, it appears headquarters sent us a measure regarding the order Aulos reported.
I guess that's why Sir Aulos is looking for a competent man who can fight with the Hecates Force. Judging by the looks of you, you'll be the right person to do this in light of your previous experience. What do you think?

If you want to take it on, go to the Temple of Flame and meet God's servant, Sir Aulos. If you say Kaizeric introduced you, he will know the purpose of your visit.
I wish your luck in the battle.
MsgWelcome: Sir Aulos will be waiting for a person I'll send to him. Please go now.
MsgIncomplete: Sir Aulos will be waiting for a person I'll send to him. Please go now.
MsgResponse4:
This place is the Temple of Flame.
It earned this name because it is dedicated to St. Mother Narsiliel.

MsgSummary:
You have to get rid of {c1}5 Hecates Elf Watchers and 10 Hecates Elf Low Class Soldiers{/c} and return to a God's servant, Aulos, in the {c2}Temple of Flame{/c}.
You can find the Hecates Elf army south of Temple of Flame.
MsgComplete: I'm glad to see you've returned safely. Well, you fight against normal soldiers a lot, so I guess figuring out their skills was no trouble to you, right?
MsgTake:
Kaizeric once obtained a corps order of Hecates Force and gave it to me.
We couldn't figure out a lot because it was only what the low class soldiers were carrying, but we were able to figure out the reason why they won't move easily.
That was because a commander of the Hecates Force, ranger Brakea Aulscream, is currently fulfilling a urgent mission and isn't in the base.
They couldn't move because their commander was not in position, even though there was a small Watch Tower they could easily take right in front of them. Heh heh, a situation like this might be idle time for them, but to us, it's a golden opportunity, don't you think?

If we don't take advantage of this opportunity, it's like not bothering to pick up a nugget of gold you tripped over. The upper authorities also ordered us to begin work in earnest, even by recruiting a competent mercenary. That's why I want you, who Kaizeric has pre-approved of, to handle this job. First, we should begin by discouraging the morale of the rank and file troops.
Go and take out a reasonable number of Watchers and Hecates Elf Low Class Soldiers and return. I'll be waiting.
MsgWelcome:
This place is the Temple of Flame.
It earned this name because it is dedicated to St. Mother Narsiliel.
MsgIncomplete: How are you liking the job I gave you? There are more things for you to do, so take care of yourself out there.
MsgResponse4: How are you liking the job I gave you? There are more things for you to do, so take care of yourself out there.

MsgSummary:
You have to get rid of {c1}5 Hecates Elf High Class Soldiers and 5 Hecates Elf Deputy Commanders{/c} and return to a God's Servant, {c2}Aulos{/c} in the Temple of Flame.
You can find the Hecates Elf army south of the Temple of Flame.
MsgComplete:
I'm impressed! Your skill is too high to be just a mercenary. If you want to apply to the regular army, find me whenever you want again. I'd be delighted to write you a letter of recommendation, heh.
Well, I have to report our progress to the top brass right away. This is a reward for what you've done. Farewell; may St. Mother Narsiliel guide your path.
MsgTake:
This mission will be much tougher, because this time I'll need you to take care of High Class soldiers and Deputy Commanders. You took care of the enemies very easily last time, but High Class soldiers and Deputy Commanders will be a little different.
However, if you take care of this job perfectly, I'm certain we'll leave their commander, Brakea, feeling more than shaken up once he returns. If we are lucky, it's also possible that we could expel the Hecates force effectively by taking advantage of that weak point. Hahaha.
So as you see, everything depends on your actions. Please carry out this mission with dedication, for the Union of Fury.

All you have to do is get rid of High Class Soldiers and Deputy Commanders and return to me. If you complete this mission, I'll give you a satisfactory reward. Now let's get this mission underway.
MsgWelcome:
This place is the Temple of Flame.
It earned this name because it is dedicated to St. Mother Narsiliel.
MsgIncomplete: How are you coming along with the latest mission I gave you?
MsgResponse4: How are you coming along with the latest mission I gave you?

MsgSummary:
You have to defeat a {c1}Vagabond Sealakel Warrior{/c} and obtain a {c3}Letter in an Envelope{/c} and give it to a low class priest named {c2}Efforn{/c}.
You can find him right outside of Temple.
MsgComplete:
This...looks like some kind of letter. Did you obtain this from the Sealakel?
{c5}(with a surprised look){/c} It appears they use letters not altogether different from ours. 
{c5}(Efforn rips off the seal, reads, and turns pale){/c} ...wha..what is this?!
MsgTake:
I figure that these days, unidentified Sealakel families are multiplying rapidly across the Fluvius River.
Originally, we rarely found a Sealakel in the Adeurian district...
These Sealakels are increasing in number very rapidly, so I wonder whether they may even be a mutation.
Do you think this is the influence of the Fluvius River? I'm not a biologist, so I don't know very well, but...

The problem isn't simply that the Sealakels are increasing in number, it's that the temperment of these multiplying Sealakels is considerably more violent than before.
Because of this, innocent belivers who came to the Temple for prayer have been taken by surpise and injured, and frequently lost their lives, too. This is a really big deal!
As far as I know, Sealakel is a little wild, but they are creatures who never harm people.
Maybe what I knew was wrong, or these Sealakels have some kind of reason. Perhaps both are correct, and so I made a decision to investigate the reason. Can you capture a Vagabond Sealakel Warrior in front of the Temple and obtain something that might be a clue? I'll be waiting.
MsgWelcome: Every single person has their own objective. What is your goal, traveler?
MsgIncomplete: Did you obtain something from Sealakel?
MsgResponse4: Did you obtain something from Sealakel?

MsgSummary:
You have to get rid of {c1}10 MetinNis Sealakel Hunters and 10 MetinNis Sealakel Warriors{/c} respectively and return to a high class priest, {c2}Efforn{/c}.
You can find the MetinNis Sealakel family southwest of the Temple of Flame.
MsgComplete:
You have returned. I have been waiting for you.
While you carried out your mission, I collected information about the MetinNis Sealakel family in my own way. After analyzing the information I collected, I was able to figure out the name of the family's boss. It is a big accomplishment for having collected the information in such a short time.
MsgTake:
If my eyes aren't deceiving me, this is a language used by the Elves.
'Dear MetinNis family'...I have never heard of Elves and Sealakels having an amicable relationship.
Then, I suppose the Elves are up to something by taking advantage of the Sealakels. It is also possible they are trying to attack here all of a sudden by manipulating Sealakels...
I think we'd better take the initiative before something happens.

I'll leave the mission of conquering these Sealakels of the 'MetinNis family' up to you.
First, begin by reducing the number of MetinNis Sealakels, which has been increasing rapidly over time. If they lose their greater numbers, their influence will be weakened as well.
According to this document, hunters and warriors are the best sealakels when it comes to fighting, so go and take down as many hunters and warriors as you can, then return.
MsgWelcome: Every single person has their own objective. What is your goal, traveler?
MsgIncomplete: Did you take down many Sealakel hunters and warriors?
MsgResponse4: Did you take down many Sealakel hunters and warriors?

MsgSummary:
You have to get rid of {c1}4 MetinNis Sealakel Priests{/c} and a boss, {c1}Cureren{/c} and return to {c2}Efforn{/c} in the Temple of Flame.
You can find the MetinNis Sealakel family southwest of the Temple of Flame.
MsgComplete:
Nasiliel...! You have returned safely...! Did you finish off Cureren?
I see. Thank the goddess. It was a dangerous job; you have done well.

Now that we've put out the urgent fire, I'd better report this to the top brass and wait until I receive an official writ of retribution against the MetNis family. I'll report your accomplishments as well, leaving out nothing. 
I'll give you this as a reward; I hope you like it.
Farewell, then. I hope for the flame of St. Mother Narsiliel to shine on your future.  <For Warrior/Guardian><For Assassin/Hunter><Fro Oracle/Pagan>
MsgTake:
I was told the Sealakels in the MetinNis family call their boss 'Cureren.' It means a 'big fish' in an older Elven dialect.
I guess perhaps the Elves dubbed the boss with this name, but...since it sounds like that, it's almost like an admission from the Elves.
Anyway, in order to exchange messages, some kind of name must have been required.

If we can eliminate Cureren, the boss of the MetinNis family, it may be possible that the Sealakels will be quiet for a while without a leader and we can even stop the Elves from planning some kind of plot.
