Although we can't stop their plan completely, at least we can buy some time to figure out some kind of solution, I suppose...
I'm certain you can handle this mission very well, but it also puts forth considerable danger now that we can't figure out the extent of their abilities. It's best to err on the side of caution and take some trusted friends with you.
No matter what happens, I'd much rather see you come out of this alive.

I pray that St. Mother Narsiliel will protect you and your friends.
I hope you'll take down Cureren and come back safely.
MsgWelcome: Every single person has their own objective. What is your goal, traveler?
MsgIncomplete: Have you tracked down Cureren yet?
MsgResponse4: Have you tracked down Cureren yet?

MsgSummary: A medicine dealer, {c2}Rosage Ern{/c} asked you to give her regard to blacksmith {c2}Kanon Kursan{/c} in the Arena Stronghold.
MsgComplete:
Really? Rosage really talked to you like that? I guess I can enjoy the festival with this child.
{c5}(Kanon smiling delightfully){/c}
..Did you say you're a mercenary right?
hm, Find a Ordine.
I heard she is looking for someone. I got a lot of request from her when I was a mercenary too. She will give you a satisfactory reward. Ah, Thanks for delivering Rosage's message to me. Take care...!
MsgTake:
Wow, you've sure got a lot of scars on your armor.
Are you a mercenary?...I don't think a regular soldier would be walking around the place like this alone. Oh, this is a perfect coincidence! Are you intending to go to the Arena Stronghold by chance? No, it's okay, if you don't have any reason to go there. I'm gonna ask you to go there, so there's your reason~

A little while ago, I received a letter of regard from Kanon, who works as a blacksmith in the Arena Stronghold. He's a good person. Ever since my grandpa died, he has looked after me like his real child. My grandpa used to be Kanon's superior officer, and Kanon had great respect for him..
He said he also resigned from the army after my grandpa died...
Oh my, that was kind of a long explanation to give to a stranger, huh?

{c5}(Rosage wiping off tears which formed around her eyes.){/c}
He sent a letter saying that soon there will be a festival in the Arena Stronghold, and to drop by this time by all means, but I don't know how to write a response letter because I never learned to write. 
That's why I need to deliver this to him via someone else's words.
Perhaps I will be late, but I guess I can go there one day during the festival period. Please deliver my message to him. I'm counting on you~
MsgWelcome: The Arena Stronghold is in the center of the Adeurian district. It is very easy to find.
MsgIncomplete: The Arena Stronghold is in the center of the Adeurian district. It is very easy to find.
MsgResponse4: Doing a blacksmith's work is not an easy job. Well, at least it's easier than making a living as a mercenary.

MsgSummary:
You have to capture an {c1}Arena Gorge Cutting Wind Harpy{/c} and collect {c3}10 Feathers of Harpy{/c} and return to {c2}Orbis{/c}, a pagan.
You can find the harpies if you exit the west gateway of the Stronghold and turn north before you cross the bridge.
MsgComplete:
...There was a mercenary who worked very slowly, like you.
His name was Kanon; you are exactly like him.
Anyway, you have done well. While you were collecting those Harpy Feathers, I did a rough overve. Maybe I can store the wings you have collected somewhere and use them later. Ah; there's more I want to ask you. Don't go yet...
MsgTake:
Who is this? Ah, you're a mercenary looking for a job? Fine, there is something I want to request of you now.

Have you ever gone harpy-hunting before?
What I'm asking for is to capture harpies and cut off the wings. For what purpose, you ask?
{c5}(thoughtful for a moment){/c}
It's a bit long to explain, hmm... Simply talking, this is to supplement some of my research data. These days mutated creatures appear near the Stronghold from time to time. These harpies are no exception. I fear that the wings I have collected will be not enough, so I want to gather some more. This must be a good explanation, right?
Please go there and capture harpies, then bring back their wings. I guess normal harpies will be much easier to catch than Cutting Wind Harpy, so just capture normal harpies. How many harpies is enough? I guess about 10 will be okay.
MsgWelcome: Did you come here to get some help? If so, you'd better go to the Castellen.
MsgIncomplete: Why is it taking so long to get those Harpy Feathers? Please bring them quickly.
MsgResponse4: Why is it taking so long to get those Harpy Feathers? Please bring them quickly.

MsgSummary: {c2}A pagan {c}Ordine{/c} asked you to find secretary {c2}Doctux{/c} and deliver his message to him.
MsgComplete:
Ordine sent you here?
Excellent, I've been waiting for you. Let's proceed to the main issue.
MsgTake:
The Arena Stronghold surroundings aren't the only place mutated creatures have appeared.
I came to know this after I received the letter. According to this letter, creatures like them have also appeared near the Arteria Force Base Camp.
They also said they need someone to help them progress the research, so I told them I'd send someone.
You know what I mean? This time, your job is to go to Arteria Force Base Camp and help them.

The person who sent me a letter is Doctux. He is a secretary of the force.
You're probably thinking you need to find the commander, right?
{c5}(sniffing){/c}
The corps commander, Fides, is an idiot with no communication skills, so don't bother finding him. It'll be better for you to find Doctux and help him with whatever the forces need.
You can trust me, because I know Fides better than anybody else, so don't give me none of yer lip. Just go to the base camp and find Doctux.
Tell him I sent you.
MsgWelcome: Are you gonna just let time burn on like this? Why don't you set out now?
MsgIncomplete: Are you gonna just let time burn on like this? Why don't you set out now?
MsgResponse4: Are you gonna just let time burn on like this? Why don't you set out now?

MsgSummary:
You have to hunt down {c1}Genetick Succubi{/c} and a {c1}Genetick NightMares{/c} and collect {c3}10 Cores of Succubus{/c} and {c3}10 Cores of Nightmare{/c} and bring them to secretary {c2}Doctux{/c}.
You can find Succubui and Nightmares easily if you take the southern exit of the base camp.
MsgComplete:
I knew it...my theory was correct.
I can feel a familiar evil power from these cores.
This must be Plagma Bloodscream's project. So...the person who has been protecting a fallen Pluigel family now delves even into forbidden magic...
Here's a reward for the work you've done. If you hone your skills beyond what you now possess, return and let me know.
I'll give you another job at that time.
MsgTake:
I already heard what kind of research she is working on now.
Yes, mutated creatures I haven't seen before have constantly been discovered in the Adeurian district, and I have been supposing this might be the result of the experiments Genetick Black Magic Lab has been running.
However, Ordine doesn't agree with my opinion completely yet.
That's why I need evidence to support my theory.

What you have to do is to collect some sort of evidence for me.
I figure you can obtain something from the Succubi and Nightmares inhabiting the area near Genetick Black Magic Lab. Go and poach a few of each and bring back what you obtain.
If my theory is correct, you'll find a glittering material like a crystal if you cut 'em open. Please bring 10 of each - that should be all the evidence I need.
MsgWelcome: I'm looking for a way to raise the morale of the entire army. Do you have any suggestions?
MsgIncomplete: Have you collected all the evidence I've asked for?
MsgResponse4: Have you collected all the evidence I've asked for?

MsgSummary:
You have to take care of {c1}10 Adeurian Small Stone Golems and 10 Genetick Mutation Zombies{/c} and return to secretary {c2}Doctux{/c}.
You can find Golems and Mutation Zombies you exit the north gateway and head toward the northwest.
MsgComplete:
Did you have an easy time dealing with any of them?
If you dealt with them easily, you'll no doubt take care of this job quite easily too.
MsgTake:
I'm glad to see you again.
Your skill has improved a lot since last time, right?
I hope you prove it with this mission.

As I proceeded to research the essenses we obtained before, I was able to figure out a number of things. The results supported my hypotheses exactly.
The mutated creatures turned out to be failures of a secret weapon production project Genetick Black Magic Lab is undertaking.
Discovering these failed mutations far and wide across the continent probably means their research is now spreading out to a much greater extent. 
Plagma must certainly be conspiring with the Senator in some fashion, with these weapons he made by himself. If we didn't notice this, we would've been deeply in trouble, but we'll trample them down now that we've found out this secret.
MsgWelcome: I'm looking for a way to raise the morale of the entire army. Do you have any suggestions?
MsgIncomplete: How many golems and zombies have you disposed of?
MsgResponse4: How many golems and zombies have you disposed of?

MsgSummary:
You have to take care of {c1}5 Adeurian Golem Watchers and 5 Genetick Alchemists{/c} and return to secretary, {c2}Doctux{/c}.
You can see them if you exit the west gateway of the Arteria Force Base Camp.
MsgComplete: Good work. Now, I need to report the situation to the corps commander, Fides, and make a proposal to organize a full-scale attack operation. Your job is over now. I appreciate your continued efforts.
MsgTake:
A job isn't over just because one feels they've set up the appropriate outcome.
If you want a conclusion with real finality, you've gotta thrust a sword forward before you call it a real "conclusion."

While I was waiting for you to come back, I finished the investigation by sending out several soldiers. I discovered the identities of the people who made golems and zombies. They were golem watchers and alchemists. They must be the people who carried out Plagma's orders.
I feel it'll be too demanding for you to cope with him yet. Right now, let's take care of the people whose work is the main force behind the advancement of this research.

Please take care of 5 Adeurian Golem Watchers and 5 Genetick Alchemists and return to me. If you finish this job, I'll mobilize a large-scale attack force and send them in after you're done there. This will be good enough for you to handle now. Once you get the job done, I'll give our forces the signal.
MsgWelcome: I'm looking for a way to raise the morale of the entire army. Do you have any suggestions?
MsgIncomplete: Did you take out all the enemies I requested?
MsgResponse4: Did you take out all the enemies I requested?

MsgSummary: A corps commander, {c2}Fides{/c}, asked you to find a watchman named {c2}Ires{/c} who was dispatched to watch the Futesys Force and report the movement of their troops.
MsgComplete:
How did you find me?
Ah, Fides...
I have no excuse to offer. I should have sent a letter much earilier...I let a corps commander wait for me...
MsgTake:
Are you looking for a job? You upstart! How dare a mere mercenary like you come to a corps commander like me and request a job! You know...fine, I'll give you a job suited to your aggressive attitude. In fact, this is good, because I was already looking for a stooge who will run an errand for me.

We, the Arteria Force Base Camp, are currently confronted by the Futesys Force, the allied forces of Elves and humans. About one month ago, I dispatched a watchman to track their movement. The name of that watchman is Ires. I want you to meet her and deliver the information she gives you to me.

Ires will be somewhere around the place where the Futesys Force is stationed. I don't know her exact location either - she's probably always on the move. Keep on the lookout, lest you fall into some Elvish trap and get jumped. We don't want Ires getting the wrong kind of attention.
MsgWelcome: Did you find Ires the watchman?
MsgIncomplete: Did you find Ires the watchman?
MsgResponse4: Get down...! If you're caught by them, your life just got a whole lot less lively...

MsgSummary:
You have to get rid of {c1}10 Futesys Guards and 10 Futesys Watchers{/c} and return to watchman {c2}Ires{/c}.
You can find these troops around the Futesys Force Base Camp.
MsgComplete:
I'm surprised by your level of skill. I don't think Sir Fides sent you here just to deliver a message.
We've picked off the outer guard, so I suppose we can enter the force's base for a full-scale assault.
MsgTake:
I guess Sir Fides really needs to hear the information I've gathered in my reconnaissance.
Then, I'll get right to the point.

This is my guess based on my observation of the scale of their armed forces, but I'm thinking these forces are meant to proceed to the Adeurian district for the purpose of engaging in all-out war.
The commander-in-chief of the Futesys Force is David Boreanaz, a human and a royal knight.
I was told he gained several great victories against the Vail army in the Borderland district.
I wondered why, with such a great commander, they hadn't already attempted to attack us...
As it turns out, David was taken ill with a fever a while ago. That's why he did't come to the front. There are no commanders in the Futesys Force whatsoever, except this commander-in-chief, so this means they're like a tiger without teeth now.

I figure this is a golden opportunity to reduce the size of their armed forces.
I want to borrow your assistance for a bit. What I'd like you to do is pick off the watchmen and guards scouting near the base camp.
I hope you take care of this promptly. Go now!
MsgWelcome: Get down...! If you're caught by them, your life just got a whole lot less lively...
MsgIncomplete: Did you take out all the watchmen and guards?
MsgResponse4: Did you take out all the watchmen and guards?

MsgSummary: You have to get rid of {c1}10 Futesys Low Class Knights and 10 Futesys High Class Knights{/c} and return to watchman {c2}Ires{/c}.
MsgComplete:
What a setup!
Now we can take the life of the commander-in-chief easily!
MsgTake:
The armed forces inside the enemy's base consists largely of Low Class Knights and High Class Knights.
Reducing their number will be advantageous to us if the war really occurs. It will also be necessary to approach their commander, David. Please go to the base camp and get rid of Low Class Knights and High Class Knights, then meet up with me again.

You have to finish everything before David's condition recovers.
Remember to make haste!
MsgWelcome: Get down...! If you're caught by them, your life just got a whole lot less lively...
MsgIncomplete: Have you taken out all the Low and High Class Knights?
MsgResponse4: Have you taken out all the Low and High Class Knights?

MsgSummary: You have to get rid of a commander-in-chief of Futesys Force, {c1}David Boreanaz{/c}, obtain a {c3}Paper of Futesys{/c}, and return to watchman {c2}Ires{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Your skill is really something else, you know that?
Actually...when I gave you this job, I questioned whether or not you could pull it off.
I want to apologize for questioning your skill even for a moment.
MsgTake:
Currrently David's condition is such that the most he can manage is to cross swords with his men in training. Even though his condition has recovered a lot in the last several days, it's not enorgh to face the enemies' unexpected attacks smoothly.
Even though he is a great commander, we can face him very easily in light of his bad condition.

I suppose that as a commander-in-chief, there will be always soldiers guarding him, so if you can gather a group of trustworthy friends in a short time, it would be safer to go with them.
While you are fighing with him, your friends can take down the surrounding soldiers and protecting you. After you get rid of David, you have to bring a Paper of Futesys he'll likely have on him, no matter what happens.

If you finish this job, I'll deliver a record of your deeds to Sir Fides through you. The fact you got rid of a famous human general will be a big advantage in your career, don't you think? I hope you'll meet with success in this mission.
MsgWelcome: Get down...! If you're caught by them, your life just got a whole lot less lively...
MsgIncomplete: What happened to David? Did you finish him off?
MsgResponse4: What happened to David? Did you finish him off?

MsgSummary: A watchman, {c2}Ires{/c}, asked you to deliver a {c(3)}Paper of Futesys{/c} to the corps commander of the Arteria Force, {c2}Fides{/c}.
MsgTake:
You got rid of a commander-in-chief and obtained a letter he was carrying.
Thanks to your performance, we've really achieved a considerable result.
Sir Fides will be pleased, no doubt.

{c5}(holding out a letter){/c}
Well, please deliver this Paper of Futesys to Sir Fides.
He has always been suspicious of the relationship between the Futesys Force and the Spinterr Resistance. I guess that with this, we can obtain the information Sir Fides has been curious about.

I'll keep on performing my assigned duty and collect other information.
I hope you'll return to the base camp safely.
MsgWelcome: Did you deliver the letter to Sir Fides?
MsgIncomplete: Did you deliver the letter to Sir Fides?
MsgResponse4: ...I'm a corps commander, Fides. What do you want from me, coming up in a humble manner like that?

MsgSummary: A corps commander, {c2}Fides{/c}, asked you to deliver a {c3}Paper of Futesys{/c} to a Castellan, {c2}Liter Vis{/c}.
MsgComplete:
What is this? Fides sent this here? Well well...
{c5}(after reading a letter, with sparkling eyes){/c}
Oh-ho! This is a secret document from Futesys; very nice. My fortune cookie is tellin' me that an attack on the Spinterr Resistance is in our future, heh heh! Good job. I want to leave another job to you, but I don't think you can deal with the Spinterr Resistance right now. When your skill reaches a level that can intimidate the Spinterr Resistance, I'll give you a mission.
See you then.

<For Warrior/Guardian><For Assassin/Hunter><For Oracle/Pagan>
MsgTake:
{c5}(with a surprised look){/c}
...This is a Paper of Futesys..!
Did you obtain this?
You're nothing short of amazing. I thought you were just another mercenary, but I didn't realize you were skilled enough to take something like this. I apologize for underrating you.

Hmmm...the Futesys Force is the suppy force of the Hecates Force.
Futhermore, as I suspected, the Futesys force has been in touch with the Spinterr Resistance.
Heh...it's a regular back-slapping session. They're all in cahoots after all.
Fine, then. We stirred up the Futesys Force, so the other two places will be hesitant to make a move for a while. This is great. Good job, soldier.

I'm not supposed to be the only one privy to this kind of information. Deliver this letter to a Castellan of the Arena Stronghold, Liter Vis.
MsgWelcome: Did you deliver the letter to the castellan?
MsgIncomplete: Did you deliver the letter to the Castellan?
MsgResponse4: The sword always tells the truth. I'm the Castellan of Arena Stronghold,  Liter Vis.

MsgSummary: You have to capture a {c1}Spinterr Elf Ranger{/c} and obtain the {c3}Paper of Spinterr{/c}, then return to the Castellan of the Arena Stronghold, {c2}Liter Vis{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Did you receive it? {c5}(Liter Vis seems excited){/c}
Good job! Oh, why is none of my soldiers able to handle such a simple job?
I'll give you the best treatment if you quit the mercenary life and join the regular army...
Well, if you don't want to, that's okay too, haha.
Let me see it...
{c5}(after examining the letter, he seems to discover something){/c} 
Oh-ho, so this is what happened, eh?
MsgTake:
I have been waiting for you.
I suppose your skill has improved a lot, right? Looking at your confident expression, I know I can trust you. Good; I'm relieved that I can leave this mission in your hands.

In the meantime, I have tried to figure out the identity of a substantial commander of the Spinterr Resistance. I've had a hard time because those shrewd elves purposely tried to throw us off by putting up three or four fake commanders.
In addition, no matter how many we kill, they seem to keep replenishing their number - it's really bothersome.
I came to consider this possibility because they're in a cooperative relationship with the Futesys Force, as mentioned in the letter you brought last time.

Anyway, what matters the most is that there is one person who is masterminding the movements of the Spinterr Resistance.
A little while ago, I extracted a confession from one of our captives that the job of rangers is to deliver important letters between their forces. Yes, what you have to do is to steal at least one letter from the rangers that mentions the name of the commander.
Of course, it doesn't matter whether they're alive or dead when you take the latters....
MsgWelcome: The sword always tells the truth. I'm a Castellan of the Arena Stronghold,  Liter Vis.
MsgIncomplete: Did you obtain a letter which includes the name of a commander?
MsgResponse4: Did you obtain a letter which includes the name of a commander?

MsgSummary:
You have to get rid of {c1}3 Spinterr Elf High Class Knights{/c} and a commander of the resistance, {c1}Tamias Kalreion{/c}, then return to the Castellan of Arena Stronghold, {c2}Liter Vis{/c}.
You can find {c1}Tamias Kalreion{/c} among {c1}Spinterr Elf High Class Knights{/c}.
MsgComplete:
You did a splendid job! Well done!
I can see that the loss of their commander is sinking in and they're and running about in confusion.
Now it's time to sweep away them at once by organizing a follow-up force with our soldiers.
Elf scoundrels, I'll help them disappear completely from Adeurian!
Here's a reward I've laid out for you. I hope you'll find it useful. I pray the Goddess protects you. <Power of DEX><Power of LUC>
MsgTake:
This is a name I haven't seen before.
In addition, according to this expression 'destroy right after receiving and confirming' and comparatively specific written instructions, this guy 'Tamias Kaleion' must be a real commander of Spinterr Resistance. This is my hunch from my years of being a soldier.
I have to express my gratitude to that stupid ranger who didn't destroy this letter; I'd place my bets on it.
With what we've learned in this letter, I'm going to eliminate this fellow...!

We don't know his identity, so we can't estimate how much skill he has.
But I bet you can take care of this.
However, you have to jump into a nest of enemies, so I figure it wouldn't be a bad idea if you're accompanied by your friends in case of an emergency.
I feel that'll improve your safety overall.
It will be very disappointing if we lose an opportunity like this.
Pick up friends who are capable of watching your back, then move in to take Tamias's head.
MsgWelcome: The sword always tells the truth. I'm a castellan of Arena Stronghold,  Liter Vis.
MsgIncomplete: Did you get rid of Tamias?
MsgResponse4: Did you get rid of Tamias?

MsgSummary: You have to get rid of {c1}15 BloodDagger Guards{/c} and return to an oracle, {c2}Nilore{/c}, in the Arena Stronghold.
MsgComplete: Your skill is exactly in-line with the reports I'd heard; very admirable. Here is a reward for what you have done. If you take care of the next job as well as you've handled this one, I'll give you a better reward. What do you think about that?
MsgTake:
I was told you're the best among the mercenaries we can hire in Adeurian.
This time, I want to hire you. If you have the ability to face a regular army of the Alliance of Light without any problem, I guess you can handle the request I'm about to give you with the same amount of ease.

There is a group of thieves who call themselves the 'BloodDagger Gang.'
Actually, Adeurian district was conquered by Vail army, when it was led by Isquiron Vis, a hero of the first war. The BloodDagger Gang is a group of peasants who barely survived among people living this area at that time.
I thought they would be easy to deal with, but their power, fed by hatred and wrath, was quite intimidating even though they haven't got any organized training.
Many small troops we dispatched to subjugate suffered stunning defeats.
Only then did I realized I couldn't underestimate them carelessly. 
 
I accused injured soldiers of underestimating the enemy and let them stay at home for a while.
I figure a competent mercenary like you will be the right person to do this kind of job.
Can you go and take care of the guards who will be securing the camp?
They are many, but I'm sure we can handle them alone.
MsgWelcome: May Etain and St. Mother Nasiliel guide your path. How can I help you?
MsgIncomplete: Did you take care of all BloodDagger Guards?
MsgResponse4: Did you take care of all BloodDagger Guards?

MsgSummary:
You have to get rid of {c1}5 BloodDagger Assassins{/c} and a boss, {c1}Kent Oldman{/c}, then return to {c2}Nilore{/c}, an oracle.
You can find {c1}Kent Oldman{/c} inside of camp of BloodDagger gang.
MsgComplete: Thanks. I guess the BloodDagger Gang will be having a hard time trying to elect a new leader for the time being. Of course, before that happens, the attack force headed for them might kick their sorry arses into the afterlife, heh heh. Here is a reward for work well-done.
MsgTake:
The boss of the BloodDagger Gang is named Kent Oldman.
This guy is not a trained soldier, just one of peasants.
I guess he was elected as a boss because he possessed greater power and better leadership then others.
In short, I mean, he is no match against you, a mercenary with top-notch skills.  

However, this guy is also a boss leading a group, so you should stay sharp.
As usual with bosses, you never know when this guy might use a dirty trick and catch you off-guard. I'm embarassed to admit it, but our attack force made that foolish mistake. However, I'm certain you'll take care of them without any mistake because you're an expert.
Please go to the camp of the BloodDagger gang, get rid of the boss, Kent Oldman, and high-tail it back to me.
MsgWelcome: May Etain and St. Mother Nasiliel guide your path. What can I help you with?
MsgIncomplete: Did you take care of Kent Oldman and his rabble?
MsgResponse4: Did you take care of Kent Oldman and his rabble?

MsgSummary: A weapon dealer named {c2}Jonet Orson{/c} told you to find a weapon dealer named {c2}Turma{/c} in Prymates village.
MsgComplete:
Yes, I'm Turma.
Did you come here after listening to Jonet Orson's story? Haha...I guess it pays to talk around, huh? Anyway, can you guarantee your skill?
More specifically, have you fought with Kobolts before?
MsgTake:
I thought you were just a guest, but you're a mercenary~
Are you looking for a job?
I'd like you to help a weapon dealer named Turma.  I don't know exactly what it is he wants, though.
He isn't the sort of person who ordinarily likes to ask for help, so I'm sure it will be the kind of job one person can't handle on their own.

You can find Prymates Village if you exit this stronghold and follow the route toward the east. The village is not that big, so it shouldn't take you too long to find Turma.
MsgWelcome: Didn't you leave for Prymates yet?
MsgIncomplete: Didn't you leave for Prymates yet?
MsgResponse4:
I used to be a miner.
But now I'm just selling weapons because those Kobolt rascals occupied the mines.

MsgSummary:
You have to capture {c1}ShovelCavern Kobolt Workers{/c} and collect {c3}7 iron ores{/c}, then return to Turma.
You find the ShovelCavern Koblot family in Getan Mine located to the southwest of village.
MsgComplete:
Ah, you have returned already. Did you collect everything?
{c5}(receiving a piece of ore){/c}
Yeah, those Kobolt monsters have been digging up ore...I never really wanted to run a business like this, but I have no choice now. Thanks for taking on my unexpected favor.
I hope this will be enough of a reward. I'll see you later, then.
MsgTake:
I already told you once, but I used to be a miner working in the ShovelCavern mine.
At that time, we managed to make a living by digging up ore and selling it.
However, a while back, some strange guys appeared in the area around the mine.
They turned out to be Kobolts. I and my coworkers deemed them unimportant and carried on with our work. We just thought those ridiculous-looking fellas would cause some minor trouble, then be on their way. We were wrong, though.
What started as only a few Kobolts increased in number as the weeks went on, and finally they attacked the mine, taking over instantly.
Many coworkers were taken off the guard and lost their lives...{c5}(shaking his head sadly){/c} I...I'd rather not think about that time.

The few coworkers who survived all left this village. I was born and raised in this village, so I can't abandon my lifelong home.
...well, I don't intend to ask you to take revenge for me. Just go to the mine the Kobolts are occupying and bring back several ores. I need them to make weapons to sell. About 7 would be good.
MsgWelcome: I used to be a miner, but the kobolts occupied the mine, so I'm selling weapons now.
MsgIncomplete: How many iron ores have you collected?
MsgResponse4: How many iron ores have you collected?

MsgSummary: You have to take care of {c1}10 Aurizen Ruin Beholders{/c} and return to {c2}Jyurable{/c} the blacksmith.
MsgComplete:
Good job~
Damn Beholders. They should've known better than to follow the Hellteeth in the first place. Now they're gonna eat it for their foolish decision.
MsgTake:
Well hey there; I didn't know you were the well-known mercenary who'd been sighted in the area.
I'll offer you a really enough reward, so do you think you could help me out?
Good, good; I like your spirit!
That's the good attitude I like to see in a Nordein~!

Anyway, if you head south from the town, you'll find a ruin named Aurizen.
I heard people used to perform some kind of ritual there.
Well, that's not really relevant, though. Anyway, the important thing is that those annoying Helltooth guys are occupying the ruin.
Now that they've suffered great losses in fighting, they're supposed to acknowledge their defeat and disappear, but they don't want to give up the ruin without a fight, it seems.

In addition, I suppose those rascals whose only skill is wielding a club performed some kind of trick, so it appears they somehow absorbed all the creatures near the ruin... It's as if Hellteeth are the sole owners of that ruin!
I don't want to see those Hellteeth setting foot on Nordein soil!
Just go to the Aurizen Ruin and dispose of the Beholders watching for intruders. That's my first request.
MsgWelcome: Irritating Hellteeth! I'm going to make as many weapons as I can, if only we could catch those rascals.
MsgIncomplete: Did you take care of those Beholders?
MsgResponse4: Did you take care of those Beholders?

MsgSummary: You have to get rid of {c1}10 Aurizen Ruin Guards and 10 Aurizen Ruin Gigantic Landers{/c} and return to {c2}Jyurable{/c} the blacksmith.
MsgComplete:
Here you are! I've been waiting for you...
Something went wrong.
Damn...I thought if we finish some of them off as an example, they would flinch, but I was wrong.
These bastards...they must really be up to something!
MsgTake:
Now that there's no one in our way, I guess we can go and sweep away those Helltooth rascals.
And while you're finishing them off, I hope you take care of all the Landers too.
I don't like the fact that they're controlled by the Hellteeth. Besides that, they even harm the village from time to time.
Probably Zbonoc probably has thoughts similar to mine on the matter.
He's probably the one who is concerned about the village the most.

Anyway, my second request is to take down Helltooth Guards and Landers.
I hope you take care of them without too much trouble.
I guess it won't be a problem to someone with your skills, though.
If we really lay into them, those Hellteeth might even come to their senses and hold back, hahaha!
MsgWelcome: Irritating Hellteeth! I'm going to make as many weapons as I can, if only we could catch those rascals.
MsgIncomplete: How is the second request going?
MsgResponse4: How is the second request going?

MsgSummary:
You have to get rid of a gargoyle, {c1}Ruzrat{/c}, and a steel golem, {c2}Osmum{/c}, and return to {c2}Jyurable{/c} the blacksmith.
You can find them among the gargoyles and steel golems in Aurizen Ruin.
MsgComplete:
Ah, thank the Goddess you returned safely! I was worried that another poor mercenary would be lost to the world beyond.
I guess Sir Zbonoc's anger will be calmed down a bit.
I don't know what Sir Zbonoc is planning, but I think I'll have to cooperate with that plan from now on. I appreciate that you finished this job safely.
Annoying Hellteeth...I can't wait to give 'em a painful experience they'll never forget!
Here is your reward. I hope it's something you'll find useful. So long, then.
 

<Power of RES><Power of WIS>
MsgTake:
I was punished very harshly by Sir Zbonoc. I began the job recklessly without discussing it with him beforehand.
He said he noticed the Hellteeth were planning something and prepared for that, but what he planned was ruined by my mistake.
He said I should take care of this mess by taking out their secret weapon.
I mean, how does he expect me to know all that without him saying anything?
All I wanted to do was expel those damn Hellteeth from our lands!
Let me apologize in advance, because I have to ask you to tackle a rough job for my last request.

I suppose it might be much safer if you get some trusted allies to go with you and take them down together, if possible.
I was told the Hellteeth made a very special gargoyle and steel golem with some kind of spell or something. According to the information Sir Zbonoc previously investigated, it's really a magnificent secret weapon.
You can find it very easily because it's twice as big as the others.
Of course...it will be not easy to defeat him. I trust your skill, but...
I don't want a person working for money to be killed in vain, so if will be much better for you to gather your friends and go together.
If you do well in finishing this job, I'll give you a nice reward, okay? Good luck!
MsgWelcome: Irritating Hellteeth....! I'm going to make as many weapons as I can if only we can catch those rascals.
MsgIncomplete: Did you dispose of everything that looked like a secret weapon?
MsgResponse4: Did you dispose of everything that looked like a secret weapon?

MsgSummary: You have to capture an {c1}Aurizen Viper Summoner{/c} and obtain a {c3}Congealed Magic Stone{/c}, then give it to a priest, {c2}Zbonoc{/c}.
MsgComplete: This is what's going on. The piece of stone you brought is a material shamans made by combining their wicked thoughts. They implanted those in opponents they wanted to manipulate and let that person obey them.
MsgTake:
I've heard a lot about you. You can handle any job without a problem, right?
A famous mercenary like you is very rare even in the Adeurian district.
I guess this is all thanks to your earnest and sincere help with the requests you take on.
Then I need to trust you and give you one job. What do you think? Do you want to try?

There is an ancient ruin called Aurizen south of the village.
I don't know exactly how this place has been made use of.
Given that the Hellteeth occupied that area and didn't give up it, there must be some kind of superb power inside there, and I guess they are trying to use it.
It's very obvious considering all creatures near the ruin are receiving the orders of the Hellteeth. Among them, one exception is a dangerous viper.

Vipers have great self-respect, so they won't become a someone's servant carelessly. However, they are now controlled by the order of the Hellteeth.
Therefore, I suppose once we examine some vipers, we might obtain a clue about this inexplicable mind-control. My request is to bring me what you obtain from the Viper Summoner.
Vipers are atrocious enemies in combat, but maybe with your skill, you'll have an easier time with them. I'll be waiting, so if you get something, bring it back to me.
MsgWelcome: Welcome to Prymates village. I'm Zbonoc, a priest.
MsgIncomplete: Did you get something from the Viper Summoners?
MsgResponse4: Did you get something from the Viper Summoners?

MsgSummary:
You have to get rid of a magician named {c1}Lazsh{/c} and a mage named {c2}Hazsh{/c}, then return to priest {c2}Zbonoc{/c}.
You can find them among Aurizen Viper Mages and Magicians.
MsgComplete:
Haha, good job. They ought to be thankful that by dying at your hands, they were freed from the control of the Hellteeth!
Anyway, at least they will no longer be humilated thanks to you.
This plan these Helltooth scum are hatching is beginning to be revealed, bit by bit. I'd better collect information again and investigate for the time being.
I'll see you later, then.
MsgTake:
It's very fortunate for us that I can decipher the Helltooth language. Let me see...it reads 'Lazsh' and 'Hazsh'... This must be the names of the vipers the shamans are manipulating.
Unfortunately, I can't figure out the identities of these mystery shamans right now. For the time being, just go and find the vipers named Lazsh and Hazsh and finish them off. If you do so, you'll be able to stop many vipers from becoming Helltooth slaves.

When you fight with normal vipers, all you have to watch out for is preventing their powerful tails from slamming down on you, but these are a little different.
I don't think you'll be defeated with such skill as you have, but stay on your guard. I hope you take care of both Lazsh and Hazsh and let me know when you've done so.
MsgWelcome: Welcome to Prymates village. I'm Zbonoc, a priest.
MsgIncomplete: What happened to Lazsh and Hazsh?
MsgResponse4: What happened to Lazsh and Hazsh?

MsgSummary: A fisherman, {c2}Beluto{/c}, asked you to deliver his message to lord {c2}Eisen{/c} in Presya Manor.
MsgComplete:
That's it. Beluto talked like that...I get it.
I'm sorry, but I'd better find out a little bit more for a while.
No, I trust your skill, but I'm thinking I should move a little bit more carefully.
Well done. I wish I can see you again.
MsgTake:
Unfortunately I'm not incredibly well-versed in the password system. In addition, I did quit this job a long time ago.
{c5}(thoughtful for a moment){/c} 
I guess Earane in Huigronn Stronghold will have no problem dealing with it.

Well, I suppose Eisen is earnestly trying to solve this problem, so I'll also cordially contribute what I can.
Tell this to Eisen: if she finds Earane in Huigronn Stronghold, she will find the answer she is looking for. Also....{c5}(glancing over you){/c} tell her that if she is thinking about sending you there to fight against the Black Breath Gang, it's an obvious misjudgment.
Your current skill just won't be enough to handle the guys in the base, evidently, so it'll be much better to find another mercenary.
Anyway, I'm done with you, so you can leave at any time.
{c5}(Beluto turns his face away, as though he is no longer interested){/c}
MsgWelcome: I'm just a fisherman. You don't wanna hear my boring fishing tales, do you?
MsgIncomplete: Did you deliver my message to Eisen?
MsgResponse4: I'm a lord of Presya Manor, Eisen. What brought you to our manor?

MsgSummary:
You have to get rid of {c1}5 Harpy Guards and 5 Mud Devourers{/c} and return to {c2}Beluto{/c}.
You can find them near the lake where {c2}Beluto{/c} is.
MsgComplete: Ho ho, this ain't bad; you've got some considerable skill. I want to give you a sufficient reward, but this is all I have because I'm just a fisherman. Just take it without complaint. Aaaaanyway, now that the disturbances have been kinda cleared up, I'd better get back to my fishing~!
MsgTake:
Hey...lookin' at you there, I'm guessing you're a freelancer, eh?
Strange thing; you look awfully familiar, though.
Are you busy right now?
Good, good...if you're not busy, you can lend a hand to this here poor fisherman.

These days, there have been a lot of nuisances near the lake.
I was already having difficulty of fishing, and to make matters worse, now there are these disturbances!
Harpy Guards and Mud Devourers have been the most troublesome.
Can you go and use your butt-kicking skill to school these punks who're interrupting my fishin' time?
Don't worry skipper; I'll give you a reward for it.
MsgWelcome: I'm just a fisherman. You don't wanna hear my boring fishing tales, do you?
MsgIncomplete: Did you do what I requested?
MsgResponse4: Did you do what I requested?

MsgSummary: A lord of Presya Manor, {c2}Eisen{/c}, told you to find {c2}Earane{/c} in Huigronn Stronghold.
MsgComplete: Ah, it was you~ (grinning)  I knew lord Eisen sent somone here, so I didn't expect you'd come. Hu hu hu...do you want to know how it is I know you?
MsgTake:
You didn't leave yet! Phew.
At first, I was afraid you'd leave to find another job.
As the result of hiring every mercenary in this area and giving them a job, I know for a FACT that none of them is more skilled than you.
Beluto underestimated you too much, and I also believed what he said. I apologize.
Could you take care of the Black Breath Gang one more time?

This code-breaking job is almost over, thanks to the assistance of Earane, who Beluto introduced me to.
Now we need a competent person who will take their base by surprise. Earane sent a message requesting someone to help.
I'd like to introduce you to Earane. Go to Huigronn Stronghold and find her and tell her you're the one I sent, then she'll let you know what to do.
May Etain guide your path!
MsgWelcome: Earane will be waiting, so you should be on your way.
MsgIncomplete: Earane will be waiting, so you should be on your way.
MsgResponse4: What a fine day! This is the perfect weather for hunting.

MsgSummary: An unknown fighter trainee, {c2}Gawain Primer{/c}, suggested you find {c2}Creath Question{/c} and learn the wisdom of fighter.
MsgComplete: Hmmm? Gawain Primer sent you here?
MsgTake:
Greetings and salutations! My name is Gawain Primer. I'm a fighter wandering here and there, training myself.
Looking at you, my highly-trained eye can see you're an adherent to the martial way!

Do you want to be a hero like Meteor Stardust, perchance? I want be a someone like him, by all means! Ever since I was a young lad, my dream has been to become a great hero like him. In order to reach that level, extremely arduous training and an effort equally matched to the harshness of that training is required.
Y'know what I think? I think you need a more PASSIONATE reason to train! That's the stuff!

Word has reached my youthful ear of a half-elf magician named Creath Question who lives in this area.
Look for him. His fresh wisdom and insights will enlighten you!
Well~ It's time to be on my way. I hope that one day, we can be heroes together in the Stardust Knights!
MsgWelcome: May the Goddess's blessing fall radiantly upon your future~
MsgIncomplete: May the Goddess's blessing fall radiantly upon your future~
MsgResponse4: Don't disturb me. I'm in the middle of important research. If you want to say something, I'll listen after I finish this.

MsgSummary:
You have to perform the tasks that Meteor Stardust accomplished in the past to understand the dignity of the Fighter.
You have to find {c1}Bacaras{/c} among the group of wyverns located on the beach to the west and defeat him, then return to {c2}Creath{/c}.
MsgComplete:
How was it? I see you've engraved that sense of dignity upon your body.
I'll give you a present, in hopes that your dignity and your blade shall never dull.
This sword is the brother of the blade I gave to Gawain in the past. Take it.
MsgTake:
Hoohoo...that Gawain fellow left me a real hum-dinger of a project.
What did he say to you?
Just a trainee?
Hah! I knew it. Despite how he might look, he's quite famous in the Stardust Knights. I have known him since he was 15 years old. Of them all, his skill is probably the closest to Meteor Stardust's level.

By the way, the wisdom he mentioned is not something you can learn just by hearing me say some smart-sounding quote.
If you're a fighter, it'd be better to learn with your body directly. In the past, Meteor Stardust challenged himself against Freezing Mirage, a water dragon which harrassed Etos Island, the birthplace of humans, in order to test himself. In that battle, Meteor achieved a landmark accomplishment by cutting off the horn of dragon. He was given the title of "Valorous" and became a remarkable hero...

If you want to be a someone like him, you need a strong sense dignity which will encourge your spirit. There are place where water wyverns gather together a little way from here toward the west. Go and test your might against a wyvern there named Bacaras, all by yourself, then return, just like Meteor Stardust did in the ancient era. Go, and engrave that dignity upon your body.
MsgWelcome: Don't disturb me. I'm in the middle of important research. If you want to say something, I'll listen after I finish this.
MsgIncomplete: Dignity isn't just made or given. It creates itself in one's heart, and shines forth in all aspects of one's life!
MsgResponse4: Dignity isn't just made or given. It creates itself in one's heart, and shines forth in all aspects of one's life!

MsgSummary: An unknown Defender, {c2}Darkys Eizman{/c}, suggested you find {c2}Creath Question{/c} and learn the wisdom of the Defender.
MsgComplete: Oh-ho? Darkys Eizman sent you here?
MsgTake:
Why hello there. My name is Darkys Eizman. I'm just a bum of a Defender, whose name isn't really worth remembering, though I'd be honored if ya did.

If you want to follow the Defender's path, you should have a solid will, excellent skill, and a lofty sense of honor. Otherwise, you'll live and die as a mediocre defender. I'm giving you this advice because I don't want you to make the same mistakes I've made. Don't think my words too presumptuous.

There is a very famous magician named Creath Question living in this area.
Why don't you find him and learn the wisdom that'll help you develop your own potential?
MsgWelcome: For Apulune! And for your lofty spirit!
MsgIncomplete: For Apulune! And for your lofty spirit!
MsgResponse4: Don't disturb me. I'm in the middle of important research. If you want to say something, I'll listen after I finish this.

MsgSummary: YYou have to perform the tasks that Meteor Stardust accomplished in the past to understand the Honor of the Defender. You have to find {c1}Bacaras{/c} among the group of wyvern located on the beach to the west and defeat him, then return to {c2}Creath Question{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Congratulations on overcoming the ordeal. How was it? Did your soul offer up an answer to your question? Perhaps you'll have to ask your soul for the rest of your life.
I prepared a small gift for you. This is a shield that Darkys himself once used. In the times when you feel lost, this letter engraved on your shield will give you strength. I will see you again someday.
MsgTake:
Hmm...I think that Darkys' leading you here was a sign of Etain's protection.
Since my birth, I have lived for 270 years. In all that time, I haven't seen another human with a sense of honor as lofty as his.

Before he was framed and banished, he was the most renowned Defender among the Royal Knights of Apulune Royal Castle.
I think it's safe to say that as Gawain Primer is to the Stardust Knights, so was Darkys Eizman to the Royal Knights.

It was truly absurd that he was banished from the Royal Knights by such a ridiculous false incrimination, and from his brother no less.
However, he didn't do anything about his brother's false incrimination.
He just said it was his own fault because he couldn't protect his honor.
He reproached himself, and accepted it very modestly.
MsgWelcome: Don't disturb me. I'm in the middle of important research. If you want to say something, I'll listen after I finish this.
MsgIncomplete: Constantly ask your soul what honor is, so that you can protect yourself no matter what trials may come your way.
MsgResponse4: Constantly ask your soul what honor is, so that you can protect yourself no matter what trials may come your way.

MsgSummary: An unknown mage, {c2}Meilan Snowflawer{/c}, suggested you find {c2}Creath Question{/c} and learn the wisdom of the Mage.
MsgComplete: Oh-ho? Meilan Snowflawer sent you here?
MsgTake:
Hello, I'm glad to see you. My name is Meilan. I'm one of many mages who is following the path of magic. It looks like you're also a follower of the path of magic.
If that's so, I recommend you find Creath Question and obtain the wisdom of magic. I'm not adept yet, by any means, but I gained considerable confidence through the wisdom I obtained from him.
Like Justin Windwalker, the hero of the past, I assume a Half Elf is has special sensitivity to being awakened to the true meaning of magic.
Anyway, if you want to continue following the path of magic, you must meet Creath Question, who has made his hermitage in this area.
Ah, one more thing - he is very eccentric. Keep that in mind.
MsgWelcome: I hope the power of Mystra will be with you...
MsgIncomplete: I hope the power of Mystra will be with you...
MsgResponse4: Don't disturb me. I'm in the middle of important research. If you want to say something, I'll listen after I finish this.

MsgSummary:
You have to go through the test {c2}Creath Question{/c} suggested in order to learn the mighty essence of magic as a Mage.
You have to find and dispose of a Sealakel Shaman named {c1}Inositol{/c} among the group of Sealakels on the beach west of this place.
MsgComplete:
You have returned. I'll tell you now... There is no such thing as 'the essence of magic.'
If there was something like that, wouldn't it be a far simpler matter for anyone to be an Arch Mage like Justin Windwalker? You dealt with magic you'd never seen nor studied before with your own power, and defeated it. Keep in mind that you've already begun to grasp what it means to have the 'essence of magic.'
This is a small present I'm giving to you, young one, who is trying to follow the path of magic.
Even though the ordeal of Mystra will surely test you someday, I hope you overcome it with sagacious wisdom.
MsgTake:
Did you come here by Meilan's recommendation?
Meilan...Meilan...ah! That naive mage. Until a little while ago, he had insisted he wanted to learn the essence of magic here.

Do you also want to learn the essence of magic from me? My tuition is expensive.
Also you could die. Well...knowing that, do you still want to do this? Hahaha~

Good, good. From now on, follow my instructions. There is a Sealakel family inhabiting the beach west of here. They are using a completely different system of magic than the system we're using. This magic is called 'spell' and 'primitive magic.' Among them, the primitive magic used by a Sealakel named Inositol is quite outstanding. Take out this Sealakel, Inositol, with your magic and return to me.
Then I'll let you know the essence of magic.
MsgWelcome: Keep it always in mind that the God of Magic, Mystra, is watching over you.
MsgIncomplete: Keep it always in mind that the God of Magic, Mystra, is watching over you.
MsgResponse4: Don't disturb me. I'm in the middle of important research. If you want to say something, I'll listen after I finish this.

MsgSummary:
You have to find betrayers of the Deities Religion, {c2}Formal Wills and Julia Dillun{/c}, and dispose of them.
Keep on the lookout, because they're protected by the harpies of Fedion Forest.
MsgComplete: Your victory is like the victory of religion, and the victory of religion is like the victory of Etain. The power of your steadfast faith must have led you to victory. Please accept my gratitude and the gratitude of the Deities Religion for your sincere faith. I hope your faith is bolstered, and continues to grow in the future.
MsgTake:
Hello. I am pleased to make your acquaintence.
I'm Catherine Parker, a Grand Inquisitor belonging to the Deities Religion. I'm here to find heretics, betrayers of the religion, and judge them. As you know, we, the priests of the Deities Religion, are supposed to serve only the God of Shaiya, Etain.

However, vicious gods of another world are trying to test us in order to possess this world, standing on the outskirts of Shaiya. My duty as a Grand Inquisitor is to eliminate the villains captivated by the vicious gods who threaten this world. The people I'm pursuing are heretics named Formal Wills and Julia Dillun. Originally, they used to be priests who belonged to the Deities Religion. However, they couldn't endure the temptation of the vicious gods of another world, and betrayed Etain. They are now hiding inside Fedion Forest and controlling harpies with the power they received from vicious gods, trying to build some sort of force.

I tried to chase and dispose of them, but the power they received from the vicious gods sealed off my power instead. I managed to escape their retribution, but I don't think I can deal with them all by myself. Could you help me and dispose of those heretics? It's a golden opportunity for you to show your faith to religion.
MsgWelcome: May Etain guide your future.
MsgIncomplete: May Etain guide your future.
MsgResponse4: May Etain guide your future..

MsgSummary:
You have to stop the Orcs' plot to destroy the Fedion Forest. You have to dispose of {c1}Talratan{/c} and return to {c2}Linus Cloud{/c}.
You can find Talratan among orcs if you go west along the way toward Arktuis Village.
MsgComplete: Don't forget that you're a ranger possessing a firm will, even if the endless bloodlust is always vying for control of your mind. This is a small gift I'd like to give to you, so please accept it.
MsgTake:
Hello there. I'm Linus Cloud, a ranger of Fedion Forest.
As you already know, the original duty of Rangers was to serve as a patrol and reconaissance. That means we have to be more aware of things happening in nature than anybody else, and take care of those things. However, as the war against the Union of Fury unfolds, our job has taken on new roles such as protecting the Alliance of Light from the Union of Fury, stealing information from them, and revealing their weaknesses in order for our armies to plot the destruction of their forces - things like these. Quite different from patrolling the woodlands, eh?

But that doesn't mean we can forget our original duty. The real objective of rangers is protecting people from the threats and intimidation of others, rather than killing or destroying people.

This area is the place where the Orcs, an old enemy like the Vail, have their base - and there are also many Orcs near the Fedion Forest I'm patroling.
These Orcs are destroying the forest and doing a lot of harm to travelers passing by through, attacking them or taking their money or belongings.
Could you help me and dispose of Talratan, the boss of these Orcs?
MsgWelcome: It'd my hope that you'll attain a firm will as a Ranger.
MsgIncomplete: It'd my hope that you'll attain a firm will as a Ranger.
MsgResponse4: It'd my hope that you'll attain a firm will as a Ranger.

MsgSummary:
You have to get rid of a Vail assassin who invaded the Haldeck Farm district.
{c1}Sien Avilross{/c}, a Vail assassin, is aiming at village from near the northwest of village. You have to get rid of him and return to {c2}Amidion Sunseer{/c}.
MsgComplete:
In the past, the hero of us, archers, Arushien SilenceRain spoke like this after he retired from active service.
[An arrow you fired will not be shaken as long as your unchangeable firm faith is not shaken.]
I also propose you ruminate this remark one more time.
This is a small gift I give to you. This is an arrow which has been threading through the battelfield with me for over 200 years. I hope you use this valuably.
MsgTake:
{c5}(Amidion pricks up his ears, cautious of the approaching sound of footstep. You speak to him.){/c}
Wh..whaaa?! Ah! Sorry. My eyesight has really been going downhill recently, so it's hard to make specific things out. If you hadn't said something, I might've thought you were an enemy and shot and arrow straight for your heart.

Recently, a vicious Vail assassin has been popping up in locations around this area and giving me a headache. If my eyesight were as good as it was in the past, my arrow would pierce his heart, but now all I can do is anticipate his appearance and fire a shot hoping to hit him, so I feel really sad.

Could you go and get rid of this Vail on my behalf? He deserves a cursed fate!
MsgWelcome: An arrow nocked to the bowstring with faith will never betray you.
MsgIncomplete: An arrow nocked to the bowstring with faith will never betray you.
MsgResponse4: An arrow nocked to the bowstring with faith will never betray you.

MsgSummary:
You have to defeat {c1}7 Ares Gray Bears{/c} and return to a headman, {c2}Tabras{/c}. The Union of Fury stationed GrayBears aimed at Blessian Fortress.
If you exit the north gateway of Blessian Fortress, you can see GrayBears are making frequent appearances.
MsgComplete: The watchers told me your performance was outstanding. The atmosphere of this fort will be much better now. However, we don't know when the Union of Fury will make another move, so I hope you'll always stay sharp and watch out.
MsgTake:
As the moves of the Gray Bears become more aggressive, restlessness is prevailing among the people. All clans of the Alliance of Light are damaged. What are we supposed to do?
This seems to be a part of plan in which the Union of Fury intends to occupy the Blessian Fortress. They must be trying to train Gray Bears and cause confusion among our ranks. Could you do something for us? I'd like you to defeat these Gray Bears and calm down people so that Blessian Fortress can be peaceful.
MsgWelcome:
The number of victims still continues to increase!
There's not much we can do now due to Ares Gray Bears.
MsgIncomplete:
The number of victims still continues to increase!
There's not much we can do now due to Ares Gray Bears.
MsgResponse4:
The number of victims still continues to increase!
There's not much we can do now due to Ares Gray Bears.

MsgSummary:
You have to hunt {c1}8 Eltanin Pixies and 8 Eltanin Vipers{/c} and return to a headman, {c2}Tabras{/c}.
Those who have a good reproductive ability are making a frequent appearance on the Battlefield of Draco situated in the center of Cantabilian.
MsgComplete: Well done. I guess we somehow stopped the clan from reproducing. Now focus on protecting the Holy Relic!
MsgWelcome: The fiends of the Eltanins increase in number each day. Why are you still here?!
MsgIncomplete: The fiends of the Eltanins increase in number each day. Why are you still here?!
MsgResponse4: The fiends of the Eltanins increase in number each day. Why are you still here?!

QuestName: The Altar of Temple of Pharos <Danger!>
MsgSummary:
You have to destroy {c1}Pharos Temple Golden Spiders{/c} and collect {c3}5 Golden Powders{/c} to give to blacksmith Nor Randolph.
You have to be accompanied by friends, as the monsters inside the Temple of Pharos are very strong.
MsgComplete: Hahaha...! How dare those petty spiders...! Nobody can take away the goldstone of holy Temple as long as this Nor is alive.
MsgTake:
Gah-hah...it can't be!
I heard a crazy rumor a little while ago. What I heard was that the spiders wandering around the Cantabilian swarmed into the Temple of Pharos and...well, they ate the goldstone of the temple, which granted them immortality of the soul!
{c5}(pausing and staring at you blankly){/c}
...You still don't understand what I mean?

The goldstone of the Temple of Pharos is a holy artifact that symbolizes the immortality of the soul...! Go now and eliminated all those blasphemous spiders who would profane the relic!
MsgWelcome: Hey! The goldstone of the Temple of Pharos is in danger of vanishing even as we speak! So...why are you still here?
MsgIncomplete: Hey! The goldstone of the Temple of Pharos is in danger of vanishing even as we speak! So...why are you still here?
MsgResponse4: Hey! The goldstone of the Temple of Pharos is in danger of vanishing even as we speak! So...why are you still here?

MsgSummary: You have to find {c3}5 Arms of Trineton Warriors{/c}, taken from {c1}Trineton High Class Warrior{/c} who came into the Temple of Pharos to steal the goldstone of immortality of the soul, and return to {c2}Nerio Goodman{/c}, a weapon merchant. You have to be accompanied by allies, as Trineton Warriors are very strong.
MsgTake: The dream of the warriors of Trineton is to have an immortal soul, as though they were gods. That's why they invaded the Temple of Pharos to obtain the goldstone of immortality of the soul. But....{c5}(with an oddly pleased look){/c} Their 'fun' has only begun! That place is just like a labyrinth, so you can't find the way out easily. You're well aware of this, aren't you? Now those lost Trineton Warriors are more like a mouse in a trap. If you can get rid of them all and retrieve their weapons, it'd be a great help to my weapon research. If you're willing to do the deed, there's a good reward in it for you.
MsgWelcome: If you can't even handle Trineton Warriors when they're stuck in a trap, I'm afraid I might've overestimated your abilities.
MsgIncomplete: If you can't even handle Trineton Warriors when they're stuck in a trap, I'm afraid I might've overestimated your abilities.
MsgResponse4: If you can't even handle Trineton Warriors when they're stuck in a trap, I'm afraid I might've overestimated your abilities.

QuestName: The Secret Passage of the Temple of Pharos
MsgSummary:
You have to get rid of {c1}5 Draco Evil Spirits{/c} and return to {c2}Nerio Goodman{/c}, a weapon merchant.
You have to get rid of Draco Evil Spirits and lift the curse om Tamia's sealed lips.
MsgComplete:
Tamia finally opened her mouth..!This is all thanks to you. The Temple of Pharos will be safe.
You did an outstanding job. I'll give you a plenty of reward.
MsgTake:
By the way, I've been meaning to ask...did the Trineton warriors really come through the Secret Passage of the Temple of Pharos?
If that's true, it's a really big problem. Tamia is the one who knows for certain, but when she went out to the Battlefield of Draco, she was struck silent by a Draco Evil Spirit. This is a really big deal.
Could you kill Draco Evil Spirits and lift the curse of silence that's been placed upon her?
If we lift the seal of the curse and Tamia tells us about the secret passage, our soldiers can go there and block that place.
This is a really important mission for the entire Alliance of Light. I'm counting on you!
MsgWelcome: Tamia hasn't opened her mouth yet. At this rate, the Temple of Pharos is going to be ruined.
MsgIncomplete: Tamia hasn't opened her mouth yet. At this rate, the Temple of Pharos is going to be ruined.
MsgResponse4: Tamia hasn't opened her mouth yet. At this rate, the Temple of Pharos is going to be ruined.

MsgSummary: You have to defeat {c1}8 Pharos Temple Devil Soldiers{/c} and defeat {c1}Depraved Pharos{/c}, then return to {c2}Nor Randolph{/c}, a blacksmith.
MsgComplete:
You have killed the soul of Pharos...! You did a fine job.
Vail monsters, Maybe they can't come near the Temple for a while. Now go to the battlefield and show your ability to enemies...!
I mean with your skill you captured Pharos..!
MsgTake:
This is it - time for the really big job! The soul of Pharos, which secures the Temple of Pharos, became depraved due to the influence of the Vail, who infiltrated secretly. We have to stop the soul of Pharos from obtaining the goldstone of the immortality of the soul.! If that were to happen, the Temple couldn't play its role, and Pharos won't be able to return to his previous self either.

The best method wuld be to disenchant the magic that depraved the Pharos, but time is a luxury we don't have. Killing the depraved soul of Pharos is the only way other than an extensive mobilization all forces. Do you think you can help me out?

Great, but you should be careful!
Even though the soul of Pharos was depraved, the Pharos's skill and the surrounding guardian soldiers became much stronger!
MsgWelcome: If the depraved soul of Pharos were to fully possess the goldstone...the results would probably be more catastrophic than even I'm imagining.
MsgIncomplete: If the depraved soul of Pharos were to fully possess the goldstone...the results would probably be more catastrophic than even I'm imagining.
MsgResponse4: If the depraved soul of Pharos were to fully possess the goldstone...the results would probably be more catastrophic than even I'm imagining.

MsgSummary:
You have to hunt {c1}7 Ares WhiteFoxes{/c} wandering around the strategic points of the Battlefield of Draco and return to {c2}Battmon{/c}, a village headman.
These WhiteFoxes are extremely violent, since they have been starving for several days.
MsgComplete: Well done! This was a great opportunity for you to prove that you have the qualifications to be a hero of Trineton.
MsgTake: Hohoho, this is really good news! I just received word that all the Ares WhiteFoxes the sleigh troops have been using have escaped. I guess that's the last we'll see of those dreadful sleigh troops, eh? Hahahaha! The thing is, though, those guys aren't idiots who will do nothing after losing the foxes. You'd better go and take out those WhiteFoxes whenever you see them, so the enemy doesn't have the chance to regain their 'workforce.'
MsgWelcome: I was told Whitefoxes are still running loose around the entrance of the battlefield.
MsgIncomplete: I was told Whitefoxes are still running loose around the entrance of the battlefield.
MsgResponse4: I was told Whitefoxes are still running loose around the entrance of the battlefield.

MsgSummary: You have to dispose of {c1}8 Demonstone Trolls and 8 DemonStone Troll Guardians{/c} and return to {c2}Battmon{/c}, a headman of village.
MsgComplete: Well done. It seems those Trolls are finally quiet. Who on earth would do something this stupid? If I ever find out who did this, they're gonna catch holy hell from me. Ah-haha, don't worry; you heard nothin' from me.
MsgWelcome: What the heck is going on? Those Trolls are still out there running amok!
MsgIncomplete: What the heck is going on? Those Trolls are still out there running amok!
MsgResponse4: What the heck is going on? Those Trolls are still out there running amok!

QuestName: The Power of the Jade Green Spider <Danger!>
MsgSummary:
You have to get rid of {c1}Rapioru Jade Green Spiders{/c} in the maze of Rapioru in order to help the windmill of Trineton spin smoothly, which you can do by obtaining {c3}5 Jade Green Powders{/c} and returning to {c2}Hetin{/c}, a blacksmith next to a windmill.
Monsters inside the maze of Rapioru possess formidable power, so it's in your best interest to team up with allies.
MsgComplete: It appears you have eliminated a plenty of spiders. I'll put the Jade Green Powder you brought me to good use. Thanks to you, the windmill will keep on spinnin' in the wind~ Good job!
MsgTake:
The power of nature can be dreadful sometimes. The snow continues to fall, and the temperature has continued to drop over the past month due to the unusual change in weather. Annoying spiders swarmed into the maze of Rapioru in order not to die for want of water.

The maze of Rapioru, since it 's made of jade, isn't affected by the influence of the outside temperature. It seems that the spiders ate a jade inside there and regained their strength.  Now they're causing damage to the district of Trineton again by using their poison and spider thread.

In addition, as the spiders consumed the jade, even the fuel of the windwill, which is drawn from the jade, began to run out. The village is becoming more and more impoverished; even our windmill won't spin. We have to kill Jade Green Spiders inside of Rapioru and stop the amount of jade from diminishing in the maze. Can you help me?
MsgWelcome: The windmill's spin seems to be getting steadily slower. Are the spiders still alive?
MsgIncomplete: The windmill's spin seems to be getting steadily slower. Are the spiders still alive?
MsgResponse4: The windmill's spin seems to be getting steadily slower. Are the spiders still alive?

MsgSummary: You have to obtain {c3}5 Staves of Blessian Mages{/c} who sneaked into the maze of Rapioru to steal deficient ores, then return to {c2}Asran Ireka{/c}, a weapon merchant. Blessian Mages possess formidable power, so it's in your best interest to be accompanied by allies.
MsgComplete:
hm, how dare you come here? You must finish them all, right?
Well, hand over weapons you brought, and go away.
MsgTake:
Hahaha!! I heard a rumor that the Blessian Warriors who came into the maze of Rapioru are locked inside. I guess they came to steal ore that they're lacking in. Haha...like I'm supposed to welcome them and let 'em have all the jade they want? Not bloodly likely! We have to protect the jade of the maze of Rapioru against these Blessian invaders.

I'd like you to dispose of them and bring the weapons they're carrying to me. I guess they'll be useful when it comes time to invent weapons more effective than what the Alliance of Light has. Are you willing to help me?
MsgWelcome: Are you saying you can't even handle Blessian Warriors when they're handed to you trapped in a maze? Is that all you've got? Say it ain't so!
MsgIncomplete: Are you saying you can't even handle Blessian Warriors when they're handed to you trapped in a maze? Is that all you've got? Say it ain't so!
MsgResponse4: Are you saying you can't even handle Blessian Warriors when they're handed to you trapped in a maze? Is that all you've got? Say it ain't so!

QuestName: The Secret Passage of the Maze of Rapioru
MsgSummary: You have to hunt {c1}5 Draco Eye Medics{/c} on the Battlefield of Draco and return to {c2}Asran Ireka{/c}, a weapon merchant.
MsgComplete: Now that their feet will be tied up, they'll be quiet for a while. I guess soldiers of fort will take care of the rest...Good job.
MsgTake:
Hey, aren't you the one who finished off the Blessian Warriors who came into the maze of Rapioru before?
{c5}(laughing mockingly){/c} You only know one side of the story, don't you? The same thing will happen again, if you don't block the entrance they came through, don't you think? One Blessian Lancer confessed everything. It seems Blessian warriors made use of Draco Eye Medics on the Battlefield of Draco as a means of transport. They trained Draco Eye Medics with magic and rode them. They can even travel to the entrance of the secret passage with it. How simple it is! Too simple, that's what. So...I want you to go and kill those Draco Eye Medics. Then, those Blessians' feet will be tied, so to speak. That means we don't have to bother facing off against them separately, right?
MsgWelcome: Draco Eye Medics are still flying around the Trineton Stronghold. Are you not doing your job?
MsgIncomplete: Draco Eye Medics are still flying around the Trineton Stronghold. Are you not doing your job?
MsgResponse4: Draco Eye Medics are still flying around the Trineton Stronghold. Are you not doing your job?

MsgSummary:
You have to take out {c1}8 Rapioru Reproduced Guardians{/c} and the {c1}Reproduced Rapioru{/c} and return to Hetin, a blacksmith.
Go with trusted allies in order to increase your chance of survival. In case you can't find the Reproduced Rapiour, you may have to wait for a while.
MsgComplete:
Did you take care of all of those phony reproductions?
Well done! I guess we are totally ready to to revive the Rapioru.
Well, now it's time for you to show your power on the battlefield - the power you used to defeat the reproduced Rapioru!
MsgTake:
Those Alliance of Light guys messed up the maze of Rapioru..!
They reproduced a Rapioru, as well as those who are protecting him such as guardians and guards. Then they killed a real Rapioru.
That means the Rapioru that exists now is the reproduced fake!

How could a magician of Blessian Fortress sneak inside and do something like this? The level of their science is simply incredible. We've really underrated their intelligence and ability! But now, we need to clean up this mess fast. We have to bring the dead Rapioru back to life and let the power of wrath and the consciousness of darkness coexist. Eliminate the reproduced Rapioru and his gang in one swift stroke; that's the plan.
MsgWelcome: You have to eliminate a reproduced Rapioru. That is the only way a real Rapioru can be revived.
MsgIncomplete: You have to eliminate a reproduced Rapioru. That is the only way a real Rapioru can be revived.
MsgResponse4: You have to eliminate a reproduced Rapioru. That is the only way a real Rapioru can be revived.

MsgSummary:
Fajro has asked you to deliver a message to his wife, {c2}Ralpidel{/c}, in Merukes of Adeurian.
If you follow the route north from the Warune Camp, you will find the Adeurian district.
MsgComplete: He wouldn't listen to me when I told him not to do it. Nordein are always so stubborn. Thank you for bringing word to me.
MsgTake: Sir Razum is one of the Nordein's greatest heroes and it is an honor for me to server under him. I left a wife and a home to serve here by his side, but I do miss my wife terribly. She nearly cut off my head when I told her I was leaving to take up arms against the Alliance. I hope she stays true to me even in my absence. If your travels take you through Adeurian, could you stop by the Merukes and check in on my wife, Ralpidel? Please tell her I love her and that I will try to be home soon. She may even need your help since I'm not around.
MsgIncomplete: Please let her know that once we've crushed the Alliance in this region we'll all be coming home. Let us pray that day comes soon.

MsgSummary: Ralpidel has asked you to get rid of the {c1}Nikelsaw Goblin Warriors{/c} who stole her medicine during a delivery. Find the stolen {c3}Drugs of Ralpidel{/c} and give them to Cecyan Cruise. Once you exit the village, you should be able to find the Goblins right away. You can find Cecyan in the Watch Tower if you go towards the northern paths.
MsgComplete: Hmmm, what took you so long? I can't believe this! What happened?! {c5}(Cecyan Cruise listens to your story){/c} Oh...I'm sorry for the troubles, friend. These days, it is very worrisome that Goblins are rampaging more than ever.
MsgTake: I started this small business to make a living after my husband left for the war. Somehow I've gotten a good reputation as a medicine woman. My medicines have actually become quite famous. Even the Vails of Fluvius River at the First Watch Tower order from me. A short while ago, I received an order from them. I had the medicines delivered via a delivery man, but he was attacked by a warrior of the Nikelsaw Goblin clan near the edge of the village. The medicine was stolen, but he managed to escape and return to village. My reputation is now at stake because of this. Please find my stolen shipment of medicine among the Nikelsaw Goblin clan warriors and deliver it to Cecyan Cruise in the Watch Tower.
MsgIncomplete: Hurry up! I'll be in big trouble if rumors about this keep spreading.

MsgSummary: Belpatus, a weapon merchant, has asked you to kill the Arachne, {c1}Hinatiel{/c} to avenge his son's death. Bring the {c3}Head of Hinatiel{/c} to him as proof. You can find Hinatiel among the Merudes Arachnes if you follow the northern paths from his location.
MsgComplete: Bless you, hero. That monster will never kill again, and for this I am thankful. {c5}(Silver tears fall from his eyes silently.){/c} Thank you friend. I hope my son can now find peace.
MsgTake: Hello, stranger. Would you hear me out? I used to have a son named Garan. He was my only living relative after losing my wife. Garan trained very hard in order to fight alongside the Tyrannus. He was my pride and joy. When my Garan was killed by the Arachne named Hinatiel, I felt as if my world had just been destroyed, and I just wanted to die so I could be with him again. Then my soul filled with rage, and now the only thing keeping me alive is the thought of seeing that monster killed and avenging my son's death. I have an offer for you, Hero. After my son died, I made plenty of money by selling weapons to help with the war. If you kill that bastard Hinatiel and bring me his head, I'll give you every coin I've made.
MsgIncomplete: May your weapons be coated in the blood of Hinatiel, and the blessings of Blening Mirage, God of Weapons, be with you.
MsgResponse4: ay your weapons be coated in the blood of Hinatiel, and the blessings of Blening Mirage, God of Weapons, be with you.

MsgSummary: Cecyan, a watcher, asked you to get rid of the {c1}3 Nikelsaw Goblin Stonethrowers{/c} and {c1}3 Nikelsaw Goblin Looters{/c} in order to stop the advance of the goblins trying to attack the Watch Tower. You can find the goblins massing near the Watch Tower.
MsgComplete: Well-done, Hero. You should think about defending the empire with us here. May Etain's blessing with you.
MsgTake: As you already know from the work you did for Ralpidel, the numbers of Nikelsaw Goblins are growing, and attacks on civilians are becoming much more common. They grow confident to the point of carelessnes. One night a few of them drunkenly stormed the tower. We slit their throats, all except one. We cut that bastard's fingers off one by one, but he wouldn't talk. I was afraid he'd run out of appendages and die before we got any information from him, but one of the guards had an idea. We brought in the guard dogs and let them chew on his stumps while he was still alive. He was begging to be put to death after 5 minutes of that. We found out that they are planning a full invasion of the tower here, and now we need to thin their numbers to stop their advance. We could really use your help if you are interested. We really can't afford to leave the tower undefended right now. If you could kill just 3 Nikelsaw Goblin Stonethrowers and 3 Nikelsaw Goblin Looters, that would be enough to stop them right now.
MsgIncomplete: I never thought goblins could cause so much trouble. I'll never think like that again.
MsgResponse4: I never thought goblins could cause so much trouble. I'll never think like that again.

QuestName: Information about the Hecates Force Base Camp
MsgSummary: Kaizeric, a watcher, asked you to bring any Corps Orders from the {c1}Hecates Elf Low Class Soldiers{/c}. You can easily find the Hecates Force Base Camp if you follow the route toward the southwest from here.
MsgComplete: Well done. I hope this nets us the information we need.
MsgTake: There's Alliance of Light detachment composed of Elves just a little northwest from here. Just the fact that they are so close to us is disconcerting, and even more disturbing is the fact that they have made no attempt to advance upon us. It seems to me that they have a tremendous tactical advantage from their current location, but they make no attempt to take the tower nearby. I need to know what their orders are. If we find out where they will be going, perhaps we could ambush them and steal a victory from those Elven dogs! I need to get my hands on a copy of their orders. Please see if you can find any Corps Orders on the Hecates Elf Low Class Soldiers. If you do, bring them to me right away.
MsgIncomplete: I'm sure this will not be easy, but I ask that you do it as quickly as possible. Time is of the essence.
MsgResponse4: I'm sure this will not be easy, but I ask that you hurry as much as you can.

MsgSummary: The blacksmith, Palchion, asked you to get rid of a disorderly goblin known as {c1}Zunarshirr{/c}, who has been harassing townsfolk. You can find the disorderly Zunarshirr in the territory of the Nikelsaw Goblin clan.
