MsgComplete: Ah, thank you hero. Now I can stretch my legs and go for a walk without having to worry about that rotten goblin stealing my goods.
MsgTake: That wretched Zunarshirr!! {c5}(Palchion screams in an angry rage. You begin to wonder if rage has completely taken him over, and start to think twice about approaching him.){/c} Sorry friend, I'm just so angry... because of that damn Zunarshirr! Sorry...sorry. I was about to get upset again. Every time I think about that cur, my blood starts to boil. That bastard sneaks into my shop when I go for walks and steals all my best items before they've even cooled from the forge. I don't know how he knows, but he never takes anything but the items I've worked hardest on. Would you please rid this land of that thieving bastard?
MsgIncomplete: Why are you still here? Are you actually intending to help me out?
MsgResponse4: Are you still here?

MsgSummary: You must hunt 10 {c1}Edged Blade Beak Galluses{/c}. They can be found near the Venatio Camp. After you've killed 10 of them, return here to Incoherent Babbling.
MsgComplete: Well done. You have now been entered into the event!  Good luck! ...Ah! I almost forgot...if your level is under 15, make sure you visit Paroution Fotress. If you go there, you'll find another event manager named 'Speaking Water Bucket.' I'll give you hint, he will be near the blacksmith, Dertin. Now it's time for me to graze, so please go away.
MsgTake:
Hello? Why are you talking to me? Why do I look like a horse...>  Ummmm...costume party?  Yeah, that's it...uh...well, since you're talking to me anyway, listen carefully to what I'm about to say. There is a monster named the Edged Blade Beak Gallus near the Venatio Camp located on the northeast side of this place. But you see, these are not really Edged Blade Beak Galluses, they're actully GMs having a costume party just like they do in Last Chaos! Really!

Aaaaanyway, please capture 10 Edged Blade Beak Galluses and return to me. Once you come back, you will have a chance to apply for a gift certificate.
MsgIncomplete: Whinny *Snort*
MsgResponse4: Neeeiiiggghh *Snort*

QuestName: Ski Resorts are the Best Place to Pick Up Girls in the Winter! (1)
MsgSummary: You have to get rid of {c1}10 Viper Demonworshippers{/c} and return to a Speaking Water Bucket.
MsgComplete: On to your next job, friend!
MsgTake:
Hey, just because a water bucket is speaking to you doesn't mean you can lift the lid and look inside. Trust me, I'm really just the manager in charge of this event, and I'm a much higher level than some n00b passing by, so don't get any funny ideas.

But dude, seriously, I love Winter! White snowfields, tearing down the hills on a sled, racing through the trees on skiis, and meeting fine hunnies in cozy mountain lodges! There's something about the cold that really warms up the ladies...awwwwwwww yeah. You take them back to the Ski Resort and they're all yours. That's right! The Ski resort! So friend, I've got quite an offer for you. If you complete two quests for me you will be eligible to win a 'Ski Resort Season Ticket'!!!  Think about it, friend...awwwwwwww yeah, season ticket.

Now first, get rid of 10 Viper Demonworshippers and return to me.
MsgIncomplete: Don't bother trying to open it, you can't.
MsgResponse4: Don't bother trying to open it, you can't.

QuestName: Ski Resorts are the Best Place to Pick Up Girls in the Winter! (2)
MsgSummary: You have to capture {c1}10 Large Thorn Horn Antelopes{/c} and then return to a Speaking Water Bucket.
MsgComplete: You are now officially entered into the drawing for the 'Ski Resort Season Ticket'!!! AWWWWWWW YEAAAAAAH! Now don't go running around like you've already won, the drawing is still coming up.
MsgTake: Alright kid, you were good last time, but you've got another inning to play. This time, capture 10 Large Thorn Horn Antelopes and return to me, the one and only Speaking Water Bucket.
MsgIncomplete: Ya know, I keep telling people not to try and open it, but they do anyway...so go ahead.  I don't care.
MsgResponse4: Ya know, I keep telling people not to try and open it, but they do anyway...so go ahead.  I don't care.

MsgSummary: Yo yo, homies! You best be capturing {c1}10 Goblin Shamans{/c}, located around the Argilla Ruins, and return back here to the Gibbering Dog.
MsgComplete: You are now automatically entered into the event to win the Super Shaiayaman costume which will transform you into... Super Shiayaman! or Woman...  I'm a dog, and sometimes I just can't tell with you people.
MsgTake: Hush, man! Put a lid on it! Ptune'll be pissed if she finds out I'm talking to people again. Seriously though...I've got a quest here.
MsgIncomplete: Bowwow!
MsgResponse4: Ruff! Ruff!

QuestName: Win a Limited Edition Twelve Sky Snowboard! (1)
MsgSummary: You have to defeat {c1}10 Kobolt High Class Mercenaries{/c} inhabiting the center of this area, and then go back to Crazy Piled Boxes.
MsgComplete: Ok, good job! Never doubted ya. You have now been entered into the ultra mega huge drawing for your 12 Sky Limited Edition Snowboard! Hoorays!!!
MsgTake:
Hello? Wagh! Are you amazed that a Crazy Pile of Boxes can talk? Hah hah ha... HEY! Put down your weapon! I'm not some guy in the boxes!! Please!!! DOn't smash me! I was beaten as a child! I just got out of an abusive relationship! Stop! Hey wait...I have a deal for you, just slow down there and listen to what I have to say.

I love Winter! Does this sound familiar? If so, then I'm sure you know how much fun it is to snowboard. Even though you look physically challenged and probably aren't too good at sports, if you show up at the Ski Resort with a brand new snowboard the chicks will be all over you! Surely you've wanted to attract the ladies at least once in your life, no? But alas, snowboards are so expensive! And all of the gear you have to buy as well... How could you ever afford all of this?!

Well my friend, don't you worry! If you complete just one quest for me, I'll enter you into our drawing for a Twelve Sky Limited Edition Snowboard!  That's right, a snowboard featuring custom graphics from the smash hit from Aeria Games, Twelve Sky!

So, arent' you glab you didn't smash me now? I don't see how you could possibly pass this up, my friend! First, defeat 10 of the Kobolt High Class Mercenaries inhabiting this area, then return to me.
MsgIncomplete: Shaiya! DOMO! Twelve Sky! Last Chaos! MegaTen! YEAH!!!!
MsgResponse4: Shaiya! DOMO! Twelve Sky! Last Chaos! MegaTen! YEAH!!!!

MsgComplete: Well, that about does it for this. You should be able to just move on to the next quest now, so good luck in that~!
MsgTake: Okay, here's what I need ya to do. There are Kobolt High Class Mercenaries roaming around this area, and the only reason they exist in this world is to be hunted to complete quests. It's a dismal existence, but what can you do? We might as well all serve our purposes in life. You, the cool, battle hardened warrior, should hunt down 10 of those Kobolt High Class Mercenaries, then come back and see me. Simple, no?
MsgIncomplete: Shaiya~ Shaiya~ Gooooooo Shaiya~!
MsgResponse4: Shaiya~ Shaiya~ Gooooooo Shaiya~!

MsgTake: Okay, what I need you to do is hunt down 10 Nermi Harpies, which inhabit this area, then return to me.
MsgIncomplete: Shaiya~ Shaiya~ Gooooooo Shaiya~!
MsgResponse4: Shaiya~ Shaiya~ Gooooooo Shaiya~!

MsgTake: Why hello there! If you've made it through all these previous event quests, I doubt you'll really be surprised by the fact that a siege weapon is talking to you. Crazy world we live in, huh?

MsgSummary: You must find a crazy old man named {c2}Dasmaras{/c} wandering the coutryside near Cornwell's Ruin.
MsgComplete: What? That stupid guard spoke to you and not to Kail? He's such a lazy bastard! I cannot believe how lazy of a guard he is... well... I guess that's why he ended up being a guard... I guess...
MsgTake:
Have you ever been to Cornwell's Ruin? It's a large ruin to the West of Keolloseu. There is a strange old man who I sometimes see wandering around there. Whenever he sees me, he keeps babbling about Cornwell's Ruin this, and Cornwell's Ruin that. It's so irritating! I try to block him out, but he follows me and babbles on and on! Sometimes I think I should just kill him, or at least maim him a little.  I mean, he's old...no one's gonna miss him, right? Damn...what's his name again?

But actually, now that you're here, I have an idea. Could you go to the ruins and tell that old coot to stop bothering me and the other guards who patrol the area? Maybe he'll listen to you. And if he doesn't...well, I think people would be angrier if a guard killed him, if you catch my drift.
MsgWelcome: You haven't left yet? I'd really appreciate it if you went and took care of that annoying old weirdo for me. I think his name was... Dis... Dat... Das... Dasmara! Yeah, that's it!
MsgIncomplete: You haven't left yet? I'd really appreciate it if you went and took care of that annoying old weirdo for me. I think his name was... Dis... Dat... Das... Dasmara! Yeah, that's it!
MsgResponse4: Cornwell's Ruin should be sealed off for everyone's safety.

MsgSummary: You have to hunt {c1}10 Skull Warriors{/c} inside Cornwell's Ruin, then return to Dasmaras.
MsgComplete:
Can you see how dreadful this place is? You somehow survived, though. I guess {c2}you{/c} are pretty skilled in the art of staying alive.
Cornwell's Ruin should be sealed off again. We need to let all the people in Keolloseu know the terrors that haunt this place once more.
MsgTake:
Greetings, traveler! You look to be curious about Cornwell's Ruins here. I know this place well. I wander the area trying to inform everyone who passes through here about the dangers this place once held. You see, Cornwell's Ruin is an ancient prison that was built after the war between the Dianoia family and the Elves more than a thousand years ago. This place stood long before humans ever appeared on this continent.

The Dianoia family were monsters made by an unknown being called St. Evil Spirit. Their abilities seemd to rival even those of the Elves. After they first appeared in this world, the Elves began losing their powers as nature was being destroyed all around them. The Elves' last stand was in Cornwell Forest, where they drove the Dianoia into a cave located at the corner of the forest and sealed them in for all time.

The cave remained sealed for over a thousand years, but in the end, the power of time was greater than the seal placed on the cave. The evil that was locked inside began seeping into the surrounding countryside and raising the long-dead warriors within the ruins.

{c5}(The old man begins to ramble on about names and places you think you may have heard about as a child. Hours seem to go by. You begin to understand why the guard dislikes this old man.){/c}

Am I boring you?! You do know that those who do not remember their history are doomed to repeat the mistakes of the past, right? Well, seeing as how you're so easily bored, how about you go on a mission for me? I need to collect some evidence to show those thick-headed guards so they can see that the evil has escaped from the cavern and is now here in the ruins.
MsgWelcome: What's the matter? Are you afraid to enter the ruins? What are you, a chicken? CHICKEN! CHICKEN SCAREDY PANTS! SCAREDY CHICKEN FRAIDY PANTS! GET IN THERE YA BIG WUSS!
MsgIncomplete: Oh come on! It's just a swarm of undead minions jailed for centuries, now raised from the dead seeking carnage and death for every living thing in Teos...  Don't be a wuss now, y'hear!
MsgResponse4: Wow! You're alive! Did you kill them? Excellent. Now we can prove that Cornwell's Ruin must be sealed for the sake of everyone's safety.

MsgSummary: You have to go meet {c2}Yaslikis{/c}, who posted the notice about the Devil of Dianoia. He is located in the Unicorn Fons.
MsgComplete: Finally, a capable person! Listen to my story, would you? It is true that the majority of the time I spend here is used for researching ancient tomes and studying the spirits of the nearby lands, but I also meet many heroes as they pass through. I met my master, Sir Licori, in just this way. Of course, he tricked me the same way he tricked you, by speaking of treasure and glory. Please don't be upset because I deceived you...just give me a few minutes of your time and listen to my story.
MsgTake: Have you heard of the Devil of Dianoia? Do you know of the treasure of the Dianoia? Anyone who wants to find this treasure should come and see me. It reads {c2}Yaslikis{/c}.
MsgWelcome: Have you heard of the Devil of Dianoia? Do you know of the treasure of the Dianoia? Anyone who wants to find this treasure should come and see me. It reads {c2}Yaslikis{/c}.
MsgIncomplete: Have you heard of the Devil of Dianoia? Do you know of the treasure of the Dianoia? Anyone who wants to find this treasure should come and see me. It reads {c2}Yaslikis{/c}.
MsgResponse4: May the holy power of the Unicorn Fons last forever.

MsgSummary:
You have to dispose of the devil {c1}Asmo{/c} inside of Cornwell's Ruin, then return to {c2}Yaslikis{/c}.
You must gather at least 6 allies for your party. These monsters are rare, so you may have to search for quite some time before finding one.
MsgTake:
The Devil of Dianoia is an evil spirit that my master, Sir Licori, was very interested in. He was created by the Dianoia family a long time ago. It took a great evil to summon this beast. Many of the family of Dianoia were sacrificed for the blood ritual, and even more were killed by the beast himself.

A while back, my master entered Cornwell's Ruin in search of this beast. He had heard that it still wandered the dungeons deep in the ruins. A week after he entered the ruins, some travelers found him dead on the path near here... A sanguine trail of twisted flesh and intestines led all the way back to the entrance of the ruins. Clutched in his left hand was this small diary - the one I'm holding now.

This is the real reason why I tricked you into coming here. I'm asking for your help - begging, even. I want you to avenge my master in the name of this feeble Elf. 

Now, according to his diary, the Devil has a skull-like head and hides deep within the Temple of Cornwell's Ruin. It wields an enormous sword that can cleave through any metal, and is cloaked with a long cape enchanted with magical powers. While roaming the halls, he has the ability to walk unseen. He has great spiritual energy allowing him to smash even the most powerful foes, and he is followed by minions who obey his every command. 

Now, I know I may look frail to you, traveler, but in the many years I've spent here, I have accumulated many Lapis gems - some very powerful. These are priceless treasures, and I will gladly give them to you if you do this for me.
MsgWelcome: If you see this Devil, tell me what he looks like. I must know for sure.
MsgIncomplete: If you see this Devil, tell me what he looks like. I must know for sure.
MsgResponse4: May the holy power of the Unicorn Fons last forever.

MsgSummary: You have to destroy {c1}10 Skeleton Wizards and 10 Skeleton Soldiers{/c}, then return to {c2}Darition Liar{/c} on Brunnen Ferry.
MsgComplete:
Er? What? Did you kill them already? What's all this fuss about nothing then, eh? I have no idea why that idiot thought those monsters were going to kill us all.

Well, in order for us to avoid a lynch mob for starting this scare, we better calm everyone down. I'll go in first and see if i can't diffuse this situation.
MsgTake:
I'm in big trouble...really big trouble! The Dianoia family will soon attack Keolloseu! Please gather as many heroes as you can and prepare our defenses! Men and women, young and old, as long as they can wield a weapon, we can use their help!

A while back my friend went to explore Cornwell's Ruins. He was attacked by monsters who tore off one of his arms and one of his legs. He said that soon, the devils who dwell there will attack the city! Hero, please go to the ruins and turn back these monsters! You must kill the Skeleton Wizards and Soldiers!
MsgWelcome: What?! You're planning to go by yourself?! You need at least a hundred more people to go with you! We're all dooooooooooomed!
MsgIncomplete: What?! You're planning to go by yourself?! You need at least a hundred more people to go with you! We're all dooooooooooomed!
MsgResponse4: I licked a Fire Lapis yesterday...now I can't taste anything I eat...

MsgSummary: You have to obtain {c3}5 Black Minerals{/c} from a {c1}Mysterious Box{/c} in the Cornwell's Ruin Dungeon, and go back to {c2}John Grik{/c} in Keolloseu village.
MsgComplete: Oh ho! You found it! Truly an amazing feat! Oh...wait... Please take one of these and place it in the brazier over there. We've gotta test whether this stuff is the real deal, after all.
MsgTake:
My business hasn't been doing all that well lately. Jane over there seems to have come upon a cache of weapons and is selling them dirt cheap to anyone who will have them.

My shop has always specialized in hand-made, quality weapons. I put my heart, soul, blood, sweat, and possibly other random things into the crafting of every weapon.  And now that bitch is over there peddling second-hand goods and putting me out on the streets! Unless I'm able to fill my next order, I'll be done for. And unfortunately, my brazier no longer burns hot enough to meet high demands.

You see, a little while ago, the old man who used to deliver the black ore for my brazier was killed. Licori was his name. He often went to the underground cave in Cornwell Forest to gather these unique pieces of ore. Ever since he died, my brazier no longer burns with a strong enough flame.

I'm telling you this because...to put it bluntly, I need you to do me a favor. If you are going to be passing through the Cornwell Forest, please search out these mysterious pieces of ore. According to Licori, hidden deep in the forest there's a Mysterious Box. This box produces the ore that he would collect.
MsgWelcome: I'll make you the finest weapon - any kind you want - if you do this for me, friend!
MsgIncomplete: I'll make you the finest weapon - any kind you want - if you do this for me, friend!
MsgResponse4: I hope you possess the skill to use that weapon.

MsgSummary: You have to put the {c3}Black Mineral{/c} you received from {c2}John Grik{/c} into the {c2}intense brazier{/c}.
MsgComplete:
{c5}(You throw the mineral you received from John into the brazier.
Shortly afterwards, the brazier is enveloped in intense flames.){/c}
MsgTake: Well...place it in the brazier, and let us pray this works!
MsgWelcome: Go on! Put it in there!
MsgIncomplete: Go on! Put it in the brazier!
MsgResponse4: {c5}(The flames roar and lick at the air){/c}

MsgSummary: After you confim the intense flames shooing from the brazier, you have to talk to {c2}John Grik{/c} again.
MsgComplete:
I knew if I could just get another shipment of that ore, I'd be able to heat my brazier again and make weapons like I used to! I can't wait to throw it in Jane's face!

Well, here is the reward I promised. Fresh from the forge. <One-Handed Sword Reward><Staff Reward><Dagger Reward>
MsgTake: {c5}(The brazier is glowing in strong flames like you've never seen before. Now you have to talk to John again.){/c}
MsgWelcome: {c5}(The brazier is glowing in strong flames like none you've ever seen before.){/c}
MsgIncomplete: {c5}(The brazier is glowing in strong flames like none you've ever seen before.){/c}
MsgResponse4: I hope you possess the skill to use that weapon.

MsgSummary:
Like {c2}Chrokev{/c} said, you have to kill {c1}10 Viper Darkness Mages and 10 Viper Spellbinders{/c} as a warm-up.
You can find these vipers to the west of Argilla Ruin.
MsgComplete: There were so many monsters, but it looks like they were nothin' to you! Well, while you were warming up by killing those Vipers I was visited by Garter, a local officer. I need to wait here for him to return. Well, since I'll be stranded here for a while, you should go speak to Kaise over there. He should be able to work with you since his replacement should be showing up soon.
MsgTake:
You know what? Standing on top of this watchtower I can see to the farthest reaches of the land. This is how we keep our lands safe from invasion. Oh, sorry... I forget my manners sometimes. My name is Chroke. My job is to watch over the Argilla Ruins.

A while back, I was assigned to this post by the head of Yemetis Temple, Hamus. He told me that this assignment is very important. 
Well, it may be important, but all I do is sit here and make sure nothing comes out of that creepy gate over there. That's it!

According to Sir Hamus, Argilla Ruin was completely collapsed and abandoned ever since he was a child. However, when I went there recently, the place was full of undead monsters.  I immediately reported this to him and I was given this assignment. Hell, at first I didn't think it was that bad. At least I had hordes of monsters to look forward to fighting. But ever since I started at this post...nothing. Not a damn thing has happened.

Soooo...you feel like exploring?
MsgWelcome: This is just a practice run. Just warming up for the big battle.
MsgIncomplete: This is just a practice run. Just warming up for the big battle.
MsgResponse4: Hey... Did you feel something when you were passing by? Like something walking across your grave?

MsgSummary: You have to meet {c2}Uon{/c}, a middle class priest, based on the information from {c2}Kaise{/c}. Uon is in the Yemetis Temple.
MsgComplete: Oh my...  He's so wrapped up the history of that ruin. He seems more like an archaeologist than a guard. Well, thanks for looking into that for me.
MsgTake:
The ruin is ancient and has an eventful history, but its secrets have their own dangers. Chroke spends hours exploring the ruin searching for signs of ancient relics.

Ah, sorry. I'm Kaise; I guard the gateway to this ruin.  Well, actually, it sounds cooler if you call me a 'researcher immersed in the romantic mysteries of ruins.' Before I became a guard, I visited the ruins as an archeologist. Ever since that moment, I have been captivated by the mysteriess it held within. In the end, in order to be here every day, I became a guard. There's not that much I'm able to say with total certainty, but the underground ruin is so amazing. My knowledge has always been limited, but I use my time here to collect all of the data I possibly can.

I believe something is going to happen here soon. This place has taken on an ominous feel. If you can, please report this to Uon, a priest at Yemetis Temple.
MsgWelcome: Someday, I'll write an archelogical book based on that ruin, and show it to everyone. Prepare to be excited by my findings!
MsgIncomplete: Someday, I'll write an archelogical book based on that ruin, and show it to everyone. Prepare to be excited by my findings!
MsgResponse4: I should have told him no when he asked to be a guard... That Kaise...

MsgSummary:
You have to get rid of the {c1}Skeleton Guard Kargos and Skeleton Guard Knight{/c} in Argilla Ruin, based on the information you received from {c2}Uon{/c}.
It's in your best interest to gather at least 6 allies for this mission. You may need to search for a long time before finding these creatures.
MsgComplete:
I'm so glad to see that you took out those monsters - what a magnificent power you've got!

Hmmm... The name of Kargos and Knight weren't mentioned in the ancient letters I've read. I think Kargos was a new manifestation brought about by the twisted energies still tormenting this place.

Anyway, now the monsters are gone, and you deserve to receive an appropriate reward for what you have done.
Don't decline my offer. Please accept this on behalf of Yemetis Temple and those who have been killed by the evil within those ruins. <Reward for Warrior and Guardian><Reward for Hunter and Assassin><Reward for Pagan and Oracle>
MsgTake:
There are several stories that are now buried in the far reaches of Vail history. The tale of the Argilla Ruin is one of them. Young folk like you and Kaise are all curious about the history of the Vail, so I can understand that feeling you get when you visit there. But despite those feelings, the ruin is far too dangerous to be freely explored.

When I was young, I went to that ruin and saw ancient writing on a wall. That ancient writing included stories about some sort of creatures trapped under a curse within the walls of the ruin. I couldn't decipher all of the text, but it seems that the Vail used to channel spirits in that temple when it was still standing. They would use these spirits to manifest great power and even use them as weapons against their enemies.

No Vail dares go to that place to channel spirits any longer, and that's mainly because of two enormous monsters who dwell within. I don't know how they came into existence, but those monsters are securing the ruin's underground first floor and second floor. They keep the evil spirits from passing on and finding rest, and they also prevent us from studying the spirits.

Could you please gather a party and destroy those abominations? I know this sounds absolutely impossible, but I'm giving you this mission as a scholar, not merely as a priest of the Vail clan.
MsgWelcome: Kill those abominations so we may further our studies.
MsgIncomplete: Kill those abominations so we may further our studies.
MsgResponse4: Oh Kaise...  Why did I ever let him be a guard at the ruins?

MsgSummary: You have to get {c3}2 Evil Spirits of Argilla{/c} from {c1}Black Skeleton Soldiers or Black Skeleton Wizards{/c} and give them to {c2}Mokirate{/c} in Panakeia Lab.
MsgComplete:
Ah, the evil spirit of Argilla... Yes, this will do nicely indeed. Wait for a moment. I'll connect with a different dimention by using these. {c5}(Mokirate chants a strange spell suddenly vomits blood.){/c} G...guah! This..this is too great a power for me to contend with. These last few days, I overdid myself, so I can't control the power of these evil spirits.

But you did bring me something rather rare, so I still need to reward you appropriately. Well...this is a sort of charm unique to this continent, 'Lapis.'
I can't give you all of them, so just pick one you'd like.

<Craft Lapis Reward><Wise Lapis Reward><Shrewd Lapis Reward>
MsgTake:
Don't start thinkin' that Panakeia Lab is just a place where only Alchemists research in solitude and read musty books. There are also several people studying about other things, like people studying the evil spirits. The research of the evil spirits is just like researching ancient history to us, the great Vail clan. In my case, I succeeded my father's research about the evil spirit, so we've basically been researching this issue for two generations.

Long ago, in the age when we were able to control evil spirits very smoothly, I was told people used to contact creatures from another world, using those evil spirits. After the clan of humans appeared in Teos, the war has continued on, so from that moment, people have been researching about things that have more direct application in war, like this alchemy, rather than the evil spirits. That's why you see fewer scholars like me these days.

However, a little while ago, we realized that we can do somthing with that evil spirit. The problem is, our research is difficult to carry out because we can't obtain those evil spirits anywhere. If only I knew how to access those evil spirits, I'd be able to complete my research and summon rare things that come from a completely different dimension. Is there any way I can get them?
MsgWelcome: Please bring anything that looks like likely evidence before me. I've gotta support my latest research through thick and thin!
MsgIncomplete: Please bring anything that looks like likely evidence before me. I've gotta support my latest research through thick and thin!
MsgResponse4: Did you carry the complete evil spirit by any chance?

MsgSummary: You have to give an {c3}Evil Spirit of Argilla{/c} to {c2}Pishat{/c}, an evil spirit researcher in Arteria Blood Lab.
MsgComplete: Ah...Mokirate sent you here? I'm sorry, but this evil spirit is no longer useful. That Mokirate...he must have chanted the wrong spell. Even among my pupils, someone who's decent all-around is hard to find. Here's my advice to you: don't study useless things like evil spirits anymore. Just stick to things that have practical applications, like alchemy.
MsgTake:
I guess I have to ask a great master of evil spirit researchers, Pishat, to purify this a little bit.

I'm sorry to bother you, but would you mind taking this to Gliter and giving it to my master, Pishat?
I fear this vicious evil spirit has taken a bit of a toll on my body.
MsgWelcome: I'm counting on you. I feel sick, so I don't think I could make the trip myself right now.
MsgIncomplete: I'm counting on you. I feel sick, so I don't think I could make the trip myself right now.
MsgResponse4: These days, nobody cares about studying evil spirits. Alchemy - that's the hot topic for researchers of today!

MsgSummary: You have to kill more than {c1}10 Underground Vagabonds{/c} in Argilla Ruins within {c4}6 hours{/c} and report the result to {c2}Pishat{/c}, an evil spirit researcher in Arteria Blood Lab.
MsgComplete:
What?
That coward fellow asked you to do this and report the result?
MsgResponse1:
What is this?
How did that coward think about you?
Looking at your sword, you must have had a pretty hard time.
MsgTake:
Urk...I can't believe I really escaped this far... I really hate myself.

The thing is, my master Pishat ordered me to go to Argilla Ruin and seal off the Underground Vagabonds. But...I chanted wrong spell by mistake, so the Underground Vagabonds became more enraged! I was so scared that I high-tailed it out of there and never looked back. Ah....I don't know what to do now!  My master's really gonna lay into me for this...eeeek...

Do you...uh...think you could go there instead of me and get rid of the Underground Vagabonds? Really, I feel horrible about having to ask, seeing as how I had a hard time with them too. I'll feel grateful if you get rid of a lot of them and talk to my master.

The more you defeat, the more praise I'm sure my master will give you!
MsgWelcome: The Underground Vagabonds are very strong, as they're very old evil spirits.
MsgIncomplete: The Underground Vagabonds are very strong, as they're very old evil spirits.
MsgResponse4: These days, nobody cares about studying evil spirits. Alchemy - that's the hot topic for researchers of today!

MsgSummary: You have to return to {c2}Sitrion{/c}, an evil spirit researcher in Venatio Camp, and tell him he has been expelled.
MsgComplete:
What? What?! Expulsion...? I can't believe this! I just made one little itsy-bitsy mistake, that's all! Well damn...it doesn't make any sense to keep studying evil spirits now. That's behind the times! Besides, I was already thinking of quitting this job.

I'll give you the equipment I've been using for to research evil spirits; here, just take it. I don't have any use for it.
MsgTake:
I can't believe that idiot asked you to do this for him. What'll he ask for next, people to wipe his ass? I'm very thankful to you for getting the job done, but I'll never forgive Sitrion.

I know the level of his abilities, so I told him to seal off the evil spirit 'Black Skeleton Warrior,' not Underground Vagabonds... He made a mistake by going after the Underground Vagabonds, and he actually couldn't handle it, then shoved it onto someone else. I feel ashamed as Vail clansman, not because he's my pupil. I don't want to see him anymore, so from this moment forth, I'm striking his name from my list of students. If you meet him again, please tell him that he's been expelled.
MsgWelcome: I don't know why my all pupils are so stupid...
MsgIncomplete: I don't know why my all pupils are so stupid...
MsgResponse4: researching evil spirits is a tough job - not for the weak of heart, or mind.

MsgSummary: You have to return to {c2}Sitrion{/c}, an evil spirit researcher in Venatio Camp.
MsgComplete:
Wow...I didn't expect my master to say something like that... But you know, the fact of the matter is, I tried to seal off the Underground Vagabonds just out of simple greed, not because I misheard what my master said. (grin) Well, anyway, I have to go back now, since he sent you to find me, after all.

I didn't expect to resolve things this easily, heh... I guess it's all thanks to meeting you - I'm really thankful for everything you've done for me. Here's a gift for you.  Go on, take it. This is something special I always carried around when I studied evil spirits.
MsgTake:
I didn't expect that stupid fellow to actually ask someone else to do the work assigned to him. But even more surprising is that you faithfully helped him carry out the difficult task he asked of you.

Originally, Sitrion was a very timid pupil, but his prescience is really amazing. Even though I'm his master, I've been surprised many a time by his ability. Actually, I instructed him to seal off the Black Skeleton Warriors, but I can't help thinking his attempt to seal off the Underground Vagabonds was somehow trying to reach one step ahead of us. Perhaps his genius was actually work in full-swing here.

Ah...anyway, I feel very thankful for what you've done for both Sitrion and me, but do you think you could do me one more favor?
Please find Sitrion again, and tell him 'You don't have to seal off the Underground Vagabonds. Just come back and we'll work toward a new objective.'
Knowing him, he may be worried about getting punished by me, so be sure to convey what I've said to him.
MsgWelcome: I'm glad for those moments when I can take unexpected pride in one of my pupils.
MsgIncomplete: I'm glad for those moments when I can take unexpected pride in one of my pupils.
MsgResponse4: Researching evil spirits is no easy task.

MsgSummary: Find {c2}Regel{/c}, a manager of the Tower of Fire. The Tower of Fire is located at the east end of this place.
MsgComplete: Did you just say Lentus?
MsgTake:
I'm Lentus. Welcome. The warrior of Destruction~ You have passed the test of the destruction ordained by Kalamus. Now, listen carefully to what I'm about to say. In the past, when the Tyrannus was almost humiliated by those weaklings from the of Alliance of Light, the Vail provided their aid to the Tyrannus. Think of it as a kind of debt we're honor-bound to pay back. That's why we the and Vail formed the Union of Fury. We have to help the Vail from now on, and the Vail have to help us as well. This relationship between us will continue, and it applies to all of the Nordein race like you and me.

Why not pay a visit to Regel in the Tower of Fire? Only you, who passed the test of Destruction, deserves to get this chance. You should be flattered.
MsgWelcome: For the great Tyrannus!!
MsgIncomplete: For the great Tyrannus!!
MsgResponse4:
This place is the Tower of Fire.
It is the place where the heart of Vampire Queen Mago is sealed away.

MsgSummary: Look for {c2}Solidum{/c} in the Tower of Blood. The Tower of Blood is located to the northwest of Starfumos Village. Refer to the map and locate it.
MsgComplete: Regel sent you here, hmm?
MsgTake:
Lentus...that's the same name as one of the strongest warrior of the Csipolune, Tyrannus's bodyguards... Were there any unusual tattoos on his body, by any chance?
{c5}(nod){/c} Really...Lentus of Csipolune?! Well, he's so great, that probably explains how he knows the problems that have befallen us. So what else can he hide?

This Tower of Fire is the twin tower to the Tower of Blood. The soul and heart of Vampire Queen Mago, who threatened the Vail race in the past, are sealed away in these towers. From that time, powerful pagans have maintained the seals thoroughly so that the seal will be not lifted.

However, a problem happened in the Tower of Blood a little while ago. The Beads of Soul, which stored the soul of Mago and sealed it off, it were cracked. Currently, only several high class nobles, including the Senator, know this truth. Otherwise, too many Vail would become panicked and on-edge. It's very likely Lentus knows this truth, as it seems the Senator already figured out the graveness of the situation and reported it to the Tyrannus.

For further information, you'd better go to Solidum, a manager of the Tower of Blood, and find out the specifics of the situation.
MsgWelcome: Make haste. The destiny of the Union likely hangs on the outcome of this.
MsgIncomplete: Make haste. The destiny of the Union likely hangs on the outcome of this.
MsgResponse4:
Good to see you, Traveler.
This is the Tower of Blood, in which the Soul of the Vampire Queen, Mago, is sealed away.

MsgSummary: If you want to take on the task taht {c2}Solidum{/c} requested, talk to {c2}Solidum{/c} again.
MsgComplete: Have you made your decision?
MsgTake:
Come on in. It appears Regel hasn't received the Senator's instructions yet. Maybe that's why she sent you here, right? I suppose you've already heard about the problem that was reported to the Senator....

In the past, when we Vail won the battle against Mago, Queen of the Vampires, we separated her heart and her soul from her body and sealed off both with powerful magic, so that she would never be able to revive. However, her corpse was borne away by her minions and hidden somewhere deep in Ruber Chaos. It is very likely that these actions were perpetrated by Vampires, who now seek to revive their queen.

To our benefit, nothing has happened to Mago's heart sealed in the Tower of Fire - it remains undisturbed. Even though she has technically revived, I'm sure her condition is less than perfect. However, it is very obvious that the Vampires have become more cunning and powerful, able to revive their queen possessing just her soul. I can't let you go to Ruber Chaos right now to seal off her soul again, so I'd like you to discover the extent to which her power is influencing the Vampires.

This mission will undoubtedly be a dangerous one. I'll give you some time to think it over, so think it over and let me know what you decide.
MsgWelcome:
Good to see you, traveler.
This place is the Tower of Blood, in which the sealed-off soul of Mago the Vampire Queen resides.
MsgIncomplete:
Good to see you, traveler.
This place is the Tower of Blood, in which the sealed-off soul of Mago the Vampire Queen resides.
MsgResponse4:
Good to see you, traveler.
This place is the Tower of Blood, in which the sealed-off soul of Mago the Vampire Queen resides.

MsgSummary:
You need to analyze a specimen to find out how much the power of the Vampires in Ruber Chaos has increased due to the liberation of the soul of {c1}Vampire Queen Mago{/c}.
You have to find and get rid of a Vampire named {c1}Shapiku{/c} and return to {c2}Solidum{/c} with the {c3}Heart of Shapiku{/c}.
You can find {c1}Shapiku{/c} near the entrance of Ruber Chaos located in the southeast of this area.
MsgComplete:
I can't say for certain before we investigate, but I definitely feel like their power has increased.
It looks like we can handle it from here. I hope you'll continue to grow in power, traveling warrior.
MsgTake:
In order to find out the correlation between the omen of revival and the increase in the Vampires' power triggered by Mago's revival, we have no choice but to select an appropriate vampire and collect a specimen to measure any increase in magical power. In order to do that, you'll have to contend with the Vampires near Ruber Chaos.

I've already selected a target that'll work for us. Find the vampire named Shapiku near the entrance of Ruber Chaos and bring its heart to me.
MsgWelcome: Hurry up. Now that the seal on Mago's soul was broken, we don't have time to sit back wait for their next move.
MsgIncomplete: Hurry up. Now that the seal on Mago's soul was broken, we don't have time to sit back wait for their next move.
MsgResponse4: Hurry up. Now that the seal on Mago's soul was broken, we don't have time to sit back wait for their next move.

QuestName: The Path of the Iron Wall (2) <Epic>
MsgSummary:
Find {c2}Regel{/c}, a manager of the Tower of Fire.
The Tower of Fire is located to the east of this place.
MsgComplete: Domnan?! Did you just say Domnan?
MsgTake:
I'm Domnan. Pleased to meet'cha.
The guardian of Iron Wall...so, you received the prophecy of the Iron Wall of Kalamus, right?. Then listen carefully to what I'm about to tell you. In the past, the Tyrannus was almost humiliated by those weaklings from the Alliance of Light. In that crucial moment, the Vail provided help to the Tyrannus. Think of it as a kind of debt we're honor-bound to pay back. That's why we formed the Union with these weak Vail in order to repay our debt. We have to help the Vail from now on, and the Vail have to help us as well. This relationship between us will continue unless the Tyrannus receives the aid of the Vail again - in which case we may be in their debt once more. This applies to all of the Nordein race like you and me.

Why not pay a visit to Regel in the Tower of Fire? Only those who received the prophecy of the Iron Wall deserve this chance. You should feel flattered.
MsgWelcome: For the glory of the Tyrannus and the Nordein!!
MsgIncomplete: For the glory of the Tyrannus and the Nordein!!
MsgResponse4:
Good to see you, traveler.
This place is the Tower of Blood, in which the sealed-off soul of Mago the Vampire Queen resides.

MsgSummary:
Look for {c2}Solidum{/c} in the Tower of Blood.
The Tower of Blood is located to the northwest of Starfumos Village. Refer to the map to locate it.
MsgComplete: Regel sent you here, hmmm?
MsgTake:
Domnan is the same name as the name of  the strong guardian of Csipolune, the Tyrannus's bodyguards..
Were there any unusual tattoos on his body, perchance?!
{c5}(nod){/c}
Domnan of Csipolune?! I scarcely believe it! Well, he's of such great renown, that probably explains how he already knows of the problem that's befallen us. So what else can he hide?

The Tower of Fire is the twin tower to the Tower of Blood to the west. The soul and heart of Vampire Queen Mago, which threatened the Vail in the past, are sealed off within these two towers. From that time on, powerful Pagans have closely monitored and upkept the seals, so that they will never be broken.

However, not too long ago, a problem happened in the Tower of Blood. The Beads of Soul, which stored the soul of Mago and sealed off, were cracked. Currently, only several high class nobles, including the Senator, know this truth. Otherwise, too many Vail would become panicked and on-edge. It's very likely Domnan knows this truth, as it seems the Senator already figured out the graveness of the situation and reported it to the Tyrannus.

For further information, you'd better go to Solidum, a manager of Tower of Blood, and find out the specifics of the situation.
MsgWelcome: Make haste. The destiny of the Union likely hangs on the outcome of this.
MsgIncomplete: Make haste. The destiny of the Union likely hangs on the outcome of this.
MsgResponse4:
Good to see you, traveler.
This place is the Tower of Blood, in which the sealed-off soul of Mago the Vampire Queen resides.

MsgComplete: Have you made your decision?
MsgTake:
Come on in. It appears Regel hasn't received the Senator's instructions yet. Maybe that's why she sent you here, right? I suppose you've already heard about the problem that was reported to the Senator....

In the past, when we Vail won the battle against Mago, Queen of the Vampires, we separated her heart and her soul from her body and sealed off both with powerful magic, so that she would never be able to revive. However, her corpse was borne away by her minions and hidden somewhere deep in Ruber Chaos. It is very likely that these actions were perpetrated by Vampires, who now seek to revive their queen.

To our benefit, nothing has happened to Mago's heart sealed in the Tower of Fire - it remains undisturbed. Even though she has technically revived, I'm sure her condition is less than perfect. However, it is very obvious that the Vampires have become more cunning and powerful, able to revive their queen possessing just her soul. I can't let you go to Ruber Chaos right now to seal off her soul again, so I'd like you to discover the extent to which her power is influencing the Vampires.

This mission will undoubtedly be a dangerous one. I'll give you some time to think it over, so think it over and let me know what you decide.
MsgWelcome:
Good to see you, traveler.
This place is the Tower of Blood, in which the sealed-off soul of Mago the Vampire Queen resides.
MsgIncomplete:
Good to see you, traveler.
This place is the Tower of Blood, in which the sealed-off soul of Mago the Vampire Queen resides.
MsgResponse4:
Good to see you, traveler.
This place is the Tower of Blood, in which the sealed-off soul of Mago the Vampire Queen resides.

MsgSummary:
You need to analyze a specimen to find out how much the power of the Vampires in Ruber Chaos has increased due to the liberation of the soul of {c1}Vampire Queen Mago{/c}.
You have to find and get rid of a Vampire named {c1}Narutul{/c} and return to {c2}Solidum{/c} with the {c3}Heart of Narutul{/c}.
You can find {c1}Narutul{/c} near the entrance of Ruber Chaos located in the southeast of this area.
MsgComplete:
I can't say for certain before we investigate, but I definitely feel like their power has increased.
It looks like we can handle it from here. I hope you'll continue to grow in power, Guardian.
MsgTake:
In order to find out the correlation between the omen of revival and the increase in the Vampires' power triggered by Mago's revival, we have no choice but to select an appropriate vampire and collect a specimen to measure any increase in magical power. In order to do that, you'll have to contend with the Vampires near Ruber Chaos.

I've already selected a target that'll work for us. Find the vampire named Narutul near the entrance of Ruber Chaos and bring its heart to me.
MsgWelcome: Hurry up. Now that the seal on Mago's soul has been broken, we don't have time to sit back wait for their next move.
MsgIncomplete: Hurry up. Now that the seal on Mago's soul has been broken, we don't have time to sit back wait for their next move.
MsgResponse4: Hurry up. Now that the seal on Mago's soul has been broken, we don't have time to sit back wait for their next move.

MsgSummary:
Find {c2}Regel{/c}, a manager of the Tower of Fire.
The Tower of Fire is located to the northeast.
MsgComplete: Hmmm...you must have heard the horrible news...
MsgTake:
Ah, you must be the one who received the prophecy of Kalamus. I'm Magmell Femina, a professor belonging to Darkness Heart, and I have urgent news. As both a Pagan and an honorable person who has dutifully fulfilled the prophecy of Kalamus, you deserve to be appraised of this sensitive information.

It may come as quite a shock, but please hear me out. I was told that Vampire Queen Mago shows signs of reviving. She's the one whose shadow loomed large over the Vail in the past. However, I haven't heard the specifics or additional confirmation of this report. You might be able to learn more if you meet Regel, a manager of the Tower of Fire. Go and meet with Regel as soon as you can. I have to deliver this news to other people here as well.
MsgWelcome: May Mystra's blessing always be with you.
MsgIncomplete: May Mystra's blessing always be with you.
MsgResponse4:
This is the Tower of Fire.
It's the place where the heart of Mago, the Vampire Queen, is sealed away.

MsgSummary:
Look for {c2}Solidum{/c} in the Tower of Blood. The Tower of Blood is located to the northwest of Starfumos Village.
Refer to the map to locate it.
MsgComplete: Hmmm...Regel sent you here?
MsgTake:
This Tower of Fire is the twin tower to the Tower of Blood in the west. The soul and heart of Vampire Queen Mago, who threatened the Vail race in the past, are sealed away in these towers. From that time, powerful pagans have maintained the seals thoroughly so that the seal will be not lifted.

However, a problem happened in the Tower of Blood a little while ago. The Beads of Soul, which stored the soul of Mago and sealed it off, it were cracked. Currently, only several high class nobles, including the Senator, know this truth. Otherwise, too many Vail would become panicked and on-edge. Right now, it's only we Pagans who know this classified information. However, we haven't yet received word from the Senator....

For further information, you'd better go to Solidum, a manager of the Tower of Blood, and find out the specifics of the situation.
MsgWelcome: Make haste. The destiny of the Union likely hangs on the outcome of this.
MsgIncomplete: Make haste. The destiny of the Union likely hangs on the outcome of this.
MsgResponse4:
Traveler, Good to see you.
This place is the Tower of Blood which sealed off the Soul of Vampire Queen, Mago.

MsgSummary: If you want to take on the task that {c2}Solidum{/c} requested, talk to {c2}Solidum{/c} again.
MsgComplete: Have you made your decision?
MsgTake:
Come on in. It appears Regel hasn't received the Senator's instructions yet. Maybe that's why she sent you here, right? I suppose you've already heard about the problem that was reported to the Senator....

In the past, when we Vail won the battle against Mago, Queen of the Vampires, we separated her heart and her soul from her body and sealed off both with powerful magic, so that she would never be able to revive. However, her corpse was borne away by her minions and hidden somewhere deep in Ruber Chaos. It is very likely that these actions were perpetrated by Vampires, who now seek to revive their queen.

To our benefit, nothing has happened to Mago's heart sealed in the Tower of Fire - it remains undisturbed. Even though she has technically revived, I'm sure her condition is less than perfect. However, it is very obvious that the Vampires have become more cunning and powerful, able to revive their queen possessing just her soul. I can't let you go to Ruber Chaos right now to seal off her soul again, so I'd like you to discover the extent to which her power is influencing the Vampires.

This mission will undoubtedly be a dangerous one. I'll give you some time to think it over, so think it over and let me know what you decide.

Good to see you, traveler.
This place is the Tower of Blood, in which the sealed-off soul of Mago the Vampire Queen resides.

You can find {c1}Narutul{/c} near the entrance of Ruber Chaos located in the southeast of this area.
MsgComplete:
I can't say for certain before we investigate, but I definitely feel like their power has increased.
It looks like we can handle it from here. I hope you'll continue to grow in power, Pagan.
MsgTake:
In order to find out the correlation between the omen of revival and the increase in the Vampires' power triggered by Mago's revival, we have no choice but to select an appropriate vampire and collect a specimen to measure any increase in magical power. In order to do that, you'll have to contend with the Vampires near Ruber Chaos.

I've already selected a target that'll work for us. Find the vampire named Narutul near the entrance of Ruber Chaos and bring its heart to me.

Find {c2}Regel{/c}, a manager of the Tower of Fire.
The Tower of Fire is located to the northeast.
MsgComplete: Hmmm...you must have heard this horrible news.
MsgTake:
Ah, you must be the holy Oracle who received the prophecy of Kalamus. I'm Verdatis Sicuti, an Oracle in the service of Etain like yourself, and I have urgent news. I figure that even when you hear this, you'll keep a clear head and control yourself.

It may come as quite a shock, but please hear me out. I was told that Vampire Queen Mago shows signs of reviving. She's the one whose shadow loomed large over the Vail in the past. However, I have faith that we can stand up against her terror if we fight with Etain's protection. We haven't received more specific news yet, but if you meet with Regel, a manager of the Tower of Fire, she'll bring you up to speed on the latest news.
MsgWelcome: May Etain guide and protect you...
MsgIncomplete: May Etain guide and protect you...

MsgSummary:
Find {c2}Regel{/c}, a manager of the Tower of Fire.
The Tower of Fire is located to the northeast.
MsgComplete: Hmmm...you must have heard this horrible news.
MsgTake:
Hush...keep quiet. This isn't a story just anyone can hear. Only someone like you who received the prophecy of Kalamus and carried it out sincerely deserves to hear it. I'm Reminas Odist, a humble member of the Jackal Assassin Force - same line of work as you. Anyway, I received an urgent order, and my job is to deliver it only to people who completed the training of the first path of quickness. You carried out the prophecy of Kalamus with great skill, so I figure you'll remain calm and take what I'm about to tell you with a judicious mind.

Do you remember Vampire Queen Mago who long ago cast her dark shadow across our lands? That vicious vampire who came into this world with an enormous solar eclipse and entered into a drawn-out, bloodsucking war against the Vail?
{c5}(after a silence for a moment){/c}
I was told that it's like she's been revived. I know...crazy, isn't it? But I'm pretty sure we can face off against her terror as long as Etain protects us. One thing's for sure...we'll be in a deep load of trouble if she revives while the war against the Alliance of Light still rages on.

We haven't received more specific news yet, but if you meet with Regel, a manager of the Tower of Fire, she'll bring you up to speed on the latest news. I have to deliver this info to other people around here as well.
MsgWelcome: May the power of Crisis abide with you.
MsgIncomplete: May the power of Crisis abide with you.
MsgResponse4:
Good to see you, traveler.
This place is the Tower of Blood, in which the sealed-off soul of Mago the Vampire Queen resides.

MsgComplete:
I can't say for certain before we investigate, but I definitely feel like their power has increased.
It looks like we can handle it from here. Keep growing; we may need to call on your power again someday.
MsgTake:
The Senator judged that we can't enter into a war against Vampires in the midst of this taxing war against the Allaince of Light. I mean, it's already a demanding enough campaign without something like Mago's revival iminent. The Darkness Heart organization judged that a more realistic alternative would be simply figuring out how much power the Vampires have gained as a result of Mago's soul returning, and dealing with the Vampires based on what we find out.

In order to find out the correlation between the omen of revival and the increase in the Vampires' power triggered by Mago's revival, we have no choice but to select an appropriate vampire and collect a specimen to measure any increase in magical power. In order to do that, you'll have to contend with the Vampires near Ruber Chaos.

I've already selected a target that'll work for us. Find the vampire named Narutul near the entrance of Ruber Chaos and bring its heart to me. You must be an expert when it comes to that kind of assassination, right? Well...here's hoping so.

MsgIncomplete: Hurry up. Now that the seal on Mago's soul was broken, we don't have time to sit back wait for their next move.

Good to see you, traveler.

MsgSummary:
Find {c2}Regel{/c}, a manager of the Tower of Fire.
The Tower of Fire is located to the east of this place.
MsgComplete: Hmm...I suppose you've heard the terrible news.
MsgTake:
The name's Stravi; pleased to make your acquaintence. It seems you've fulfilled the prophecy about Kalamus's path of concentration with flying colors.
Then listen carefully to what I'm about to tell you. In the past, the Tyrannus was almost humiliated by those weaklings from the Alliance of Light. In that crucial moment, the Vail provided help to the Tyrannus. Think of it as a kind of debt we're honor-bound to pay back. That's why we formed the Union with these weak Vail in order to repay our debt. We have to help the Vail from now on, and the Vail have to help us as well. This relationship between us will continue unless the Tyrannus receives the aid of the Vail again - in which case we may be in their debt once more. This applies to all of the Nordein race like you and me.
Go to Regel in Tower of Fire. Only person who succeeded in the path of concentration deserves to get this chance. You should be flattered.
MsgWelcome: All hail the Tyrannus, and long life to the Nordein!
MsgIncomplete: All hail the Tyrannus, and long life to the Nordein!

Look for {c2}Solidum{/c} in Tower of Blood.
The Tower of Blood is located to the northwest of Starfumos Village. Refer to the map to locate it.
MsgComplete: Hmmm...Regel sent you here?
MsgTake:
Stravi...so, the Nordein also heard about our problem? Or, is it that the Senator asked for help? I'm guessing that the latter is what's actually the case.
{c5}(mumbling half to himself){/c}

The Tower of Fire is the twin tower to the Tower of Blood to the west. The soul and heart of Vampire Queen Mago, who threatened the Vail in the past, are sealed off within these two towers. MsgSummary:
You have to find {c2}Tiris BlueArrow{/c}, a chief of guards in Silvaren.
Silvaren is located in the south of this area. To find it easily, you can refer to your map.
MsgComplete: Olando Jordan? Aaaah, that small-fry human apprentice fighter told you, right?
MsgTake:
Hey-hey-hey! I've heard about you! I'm Olando Jordan. You might not think it from my appearance, but I'm an apprentice fighter of Stardust Knight. Ehem~
{c5}(Olando whose face turned red in a state of elation.){/c}
Ah! I wonder you already know this. Apparently, the Orcs in Maitreyan launched a surprise attack on Silvaren, but were captured by Tiris, Silvaren's chief of guards.

I figure they've gotta have some kind of important information! I'm on my way to the Stardust Knights of Apulune to deliver that news to them. I've got a document Tiris told me to deliver to a chief, but he also told me to let you see it. Isn't that a violation of the rules. I'd just suggest going to see Tiris in Silvaren - I'm sure he'd be delighted to meet'cha. Oh, would you look at the time! I'm so busy these days, busy busy busy! Gotta get a move on now~
MsgWelcome: I'm super-duper busy! Places to go, people to shoot the breeze with~
MsgIncomplete: I'm super-duper busy! Places to go, people to shoot the breeze with~
MsgResponse4: Welcome to Silvaren.

MsgSummary:
{c2}Tiris BlueArrow{/c} asked you to meet with a captured Orc, a chief of the Bloodwolf assault troop named {c2}Beseltu{/c}.
You can find {c2}Beseltu{/c} a little way off from {c2}Tiris BlueArrow{/c}.
MsgComplete: What!? You feeble human fighter!
MsgTake:
Welcome friend, follower of the path of dignity~ Just as your heard from Olando Jordan, we succeeded in capturing the chief of Maitreyan Orc assault troop, who launched a surprise attack against Silvaren. His name is Beseltu. Other than his name, rank, and unit, he simply shut up - we can't get any information out of him.

It has been 1000 years since their king, Ankylul WildDark, was defeated by the Elves in the Storm War, and he sneaked into the depths of Maitreyan. For all those thousand years, the Orcs have only been protecting their citadel, except for sporadic skirmishes here and there. Actually, this is the first time they've launched an attack on a place as far from their seat of power as Silvaren. I fear this incident may have set the Orcs into a more warlike mood - perhaps even gearing up for a large-scale assault.

If someone like you, a dignified warrior, lends us a hand, it would be a great help. First, try speaking with Beseltu. Who knows; perhaps this barbaric Orc will respond to you where our own attempts at communication have failed...
MsgWelcome: I'll be waiting for you to bring good news.
MsgIncomplete: I'll be waiting for you to bring good news.
MsgResponse4:
Woaaaaaagh! 
{c5}(roaring in fury){/c}

MsgSummary: {c2}Beseltu{/c} wants you to take revenge on an Orc named {c1}Palcum{/c} and {c1}Blood Wolf Attackers{/c} who betrayed him. In order to get the information {c2}Tiris{/c} wants, it seems you have to deliver Beseltu's vengeance to these Orcs. First, return to {c2}Tiris{/c} and report this situation.
MsgComplete: Well...what did you find out?
MsgWelcome: (Beseltu remains silent)
MsgIncomplete: (Beseltu remains silent)
MsgResponse4:
Woaaaaaagh! 
{c5}(roaring in fury){/c}

MsgSummary:
{c2}Tiris BlueArrow{/c} wants you to obtain information from {c2}Beseltu{/c} by helping Beseltu carry out his revenge.
You have to get rid of {c1}Blood Wolf Attackers{/c} and {c1}Palcum{/c}, who are supposedly near Maitreyan and return to {c2}Beseltu{/c} with the {c3}Head of Palcum{/c} and {c3}12 Heads of Blood Wolf Attackers{/c} in order to hear what you want to know. You can find Maitreyan north of Silvaren.
MsgComplete: Gah...hahahaha! HYAHAHAHAHA!
MsgTake:
Well! That's quite a surprise!

{c5}(Tiris looks very surprised){/c}

It looks like this is our golden opportunity. Not only will we be able to obtain the information from Beseltu, we'll be able to reduce the number of Orcish troops a bit in the process!
If you do what the Orc said, I'll ask Alius Magicartisan, famous for his mastery of craftsmanship, to make something perfect for you. I think that Etain meant for this to be your destiny. That's why all of us happen to be in Silvaren at the exact same time, I believe.

May Etain bless Alliance of Light.
MsgWelcome: Hurry up. Men cannot remain in Silvaren for too long, so be sure to finish up and come back before Alius leaves.
MsgIncomplete: Hurry up. Men cannot remain in Silvaren for too long, so be sure to finish up and come back before Alius leaves.
MsgResponse4:
Woaaaaaagh! 
{c5}(roaring in fury){/c}

MsgSummary: You have to convey the information you heard from {c2}Beseltu{/c} to {c2}Tiris{/c}.
MsgComplete: Damn...we're in worse trouble than I thought!
MsgWelcome: (Beseltu remains silent)
MsgIncomplete: (Beseltu remains silent)
MsgResponse4: Welcome to Silvaren.

MsgSummary:
{c2}Tiris{/c} asked a famous artisan, {c2}Alius Magicartisan{/c}, to prepare an incredible reward as a thanks to the work you've done for him.
You have to find the famous artisan {c2}Alius Magicartisan{/c} and receive the reward he's made for you.
MsgComplete: Ah, so you're the Human Fighter who's been lending a hand lately? Thanks for helping Tiris.
MsgTake:
Ankylul WildDark has revived... Is that what he said? How did he look when he said it?

{c5}(Tiris seems shocked){/c}

As of right now, this has becomes a problem I can no longer handle on my own.
I'm glad now that I sent messengers from the Elves to the Stardust Knights, the Royal Knights, and Iudex.

Anyway, I'm very grateful to you. You're truly a human who follows the path of dignity~
I hope that the gift I asked to Alius to craft will be finished by now.
I think you'll like it; I asked him to make something befitting a fighter with a solid sense of pride and dignity.
MsgWelcome: May Etain protect you.
MsgIncomplete: May Etain protect you.
MsgResponse4: When I work, my heart must move first - only then can my hands accomplish great things.

MsgSummary:
You have to find {c2}Tiris BlueArrow{/c}, a chief of guards in Silvaren.
Silvaren, where Tiris stays, is located in the south of this area.
Refer to the map if you're having trouble finding it.
MsgComplete:
Cristina Kitten?
Ah! That small human apprentice fighter told you, right?
MsgTake:
Hello there! I'm Cristina Kitten, of the Royal Knights.
I've heard so much about you. How was Darkys?

{c5}(Cristina blushes as bashfully){/c}

I don't think he's guilty of any charges. There are many among the Royal Knights who believe him innocent, too. I'm betting he will be exonerated someday, and when he is, I hope he'll come back.

Aaaah! I've dilly-dallied here too long... I'm on my way to Apulune to deliver the news from Silvaren now. You're not a Defender of the Royal Knights yet, but if you want to protect your honor and increase in strength, I'd recommend you go meet with Tiris BlueArrow, a guard of Silvaren. Anyway, I've gotta be on my way! See ya 'round!

May the King's honor ever be upheld!
MsgWelcome: I hope I see you in Apulune someday.
MsgIncomplete: I hope I see you in Apulune someday.
MsgResponse4: Welcome to Silvaren.

MsgSummary:
{c2}Tiris BlueArrow{/c} asked you to meet a captured Orc named {c2}Beseltu{/c}, the chief of the Bloodwolf assault troop.
You can find {c2}Beseltu{/c} a little way off from {c2}Tiris BlueArrow{/c}.
MsgComplete: What!? A feeble Human Defender?
MsgTake:
Welcome friend, follower of the path of dignity~ Just as your heard from Christina, we succeeded in capturing the chief of Maitreyan Orc assault troop, who launched a surprise attack against Silvaren. His name is Beseltu. Other than his name, rank, and unit, he simply shut up - we can't get any information out of him.

It has been 1000 years since their king, Ankylul WildDark, was defeated by the Elves in the Storm War, and he sneaked into the depths of Maitreyan. For all those thousand years, the Orcs have only been protecting their citadel, except for sporadic skirmishes here and there. Actually, this is the first time they've launched an attack on a place as far from their seat of power as Silvaren. I fear this incident may have set the Orcs into a more warlike mood - perhaps even gearing up for a large-scale assault. 

It's said that Orcs are descended from from  Oak, one of the Telaiosis who they considered their God in the past. Because of that, they have a lineage that they draw great pride and dignity from. If someone like you with an untarnished sense of dignity lends us a hand, it would be a great help. First, try speaking with Beseltu. Who knows; perhaps this barbaric Orc will open up to you where our own attempts at communication have failed...
MsgWelcome: I'll be waiting for you to bring some good news.
MsgIncomplete: I'll be waiting for you to bring some good news.
MsgResponse4:
Woaaaaaagh! 
{c5}(roaring in fury){/c}

MsgSummary: {c2}Beseltu{/c} wants you to take revenge on an Orc named {c1}Dratan{/c} and the {c1}Blood Wolf Attackers{/c} who betrayed him. In order to get the information {c2}Tiris{/c} wants, it seems like you have no choice but to retaliate against them. First, return to {c2}Tiris{/c} and report this situation.
MsgComplete: What did you find out?
MsgWelcome: (Beseltu remains silent)
MsgIncomplete: (Beseltu remains silent)
MsgResponse4: Welcome to Silvaren.

MsgSummary:
{c2}Tiris BlueArrow{/c} wants you to obtain information from {c2}Beseltu{/c} by helping Beseltu carry out his revenge.

You have to get rid of {c1}Blood Wolf Attackers{/c} and {c1}Dratan{/c}, who are supposedly near Maitreyan and return to {c2}Beseltu{/c} with the {c3}Head of Dratan{/c} and {c3}12 Heads of Blood Wolf Attackers{/c} in order to hear what you want to know. You can find Maitreyan north of Silvaren.
MsgComplete: Gah...hahahaha! HYAHAHAHAHA!
MsgTake:
Wow...you really did it!

{c5}(Tiris looks very surprised){/c}

It looks like this is our golden opportunity. Not only will we be able to obtain the information from Beseltu, we'll be able to reduce the number of Orcish troops a bit in the process!
If you do what the Orc said, I'll ask Alius Magicartisan, famous for his mastery of craftsmanship, to make something perfect for you. I think that Etain meant for this to be your destiny. That's why all of us happen to be in Silvaren at the exact same time, I believe.

I pray the formidable shield of honor will always protect you.
MsgWelcome: Hurry up. Men cannot remain in Silvaren for too long, so be sure to finish up and come back before Alius leaves.
MsgIncomplete: Hurry up. Men cannot remain in Silvaren for too long, so be sure to finish up and come back before Alius leaves.
MsgResponse4:
Woaaaaaagh! 
{c5}(roaring in fury){/c}

MsgSummary: You have to convey the information you heard from {c2}Beseltu{/c} to {c2}Tiris{/c}.
MsgComplete: Oh dear...it looks like we're in more trouble than I thought.
MsgTake:
Look before you; see and know the ultimate end of those who cast away their honor. And always remember, Human, that this could be your future as well.

{c5}(Beseltu pauses for a moment, staring at the distant sky){/c}

As I promised, I will tell you what I know. But even knowing this, it is obvious there is nothing you can do about it...

{c5}(Beseltu giving a pause as if he is hesitating){/c}

Our king, Ankylul WildDark, has recovered his lost power and revived. This is all I know.
I suppose now I'll also fall into Gehenna like my 'friends' who threw away their dignity....

Goodbye. In another time, our honor may have made us friends.
Let us meet in Atsilut one day when the Goddess forgives our sins.
MsgWelcome: (Beseltu remains silent)
MsgIncomplete: (Beseltu remains silent)
MsgResponse4: Welcome to Silvaren.

MsgSummary:
{c2}Tiris{/c} asked a famous artisan, {c2}Alius Magicartisan{/c}, to prepare an incredible reward as a thanks to the work you've done for him.
You have to find the famous artisan {c2}Alius Magicartisan{/c} and receive the reward he's made for you.
MsgComplete: Ah, so you're the Human Defender who's been lending a hand lately? Thanks for helping Tiris.
MsgTake:
Ankylul WildDark has revived... Is that what he said? How did he look when he said it?

{c5}(Tiris seems shocked){/c}

As of right now, this has becomes a problem I can no longer handle on my own.
I'm glad now that I sent messengers from the Elves to the Stardust Knights, the Royal Knights, and Iudex.

Anyway, I'm very grateful to you. You're truly a human who follows the path of honor~
I hope that the gift I asked to Alius to craft will be finished by now.
I think you'll like it; I asked him to make something befitting a Defender who knows the true value of honor.

Then, may Etain protect you, as you protect others.
MsgWelcome: May Etain protect you.
MsgIncomplete: May Etain protect you.
MsgResponse4: When I work, my heart must move first - only then can my hands accomplish great things.

MsgSummary:
You have to find {c2}Tiris BlueArrow{/c}, a chief of guards in Silvaren.
Silvaren where {c2}Tiris{/c} stays is located in the south of this area.
Refer to the map if you have trouble locating it.
MsgComplete: Ellion Sunrider?! Ah! The mage who belongs to MystrasEyes.
MsgTake:
Suilad, and greetings, walker of the way of magic. My name is Ellion Sunrider.
I am a descendant of Mystra, whose teachings all those who follow the path of magic serve. My affiliation is with the organization called MystrasEyes, formed of those who are descended from Mystra.

{c5}(Ellion speaks, full of confidence){/c}

You have found me on my way to Serius, from whence I have come after hearing an interesting story from Silvaren.
It seems as though the Orcs in Maitreyan who fought us in the past made a surprise attack on Silvaren, but were repelled and and were captured by Tiris, a chief of guards of Silvaren.
 
I fear Orcs will soon be on the move again. I want to convey this news to friends in Serius as soon as possible.
Of course, I bet Tiris already reported this to Iudex, though. If you're curious and want the story straight from the source, go to Silvaren.

Anar caluva tielyanna, friend~
MsgWelcome: Keep in mind that the power of Mystra remains ever with you.
MsgIncomplete: Keep in mind that the power of Mystra remains ever with you.
MsgResponse4: Welcome to Silvaren.

MsgSummary:
{c2}Tiris BlueArrow{/c} asked you to meet a captured Orc named {c2}Beseltu{/c}, the chief of the Bloodwolf assault troop.
You can find {c2}Beseltu{/c} a little way off from {c2}Tiris BlueArrow{/c}.
MsgComplete: Kya-rarara! An Elven mage?
MsgTake:
Quel Re, friend and follower of the path of magic~ Just as your heard from Ellion, we succeeded in capturing the chief of the Maitreyan Orc assault troop, who launched a surprise attack against Silvaren. His name is Beseltu. Other than his name, rank, and unit, he simply shut up - we can't get any information out of him.

It has been 1000 years since their king, Ankylul WildDark, was defeated by the Elves in the Storm War, and he sneaked into the depths of Maitreyan. Perhaps time has dulled their memories of how dreadful a force we Elves can be. Up to now, the Orcs have tormented us largely with their guerilla warfare; this is the first time I know of that they've launched a full-scale surprise attack against us. 

I fear that they may finally be building their forces again, preparing for larger and larger assaults. If you have the time, it might be a good idea to see that captured Orc yourself and give us a hand with him.
MsgWelcome:
Lle desiel?
Please go now.
MsgIncomplete:
Lle desiel?
Please go now.

Woaaaaaagh! 
{c5}(roaring in fury){/c}

QuestName: A Messanger of the Deities Religion <Epic>
MsgSummary:
You have to find {c2}Tiris BlueArrow{/c}, a chief of guards in Silvaren.
Silvaren where {c2}Tiris{/c} stays is located in the south of this area.
Refer to the map, if you're having trouble finding it.
MsgComplete: Filan Merimore...ah, the priest, a messanger of Deities Religion.
MsgTake:
Ah, at last we meet! I heard you helped Catherine bring judgment against Formal Wills and Julia Dillun.
Filan Merimore's my name, and prayer's my game! I'm on my way to a branch of the Deities Religion to deliver the news about the Maitreyan Orcs who launched a surprise attack against Silvaren. As a human, I don't know what kind of love and hate relationship the Elves and Orcs have, but we're in the midst of a war against that disgusting Union of Fury...!
Ah! Etain~ Forgive the arrogance in my words and deeds.

{c5}(Filan Merimore realizes she was becoming overly agitated when talking about the Union of Fury, and she feels restless){/c}

I have to hurry along to Apulune now. Please keep on toward Silvaren and find a chief of guards named Tiris BlueArrow. Tiris will tell you all the details of the situation you need to know. Ah, and don't forget that the religion always keeps our eyes on your remarkable performance and growth. Remember that at all times, we're the agents of Etain in this world. Ta-ta for now~
MsgWelcome: May Etain's blessing will be with you~
MsgIncomplete: May Etain's blessing will be with you~
MsgResponse4: Welcome to Silvaren.

It has been 1000 years since their king, Ankylul WildDark, was defeated by the Elves in the Storm War, and he sneaked into the depths of Maitreyan. Perhaps time has dulled their memories of how dreadful a force we Elves can be. Up to now, the Orcs have tormented us largely with their guerilla warfare; this is the first time I know of that they've launched a full-scale surprise attack against us. 

It's said that Orcs are descended from from  Oak, one of the Telaiosis who they considered their God in the past. I suppose it's highly improbable that an elf like me would be able to get any further information out of him. MsgComplete: I didn't let Alius know yet, but it appears the news already arrived there.
MsgTake:
Mae govannen~ I see you're a friend who follows the path of Will. My name is Alies Moonseer, a watcher of Frost Woods. Please, lower your voice... We wouldn't want to surprise the creatures of these woods.

{c5}(Alies looks around carefully){/c}

I heard an interesting story via travelers from Silvaren, and I'm now making my way to Serius to tell 'em what I heard. According to the story, the Orcs in Maitreyan who were defeated by the Elves and went down in history as the losers are starting to become active again.

These Orcs launched a surprise attack on Silvaren, and apparently a boss Orc was captured by Tiris, a chief of guards of Silvaren. I don't know the details, so for further information, you can head on down to Silvaren yourself. I pray that this isn't some long-plotted revenge by Ankylul WildDark, the ancient Orcish King.

Anar caluva tielyanna~
MsgWelcome: I pray that Old Willow, God of Nature, will watch over you wherever you may roam.
MsgIncomplete: I pray that Old Willow, God of Nature, will watch over you wherever you may roam.

MsgComplete: Ah!? Len told you about me? How is she?
MsgTake:
Lle merna aut farien? Hello there. I'm always glad to make the acquaintence of someone who follows the path of conviction. My name is Len Starshooter. I already heard what you have done for Amidion. I respect you as one who walks the same path. Please lower your voice, lest we surprise the creatures of these woods.

{c5}(Len politely confers respect upon you){/c}

Recently, a rumor flew in to me from Silvaren on the wings of the wind. In the past, the Orcs we busted up in the Storm War hid inside Maitreyan. It seems the Orcs have recovered the power there and now launched a surprise attack against Silvaren. But it seems that in the skirmish, a boss Orc was captured by Tiris, a chief of guards of Silvaren. I'm not sure of the specific details right now, so for further information, just go to Silvaren and meet Tiris yourself.

Quel fara~ I pray the Goddess Etain and Pantera, God of the Hunt, will be with you.
MsgWelcome: I pray that the blessing of Old Willow, God of Nature, will watch over you.
MsgIncomplete: I pray that the blessing of Old Willow, God of Nature, will watch over you.
MsgResponse4: Welcome to Silvaren.

MsgSummary:
{c2}Tiris BlueArrow{/c} asked you to meet a captured Orc named {c2}Beseltu{/c}, the chief of the Bloodwolf assault troop.
You can find {c2}Beseltu{/c} a little way off from {c2}Tiris BlueArrow{/c}.
MsgComplete: Hahaha...pew pew, you sissy Elf Archer!
MsgTake:
Elen sila lumenn omentielvo~

I see before me a friend who follows the path fo conviction~ Just as your heard from Len, we succeeded in capturing the chief of the Maitreyan Orc assault troop, who launched a surprise attack against Silvaren. His name is Beseltu. Other than his name, rank, and unit, he simply shut up - we can't get any information out of him.

It has been 1000 years since their king, Ankylul WildDark, was defeated by the Elves in the Storm War, and he sneaked into the depths of Maitreyan. Perhaps time has dulled their memories of how dreadful a force we Elves can be. Up to now, the Orcs have tormented us largely with their guerilla warfare; this is the first time I know of that they've launched a full-scale surprise attack against us. They'd do well to recognize that we soundly beat all our foes.

I fear that they may finally be building their forces again, preparing for larger and larger assaults. If you have the time, it might be a good idea to see that captured Orc yourself and give us a hand with him.
MsgWelcome: Lle desiel?
MsgIncomplete: Lle desiel?
MsgResponse4:
Woaaaaaagh! 
{c5}(roaring in fury){/c}

MsgSummary: {c2}Beseltu{/c} wants you to take revenge on an Orc named {c1}Palcum{/c} and the {c1}Blood Wolf Attackers{/c} who betrayed him. In order to get the information {c2}Tiris{/c} wants, it seems like you have no choice but to retaliate against them. First, return to {c2}Tiris{/c} and report this situation.
MsgComplete: What did you find out?
MsgWelcome: (Beseltu turns his face away)
MsgIncomplete: (Beseltu turns his face away)
MsgResponse4: Welcome to Silvaren.

MsgSummary:
The Path of Conviction (2-2) <Epic>

{c2}Tiris BlueArrow{/c} wants you to obtain information from {c2}Beseltu{/c} by helping Beseltu carry out his revenge.

You have to get rid of {c1}Blood Wolf Attackers{/c} and {c1}Palcum{/c}, who are supposedly near the Maitreyan and return to {c2}Beseltu{/c} with the {c3}Head of Palcum{/c} and {c3}12 Heads of Blood Wolf Attackers{/c} in order to hear what you want to know. You can find Maitreyan north of Silvaren.
MsgComplete: {c5}(Beseltu spits upon the head of Palcum){/c}
MsgTake:
Well! That's quite a surprise!

{c5}(Tiris looks very surprised){/c}
