It looks like this is our golden opportunity. Not only will we be able to obtain the information from Beseltu, we'll be able to reduce the number of Orcish troops a bit in the process!
If you do what the Orc said, I'll ask Alius Magicartisan, famous for his mastery of craftsmanship, to make something perfect for you. I think that Etain meant for this to be your destiny. That's why all of us happen to be in Silvaren at the exact same time, I believe.

May Etain bless Alliance of Light.
MsgWelcome: Hurry up. Men cannot remain in Silvaren for too long, so be sure to finish up and come back before Alius leaves.
MsgIncomplete: Hurry up. Men cannot remain in Silvaren for too long, so be sure to finish up and come back before Alius leaves.
MsgResponse4:
Woaaaaaagh! 
{c5}(roaring in fury){/c}

MsgSummary: You have to convey the information you heard from {c2}Beseltu{/c} to {c2}Tiris{/c}.
MsgComplete: Oh dear...it looks like we're in more trouble than I thought.
MsgWelcome: (Beseltu remains silent)
MsgIncomplete: (Beseltu remains silent)
MsgResponse4: Welcome to Silvaren.

MsgSummary:
{c2}Tiris{/c} asked a famous artisan, {c2}Alius Magicartisan{/c}, to prepare an incredible reward as a thanks to the work you've done for him.
You have to find the famous artisan {c2}Alius Magicartisan{/c} and receive the reward he's made for you.
MsgComplete: You're the follower of Pantera who's been lending a hand lately? Thanks for helping Tiris.
MsgTake:
Mani?  Lle lakwenien? 

Ankylul WildDark has revived... Is that what he said? How did he look when he said it?
{c5}(Tiris seems shocked){/c}

As of right now, this has becomes a problem I can no longer handle on my own. I'm glad now that I sent messengers from the Elves to the Stardust Knights, the Royal Knights, and Iudex. Allow me to express my gratitude to you. Diola lle~ 

I hope that the gift I asked to Alius to craft will be finished by now.
I think you'll like it; I asked him to make something befitting an adherent to the ways of Pantera, as you are.

Vanya sulie~ May Etain protect you.
MsgWelcome: May Etain protect you.
MsgIncomplete: May Etain protect you.
MsgResponse4: When I work, my heart must move first - only then can my hands accomplish great things.

MsgSummary: You have to get rid of {c1}15 Sumatra Sealakel Summoners{/c} and return to {c2}Liel Uodia{/c}, a medicine merchant.
MsgTake:
Lately, I've been making a perfume in my spare time while I tend to business.
It's a very delicate art, so there are a plenty of things that can potentially throw off the process.
However, there are some things beyond the realm of my control.

Did you know there are Sealakels living on the Rapaltien Coast? The fishy smell of their bodies is wafted on the wind even to as far away as here. It's such a disgusting smell! Every time I catch a whiff of it while on the job, I feel like my nose just got hit by a runaway carriage. It's all I can manage to keep working! So what I'd like you to do is get rid of those stinky Sealakels - especially the Sumatra Sealakels, the most pungent of the bunch. Make it your top priority!
MsgWelcome: Have you rid the air of their foul stench?
MsgIncomplete: Have you rid the air of their foul stench?
MsgResponse4: Hmm...which perfume are you using? I don't mean to make a fuss, but I don't think it's the right scent for you...

MsgSummary: You have to get rid of {c1}7 Edged Blade Wind Harpy Summoners and 7 Sumatra Sealakel Chasers{/c} and return to {c2}Monokeros{/c}, a castellan, to receive a reward.
MsgComplete:
Oh, did you get rid of those Harpies and Sealakels we talked about? These last few days, there are many people like you who have paid me a visit. I guess that poster was pretty effective, eh?

Thanks for helping residents of Adellia and the travelers on the road. Is this a just compensation for your labor? I look forward to working with you again.
MsgTake:
{c5}(A poster seems to have been put up recently. Its clean lettering makes it an easy read.){/c}
 
All people in Adellia are requested to take notice. Recently, wild creatures near the Huigronn Stronghold have been making surpise attacks against innocent and weak travelers, seemingly at random. Many have been injured in these attacks; some have been killed.

These violent 7 Edged Blade Wind Harpy Summoners and 7 Sumatra Sealakel Chasers must be brought to justice. To the brave person who heeds this call, carries out this task, and returns to me, a handsome reward shall be given.
                        -Castellan Monokeros
MsgWelcome:
Huigronn Stronghold Bill-Board
(A poster seems to have been put up recently. Its clean lettering makes it an easy read.)
MsgIncomplete:
Huigronn Stronghold Bill-Board
(A poster seems to have been put up recently. Its clean lettering makes it an easy read.)
MsgResponse4: I'm Monokeros, a castellan of Huigronn Stronghold. What brought you here, traveler?

MsgSummary: You have to get rid of {c1}15 South Wind Harpies{/c} and return to {c2}Janet Castine{/c} in Sidelos Refinery.
MsgComplete: Whoa! It's just wasn't something I could do by myself. I really appreciate for what you've done for Dear. Please come again; I'll be waiting with a lot of fine weapons!
MsgTake:
Excuse me...you wouldn't happen to be a mercenary, would you? If so, I can get you a mighty fine weapon; somethin' of the sort you don't see every day. And as payment, instead of money, perhaps you could do me a favor. What do you say?
Ah, thanks.

I have a younger brother named Dear. We're not related by blood, but he is the last remaining 'family' I have, and I care about him. Due to the war, he lost his memory. I took him in and taught him how to make defense items to let him make a living by himself.

He's still pretty shy around people, but I feel relieved because he became a lot brighter than before. However, these days...I'm very worried that the harpies near the refinery have greatly increased in number. That boy is really scared of Harpies. He can't even sleep when he hears the harpies' cries - he'll often have nightmares from the sounds alone. I feel so sorry for him. Could I ask you to take out some of those harpies? Their number is too large for me to think about handling by myself.
MsgWelcome: The harpies are slowly decreasing in number. Please, work as hard as you can.
MsgIncomplete: The harpies are slowly decreasing in number. Please, work as hard as you can.
MsgResponse4: The harpies are slowly decreasing in number. Please, work as hard as you can.

MsgSummary: You have to get rid of {c1}10 Burning Stone Dwarf Workers and 10 Burning Stone Dwarf Skilled Masters{/c} and return to {c2}Doubtn{/c}, a miner.
MsgComplete: Well...fine, I admit your skills ain't so bad. I apologize for what I said. I think I came across a bit too harsh, trying to call your skill into question without even knowin' you. However, anyone would become like me if they lived in rough circumstances like these. At any rate, you did a good job.
MsgTake:
What are you, traveler or mercenary? Bah...I don't like either of 'em, truth be told. Right now, our village is on the verge of bein' destroyed. Those annoying Dwarves... Tehan is doing his best, in his own way, but there're just too many Dwarves.

{c5}(looking askance at you) ..{/c}

I'm guessin' you're a mercenary, right? I thought so - you swaggered into this dangerous village as cocksure as all the rest. You must be lookin' for a way to make some coin, right? Fine. I've got a job for you, and the pay is good if the work is complete. Here's the deal: you get rid of dwarves, and I give you a reward. Our concern will be alleviated and you can earn money. That works, don't it? And don't think of backin' out either.

If you're so rarin' to go, I'll point you in the direction of the Dwarves straightaway. We've gotta help each other if someone is in trouble, don'tcha think?
MsgWelcome: I suppose you didn't forget our deal, right? I hope you're finishing 'em off quickly - just let me know if it's gettin' to be too much for you.
MsgIncomplete: I suppose you didn't forget our deal, right? I hope you're finishing 'em off quickly - just let me know if it's gettin' to be too much for you.
MsgResponse4: I suppose you didn't forget our deal, right? I hope you're finishing 'em off quickly - just let me know if it's gettin' to be too much for you.

MsgSummary: {c2}Beluto{/c}, a fisherman, asked you to deliver his message to {c2}Eisen{/c}, a lord in Presya Manor.
MsgComplete:
That's it. Beluto talked like that...I get it.
I'm sorry, but I'd better find out a little bit more for a while.
No, I trust your skill, but I'm thinking I should move a little bit more carefully.
Well done. I wish I can see you again.
MsgWelcome: Did you deliver my message to Eisen?
MsgIncomplete: Did you deliver my message to Eisen?
MsgResponse4: Did you deliver my message to Eisen?

MsgSummary:
You have to ransack {c1}Black Breath Loot{/c} and collect a {c3}Small Jewel Case{/c}, then return to {c2}Henya Kind{/c} with it.
You have to return within {c4}60 minutes{/c}, and you must have collected at least {c3}3{/c}. You can find the Black Breath Gang's base to the south of Presya Manor.
MsgComplete: This amount is a bit small for my liking, but I'd never imagined you could even find these. Thanks.
MsgResponse1: You brought more than I was expecting, but I've no complaints about that! Thank you.
MsgResponse2: Oh my...how did you collect so many? Really, thank you. You worked hard and did a great job. Such a good young'un!
MsgTake:
You look like a good strong young'un! Can granny here ask you a favor? You can't just reject my request heartlessly, right? Ho ho! As you can see, I'm old now , so I can't make goods easily with my hands. That's why I order goods from a gemstone craftman living in Willieoseu and sell them here.

A few days ago, I placed another order, and the wagon was on its way here, but that wagon was attacked suddenly by theives. According to a wagoner who was injured but narrowly escaped, they were called the "Black Breath Group" or something like that. But those gosh-darn scoundrels stole all the things I'd ordered! So, young'un, Can you get my order back? I lost the whole shipment, and that loss is hittin' me harder than a lack of calcium in my diet.

{c5}(Wiping the moisture from her eyes){/c}
I lost my son and my grandson to the war. Now I'm alone, living hand-to-mouth. It's okay if you only recover a few - anything is better than nothing - but please find as many as you can, won't you?
MsgWelcome: Did you find whatever remains of my shipment? I hope you can track it down...
MsgIncomplete: Did you find whatever remains of my shipment? I hope you can track it down...
MsgResponse4: Did you find whatever remains of my shipment? I hope you can track it down...

MsgSummary: You have to take care of {c1}10 Bigeye Tatoramos and 10 Branch Horn Big Larvas{/c} and return to {c2}Caitlin{/c}.
MsgComplete: You're already back? I guess it's just like the rumors say - you take care of things very promptly. You've got some cool skill. Let me give you this - it's a reward for what you've done. I hope you'll keep on growing in strength. Here's to the victory of the Alliance of Light!
MsgTake:
I'm Caitlin Donovan, a Chief of Defense for Huigronn Stronghold. These days strange creatures have been discovered here and there in the Adellia district. These creatures are Tatoramos and Larvae, which are unfamiliar to Humans and Elves. As a result of my research, I found out that these creatures were rounded up by the  Primomum Army, the Deatheater army currently stationed in the southwest of this area, then set loose in our territory.

Allow me to extend to you a chance to make a contribution to the Alliance of Light's victory. The leaders are thinking we can seriously cut down the food supply of the Primomum Army by eliminating these creatures. I'll leave this task up to you. You're not a regular soldier, but I'll trust that a mercenary famous in the Adellia district like you will be able to handle this without too much trouble. I'll be waiting for your report, then.
MsgWelcome: I want you to take care of this promptly. Why is it taking so long?
MsgIncomplete: I want you to take care of this promptly. Why is it taking so long?
MsgResponse4: I want you to take care of this promptly. Why is it taking so long?

MsgSummary: You have to finish off {c1}10 Barren Ground Arachne Fighters{/c} and return to {c2}Caitlin{/c}.
MsgComplete: I've been waiting for you. I just finished researching Arachnes.
MsgTake:
Nice to see you again. I think I've got another job lined up for you, if you're game.

Another strange creature was discovered near this area again. They are eccentric creatures called Arachne. In looks, they resemble a spider, but they have woman's upper body. The problem is, Rangers who went out to scout Chaos Elves in the north frequently lost their lives to Arachne attacks. This is definitely an unnecessary loss of good men and women who help contribute to the war effort.

Our superiors instructed us to investigate why Arachnes are rampaging around like this. In the meantime, I'd like you to take out whatever Arachnes you find, so that our soldiers don't meet a pointless end like that. Go now - I trust you'll take care of this with your usual effectiveness.
MsgWelcome: I trust your skill. I hope you finish this promptly once again.
MsgIncomplete: I trust your skill. I hope you finish this promptly once again.
MsgResponse4: I trust your skill. I hope you finish this promptly once again.

MsgSummary: You have to dispose of {c1}10 Barren Ground Arachne Captors and 10 Barren Ground Arachne Watchers{/c} and return to {c2}Caitlin{/c}.
MsgTake:
As a result of our investigation, I've discovered that the Arachnes are being controlled by Chaos Elves. Of course, we came to this conclusion based on plenty of strong evidence, but...I still can't say with absolute certainty. In order to do so, we have to find out who is controlling the Arachnes and discover the details abotu their purpose. Why are they using Arachne? To what ends?

Right now, it's impossible to find out what we want to know. That'll still take a lot of time. I'm thinking I'll write a report about what I've discovered on my own and submit it to my superiors. I'll ask you to lend a hand with the best solution we can implement at the moment. I'd like you to go out and bust up some Arachnes again. My hope is that you'll buy some time for us before we receive a detailed guideline from the top brass. I'm looking forward to hearing the good news.
MsgWelcome: I trust your skill. I hope you finish this promptly once again.
MsgIncomplete: I trust your skill. I hope you finish this promptly once again.
MsgResponse4: I trust your skill. I hope you finish this promptly once again.

MsgSummary: You have to get rid of a {c1}BlackMaul Dwarf Explorer{/c} and a {c1}Burning Stone Dwarf Explorer{/c} and collect {c3}20 Exploration Reports{/c}, then give them to {c2}Wisen Allter{/c}.
MsgComplete: Well done. This amount will do just fine. I'll read over these meticulously with a commander, then we'll incinerate them all in the fires. Dwarves are cautious in defeat, so they'll stop making reports for a while, then take up a wait-and-see policy. Well done.
MsgTake:
Those Dwarves are getting rather cunning. I already knew they weren't simple explorers. I know Blackmaul and Burningstone Dwarves have been walking around the west perimeter of the corps pretending like they're exploring the area and actually writing out reports about our corps. The problem is, where the heck they are getting enough information to write out reports in any kind of detail? According to our informants, it turns out they formed a union with Primomum army.

A union between Deatheaters and Dwarves. Doesn't that strike you as more than a little odd? This might be the most ridiculous combination ever formed. Well, as much as we've enjoyed the laughs, it's time to put an end to this farce. Go and get rid of those Dwarven Explorers and steal any Exploration Reports they have on them, then bring them to me. We can't overlook the likelihood that those reports are headed for the hands of the Primomum army.
MsgWelcome: How many of those Dwarven reports have you filched so far?
MsgIncomplete: How many of those Dwarven reports have you filched so far?
MsgResponse4: How many of those Dwarven reports have you filched so far?

MsgSummary: You have to get rid of {c1}10 Dead Field Guards and 10 Dead Field Soul Watchers{/c} and return to {c2}Eorte Dulkies{/c}, a medicine merchant.
MsgComplete: Oh my...your injuries look really bad. I'm sorry, it was pretty tough, wasn't it? I'll prescribe a medicine that's very effective. Thank you very much. I might be able to investigate there now. I don't know how much time it will take, but I'll let that place turn into the beautiful earth of Adellia no matter what happens...!
MsgTake:
Have you ever gone to the Rankesian Hills before? I was told that in those hills, one can find scattered bones of monsters Sunting Manaburn controlled when he was summoned long ago. Therefore, evil spirits still remain beneath that earth, so the land here shows no signs of life. It's really a sad state of affairs.

I want to revitalize that withered earth, plunging deep into the earth fraught with the shade of trees Etain loved. However, when I was about to go there to investigate the possibility of this, everybody dissuaded me from going there by saying atrocious monsters live there and kill traveling passerbys ruthlessly...
I'm sorry to bother you, but I'd like you to lend your strength to my cause for a bit. Could you get rid of those atrocious monsters?
MsgWelcome: What of the monsters? Be on your guard, and don't get hurt...
MsgIncomplete: What of the monsters? Be on your guard, and don't get hurt...
MsgResponse4: What of the monsters? Be on your guard, and don't get hurt...

MsgSummary: You have to get rid of {c1}Black Breath Robbers{/c} and collect {c3}10 Stolen Weapons{/c}, then give them to {c2}Elliot{/c}.
MsgComplete: Hmm...there were only a few of them left, as I expected. Well, that's fine by me. At least you've carried out an important task. I'll leave a full-scale mission to you next time.
MsgTake:
Good, good. You came here when we definitely have neeed of you. You're the only one I can leave this kind of job to...heh heh. I figured out the identity of the Black Breath Gang, more or less. Those villains are stealing weapons by ambushing the wagons carrying the military supplies and selling them to the black market at an enormously high markup. More importantly, their main customers are Vail and Deatheater merchants! Up until now, we'd never have guessed it...we might have suffered serious consequences if we hadn't realized this. I feel a bit faint, now that I think on it.

I already reported this to my superiors. Sooner or later, armed forces escorting military supply wagons will be better reinforced. What I need you to do is to find the weapons they haven't sold yet. My guess is, there'll probably be only a few left. I'd like you to retreive as many weapons as possible, though.  Make haste!
MsgWelcome: How many weapons have you found? Bring whatever you discover to me!
MsgIncomplete: How many weapons have you found? Bring whatever you discover to me!
MsgResponse4: How many weapons have you found? Bring whatever you discover to me!

MsgSummary: You have to take care of {c1}2 Black Breath Subforemen{/c} and {c1}Ternid{/c}, a boss of the Black Breath Gang, then return to {c2}Elliot{/c}.
MsgComplete: Haha! I knew your skill would wipe 'em out! I feel it was a great call to let you handle this job. I'd better send a message to the Au Bird Force and make a plan now. Good job!
MsgTake:
I got a message from a patrol I sent out in order to collect information. He found out the name of a Black Breath Gang boss. The name is Ternid.
I'm not sure if this is the name of the top boss or not, but I guess at least this guy has some cloud in the organization.

I'm thinking, if we can kill this guy, the Black Breath Gang group posted in this area might break up considerably. I'm sure that, at the very least, it'd crank up the confusion for them, heh heh...

So, I want you to go and get rid of Ternid. You'll probably also have to get rid of a couple subforemen as well, since those lackeys probably always follow him around. If you can't handle them by yourself, it's okay to go with a group of trusted allies. I'm counting on you!
MsgWelcome: You haven't taken care of Ternid yet?
MsgIncomplete: You haven't taken care of Ternid yet?
MsgResponse4: You haven't taken care of Ternid yet?

MsgSummary: You have to find and open {c1}Tarakan's Herb Boxes{/c} and collect {c3}5 Herbs of Tarakan{/c}, then return to {c2}Tarakan{/c}.
MsgComplete: Thank the Goddess! I was afraid you might get hurt by the Goblins. Looks like my fears were unfounded, eh? It's good to know someone as dependable as you. Thanks again!
MsgTake:
Excuse me... Can I ask you something?

A little while ago, I heard a rumor about a rare herb growing near the place where the Goblins are staying, so I went out there to dig it up.
However, goblins discovered me in their territory, and rushed toward me with an unholy glimmer in their eyes. I was so scared, I just ran away without looking back.

The problem is, in my flight, I lost all my boxes, including the herbs that were inside. I must have dropped them somewhere on the path...
{c5}(scratching his head again and again){/c}
I have a bad memory, so I'm not sure what exact route I took.  It's hard to remember when you're being chased by Goblins. They're scary! I've got no shame in admitting that you're way smarter and braver than me. That's why I'm asking for your help. Can you find the herbs in my herb boxes and bring them? I'll be waiting!
MsgWelcome: Did you find all my herbs?
MsgIncomplete: Did you find all my herbs?
MsgResponse4: Did you find all my herbs?

MsgSummary: You discovered a {c2}Corpse of Merukes Security{/c}. You'd better find {c2}Lukobo{/c}, a headman of Merukes village, and let him know about it.
MsgTake: {c5}(You discovered the corpse of a Deatheater man with a sinewy frame. The body has not yet lost all its warmth. It appears he died just a few minutes ago. Judging by the deep sickle-shaped gash on his back, he seems to have been killed by an Arachnes nearby. Ransacking the corpse, you discovered the small badge with <Merukes Security> printed on it. You'd better tell headman Lukobo about this.){/c}
MsgWelcome: (It seems there's nothing more of interest to find on the corpse.)
MsgIncomplete: (It seems there's nothing more of interest to find on the corpse.)
MsgResponse4: I'm a headman, Lukobo. What brings you to our village, stranger?

MsgSummary: You have to get rid of {c1}15 Merudes Arachne Fighters{/c} and return to {c2}Lukobo{/c}, a headman.
MsgComplete:
I really appreciate your helping us with our security and saving our village from danger. I guess those Arachnes will have no choice but to lay low for a while.
Nordein never forget a kindness we receive. Please accept my cordial reward, my friend.
MsgTake:
These days, the number of village males attacked by Arachnes is on the rise...It's too bad young Nordeins don't have the strength they'll grow into in their later years. Especially men that are weaker than women, gah hah hah! At this rate I doubt anyone could dare to aspire to being the Tyrannus. They'll be a lucky lot if they don't fall to Humans in battle, gyahaha!

Well, besides this, I can't neglect repeated deaths of my own townsfolk. Do you think you can take care of these Arachnes together with our security force? This is too demanding for the young boys in our village to deal with. That's why I'm asking for your help. If you lend your aid, I'll never forget your kindness.
MsgWelcome: Did you get rid of those Arachnes?
MsgIncomplete: Did you get rid of those Arachnes?
MsgResponse4: Did you get rid of those Arachnes?

MsgSummary: You have to hunt a {c1}Merudes Arachne Fighter{/c} and collect {c3}10 Bloods of Arachne{/c} and return to {c2}Sliva{/c}, a cook.
MsgTake:
Guess what! I'm preparing a super-special food! This is a special dish I'm making just for my lover~ All the ingredients are stewing and boiling in my big cauldron. However, I'm worried because the most vital, special, ULTIMATE spice is missing! Without that spice, this food will never be truly delicious~ What is the secret ingredient? Excellent question~ It is the fresh blood of an Arachne~ If I add even three drops of it to the recipe and boil it while old man Lukobo is dozing off, then, the ultimate Silva-plate Special will be complete! However, I've gotta keep an eye on the food; I can't leave while it's cooking. Can you help me?

I want to make a dish second-to-none, to show the true PASSION of my heart!
MsgWelcome: How much Arachne Blood have you collected so far? I'm waiting~
MsgIncomplete: How much Arachne Blood have you collected so far? I'm waiting~
MsgResponse4: How much Arachne Blood have you collected so far? I'm waiting~

MsgSummary: You have to give a {c3}Dish of Sliva{/c} to {c2}Grebe{/c}, a butcher.
MsgComplete:
What's this?
{c5}(smelling){/c} Ah...this must be food that child made..but why for me? Ah, because of the meat... Well, thanks to you and Silva, I'll dine well tonight.
MsgWelcome: Did you deliver my food to Grebe?
MsgIncomplete: Did you deliver my food to Grebe?
MsgResponse4: What is it? Do you need some meat?

MsgSummary: You have to get rid of {c1}15 Arena Gorge Harpies{/c} and return to {c2}Vikus Loen{/c}.
MsgComplete: Well, I still hear the harpies' cry, but...I can definitely tell their numbers have dropped a lot. Thank you. Now I can sit deep in thought in peace and quiet. This money will be enough, right? Well, I've got some deep thoughts to ponder, so you can let yourself out. Thanks again!
MsgTake:
Why is the problem I'm concerned about so important, you say? Hey now! I thought you seemed decent, but now you're getting all rude with me! How can you casually  brush off the weighty concerns of someone you just met? C...could it be that you only care about yourself? Your personality leaves something to be desired, but everyone's been talking about your great skill. I'll just let it slide this time.

There's one thing that's really been bothering me lately, so I have to ask for your help. I'm already having a headache due to no shortage of problems in life. But with those harpies outside of the stronghold crying noisily day and night? I can hardly even hear myself think! And that's not to mention all the sleepless nights. Can you get rid of those annoying harpies? I'll give you as much money as you want.
MsgWelcome: It's still noisy out there...are you doing your job?
MsgIncomplete: It's still noisy out there...are you doing your job?
MsgResponse4: It's still noisy out there...are you doing your job?

MsgSummary:
You have to get rid of {c1}Genetick Succubi{/c} and go back to {c2}Atlon Pietry{/c}.
You have to get rid of at least {c1}10{/c} and return within {c4}60 minutes{/c}.
MsgComplete: Not bad, but now that you have more time, you should have finished a few more off. Ah, it's a pity...
MsgResponse1:
Whoa, amazing! 
I was worried because I thought the time might be too short. Glad to know I was mistaken!
MsgTake:
Ahh, welcome~ I got a good chance to make a fortune this time around. But this isn't so easy for me to deal with alone. I'm assuming you're a mercenary, right? If you're free now, let's go in on this venture together, whaddaya say?

A little while ago, Dux was doing stealth training in the forest. Of course, we were together; we were hiding in the forest and talking. Now, a little while ago, we overheard a commander say he'd offer a great reward to anyone who would wipe out Genetick Succubi. When I heard that, I thought, "Hey, I've got as good a chance as anyone!" According to what I've heard, the commander is not a stingy person, so the reward will be impressive, to say the least. What do you think? Wanna go in together on this?

I give you information, and you take care of the job. We'll split it fifty-fifty. Deal? You've gotta get the job done faster than others, so take care of them within 60 minutes and come back without delay!
MsgWelcome: Have you taken out any Succubi yet?
MsgIncomplete: Have you taken out any Succubi yet?
MsgResponse4: Have you taken out any Succubi yet?

MsgSummary: You have to find {c2}Fides{/c}, a corps commander, and report the subjugation of {c1}Genetick Succubi{/c} to him and receive a reward.
MsgComplete: What do you want from a corps commander? An amature mercenary? Wait, what's that now? You want me to give you a reward because you took down Genetick Succubi? Hahahahaha! You're some piece of work, you know that? When did I say I'd give you money for that? Even though I said so, what you've done is not even close. Just get lost.
MsgTake:
Anyway, you finished the job, so find the commander and report to him about taking out those succubi, and just get the reward! Super simple, right?

If you think of skippin' out on me with the cash...well, you should know that I'm pretty well acquainted with the surrounding land - it'll be tough to hide.
MsgWelcome: Did you find the corps commander? What of the reward?
MsgIncomplete: Did you find the corps commander? What of the reward?
MsgResponse4: Hey, how are you making most of your money these days? I heard that there's recently been a lot of bounty jobs.

MsgSummary: You have to find {c2}Fides{/c}, a corps commander, and report the subjugation of {c1}Genetick Succubi{/c} to him to receive a reward.
MsgComplete: What? What's this now? What does a mere mercenary want with me? Ah, you're here about the Genetick Succubi extermination job, eh? I suppose you're lookin' to cash in on that reward I promised.
MsgTake: Now all that remains to be done is to seek out the commander and collect the money. Just go and report the exterminatino of the succubi to him and collect that reward.
MsgWelcome: Did you track down that corps commander? What's happening with that reward?
MsgIncomplete: Did you track down that corps commander? What's happening with that reward?
MsgResponse4: I'm Fides, corps commander. What's up with that humble look? What do you want?

MsgSummary: You have to go back to {c2}Atlon Pietry{/c} with the reward you received from {c2}Fides{/c}, a corps commander.
MsgTake:
I'm sorry, but I don't think I gave you such a promise before. I never even made a public notice of the reward, actually.

To put it bluntly, I have no idea where you heard such a nonsensical story. You've got some gall, tracking me down out of the blue and wanting money for a job you completed by that I never actually hired you for...
{c5}(sneering){/c} I guess it's just my day for absurdities, eh?

{c5}(he surveys you from top to bottom) {/c}
Well, you certainly look exhausted enough; it would seem to be true you've actually exterminated those succubi, as you claim. Alright. I like your spirit, at least, so I'm gonna cut a deal with you.

{c5}(Fides gestures for someone to give you a bag heavy with coins){/c}

Taking out those succubi is a notable help to our army. In light of this, the office of the corps commander offers you this reward as a token of gratitude for services rendered. But just a word of advice for you - next time, make sure you have an agreement with your employer before you begin a job, haha!
MsgWelcome: I've paid you the reward. I'm kind of busy now, so if you need something else, it'll have to wait.
MsgIncomplete: I've paid you the reward. I'm kind of busy now, so if you need something else, it'll have to wait.
MsgResponse4: Hey, how are you making most of your money these days? I heard that there's recently been a lot of bounty jobs.

MsgSummary: You have to get rid of a {c1}Genetick NightMare{/c} and return to {c2}Dux{/c}, an officer. You have to get rid of {c1}at least 5{/c}, and return {c4}within 60 minutes{/c}.
MsgComplete: Aww man, what's this? Is this all you got? Dangit, I picked the wrong person for this job. Now I can't turn a profit on this. What a disaster. Just...go on; get outa here!
MsgResponse1: Alrighty; this'll do nicely. Good job, and thanks again!
MsgResponse2: Wowzers, you're really something else! I didn't expect you to take out so many, given the limited window of time. Haha, Fides can go suck it! Serves him right! Here's your reward.
MsgTake:
Okay, so there's this Fides bloke, right? Even though he's younger than me, he got the position of the corps commander thanks to his family's position. Guh...that guy's a real eyesore. But if we work together, we can rub his nose in it - whaddaya say?

A little while ago, a castellan of Arena Stronghold asked Fides for a favor - namely, to capture a couple Genetick NightMares, cut off their horns, and send them to him. {c5}(with a wicked smile){/c}
I'm planning to make Fides look like the buffoon he is by taking advantage of this opportunity, heh heh! But to do it, I need your help. All you have to do is kill all the NightMares in advance, before the soldiers can get to them.

Once slain, their corpses disappear very quickly. By the time the soldiers come, only a few NightMares with a horn will be there~ I'll just pretend like I'm working here... You can return to me when you've completed this request.
MsgWelcome: You've just gotta take 'em out before the soldiers find them.
MsgIncomplete: You've just gotta take 'em out before the soldiers find them.
MsgResponse4: You've just gotta take 'em out before the soldiers find them.

MsgSummary: You have to get rid of {c1}10 Whittard Town Ghosts{/c} and return to {c2}Teemid{/c}.
MsgComplete: Did you wipe 'em all out? Wahahaha~ Thank the goddess! I guess I don't have to be afraid anymore when I patrol this area~! Well, Nordein are a people who repay kindness. Really, thanks for your help!
MsgTake:
Ah! Someone's actually here! Woohoo! Hey...you're not afraid of ghosts or anything like that, are you? Awesome; just like I thought! There's no way a cool, awe-inspiring mercenary like you would be scared of a few spooks, right?

Ah, I forgot to introduce myself. I'm Teemid, a scouter dispatched here to keep an eye on the movement of the Blood Dagger Gang. There isn't a thing in this world I'm scared of!

{c5}(with a downcast voice all of a sudden){/c}

Well...there IS one thing, kinda. It's ghosts... I really hate ghosts, especially those ones full of worldly remorse. But a little while back, ghosts appeared in the ruins up there. According to what my granny said, they might be the ghosts of humans massacred in the war...but they're scaring the hell outta me! I can't even sleep. Please, you've gotta help me get rid of 'em!
MsgWelcome: What's happening with those g..gh...ghosts?
MsgIncomplete: What's happening with those g..gh...ghosts?
MsgResponse4: What's happening with those g..gh...ghosts?

MsgSummary: You have to dispose of {c1}10 WedgeRock Kobolt Low Class Warriors and 10 WedgeRock Kobolt High Class Warriors{/c} and return to {c2}Teemid{/c}.
MsgComplete: Great~! What you've done leaves me feeling refreshed, y'know. I guess those Kobolts can't just walk around wherever they please for the time being, eh? I'll give them a tough time when I have a chance. Thanks again!
MsgTake:
I'm from Prymates village. I used to work as a miner, actually. But...one day, those ShovelCavern bastards busted in out of nowhere and stole our mine! After that, I quit working at the mine completely. Then, I went to Arena Stronghold in order to find any job I could do, and I happened to find favor with a castellan and began working as a scouter. Heh...I suppose I talk too much, huh?

Anyway, when I came here, I discovered there were Kobolt monsters rampaging around! Though they're just Kobolts, they're even raising Tatoramo as well now...
I loathe Kobolts. I'm dying to really lay into them and wreak some good 'ol-fashioned havoc, but...I'm on duty now, so I can't go makin' a mess without reason. I've got enough here for a reward, so can you take them down? Kobolts don't deserve to live!
MsgWelcome: How many Kobolts have you finished off?
MsgIncomplete: How many Kobolts have you finished off?
MsgResponse4: How many Kobolts have you finished off?

MsgSummary: You have to dispose of {c1}10 Flamethrower Liches and 10 Flamethrower Goblins{/c} respectively and return to {c2}Soulin Cruz{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Looks like you pulled through alright. Did you have a difficult time of it?
I'm sorry to ask without giving you time for a breather, but I've got another favor to ask of you.
MsgTake:
After the Goddess was killed by the ancient people, the Phoenix, king of the fire spirits, was overcome by frustration withdrew to a solitary place on the continent.
At that time, many fire spirits under Phoenix's control followed him, but the spirits who didn't follow lost their king and remained scattered over various parts of the continent. Spirits unchained from the king's control turned into violent monsters and indiscriminately attacked people who came into their territory.

Before the king returns again, we have no choice but to calm them down by taking out the most troublesome of the lot. I attempted to seal them off, but it was too difficult, since they're too widely scattered across many different locations. Thus, I implore you: can you extinguish the flames of those fire spirits who lost their king? May the Goddess protect you.
MsgWelcome: The spirits of fire beginning to flare with rage. Perhaps it's because they lost their king.
MsgIncomplete: The spirits of fire beginning to flare with rage. Perhaps it's because they lost their king.
MsgResponse4: The spirits of fire beginning to flare with rage. Perhaps it's because they lost their king.

MsgSummary: You have to get rid of {c1}10 MetinNis Guard Summoners{/c} and return to {c2}Soulin Cruz{/c}.
MsgComplete: Thank the Goddess. I was worried about you, but it looks like you've returned safely. Thanks for dispelling the spirits. I suppose we'd better return to our research and investigation again. This is a reward for what you have done. Farewell!
MsgTake:
The King of the fire spirits is not the only one who went into deep seclusion after the death of the Goddess. The King of the water spirits, Naiad, did the same. Like the fire spirits, the water spirits who didn't follow Naiad are also out of control but strangely, they look comparatively more organized than the fire spirits.
After running a thorough investigation into the matter, we think it's most likely that the gigantic hydra near them is influencing the spirits somehow.

We don't have anything concrete on the hydra yet, and the water spirits are still out there, causing harm to ordinary folk. So for the time being, I think you should focus on dealing with those water spirits. I pray the wistom of Mystra saves you from danger.
MsgWelcome: Did you take care of the spirits of water?
MsgIncomplete: Did you take care of the spirits of water?
MsgResponse4: Did you take care of the spirits of water?

MsgSummary:
You have to find {c2}Rotza{/c}, a keeper of Kalimoss Cemetery and receive a {c3}Soul-Gathering Bottle{/c} so that {c2}Quion{/c} can obtain a new specimen.
You can check the location of Kalimoss Cemetery on the notice board at the entrance of the small route to the left of the entrance of Aridon.
MsgComplete:
You're asking about that bottle Quion let me keep?
Well, here it is. There's a letter included that'll tell you how to work it correctly.
Say, do you think you can help me with a favor too?
MsgTake:
Looks like we've run clean out of specimens. In order to continue our research, we need a new specimen. Problem is, I don't think I can go out too far because of my waist injury.

If you're not busy, I'd like you to help me. What do you say? The job is quite easy. All you have to do is bring about 10 souls I can use as specimens from Kalimoss Cemetery next to Aridon.

I let Rotza, a cemetery keeper, keep a Soul-Gathering Bottle I use. You'll have to borrow it and get the job done, then return to me.
MsgWelcome: Why haven't you left yet?
MsgIncomplete: Why haven't you left yet?
MsgResponse4: Pleased to meet you. I'm Rotza, a keeper of Kalimoss Cemetery.

MsgSummary: You have to defeat {c1}Ruin Ghosts{/c} and collect {c3}10 Soul Essences{/c}, then go back to {c2}Quion{/c} in Arteria Blood Lab.
MsgComplete:
You did very well, even considering this is your first time. These seem to be the highest quality souls I've gotten recently.
I hope you'll stop by and give me a hand with some more tasks from time to time. Thanks again.
MsgTake:
(Looking at the bottle, there is a paper with instructions attached to the surface.)
"You can collect a high-quality soul from Ruin Ghosts. You can obtain these souls in the form of essence, and they make good specimens."
(It seems what you have to do is defeat Ruin Ghosts and collect the souls Quion requested. You recall Quion asked you to collect about 10.)
MsgWelcome: A bottle for collecting souls - the bottle is empty.
MsgIncomplete: A bottle for collecting souls - the bottle is empty.
MsgResponse4: My job is to collect souls. Do you want to know how it's done?

MsgSummary: You have to destroy {c1}15 Rotton Ground Zombies{/c} and return to {c2}Rotza{/c}, a grave keeper.
MsgComplete:
Excellent. Thanks to you, we took care of them without much trouble.
Well, this job will just be an exercise in repetition unless we get to the bottom of this problem and solve it. Anyway, you did a fine job~
MsgTake:
Do you think you can lend me your aid?
Good, good; you're a friend indeed! This isn't all that difficult, so don't get your panties in a knot.

Something strange happened around the cemetery... I mean, stranger than the usual. Corpses rose up and began walking around. That's pretty strange, right?! And still, no one knows the reason why. As the person in charge of managing the cemetery, I feel as if those zombies are disturbing the rest of the others who have the good sense to sleep in silence. Plus, y'know...it kind of makes me feel a bit uneasy.

You're supposed to let dead people go back to where they belong, don't you think? I hope you can help me and take care of this job. What do you think? Are you feeling up to it?
MsgWelcome: How're things going with those zombies?
MsgIncomplete: How're things going with those zombies?
MsgResponse4: How're things going with those zombies?

MsgSummary: {c2}Tusan{/c} asked you to punish the wild boars that messed up the mushroom field. You have to get rid of {c1}15 Big Grinding Teeth Wild Boars{/c} and return to {c2}Tusan{/c}. You can find {c1}Big Grinding Teeth Wild Boars{/c} around the field in front of the village.
MsgComplete: Hmm...you've returned? Ah, I apologize; I got a bit excited about my field, because I wanted to punish wild boars. Thanks for your help. Lolo and I decided to cultivate the field again. Wish me luck!
MsgTake:
Those wild boars are real trouble! Why? They messed up the mushroom field in front of village that Lolo and I spent so long growing!

There are only a few of my mushrooms left because those wild boars gobbled 'em up without a second thought! We spent so long cultivating these mushrooms, but now it's more like a barren field! Lolo told me to calm down, but I can't stand this anymore! Those damn Wild boars, they're gonna have to pay for this!

I suppose can bust 'em up easily, right? Good! Go and beat those wild boars so hard that they'll feel it in the afterlife!
MsgWelcome: Tell me how those wild boars squealed when they got whooped!
MsgIncomplete: Tell me how those wild boars squealed when they got whooped!
MsgResponse4: Tell me how those wild boars squealed when they got whooped!

MsgSummary:
{c2}Latie{/c} asked you to bring what you obtain after disposing of the evil spirits of Escaton.
You have to get rid of {c1}Ancient God Believers and Ancient God Worshipers{/c} and collect {c3}20 Congealed Magic Stones{/c}, then return.
MsgComplete: This is...a piece of stone? Ah, there seems to be something written on the surface. Let's see...at first glace, it seems like an ancient letter... However, I'd better do a bit more research to gather some more concrete details. Thanks for the good specimen.
MsgTake:
The power of the evil spirits that haunt Escaton Ruin is very strong. It's not easy to approach them.
A little while ago, I was attacked all of a sudden, so I'm hiding here now and taking a rest for a moment.

You must be the one who got an order from a lord to take care of the evil spirits, right? Then I guess I'll be able to ask you a favor. Don't worry; it's not that difficult. If you obtain anything when you beat up the ancient god believers and worshipers, I'd like you to bring them to me. I suppose they'll be useful in my research.
MsgWelcome: What have you obtained?
MsgIncomplete: What have you obtained?
MsgResponse4: What have you obtained?

MsgSummary: {c2}Rato{/c} in Gliter asked you to go to the Frovation Village and help {c2}Talpa{/c}.
MsgComplete:
I'm a bit busy right now, so tell me later. Wait...what now? Rato sent you here?
Oy oy... I haven't had time to meet up with him recently; now I'm feeling guilty for skipping out.
MsgTake:
These days a friend of mine seems to be really busy. I sent a letter saying I wanted to meet with him and have a tankard or two together, but he replied he can't leave the farm at all because he's got tons of work to do.

I feel kinda sorry for him because he always seems to be busy. That's why I'm asking for your help. Can you go to the Frovaton Village and help my friend Talpa? If someone gives him a hand, Talpa should at least be able to come and knock back a few with me, I guess. I just want to meet up with my friend and have a nice, long chat like we haven't had in a long time. Please, help me out.
MsgWelcome: You ought to set out for Frovaton Village~
MsgIncomplete: You ought to set out for Frovaton Village~
MsgResponse4: I like my fish like I like my leather: fresh. Otherwise, you can't really sell either for a decent price.

MsgSummary: {c2}Talpa{/c} asked you to get rid of animals that have been overrunning his property. You have to take care of {c1}10 Round Horn Bison and 10 Crazyeye Gray Bears{/c} and return to {c2}Talpa{/c}.
MsgComplete: You've really got some skill. You finished this earlier than I expected. Thanks to you, I have time to meet with Rato. Finally, after what seems like such a long time, I'll be able to have a good time with my a good friend. I really appreciate what you've done for me. Now, I gotta prepare to head into Gliter~
MsgTake:
The farm is short-handed, as always. Sometimes hunters who set up camp in the area come and help us, but they have their own jobs to tend to.

We occasionally ask outsiders to help us, but...you know...we feel bad about it. This is our job and our responsibility.
Though...you're the one Rato sent, so considering his sincerity, may I ask you a favor?

These days, there's been a lot of Round Horn Bison and Crazyeye Gray Bears around my property. I don't know the reason why, but...at this rate, this area will be completely covered with these guys. We have to reduce their number. Can you help us? I'll give you a good reward, so don't hesitate.
MsgWelcome: Have you finished what I asked of you?
MsgIncomplete: Have you finished what I asked of you?
MsgResponse4: Have you finished what I asked of you?

MsgSummary: {c2}Kir Iero{/c} asked you to clear out the Arachnes near the village. You have to defeat {c1}10 Arachne Patrollers{/c} and return to {c2}Kir Iero{/c}.
MsgComplete: Oh, good job~ These mere arachnes must have been a piece of cake to you, right? Haha...be sure to drop by later and lend a hand if you're feelin' up to it.
MsgTake:
Lately, there's been a rumor goin' around that spies for the Alliance of Light have sneaked into Reikeuseu district. Well, you don't seem to be one of them, though...
If you're not busy, why don't you help our guards and work for the public security?

Arachnes have expanded their habitat disturbingly close to the village. Their fertility is simply incredible - we're in trouble because they continue to increase in number no matter how many we take down. I hope you give us a hand in cutting down the number of these Arachnes. Show me what'cha got~
MsgWelcome: How's it going bustin' up those Arachnes?
MsgIncomplete: How's it going bustin' up those Arachnes?
MsgResponse4: How's it going bustin' up those Arachnes?

MsgSummary:
While you were beating up Arachnes, you came across a {c3}Small Skull{/c}.
You'd better let one of the guards of Gliter see this and see what they have to say.
MsgComplete: Oh, this...where did you find this? While were you killing Arachnes, you say? So...that's what happened. Arachnes were the culprits..
MsgTake:
{c5}(You discovered a small skull hanging on the top of the scythe of one of the collapsed Arachnes.
Judging by its size, it seems to be the skull of a child. It might be a good idea to let one of guards in Gliter know about this.){/c}
MsgWelcome: You can't tell anything more simply by looking at it.
MsgIncomplete: You can't tell anything more simply by looking at it.
MsgResponse4: Hey...do you have some money? I'll give it back to you no matter what, as long as I earn a ton of money.

MsgSummary: {c2}Ganon Erat{/c} asked you to get rid of Arachnes who hurted children. You have to kill {c1}10 Arachne Assassins{/c} and return to {c2}Ganon Erat{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Hey, glad to see you were successful! I guess those Arachnes will have to watch their back from now on. I'd better let people know and tell them be careful.
{c5}(looking at the skull in your hand){/c} I hope I don't have to see this kind of thing anymore.
MsgTake:
A while back, I started receiving a lot of reports of children playing near the village going missing. I was investigating who the criminal could be. Looking at this, I think it's pretty clear that Arachnes were the culprits.

Spiders eating children...I never imagined that Arachnes would do something so outrageous! We'd better re-open that investigation about the missing children straightaway. While we're investigating, please go slay more of those spiders. We've gotta make sure no one will fall victim to them anymore, don't you think? I'm counting on you.
MsgWelcome: Everything's under control now. How's your work coming along?
MsgIncomplete: Everything's under control now. How's your work coming along?
MsgResponse4: Everything's under control now. How's your work coming along?

MsgSummary: {c2}Slot{/c} asked you to bring a hammer he needs to mend a fence. You have to collect {c3}5 Hard Hammers{/c} and return to {c2}Slot{/c}.
MsgComplete: Oh, sweetness! I can work with this without any problem for sure! And if one breaks, I've got like...four more! Thanks. And of course, if you happen to want some choice cuts of meat, just come to me! I'll pick a good one for you.
MsgTake:
Zaite asked me a favor - he wanted me to fix his broken cattle fence. The problem is, I haven't done this kind of work for quite some time - now I'm a butcher and my experience is mostly in slicing meat. The tools I used in the past have become too old, so I can't start the job right now. Gliter is too far away from here to go and buy new ones, too...

If you're planning to go out to hunt, can you do something for me? I'd like you to collect about 5 Hard Hammers. I heard you can get 'em pretty easily during hunting.
If you come back and give them to me, I'll pay you for them, certainly.
MsgWelcome: Oh, you're back early? Then, did you find those hammers I need?
MsgIncomplete: Oh, you're back early? Then, did you find those hammers I need?
MsgResponse4: Oh, you're back early? Then, did you find those hammers I need?

MsgSummary: {c2}Lalph{/c} asked you to sweep away frogs, the principal offender tainting the environment near the lab. You have to get rid of {c1}10 Crow Swamp Frogs and 10 Crow Swamp Big Poison Frogs{/c} and go back to {c2}Lalph{/c}.
MsgComplete: Well well! Just like I thought, you're a first-rate frog-buster! I'm always good at judging peoples' character - you've gotta be, if you run a business like me. Well, it can't have been easy for you to beat up so many frogs, haha! Thanks for doing this for me. I hope you have a pleasant journey, wherever you're headed.
MsgTake:
It seems that the frog population around the lab is doing a little TOO well - they're everywhere now! To make matters worse, these frogs leak their poison everywhere, so the surrounding environment is quickly becoming contaminated. We installed a purification device at the lab, of course, but it's not that effective because there's just too many frogs to effectively filter their noxious fumes out.

If this situation continues unabated, I'm afraid customers coming to buy things from this lab will decrease as well. If you're not busy by any chance, could you wipe out some of the frog population? I'll give you a reward, of course - don't worry about that. Good luck, then!
MsgWelcome: You really know how to make those frogs "croak", hahaha!
MsgIncomplete: You really know how to make those frogs "croak", hahaha!
MsgResponse4: You really know how to make those frogs "croak", hahaha!

MsgSummary: {c2}Lalph{/c} told you he has to do something for {c2}Lolo{/c}, an herb collector. You have to gather {c3}20 Cactus Flowers{/c} and give them to {c2}Lolo{/c} in Herba Farm.
MsgComplete:
Ah, I've been waiting. You're the one who's doing a favor for Uncle Lalph, right? Wow... It mustn't have been easy to get your hands on all these.

Thank you very much~ I'll be able to make the headman's medicine with this, no problems. He's been really sick these days, so it comes as a real help to get these herbs from you.
MsgTake:
Ah, looks like we meet again. I hope you don't think any less of me for it, but I'd like to ask something of you again.
Lolo asked me to find a certain herb, but the task is too demanding for me to deal with.

Lolo is an herb collector living on Herba Farm. We often doing a business together. This time, she asked me to get about 20 Cactus Flowers. She said if I defeated Mutated Arachnes near the lab, I'd be able to get my hands on some. Given the skill that you displayed last time, I suspect you can deal with Arachnes pretty easily too...

Could you get these Cactus Flowers and give them to Lolo? I'll send word ahead to expect you. Thanks!
MsgWelcome: Ah, just collect those Cactus Flowers and give them to Lolo.
MsgIncomplete: Ah, just collect those Cactus Flowers and give them to Lolo.

MsgSummary:
{c2}Basoth{/c} thinks Mutated Arachnes are controlled by witches in the Ruins.
You have to get rid of {c1}10 Mutated Arachne Berserkers and 10 Mutated Arachne Combaters{/c} and return to {c2}Basoth{/c}.
MsgComplete: Witches controlling Arachnes...that's just my conjecture, but I think there's merit in it. Even if it is not true, those spiders walking freely around the ruin are very dangerous to other scholars as well. I'm sure taking care of them was a good choice. Good job.
MsgTake:
Damn, I never expected Arachnes might attack me all of a sudden! I should have been more mindful of my surroundings. My protections mostly ward against evil spirits wandering around the ruin. I'd better get some treatment and take a rest before continuing with my investigation.

Hey...judging by your equipment, are you by any chance a mercenary?
Then, can I hire you for a while? I'm currently conducting an investigation the Escaton Ruin. However, the Mutated Arachnes' sudden attack forced me to escape here.
I can't help but suspect that they're controlled by vicious witches inhabiting the ruin. We'd better take care of those Arachnes before they hurt other scholars or wreck some irreparable part of the ruin.

Please, take out those Mutated Arachnes. Don't worry about a reward - you'll have it.
MsgWelcome: How have you done with those Arachnes so far?
MsgIncomplete: How have you done with those Arachnes so far?
MsgResponse4: How have you done with those Arachnes so far?

MsgSummary: {c2}Hannen{/c} told you to thin out the number of animals, which has been increasing at an unusually fast pace recently. You have to get rid of {c1}15 Crow Swamp Bison{/c} and return to {c2}Hannen{/c}.
MsgComplete: Thank the Goddess. For a while there, I was worried you might get exhausted and give up the job! Hoho, good work! I hope you'll find this reward satisfactory. Thanks again!
MsgTake:
Around this area, the number of animals has really been increasing rapidly. Is it breeding? Are they coming in from other areas? I'm not sure yet, honestly. Right now, we're investigating the cause, but we still can't find the answer. Even with that, we can't just sit and do nothing, don't you think? We should do what it's in our power to do.

Bison and Gray Bears near the lab are two of the animals we have too many of around here. In fact, their number has more than doubled compared to last year.
As they increase in number, the surrounding environment of the lab has been ruined more and more. This is only a short term solution, but we need to reduce their numbers first.

Guards at the lab have taken care of Gray Bear, so can you handle the Bison? Lalph's told me quite a bit about your skill. I think you can deal with them easily by yourself. Good luck, and let me know when you're all finished up.
MsgWelcome: It's not too hard, is it? How many have you put down?
MsgIncomplete: It's not too hard, is it? How many have you put down?
MsgResponse4: It's not too hard, is it? How many have you put down?

MsgSummary: You have to collect {c3}10 Spirit Essences{/c} and return to {c2}Pauke{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Oh, good job. Thanks...now, where am I going to use this?
Ah, I guess this might be helpful in research to cure blood-borne diseases. I hope my results improve with this...
MsgTake:
As soon as I asked a lord of Gliter where I might find a skillful mercenary, he recommended you. I feel like you must be trustworthy if even someone as critical as him was pleased with your performance and skill.

What I need is a material called Spirit Essence. It's very difficult to find, so I was told it's sold at a premium price, even among collectors. The amount actually being sold at any given time is also very limited, so even if you have the money, there may not be much for sale anyway. The only remaining solution is to find it directly, which is why I've decided to call upon a person like you.

The word is, when you hunt strong monsters, it will appear from their bodies when they die - though it can't be a common occurrence. I'd like you to collect about 10 of these Spirit Essences and bring them to me.
MsgWelcome: How many Spirit Essences have you found?
MsgIncomplete: How many Spirit Essences have you found?
MsgResponse4: How many Spirit Essences have you found?

MsgSummary: {c2}Illa Gordie{/c} told you she wants to cook a food for {c2}Hamus{/c}, a leader of Yemitis Temple. You have to collect {c3}5 Roasted Red Crayfish{/c} and give them to {c2}Kaff{/c}, a cook in Gliter.
MsgComplete:
Oh, Illa is always so goodhearted. Well then, I'll exhibit the best of my skill if this is to be a meal fit for Hamus! Now, just wait there a bit~

{c5}(Kaff seems to start cooking the Crayfish. After a while, Kaff puts forth a completely cooked dish. It smells rich and delicious.){/c}
MsgTake:
A few days ago, Grandpa Hamus got sick... He seems to be suffering from fatigue. He keeps saying 'Oh, it's so cold in here' and coughs a lot. Everybody tells him to take a full rest, but he stubbornly clings to his work. I'm really worried about him.

That's why I'm trying to make some delicious food for Grandpa Hamus. He always seems to be saying how he wants to eat some Roasted Red Crayfish.] If you find some and give them to Kaff in Gliter, he'll make a top-quality meal out of it!

I can't leave myself, since I've just recently started up a new business, so I'd like you to go in my place. Do you think you can do it?
MsgWelcome: Did you find any crayfish? Just give the ones you find to Uncle Kaff.
MsgIncomplete: Did you find any crayfish? Just give the ones you find to Uncle Kaff.
MsgResponse4: I'll teach you a recipe you can cook to earn good money. But if I do, you've gotta pay me a little tuition - that's how it goes!

MsgSummary: You have to receive {c3}Roasted Red Crayfish{/c} from {c2}Kaff{/c}, a cook and return to {c2}Illa Gordie{/c} in Yemitis Temple.
MsgComplete: Ah, Uncle Kaff's food always looks so delicious~ I'll bet Grandpa Hamus will really eat it up! I'd better give this to him quickly while it's still hot! Thanks again~
MsgTake: Well, here it is. I hope Sir Hamus eats it all up and regains his strength. If it cools too much, the flavor might lose a bit of its appeal, so make sure you deliver it on time. Give my regards to Illa too.
MsgWelcome: I already gave you the food, so hurry up and deliver it before it cools down~
MsgIncomplete: I already gave you the food, so hurry up and deliver it before it cools down~
MsgResponse4: Oh, you're one of our long-time customers? Well, whether or not you are, feel free to pick up anything you need!

MsgSummary: {c2}Ophen{/c}, a low-class priest, told you to find {c2}Hamus{/c}, a leader of the Temple.
MsgComplete: Welcome, traveler. You're the one Ophen's been talking about, right? I've heard your skill is truly top-notch. I'm hoping you'll put those skills to work for this job.
MsgTake:
I remember, you did a good job taking care of those vipers before. I sought you out again to perform a favor for Hamus, a leader of the Temple.
I was talking to him and brought you up, and after more discussion, he said he was interested in meeting you. I'm not sure exactly why he's looking for you...maybe he needs to exterminate some vipers? That's what I was talking to him about when he said he wanted to meet you.

It's strange, though - I already took care of it, so it shouldn't be any concern of his anymore. Well, Hamus must certainly have something in mind. Go and meet with him, if you would.
MsgWelcome: Isn't Sir Hamus still looking for you?
MsgIncomplete: Isn't Sir Hamus still looking for you?
MsgResponse4:
We, the Vail, are a noble people chosen by the Goddess.
May the Holy Mother Narsilriel guide your path.

MsgSummary: {c2}Hamus{/c}, a leader of the Temple, asked you to get rid of Vipers in Crow Swamp and collect their hearts. You have to hunt {c1}Viper Spellbinders and Viper Darkness Mages{/c} and collect {c3}20 Viper Hearts{/c}, then return to {c2}Hamus{/c}.
MsgComplete: Good, good; you've collected all the hearts I requested and have returned safely. I was worried about you, but I'm relieved to see that no serious harm has befallen you. By now, you must have a clue about the ritual, right?
MsgTake:
I need your power to hunt the Vipers living in a swampy area. Originally, I let Ophen handle this, but he neglected this task in favor of others. Simply killing a few every now and then does not suffice. because of Ophen's negligence and clumsy handling of the matter, the Vipers have extended their territory from Dusk Swamp to Crow Swamp. I've heard they're now even offering up human sacrifices in their dark rituals...

Please go and take out the Vipers in Crow Swamp and collect their hearts. We need to put them on the altar of Narsilriel. Vipers never go down easy, so be careful. Also, if you can, please look into the particulars surrounding their ritual. I pray the Holy Mother Narsilriel protects you.
MsgWelcome: So, how are you coming along with the Viper extermination?
MsgIncomplete: So, how are you coming along with the Viper extermination?
MsgResponse4: So, how are you coming along with the Viper extermination?

MsgSummary:
You discovered a collapsed altar and a pile of skulls next to it in the habitat of the Vipers.
You have to return to {c2}Hamus{/c}, a leader of the Temple, and tell him what you discovered.
MsgComplete:
Ah...it's as I'd suspected. Alas, I wish that I was wrong, rather than be right!
I'd best notify the priests to prepare for an exorcism ritual.

Then, I must find a way to stop the Vipers from performing their ritual in the near future. Thanks for your help in these undertakings.
MsgWelcome: You feel as if the deceased are screaming silently for vengeance.
MsgIncomplete: You feel as if the deceased are screaming silently for vengeance.
MsgResponse4:
We, the Vail, are a noble people chosen by the Goddess.
May the Holy Mother Narsilriel guide your path.

MsgSummary:
{c2}Hamus{/c} asked you to get rid of vicious witches manipulating the Vipers.
You have to defeat {c1}10 Ancient God Evalgelists and 10 Ancient God Praisers{/c} and return to {c2}Hamus{/c}.
MsgComplete: Ah, praise Narsilriel; you've returned safely. Your truly have outstanding skill. I ought to give you jobs more often! Take care, then, until we meet again!
MsgTake:
I have discovered a very important fact about Vipers and their ritual. It turned out they are being controlled by witches serving an Ancient God!

Have you ever heard of the Argilla Ruin? In the past, several researchers tried to unlock the potential power of the ancient people, but none were successful. After that, they decided to keep that power in check by means of a control device. However, these witches, fanatics of their Ancient God, broke a part of the control device and manipulated these creatures by taking advantage of that leak of power.

Please go to those ruins and take out as many of those fanatics as you can. In the meantime, I'll hasten to the authorities and make a report regarding the damage to the control device.
MsgWelcome: How goes the mission? Please, be careful.
MsgIncomplete: How goes the mission? Please, be careful.
MsgResponse4: How goes the mission? Please, be careful.

MsgSummary: {c2}Stewart{/c} asked you to capture {c1}Dwarf Bandits{/c} and collect {c3}15 Roasted Wild Boars{/c}, stolen right out of the village pantry.
MsgComplete: Wow, thank the Goddess! You really came through for me, stranger. Thanks to you, I'll be able to whip up a delicious meal right on schedule. Please, take this in thanks for your work. And hey, if you have some time tonight, feel free to drop by the birthday party, haha~
MsgTake:
Ah cripes, I'm in a load of trouble! The main dish I was preparing as a treat for the villagers tonight up and disappeared! I was boasting, saying I'd give them the best roasted wild boar they'd ever eaten, too!
(moaning)...

Can you give me a hand? If it was any other occasion, I'd simply cook something different, but today is the birthday of Granny Amanda, the village headmistress, so I'd like to prepare something special for the party. I should be starting my preparations right now, otherwise...oh god...

I'm sure those rotten Dwarves did this! They've taken up a position on the hill near this village. Please go and take care of them and save my meat!
MsgWelcome: Have you recovered the meat? Each minute that ticks by is a minute they could be over the cooking fire!
MsgIncomplete: Have you recovered the meat? Each minute that ticks by is a minute they could be over the cooking fire!
MsgResponse4: Have you recovered the meat? Each minute that ticks by is a minute they could be over the cooking fire!

MsgSummary:
{c2}Letus Nilson{/c}, a guard, asked you to help with the Brown Bear Buster Campaign.
You have to get rid of {c1}15 Forest Ranger Brown Bears{/c} and return to {c2}Letus Nilson{/c}.
If you exit the north gateway of Keolloseu and head northward, you can find {c1}Forest Ranger Brown Bears{/c} on the left side of the route.
MsgComplete:
It appears you've really busted all those Brown Bears!
My coworkers were already surpised because the area I'm in charge of has been taken care of quicker than they thought. Hahaha~ Of course, I appreciate what you've done. Here's a little somethin' for you. Here's hoping your journey continues to be a pleasant one!
MsgTake:
These days Keolloseu guards are driving a campaign to reduce the number of violent animals the safety and convenience of travelers.
The [Brown Bear Buster Campaign] is one of them. However, I'm a bit concerned that I won't be able to fulfill the quota I took by the deadline.

{c5}(lowering voice){/c} As you can see, I'm even escorting a lord.

My quota is the same as the others have, but I think it's unfair. I'm kinda scared of the leader, so I can't really speak out against his assignment rashly...

That's why I've come to ask you, can you help me out? All you've gotta do is take care of about 15 bears. That's all. Of course, I'll give you a reward too; no worries.
MsgWelcome: I'm whittling the number down little by little. How many have you taken care of so far?
MsgIncomplete: I'm whittling the number down little by little. How many have you taken care of so far?
MsgResponse4: I'm whittling the number down little by little. How many have you taken care of so far?

MsgSummary: A guard, {c2}Josh Blank{/c}, asked you to find another guard, {c2}Paul Jake{/c}, and check to see how he's doing with his assigned duty. You have to find the guard, {c2}Paul Jake{/c}, and ask him.
MsgComplete: {c5}(with an unpleasant look){/c} What? Josh sent you here? Damn...what a nuisance...
MsgTake:
"Those who don't work, don't eat." You've heard this nugget of old wisdom before, right? I'm sorry to drop something like that in your lap as soon as I see you, but to be honest, I'm a little steamed right now.

For a while now, we guards have been reducing the number of violent animals for the sake of traveler safety. This time, Paul caused trouble again. Whether you like it or not, you should complete the tasks you've taken on, but he doesn't have any sense of responsibility like that at all. Makes me wonder how a wastrel like him who shirks work plans to earn his daily bread.

I have a commander breathing down my neck because Paul's report STILL hasn't come in. He's really got me bent out of shape.

Dammit, I don't even wanna see his face...otherwise I might feel liks slugging him. I'm sorry to have to ask this of you, but can you go there instead and find out what on earth is going on?
MsgWelcome: Have you found Paul? What's going on with him?
MsgIncomplete: Have you found Paul? What's going on with him?
MsgResponse4: Geez...I'm totally dying to go fishing. Do you like fishing?

MsgSummary:
A guard, {c2}Paul Jake{/c}, asked you to take care of {c1}10 Strong Jaw Group Wolves and 10 Group Wolf Teeth{/c}.
You have to capture wolves and return to {c2}Paul Jake{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Hey...why are you back so quickly? Are you sure you took care of all of them?
I know, I know...you managed to take down a few, but the experience left you fully petrified, right? Ah, you have my deep sympathies. That's why you come back, right? Wait...no? Dangit...
MsgTake:
"For the sake of the travelers?" Bah...it's all nonsense. Why should I waste my precious time for the sake of people I don't even know?

(while talking, Paul looks you up and down) Now that I get a good look at you, you're probably pretty good at stuff like that, right? A real pro in the field of beating the tar outta monsters. Well, that's great! So great, in fact, that if you go there in my place and take care of those wolves, I'll give you a nice reward. That's not so bad, is it? I doubt Group Wolves will give you much trouble.

A little while back, I had a banner night at the gambling house, heh heh. If you take care of this job for me, you won't need to count money among your concerns!
MsgWelcome: Have you dealt with all the wolves?
MsgIncomplete: Have you dealt with all the wolves?
MsgResponse4: Have you dealt with all the wolves?

MsgSummary: A guard, {c2}Paul Jake{/c}, said he lost the money he was supposed to give to you and that you ought to visit {c2}Josh Blank{/c} and receive it from him. You should go to {c2}Josh Blank{/c} and receive your reward.
MsgTake:
Aye...heh heh...actually, I placed a couple bad bets and lost the money I was supposed to give you to the house. Crazy world, eh? But what can ya do? Gambling is originally intended to make people lose money...so, the long and short of it is, I don't have any money to pay you with.

Damn, you know whose fault this REALLY is? Josh's fault! He shouldn't have pushed me so hard. Why does he keep bothering me even by sending someone to check up on me? I'm not a little kid, y'know. But hey, that's his business. If you really want to receive your pay, go see Josh. He's the one who caused this problem, not me.

I'm gonna catch up on some fishing now.
MsgWelcome: Well...I got nothin' to talk about. But I'm sure Josh has a mouthful, as usual.
MsgIncomplete: Well...I got nothin' to talk about. But I'm sure Josh has a mouthful, as usual.
MsgResponse4: Becoming a guard isn't so easy! Don't underestimate me!

MsgSummary:
{c2}Mano{/c} asked you to find out the reason why the ore he ordered hasn't arrived yet.
If you happen to be coming, there's a chance you might meet {c2}Taz{/c} on your way.
MsgComplete: Hmm...it looks like Mano's been looking for me. The delivery was delayed, so he must be worried. I guess I'd better explain why I'm here first, though.
MsgTake:
Excuse me, but do you think you could do a favor for me?

A few days ago, I ordered a shipment of ore from Antaraks Farm as usual, but I've heard nothing from them since; not even an order confirmation. By now, it should have arrived here already. I'd like you to go to Antaraks Farm and find out what's going on.

To top it off, these days, the vicinity of the road leading to the village is has become more dangerous, fraught with violent animals. I'm worried about Taz. I hope nothing has happened to him. Ah; Taz is my usual deliveryman. He's the man you need to look for. I'm looking forward to receiving the good news.
MsgWelcome: Have you found Taz? What's the status of my order?
MsgIncomplete: Have you found Taz? What's the status of my order?
MsgResponse4: Living life is a great blessing in itself, you know, no matter how tough the times may be.

MsgSummary: {c2}Taz{/c} told you he lost the ore he was delivering in an attack by a group of wolves. You need to defeat {c1}Strong Jaw Group Wolves{/c} and collect {c3}15 Copper Ores{/c} and take them to {c2}Mano{/c}. You can find {c1}Strong Jaw Group Wolves{/c} southeast of Botane Farm.
MsgComplete:
...That accident occured.
I hope Taz get well sooner than later... As my job is roughly over, I got to stop by the farm.
You're so kind. You even have delivered this by yourself~Thanks~!
MsgTake:
Have you ever heard of wolves making a surprise attack on travelers? It's not such an infrequent happening these days - I was also injured by them. Group Wolves, notorious in these parts for their fierceness, jumped on me, their amber eyes full-wide... {c5}(waving his hand){/c} Ah, can you imagine my horror? One of those monsters bit into my leg all of a sudden! I feared for my life, and in that instant I left everything and ran as fast as I could, barely making my escape.

I'm recovering slowly through Flora's cure, but I can't make a long trip yet. I don't think I can meet with Mano yet, to say nothing of gathering up the ore I lost in the wolf attack.

I'm sorry to make a request of you when you just stopped in to find me, but do you think you could gather that ore back from the wolves and make the delivery to Mano yourself? If you do, please tell him all I've told you, so he'll know that at least I'm alive and recovering.
MsgWelcome: How many pieces of ore have you found?
MsgIncomplete: How many pieces of ore have you found?
MsgResponse4: Strong armor is an absolute essential for fighting. Though, I'm sure you know that all too well.

MsgSummary: After defeating a {c1}Field Keeper Brown Bear{/c}, you unexpectedly found {c3}Rotten Wood{/c}. You should go to an Elven Hunters Camp and let {c2}Earl Blendy{/c} know about this.
MsgComplete:
Was this on the neck of the brown bear?
{c5}(seems to be controlling his temper){/c} All right, I already had something to say about this to the humans.
MsgTake: {c5}(You found something on the neck of brown bear. Once you pulled it free, it turned out to be Rotten Wood. You don't know why it was hanging on the neck of Brown Bear, but Elven Hunters know more about animals than anyone else. For a better idea of what's going on, you set out for a Hunter Camp to find Earl Blendy, an Elven Hunter. It is likely she knows what significance the rotten wood has, if any.){/c}
MsgWelcome: This wood is rotten.
MsgIncomplete: This wood is rotten.
MsgResponse4: I pity the animals. They're being warped into strange creatures more often these days...

MsgSummary:
{c2}Earl Blendy{/c} asked you to go to Arbor Farm, a Human Logging settlement, and meet the person in charge of harvesting lumber to convey her message to them.
You have to find the person in charge of Arbor Farm's logging operation.
MsgComplete:
Are you looking for a person in charge of logging? Hmm...it looks like Timber's busy at the moment.
Just tell me instead, and I'll deliver the message to him when he's free. What's the message?
MsgTake:
In 1505, when they entered into Ereumana for the first time, Humans reached an agreement with the Elves in order to establish settlements there, promising that they would cut down trees on a very limited basis, in order to honor nature, as we do. Logging is an industry at odds with the fundamental principles of Elves, but Elves agreed to the concession in order to have a mutually-beneficial coexistence with Humans.

But these days, pieces of wood like the one you're holding have been discovered in other places...and much too frequently for my tastes.
What it shows is that humans are logging wherever they please, even outside of the boundary they agreed upon with us. As an Elf, and as a Hunter, I can no longer overlook their blatant disregard of their promise.

I'd like you to go to the Humans' logging settlement and deliver this messages to whoever's the head of logging there. "Elves never forgive people who treat promises lightly." Of course, they'll know what I mean.{c5} (Earl turns around coldly){/c}
MsgWelcome: Haven't you set out for the logging settlement yet?
MsgIncomplete: Haven't you set out for the logging settlement yet?
MsgResponse4: Have you always wanted to be...a LUMBERJACK? If you've an earnest will and a sharp axe, you're already prepared!

MsgSummary:
{c2}Paulo{/c} asked you to get rid of Stonepick Goblins who are occupying the logging area.
You have to defeat {c1}15 Stonepick Goblin Shamans and 15 Stonepick Goblin Swordfighters{/c} and return to {c2}Paulo{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Wow, you've really managed it! I owe you one. I'll talk to Timber and work out this problem with the Elven Hunters.
I pray Etain's blessing be ever with you.
MsgTake:
Oops...it looks like we've stepped on the toes of the Elves unintentionally. But we've got some unavoidable circumstances on our end. We didn't break the agreement with the Elves on purpose.

The location our town was assigned for our logging needs was a small forest near the Rimus Valley. A while back, though, Goblins came in groups and occupied our logging spot. Ever since that time, we haven't had much of a choice but to do our logging in other places in order to meet demand. The local lord hasn't taken any measures to help us re-claim our land no matter how much we plead the situation.

The villagers are doing their best to help us re-capture our logging area as soon as possible. If it's not too much trouble, could you lend us a hand?
Just go in there and hack down some Goblins. If you do that, it'll be a big help to us.
MsgWelcome: Goblins are a lot stronger than they look. Be on your guard!
MsgIncomplete: Goblins are a lot stronger than they look. Be on your guard!
MsgResponse4: Goblins are a lot stronger than they look. Be on your guard!
