MsgSummary: {c2}The chief of Keolloseu's guards{/c} told you he lost contact with a Scouter he sent to Cornwell's Ruin. You have to go near the Ruin and find a scouter.
MsgTake:
I'm getting really worried. You see, I sent a Scouter near the Cornwell's Ruin. I haven't got any messages for two weeks - only the initial report ever arrived. He can sometimes be a bit slack in his duties, so I thought it nothing of consequence. As more and more time went by, I began to feel a sense of foreboding, though.

If you don't mind, I'd like you to track down the whereabouts of my man. I hope nothing happened to him.
MsgWelcome: Have you found my scouter? What was his power reading?
MsgIncomplete: Have you found my scouter? What was his power reading?
MsgResponse4: This human has already passed on. The corpse seems to emit a nasty smell.

MsgSummary:
You discovered a {c3}Discolored Leather Bag{/c} on the {c2}Scouter's corpse{/c}.
You'd better return to the {c2}Chief of Keolloseu guards{/c} and let him know what happened to the Scouter he sent out.
MsgComplete: I wish my worries had just been the ungrounded fear I first took them for. I'd best send someone to take care of his corpse now. Can I ask one more favor of you?
MsgTake: {c5}(You've discovered a Leather Bag, though it is strangely discolored. You untie the knot, clotted with blood, and open it. You can also see a Banana, which is also discolored. You'd better give this Leather Bag to the Chief of the Keolloseu guards and let him know about the death of the Scouter.){/c}
MsgResponse4: Good to see you, traveler. I'm the chief of the Keolloseu guards.

MsgSummary: {c2}A chief of Keolloseu guards{/c} told you to find an alchemist, {c2}Curni{/c}, and let her see a {c3}Discolored_Leather_Bag{/c}. You have to find {c2}Curni{/c} and ask her to inspect it.
MsgTake:
{c5}(opening and closing the Leather Bag){/c}
I'd like you to go to Curni, an alchemist, and ask her to inspect the Banana in this bag. This is the only clue we have about his death. Well...to be honest, Curni makes lots of mistakes, but she sometimes makes surprising accomplishments. I hope she'll be able to give us the information we need. I'll be waiting!
MsgWelcome: Haven't you paid Curni a visit yet?
MsgIncomplete: Haven't you paid Curni a visit yet?
MsgResponse4: Oh dear...I failed to create it again. I just don't know what went wrong this time!

MsgSummary:
{c2}Curni{/c} told you to tell what she told you to the {c2}Chief of Keolloseu guards{/c}.
You have to find the {c2}Chief of Keolloseu guards{/c}.
MsgComplete: So...was it zombie poison? It's even from Cornwell's Ruin... That place gives me the heebie-jeebies.
MsgTake:
Hmmm...so, there could really be Poison Mist Zombies out there...
I was told they are a mass of rotten spirits generated from the corpses of the Dianoia family sealed off in the ruin. This is not an established theory, but...it's the strongest theory we have to go on.

I'll keep this rotten Banana as a specimen for a while, since I also think it's necessary to research this poison. Please go back to the Chief of guards and tell him that I'll send word if I uncover any new information.
MsgWelcome: Have you told what I said to the Chief of guards?
MsgIncomplete: Have you told what I said to the Chief of guards?
MsgResponse4: Good to see you, traveler. I'm the chief of the Keolloseu guards.

MsgSummary: You have to get rid of {c1}15 Poison Mist Zombies{/c} and return to the {c2}Chief of Keolloseu guards{/c}.
MsgComplete: Thanks a bunch. I hope it wasn't too hard on you. You're quite skillful, you know. I look forward to seeing you from time to time. Anyway, here's the reward I promised you.
MsgTake: I don't know what kind of place Cornwell's Ruin is. All l know is that it's somehow related to the dark past of Elves. I'm not really interested in Elven History, but I can't stand to lose good men because of something like this. As if battles weren't depleting enough, this just adds to the loss of war potential of our allied forces. Please, go and wipe out as many of those zombies as you can; there's a reward waiting here for you if you clean out some of their vile horde.
MsgWelcome: How many zombies have you put to rest?
MsgIncomplete: How many zombies have you put to rest?
MsgResponse4: How many zombies have you put to rest?

MsgSummary: {c2}Istarr{/c} asked you to deliver his message to {c2}Renne{/c} in Unicorn Fons.
MsgComplete: What? He can't do it because orders are piled up? I definitely ordered it with enough preparation time to spare... He's not supposed to handle things like this, even if he's too busy. Pssssh!
MsgTake:
Excuse me, could you perchance do me a favor? I'm now so busy with work that I don't even have a time to write a letter.

When I vacated my position for a while due to personal matters, I became totally backlogged with order sheets. I'm doing my best, but it's impossible to fill all the orders by the completion time on the forms. More specifically, I don't think I can fulfill Renne's request she put in last time she was in Unicorn Fons.

I know Renne's personality very well, but...I've gotta go by the order of the orders. I can't just arbitrarily finish her request first. I'm sorry to bother you, but please let her know that I'll come take care of her request in my next batch of orders.
MsgWelcome: I hope Renne isn't too upset over this.
MsgIncomplete: I hope Renne isn't too upset over this.
MsgResponse4: Summoning skills aren't as simple as they may seem. At the very least, you ought to have better skills than a decrepit man like Pange.

MsgSummary: You have to get rid of {c1}15 Great Tree Haunting Ghosts{/c} and return to {c2}Renne{/c}.
MsgComplete: Well done. There's been a real reduction in the number of rampaging souls - I can feel it. Now I feel glad that Istarr sent a good person. Is it alright to ask you another favor sometime?
MsgTake:
Well, okay. I suppose I'll ask you instead. Istarr sent you here for that, right? Well...before you say otherwise, I'll just assume that and ask you a favor!

A little while back, violent souls began wandering around the Unicorn Fons. The problem is, they're hurting people who come to experience the purifying power Unicorn Fons possesses. That's why I put in an order sheet for a professional exorcism. However, now that it seems like my order won't be processed until later, I have no choice but to take those bastards down with cold steel and hot magic! Yeah!

I want you to handle this job of quieting down those violent souls. I'll be waiting, so please come back when you get the job done.
MsgWelcome: How's the job going? I'll bet you won't leave a SOUL survivor!
MsgIncomplete: How's the job going? I'll bet you won't leave a SOUL survivor!
MsgResponse4: How's the job going? I'll bet you won't leave a SOUL survivor!

MsgSummary: {c2}Zimmer{/c} feels offended because toads disturbed his fishing. You have to capture {c1}Gigantic Toads{/c} and collect {c3}15 Toad Legs{/c}, then return to {c2}Zimmer{/c}.
MsgComplete: Wow, you really hit 'em hard! Great, I bet those toads will think twice before rampaging around now, heh heh! I'd better let Sarah know to scrap her dinner plans - we've having toad legs tonight! Thanks a lot, traveler!
MsgTake:
Curse those toads! Curse them! How dare they disturb my fishing! It's the only pleasurable thing I've got left in life! I became a ferry keeper because of the expectation I could fish whenever I wasn't actively engaged in work, even!

Young fish keep dying because those toads keep spraying lake with some nasty toxin! Not to mention, they keep driving away all the fish. I got to find a way to take them out... Say there, sonny jim, can you help this old man? I'd like you to kill some of those toads. Hack 'em up, blast 'em with magic - it's your choice. Of course, it would be much better if you could bring some Toad Legs too. Good luck~
MsgWelcome: Have you beaten up lots of toads yet?
MsgIncomplete: Have you beaten up lots of toads yet?
MsgResponse4: Have you beaten up lots of toads yet?

MsgSummary: {c2}Sarah Hamilton{/c} told you she needs an ingredient - roasted fish - for the Monarchy festival. You have to find {c2}Cordelia{/c} at the fishing spot in Brunen and ask about it.
MsgComplete:
Fish to prepare for the Monarchy festival?
Hmm...what should I do? I can get it, but it won't be that easy...
MsgTake:
The Monarchy festival is just around the corner! We're so busy with food preparation, though! If Tami doesn't cause any problem, things couldn't be much better, heh...

Ah..well, that's not what I'm trying to say. Actually, I do have one favor to ask. I have to make my "Sara's Special Roasted Fish," but all the fish I bought have gone stale. I totally lost track of it for two days because I was so busy preparing the vegetables!

If I want to get a fresh fish right now, I have to order it from Cordelia on the Ferry. Can you go see her in my stead and get a fresh fish? I'll give you enough for the fish, and something for your troubles as well. Good luck!
MsgWelcome: Did Cordelia give you a fresh fish?
MsgIncomplete: Did Cordelia give you a fresh fish?
MsgResponse4: I'm Cordelia; I fish for a living. If you have a question about fishing, I'm the one to ask!

MsgSummary:
{c2}Cordelia{/c} asked you to dispose of Sealakels who have been disturbing the fishing.
You have to get rid of {c1}15 Swordtail Sealakel Fighters{/c} and return to {c2}Cordelia{/c}.
MsgComplete: Oh~ Looks like they won't be bringing their noise, nor their funk, anytime soon, thanks to you! Looks like you've taken out quite a good number of them! My thanks, traveler!
MsgTake:
These days, Sealakels are grabbing fish from the lake left and right. There's no way to really make them stop doing it, so the amount of fish that are around to be caught is at a real low right now. If I give all my catch to you, I won't have anything to sell.

Of course, it'd be great if you could get rid of the Sealakels. If I give these to you, I keep thinking of how long I'll have to fish to get this many again. But if you clear out those Sealakels, I'll make it worth your while.
MsgWelcome: Did you get rid of those annoying Sealakels?
MsgIncomplete: Did you get rid of those annoying Sealakels?
MsgResponse4: Did you get rid of those annoying Sealakels?

MsgSummary: You have to give the {c3}Box of Fresh Fish{/c} you received from {c2}Cordelia{/c} to {c2}Sarah Hamilton{/c}.
MsgComplete: I've been waiting for you~ Did you get any fish? Let me see... Oh...they don't look as fresh as they usually do. Cordelia must be going through hard times these days too... Still, it would've been too late to order them from the Apulune Merchant Guild anyway. Well done, and thanks!
MsgTake: Well, All you've gotta do is give this box to Aunt Sarah. It has the usual amount she orders. I guess from now on, things should get a lot easier because I don't have to compete with those Sealakels anymore. Thanks again, and take care~
MsgWelcome: Did you give those fish to Aunt Sarah?
MsgIncomplete: Did you give those fish to Aunt Sarah?
MsgResponse4: I'm Tami's mother, Sarah. Did you happen to see Tami?

MsgSummary: You should give the {c3}Eolith Fur{/c} you received from {c2}Marcia{/c} to {c2}Renne{/c} in Unicorn Fons.
MsgTake:
Ah, I almost forgot... There was one thing Renne requested. She asked me to do it when I told her I was heading for the Leopardess Habitat. She said she wants to research about the ecology of Leopardesses, so she asked me to bring a specimen she can use. I remembered it when I caught a glance of this hair, hoho~

Well, if I cut off this much to give her, it'll make a good specimen, right? I hope you can go to Unicorn Fons for me and give this to Renne.
I've gotta go to Keolloseu and pick up a bounty. Thanks again, and good luck!
MsgWelcome: Haven't you paid Renne a visit yet? I'm sure she'll be waiting..
MsgIncomplete: Haven't you paid Renne a visit yet? I'm sure she'll be waiting..
MsgResponse4: Summoning skill isn't as simple as it seems. At the very least, you should have better skills than a decrepit man like Pange.

MsgSummary: {c2}Renne{/c} asked you to go to the Leopardess habitat and get rid of {c1}15 Leopardess Warriors{/c}, then return.
MsgComplete: It seems you've gotten rid of all the Leopardesses. Then, are you sure you handled another job I gave to you? I hope you haven't forgotten about it.
MsgTake:
Well, I can't let someone who's depending on me leave in vain. I just needed a person who'd do another job for me. I needed a good fighter...like you!

It's absurd to think that Leopardesses will go back to their generally mild nature just from killing one Eolith. If it were that easy, this problem would've been solved a long time ago. What we need is consistent research. This time, I'm trying to make use of the purification power Unicorn Fons possesses by introducing it into the Leopardess habitat. That's the thrust of my experiment.

If I'm to go through with it, I'll need you to deal with some enemies in Leopardess habitat. Warriors are likely the most violent ones, so just take care of them first, and we'll see how things lay from there.
MsgWelcome: Did you finish the task I assigned you?
MsgIncomplete: Did you finish the task I assigned you?
MsgResponse4: Did you finish the task I assigned you?

MsgSummary: It seems {c2}Renne{/c}'s purification experiment has failed. You should tell {c2}Renne{/c} exactly what you saw.
MsgComplete:
{c5}(with a rather disappointed look){/c}
Hmm...I must have over-simplified when I was thinking about this... I'd do a bit more research before my next test run. Thanks; you're free to go now.
MsgTake:
{c5}(You discover a Dead Stump and pour some spring water on it.

The spring water which flowed through the ruts of the dead stump falls on the ground and stagnates. The color of the ground seems to brighten temporarily, but then becomes dark again. You hear nothing, and smell nothing. It appears Renne's experiment failed. You have to go back to Renne and tell her of this result.){/c}
MsgWelcome: It seems to have rotted a long time ago.
MsgIncomplete: It seems to have rotted a long time ago.
MsgResponse4: Summoning skill isn't as simple as it seems. At the very least, you should have better skills than a decrepit man like Pange.

MsgSummary:
Gardenia asked you to defeat {c1}Cloron Goblins{/c} and collect {c3}Rare Gemstones{/c}.
You have to collect at least {c3}5 gemstones{/c} and go back to {c2}Gardenia{/c} within {c4}60 minutes{/c}.
You can find Cloron Goblins if you go across the river southeast of Cloron Forest.
MsgComplete: You brought fewer than I was hoping, but thanks nonetheless.
MsgResponse1: Oh, if it were only a little bit more, then we'd surely be set! But I can see you did your best, so thanks for what you've brought.
MsgResponse2:
Whoa! I never expected you'd bring in this many gemstones! This is a real haul you've got here!
A big thanks for your help, traveler. I hope you'll drop by next time I need a hand, heh heh!
MsgTake:
Have you heard the rumors about Cloron's Lair? I heard an ancient treasure is buried there, which is why sometimes, if you defeat one of the monsters ambling around there, it'll have a gemstone in its possession. Do you think there's any truth to it?

Sometimes, in my work, I do business with nobles in the capital, who always buy the most expensive I have to offer. If this rumor is true, I figure I'll have one more thing to offer them, and one with a high return at that! Don't worry; I'd pay you quite well too.

An associate of mine said he heard tales of people obtaining this sort of treasure from Cloron Golbins. I can afford to delay my journey for about 60 minutes, so within that time frame, just bring me as many as you're able.
MsgWelcome: How many gemstones have you collected?
MsgIncomplete: How many gemstones have you collected?
MsgResponse4: How many gemstones have you collected?

MsgSummary: {c2}Kail{/c}, a lord, asked you to go to a Ranger, {c2}Haira{/c}, and find out what classified information she's obtained.
MsgComplete: Are you the messenger sent by the lord? Thank the Goddess, you made it in time.
MsgTake:
Good to see you again. I haven't forgot the skill you showed back when I needed someone to get rid of the monsters infesting Cloron's Lair. I think you're a pretty trustworthy person, so can I ask you to handle another task on my behalf?

A little while ago, I received a message from Berca, who works at the Watch Tower near Aelbeageu. A Ranger named Haira who was dispatched to Sia Maia said she came across some valuable information. She also said to send along someone I considered trustworthy, in case she needed some backup. I'd like you to take on this job.

Go to Sia Maia and meet her. If you say Lord Kail sent you, she should tell you more about the situation.
MsgWelcome: What? You haven't left yet?
MsgIncomplete: What? You haven't left yet?
MsgResponse4: Hmm? What is it? I have to go out scouting soon, so please make it quick.

MsgSummary: You were told it is likely Vail are hiding in the Ereumana district. You have to go to the area {c2}Haira{/c} patrolled and find something that presents solid evidence of this theory.
MsgComplete:
{c5}(You discovered the remains of a camp, presumably left behind by the Vail force Haira spoke of.
You look around quickly to find something that could serve as evidence of a Vail presence.){/c}
MsgTake:
Well then, I'll get right to the point. I have good reason to believe that there are Vail hiding in the Ereumana district.

A little while ago, I went out scouting and discovered a dead brown bear with an unfamiliar injury. Even though I investigated meticulously, I couldn't match the injury to any weapons used by Humans or Elves. After that, I made a close sweep of the area. As I went on, I began to belive more and more that the Vail were maintaining a presence in this district.

The area I patrolled is near the Cornwell Forest. I'd like you to make a sweep of the area yourself and see if you can find anything that would serve as hard evidence to back up my theory. I'm planning to continue my patrol; I'm sure they're hidden in more that just one place. Above all, be careful!
MsgWelcome: Please stay sharp. Prudence is a virtue in Scouters.
MsgIncomplete: Please stay sharp. Prudence is a virtue in Scouters.
MsgResponse4: It seems to be the remains of a camp settlement, cleared out in haste.

MsgSummary: You have to give a {c3}Torn Patch{/c} you discovered at {c2}the camp remains{/c} to {c2}Haira{/c} in Sia Maia.
MsgTake:
{c5}(There is something half-sticking out of the ground near where a bonfire was burned. It appears to have been hastily buried before the camp's occupants left. When you dig it up, it turns out to be a piece of durable cloth, like the sort used for banners and flags. When you dust off the dirt and look at it more carefully, you can see a faint symbol of the Union of Fury!

This seems to be the kind of decisive evidence Haira was looking for. You should deliver the piece of cloth you've discovered to Haira.){/c}
MsgWelcome: It doesn't seem like there's much else of interest here.
MsgIncomplete: It doesn't seem like there's much else of interest here.
MsgResponse4: Hmm? What is it? I have to go out scouting soon, so please make it quick.

QuestName: To Exorcise is Good for You!
MsgSummary:
{c2}Poites, a low-class Priest{/c}, wants you to help with an exorcism.
You have to get rid of {c1}10 Cloron Evil Spirits{/c} and return to {c2}Poites{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Ah, I see you have returned, unsullied by theYou have returned safely.
Thanks for your help.
This job will continue, so I hope I can receive your help next time again.
MsgTake:
Heinous monsters, driven mad by fear of the dragon deep within, are not the only malevolent force hovering around Cloron's Lair. Vicious souls also wander the area, bereft of life and memory, with only hate and sorrow keeping them bound to this world.

Even though we've not much power, when we have time, we perform exorcisms to help guide these lingering souls to peace. You arrived just as I was about to begin the ritual, actually, so I'd like to ask if you could help with the exorcism. It shouldn't take anything too difficult on your part. All I ask is for you to go to Cloron's Lair and defeat roughly 10 weakened spirits, then return to me.

I can only delay a short time, so please finish the job within 5 minutes, if you can.
MsgWelcome: How many evil spirits did you finish off?
MsgIncomplete: How many evil spirits did you finish off?
MsgResponse4: How many evil spirits did you finish off?

MsgSummary: Wait a while, then talk to {c2}Ensiferr{/c} again.
MsgWelcome: For the honor of the Stardust Knights!
MsgIncomplete: For the honor of the Stardust Knights!
MsgResponse4: For the honor of the Stardust Knights!

MsgSummary: You have to destroy the WarEdge Clan near the Arvea Feller's Town located in the east of Adellia. You have to get rid of {c1}15 WarEdge Orc Legionary Soldiers and 7 WarEdge Orc Squad Leaders{/c} and report back to {c2}Ensiferr{/c}.
MsgComplete: Come on in. Here's a letter I was directed to give you upon successful completion of the mission, as well as this stipend, to be used as "war funds."
MsgTake:
Greetings, friend!

I'm the leader of the Stardust Knights, Sherlock Spencer. Word reached me of your heroic actions in Silvaren, and I'd like to pay my respect to you on behalf of the soldiers of the Alliance of Light.

However, currently, the spear-rattling of the Orcs is becoming harder and harder to ignore. The Orcs becoming an active military power would be a very serious problem in the midst of the war against the Union of Fury. The King, William Typhon, ordered us to stop the Orcs from becoming any more powerful.

However, in this situation, we can't pull knights from the forefront of the war to take care of threats at our back. And that's when I recalled what you'd accomplished before. If you can help us in this moment of difficulty, we'll recognize you as an honorary member of the Stardust Knights in the name of His Majesty the King. A royal gift awaits you at the successful completion of this mission too.

But anyway, let me get back to business. There is a powerful group of orcs called the WarEdge Clan that roams in both the west and east of the Adellia district.
The messenger sent from Maitreyan hasn't reached them yet; at this point, we're lucky they've yet to form an alliance with the Orcs in Maitreyan. Before they respond to Maitreyan's offer of alliance, we have to cause them damage so massive that they are incapable of cementing an alliance. First, I'd like you to destroy the WarEdge clan near the Arvea Feller's Town in the east of the district. More specifically, you have to get rid of 15 WarEdge Orc Legionary Soldiers and 7 WarEdge Orc Squad Leaders, then deliver a report to Ensiferr.

P.S. - This letter has been enchanted to self-destruct after you read it. Gotta keep security up!

MsgSummary: You have to go to the WarEdge Clan Town located to the west of Huigronn Stronghold and get rid of {c1}15 WarEdge Orc Warriors and Kiba-Tul, a chief of the WarEdge clan{/c}, then return to {c2}Ensiferr{/c}.
MsgComplete: Well done.
MsgTake:
Congratulations! If you're reading this letter, it means you've completed the first mission. You've really got some talent, I must admit. However, remember that this is just the beginning.

Now, you need to stop the WarEdge clan in the west of Adellia from joining the Maitreyan force. I was told the WarEdge Clan Orcs in the west are stronger than Orcs in the east. I recommend that you join others who seek to accomplish the same ends. The Elves in league with the Royal Knights are also doing what they can to stop the WarEdge Orcs from joining with Maitreyan. I'm sure there are others out there who are also working toward this goal, so keep that in mind.

Now, go to the WarEdge Clan village located to the west of Huigronn Stronghold. You have to get rid of 15 Orc Warriors and the clan's chief, Kiba-Tul, then report to Ensiferr.

P.S. - This letter has been enchanted to self-destruct after you read it. Gotta keep security up!

QuestName: To the Office of the Stardust Knights! <Epic>
MsgSummary: You have to meet {c2}Sherlock Spencer{/c} in the Stardust Knights Office of Apulune. Go to Apulune, and use a portal for a shorter trip.
MsgComplete: Welcome! Finally, I get a chance to meet you face to face. First, let me reimburse you for any traveling expenses you may have incurred.
MsgTake:
I think we've reached the point where you have to pay a visit to the Stardust Knights guild in Apulune.
Go to Sherlock Spencer, the leader of the Stardust Knights guild. Feel free to use a portal - the Stardust Knights will reimburse you for anything you spend to reach Apulune.

If you find Sherlock Spencer and deliver this message, he'll reimburse you from his own coffers, if need be. I suppose it's now time for us to part ways. Goodbye, and see you again.
MsgWelcome: Sir Sherlock will be waiting for you. Make haste, now!
MsgIncomplete: Sir Sherlock will be waiting for you. Make haste, now!
MsgResponse4: Hello there, friend. How many I be of assistance?

MsgSummary:
You have to go to Aelbeageu by using a portal to Keolloseu in Apulune .
Once you've arrived, you have to meet {c2}Mulus Toreo{/c} in Aelbeageu and give the {c3}Letter to Mulus{/c} to him.
MsgComplete: Come on in, I've been waiting for you.
MsgTake:
On behalf of His Majesty the King, let me thank you for all the help you've given to the Alliance of Light. However, there is something more I'd like to ask of you. If you're a stong believer in the Alliance of Light's cause, I figure you won't decline this request.

{c5}(Sherlock looks at you with determined eyes){/c}

We Humans don't know all that much about the history of Teos Epeiros as it was before the more modern times. The love-and-hate relationship between the Elves and the Orcs is an example of one of those issues we just don't understand the history of. Normally, we'd let them sort it out themselves, but sometimes, the Elves' problems don't just impact the Elves - with the Alliance formed between Elves and Humans, their problems can become our problems as well. Currently, Ankylul WildDark, the King of the Orcs and a very powerful warrior-magician, is being revived in Maitreyan. The Elves sustained considerable damage in their last war against the Orcs.

The Elves suspect that Ankylul hasn't regained all his power yet. In order to get rid of him, there are other problems we need to address first. First, I'd like you to meet with Mulus Toreo in Aelbeageu and deliver this letter to him. Use the portal to Keolloseu here in Apulune to cut most of the distance off your journey. Of course, we'll reimburse you for traveling expenses; Mulus will take care of it when you reach him with the letter.
MsgWelcome: Hurry up. Time will not wait for us.
MsgIncomplete: Hurry up. Time will not wait for us.
MsgResponse4: Oh my, I must've dozed off. I'm a Mulus, follower of Etain. What news have you brought?

MsgSummary: You have to return to {c2}Mulus Toreo{/c} with {c3}99 Rilans{/c}, which you can buy from shops or obtain from low-class monsters in this district, {c3}30 Spirit Cores, and 20 Adamars Stones{/c}, which can be obtained from monsters.
MsgComplete: Well done. Just wait a moment now.
MsgTake:
{c5}(Mulus puts down the letter from Sherlock he was reading and gives you a serious look){/c}

As you may have surmised, normal methods won't be effective for getting rid of Ankylul WildDark, the King of the Orcs. Ankylul is a descendant of Oak, one of the Telaiosis who existed before even we Elves came into being long ago. The result of our ancestors' sin are the cursed and depraved beings we know today as Orcs. This is why their ruler, Ankylul, has a small portion of the power of the Telaiosis, and why they bear us such enmity. 

We sustained great losses in the past trying to take down Ankylul. At this time, Ankylul hasn't recovered his full power, nor has he roused the Orc clans scattered throughout this land and bound them into a great army. If we don't get rid of him now, it will only become more and more unlikely we'll have a clear shot. I can give you the chance, by make a powerful magical nostrum that will allow you to stand against Ankylul. I'll need you to bring me the materials, though, and I'm telling you beforehand, it's quite a bit.

First, bring me 99 Rilans, 30 Spirit Cores, and 20 Adamars Stones. You can buy these materials from shops, or you can obtain them from many monsters out there as well. If you have friends traveling the land, it can't hurt to ask them to be on the lookout for these materials too.
MsgWelcome: You have to hurry before Ankylul regains his full power.
MsgIncomplete: You have to hurry before Ankylul regains his full power.
MsgResponse4: You have to hurry before Ankylul regains his full power.

MsgSummary: You have to return to {c2}Sherlock Spencer{/c} in Apulune with a {c3}Termination Report{/c}.
MsgComplete: Ah, you've finally arrived! I've been waiting for you.
MsgTake: This is a valuable magical nostrum, called an 'Arkein Potion.' It ought to prove very useful when you face off against Ankylul. Now, I need you to deliver this report to Sir Sherlock, the leader of the Stardust Knights. If you do, he'll let you know the best strategy to employ when you confront Ankylul. Well, off with you now; we've no time to waste.
MsgWelcome: I hope we can meet again someday.
MsgIncomplete: I hope we can meet again someday.
MsgResponse4: Hello there, friend. How many I be of assistance?

MsgSummary: You have to go to {c2}Alius Magicartisan{/c}, who is currently staying in Silvaren, and deliver to him a {c3}Letter to the Artisan{/c}.
MsgComplete: Hmmm...as you can see, I'm a bit irritated at the moment.
MsgTake:
While you were with Mulus, we received a complete report from Iudex via the Elven Embassy. It said that Alius, famous across the continent as a great artisan, was asked to craft a number of formidable arms which might be able to strike down Ankylul.

There might be one that fits you among those weapons. Go to Allius in Silvaren with this letter. And be sure to make haste - Alius is notorious for his fussy personality, so much that he frustrates even the most patient of the Elven sages.
MsgWelcome: Glory to the Alliance of Light!
MsgIncomplete: Glory to the Alliance of Light!
MsgResponse4: When I work, my heart must move first - only then can my hands accomplish great things.

MsgSummary:
You should get {c3}20 Magic Leathers, 20 Adamars Stones{/c}, and {c3}90 Gold Apples{/c} and return to {c2}Alius Magicartisan{/c}.
You can buy some of these materials from shops, or you can obtain them from various monsters as well.
MsgComplete: Ah~ Now that all the materials are in place, allow me to get to work. Just wait a moment...
MsgTake:
The old men in Iudex said Ankylul WildDark is an Orc who possesses the formidable power of fire, so I was asked to make arms imbued with the power of water. However, I don't have any material left because those noisy old men haven't given me any material at all - they just kept asking me to make them, as though I'm some magic factory! What can I do? I can't obtain these items in person, I need a person who'll go get them while I work.

I'll let you know the materials so you can go out and gather them yourself. What you should get is: 20 Magical Leathers, 20 Adamars Ores, and 90 Gold Apples.
I figure you can get Gold Apples easily enough, but...as for the other two, I know you can get Magic Leathers and Adamars Ores from D-Water Borderland. I haven't tried myself, though, so it wouldn't hurt to ask other people. You may even learn of other ways these items can be obtained. Take care, then!
MsgWelcome: The more quickly you act, the better it'll be for both of us.
MsgIncomplete: The more quickly you act, the better it'll be for both of us.
MsgResponse4: The more quickly you act, the better it'll be for both of us.

QuestName: Return to the Stardust Knights' Office <Epic>
MsgSummary: Go pay a visit to {c2}Sherlock Spencer{/c} in Apulune.
MsgComplete: It looks like all the pieces are in place...
MsgTake:
Well, it looks like I've finished crafting them all. No fancy names - I simply call it an Elven Aqua Sword, made in the style of the Elves and imbued with the power of water. I hope it will prove an effective bane to Ankylul. Now you can return to Sherlock Spencer. Give him my regards as well.

I wonder if I'll be able to see you again. Perhaps I'll be able to hear you on the wind...
MsgWelcome: May Etain guide your path.
MsgIncomplete: May Etain guide your path.
MsgResponse4: Hello there, friend. How many I be of assistance?

MsgSummary: Go to the darkened halls of Maitreyan and destroy its foul ruler, {c1}Ankylul WildDark{/c}, and his servant, {c1}Lamultan Bloodstorm{/c}, then return to {c2}Sherlock Spencer{/c}. Chances are you may not be able to accomplish these objectives alone. Bring friend and allies for a better chance of success.
MsgComplete: Well done! I salute your courage and bravery!
MsgTake:
Now all the preparations are complete. If we delay any longer, Ankylul will fully recover his terrible power.

It's time for you to leave for Maitreyan. Go and fell the ruler of Maitreyan, Ankylul WildDark, and his servant, Lamultan Bloodstorm, then return. As I've said before, they are very formidable beings. I beseech you, don't go alone - gather friends and allies who will stand with you against the darkness. Surely there are others in the world who wish to see Ankylul WildDark cast back into the depths. I look forward to news of your success.
MsgWelcome: May Etain guide your path.
MsgIncomplete: May Etain guide your path.
MsgResponse4: May Etain guide your path.

MsgSummary: You have to go to the royal castle and have an audience before {c2}His Majesty, the King{/c}.
MsgComplete: Come before me, Knight, and let the heralds sound the trump for you. Your courage has led you to do great things for this kingdom, and I intend to let the world know of your bravery. I want you to receive something I've personally had prepared for you. These arms mark those among the Stardust Knights whose valorous deeds have earned my favor. May it forever signify your honor and dignity!
MsgTake: What an honor - His Majesty the King is waiting to have an audience with you! Go to the royal castle and have an audience with the king. His Majesty will compliment you on your accomplishments and reward you in person.
MsgWelcome: May your dignity shine as brightly as the stars in the sky.
MsgIncomplete: May your dignity shine as brightly as the stars in the sky.
MsgResponse4: May your dignity shine as brightly as the stars in the sky.

QuestName: A Messanger from the Royal Knights <Epic>
MsgSummary: Wait a little while, then talk to {c2}Echion{/c} again.

You have to destroy the WarEdge clan near the Arvea Feller's Town located in the east of Adellia. You have to dispose of {c1}15 WarEdge Orc Legionary Soldiers and 7 WarEdge Orc Squad Leaders{/c} and report back to {c2}Echion Ravis{/c}.
MsgComplete: Come on in. Here's a letter I was instructed to give you upon successful completion of the mission, as well as this stipend, to be used as "war funds." Like the letter before it, it was sealed by his own hand, expressly meant for your eyes only. Make sure you read it!
MsgTake:
Salutations!

I'm a leader of Royal Knights, Lectis Eizman.
The heroic deeds you performed in Silvaren raised the reputation of Humans in the eyes of our Elven allies. On behalf of His Majesty, the King of glorious Apulune, let me be the first to acknowledge the bravery you've shown thus far.

However, currently, the spear-rattling of the Orcs is becoming harder and harder to ignore. The Orcs becoming an active military power would be a very serious problem in the midst of the war against the Union of Fury. The King, William Typhon, ordered us to stop the Orcs from becoming any more powerful.

However, I can safely say there are no knights here to fight against the Orcs, except the knights assigned to guard Apulune - at the moment, every knight we can spare has been sent to the forefront of combat.

If you can help us in this moment of difficulty, we'll recommend you for recognition as an honorary member of the Royal Knights in the name of His Majesty the King. A royal gift awaits you at the successful completion of this mission too.

But anyway, let me get back to business. There is a powerful group of orcs called the WarEdge Clan that roams in both the west and east of the Adellia district.
The messenger sent from Maitreyan hasn't reached them yet; at this point, we're lucky they've yet to form an alliance with the Orcs in Maitreyan. Before they respond to Maitreyan's offer of alliance, we have to cause them damage so massive that they are incapable of cementing an alliance. First, I'd like you to destroy the WarEdge clan near the Arvea Feller's Town in the east of the district. More specifically, you have to get rid of 15 WarEdge Orc Legionary Soldiers and 7 WarEdge Orc Squad Leaders, then deliver a report to Echion.

P.S. - This letter has been enchanted and will soon self destruct. Please refrain from reading it within a foot of your face.

MsgSummary: You have to go to the WarEdge Clan Town located to the west of Huigronn Stronghold and get rid of {c1}15 WarEdge Orc Warriors and Kiba-Tul, a chief of the WarEdge clan{/c}, then return to {c2}Echion Ravis{/c}.
MsgComplete: Hey, you did it! Good show!
MsgTake:
Congratulations! If you're reading this letter, it means you've completed the first mission. That means you've safely passed the first test toward becoming a Royal Knight. However, remember that this is just the beginning.

Now, you need to stop the WarEdge clan in the west of Adellia from joining the Maitreyan force. I was told the WarEdge Clan Orcs in the west are stronger than Orcs in the east. I recommend that you join others who seek to accomplish the same ends. The Elves who are in league with the Royal Knights are also doing their best to stop the Orcs from joining forces with the Maitreyan stronghold. I'm sure there are others out there who are also working toward this goal, so keep that in mind.

Now, go to the WarEdge Clan village located to the west of Huigronn Stronghold. You have to get rid of 15 Orc Warriors and the clan's chief, Kiba-Tul, then report to Echion. After that, further information will await you.

This letter has been enchanted and will soon self destruct. Please refrain from reading it within a foot of your face.

QuestName: A Summons from the Royal Knights' Leader <Epic>
MsgSummary: You have to meet {c2}Lectis Eizman{/c} in the Royal Castle of Apulune. Go to Apulune, and use a portal for a shorter trip.
MsgComplete: Welcome! Finally, I get a chance to meet you face to face. First, let me reimburse you for any traveling expenses you may have incurred.
MsgTake:
I think it's about time that you speak with the top brass personally. The leader of the Royal Knights, Lectis Eizman, will be waiting for you in Apulune's Royal Castle. Feel free to use a portal for a quicker trip - the Royal Knights will reimburse you for any traveling expenses you incur in transport.

If you find Lectis Eizman and deliver this message, he'll repay you straightaway. I suppose my work here is done now; goodbye, and safe travels!
MsgWelcome: Sir Lectis will be waiting for you. Go quickly!
MsgIncomplete: Sir Lectis will be waiting for you. Go quickly!
MsgResponse4: What do you want?  Is someone of your rank allowed to talk to me directly?  (Lectis looks displeased)

MsgSummary:
You have to go to Aelbeageu by using a portal to Keolloseu in Apulune .
Once you've arrived, you have to meet {c2}Mulus Toreo{/c} in Aelbeageu and give the {c3}Letter to Mulus{/c} to him.
MsgComplete: Come on in, I've been waiting for you.
MsgTake:
On behalf of His Majesty the King, let me thank you for all the help you've given to the Alliance of Light. However, there is something more I'd like to ask of you. If you're a stong defender of the Alliance of Light's cause, I figure you won't decline this request.

We Humans don't know all that much about the history of Teos Epeiros as it was before the more modern times. The love-and-hate relationship between the Elves and the Orcs is an example of one of those issues we just don't understand the history of. Normally, we'd let them sort it out themselves, but sometimes, the Elves' problems don't just impact the Elves - with the Alliance formed between Elves and Humans, their problems can become our problems as well. Currently, Ankylul WildDark, the King of the Orcs and a very powerful warrior-magician, is being revived in Maitreyan. The Elves sustained considerable damage in their last war against the Orcs.

The Elves suspect that Ankylul hasn't regained all his power yet. In order to get rid of him, there are other problems we need to address first. First, I'd like you to meet with Mulus Toreo in Aelbeageu and deliver this letter to him. Use the portal to Keolloseu here in Apulune to cut most of the distance off your journey. Of course, we'll reimburse you for traveling expenses; Mulus will take care of it when you reach him with the letter.
MsgWelcome: Hurry up. Time will not wait for us.
MsgIncomplete: Hurry up. Time will not wait for us...
MsgResponse4: Oh my, I must've dozed off. I'm a Mulus, follower of Etain. What news have you brought?

MsgSummary: You have to return to {c2}Mulus Toreo{/c} with {c3}99 Rilans{/c}, which you can buy from shops or obtain from low-class monsters in this district, {c3}30 Spirit Cores, and 20 Adamars Stones{/c}, which can be obtained from monsters.
MsgComplete: Well done. Just wait a moment now.
MsgTake:
{c5}(Mulus puts down the letter from Sherlock he was reading and gives you a serious look){/c}

As you may have surmised, normal methods won't be effective for getting rid of Ankylul WildDark, the King of the Orcs. Ankylul is a descendant of Oak, one of the Telaiosis who existed before even we Elves came into being long ago. The result of our ancestors' sin are the cursed and depraved beings we know today as Orcs. This is why their ruler, Ankylul, has a small portion of the power of the Telaiosis, and why they bear us such enmity. 

We sustained great losses in the past trying to take down Ankylul. At this time, Ankylul hasn't recovered his full power, nor has he roused the Orc clans scattered throughout this land and bound them into a great army. If we don't get rid of him now, it will only become more and more unlikely we'll have a clear shot. I can give you the chance, by make a powerful magical nostrum that will allow you to stand against Ankylul. I'll need you to bring me the materials, though, and I'm telling you beforehand, it's quite a bit.

First, bring me 99 Rilans, 30 Spirit Cores, and 20 Adamars Stones. You can buy these materials from shops, or you can obtain them from many monsters out there as well. If you have friends traveling the land, it can't hurt to ask them to be on the lookout for these materials too.
MsgWelcome: You have to hurry before Ankylul regains his full power.
MsgIncomplete: You have to hurry before Ankylul regains his full power.
MsgResponse4: You have to hurry before Ankylul regains his full power.

MsgSummary: You have to return to {c2}Lectis Eizman{/c} in Apulune with a {c3}Termination Report{/c}.
MsgComplete: Ah, you've finally arrived! I've been waiting for you.
MsgTake: This is a valuable magical nostrum, called an 'Arkein Potion.' It ought to prove very useful when you face off against Ankylul. Now, I need you to deliver this report to Lectis Eizman, the leader of the Royal Knights. If you do, he'll let you know the best strategy to employ when you confront Ankylul. Well, off with you now; we've no time to waste.
MsgWelcome: I hope we can meet again someday.
MsgIncomplete: I hope we can meet again someday.
MsgResponse4: What do you want?  Is someone of your rank allowed to talk to me directly?  (Lectis looks displeased)

MsgSummary: You have to go to {c2}Alius Magicartisan{/c}, who is currently staying in Silvaren, and deliver to him a {c3}Letter to the Artisan{/c}.
MsgComplete: Hmmm...as you can see, I'm a bit irritated at the moment.
MsgTake:
While you were with the Sage of Aelbeageu, we received a complete report from Iudex, their administration, via the Elven Embassy. It said that Alius, famous across the continent as a great artisan, was asked to craft a number of formidable arms which might be able to strike down Ankylul.

There might be one that fits you among those weapons. Go to Allius in Silvaren with this letter. And be sure to make haste - Alius is notorious for his fussy personality. If his heart isn't in the work, none can tell whether he'll do it, even if it's a direct order from Iudex...
MsgWelcome: Glory to the Alliance of Light!
MsgIncomplete: Glory to the Alliance of Light!
MsgResponse4: When I work, my heart must move first - only then can my hands accomplish great things.

MsgSummary:
You should get {c3}20 Magic Leathers, 20 Adamars Stones{/c}, and {c3}90 Gold Apples{/c} and return to {c2}Alius Magicartisan{/c}.
You can buy some of these materials from shops, or you can obtain them from various monsters as well.
MsgComplete: Ah~ Now that all the materials are in place, allow me to get to work. Just wait a moment...
MsgTake:
The old men in Iudex said Ankylul WildDark is an Orc who possesses the formidable power of fire, so I was asked to make arms imbued with the power of water. However, I don't have any material left because those noisy old men haven't given me any material at all - they just kept asking me to make them, as though I'm some magic factory! What can I do? I can't obtain these items in person, I need a person who'll go get them while I work.

I'll let you know the materials so you can go out and gather them yourself. What you should get is: 20 Magical Leathers, 20 Adamars Ores, and 90 Gold Apples.
I figure you can get Gold Apples easily enough, but...as for the other two, I know you can get Magic Leathers and Adamars Ores from D-Water Borderland. I haven't tried myself, though, so it wouldn't hurt to ask other people. You may even learn of other ways these items can be obtained. Take care, then!
MsgWelcome: The more quickly you act, the better it'll be for both of us.
MsgIncomplete: The more quickly you act, the better it'll be for both of us.
MsgResponse4: The more quickly you act, the better it'll be for both of us.

QuestName: A Return to the Royal Knights <Epic>
MsgSummary: Pay a visit to {c2}Lectis Eizman{/c} in Apulune.
MsgComplete: It looks like all the pieces are in place...
MsgTake:
Well, it looks like I've finished crafting them all. No fancy names - I simply call this the Elven Aqua Hammer, made in the style of the Elves and imbued with the power of water. I hope it will prove an effective bane to Ankylul. Now you can return to Lectis. No need to give him my regard; that cold-hearted ass would go on living the high life whether or not he ever heard from me again.
	
I wonder if I'll be able to see you again. Perhaps I'll be able to hear you on the wind...
MsgWelcome: May Etain guide your path.
MsgIncomplete: May Etain guide your path.
MsgResponse4: What do you want?  Is someone of your rank allowed to talk to me directly?  (Lectis looks displeased)

MsgSummary: Go to the darkened halls of Maitreyan and destroy its foul ruler, {c1}Ankylul WildDark{/c}, and his servant, {c1}Lamultan Bloodstorm{/c}, then return to {c2}Sherlock Spencer{/c}. Chances are you may not be able to accomplish these objectives alone. Bring friend and allies for a better chance of success.
MsgTake:
It looks like we're as prepared as we'll ever be. If we delay any longer, it'll only increase the likelihood that Ankylul will recover his power completely.

It's time for you to leave for Maitreyan - the true test of your abilities. Go and fell the ruler of Maitreyan, Ankylul WildDark, and his servant, Lamultan Bloodstorm, then return. As I've said before, they are very formidable foes. Don't try to go it alone - gather friends and allies who will lend their powers to this cause. Surely there are others in the world who wish to see Ankylul WildDark cast back into the depths. I look forward to your return when this mission is complete.
MsgWelcome: May Etain guide your path.
MsgIncomplete: May Etain guide your path.
MsgResponse4: May Etain guide your path.

MsgSummary: You have to go to the royal castle and have an audience before {c2}His Majesty, the King{/c}.
MsgComplete: Come before me, Glorious Knight, and let the heralds sound the trump for you - I intend to let the world know of your bravery. I want you to receive something I've personally had prepared for you. These arms mark those among the Royal Knights whose stalwart deeds have earned my favor. May it forever signify your honor and glory!
MsgTake:
What an honor - His Majesty the King is waiting to have an audience with you! This may very well be the proudest moment in your life, so you ought to feel honored. Go to the royal castle and have an audience with the king. His Majesty will compliment you on your accomplishments and reward you in person.

{c5}(Lectis looks somewhat displeased){/c}
MsgWelcome: Here's to the great dignity of your accomplishments!
MsgIncomplete: Here's to the great dignity of your accomplishments!
MsgResponse4: Here's to the great dignity of your accomplishments!

QuestName: A Messanger of the Deities Religion <Epic>
MsgSummary: Wait a while, then talk to {c2}Getis Niveran{/c} again.
MsgComplete:
I came here to deliver a letter on behalf of Lana Fairwind, High Priestess of the Deities Religion.
After Lana had a private audience with His Majesty, the King, the religion made a decision to help His Majesty, who is worried about the Orcish presence in Maitreyan.

However, most of our acolytes are now serving in the war against the Union of Fury, so the number of people we're free to allocate to causes on the home front has already reached its upper limit.

This is a letter Lana wanted me to present to you in person. It has been sealed, to be opened by no hands besides yours. It seems to be some kind of very important favor, so be sure you read it carefully.

MsgSummary: You have to destroy the WarEdge Clan near the Arvea Feller's Town located in the east of Adellia. You have to get rid of {c1}15 WarEdge Orc Legionary Soldiers and 7 WarEdge Orc Squad Leaders{/c} and report back to {c2}Getis Niveran{/c}.
MsgComplete: Hey, welcome back! Take this - it's a letter I was told to give you upon the successful completion of the mission. Oh, and before I forget, here's a little extra coin, to cover your traveling expenses.
MsgTake:
May the Goddess's blessing be with you!

I'm Lana Fairwind, of the Deities Religion. The lesson of Etain's guidance you displayed in Silvaren set an excellent example for many brothers and sisters of our religion. However, currently the Orcs' military maneuvers are becoming more and more aggressive, and it has many brothers and sisters afraid for themselves and their families at home.

Both now and in the future, it is the Priests' duty to prove Etain's magnificient power, and help heal the wounds of this land, that we may once again live in peace. If you prove Etain's power, it will set an example for all brothers and sisters of our religion. You'll be recognized as both a member of Deities Religion and a faithful servant of Etain. There will no doubt be a gift awaiting you when you accomplish your mission as well.

But anyway, let me get back to business. There is a powerful group of orcs called the WarEdge Clan that roams in both the west and east of the Adellia district.
The messenger sent from Maitreyan hasn't reached them yet; at this point, we're lucky they've yet to form an alliance with the Orcs in Maitreyan. Before they respond to Maitreyan's offer of alliance, we have to cause them damage so massive that they are incapable of cementing an alliance. First, I'd like you to destroy the WarEdge clan near the Arvea Feller's Town in the east of the district. More specifically, you have to get rid of 15 WarEdge Orc Legionary Soldiers and 7 WarEdge Orc Squad Leaders, then deliver a report to Getis.

P.S. - In the interest of keeping our information secure, this letter has been enchanted to self-destruct shortly after you read it.

MsgSummary: You have to go to the WarEdge Clan Town located to the west of Huigronn Stronghold and get rid of {c1}15 WarEdge Orc Warriors and Kiba-Tul, a chief of the WarEdge clan{/c}, then return to {c2}Getis Niveran{/c}.
MsgComplete: Hey, some great work there!
MsgTake:
Congratulations. Your firm belief in Etain has now been proven once again. However, remember that this is just the beginning. Whenever we are called, wherever we are called, we will answer the trials Etain places before us, and it is up to you to prove our resolve in this trial.

Now, we need to stop the WarEdge clan in the west of Adellia from joining the Maitreyan force. Keep in mind that the WarEdge Clan Orcs in the west are stronger than the Orcs in the east. I recommend that you join others who seek to accomplish the same ends. The Elves who are in league with us are also doing what they can to stop the WarEdge Orcs from joining with Maitreyan. I'm sure there are others out there who seek this same end, so keep that in mind when asking around.

Now, go to the WarEdge Clan village located to the west of Huigronn Stronghold. You have to get rid of 15 Orc Warriors and the clan's chief, Kiba-Tul, then report to Getis.

P.S. - In the interest of keeping our information secure, this letter has been enchanted to self-destruct shortly after you read it.

MsgSummary: You have to meet {c2}Lana Fairwind{/c}, the High Priestess of the Deities Religion, in Apulune. Go to Apulune, and use a portal for a shorter trip.
MsgComplete: Welcome! It's good to finally be able to meet you in person. Did you have much trouble getting here? Oh - take this; it ought to cover your traveling costs.
MsgTake:
At this point, for more detailed information, you should pay a visit to the Deities Religion's headquarters in Apulune. I'd recommend using a portal - it'll cut down on the amount of legwork. Once you're there, just seek out Lana Fairwind, the High Priestess of the Deities Religion.

The religion will repay you for the cost of transport, so don't worry about the cost of using a portal.

If you find Lana and deliver this message, she'll repay you for what you spent in reaching Apulune. I suppose it's time to part ways; fare thee well! Bring me back a souvenir, maybe!
MsgWelcome: Please, do not tarry - you wouldn't want to keep Lana waiting.
MsgIncomplete: Please, do not tarry - you wouldn't want to keep Lana waiting.
MsgResponse4: Etain's grace be with you. Can I be of service to you today?

MsgSummary:
You have to go to Aelbeageu by using a portal to Keolloseu in Apulune .
Once you've arrived, you have to meet {c2}Mulus Toreo{/c} in Aelbeageu and give the {c3}Letter to Mulus{/c} to him.

In order to get rid of him, there are problems we need to deal with in advance..
First, you have to meet Mulus Toreo in the Aelbeageu of Ereumana and borrow his brilliant wisdom.
Go to Aelbeageu with this letter.
You can use a portal in the Apulune and go there via Keolloseu.
Of course, we'll provide traveling expenses.
If you convey this letter to Mulus, he'll convey traveling expenses to you.

The Elves suspect that Ankylul hasn't regained all his power yet. In order to get rid of him, there are other problems we need to address first. QuestName: Return to the Deities Religion's Headquarters <Epic>

QuestName: The Final Blow to the Heretics <Epic>
MsgSummary: Venture to the deepest reaches of Maitreyan and destroy its foul ruler, {c1}Ankylul WildDark{/c}, and his servant, {c1}Lamultan Bloodstorm{/c}, then return to {c2}Lana Fairwind{/c}. Chances are you may not be able to accomplish these objectives alone. Bring friend and allies for a better chance of success.
MsgComplete: May Etain font of blessing flow out upon you, who today has delivered her supreme justice!
MsgTake:
Now all the preparations are complete. If we delay any longer, Ankylul will recover his fell strength, and our prospects will be grimmer indeed.

The time has come to see you off to Maitreyan. Go now, and destroy Ankylul WildDark, the wicked king of Maitreyan, and his attendant, Lamultan Bloodstorm, and become the instrument of Etain's justice. As you're well aware by now, they are very formidable foes. I entreat you, do not go alone - gather friends and allies who have also received the blessing of Etain. Surely there are others in the world who wish to see Ankylul WildDark smote down by Etain. I look forward to your success.
MsgWelcome: May Etain guide your path.
MsgIncomplete: May Etain guide your path.
MsgResponse4: May Etain guide your path.

MsgSummary: You have to go to the royal castle and have an audience before {c2}His Majesty, the King{/c}.
MsgComplete: Come before me, Priest of unshakeable faith, and let the heralds sound the trump for you. Your deeds have set an example not only to those of the Deities Religion, but to all people in these lands. I want you to receive something I've personally had prepared for you. These arms mark those acolytes of the Deities Religion whose valorous deeds have earned the blessing of both their king and their Goddess. May it forever be a mark of the depth of your belief!
MsgTake: Honor be upon your house - His Majesty the King is waiting to have an audience with you. Go to the royal castle and have an audience with the king. His Majesty will compliment you on your accomplishments and reward you in person.
MsgWelcome: I pray that Etain's blessings alight on you as you walk the path of the devout.
MsgIncomplete: I pray that Etain's blessings alight on you as you walk the path of the devout.
MsgResponse4: I pray that Etain's blessings alight on you as you walk the path of the devout.

QuestName: A Messenger of the Windwalker Guild <Epic>
MsgSummary: Wait a while, then talk to {c2}Ignifer Greenwood{/c} again.
MsgWelcome: I wish wind spells would make me less wind-ed!
MsgIncomplete: I wish wind spells would make me less wind-ed!
MsgResponse4: I wish wind spells would make me less wind-ed!

MsgSummary: You have to destroy the WarEdge Clan near the Arvea Feller's Town located in the east of Adellia. You have to get rid of {c1}15 WarEdge Orc Legionary Soldiers and 7 WarEdge Orc Squad Leaders{/c} and report back to {c2}Ignifer Greenwood{/c}.
MsgComplete: Hey-hey! Come on over. Here's a letter I'm supposed to give you when you returned, which it seems like you have. And here's a little something on the side, for you to outfit yourself for battle.
MsgTake:
Greetings, fellow mage. I'm Kilian Fireone, a magician belonging to MystrasEyes, as well as the Archmage of the Windwalker Magician's Guild. On behalf of the Alliance of Light, let me thank you for your brave actions in Silvaren.

However, currently, the spear-rattling of the Orcs is becoming harder and harder to ignore. The Orcs gathing military strength is a very serious problem in the midst of this war against the Union of Fury. 
We Elves have no wish to experience the same bloodshed that we did during the past war against the Orcs, nor do we have the manpower in reserve to fight a war on another front in the midst of this great campaign against the Union of Fury.

But anyway, let me get back to the subject at hand. There is a powerful group of orcs called the WarEdge Clan that roams in both the west and east of the Adellia district.
The messenger sent from Maitreyan hasn't reached them yet; at this point, we're lucky they've yet to form an alliance with the Orcs in Maitreyan. Before they respond to Maitreyan's offer of alliance, we have to cause them damage so massive that they are incapable of cementing an alliance. First, I'd like you to destroy the WarEdge clan near the Arvea Feller's Town in the east of the district. More specifically, you have to get rid of 15 WarEdge Orc Legionary Soldiers and 7 WarEdge Orc Squad Leaders, then deliver a report to Ignifer.

P.S. - I've enchanted this letter to self-destruct after you read it, for security. So make sure you remember everything I wrote; there may be a quiz on it later.

MsgSummary: You have to go to the WarEdge Clan Town located to the west of Huigronn Stronghold and get rid of {c1}15 WarEdge Orc Warriors and Kiba-Tul, a chief of the WarEdge clan{/c}, then return to {c2}Ignifer Greenwood{/c}.
MsgComplete: Hey, good job there!
MsgTake:
Marvelous! If you're reading this letter, it means you've completed the first mission. Looks like you've definitely got some abilities above the ordinary. But keep in mind that this is just the beginning.

Now, you need to stop the WarEdge clan in the west of Adellia from joining the Maitreyan force. It seems that the WarEdge Clan Orcs in the west are stronger than Orcs in the east, so I recommend that you join others who seek to accomplish the same ends. The Humans who have allied with us are also doing what they can to stop the WarEdge Orcs from joining with Maitreyan. I'm sure there are others out there who are also working toward this goal, so keep that in mind.

Now, go to the WarEdge Clan village located to the west of Huigronn Stronghold. You have to get rid of 15 Orc Warriors and the clan's chief, Kiba-Tul, then report to Ignifer.

P.S. - I've enchanted this letter to self-destruct after you read it, for security. So make sure you remember everything I wrote; there may be a quiz on it later.

QuestName: Journey to the Windwalker Magician's Guild <Epic>
MsgSummary: You have to go to the Windwalker Magician's Guild in Apulune and meet {c2}Kilian Fireone{/c}. Go to Apulune, and use a portal for a shorter trip.
MsgComplete: Welcome, fellow mage. I'm glad to get the chance to finally meet you. But first, let me reimburse you for your traveling costs.
MsgTake:
Okay, the initial stages have been completed - now you have to go to the Windwalker Magician's Guild in Apulune yourself and seek out Kilian Fireone. Don't worry about using a portal to make the trip quick - the Guild will reimburse you for anything you spend to reach Apulune.

Now it's time for us to part ways, friend. Vanya sulie.
MsgWelcome: Sir Kilian will be waiting for your arrival.
MsgIncomplete: Sir Kilian will be waiting for your arrival.
MsgResponse4: Oh? Is there something you want?

MsgSummary:
You have to go to Aelbeageu by using a portal to Keolloseu in Apulune .
Once you've arrived, you have to meet {c2}Mulus Toreo{/c} in Aelbeageu and give the {c3}Letter to Mulus{/c} to him.
MsgComplete: Come on in, I've been waiting for you.
MsgTake:
I really appreciate all you've done for the Alliance of Light, and I give my utmost gratitude for your help. However, there's one more thing I must ask of you.

The help you have given to Alliance of Light is really great.
I express myinfinite gratitude for your help. However, there is one more thing I'm going to ask to you.

{c5}(Kilian looks toward you with light in his eyes){/c}

You know by now that Ankylul WildDark, the King of Orcs who dealt the Elves a crippling blow so long ago, is being revived deep within the halls of Maitreyan. But luckily for us, Ankylul has not yet regained all his power.

In order to get rid of him, there are other problems we need to address first. First, I'd like you to meet with Mulus Toreo in Aelbeageu and deliver this letter to him. Use the portal to Keolloseu here in Apulune to cut most of the distance off your journey. Of course, we'll reimburse you for traveling expenses; Mulus will take care of it when you reach him with the letter.
MsgWelcome: Hurry up. Time will not wait for us.
MsgIncomplete: Hurry up. Time will not wait for us.
MsgResponse4: Oh my, I must've dozed off. I'm a Mulus, follower of Etain. What news have you brought?

MsgSummary: You have to return to {c2}Mulus Toreo{/c} with {c3}99 Rilans{/c}, which you can buy from shops or obtain from low-class monsters in this district, {c3}30 Spirit Cores, and 20 Adamars Stones{/c}, which can be obtained from monsters.
MsgComplete: Well done. Just wait a moment now.
MsgTake:
{c5}(Mulus puts down the letter from Sherlock he was reading and gives you a serious look){/c}

As you may have surmised, normal methods won't be effective for getting rid of Ankylul WildDark, the King of the Orcs. Ankylul is a descendant of Oak, one of the Telaiosis who existed before even we Elves came into being long ago. The result of our ancestors' sin are the cursed and depraved beings we know today as Orcs. This is why their ruler, Ankylul, has a small portion of the power of the Telaiosis, and why they bear us such enmity. 

We sustained great losses in the past trying to take down Ankylul. At this time, Ankylul hasn't recovered his full power, nor has he roused the Orc clans scattered throughout this land and bound them into a great army. If we don't get rid of him now, it will only become more and more unlikely we'll have a clear shot. I can give you the chance, by make a powerful magical nostrum that will allow you to stand against Ankylul. I'll need you to bring me the materials, though, and I'm telling you beforehand, it's quite a bit.

First, bring me 99 Rilans, 30 Spirit Cores, and 20 Adamars Stones. You can buy these materials from shops, or you can obtain them from many monsters out there as well. If you have friends traveling the land, it can't hurt to ask them to be on the lookout for these materials too.
MsgWelcome: You have to hurry before Ankylul regains his full power.
MsgIncomplete: You have to hurry before Ankylul regains his full power.
MsgResponse4: You have to hurry before Ankylul regains his full power.

MsgSummary: You have to return to {c2}Kilian Fireone{/c} in Apulune with a {c3}Termination Report{/c}.
MsgComplete: Ah, you've finally arrived! I've been waiting for you.
MsgTake: This is a valuable magical nostrum, called an 'Arkein Potion.' It ought to prove very useful when you face off against Ankylul. Now, I need you to deliver this report to Kilian Fireone. If you do, he'll let you know the best strategy to employ when you confront Ankylul. Well, off with you now; we've no time to waste.
MsgWelcome: I hope we can meet again someday.
MsgIncomplete: I hope we can meet again someday.
MsgResponse4: Oh? Is there something you want?

MsgSummary: You have to go to {c2}Alius Magicartisan{/c}, who is currently staying in Silvaren, and deliver to him a {c3}Letter to the Artisan{/c}.
MsgComplete: Hmmm...as you can see, I'm a bit irritated at the moment.
MsgTake:
While you were with Mulus, we received a complete report from Iudex via the Elven Embassy. It said that Alius, famous across the continent as a great artisan, was asked to craft a number of formidable arms which might be able to strike down Ankylul.

There might be one that fits you among those weapons. Go to Allius in Silvaren with this letter. And be sure to make haste - Alius is notorious for his fussy personality, so much that he frustrates even the most patient of the Elven sages.
MsgWelcome: Time will not wait for us.
MsgIncomplete: Time will not wait for us.
MsgResponse4: When I work, my heart must move first - only then can my hands accomplish great things.

MsgSummary:
You should get {c3}20 Magic Leathers, 20 Adamars Stones{/c}, and {c3}90 Gold Apples{/c} and return to {c2}Alius Magicartisan{/c}.
You can buy some of these materials from shops, or you can obtain them from various monsters as well.
MsgComplete: Ah~ Now that all the materials are in place, allow me to get to work. Just wait a moment...
MsgTake:
The old men in Iudex said Ankylul WildDark is an Orc who possesses the formidable power of fire, so I was asked to make arms imbued with the power of water. However, I don't have any material left because those noisy old men haven't given me any material at all - they just kept asking me to make them, as though I'm some magic factory! What can I do? I can't obtain these items in person, I need a person who'll go get them while I work.

I'll let you know the materials so you can go out and gather them yourself. What you should get is: 20 Magical Leathers, 20 Adamars Ores, and 90 Gold Apples.
I figure you can get Gold Apples easily enough, but...as for the other two, I know you can get Magic Leathers and Adamars Ores from D-Water Borderland. I haven't tried myself, though, so it wouldn't hurt to ask other people. You may even learn of other ways these items can be obtained. Take care, then!
MsgWelcome: The more quickly you act, the better it'll be for both of us.
MsgIncomplete: The more quickly you act, the better it'll be for both of us.
MsgResponse4: The more quickly you act, the better it'll be for both of us.

QuestName: Return to the Windwalker Magicians' Guild <Epic>
MsgSummary: Return to {c2}Kilian Fireone{/c} in the Windwalker Magicians' Guild in Apulune.
MsgComplete: It looks like all the pieces are in place...
MsgTake:
Well, it looks like I've finished crafting them all. No fancy names - I simply call it an Elven Aqua Staff, made in the style of the Elves and imbued with the power of water. I hope it will prove an effective bane to Ankylul. Now you can return to Kilian. Be sure to tell him I said hello.

I wonder if I'll be able to see you again. Perhaps I'll be able to hear you on the wind...
MsgWelcome: May Etain's blessing be with you.
MsgIncomplete: May Etain's blessing be with you.
MsgResponse4: Oh? Is there something you want?

MsgSummary: Go to the darkened halls of Maitreyan and destroy its foul ruler, {c1}Ankylul_WildDark{/c}, and his servant, {c1}Azman Elfvein{/c}, then return to {c2}Kilian Fireone{/c}. Chances are you may not be able to accomplish these objectives alone. Bring friend and allies for a better chance of success.
MsgComplete: Finally, we have swept away the last remnants of this dark chapter in Elven history. I thank you for your many brave deeds. From this day forward, let it be known that you are officially a mage of MystrasEyes.
MsgTake:
Now all the preparations are complete. If we delay any longer, Ankylul will fully recover his terrible power.

It's time for you to leave for Maitreyan to fell its dark King, Ankylul WildDark, and his servant, Lamultan Bloodstorm. As I've said before, they are formidable foes who will test the very mettle of your being. I advise against going alone - gather friends and allies who will stand with you against the darkness. Surely there are others in the world who wish to see Ankylul WildDark cast back into the depths. I look forward to news of your success.
MsgWelcome: May Etain's blessing be with you.
MsgIncomplete: May Etain's blessing be with you.
MsgResponse4: May Etain's blessing be with you.

MsgSummary: Wait a while, then talk to {c2}Lageos Greenroad{/c} again.

You have to destroy the WarEdge Clan near the Arvea Feller's Town located in the east of Adellia. You have to get rid of {c1}15 WarEdge Orc Legionary Soldiers and 7 WarEdge Orc Squad Leaders{/c} and report back to {c2}Lageos Greenroad{/c}.
MsgComplete: Hey there! I've got another letter here for you - one I was instructed to give you upon your return, along with this money, to outfit yourself as you see fit.
MsgTake:
Greetings to you, fellow forest-walker.

I'm Picea Leafwind, a ranger of LoadForest. On behalf of all the members of the Alliance of Light, let me thank you for your heroic actions and quick thinking in Silvaren.

However, currently the military maneuvering of the Orcs is becoming harder and harder to ignore. We can't afford to waste any time. We Elves have no desire for a repeat of the same situation we faced in our past war against the Orcs. To add to that, we don't have the manpower to fight a war on two fronts - the majority of our forces are focused on battling the Union of Fury.

The messenger sent from Maitreyan hasn't reached them yet; at this point, we're lucky they haven't yet formed an alliance with the Orcs in Maitreyan. Before they respond to Maitreyan's offer of alliance, we have to cause them damage so massive that they are incapable of cementing an alliance. First, I'd like you to destroy the WarEdge clan near the Arvea Feller's Town in the east of the district. More specifically, you have to get rid of 15 WarEdge Orc Legionary Soldiers and 7 WarEdge Orc Squad Leaders, then deliver a report to Lageos.

P.S. - This letter has been enchanted to self-destruct after you read it. We can't let the enemies know that we know what they know!

MsgSummary: You have to go to the WarEdge Clan Town located to the west of Huigronn Stronghold and get rid of {c1}15 WarEdge Orc Warriors and Kiba-Tul, a chief of the WarEdge clan{/c}, then return to {c2}Lageos Greenroad{/c}.
MsgComplete: Admirable work! I'm pleasantly surprised.
MsgTake:
Congratulations! If you're reading this letter, it means you've completed the first mission. You've really got some talent, I must admit. However, remember that this is just the beginning.

Now, you need to stop the WarEdge clan in the west of Adellia from joining the Maitreyan force. My information network has revealed that the WarEdge Clan Orcs in the west are stronger than Orcs in the east. I recommend that you yoke your strength with others who also seek the destruction of the Orcs. The Humans in league with us are also doing what they can to stop the WarEdge Orcs from joining with Maitreyan. I'm sure there are others out there who are also working toward this goal, so keep that in mind.

Now, go to the WarEdge Clan village located to the west of Huigronn Stronghold. You have to get rid of 15 Orc Warriors and the clan's chief, Kiba-Tul, then report back to Lageos Greenroad.

P.S. - This letter has been enchanted to self-destruct after you read it. We can't let the enemies know that we know what they know!

MsgSummary:
You have to meet {c2}Picea Leafwind{/c} in the Elven Embassy of Apulune.
Go to Apulune via the nearest portal.
MsgComplete: Welcome. I'm glad to have the chance to meet you face to face. It must've cost a bit to get here on short notice; let me reimburse you for your trouble.
MsgTake:
I think we've now reached the point where you'll have to pay a visit to the Elven Embassy in Apulune personally. Picea is probably waiting to meet you, so don't make her wait too long - take a portal, and don't worry about the portal costs; the embassy will cover that for you once you reach Picea with this message.

Anyway, I suppose it's time for the two of us to say goodbye. Vanya sulie~
MsgWelcome: Picea will be waiting for you.
MsgIncomplete: Picea will be waiting for you.
MsgResponse4: Nature was created by Etain for all to enjoy.

MsgSummary:
You have to go to Aelbeageu by using a portal to Keolloseu in Apulune .
Once you've arrived, you have to meet {c2}Mulus Toreo{/c} in Aelbeageu and give the {c3}Letter to Mulus{/c} to him.
MsgComplete: Come on in, I've been waiting for you.
MsgTake:
I truly appreciate all the help you've given to the Alliance of Light. Let me express my gratitude for all your help. However, there's one thing I do want to ask you.

{c5}(Picea looks at you with trusting eyes){/c}

Ankylul WildDark, the King of Orcs, who fought us to the brink of ruin in an earlier age, is a powerful warrior-mage who bears deep enmity against the Elves. We've suffered a great many losses at the hands of Ankylul and his Orcish forces, but thankfully, he hasn't yet regained his full power. 

In order to defeat him, there are things we must arrange in advance to give us the best possible margin for success. First, seek out Mulus Toreo in Aelbeageu and hear what wisdom he has to impart. Take this letter and go to Aelbeageu. Use the portal in Apulune to go to Keolloseu to cut most of the distance off the trip. Of course, we'll provide the traveling expenses.
MsgWelcome: Hurry up. Time will not wait for us.
MsgIncomplete: Hurry up. Time will not wait for us.
MsgResponse4: Oh my, I must've dozed off. I'm a Mulus, follower of Etain. What news have you brought?

MsgSummary: You have to return to {c2}Mulus Toreo{/c} with {c3}99 Rilans{/c}, which you can buy from shops or obtain from low-class monsters in this district, {c3}30 Spirit Cores, and 20 Adamars Stones{/c}, which can be obtained from monsters.
MsgComplete: Well done. Just wait a moment now.
MsgTake:
{c5}(Mulus puts down the letter from Picea he was reading and gives you a serious look){/c}

As you may have surmised, normal methods won't be effective for getting rid of Ankylul WildDark, the King of the Orcs. Ankylul is a descendant of Oak, one of the Telaiosis who existed before even we Elves came into being long ago. The result of our ancestors' sin are the cursed and depraved beings we know today as Orcs. This is why their ruler, Ankylul, has a small portion of the power of the Telaiosis, and why they bear us such enmity. 

We sustained great losses in the past trying to take down Ankylul. At this time, Ankylul hasn't recovered his full power, nor has he roused the Orc clans scattered throughout this land and bound them into a great army. MsgIncomplete: You have to hurry before Ankylul regains his full power.
MsgResponse4: You have to hurry before Ankylul regains his full power.

MsgSummary: You have to return to the Elven Embassy in Apulune and hand the {c3}Termination Report{/c} to {c2}Picea Leafwind{/c}.
MsgComplete: Ah, you've finally arrived! I've been waiting for you.
MsgTake: This is a valuable magical nostrum, called an 'Arkein Potion.' It ought to prove very useful when you face off against Ankylul. Now, I need you to deliver this report to Picea. If you do, she'll let you know the best strategy to employ when you confront Ankylul. Well, off with you now; we've no time to waste.
MsgWelcome: I hope we can meet again someday.
MsgIncomplete: I hope we can meet again someday.
MsgResponse4: Nature was created by Etain for all to enjoy.

MsgComplete: Hmmm...as you can see, I'm a bit irritated at the moment.
MsgTake:
While you were with Mulus, we received a complete report from Iudex via the Elven Embassy. It said that Alius, famous across the continent as a great artisan, was asked to craft a number of formidable arms which might be able to strike down Ankylul.

MsgResponse4: When I work, my heart must move first - only then can my hands accomplish great things.

MsgTake:
The old men in Iudex said Ankylul WildDark is an Orc who possesses the formidable power of fire, so I was asked to make arms imbued with the power of water.
