MsgWelcome: The more quickly you act, the better it'll be for both of us.
MsgIncomplete: The more quickly you act, the better it'll be for both of us.
MsgResponse4: The more quickly you act, the better it'll be for both of us.

MsgSummary: Return to {c2}Picea Leafwind{/c} in the Elven Embassy in Apulune.
MsgComplete: It looks like all the pieces are in place...
MsgTake:
Well, it looks like I've finished crafting them all. No fancy names - I simply call it an Elven Aqua Reverse-Sword, made in the style of the Elves and imbued with the power of water. I hope it will prove an effective bane to Ankylul. Now you can return to Picea. Be sure to pass my greetings along to her.

I wonder if I'll be able to see you again. Perhaps I'll be able to hear you on the wind...
MsgWelcome: May Etain's blessing be with you.
MsgIncomplete: May Etain's blessing be with you.
MsgResponse4: Nature was created by Etain for all to enjoy.

MsgSummary: Go to the darkened halls of Maitreyan and destroy its foul ruler, {c1}Ankylul_WildDark{/c}, and his servant, {c1}Azman Elfvein{/c}, then return to {c2}Picea Leafwind{/c}. Chances are you may not be able to accomplish these objectives alone. Bring friend and allies for a better chance of success.
MsgComplete: From this point, the remnants of our difficult struggle against the Orcs have finally been swept away. Allow me to pay my respect to your strength of character. Henceforth, let it be known that you're a Ranger who belongs to the glorious LordForest.
MsgTake:
Now all the preparations are complete. If we delay any longer, Ankylul will fully recover his terrible power.

It's time for you to leave for Maitreyan. Go and fell the ruler of Maitreyan, Ankylul WildDark, and his servant, Azman Elfvein, then return here. As I've said before, they are very formidable beings. I beseech you, don't go alone - gather friends and allies who will stand with you against the darkness. Surely there are others in the world who wish to see Ankylul WildDark cast back into the depths. I look forward to news of your success.
MsgWelcome: May Etain's blessing will be with you.
MsgIncomplete: May Etain's blessing will be with you.
MsgResponse4: May Etain's blessing will be with you.

MsgSummary: Wait a while, then talk to {c2}Floralis Starshine{/c} again.
MsgTake:
Tampa~ Amin Merna Quen... *pants*

Sorry for my halting speech. *gasp* In order to find you, I ran all the way here, so it's kind of difficult to make sense at the moment.

Can you give me some time to catch my breath?

{c5}(Floralis explains the necessity of taking a breather){/c}

MsgSummary: You have to destroy the WarEdge Clan near the Arvea Feller's Town located in the east of Adellia. You have to get rid of {c1}15 WarEdge Orc Legionary Soldiers and 7 WarEdge Orc Squad Leaders{/c} and report back to {c2}Floralis Starshine{/c}.
MsgComplete: I'm glad to see you've returned safely. Here's another letter, one I was instructed to give you upon your return, as well as a small stipend to be used to outfit yourself as you see fit.
MsgTake:
Elen sila lumenn omentilvo.

I'm Rakusian, an Archer of Pantera's Ark, currently serving as an ambassador at the embassy in Apulune. On behalf of all the Alliance of Light, let me thank you for your bravery and heroism you displayed in Silvaren.

However, currently the military maneuvering of the Orcs is becoming harder and harder to ignore. We can't afford to waste any time. We Elves have no desire for a repeat of the same situation we faced in our past war against the Orcs. To add to that, we don't have the manpower to fight a war on two fronts - the majority of our forces are focused on battling the Union of Fury.

The messenger sent from Maitreyan hasn't reached them yet; at this point, we're lucky they haven't yet formed an alliance with the Orcs in Maitreyan. Before they respond to Maitreyan's offer of alliance, we have to cause them damage so massive that they are incapable of cementing an alliance. First, I'd like you to destroy the WarEdge clan near the Arvea Feller's Town in the east of the district. More specifically, you have to get rid of 15 WarEdge Orc Legionary Soldiers and 7 WarEdge Orc Squad Leaders, then deliver a report to Floralis.

P.S. - This letter has been enchanted to self-destruct after reading. Please take care not to lose any fingers when it does.

MsgSummary: You have to go to the WarEdge Clan Town located to the west of Huigronn Stronghold and get rid of {c1}15 WarEdge Orc Warriors and Kiba-Tul, a chief of the WarEdge clan{/c}, then return to {c2}Floralis Starshine{/c}.
MsgComplete: Ah, that's some straight shootin'!
MsgTake:
Congratulations! If you're reading this letter, it means you've completed the first mission. I'll admit, you do show a lot of promise. However, remember that this is just the beginning.

Now, you need to stop the WarEdge clan in the west of Adellia from joining the Maitreyan force. I was told the WarEdge Clan Orcs in the west are stronger than Orcs in the east. I recommend that you join others who seek to accomplish the same ends. The Humans who are allied with us are also doing what they can to stop the WarEdge Orcs from joining with Maitreyan. I'm sure there are others out there who are also working toward this goal, so keep that in mind.

Now, go to theWarEdge Clan village located to the west of Huigronn Stronghold. You have to get rid of 15 Orc Warriors and the clan's chief, Kiba-Tul, then report to Lageos.

P.S. - This letter has been enchanted to self-destruct after reading. Please take care not to lose any fingers when it does.

MsgSummary:
You have to meet {c2}Rakusian Justice{/c} in the Elven Embassy of Apulune.
Go to Apulune, and use a portal for a shorter trip.
MsgComplete:
Welcome. I'm glad to finally have the chance to see you with my own eyes.
First things first, let me reimburse you for the costs you've incured in traveling here.
MsgTake:
Now, you need to go to the Elven Embassy in Apulune in person, to meet with Rakusian. Go to the nearest place you can find a portal and use that - don't worry, when you find Rakusian and give him this message, he'll reimburse you for your portal fee from the embassy's coffers.

Now, it is time for me to be on my way; take care in your journeys. Vanya sulie~
MsgWelcome: Sir Rakusian will be waiting for you, so go there without delay.
MsgIncomplete: Sir Rakusian will be waiting for you, so go there without delay.
MsgResponse4: Is there anything I can advise you on?

QuestName: Seek Out the Wisdom of the Sage <Epic>
MsgSummary:
You have to go to Aelbeageu by using a portal to Keolloseu in Apulune .
Once you've arrived, you have to meet {c2}Mulus Toreo{/c} in Aelbeageu and give the {c3}Letter to Mulus{/c} to him.
MsgComplete: Come on in, I've been waiting for you.
MsgTake:
I want to express my gratitude for all the help you've given to the Alliance of Light. However, there's one more task that I want to ask of you.

{c5}(Rakusian looks at you with a penetrating gaze){/c}

Ankylul WildDark, the King of Orcs, who fought us to the brink of ruin in an earlier age, is a powerful warrior-mage who bears deep enmity against the Elves. We've suffered a great many losses at the hands of Ankylul and his Orcish forces, but thankfully, he hasn't yet regained his full power. 

In order to defeat him, there are things we must arrange in advance to give us the best possible margin for success. First, seek out Mulus Toreo in Aelbeageu and hear what wisdom he has to impart. Take this letter and go to Aelbeageu. Use the portal in Apulune to go to Keolloseu to cut most of the distance off the trip. Of course, we'll provide the traveling expenses.
MsgWelcome: Time will not wait for us.
MsgIncomplete: Time will not wait for us.
MsgResponse4: Oh my, I must've dozed off. I'm a Mulus, follower of Etain. What news have you brought?

MsgSummary: You have to return to {c2}Mulus Toreo{/c} with {c3}99 Rilans{/c}, which you can buy from shops or obtain from low-class monsters in this district, {c3}30 Spirit Cores, and 20 Adamars Stones{/c}, which can be obtained from monsters.
MsgComplete: Well done. Just wait a moment now.
MsgTake:
{c5}(Mulus puts down the letter from Rakusian he was reading and gives you a serious look){/c}

As you may have surmised, normal methods won't be effective for getting rid of Ankylul WildDark, the King of the Orcs. Ankylul is a descendant of Oak, one of the Telaiosis who existed before even we Elves came into being long ago. The result of our ancestors' sin are the cursed and depraved beings we know today as Orcs. This is why their ruler, Ankylul, has a small portion of the power of the Telaiosis, and why they bear us such enmity. 

We sustained great losses in the past trying to take down Ankylul. At this time, Ankylul hasn't recovered his full power, nor has he roused the Orc clans scattered throughout this land and bound them into a great army. If we don't get rid of him now, it will only become more and more unlikely we'll have a clear shot. I can give you the chance, by make a powerful magical nostrum that will allow you to stand against Ankylul. I'll need you to bring me the materials, though, and I'm telling you beforehand, it's quite a bit.

First, bring me 99 Rilans, 30 Spirit Cores, and 20 Adamars Stones. You can buy these materials from shops, or you can obtain them from many monsters out there as well. If you have friends traveling the land, it can't hurt to ask them to be on the lookout for these materials too.
MsgWelcome: You have to hurry before Ankylul regains his full power.
MsgIncomplete: You have to hurry before Ankylul regains his full power.
MsgResponse4: You have to hurry before Ankylul regains his full power.

MsgSummary: You have to return to {c2}Rakusian Justice{/c} in the Elven Embassy in Apulune with a {c3}Termination Report{/c}.
MsgComplete: Ah, you've finally arrived! I've been waiting for you.
MsgTake: This is a valuable magical nostrum, called an 'Arkein Potion.' It ought to prove very useful when you face off against Ankylul. Now, I need you to deliver this report to Rakusian. If you do, he'll let you know the best strategy to employ when you confront Ankylul. Well, off with you now; we've no time to waste.
MsgWelcome: I hope we can meet again someday.
MsgIncomplete: I hope we can meet again someday.
MsgResponse4: Is there anything I can advise you on?

MsgSummary: You have to go to {c2}Alius Magicartisan{/c}, who is currently staying in Silvaren, and deliver to him a {c3}Letter to the Artisan{/c}.
MsgComplete: Hmmm...as you can see, I'm a bit irritated at the moment.
MsgTake:
While you were with Mulus, we received a complete report from Iudex via the Embassy. It said that Alius, famous across the continent as a great artisan, was asked to craft a number of formidable arms which might be able to strike down Ankylul.

There might be one that fits you among those weapons. Go to Allius in Silvaren with this letter. And be sure to make haste - Alius is notorious for his fussy personality, so much that he frustrates even the most patient of the Elven sages.
MsgWelcome: Time will not wait for us.
MsgIncomplete: Time will not wait for us.
MsgResponse4: When I work, my heart must move first - only then can my hands accomplish great things.

MsgSummary:
You should get {c3}20 Magic Leathers, 20 Adamars Stones{/c}, and {c3}90 Gold Apples{/c} and return to {c2}Alius Magicartisan{/c}.
You can buy some of these materials from shops, or you can obtain them from various monsters as well.
MsgComplete: Ah~ Now that all the materials are in place, allow me to get to work. Just wait a moment...
MsgTake:
The old men in Iudex said Ankylul WildDark is an Orc who possesses the formidable power of fire, so I was asked to make arms imbued with the power of water. However, I don't have any material left because those noisy old men haven't given me any material at all - they just kept asking me to make them, as though I'm some magic factory! What can I do? I can't obtain these items in person, I need a person who'll go get them while I work.

I'll let you know the materials so you can go out and gather them yourself. What you should get is: 20 Magical Leathers, 20 Adamars Ores, and 90 Gold Apples.
I figure you can get Gold Apples easily enough, but...as for the other two, I know you can get Magic Leathers and Adamars Ores from D-Water Borderland. I haven't tried myself, though, so it wouldn't hurt to ask other people. You may even learn of other ways these items can be obtained. Take care, then!
MsgWelcome: The more quickly you act, the better it'll be for both of us.
MsgIncomplete: The more quickly you act, the better it'll be for both of us.
MsgResponse4: The more quickly you act, the better it'll be for both of us.

MsgSummary: Return to Apulune and meet with {c2}Rakusian Justice{/c}, in the Elven Embassy.
MsgComplete: It looks like all the pieces are in place...
MsgTake:
Well, it looks like I've finished crafting them all. No fancy names - I simply call it an Elven Aqua Bow, made in the style of the Elves and imbued with the power of water. I hope it will prove an effective bane to Ankylul. Now you can return to Rakusian; give him my regards and let him know I plan on paying him a visit soon.

I wonder if I'll be able to see you again. Perhaps I'll be able to hear you on the wind...
MsgWelcome: May Etain's blessing be with you.
MsgIncomplete: May Etain's blessing be with you.
MsgResponse4: Is there anything I can advise you on?

MsgSummary: Go to the darkened halls of Maitreyan and destroy its foul ruler, {c1}Ankylul_WildDark{/c}, and his servant, {c1}Azman Elfvein{/c}, then return to {c2}Sherlock Spencer{/c}. Chances are you may not be able to accomplish these objectives alone. Bring friend and allies for a better chance of success.
MsgComplete: From this point, the remnants of our difficult struggle against the Orcs have finally been swept away. Allow me to pay my respect to your strength of character. Henceforth, let it be known that you're an Archer who can claim membership in the famous Pantera's Ark organization.
MsgTake:
Now all the preparations are complete. If we delay any longer, Ankylul will fully recover his terrible power.

It's time for you to leave for Maitreyan. Go and fell the ruler of Maitreyan, Ankylul WildDark, and his servant, Azman Elfvein, then return to me. As I've said before, they are very formidable fiends. But don't think that being a hero means you should tackle this alone - gather friends and allies who will stand with you against the darkness. Surely there are others in the world who wish to see Ankylul WildDark cast back into the depths. I look forward to news of your success.
MsgWelcome: May Etain's blessing be with you.
MsgIncomplete: May Etain's blessing be with you.
MsgResponse4: May Etain's blessing be with you.

QuestName: A Messenger from the Csipolune Dragoons <Epic>
MsgSummary:
You have to get rid of {c1}12 Arena Stronghold Small Landers{/c} and {c1}8 Arena Stronghold Large Landers{/c}, then return to {c2}Tanparulhan{/c}.
You can find a group of Landers immediately after exiting the Arena Stronghold toward the southwest.
MsgComplete: Well done, my comrade! I can see the skill that flows through your veins. But remember, there is no harm in being cautious...
MsgTake:
Welcome, comrade. I'm Tanparulhan, a Dragoon of Csipolune. Did you know that word of your deeds has already spread far and wide throughout Csipolune? Indeed. However, in the mission you're going to be given, failure is totally unacceptable. That's why we need to put your skills to the test, just to be certain. Please, take no offense; this mission is a matter of utmost importance to the entire Union of Fury.

There are groups of Landers living near the Arena Stronghold. They might look ripe for an ass-whoopin' compared to the soldiers of the Alliance of Light, but they're tough enough to be a good test. If you get rid of 12 Arena Stronghold Small Landers and 8 Arena Stronghold Large Landers, you'll not only prove your ability, but also play an important part in reducing their threat in this area.
MsgWelcome: Do not delay, comrade.
MsgIncomplete: Do not delay, comrade.
MsgResponse4: Do not delay, comrade.

MsgSummary:
You have to get rid of {c1}14 Spinterr Elf Rangers and 6 Spinterr Elf Snipers{/c}, then return to {c1}Tanparulhan{/c}.
You can find the Spinterr Resistance forces if you follow the route northeast from the Arena Stronghold.
MsgComplete:
Hahaha~ You are more than worthy to be a Dragoon of Csipolune. The time of testing is over now.
These are the instructions that my superior, Perrvadoom PhantomBlood, told me to give to you. Read over them carefully. I hope we will someday meet again, comrade!
MsgTake:
Let me remind you once again this will be a very important mission, so don't take it personally if we want to assess your skill very carefully. If you handle this mission without trouble, you'll become a member of the glorious Csipolune Dragoons.

There is a resistance force of Elves not far away from here, toward the northeast. They're called the Spinterr Resistance. Among them, Spinterr Elf Rangers and Spinterr Elf Snipers have us locked down and torment us at close range near the Arena Stronghold. Go and finish some of them off, then return to me.

They're strong and very organized, it wouldn't be a bad idea to gather friends and allies to aid you in the battle. I'll be waiting here for you to deliver news of your triumph.
MsgWelcome: Hurry up. You don't have time to waste...
MsgIncomplete: Hurry up. You don't have time to waste...
MsgResponse4: Hurry up. You don't have time to waste...

MsgSummary: You have to get rid of {c1}Acre the Betrayer{/c}, who is hiding near the Genetick Lab in Adeurian, then return to {c2}Perrvadoom PhantomBlood{/c} in Iris with the {c3}Head of Acre{/c}.
MsgComplete: Come in, my comrade! You finished off the betrayer with a harsh elegance. Remember always the tragic end that awaits all who would betray our cause.
MsgTake:
I'm always pleased with the news you bring. It reminds me of the magnificent power we Nordein possess. Currently, the Union of Fury is beset by foes on all sides. The unrelenting Alliance of Light stands before us, and shadowy groups from other dimensions are constantly seeking a chance to attack us from behind.
We're fully aware of the influence of the Alliance of Light in our realm, but the orders I'll soon be giving you will pit you against an unknown being that even those pedantic Vail scholars can't uncover.

First, go to the Genetick Lab in Adeurian. I've obtained information tracing a betrayer of the Union named Acre to that area. You know what needs to be done - get rid of Acre, and bring his head back as evidence. I'll be in Iris, the Vail capital. After you return, I've got a detailed story to tell you.

P.S. - This letter has been enchanted to self-destruct after you read it. Caution: if it gets hot, just drop it.

MsgSummary: You have to find {c2}Arkus{/c} of Panakeia Lab, located in the Reikeuseu district, and give him a {c3}Letter from Perrvadoom{/c}.
MsgComplete: Ah, come on in.
MsgTake:
You're probably unaware of exactly what this betrayer did to deserve such a fate at your hands, so I wanted to let you know. Perhaps you already know of the Aidion Neckria, a place holy to the Vail?

Up until relatively recently, it was overrun by devils from another dimension - can you believe it? Apparently, they had been the denizens of that place for a long time. Originally, Acre was one of the high priests in charge of managing the Aidion Neckria. In fact, Acre was the very person who first discovered that the Aidion Neckria was occupied by devils from another dimension. However, Acre didn't report the devils he discovered to the Senator. Avarice had blinded his good sensibilities - he must've thought he could take advantage of these devils' power.

However, these devils from another dimension were not beings that would be so easily controlled. One of them took advantage of Acre until he regained the power he lost when he entered this dimension. Once this devil regained his power, he betrayed Acre, and instantly Aidion Neckria was turned into the scene of a massacre.

Acre became afraid that his transgression would be uncovered, and he escaped in the chaos, but as you can see, he paid the ultimate price in the end. However, we're now in a position where we have to work together with the Vail to deal with these devils. Take this letter to Panakeia Lab in Reikeuseu. If you give it to Arkus, he will help you prepare to do battle against this devil. Make haste now; we've no time to lose.
MsgWelcome: Arkus will be waiting for you, make your way to Panakeia Lab at once.
MsgIncomplete: Arkus will be waiting for you, make your way to Panakeia Lab at once.
MsgResponse4: Ah, this job has turned out to be a huge success. Have you come here to learn magic as well?

MsgSummary:
Please bring {c3}99 Rilans, 30 Spirit Cores, and 20 Adamars Stones{/c} to {c2}Arkus{/c}.
You can obtain these materials easily from shops or monsters, and you may also be able to find additional places to obtain them through information from other travelers.
MsgComplete: Well done. Now, please just wait for a bit.
MsgTake:
Hmmm...

{c5}(Arkus looks at you with stern eyes after reading the letter){/c}

So, Acre is dead? Life's wick has been cut short for a shameful betrayer of the family. I pay my respects to your bravery in the matter, but killing Acre is only a token triumph at best. The true foe we must eventually face is Astaroth, the king of the devils from another dimension. In addition, I've heard rumors that Mago, the Vampire Queen, is reviving as well. This is a cause for great concern. We don't have much time to waste - in order to face off against Astaroth, ordinary preparations won't suffice.

Due to the nature of our enemy, I'm trying to make a secret magical medicine we have long been researching. But in order to do so, I'll need you to bring me 99 Rilans, 30 Spirit Cores, and 20 Adamars Stones. There's no specific place to get them, but you can find them around without too much difficulty, either from shops or other travelers. In the meantime, I will ready a Sage's Stone for use in the process...
MsgWelcome: The power of Astaroth grows ever stronger. We must hurry...
MsgIncomplete: The power of Astaroth grows ever stronger. We must hurry...
MsgResponse4: Ah, this job has turned out to be a huge success. Have you come here to learn magic as well?

MsgSummary: You have to return to {c2}Perrvadoom{/c} in Iris.
MsgComplete: Hahaha~ Just as I expected, he knew full well what would be useful for you to have.
MsgTake:
Behold, the Arkein Potion, made from sage's stone, the pinnacle of Alchemy! To make it is no mean feat; it's not something one can simply buy from a street vendor. Its value is nigh unfathomable, but you will know its usefulness when you battle Astaroth.

Now you can return to Perrvadoom; he probably has something new to tell you by now. Anyway, give him my regards.
MsgWelcome: Go now; I'm sure Perrvadoom will be waiting for you.
MsgIncomplete: Go now; I'm sure Perrvadoom will be waiting for you.
MsgResponse4: To call upon the Csipolune Dragoons is to summon the winds of destruction!

MsgSummary:
Seek out {c2}Palbatus{/c}, a blacksmith famous among the Deatheaters.
{c2}Palbatus{/c}, who has retired, dwells somewhere in the Helm Marsh, in the Keuraijen district.
MsgComplete: What's this now? I'm not interested in working anymore.
MsgTake:
Perhaps you're acquainted with the stories of Palbatus, great among the smiths of the Nordein?

Palbatus has the ability to imbue the goods he makes with spiritual power. I've drafted a letter asking him to make something useful to use in the upcoming battle. Take it and find Palbatus, who has been living in seclusion near Helm Marsh in the Keuraijen district.

But you must be careful - Helm Marsh is a dangerous place. I've heard that a dragon built its nest near there, so be on your guard, and return unharmed.
MsgWelcome: There's no time for hesitation.
MsgIncomplete: There's no time for hesitation.
MsgResponse4: The sound of the hammer and the anvil no longer rings within my dwelling.

MsgSummary: You have to collect {c3}25 Magic Leathers, 90 Gold Apples, and 10 Gold Powders{/c} and give them to {c2}Palbatus{/c}. You can obtain these materials from shops or monsters, or from other travelers.
MsgComplete: Fine, let's begin! You're an amateur at this, so just sit back and watch.
MsgTake:
Hmm...you think there's still some use left in this body?

{c5}(Palbatus's eyes scan over the letter with a serious look){/c}

Heh...I guess these old bones can still glow with the embers of enthusiasm. So don't just stand there with a dumb look on your face; grab a piece of paper and jot down a list of matierials for me. I'll need 25 Magic Leathers, 90 Gold Apples, and 10 Gold Powders. If you bring those to me, I'll craft you a weapon imbued with a soul of fire.

Where do you get these materials? Well...isn't that something you should find out on your own? Go to a shop, or get them from monsters, or find out some information from other travelers - whatever methods you use are fine, as long as you get all the materials to me.
MsgWelcome: If you've got time to sit there and twiddle your thumbs, get your ass moving!
MsgIncomplete: If you've got time to sit there and twiddle your thumbs, get your ass moving!
MsgResponse4: If you've got time to sit there and twiddle your thumbs, get your ass moving!

MsgSummary: Return again to {c2}Perrvadoom{/c} in Iris.
MsgComplete: Oh? Looks like you've received a fine axe for your troubles. Good; you'll be putting it to use soon, because I'll be giving you the last mission now. If you complete this mission, you'll be an official member of the Csipolune Dragoons.
MsgTake: Ah...it's finally complete! I call this axe the Nordein Flame Mountain. Arm yourself with it, and show that devil a nightmare of flames! Hahahahaha!
MsgWelcome: Your business with me is complete, so return to Perrvadoom now.
MsgIncomplete: Your business with me is complete, so return to Perrvadoom now.
MsgResponse4: To call upon the Csipolune Dragoons is to summon the winds of destruction!

MsgSummary: You must defeat {c1}Astaroth{/c}, the King of Devils from another dimension, deep inside Aidion Neckria, then return to {c2}Perrvadoom PhantomBlood{/c}. {c1}Astaroth{/c} is a mighty fiend, far stronger than any one person, so it would be wise to recruit friends and allies to battle him together.
MsgComplete: Now you're a true hero in both word and deed. From this moment forth, you are reborn as a Dragoon of Csipolune! And this shall be a sign to prove that you are the hero who defeated Astaroth, the King of Devils. May Etain guide your path.
MsgTake:
We can delay no longer. Now, you must venture deep into Aidion Neckria to the grave of Mornie, the progenitor of the Vail race. Astaroth, the King of Devils from another dimension, is planning to make that the site of his complete birth into this world, and you must put a stop to it. I've also been told that the "closed space" the Vail are using to seal off Aidion Neckria has reached its limit, so you'd best hurry.

Astaroth may well have some unknown power never before seen in this world, so even with the best preparation, there's no guarantee you're life is safe against his dark power. Make sure to go with a team you trust. Since the Vail and the Nordein are getting along better these days, I suppose it shouldn't be too hard to find a group of allies. Go now, and fare thee well!
MsgWelcome: I pray that the thundering power of Tiamat will be with you.
MsgIncomplete: I pray that the thundering power of Tiamat will be with you.
MsgResponse4: I pray that the thundering power of Tiamat will be with you.

QuestName: A Messenger from the Csipolune Guard <Epic>
MsgSummary:
You have to get rid of {c1}12 Arena Stronghold Small Landers{/c} and {c1}8 Arena Stronghold Large Landers{/c}, then return to {c2}Distoltum{/c}.
You can find a group of Landers immediately after exiting the Arena Stronghold toward the southwest.
MsgComplete: Well done, my comrade! I can see the skill that flows through your veins. But remember, there is no harm in being cautious...
MsgTake:
Welcome, comrade. I'm Distoltum, a Guard of Csipolune. Did you know that word of your deeds has already spread far and wide throughout Csipolune? Indeed. MsgWelcome: Do not delay, my fellow soldier.
MsgIncomplete: Do not delay, my fellow soldier.
MsgResponse4: Do not delay, my fellow soldier.

MsgSummary:
You have to get rid of {c1}14 Spinterr Elf Rangers and 6 Spinterr Elf Snipers{/c}, then return to {c1}Distoltum{/c}.
You can find the Spinterr Resistance forces if you follow the route northeast from the Arena Stronghold.
MsgComplete:
Hahaha~ You are more than worthy to be a Guard of Csipolune. We've no more need to test you.

These are the instructions that my superior, Rakenin StromFire, told me to give to you. Read over them carefully. I hope we will someday meet again, comrade!
MsgTake:
Let me remind you once again this will be a very important mission, so don't take it personally if we want to assess your skill very carefully. If you handle this mission without trouble, you'll become a member of the glorious Csipolune Dragoons.

They're strong and very organized, it wouldn't be a bad idea to gather friends and allies to aid you in the battle. I'll be waiting here for you to deliver news of your triumph.
MsgWelcome: Hurry up. You don't have time to waste.
MsgIncomplete: Hurry up. You don't have time to waste.
MsgResponse4: Hurry up. You don't have time to waste.

MsgComplete: Come in, my comrade! You finished off the betrayer with a harsh elegance. Remember always the tragic end that awaits all who would betray our cause.

P.S. - This letter has been enchanted to self-destruct after reading. You know...military secrets and all.

MsgComplete: Ah, come on in.

If you give it to Arkus, he will help you prepare to do battle against this devil. Make haste now; we've no time to lose.
MsgWelcome: Arkus will be waiting for you, so make your way to Panakeia Lab at once.
MsgIncomplete: Arkus will be waiting for you, so make your way to Panakeia Lab at once.
MsgResponse4: Ah, this job has turned out to be a huge success. Have you come here to learn magic as well?

MsgSummary:
Please bring {c3}99 Rilans, 30 Spirit Cores, and 20 Adamars Stones{/c} to {c2}Arkus{/c}.
You can obtain these materials easily from shops or monsters, and you may also be able to find additional places to obtain them through information from other travelers.
MsgComplete: Well done. Now, please just wait for a bit.
MsgTake:
Hmmm...

{c5}(Arkus looks at you with stern eyes after reading the letter){/c}

So, Acre is dead? Life's wick has been cut short for a shameful betrayer of the family. I pay my respects to your bravery in the matter, but killing Acre is only a token triumph at best. The true foe we must eventually face is Astaroth, the king of the devils from another dimension. In addition, I've heard rumors that Mago, the Vampire Queen, is reviving as well. This is a cause for great concern. We don't have much time to waste - in order to face off against Astaroth, ordinary preparations won't suffice. 

Due to the nature of our enemy, I'm trying to make a secret magical medicine we have long been researching. But in order to do so, I'll need you to bring me 99 Rilans, 30 Spirit Cores, and 20 Adamars Stones. There's no specific place to get them, but you can find them around without too much difficulty, either from shops or other travelers. In the meantime, I will ready a Sage's Stone for use in the process...
MsgWelcome: The power of Astaroth grows ever stronger. We must hurry...
MsgIncomplete: The power of Astaroth grows ever stronger. We must hurry...
MsgResponse4: The power of Astaroth grows ever stronger. We must hurry...

MsgSummary: You have to return to {c2}Rakenin StromFire{/c} in Iris.
MsgComplete: Hahaha~ Just as I expected, he knew full well what would be useful for you to have.
MsgTake:
Behold, the Arkein Potion, made from sage's stone, the pinnacle of Alchemy! To make it is no mean feat; it's not something one can simply buy from a street vendor. Its value is nigh unfathomable, but you will know its usefulness when you battle Astaroth.

Now you can return to Rakenin; he probably has something new to tell you by now. Anyway, give him my regards.
MsgWelcome: Go now; I'm sure Rakenin will be waiting for you.
MsgIncomplete: Go now; I'm sure Rakenin will be waiting for you.
MsgResponse4: The Impregnable Shield none can penetrate; this is the Csipolune Guard!

MsgSummary:
Seek out {c2}Palbatus{/c}, a blacksmith famous among the Deatheaters.
{c2}Palbatus{/c}, who has retired, dwells somewhere in the Helm Marsh, in the Keuraijen district.
MsgComplete: What's this now? I'm not interested in working anymore.
MsgTake:
Perhaps you're acquainted with the stories of Palbatus, great among the smiths of the Nordein?

Palbatus has the ability to imbue the goods he makes with spiritual power. I've drafted a letter asking him to make something useful to use in the upcoming battle. Take it and find Palbatus, who has been living in seclusion near Helm Marsh in the Keuraijen district.

But you must be careful - Helm Marsh is a dangerous place. I've heard that a dragon built its nest near there, so be on your guard, and return unharmed.
MsgWelcome: There's no time for hesitation.
MsgIncomplete: There's no time for hesitation.
MsgResponse4: The sound of the hammer and the anvil no longer rings within my dwelling.

MsgSummary: You have to collect {c3}25 Magic Leathers, 90 Gold Apples, and 10 Gold Powders{/c} and give them to {c2}Palbatus{/c}. You can obtain these materials from shops or monsters, or from other travelers.
MsgComplete: Fine, let's begin! You're an amateur at this, so just sit back and watch.
MsgTake:
Hmm...you think there's still some use left in this body?

{c5}(Palbatus's eyes scan over the letter with a serious look){/c}

Heh...I guess these old bones can still glow with the embers of enthusiasm. So don't just stand there with a dumb look on your face; grab a piece of paper and jot down a list of matierials for me. I'll need 25 Magic Leathers, 90 Gold Apples, and 10 Gold Powders. If you bring those to me, I'll craft you a weapon imbued with a soul of fire.

Where do you get these materials? Well...isn't that something you should find out on your own? Go to a shop, or get them from monsters, or find out some information from other travelers - whatever methods you use are fine, as long as you get all the materials to me.
MsgWelcome: If you've got time to sit there and twiddle your thumbs, get your ass moving!
MsgIncomplete: If you've got time to sit there and twiddle your thumbs, get your ass moving!
MsgResponse4: If you've got time to sit there and twiddle your thumbs, get your ass moving!

MsgSummary: Return again to {c2}Rakenin StromFire{/c} in Iris.
MsgComplete: Oh? Looks like you've received a fine hammer for your troubles. Good; you'll be putting it to use soon, because I'll be giving you the last mission now. If you complete this mission, you'll be an official member of the Csipolune Guard.
MsgTake: Ah...it's finally complete! I call this axe the Nordein Egnisil. Arm yourself with it, and show that devil a nightmare of flames! Hahahahaha!
MsgWelcome: Your business with me is complete, so return to Rakenin now.
MsgIncomplete: Your business with me is complete, so return to Rakenin now.
MsgResponse4: The Impregnable Shield none can penetrate; this is the Csipolune Guard!

QuestName: The Devil King from Another Dimension <Epic>
MsgSummary: You must defeat {c1}Astaroth{/c}, the King of Devils from another dimension, deep inside Aidion Neckria, then return to {c2}Rakenin StromFire{/c}. {c1}Astaroth{/c} is a mighty fiend, far stronger than any one person, so it would be wise to recruit friends and allies to battle him together.
MsgComplete: Now you're a true hero in both word and deed. From this moment forth, you are reborn as a member of the elite Csipolune Guard! And this shall be a sign to prove that you are the hero who defeated Astaroth, the King of Devils. May Etain guide your path.
MsgTake:
We can delay no longer. Now, you must venture deep into Aidion Neckria to the grave of Mornie, the progenitor of the Vail race. Astaroth, the King of Devils from another dimension, is planning to make that the site of his complete birth into this world, and you must put a stop to it. I've also been told that the "closed space" the Vail are using to seal off Aidion Neckria has reached its limit, so you'd best hurry.

Astaroth may well have some unknown power never before seen in this world, so even with the best preparation, there's no guarantee you're life is safe against his dark power. Make sure to go with a team you trust. Since the Vail and the Nordein are getting along better these days, I suppose it shouldn't be too hard to find a group of allies. Go now, and fare thee well!
MsgWelcome: I pray that the thundering power of Tiamat will be with you.
MsgIncomplete: I pray that the thundering power of Tiamat will be with you.
MsgResponse4: I pray that the thundering power of Tiamat will be with you.

MsgSummary:
You have to get rid of {c1}12 Arena Stronghold Small Landers{/c} and {c1}8 Arena Stronghold Large Landers{/c}, then return to {c2}Amantul{/c}.
You can find a group of Landers immediately after exiting the Arena Stronghold toward the southwest.
MsgComplete: Well done. You were like a fierce animal, fangs bared at your enemies! I can feel the potential awakening within you. But remember, there is no harm in being cautious...
MsgTake:
Greetings, fellow walker of the wilds. I'm Amantul, a Hunter of Lauchtier. Did you know that word of your deeds has already spread far and wide throughout Csipolune? It's true. However, in the mission you're going to be given, failure is totally unacceptable. That's why we need to put your skills to the test, just to be certain. Please, take no offense; this mission is a matter of utmost importance to the entire Union of Fury.

There are groups of Landers living near the Arena Stronghold. They might look weak enough compared to the soldiers of the Alliance of Light, but they're tough enough to rough a steady soldier up, in a group. If you get rid of 12 Arena Stronghold Small Landers and 8 Arena Stronghold Large Landers, you'll not only prove your ability, but also reduce the danger they pose to citizens and soldiers in this area.
MsgWelcome: Now run, letting the fierceness flow through your veins!
MsgIncomplete: Now run, letting the fierceness flow through your veins!
MsgResponse4: Now run, letting the fierceness flow through your veins!

MsgSummary:
You have to get rid of {c1}14 Spinterr Elf Rangers and 6 Spinterr Elf Snipers{/c}, then return to {c1}Amantul{/c}.

You can find the Spinterr Resistance forces if you follow the route northeast from the Arena Stronghold.
MsgComplete:
Hahaha~ You are truly a fearsome beast, worthy to be counted among the members of Laughtier. Your testing is now finished.

These are the instructions that my superior, Shycalun Savagebest, told me to give to you. Read over them carefully. I hope we will someday meet again, on the battlefield!
MsgTake:
Fierce though you may be, let me remind you once again this will be a very important mission, so don't give us the evil eye just because we want to verify your skill. If you handle this mission without trouble, you'll become a member of the proud Hunters of Laughtier.

There is a resistance force of Elves not far away from here, toward the northeast. They're called the Spinterr Resistance. Among them, Spinterr Elf Rangers and Spinterr Elf Snipers have us locked down and torment us at close range near the Arena Stronghold. Go and finish some of them off, then return to me.

They're strong and very organized, so it wouldn't be a bad idea to gather friends and allies to aid you in the battle. I'll be waiting here for you to deliver news of your triumph.
MsgWelcome: Hurry up. Time is of the essence...
MsgIncomplete: Hurry up. Time is of the essence...
MsgResponse4: Hurry up. Time is of the essence...

MsgSummary: You have to get rid of {c1}Acre the Betrayer{/c}, who is hiding near the Genetick Lab in Adeurian, then return to {c2}Shycalun Savagebest{/c} in Iris with the {c3}Head of Acre{/c}.
MsgComplete: Well well, you truly unsheathed your claws and gave the betrayer a beautiful crimson death. Burn that image into your mind - the final end that all traitors will meet with.
MsgTake:
I'm always pleased with the news you bring. It keeps the magnificent power we Nordein possess in the forefront of my mind. Currently, the Union of Fury is beset by foes on all sides. The unrelenting Alliance of Light stands before us, and shadowy groups from other dimensions are constantly seeking a chance to attack us from behind.

We're fully aware of the influence of the Alliance of Light in our realm, but the orders I'll soon be giving you will pit you against an unknown being that even those pedantic Vail scholars can't uncover.

First, go to the Genetick Lab in Adeurian. I've obtained information tracing a betrayer of the Union named Acre to that area. You know what needs to be done - get rid of Acre, and bring his head back as evidence. I'll be in Iris, the Vail capital. After you return, I've got a detailed story to tell you.

P.S. - This letter has been enchanted to self-destruct after you read it. Do not ingest it.

MsgSummary: You have to find {c2}Arkus{/c} of Panakeia Lab, located in the Reikeuseu district, and give him a {c3}Letter from Shycalun{/c}.
MsgComplete: Ah, come on in.
MsgTake:
You're probably unaware of exactly what this betrayer did to deserve such a fate at your hands, so I wanted to let you know. Perhaps you already know of the Aidion Neckria, a place holy to the Vail?

Up until relatively recently, it was overrun by devils from another dimension - can you believe it? Apparently, they had been the denizens of that place for a long time. Originally, Acre was one of the high priests in charge of managing the Aidion Neckria. In fact, Acre was the very person who first discovered that the Aidion Neckria was occupied by devils from another dimension. However, Acre didn't report the devils he discovered to the Senator. Avarice had blinded his good sensibilities - he must've thought he could take advantage of these devils' power.

However, these devils from another dimension were not beings that would be so easily controlled. One of them took advantage of Acre until he regained the power he lost when he entered this dimension. Once this devil regained his power, he betrayed Acre, and instantly Aidion Neckria was turned into the scene of a massacre.

Acre became afraid that his transgression would be uncovered, and he escaped in the chaos, but as you can see, he paid the ultimate price in the end. However, we're now in a position where we have to work together with the Vail to deal with these devils. Take this letter to Panakeia Lab in Reikeuseu. If you give it to Arkus, he will help you prepare to do battle against this devil. Make haste now; we've no time to lose.
MsgWelcome: Arkus will be waiting for you, so make your way to Panakeia Lab at once.
MsgIncomplete: Arkus will be waiting for you, so make your way to Panakeia Lab at once.
MsgResponse4: Ah, this job has turned out to be a huge success. Have you come here to learn magic as well?

I'll need 25 Magic Leathers, 90 Gold Apples, and 10 Gold Powders. If you bring those to me, I'll craft you a weapon imbued with a soul of fire.

Where do you get these materials? Well...isn't that something you should find out on your own? Go to a shop, or get them from monsters, or find out some information from other travelers - whatever methods you use are fine, as long as you get all the materials to me.
MsgWelcome: If you've got time to sit there and twiddle your thumbs, get your ass moving!
MsgIncomplete: If you've got time to sit there and twiddle your thumbs, get your ass moving!
MsgResponse4: If you've got time to sit there and twiddle your thumbs, get your ass moving!

MsgSummary: Go back to {c2}Integra Bloodmoon{/c} in Iris.
MsgComplete: Oh? Looks like you've received a finely-crafted staff for your troubles. I can feel the arcane energies swirling around this staff - and you got it not a moment too soon, because I'll be giving you the last mission now. If you complete this mission, you'll be welcomed into the sagacious ranks of Darkness Heart.
MsgTake: Ah...it's finally complete! I shall call this staff the Nordein Karol. Arm yourself with it, and show that devil a nightmare of flames! Hahahahaha!
MsgWelcome: Your business with me is complete, so return to Integra now.
MsgIncomplete: Your business with me is complete, so return to Integra now.
MsgResponse4: May Mystra, Mother of Magic, protect you.

MsgSummary: You must defeat {c1}Astaroth{/c}, the King of Devils from another dimension, deep inside Aidion Neckria, then return to {c2}Integra Bloodmoon{/c}. {c1}Astaroth{/c} is a mighty fiend, far stronger than any one person, so it would be wise to recruit friends and allies to battle him together.
MsgComplete:
You're a real hero, brother.
From now on, you'll be reborn as a Pagan of Darkness Heart.
This will be a sign which will prove it. 
The hero who defeated Astaroth, the king of Devil of Another dimension~
May Etain protect you!

Now you're a true hero in both word and deed. From this moment forth, your baptism as a Pagan of Darkness Heart is complete, and this shall be a sign to prove that you are the hero who defeated Astaroth, the King of Devils. May Etain protect you from harm.
MsgTake:
We can delay no longer. Now, you must venture deep into Aidion Neckria to the grave of Mornie, the progenitor of the Vail race. Astaroth, the King of Devils from another dimension, is planning to make that the site of his complete birth into this world, and you must put a stop to it. I've also been told that the "closed space" the Vail are using to seal off Aidion Neckria has reached its limit. If we delay any longer, our inner territories will become a war zone.

Astaroth may well have some unknown power never before seen in this world, so even with the best preparation, there's no guarantee you're life is safe against his dark power. Make sure to go with a team you trust. Since the Vail and the Nordein are getting along better these days, I suppose it shouldn't be too hard to find a group of allies. Go now, and come back safe.
MsgWelcome: May Mystra's mighty power guard you from peril.
MsgIncomplete: May Mystra's mighty power guard you from peril.
MsgResponse4: May Mystra's mighty power guard you from peril.

MsgSummary:
You have to get rid of {c1}12 Arena Stronghold Small Landers{/c} and {c1}8 Arena Stronghold Large Landers{/c}, then return to {c2}Kein Burnbless{/c}.
You can find a group of Landers immediately after exiting the Arena Stronghold toward the southwest.
MsgComplete: Well done, friend. The skills you've got are just like the rumors say. But remember, there's no harm in being cautious...
MsgTake:
Welcome, friend. I'm Kein Burnbless, an Oracle from the Great Temple of Etainas. As it so happens, word of your deeds has already spread all over Iris. However, in the mission you're going to be given, failure is totally unacceptable. That's why we need to put your skills to the test, just to be certain. Please, take no offense; this mission is a matter of utmost importance to the entire Union of Fury.
	
There are groups of Landers living near the Arena Stronghold. They might not look like much compared to the soldiers of the Alliance of Light, but they're tough enough to keep you on your toes. If you get rid of 12 Arena Stronghold Small Landers and 8 Arena Stronghold Large Landers, you'll not only prove your ability, but also play an important part in reducing their threat in this area.
MsgWelcome: Please hurry up. We don't have all the time in the world...
MsgIncomplete: Please hurry up. We don't have all the time in the world...
MsgResponse4: Please hurry up. We don't have all the time in the world...

MsgSummary: You have to get rid of {c1}14 Spinterr Elf Rangers and 6 Spinterr Elf Snipers{/c}, then return to {c1}Kein Burnbless{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Indeed, you are more than worthy to be an Oracle of Etainas. I don't think there's any more need to test you.

These are the instructions that my superior, Vatican Iscaliote, told me to give to you. Check them out, and listen to what's written there. Here's where we part ways, so I hope I'll see you someday at the Great Temple.
MsgTake:
Let me remind you again that this will be a very important mission, so don't take it personally if we want to assess your skill very carefully. If you handle this mission fine, you'll be well on your way to becoming a member of Etainas

There is a resistance force of Elves not far away from here, toward the northeast. They're called the Spinterr Resistance. Those Spinterr Elf Rangers and Spinterr Elf Snipers have us locked down and continue to torment us at close range near the Arena Stronghold. Go and finish some of them off, then return to me.

They're strong and very organized, so it wouldn't be a bad idea to gather friends and allies to aid you in the battle. I'll be waiting here for you to deliver news of your triumph.
MsgWelcome: Please hurry up. We don't have a lot of time to spare...
MsgIncomplete: Please hurry up. We don't have a lot of time to spare...
MsgResponse4: Please hurry up. We don't have a lot of time to spare...

MsgSummary: You have to get rid of {c1}Acre the Betrayer{/c}, who is hiding near the Genetick Lab in Adeurian, then return to {c2}Vatican Iscaliote{/c} in Iris with the {c3}Head of Acre{/c}.
MsgComplete: Hey there, come on in. You gave that traitor a fitting end; I heard it was quite a spectacle. Never let yourself forget the tragic end that awaits all who would betray our cause.
MsgTake:
Hello there, I'm Vatican Iscaliote, an Oracle of the Great Temple of Etainas. You may not know it, but we've been keeping our eyes on you, and we believe you have the potential to be a great help to us in this current matter we're facing.

Currently, the Union of Fury is beset by numerous foes - the Alliance of Light stands ever ready on the battlefield before us, and to the unknown rear, mysterious fiends from other dimensions seek to break into this world and cause us untold harm.  The Alliance of Light is at least an enemy we know, but the mission we're hoping to give you will pit you against a foe that even the Vail don't fully understand.

First, I'd like you to go to the Genetick Lab in Adeurian. I've obtained intelligence tracing Acre, a traitor to the Union, to that area. Get rid of him, and bring his head to me as evidence of your success. I'll be at the Great Temple in Iris, the Vail Capital. After you complete this mission, I want to talk to you in-depth about the background of this case. I pray that Etain offers you her protection.

P.S. I've enchanted this letter to self-destruct after you've finished reading it, for both our protection and yours.

MsgSummary: You have to find {c2}Arkus{/c} of Panakeia Lab, located in the Reikeuseu district, and give him a {c3}Letter from Vatican{/c}.
MsgComplete: Ah, come on in.
MsgTake:
You're probably unaware of exactly what this betrayer did to deserve such a fate at your hands, so I wanted to let you know. Perhaps you already know of the Aidion Neckria, a place holy to the Vail?

Up until relatively recently, it was overrun by devils from another dimension - can you believe it? Apparently, they had been the denizens of that place for a long time. Originally, Acre was one of the high priests in charge of managing the Aidion Neckria. In fact, Acre was the very person who first discovered that the Aidion Neckria was occupied by devils from another dimension. However, Acre didn't report the devils he discovered to the Senator. Avarice had blinded his good sensibilities - he must've thought he could take advantage of these devils' power.

However, these devils from another dimension were not beings that would be so easily controlled. One of them took advantage of Acre until he regained the power he lost when he entered this dimension. Once this devil regained his power, he betrayed Acre, and instantly Aidion Neckria was turned into the scene of a massacre.

Acre became afraid that his transgression would be uncovered, and he escaped in the chaos, but as you can see, he paid the ultimate price in the end. However, the devil still dwells in Aidion Neckria. Take this letter to Panakeia Lab in Reikeuseu. If you give it to Arkus, he will help you prepare to do battle against this devil. Make haste now; we've no time to lose.
MsgWelcome: Arkus will be waiting for you, so make your way to Panakeia Lab at once.
MsgIncomplete: Arkus will be waiting for you, so make your way to Panakeia Lab at once.
MsgResponse4: Ah, this job has turned out to be a huge success. Have you come here to learn magic as well?

MsgSummary:
Please bring {c3}99 Rilans, 30 Spirit Cores, and 20 Adamars Stones{/c} to {c2}Arkus{/c}.
You can obtain these materials easily from shops or monsters, and you may also be able to find additional places to obtain them through information from other travelers.
MsgComplete: Well done. Now, please just wait for a bit.
MsgTake:
Hmmm...

{c5}(Arkus looks at you with hopeful eyes after reading the letter){/c}

So, Acre is dead? Life's wick has been cut short for a shameful betrayer of the family. I pay my respects to your bravery in the matter, but killing Acre is only a token triumph at best. The true foe we must eventually face is Astaroth, the king of the devils from another dimension. In addition, I've heard rumors that Mago, the Vampire Queen, is reviving as well. This is a cause for great concern. We don't have much time to waste - in order to face off against Astaroth, ordinary preparations won't suffice.

Due to the nature of our enemy, I'm trying to make a secret magical medicine we have long been researching. But in order to do so, I'll need you to bring me 99 Rilans, 30 Spirit Cores, and 20 Adamars Stones. There's no specific place to get them, but you can find them around without too much difficulty, either from shops or other travelers. In the meantime, I will ready a Sage's Stone for use in the process...
MsgWelcome: The power of Astaroth grows ever stronger. We must hurry...
MsgIncomplete: The power of Astaroth grows ever stronger. We must hurry...
MsgResponse4: Ah, this job has turned out to be a huge success. Have you come here to learn magic as well?

MsgSummary: You have to return to {c2}Vatican Iscaliote{/c} in Iris.
MsgComplete: Just as I expected, he knew what would really be useful for you in your upcoming battle.
MsgTake:
Behold, the Arkein Potion, made from sage's stone, the pinnacle of Alchemy! To make it is no mean feat; it's not something one can simply buy from a street vendor. Its value is nigh unfathomable, but you will know its usefulness when you battle Astaroth.

Now you can return to Vatican; he probably has something new to tell you by now. Anyway, give him my regards.
MsgWelcome: Get a move on; I'm sure Vatican will be waiting for you.
MsgIncomplete: Get a move on; I'm sure Vatican will be waiting for you.
MsgResponse4: The Goddess will always be with us.

MsgSummary:
Seek out {c2}Palbatus{/c}, a blacksmith famous among the Deatheaters.
{c2}Palbatus{/c}, who has retired, dwells somewhere in the Helm Marsh, in the Keuraijen district.
MsgComplete: What's this now? I'm not interested in working anymore.
MsgTake:
I figure you've heard the tales of Palbatus, a smith famous among the Nordein. Although it's said he's retired, we need his craftsmanship on our side.

Palbatus has the ability to imbue the goods he makes with spiritual power. I've drafted a letter asking him to make something useful to use in the upcoming battle. Take it and find Palbatus, who has been living in seclusion near Helm Marsh in the Keuraijen district.

But you must be careful - Helm Marsh is a dangerous place. I've heard that a dragon built its nest near there, so be on your guard, and return unharmed.
MsgWelcome: There's no time for hesitation.
MsgIncomplete: There's no time for hesitation.
MsgResponse4: The sound of the hammer and the anvil no longer rings within my dwelling.

MsgIncomplete: May the incredible power of Crisis infuse your limbs with true strength!
MsgResponse4: May the incredible power of Crisis infuse your limbs with true strength!

MsgSummary:
You have to collect {c3}30 Spirit Cores{/c} and give them to {c2}Doltin Coper{/c}.
You can find Spirit Cores from monsters or buy them from other travelers.
MsgComplete:
Well, pick whichever of the three suits you best. Sorry if it's not red-colored, but I guarantee this is three times stronger than that other stuff.

<Reward For Fighter/Defender><Reward For Ranger/Archer><Reward For Mage/Priest>
MsgTake: These days, even I've been learning some new techniques. Just you wait and see the kind of things I'll make with this technique - guaranteed to blow you away! Just one problem, though - I don't have enough material on hand to make what I want. Do you think you could bring me about 30 Spirit Cores? If you bring them to me, I'll show you the fruits of my new technique firsthand.
MsgWelcome: What's taking so long? I'm anxious to show you what my new technique can do!
MsgIncomplete: What's taking so long? I'm anxious to show you what my new technique can do!
MsgResponse4: What's taking so long? I'm anxious to show you what my new technique can do!

MsgSummary:
You have to collect {c3}30 Nightmare Cores{/c} and give them to {c2}Lavenne Watersaga{/c}.
You can find Nightmare Cores from monsters or buy them from other travelers.
MsgComplete:
Heh...well, go ahead and pick whichever of the three you like best.

<Reward For Fighter/Defender><Reward For Ranger/Archer><Reward For Mage/Priest>
MsgTake: Hey now, recently, I picked up some useful techniques at the Blacksmiths' Union meeting. If you wait and see what kind of armor and weapons I can make now, I guarantee you'll be amazed! Just one problem, though - I don't have enough material on hand to make what I want. Do you think you could bring me about 30 Nightmare Cores? If you bring them to me, I'll let you keep one of the things I make - how's that for a payoff?
MsgWelcome: Haven't you gotten them yet? I'm dying to test out my new technique!
MsgIncomplete: Haven't you gotten them yet? I'm dying to test out my new technique!
MsgResponse4: Haven't you gotten them yet? I'm dying to test out my new technique!

MsgSummary:

You can find Manitou Cores from monsters or buy them from other travelers.
MsgComplete:
Well now, just pick whichever of the three you want.
Who knows, maybe you'll feel like a new person after you swing it around a couple times! Hahaha~

<Reward For Fighter/Defender><Reward For Ranger/Archer><Reward For Mage/Priest>
MsgTake:
The Blacksmiths' Union has really created a technological revolution this time! And because of that, I've picked up a new technique or two myself. You'll definitely be impressed when you see what kinds of goods I can make now!

In fact, the only thing stopping me would be a lack of materials...and unfortunately, that's exactly the problem I'm facing right now. Do you think you could bring me about 30 Manitou Cores? If you bring them to me, I'll let you have a piece of the new technological revolution! I can tell you're so excited!
MsgWelcome: C'mon, you've gotta get those Manitou Cores so we can test this revolutionary technique!
MsgIncomplete: C'mon, you've gotta get those Manitou Cores so we can test this revolutionary technique!
MsgResponse4: C'mon, you've gotta get those Manitou Cores so we can test this revolutionary technique!

MsgSummary:
You have to collect {c3}15 Dark Mage Stones{/c} and {c3}3 Endure Lapises Lv3{/c}, then
give them to {c2}Brad Stone{/c}.
You can get Dark Mage Stones and Endure Lapises from monsters or buy them from other travelers.
MsgComplete:
Go on and pick whichever of the three suits your fancy.

<Reward For Fighter/Defender><Reward For Ranger/Archer><Reward For Mage/Priest>
MsgTake:
The Blacksmiths' Union has really created a technological revolution this time! And because of that, I've picked up a new technique or two myself. You'll definitely be impressed when you see what kinds of goods I can make now!

However, I'm lacking in the materials I need to test out this new technique. Do you think you could bring me 15 Dark Mage Stones and 3 Endure Lapises Lv3? If you bring them to me, I'll let you get in on the ground floor of this new technological revolution!
MsgWelcome: Haven't you got the Dark Mage Stones and Endure Lapises? We need to test this revolutionary new technique!
MsgIncomplete: Haven't you got the Dark Mage Stones and Endure Lapises? We need to test this revolutionary new technique!
MsgResponse4: Haven't you got the Dark Mage Stones and Endure Lapises? We need to test this revolutionary new technique!

MsgSummary:
You have to collect {c3}30 Spirit Cores{/c} and give them to {c2}Dugon Hisuren{/c}.
You can get Spirit Cores from monsters or buy them from other travelers.
MsgComplete:
Y...you can choose w...whichever you want of the three here. S...so what'll it be?
<Reward For Warrior/Guardian><Reward For Assassin/Hunter><Reward For Pagan/Oracle>
MsgTake:
Re..Recently I...I.. have learned one new...technique. 

You will definitely be astonished...if you see the things I can make with this...n...new technique!
H...However...now I don't have e...enough material to make anything...
Could you collect some.....Spirit Cores and bring them.......to me?
About...30 Spirit Cores would be great.... Once you bring them, I'll show.....you my new...technique.
MsgWelcome: Why...why is it taking so long?
MsgIncomplete: Why...why is it taking so long?
MsgResponse4: Why...why is it taking so long?

MsgSummary:
You have to collect {c3}30 Nightmare Cores{/c} and give them to {c2}Martelo{/c}.
You can get Nightmare Cores from monsters or buy them from other travelers.
MsgComplete:
Well, you can pick whichever of the three you like. It's not red-colored, but I guarantee this will be three times stronger than one of those red ones.
<Reward For Warrior/Guardian><Reward For Assassin/Hunter><Reward For Pagan/Oracle>
MsgTake:
Recently, I learned a new technique thanks to the active research of the Blacksmiths' Union. You'll definitely be impressed once you see the kind of things I can create with this technique!

The thing is, right now, I'm running a bit short of materials. Could you collect about 30 Nightmare Cores and bring them to me? If you bring 'em, you'll also benefit from the result, I guarantee it.
MsgWelcome: Hmm? Why are things taking so long?
MsgIncomplete: Hmm? Why are things taking so long?
MsgResponse4: Hmm? Why are things taking so long?

MsgSummary:
You have to collect {c3}30 Manitou Cores{/c} and give them to {c2}Kanon Kursan{/c}.
You can get Pint Coarrs from monsters or buy them from other travelers.
MsgComplete:
Well then, just pick whichever of the three you want.

<Reward For Warrior/Guardian><Reward For Assassin/Hunter><Reward For Pagan/Oracle>
MsgTake:
The research that the Blacksmiths' Union has been donig finally paid off, and now we're on the verge of a revolution in metalworking! As one fruit of that research, I've picked up a great new technique. Once I make some weapons or armor with this technique, it'll blow your mind, aye.

Except...I don't have enough material right now to make anything. Do you think you could collect about 30 Manitou Cores and bring them to me? Once you do, I'll put the new technological revolution right in your hands!
MsgWelcome: You haven't gotten them yet? Don't you want to see the beautiful fruits of the technological revolution?!
MsgIncomplete: You haven't gotten them yet? Don't you want to see the beautiful fruits of the technological revolution?!
MsgResponse4: You haven't gotten them yet? Don't you want to see the beautiful fruits of the technological revolution?!

MsgComplete:
Go ahead, pick whichever of the three you like best.
Who knows, maybe you'll be reborn in spirit if you use this! Hahaha~

<Reward For Warrior/Guardian><Reward For Assassin/Hunter><Reward For Pagan/Oracle>
MsgTake:
The Blacksmiths' Union are on the verge of a technological revolution! And of course, being a member of that union, I've learned one of the new techniques that will usher in this new technological age! Once you've seen what I can make now, you won't want to go back to old-style weapons and armor!

However, even the latest and greatest smithing technique still requires raw materials to forge, and that's where I'm lacking, unfortunately. Could you bring me 15 Dark Mage Stones and 3 Endure Lapises Lv3? Once you bring them, you'll be all clear to advance into the bright and glorious future of technological advancement!
MsgWelcome: What do you mean you don't have them all yet? We must hasten the technological revolution!
MsgIncomplete: What do you mean you don't have them all yet? We must hasten the technological revolution!
MsgResponse4: What do you mean you don't have them all yet? We must hasten the technological revolution!

MsgSummary:
{c2}Vank Jerad{/c} told you that he'll give you a present if you get rid of {c1}10 Black Claw Succubi{/c}.
You can find Black Claw Succubi east of Gliter.
MsgComplete:
{c5}(sniffing){/c}
Hmm...I can smell it...certainly. I mean...the reek of blood...Succubi blood. I suppose...I believe you.

Here's what I have...to offer. Pick up..whatever...you want. I'll be a g..good help to you.

<Reward for Warrior/Guardian><Reward for Oracle/Pagan><Reward for Assassin/Hunter>
MsgTake:
I...I know what you....need.
However, I can't give it to you for free.
Hmm..yes...yes...Succubi...Succubi will be...good.
If you....defeat Succubi...I will give you....what I...have.
MsgWelcome: Aren't....you curious....what it....is?
MsgIncomplete: Aren't....you curious....what it....is?
MsgResponse4: Aren't....you curious....what it....is?

MsgSummary:
{c2}Dink Jerad{/c} told you he will give you a present if you get rid of {c1}10 Edged Blade Feather Galluses{/c}.
You can find {c1}10 Edged Blade Feather Galluses{/c} east of Gliter.
MsgComplete:
Your...body...covered with feathers. You worked...hard to capture...Galluses.
Well...here they are...so pick...up...whatever you need. Fight well...
<Reward for Oracle/Pagan><Reward for Assassin>
MsgTake:
Did.... Vanker give you a Walker? It's..n..nice. I was trying to give...it..to you.
But...you...you know what? Garter said e...equipment for m...mercenaries is ha...hard to find..
It's a g..good thing I made this...from time to time...it's helpful....

By the way...there is something I can give you that will aid you...in the Vail Forces. Of course...it's not free either. But if you h..hunt Edged Blade Feather Galluses, I'll...g..give you...a present.
MsgWelcome: Did ...you defeat...all...the Galluses?
MsgIncomplete: Did ...you defeat...all...the Galluses?
MsgResponse4: Did ...you defeat...all...the Galluses?

MsgSummary:
{c2}Sant{/c} told you he will give you a present if you get rid of {c1}10 Soldier Larvae{/c}.
You can find {c1}Soldier Larvae{/c} west of the street stall where Sant is.
MsgComplete:
Ah, well done. This is a strong set of armor that'll make up for any deficiencies you might have.
I hope it encourages you to fight even more bravely on the battlefield.

<Reward for Warrior/Guardian><Reward for Hunter>
MsgTake:
You're a nice-lookin' Nordein warrior. But it feels like something is missing, though. What is it?
I figure I can give you that "missing thing" if you'll do me a favor. It's a simple job, really.
All you have to do is hunt down about 10 Soldier Larvae. No sweat, right?
MsgWelcome: How about those Larvae? Have you finished 'em off yet?
MsgIncomplete: How about those Larvae? Have you finished 'em off yet?
MsgResponse4: How about those Larvae? Have you finished 'em off yet?

MsgSummary:
{c2}Chiboss{/c} told you that he'll give you a present if you get rid of {c1}10 Blackskull Skeleton Soldiers{/c}.
You can find {c1}Blackskull Skeleton Soldiers{/c} north of the farm where {c2}Chiboss{/c} is.
MsgComplete:
Zaite looked so happy - he said he saw an unfamiliar Assassin take care of the source of our headache.

That must've been you, eh? Good, good; you've showed your skill well enough. Now I can give you what you deserve. Be sure to use it wisely!
MsgTake:
There's a Vail assassin I used to stay with here.
It's been about a week since he left for the frontier districts under orders from his superiors.
What I liked most about him was his boundless support for his juniors.
Even though he was transferred to the frontier districts, he's still doing the same kind of work.
So far, he's been sending supplies via the Mercenaries who stop here on their way through.

Of course, there's something you can use there too, but I'm not supposed to give it to you gratis, am I?

You should at least have the skill to earn what you want, ain't that true?
Well, how about you go hunt Blackskull Skeleton Soldiers, then come back here?
If you return safely, I'll gladly give you what you deserve.
MsgWelcome: How many Blackskull Skeleton Soldiers have you defeated?
MsgIncomplete: How many Blackskull Skeleton Soldiers have you defeated?
MsgResponse4: How many Blackskull Skeleton Soldiers have you defeated?

QuestName: A Rosage by Any Other Name
MsgSummary:
Kanon Kursan said {c2}Rosage Ern{/c} is looking for a skillful mercenary.
You should find {c2}Rosage Ern{/c} and find out what her request is.
MsgComplete:
Ah, Kanon sent you here, right?! Hohoho, I knew he'd totally send me someone good!
It's lucky you didn't show up late!
MsgTake:
Ah, Great timing!
I'll give top priority to fixing your item, so can you do me a favor as payment?

Since a few days ago, Rosage has been pestering me to introduce her to a good mercenary. Actually...one day, I told her I worked as a mercenary for a while, when I was younger. Apparently, she'd remembered it all this time. However, all the guys I know already either died or quit the business. That's why I'm coming to you.
{c5}(smiling){/c} Your name's already quite famous 'round these parts, so I'm confident you'll handle everything fine. I leave it to you!

Rosage is the only granddaughter of my late teacher. I just want to do what'll make her happy, where I'm able. Please, I'm begging you, find her and lend her your services.
MsgWelcome: Rosage is working at the Temple of Flame. Go there as soon as you can.
MsgIncomplete: Rosage is working at the Temple of Flame. Go there as soon as you can.
MsgResponse4: W..what's this smell? D...did you pee in your... Ah-hahaha, I'm just playin' with you!

QuestName: If You Can't Tell a Woman, Telamon
MsgSummary:
{c2}Rosage Ern{/c} asked you to help {c2}Telamon Deiat{/c}, who seems to be in trouble.
It appears you have to find {c2}Telamon Deiat{/c}, find out what's going on, and help him.
MsgComplete:
{c5}(Like Rosage said, Telamon gives you a silent look after you put forth your supreme confidence){/c}

...Ahah, I've heard about you before, actually.
You're a great Mercenary who can bust through anything, right? Then...can you help me too?

{c5}(exhales a big sigh){/c} Ah~ Thank...thank the Goddess.
MsgTake:
Actually, what I wanted to ask you isn't something for me - it's a favor I'd like you to do for someone else.
Do you see Telamon over there?

Telamon is a very kind person, but...sometimes he's too kind.
Even though rough things happen to him, he worries about them all alone because he doesn't want to trouble anyone else.
I think this situation is like that too.
For several days, he has been totally on pins and needles about something. I've tried to ask him about it, but he just talks to me like with a smile, saying 'I'm doing a-okay Rosage; it's nothing you need to bother yourself with.'
I know he doesn't want me to be worried about him, but...that just makes me want to help him out more!

If you find Telamon, talk to him confidently. Be like "I'm so awesome that whatever it is you're having trouble with, just looking at it can solve it!" Then, maybe he'll open up and talk to you.
Oh! By the way, you absolutely, totally can't tell him I told you to do this~!
MsgWelcome: I think it's definitely something that he'll need a lot of help with. Please help Telamon~!
MsgIncomplete: I think it's definitely something that he'll need a lot of help with. Please help Telamon~!
MsgResponse4:
Oh-ho, a visitor, is it?
This Telamon-brand gear is handmade by Telamon himself - that'd be me, of course. Just pick up what you need~

MsgSummary: Telamon said he lost something his customer left to him. You have to search near the island west of the Temple of Flame, and capture a {c1}MetinNis Sealakel Hunter{/c} and collect {c3}10 Strange Goods{/c}, then go back to Telamon with them.
MsgComplete:
{c5}(Before you even begin talking, Telamon grabs your arm with tears in his eyes){/c}

I'm in big trouble! I got a letter from the customer who left the statue in my care...and I guess they found out that I lost it, somehow! What am I gonna do?
MsgTake:
You know...I've tried to find it alone, but...it's too hard, so, I was worried about it....

Ten days ago, a woman came to me and left a statue, saying she'd return to claim it exactly one month later. She seemed really earnest about it, so I agreed to keep it all this time, but...I lost it by mistake...
I didn't believe it at first; I looked everywhere, but I couldn't find it. Just 10 days have passed, but I lost it already.... I need to find it before that customer comes to me again, or I'll really be in hot water.

There's one place I couldn't go because...well...it was scary. It's an island, actually. So, Mercenary, what I kinda want to do is have you go to the island and look for the statue. But the place is crawling with Sealakels, and you'll probably have to b..bust up a couple of them to find it. But you're not afraid, 'cause you're strong, right? You...you've gotta help me!
MsgWelcome: Did you...find it? Watch out...for those Sealakels...
MsgIncomplete: Did you...find it? Watch out...for those Sealakels...
MsgResponse4: Did you...find it? Watch out...for those Sealakels...

MsgSummary: {c2}Telamon Deiat{/c} received a letter that says 'If you can't find what you lost, you'll have to pay me back in full.' {c2}Telamon Deiat{/c} said 'I guess I have to ask for help from Atlon.' You have to go to the Arteria Force Base Camp and find {c2}Atlon Pietry{/c}.
MsgTake:
If I can't...f..find that thing, I'll have to pay back...2..200 billion gold!
{c5}(Telamon's face turns deathly pale){/c}
I...I've never had that much in my entire life!
{c5}(after looking at the strange goods you brought){/c} Hmm...no, none of these is the statue I'm looking for... What should I do?

{c5}(He seems anxious for a while, but before long he seems to make up his mind) {/c}

Now that this has happened, I guess I have no choice but to ask for help from Atlon.
Atlon generally does what I ask of him. Sir Mercenary, you've gotta help me out a little more!
Please go to Atlon and tell him what happened to me! I'm counting on you...
MsgWelcome: Did you tell Atlon what I said?
MsgIncomplete: Did you tell Atlon what I said?
MsgResponse4:
Hey, you know of any good moneymaking ideas?
I've heard there are a lot of bounty jobs these days...

MsgSummary: {c2}Atlon Pietry{/c} has three pieces of information he can give you. Think carefully, then choose one piece of information. Once you make your choice, you can't undo it, so be careful.
MsgComplete:
{c5}(Atlon closes a book with a snap){/c}
Alright, there are three pieces of information I can let you know about.
Any of these will be a helpful lead to start out, so choose whatever catches your interest.

<Information About Woman><Information About Location><Information About Statue>
MsgTake:
The thing he lost was a statue, right?
(Alton rummages through several strange files) 
Now that I think about it...recently, I heard a rumor that a certain beautiful woman is looking for something. I'd bet that statue is what she's looking for.
I still remember it because the size of the bounty was so incredible.
There's something strange about all this, though...

Normally, if someone loses something, they try to let as many people as they can know about it, so that if anyone else finds out anything, they can let the owner know.
However, this woman seems to be very secretive in her searching.
The information we have available is very limited, and all we know is that the bounty attached is huge. It's the exact opposite of what someone sensible would do in this situation.

I dunno about you; I think it's kind of suspicious. Do you think the statue she's looking for is the same as the one Telamon lost?
MsgWelcome: So, what do you think about it all?
MsgIncomplete: So, what do you think about it all?
MsgResponse4: So, what do you think about it all?

MsgSummary:
You have chosen to hear the lead about the beautiful woman.
{c2}Atlon Pietry{/c} told you that you can find a Nameless Lady if you follow the path toward the Prymates Village.
You have to find her and question her about the whereabouts of the statue.
MsgComplete:
{c5}(looking quite surprised){/c}
Wait...who are you?
You're definitely not someone I know.
What on earth do you want?
Wait, that's not the right question....
I want to know how you tracked me down.
Have you been following me around stealthily?

Who asked you to find me?

<Because Atlon gave you the information about her, you answer Atlon.><Because Telamon asked you for the favor first, you answer Telamon.>
MsgTake:
Alright, I'll tell you what I know about the beautiful woman.

She's the same woman I was telling you about before. It seems she made an effort to conceal her identity and position in her own way, but guys won't easily forget a gal who's such a looker. Two days ago, people said they saw her leaving Gliter and heading for Prymates Village. If you head off toward there, there's a good chance you'll run into her.
You and she have the same purpose, after all, so maybe you can help each other out, right?
MsgWelcome: What is it? I already told you what I know - look for that woman and ask her the rest.
MsgIncomplete: What is it? I already told you what I know - look for that woman and ask her the rest.
MsgResponse4: What is it? I already told you what I know - look for that woman and ask her the rest.

MsgSummary:
You have chosen the information about the location.
{c2}Atlon Pietry{/c} told you about a place called the 'Forest of Oblivion,' and suggested that you look for the lost statue there.
He said if you can find a {c2}Woods-Keeper Gnome{/c}, it mean you've found the Forest of Oblivion.
MsgTake:
Fine, as you wish, I'll give you 'Information about location.'

There is a place named Woods of Oblivion.
As for where it is...if you open your map after we're done talking, the place ought to become clear, I guess.
None of the people who have actually gone there have been able to offer an accurate explanation.
Some say it's in the north, and some say they found it in the west...that's just the way this place is.

If you see an ugly gnome walking around, you'll know that you're finally inside of the woods.

That guy...I guess you can think of him as a sort of "Woods-Keeper."
At any rate, I've heard that many people have lost things in those woods and never found them again.
I'm thinking that it's likely the statue Telamon lost will be in there.
Go there and see if you can find it!
MsgWelcome: Hmm? I already told you what I know. Your best bet is to head to the Forest of Oblivion.
