MsgIncomplete: Hmm? I already told you what I know. Your best bet is to head to the Forest of Oblivion.
MsgResponse4: Hmm? I already told you what I know. Your best bet is to head to the Forest of Oblivion.

MsgSummary:
You have chosen the Information About the Statue.
{c2}Atlon Pietry{/c} told you there is a {c2}Nordein Grocer{/c} he knows very well and told you to find out if the thing you're looking for is there or not.
You have to find the {c2}Nordein Grocer{/c}.
MsgComplete: Heh...I heard someone was going all around asking for me - was that you?  Well, here I am, so let me hear your story; I'm all ears.
MsgTake:
There's a grocer with whom I'm well acquainted.
He's a Nordein, but his temperment is really similar to mind, so we became close friends. 
He's always in the know about nearly everything. It's like there's nothing you can bring up that he won't know where it came from.

Find this friend of mine and tell him you're looking for a statue.
It's definitely possible he'll know something about it.
Who knows - maybe you'll find the statue you're looking for there!
Pay him a visit at least once.
You'll probably have to walk around a bit, though, because he's never been one to stay in the same place for too long.
MsgWelcome: What? I already told you what I know. Travel around and find my friend, the Nordein grocer.
MsgIncomplete: What? I already told you what I know. Travel around and find my friend, the Nordein grocer.
MsgResponse4: What? I already told you what I know. Travel around and find my friend, the Nordein grocer.

MsgSummary:
You answered {c2}Atlon Pietry{/c}.
As soon as you said his name, the woman snubs you coldly and turns around.
You'd better go back to {c2}Atlon Pietry{/c} and obtain a new lead
MsgComplete:
Oh-ho, am I that famous (laughs)? She's a real cutie, that gal. I guess I'll have to find her someday and have a good old-fashioned chat.
You know...to improve my image~

So what...I suppose you need a new lead to follow, right?
{c5}(grumbling){/c}
Weeeeell, I suppose I'll let it slide, 'cause it's for Telamon's sake.

<Information about Iocation><Information about Statue>
MsgWelcome: Go away; I don't wish to associate with you.
MsgIncomplete: Go away; I don't wish to associate with you.
MsgResponse4: Go away; I don't wish to associate with you.

MsgSummary:
The {c2}Woods-Keeper Gnome{/c} said that a Nordein took what you're looking for.
You have to go back to {c2}Atlon Pietry{/c} and ask him if this is useful information or not.
MsgComplete:
Did you find what you're looking for in the woods?
{c5}(he listens to your story){/c}
Eh? A large Nordein? What about it?

...Ah, wait, I might know what he means.
A large Nordein who roams around collecting things...I get it. Yes, I guess he's probably talking about my friend~
MsgTake:
Oh-ho, you lost something in here?
{c5}(the Gnome giggles){/c}
It's nothing that WE do.
It's the humans who leave things behind, really.
Nor do we take what's left behind.
But a large Nordein sometimes comes through and takes things.

Is it important to you? Do you want to find it?
{c5}(the Gnome giggles again){/c}
You won't find it here, then. The large Nordein; he took what you're looking for.

{c5}(It's unclear where to proceed from here on out, but you know he said that a Nordein apparently took something.
You'd better go find Atlon and tell him what the Gnome said.){/c}
MsgWelcome: Nordein. Definitely a large Nordein. (giggle)
MsgIncomplete: Nordein. Definitely a large Nordein. (giggle)
MsgResponse4: Nordein. Definitely a large Nordein. (giggle)

MsgSummary:
The {c2} Nordein Grocer{/c} told you to choose from among three statues he owns.
You can't take back your choice, so think it over carefully.
MsgComplete:
Well...here are three statues I've come into possession of most recently.

{c5}(displays the statues for you){/c}
Do you think the statue you're looking for is one of these? Pick the one you think is the most likely choice.

<Gold Statue><Silver Statue><Stone Statue>
MsgTake:
There's no item on the continent of Teos that I don't know about!
Even if I don't have the items themselves, I DO have information about them.
What is it you're looking for?
Ah, a statue~ Can you give me a rough estimate of its size and shape?
Wait, what's that? All you know is that it's a statue that was recently lost?

Well, first I'd better check to see if there's a statue among the things I obtained recently. It won't take that long, so just wait a bit. 
{c5}(the Nordein rummages through a large stash of items){/c}

MsgSummary:
You chose a {c3}Gold Statue{/c} from among the statues the Nordein let you see.
The Nordein said he'll take in trade a number of goods equivalent in value to the statue, and asked you to collect {c3}20 Silver Scissors{/c}.
You can obtain {c3}Silver Scissors{/c} from monsters or buy them from travelers in the Adeurian district.
MsgComplete:
Hahaha, good show, mate!
Thanks to you, I've gotten a nice shipment of fine scissors without breaking a sweat!
MsgTake:
Ah, the gold statue, is it?

A sparkling luster and decorated with gemstones...it looks totally expensive, doesn't it?
I don't know much about it, but now you can find knockoffs that look like this in the marketplace.
I thought I could make a fortune on this, so I bought it before someone else could. I suppose it's because I couldn't determine the origin of this piece.

Anyway, you're my customer, so if this is what you want, as a merchant I'm supposed to take money and give this to you. However, I'm not certain what its price in gold pieces would be, and I don't want to sell either of us short. But how about this - do you think you could bring me something I've been trying to collect?

These days, I stop by the capital every so often, and maidens from the families of nobles in the capital are frequently looking for silver scissors. I didn't know where I could find these, so I asked my friends where they are, and they said I could get them in the Adeurian district.

About 20 will be fine. It shouldn't be that hard, right? You might even think of it as a good deal, compared to what someone would pay in gold.
Anyway, I'll be waiting~
MsgWelcome: How is it going with those silver scissors? How many do you have so far?
MsgIncomplete: How is it going with those silver scissors? How many do you have so far?
MsgResponse4: How is it going with those silver scissors? How many do you have so far?

MsgSummary:
You chose a {c3}Siver Statue{/c} from among the statues the Nordein let you see.
The Nordein said he'll take in trade a number of goods equivalent in value to the statue, and asked you to collect {c3}20 Magic Silks{/c}.
You can obtain {c3}Magic Silks{/c} from monsters or buy them from travelers in the Adeurian district.
MsgComplete:
Ah, good job!
You've been a great help to me, y'know.
Thanks again, my mercenary-minded friend~
MsgTake:
Hmm...so it's the Silver Statue, is it?

{c5}(he tilts his head){/c}
...you sure about that?
Well...anyway, now that you've made your choice, the merchant's creed declares that I should sell it to you. 
However...how many gold pieces is this thing worth? I'm not really sure, honestly.
So instead, how about you do a favor for me?

There's an excellent chance to make a killing from someone who's willing to buy Magic Silks in large quantities, but I already have my hands full managing my other projects, so I don't know if I'll have time to round up a few bolts of silk.

I hope you'll be able to do it in my stead.
If you can get me around 20, I'll be able to take care of my other urgent matters without any worries. I'll be waiting for you, then~
MsgWelcome: How's it going with those Magic Silks? How many have you gotten so far?
MsgIncomplete: How's it going with those Magic Silks? How many have you gotten so far?
MsgResponse4: How's it going with those Magic Silks? How many have you gotten so far?

MsgSummary:
You obtained a {c3}Stone Statue{/c} from a {c2}Nordein Grocer{/c}.
You have to go back to {c2}Telamon Deiat{/c} with the statue.
MsgComplete:
Hey-hey, a stone statue!
Thank the Goddess~
I won't have to pay that ridiculously huge replacement fee!
Good job. You've been through a lot because of me, haven't you?
You've worked really hard, so let me give you a gift.
MsgTake:
So, is this the one you want?

Actually, I found this one by accident when I was passing by the place where MetinNis Sealakels stay. It looks rather cheap, and the craftsmanship seems to be rather clumsy.
I was just holding onto it in case I ran into someone who fancied this sort of thing.
I didn't expect anyone around here to be looking for it, though! Hahaha!

Well, since I paid nothing for it, I won't charge you anything either.
Go and give this to whoever it is that's looking for it. So long!
MsgWelcome: I already gave you the statue, right? What more do you want?
MsgIncomplete: I already gave you the statue, right? What more do you want?
MsgResponse4: I already gave you the statue, right? What more do you want?

MsgSummary:
The {c2}Nordein Grocer{/c} gave you a statue.
You should take the {c3}Boxed Statue{/c} back to {c2}Telamon Deiat{/c} who requested that you find what he lost.
MsgComplete:
I..I have been waiting for this!
Statue, Did you come here to find a statue? customer?
You brought something here.. Please let Telamon see it~!

(Telamon with a disappointed look right after looking at a statue) 
No..This is not a statue Telamon lost...What should I do, I got only a few days left..
{c5}(weeping){/c} Can you help me one more time? Customer?

<I did my best. I just want to receive money and finish this..><Now that I already began this, I'd better do this to the last in spite of annoyance. I'll help you again.>
MsgTake:
Well, you did what I asked of you, so I'll give you the statue.
I'd better put it in a box to keep it safe during transport.

It's yours now, so you can do whatever you want with it.
Ah, didn't you say there was someone looking for this?
I hope it makes the trip alright.

Anyway, the road goes ever on, so I'd best get a move on.
I look forward to the next time we meet~

{c5}(You received the Boxed Statue.
You'd better give it to Telamon, who first asked you to find the statue he'd lost.){/c}
MsgWelcome: I already gave you the statue, right? Whatever you do with it from now on is your own business.
MsgIncomplete: I already gave you the statue, right? Whatever you do with it from now on is your own business.
MsgResponse4: I already gave you the statue, right? Whatever you do with it from now on is your own business.

MsgSummary:
What {c2}Telamon Deiat{/c} has been looking for is a {c3}Stone Statue{/c}!
You'd better go back to the {c2}Nordein Grocer{/c} again and ask him about the {c3}Stone Statue{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Haha, what's this? You've found me again, friend? I must've been such good company, right?
{c5}(he laughs loudly after hearing your story){/c}
Hahaha~ so you mean the one you took was totally useless to him, right?
I guess it just isn't your day, heh~ Alright, let's see what we can do about the Stone Statue.
MsgTake:
Well...I remember a little bit, now that I think about it.

I can't remember its shape, but...
It was definitely made out of stone, not a metal...
I'm sorry!
I'm so stupid, only remembering now! Stupid stupid stupid!

Well...did that Nordein guy have any statues made out of stone?
MsgWelcome: Soooo...we've gotta look for a Stone Statue now...
MsgIncomplete: Soooo...we've gotta look for a Stone Statue now...
MsgResponse4: Soooo...we've gotta look for a Stone Statue now...

MsgSummary:
{c2}Telamon Deiat{/c} asked you to deliver the statue to its original owner.
He told you where the owner would be and asked you to find them.

He said the owner would be heading toward Prymates Village.
MsgComplete:
Ah, that weird Vail guy sent you here, is that right? I guess that threat of owing me a monetary repayment for the statue worked rather well, seeing as how you came here earlier than I expected. Let me take a look at it.
{c5}(her face darkens after looking at the statue){/c}

...Well, it looks incredibly similar, but this isn't my statue.
Ara... I must have picked the wrong person to leave it with. Say...are you a mercenary? Do you think you can do a little more for me? I'll make it worth your while, definitely.

<My only business was fulfilling Telamon's request. Now that I've finished my job, I'll be on my way.><I'll do as much as I can, if it's for a beauty like you~>
MsgTake:
{c5}(Telamon smiles brightly after looking at the statue){/c}
Yes, this...this is it!
This is the statue I lost before!
Phew... Thank the Goddess! Now I've just gotta give it to...

{c5}(he turns pale suddenly){/c}
Uh-oh! I still have to take care of a lot of stuff today!
What...what should I do? I still have a lot of things to collect...and I've gotta give this back, in order 
to avoid having to pay that huge fee! Arrrrgh...what should I do?

{c5}(Telamon fumes there, looking rather pitiful. When you say you'll help him one more time, Telamon's eyes fill with manly tears){/c}

Re...Really? You're totally the kindest customer I've ever had!
I'm totally touched, right here in my heart~

I don't know her name.
When I saw her, she was dressed in black clothes...
H...however, she's so beautiful that I doubt you'll have any trouble recognizing her...
Really, it's the truth! I'll be waiting here, of course.
MsgWelcome:
Did you give....that statue to her?
Really, don't be late this one time, for sure!
MsgIncomplete:
Did you give....that statue to her?
Really, don't be late this one time, for sure!
MsgResponse4:
Did you give....that statue to her?
Really, don't be late this one time, for sure!

MsgSummary:
A {c2}Nameless Lady{/c} told you to deliver a message to {c2}Zbonoc{/c}, saying she doesn't have "that item" yet.
She said that after that, just follow {c2}Zbonoc{/c}'s instructions.
You have to find {c2}Zbonoc{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Hey there...what brings a youngster like you to this village, eh?

Hmm...someone sent you?
Ah-ha, you mean that Vail woman...
MsgTake:
Pff...don't try that sweet-talk on me. Words alone are cheap...

{c5}(the woman's expression wavers for a moment, then returns to its normal state){/c}
Ah, so you're going to help me out? Great.
It's a simple job, really. All you have to do is deliver a short message from me to a certain person.

Go to Prymates Village, a Nordein settlement.
Find a person named Zbonoc, a priest, and tell him 'I haven't found the item yet.' If you say that, he'll know what to do from there.

If you can help him a little bit more after that, he'll probably have a few instructions for you.
Now, time to snap into action~
MsgWelcome: Did you meet Zbonoc?
MsgIncomplete: Did you meet Zbonoc?
MsgResponse4: Did you meet Zbonoc?

MsgSummary:
A {c2}Nameless Lady{/c} told you to deliver a message to {c2}Zbonoc{/c}, saying she doesn't have "that item" yet.
She said that after that, just follow {c2}Zbonoc{/c}'s instructions.
You have to find {c2}Zbonoc{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Hey there...what brings a youngster like you to this village, eh?

Hmm...someone sent you?
Ah-ha, you mean that Vail woman...
MsgTake:
Telamon...that's the name of the guy I left the statue with...
(she exhales, sighing) 
I must have had a bad eye for picking people...If you haven't found him yet, that leaves me with few options.

Say...you're a mercenary, aren't you? Please help me.
It's a simple job, really. All you have to do is deliver a short message from me to a certain person.

Go to Prymates Village, a Nordein settlement.
Find a person named Zbonoc, a priest, and tell him 'I haven't found the item yet.' If you say that, he'll know what to do from there.

If you can help him a little bit more after that, he'll probably have a few instructions for you.
Now, time to snap into action~
MsgWelcome: Did you meet with Zbonoc?
MsgIncomplete: Did you meet with Zbonoc?
MsgResponse4: Did you meet with Zbonoc?

MsgSummary:
{c2}Zbonoc{/c} said the statue the woman gave to him was actually a fake.
He said he left the real one in the care of {c2}Dux{/c}, an officer in the Arteria Force Base Camp.
{c2}Zbonoc{/c} told you to track down {c2}Dux{/c}.
MsgTake:
There's something about that woman I haven't trusted from the beginning.
The only thing I'm after is a method to make 'that medicine.' Without a doubt, I got lucky.
I didn't expect to meet a woman like her who fit my needs so well.

Ah...perhaps I've piqued your curiosity, so let me tell you a little more about this situation.
I was told that woman was cast out of a family of Vail aristocrats because she's actually a half-blood. Imagine that, eh?

That family must have placed a great value on the purity of their bloodline. It's rare that you hear of Vail disowning family. But really, it's that family who are the unlucky ones.
In the end, that woman's sadness turned into a grudge against them.
After much trial, she discovered a way to make a poison deadly only to Vail, using phials of Vail blood.

It's a sad story, but it fits my plan oh-so well!
Because of that, I promised her my cooperation and got a recipe for that poison, and put it inside a statue for safekeeping...
I can't believe the statue itself disappeared! Just my luck...

{c5}(Zbonoc's face shows a wicked smile){/c}

However, that one's just a fake.
I switched it with the real one when she didn't notice, and stashed it somewhere else.
Go to Arteria Force Base Camp and find an officer named Dux and retrieve it from him.
Just tell him you're here to get the thing that Zbonoc left with him.
MsgWelcome: What of the statue? Didn't you get it from Dux?
MsgIncomplete: What of the statue? Didn't you get it from Dux?
MsgResponse4: What of the statue? Didn't you get it from Dux?

MsgSummary:
{c2}Dux{/c} told you that the statue he was holding onto was stolen in a sudden attack by Golems.
You have to capture {c1}Adeurian Small Stone Golems{/c} and retrieve a {c3}statue{/c},then give it to {c2}Zbonoc{/c}.
You can find {c1}Adeurian Small Stone Golems{/c} near the Arena Stronghold.
MsgComplete:
Well, that took longer than I was thinking.
Base Camp is a good distance from here, but...well, it's back in my hands, so there's no problem. Now, let's disenchant the statue and take out the recipe.

{c5}(Zbonoc mumbles something and breaks the statue, pulling out a note hidden inside){/c}

Oh dear...I didn't notice before, but one material still hasn't been confirmed. Now I have no choice.

I can't ask the woman now, so I'll have to test it out myself.
Well...which material should I test first?
<Smelly Material><Disgusting Material>
MsgTake:
Tsch...looks like I've got no choice...
I'll level with ya. But never tell this to Zbonoc, ever, no matter what happens.

A few days ago, Golems invaded us, pushing deep inside the base camp.
In order to throw 'em out, we were runnin' around for a long time and fighting from all sides. After that, I came back to a camp. Guess what? The statue I was holdin' onto was gone!

I assume one of Golems stole it, perhaps.
I thought I might be able to find it if I just keep killin' any golem I come across...
{c5}(Dux scratches his head repeatedly){/c}

I wanted to just go out and get it back myself, but...since their attack, the atmosphere around here has become so strict, so we can't just go out anytime we want.
So I want you to find it instead, and take it to Zbonoc.
But don't ever tell him I lost it! Like...not ever! You gotta do at least that.
MsgWelcome:
There are definitely Golems in the area.
You'll definitely find the statue if you bust up every Golem you see until one drops it!
MsgIncomplete:
There are definitely Golems in the area.
You'll definitely find the statue if you bust up every Golem you see until one drops it!
MsgResponse4:
There are definitely Golems in the area.
You'll definitely find the statue if you bust up every Golem you see until one drops it!

MsgSummary:
You have chosen the Smelly Material.

{c2}Zbonoc{/c} told you that this material can be obtained from {c1}Genetick Mutation Zombies{/c}.
You have to defeat {c1}Genetick Mutation Zombies{/c} and collect {c3}10 Rotten Sacks of Poison{/c} and give them to {c2}Zbonoc{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Did you bring them? Good, good; give them to me!

I've already prepared all the other materials; now all that remains is to dump in the rotten sacks of poison and mix it together. Mmm...just wait a moment now...

{c5}(Zbonoc squeezes a dark, viscous-looking paste from one of the sacks you brought in.
He mixes and shakes the concoction, and seems to be looking at something. Shortly after, he pours the water he mixed in the bowl onto the ground with a dissatisfied look){/c}

Gah...a failure.
This color is totally different from what the recipe says it should look like.
I'd better try the experiment again.
Now I have to find another material and re-do everything...
MsgTake:
Okay, then I'd better experiment with that material first.
Rotten Sacks of Poison...I use this material in many of my other spells.
You can get it from Mutation Zombies.

You can find zombies easily near the Genetick Black Magic Lab.

Let me see.... Just bring me 10. I think that ought to be good enough.
Now go and get them.
MsgWelcome: How many Rotten Sacks of Poison have you picked up thus far?
MsgIncomplete: How many Rotten Sacks of Poison have you picked up thus far?
MsgResponse4: How many Rotten Sacks of Poison have you picked up thus far?

MsgSummary:
You have chosen the disgusting material.
{c2}Zbonoc{/c} told you that this material can be obtained from {c1}Adeurian Golem Watchers{/c}.
You have to capture a {c1}Adeurian Golem Watcher{/c} and collect {c3}10 Bloody Bones{/c}, then give them to {c2}Zbonoc{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Ahhhhh...give it to meeee!
{c5}(Zbonoc snatches it, almost like a thief){/c}

I must mix this and that...oh, and I can't do it without that one...!

{c5}(mumbling, Zbonoc proceeds with his experiment
After a while, he stops mixing and seems to be checking the concoction. Before long, he smiles.){/c}

Ah, the color looks just as the recipe says!

Fine, this is good enough.
Thanks for your help.
I look forward to seeing you again, hehehe.
MsgTake:
Bloody Bones...this is something I'm not that familiar with.

I've heard where it came from once before.
I was told that you can find them in the possession of Adeurian Golem Watchers.
Can you obtain one every time you kill a Watcher?
I'm really not sure myself. I haven't ever seen one in person before, heh!

First things first, just go out and find it.
If you collect about 10, just bring them to me.
I've heard that Golem Watchers often wander near the Genetick Black Magic Lab, so just go there.
MsgWelcome: How many of those Bloody Bones have you collected so far?
MsgIncomplete: How many of those Bloody Bones have you collected so far?
MsgResponse4: How many of those Bloody Bones have you collected so far?

QuestName: I'm Comin' Back to You, Woman~
MsgSummary:
{c2}Zbonoc{/c} told you that he also can't find the {c3}Statue{/c} yet.
It appears you have to go back to the Vail woman and deliver this news to her.
MsgComplete:
Ah, I see...as I'd thought, they haven't found it yet.

{c5}(the woman pauses for a moment, shortly after she opens her mouth, seeming to make up her mind about something.){/c}

I have a method I try to use as infrequently as possible, but...at least this should be better than constantly wasting time.

Don't be frightened; what you have to do isn't too difficult. Let me explain.
MsgTake:
You couldn't find it?
Gah...it's no good. At this rate, we'll never see any progress.

{c5}(Zbonoc exhales a short sigh){/c}

Please go back to her, and tell her that we're doing our best by letting several trustworthy people continue to search for it. Let her know I'll contact her once we've found it.
Alright; I'm counting on you from here on out!
MsgWelcome: Did you pass my message along to her?
MsgIncomplete: Did you pass my message along to her?
MsgResponse4: Did you pass my message along to her?

MsgSummary:
A woman asked you to deliver her letter to {c2}Ordine{/c}, a Pagan in the Arena Stronghold.
You have to find {c2}Ordine{/c} and hand her the letter entrusted to you by the woman.
MsgComplete:
A letter for me?

{c5}(Ordine tears open the letter. As she reads it, you see a change in her expression.){/c}

...Wait, how do you know this woman? Did you receive this in person?
That means...she's still alive, right?

{c5}(Ordine's spirits seem greatly uplifted){/c}

Haha! What better news could I have received today?
Merdin...so you're still alive~
MsgTake:
If you go to the Arena Stronghold, you may chance to run into a Pagan named Ordine.
I'm not sure if she's still there, but I'm hoping she will be.

She is...a dear friend of mine.
I wonder if she hates me now... A long time ago, I left without so much as a word...

(she seems momentarily puzzled after relating her story)

Anyway, what's important right now is this.

(she hands you a letter)

This is a letter I wrote a few days ago, asking Ordine if she could lend her help to me.
I don't know if it's an offer that'll fall upon deaf ears, but this isn't the time to worry about something like that.
All you have to do is deliver this letter to her.
After that, the decision is ultimately hers to make. Anyway, you'd best get going now...
MsgWelcome: Did you give the letter to Ordine as I asked?
MsgIncomplete: Did you give the letter to Ordine as I asked?
MsgResponse4: Did you give the letter to Ordine as I asked?

MsgSummary:
{c2}Ordine{/c} asked you to bring {c3}Bloody Bones{/c}, a material mentioned in the letter.
She said you can get {c3}Bloody Bones{/c} from {c1}Adeurian Golem Watchers{/c}.
You have to obtain {c3}15 Bloody Bones{/c} and return to {c2}Ordine{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Hey, not bad; not bad at all.
Don't worry; I've got plenty of money...
Let me see, I've got this much on me right now, and then...
Anyway, how about I prepare your reward and send it along to Merdin separately? It shouldn't take too long.
MsgTake:
I haven't heard anything from her for over 5 years, since she left home without a word to anyone.

I thought she must have died somewhere. 
Otherwise, why would she go so long without at least contacting me?

But now that she sent a letter like this, Merdin must have a driving reason.
She didn't talk all that much, but she was always a deep thinker.

Well, if Merdin needs my help with anything, she has but to ask!
Do I hate her? What kind of nonsense is that? 
I guess that now, she must still be researching that medicine she was making alone.

By the way, this material in the letter - I used up all the rest that I had a few days ago.
Now I have to replenish my stock.
Do you think you'd be able to go out and gather some for me? Would that be okay?

You can get Bloody Bones from Adeurian Golem Watchers, which you should be able to find roaming around near the Genetick Black Magic Lab. Fifteen should be sufficient.
MsgWelcome: Have you collected all the Bloody Bones I need?
MsgIncomplete: Have you collected all the Bloody Bones I need?
MsgResponse4: Have you collected all the Bloody Bones I need?

MsgSummary:
{c2}Ordine{/c} asked you to give a material you collected for her to the woman who sent the letter.
You have to deliver {c3}10 Bloody Bones{/c} to the {c2}Nameless Lady{/c}.
MsgComplete:
(You give the woman the items provided by Ordine) 

Hmm...so that's how it went. I guess Ordine really does understand me. You don't know how thankful I am to have a friend like her.

Thanks for doing this favor for me
From now on, I'll I should be able to handle the rest by myself.
I wish you well.
MsgTake:
(she hands you a portion of the bones) 

Well, here's what she needs. Be careful with that.

I'm pretty sure I know why Merdin originally left.
I can also guess why she's never returned, too, but....there's nothing I can do about that.

I think she'll return one day, after she takes care of the matters she's caught up in.
Please tell Merdin that if she ever needs anything, I'm always there for her.
Tell her to take care of her health, too.

I never hated her...please, let her know somehow. I'd do almost anything, if only she asked me.
MsgWelcome: Are you sure you gave them to Merdin?
MsgIncomplete: Are you sure you gave them to Merdin?
MsgResponse4: Are you sure you gave them to Merdin?

MsgSummary:
{c2}Liel Uodia{/c} suggests you find her patron, {c2}Janet Castine{/c} in Sidelos Refinery and listen to her request.
It'd be a good idea to find {c2}Janet Castine{/c} and listen to what's going on.
MsgComplete:
Ah, Liel asked you to pay me a visit?
You must be a mercenary, then?
MsgTake:
Guh...I can't stand the sweaty smell of mercenaries...
{c5}(frowning){/c}
Ah, there was something I wanted to ask if I ever met someone like you.

Have you ever gone to the Sidelos Refinery before?
Janet Castine a big customer of mine; she buys from me, then resells there. Last time I heard from her, she said there was something urgent she needs to take care of, so she's looking to employ a skillful mercenary.'

If you've got a decent amount of free time on your hands, why don't you pay her a visit and see what she needs.
MsgWelcome: You're thinking, "Why should I waste my time on her suggestion," aren't you?
MsgIncomplete: You're thinking, "Why should I waste my time on her suggestion," aren't you?

MsgSummary:
{c2}Janet Castine{/c} asked you to find {c2}Dear Castine{/c} and give him some help.
Seek out {c2}Dear Castine{/c} and ask him what kind of help he needs.
MsgComplete:
Ah...Janet told you to come here?
Heh... It guess she's really concerned about me.
MsgTake:
I'm looking for a mercenary to help out my brother, Dear.
He's not my brother by blood, but...

I brought up that child who I found on the battlefield, named him myself, and taught him how to work. He's as good as family in my eyes. 
Fortunately, these days he seems to be recovering the memories he lost due to trauma.
However, lately, he seems worried about something. He's been kind of quiet, and often skips lunch, too.
Even when I ask him what's the matter, he just smiles and says 'Oh, nothing'...

He says he'll tell me more sometime later...
I'm worried about him, but that kid must be grappling with something in his own mind.
Please go and help Dear, if you can.
MsgWelcome: Dear will be waiting for you, so go see if you can help him out.
MsgIncomplete: Dear will be waiting for you, so go see if you can help him out.

MsgSummary:
{c2}Dear Castine{/c} told you he's looking for {c3}Glittering Ornaments{/c}.
You should capture {c1}Black Breath Thieves or Black Breath Pickpockets{/c} and collect {c3}10 Glittering Ornaments{/c} and give them to {c2}Dear Castine{/c}.
You can find {c1}Black Breath Thieves and Black Breath Pickpockets{/c} northeast of Presya Manor.
MsgComplete: (he looks at what you have collected) ...No...this is glittering alright, but...I don't feel like this is what I'm looking for.
MsgTake:
A little while back, I started having these strong thoughts that I have to find something... I don't know exactly what it is, though. Whenever I try to remember, I get a bad headache.

One thing, though...I think what I'm looking for is something like 'Glittering Ornaments.' That's all I can remember. I tried to find some alone, but I haven't found any yet. There was one place I couldn't go because I was so scared...the place where the Black Breath Gang is staying. Can you go there and find 'em? If you find something glittering or shiny around there, please, bring it back to me. Be careful, though; it's a dangerous place.
MsgWelcome: Did you find any Glittering Ornaments?
MsgIncomplete: Did you find any Glittering Ornaments?
MsgResponse4: Did you find any Glittering Ornaments?

MsgSummary:
{c2}Dear Castine{/c} told you to find {c2}Balt Randolph{/c}, a warehouse keeper of Huigronn Stronghold and obtain information from him. 
You have to go to Huigronn Stronghold and find {c2}Balt Randolph{/c}, a warehouse keeper.
MsgComplete:
You must've heard I'm quite the talker, eh?

*hiccough* This is a warehouse, right?
MsgTake:
*sigh* Is there anyone who might know what kind of thing it is I'm looking for?

Hmm...wait a minute, Janet told me that she sometimes consults Balt, a warehouse keeper of Huigronn Stronghold. I'm wondering if Balt might be able to give us a clue. Please, will you go to Balt and ask him what he knows?

If he gives you any good leads, please find that 'Glittering Ornament' and bring it to me...
MsgWelcome: Haven't you visited Balt yet?
MsgIncomplete: Haven't you visited Balt yet?

MsgSummary:
{c2}Balt Randolph{/c} wants to take in a couple drinks with you.
If you want to obtain the information you want, it seems to be the best course of action. Once you select one, you can't choose it again, so be prudent in your drinking!
MsgComplete:
Fine~ hiccough, then among these three alcohols here~!
Which one do you want to quaff?
hiccough!
<I'd like to drink a sweet liquor.><I'd rather go with a normal Beaujalais Nouveau.><An expensive Glinfiddich would be okay..>
MsgTake:
I've got three children, see.
Ru is in Proelium Frontier, Nor lives in Cantabilian, and Grena resides in Adellia.
They're all totally rich! *hiccough*

'Cause of that, there's nothing I don't know - my children are everywhere.
The world's at my fingertips, hehe~

Just a glass-a booze makes me forget all my troubles; it's like alcohol is the key that opens up the gate to the world's pleasures~ *hiccough*
Just a few swigs and the world's all mine! *hic*

I'm feelin' good today; How's about you and I throw back a few pints together? Just wait a bit for me. *hic*

{c5}(He turns around and ambles toward the pub){/c}

MsgSummary:
{c2}Balt Randolph{/c} knows {c2}Steve Chaser{/c} in Argartes Supply Base very well.
In order to find out more about Glittering Ornaments, you'd do well to track down {c2}Steve Chaser{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Oh~ Did you come here to find information?
This is very good news~Haha~!

But.. hmm, Glittering_ornament~ What should I do?
Recently, I haven't heard something like that.
This is very strange, I can't believe there is a goods I haven't heard before in this area..!

<You urge him to think about it carefully one more time.><It seems you'd better go back to Balt again.>
MsgTake:
Sweet liquor?
Heh...I guess it's okay if you drink it once in a while, just for a change of pace.
But I don't like it much 'cause it's weak. I have a friend named Steve - this drink is as wishy-washy as his character.

If you'll buy his own self-assessment, he's 'very well informed about all kinds of things,' but he's not all that talkative, and when he does talk, he's not funny at all. Last time, when he came to drink with me, he said he found something like this 'Glittering Ornament' ya keep chattering on about.

As far as I know, he's currently living in Argartes Supply Base.
Ouch~! H..hey! Where are you going? I ain't even finished one glass of booze yet! *hiccough* Hey!
MsgWelcome:
The longer you live, the harder your life,
so drink up some booze and forget all the strife~ *hiccough*
MsgIncomplete:
The longer you live, the harder your life,
so drink up some booze and forget all the strife~ *hiccough*

QuestName: Beaujalais Nouveau: Cheese With Your Whine?
MsgSummary: {c2}Balt Randolph{/c} said if you need information, you ought to visit {c2}Nomion Melos{/c} and listen to his story. You have to find {c2}Nomion Melos{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Hey, what's up?
Ah, are you looking to make a purchase, by any chance?
MsgTake:
Haha...oh gawd, I can get drunk on Beaujalais Nauveau alone at home whenever I want. Guh-huh, I guess you're the kind who favors a languid drink, eh?

Ah~ That reminds me of this fella, Nomion - there's a perfect drinkin' buddy for ya.
He's really mellow, that one; he'll listen to yer life story; any tedious tale of love and woe you wanna pitch at him.

How 'bout you pay him a visit and learn how to be a good drinkin' buddy, eh? *hiccough*
MsgWelcome: I done said, you gotta visit Nomian~ *hiccough*
MsgIncomplete: I done said, you gotta visit Nomian~ *hiccough*

MsgSummary: {c2}Balt Randolph{/c} said a fisherman named {c2}Beluto{/c}, in Presya Manor, knows a lot that may help you. You have to go to Presya Manor and find {c2}Beluto{/c} the fisherman.
MsgComplete:
Hew, Please don't disturb my leisure time.
What can a fisherman like me know?
MsgTake:
Hoho! Are you really offering Glinfiddich?!
You're a buddy who really knows how to drink! Hehehe*hic*!

So I've got another drinkin' buddy, see.
There's a fisherman named Beluto; best drinkin' friend I've met so far in Presya Manor.

It seems he's got information about all sorts of things related to this district~ 
That's why he's such a good drinkin' buddy - I always learn somethin', y'see?

A little while ago, I heard that there was a lonely old woman in Presya Manor, so I got in touch with him and brought it up all casual-like while we were drinking.
He said 'I'll check it out right away.' Hehe...that's fast results! *hic*
MsgWelcome:
Hey there, fellow liquor-lover~
What did Beluto say?
MsgIncomplete:
Hey there, fellow liquor-lover~
What did Beluto say?

MsgSummary:
It seems there is no useful information you can obtain from {c2}Steve Chaser{/c}.
You'd better go back to {c2}Balt Randolph{/c} and hit him up for information again.
MsgComplete:
*hic* Hey, you look kinda familiar. Have we drank together before?

Then...uh...where'd I see you again? *hiccough*
If we haven't met before, how about grabbin' a drink with me? *hiccough* <This time, Beaujalais Nauveau would be great!><Why don't we try the expensive Glinfiddich?>
MsgTake:
It's too bad, man; I wish I was able to help you out.
I hope you find what you're lookin' for in the end.
Take care~
MsgWelcome: I thought you already left, didn't you?
MsgIncomplete: I thought you already left, didn't you?

MsgSummary: {c2}Nomion Melos{/c} gave you a {c3}Glinfiddich{/c}, saying it was the 'magic key'. It seems you'll get a good result if you give the {c3}Glinfiddich{/c} you received to {c2}Balt Randolph{/c}.
MsgComplete:
*hic* Hey, you look kinda familiar. Have we drank together before?

Then...uh...where'd I see you again? *hiccough*
If we haven't met before, how about grabbin' a drink with me?

Oh, what's this? A present for me? (he takes the bottle and looks at it) Oh my god, is it really Glinfiddich?!
MsgTake:
Haha...if you cater to Balt's higher tastes, he'll tell you whatever you want to know.

He begins the day talking and ends it still talking~ Of course, while he's under the influence, he says a bunch of stuff he probably shouldn't. Ah, why not try this?

{c5}(he hands you a Glinfiddich){/c}

Paid an arm and a leg for this bottle back when good liquor was the highlight of my life.

However, a while back, I quit drinking, 'cause the woman I'm in love with doesn't like alcohol.
Amazin' what a woman's influence will do, eh? Anyway...

That's why I don't have much use for this anymore, so I want you to take it.
I'm betting it'll be the magic key that opens that guy's mouth, haha!
MsgWelcome: Just give this to Balt and everything should work out a-okay.
MsgIncomplete: Just give this to Balt and everything should work out a-okay.

MsgSummary: {c2}Beluto{/c} said he'll look for information about the 'Glittering Ornament', and told you to wait for a while. You can talk to {c2}Beluto{/c} again after a while.
MsgComplete:
It seems there are three separate leads I can give you.
But...info ain't free; you'll have to pay for my services.
Just get the info you think sounds like the best lead first; that's my advice.
<Story about a Precious Stone><Story about a Glass Carving><Story about a Pendant>

MsgSummary:
{c2}Beluto{/c} gave you information about a Precioius Stone.
He said you have to find {c2}Henya Kind{/c}, a general dealer living in Presya Manor, and ask about a Precious Stone.
You just need to track down {c2}Henya Kind{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Are you here to see that precious stone I obtained a little while ago?
hoho~ I see~
MsgTake:
When it comes to glitering things, precious stones definitely fit that bill.
A little while ago, I heard that a general sundries dealer named Henya went to the capital and obtained a precious stone that sparkled with many colors from a fisherman.
You should find Henya and have him let you look at the stone. Then you can see whether it's what you're after.
MsgWelcome: Henya's currently doing business in Presya Manor.
MsgIncomplete: Henya's currently doing business in Presya Manor.

MsgSummary:
{c2}Henya Kind{/c} told you he'd swap his Precious Stone for a number of materials. You have to collect {c3}20 Magic Silks{/c} and give them to {c2}Henya Kind{/c}.
You can obtain {c3}Magic Silks{/c} from monsters or buy them from travelers in this area.
MsgComplete: Hoho, these are indeed Magic Silks of the finest quality! Well done, my young friend~
MsgTake:
You know what? I actually got this stone from a fisherman in the capital; traded him some of my goods in exchange for it.
According to his story, he found it in the belly of a fish he caught.

So, do you think this is the thing you're looking for? If so, I can give it to you.
Of course, you'll have to pay a fair market price for it - can't let it go for free, after all.

Right now, the market for Magic Silk is hot, hot, hot! Hotter than a naked Elf girl under a waterfall!
However, I've been having knee trouble, so I can't go out and collect them myself. I can hardly walk to the outhouse, even. I'm sure a strong person like you would have no trouble rounding up a couple Magic Silks on the quick, right? Hahaha~

All you have to do is bring me 20 Magic Silks. Do that and the Precious Stone's as good as yours. How's that for a deal?
MsgWelcome: How many Magic Silks have you collected~?
MsgIncomplete: How many Magic Silks have you collected~?
MsgResponse4: How many Magic Silks have you collected~?

MsgSummary:
You have obtained a {c3}Precious Stone{/c} from {c2}Henya Kind{/c}.
You have to let {c2}Dear Castine{/c} in Sidelos Refinery see the {c3}Precious Stone{/c} you obtained and ask if it's what he's looking for.
MsgComplete:
(he looks intently at the precious stone, turning it over in his hands) 

Hmm...honestly, I don't think this is what I'm looking for.
It wasn't so fancy and expensive like this.

I'm sorry to bother you again, but...do you think you could lend me your help again?
<I'll take a reward for what I have done and finish this job ><I'll help him a little bit more, seeing as he's so destitute and all...>
MsgTake:
Well, as I promised, I'll give this precious stone to you.
Take it; it's yours to do with as you please now.
Thanks again for those magic silks~
MsgWelcome: I already gave you the magic stone. Is there anything else I can sell you?
MsgIncomplete: I already gave you the magic stone. Is there anything else I can sell you?

MsgSummary:
{c2}Beluto{/c} gave you information about a Glass Carving.
He said you have to find {c2}Edel{/c}, a daughter of a lord living in Presya Manor and ask about a Glass Carving.
You'd better find {c2}Edel{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Are you here to look at the Glass Carving I own?
Alright, sure thing. How about you do something for me first, though?
MsgTake:
You mean that carving made from glass?
Well, that's also a glittering ornament, right?
I was told that Edel, a daughter of the Castellan, found a glass carving a while ago.

Perhaps no one's come to claim it so far...

You ought to go there and see if it's what you're looking for.
MsgWelcome: You can find Ms. Edel inside Presya Manor.
MsgIncomplete: You can find Ms. Edel inside Presya Manor.

MsgSummary:
{c2}Edel{/c} told you to exchange materials with her for the Glass Carving. 
You have to collect {c3}20 Silver Scissors{/c} and give them to {c2}Edel{/c}.
You can obtain {c3}Silver Scissors{/c} from monsters or buy them from travelers in this area.
MsgComplete: You have performed the job admirably. Well done.
MsgTake:
These days I'm collecting Silver Scissors.

If you collect about 20 Silver Scissors, I'll exchange it for this Carving.
I'll be waiting for you, then.
MsgWelcome: How many Silver Scissors have you collected?
MsgIncomplete: How many Silver Scissors have you collected?

MsgSummary:
You have obtained a {c3}Glass Carving{/c} from {c2}Edel{/c}.
You have to let {c2}Dear Castine{/c} in Sidelos Refinery see the {c3}Glass Carving{/c} you obtained and ask if it is what he's looking for.
MsgComplete:
(after looking at the Carving for a long time) 

Hmm...I don't think this is what I'm looking for.
The thing I'm looking for is...sparkly, but...it wasn't transparent like this.
I'm sorry to bother you again, but...can you help me one more time? Pretty please?
<I'll take a reward for what I've done and be done with this job. ><I'll help him a little bit more, seeing as he's in such pitiful straits.>
MsgTake:
Well, as I promised, I'll give this Glass Carving to you.
It's yours now; do with it as you please. Good day.
MsgWelcome: Haven't I given you the Glass Carving already?
MsgIncomplete: Haven't I given you the Glass Carving already?

MsgSummary:
In a flash of insight {c2}Dear Castine{/c} remembered that his 'Glittering Ornament' is a Pendant.
You have to find {c2}Beluto{/c} and ask him if he knows anything about a Pendant.
MsgComplete:
Again? you?
Ah, now you know exactly what you're looking for.
well, that is a good news.
MsgTake:
Actually I'm remembering a little bit now...
What I'm looking for...I think...it's a Pendant.

Yeah...I think that sparkling thing was a Pendant.

{c5}(frowning){/c}

If I try to remember too much, I get a bad headache. That's all I can tell you right now; I'm sorry I can't be of more help.
MsgWelcome: It was a Pendant; I'm quite sure of it now.
MsgIncomplete: It was a Pendant; I'm quite sure of it now.

MsgSummary:
{c2}Beluto{/c} gave you the information about a {c3}Pendant{/c}.
He gave you a nameless {c3}Pendant{/c} he owns and said you have to check it out.
You'd better go to {c2}Dear Castine{/c} and let her see a {c3}Pendant{/c}.
MsgTake:
Pendant? Hmm...actually, I just recently got my hands on this nameless pendant here.

Well, here. I don't know if this is what your patron is looking for, but I also found that thing on the side of the road, so I'll just give it to you.

As you can see, this thing's been around quite a while, judging by the number of scratches and dents on it. 
I don't think there's much in the way of monetary value in it.

Well, here you go.
I hope this'll be of some use to you. Anyway, I'm off to fish~
MsgWelcome: Is that Pendant what you were looking for?
MsgIncomplete: Is that Pendant what you were looking for?

MsgSummary:
The {c3}Pendant{/c} {c2}Beluto{/c} gave to you is not what {c2}Dear Castine{/c} is looking for.
You'd better give the {c3}Pendant{/c} back to {c2}Beluto{/c}.
MsgComplete:
This wasn't the right one?
Ah well, you don't have to bother bringing it back to me. Well, looks like you're having a rough day, huh? At least the job's over now.
And since you're free, how 'bout helping me out with something, then?

Shortly after you left, I got a request.
But these days I've got tons of work to do, so I need someone else's help. What do you think? <I've got no time to help a middle-aged man. I'll just receive compensation for what I've done so far and leave here.><I've got plenty of time, so it's okay. But you'll have to be more specific about the request before I accept.>
MsgTake:
It is...possible...? Ah, sorry.

{c5}(Dear says nothing for a long time, then begins talking again slowly){/c}

...I don't think this is what I have been looking for. I guess you'd better give it back to whoever you got it from.

What do do...
{c5}(Dear looks somewhat puzzled){/c}

Okay...I guess I'll ask someone else at a later time, then.
Thanks for all you've done for me.
MsgWelcome: That Pendant isn't mine; you should give it back to whoever you got it from.
MsgIncomplete: That Pendant isn't mine; you should give it back to whoever you got it from.

MsgSummary:
{c2}Beluto{/c} requested that you find a client of his.
Unexpectedly, this request also involves a {c3}Pendant{/c}.
You have to find a person named {c2}Estelle{/c} in the Au Bird Force Base Camp; she's missing a pendant that might be the one {c2}Beluto{/c} found.
MsgComplete:
Beluto sent you here?
Did he find the Pendant already?
MsgTake:
Alright then, let's look over the request, shall we?

{c2}(Beluto picks out a letter from a client and reads over it.){/c}

It says here the client is a person named Estelle in the Au Bird Force Base Camp.
The item this lady is looking for is a Pendant.
Haha, imagine that - a Pendant.
I guess I'm fortunate you brought it back. I think there's a good chance this lady might be the real owner. Why not go check it out?
MsgWelcome: Was the client the actual owner of the pendant?
MsgIncomplete: Was the client the actual owner of the pendant?

QuestName: Steve Tells it Like it is
MsgSummary:
{c2}Steve Chaser{/c} told you about a fisherman in Presya Manor named {c2}Beluto{/c} who might be privy to some useful information.
You'd better go to Presya Manor and look for {c2}Beluto{/c} the fisherman.
MsgComplete:
What brought you here again?
Geez, can't you leave me be? I just want to fish, that's all.
MsgTake:
Hmmm...ah, yes, that's who'd be good!
I have a friend who I'm sure will know a lot of things that even I don't know.
Why don't you find him and ask him about what you're interested in?

His name is Beluto; he lives a little ways away from here.

According to him, he's 'just a fisherman,' but he really does have a lot of info close at hand. Well...except, for the fact that his info isn't as detailed as MY info, of course.
I guess maybe you'll at least get a lead, though.
Hahaha~ Good luck to you!

Where's he living, you ask?
Ah...I think you can find him near Presya Manor.
MsgWelcome: Did you find Beluto?
MsgIncomplete: Did you find Beluto?

MsgSummary:
Fortunately it turned out a {c3}Pendant{/c} you took was {c2}Estelle{/c}'s one.
You'd better stop by {c2}Beluto{/c} and tell him you carried out the request safely.
MsgComplete:
Really? That is a good news.
But you got to do one more thing for me.
No, it's supposed to be your job starkly, but..
MsgTake:
Ah, Thank the Goddess...! Thank you!

This pendant is truly precious to me.
When I lost it, I just didn't know what to do.
I feel so lucky that you managed to come across it when you did.
It seems that Beluto is just as savvy and competent as the rumors say.
Please go to him and thank him for all his help. And thank you too, of course.
MsgWelcome: Please express my gratitude to Beluto~
MsgIncomplete: Please express my gratitude to Beluto~

MsgSummary:
{c2}Beluto{/c} said he got a lead on where another Pendant can be found.
You have to go there and try to get the Pendant.
Once you capture a {c1}Black Breath Grave Digger{/c} and obtain a Pendant, you'd better go back to Dear, your original client, and see if it might be the thing he's looking for.
MsgTake:
I was worried about whether or not that Pendant would be the right one, so I looked into the matter myself.
Chances are, we'll find one if we investigate the place where Black Breath Grave Diggers are living.

Well, it doesn't matter anymore because the Pendant I had really was the one she was looking for.
When you came to me the first time, you also said you're looking for a Pendant, didn't you?

If you want to finish things up with your previous client, why not find this other Pendant and bring it to him? This might be your lucky strike.

I suppose if you rummage around the place the Black Breath Gang currently occupies, it is very possible you'll find that Pendant.
If you find it, you'd best go to your first see if he recognizes it.
MsgWelcome: Did you find that Pendant?
MsgIncomplete: Did you find that Pendant?

MsgSummary:
The Pendant turned out to be {c2}Dear Castine{/c}'s pendant after all.
{c2}Dear Castine{/c} told you a strange story, and asks you to express his gratitude to {c2}Beluto{/c}.
You have to go back to {c2}Beluto{/c} and tell him what {c2}Dear Castine{/c} said.
MsgComplete:
Ah, really? It's a good stroke of luck to re-unite something like that with its original owner.

Anyway, don't you think it's odd that those two Pendants have the same shape?

Just now, that Pendant you gave to your client...it looks almost the same as the one you returned to Estelle earlier.

The photo in the Pendant looks like her too, doesn it? ...Ah well...I'm not supposed to get too involved with clients' personal circumstances and stories. You might enjoy a little poking around, though...

You did a fine job. I'll see you later~
MsgTake:
Ah, I see...this Pendant is one you just recently found, right?

Hmm... 
(Dear opens the Pendant carefully and checks inside)

Y..yes. This...I'm sure this is mine.
Heh...I thought I'd lost it forever...
I just tried to forget that I had ever owned it.
I just wanted to forget this memory and person forever..

...Please tell Beluto I really feel thankful for all the help.
MsgWelcome: H..haven't you left yet?
MsgIncomplete: H..haven't you left yet?

MsgSummary:
{c2}Estelle{/c} told you that she's looking for someone.
After she heard {c2}Dear Castine{/c}'s story, which sounds oddly familiar, she wants to investigate. She wants you to find {c2}Dear Castine{/c} and ask him if he knows of someone named {c2}Estelle{/c}.
MsgComplete:
{c5}(Dear snapped to attention when you asked him if he knows a lady named Estelle){/c}

..What did you just say..? Estelle..?
MsgTake:
Thank you very much. This...
This pendant is very precious to me..

I used to have a person I loved deeply.
He was kind and good, and I knew I would be happy with him.

However, my parents were opposed to our marriage - the only reason they ever gave was that he was a human, not an Elf like us. But that didn't matter to me at all.

But...one day, all of a sudden he ...left for the battlefield. without saying anything.

All I could think of was that I had to find him, by any means necessary. That's why I came to this place, the site of the last battle I know he took part in...

Actually, I'd like you to do one more favor for me, if you wold.
A little while ago, someone I know said he saw someone who looks very similar to him in the Sidelos Refinery...
I was told the man goes by the name of Dear..
Can you go to Dear and ask him if he remembers someone named 'Estelle'?
If he's the person I'm looking for, he'll definitely give you an affirmative answer.
MsgWelcome: Have you asked Dear as I requested?
MsgIncomplete: Have you asked Dear as I requested?

MsgSummary:
{c2}Dear Castine{/c} seems to know {c2}Estelle{/c}.
He said if he can find his lost Pendant, he'll be able to meet {c2}Estelle{/c}.
You have to defeat {c1}Black Breath Grave Diggers{/c} and find {c3}Dear's Pendant{/c}, then give it to {c2}Dear Castine{/c}.
MsgTake:
...That Pendant you brought to me before...
I thought it was too improbable to be true, but...Estelle...is she really...here?

...But why? She was the one who said goodbye and....left me first...

Because....I'm not an elf....
...I have no idea what's happened.

{c5}(Dear remains silent for a while, then begins to talk again){/c}

I have to find the lost Pendant...
Once I find it... I think I'll be able... to meet her..
MsgWelcome: I have to find that Pendant. If I can, then...
MsgIncomplete: I have to find that Pendant. If I can, then...

MsgSummary:
{c2}Dear Castine{/c} asked you to let {c2}Estelle{/c} see the Pendant you found and tell her of his story.

You have to find {c2}Estelle{/c} and deliver the Pendant, along with {c2}Dear Castine{/c}'s story.
MsgComplete:
{c5}(Estelle listens to the whole story, shedding tears after looking at the Pendant you brought){/c}

So he was really Richard after all. That letter was...a fake our family fabricated...
Haha...it's strange how these things work out, isn't it?

Thank you so much...
Now, finding him in person is the only thing left.
I really appreciate all you've done for us.
MsgTake:
I used to go by another name...Richard Tellan.

And I loved an Elven maiden named Estelle Marymore.
However, one day I received a letter from her bidding me goodbye. From that day forward, I felt I had been abandoned.

Right after that, I voluntarily joined the army.
I intended to die on the battlefield without anyone knowing.
However...I somehow survived like this, and now...she...Estelle is looking for me...

...Perhaps one last time, I'll summon up the faith to believe.
Just like this Pendant that came back even though I lost it,
her feelings are also coming back to me again.
MsgWelcome: Please tell Estelle what I've said.
MsgIncomplete: Please tell Estelle what I've said.

MsgSummary: The Alliance of Light's Supply Manager wants {c3}Old Boots, Austin Bread, and Rusty Axes{/c}. You can obtain these items from the {c1}monsters of Erina{/c}. Hurry, because it won't be long before the manager resumes his journey.
MsgComplete:
There isn't much time left. The promised date isn't far now...
Here...take this. Go to the recruiting officer and you may hear some good news.
MsgTake: Hush. There are presently things afoot that not many may know of. How committed are you to the Light? Have you entertained thoughts of joining the Union of Fury? Come; with your able body and the spirit I see in your eyes, I think you'll make an apt patriot. Will you lend me your aid? Our military is running low on certain supplies; we need old boots, Austin bread, and some rusty axes. Bring them, and I'll fill you in on all the details of the war with the Union of Fury. But do not tarry; I must move on before long.
MsgWelcome: I've still a long way to go. There must be more efficient ways of rationing our small quantities of supplies.
MsgIncomplete: I've still a long way to go. There must be more efficient ways of rationing our small quantities of supplies.

MsgSummary: The Supply Manager for the Alliance of Light wants {c3}Cactus Leaf{/c} to use in concealment strategies. It can be obtained from {c1}Spirits and Zombies from Erina and monsters at Cloron Lair{/c}. Hurry, because it won't be long before the manager resumes his journey.
MsgComplete:
These look good. Your loyalty is worthy of emulation, friend!
I'll get you those curtains, so hang onto them this time.
MsgTake:
So, have you been to see the recruiting officer? Hmm...what's that? You lost the curtain I gave you? It's your fault for not hanging onto it, so don't try to lay the blame on others. Anyway, thanks to you, we almost have enough supplies. Even so, time is running out; I don't know whether we can make it. That being the case, I have one more favor to ask. 

You may know that those of the Union of Fury have senses of smell stronger than Humans or Elves. However, their night vision is actually weak. Go and hunt some Orcs and Ogres in Cloron, as well as whatever other spirits, ghosts, and zombies you can rummage up. They all carry cacti, and I want you to obtain the leaves of these cacti. They've got a certain property that'll go a long way toward concealing our ambushes.
MsgWelcome: If we can hide our scent at night, the Deatheaters will be as good as blind to our presence.
MsgIncomplete: If we can hide our scent at night, the Deatheaters will be as good as blind to our presence.

MsgSummary:
We need {c3}sleep cure scrolls, stop cure scrolls, and slow move cure scrolls{/c} to fight back. They can be obtained from the {c1}monsters in the Erina district{/c}.
These will be useful in the battles to come. 
Hurry, because it won't be long before the manager resumes his journey.
MsgComplete:
Looks like you're an old hand at this, haha!
Here's another curtain for your efforts. This time, the recruiting officer's gotta acknowledge your competence.
MsgTake:
What did the recruiting officer say? Ah...you didn't have enough curtains? Haha!
Alright then, maybe we can strike a deal.
You know the Proelium Frontier, right?
If those Fury soldiers are affected by both "stop" and "slow move" attacks, they know their time's as good as up. Same goes for us too, unfortunately.
So of course, I always feel safer when I'm packing cure scrolls in my bag.
Please get me a sleep cure scroll, a stop cure scroll, and a slow move cure scroll.
You probably won't have an easy time of it, so I got you a rifle candle, cruits, and some magic herbs.
Thank you for helping bolster the strength of our forces.
{c5}(the manager speaks aloud to no one in particular){/c}
Of course, one could always buy them from the medicine merchant...
MsgWelcome: In Proelium, it's best to possess the high ground.
MsgIncomplete: In Proelium, it's best to possess the high ground.

MsgSummary:
The Manager of Light is looking for {c3} Cream Bread, Poison Linz, and Red Rose {/c} to contaminate the Union of Fury's food as well as to bolster the Alliance's food supply. 
These items can be obtained from {c1}the monsters in Willieoseu{/c}. 
Hurry, because it won't be long before the manager resumes his journey.
MsgComplete:
Poison Linz is highly toxic; I hope you didn't get any in your wounds.
You've proven your loyalty, friend. Please take these 3 curtains to the recruiting officer.
MsgTake:
Have we met before? You're looking hale; I like the healthy shine in your eyes. As you can see, we're busy preparing for battle. Our target is currently a secret, but know that if we succeed, we will surely deal a blow to them.

My request is for you to gather some items I need while the enemy's attention is not fully focused here. In the Union of Fury, the sweetness of Cream Bread makes it a favorite food. But while we fight them, we can add Poison Linz and Rose to the bread! I get giddy just thinking about them downing our Linz bread after a battle~ 
Of course, this is a secret between you and me - don't tell another soul.
MsgWelcome: Work made you hungry? Hear, try some of my special Linz bread! Haha...I'm just kidding, y'know.
MsgIncomplete: Work made you hungry? Hear, try some of my special Linz bread! Haha...I'm just kidding, y'know.

MsgSummary:
The Supply Manager of Light has asked you to find an {c3}Ax, Large Ax, and Lugs{/c} for building a marine ship. 
These items can be obtained from {c1} monsters in Willieoseu{/c}. 
Hurry, because it won't be long before the manager resumes his journey.
MsgComplete: This situation is favorable to us. You must keep this secret to yourself while the war is still being fought.
MsgTake:
I'll tell you why I've collected all these items.
Do you know what gives us a military advantage over the Union of Fury? It's the marine superioritiy of the humans!
Even the elves praise our naval competence. The key strategem in this war will be the naval power of the human forces. With that, we can take the war even to a distant shore.
I need your help to get some equipment for me. Please find an ax, a large ax, and some lugs. These will help me outfit the ship to be more effective.
Don't doubt your loyalty to the Alliance; we'll come out on top in the end.
MsgWelcome: We have enough ships, but each one must be soundly outfitted. Fortune favors the prepared, you know.
MsgIncomplete: We have enough ships, but each one must be soundly outfitted. Fortune favors the prepared, you know.

MsgSummary:
The Supply Manager of Light has asked you to find {c3}faint cure scrolls, silence cure scrolls, and darkness cure scrolls{/c} to resist the enemy. They can be obtained from the {c1}monsters in Willieoseu{/c}.
The potions should come in handy during this quest. 
Hurry, because it won't be long before the manager resumes his journey.
MsgComplete: As two people work together, their trust in each other increases, don't you think? With each success you meet with, victory is that much closer to being in our hands.
MsgTake:
Can you talk with the recruiting officer?
I trust the Elves; they're our benefactors who gave us a helping hand when we migrated here from the other world so long ago. You might say they're our 'mentors,' in a way.

I've enjoyed these little chats we've had; it adds some flavor to my day.
Please bring me faint, silence, and darkness cure scrolls. I needn't tell you how useful they are for any soldier to carry. I've prepared some potions to aid you.
I know such items can be gotten from medicine merchants, but your efforts result in better quality, not to mention you're faster.
MsgWelcome: Elves may seem brusque in their mannerisms, but they're actually quite kind-hearted.
MsgIncomplete: Elves may seem brusque in their mannerisms, but they're actually quite kind-hearted.

MsgSummary: The Supply Manager of Light has asked you to find {c3}red meat, dry firewood, and a hoe{/c}. These items can be obtained from the {c1}monsters in Adellia and D-Water Borderland, as well as those in Willieoseu{/c}. Hurry, because it won't be long before the manager resumes his journey.
MsgComplete: Even a perfect plan can have unexpected results; situations change all the time. We can help a plan have the greatest chance of success by carefully preparing for as many potential outcomes as possible. Now, take these 3 curtains and find the recruiting officer in the capitol.
MsgTake:
Looks like I need to start saving up some food.
I had thought the reserves I had would be enough for a long term battle, but I suppose it was foolish to think the fighting might be over before that supply ran out.
I need to prepare some dried meat. Red meat from Adellia makes for good jerky.
Can you get me some red meat, dry firewood, and a hoe? That'd last me the rest of the journey. Be quick about it; I'm always on the move.
MsgWelcome: Har har...can you find me a really good hoe? *wink*
MsgIncomplete: Dry food is much lighter to carry, actually.

MsgSummary:
The Supply Manager of Light has asked you to find {c3}cure potions and abolition potions{/c} to aid in the battle. They can be obtained from the {c1}monsters at Adellia{/c}.
The potions should come in handy during this quest. 
Hurry, because it won't be long before the manager resumes his journey.
MsgComplete: Excellent. We're stockpiling items at a good rate through the combined efforts of our Light allies. Here's a curtain you ought to find useful.
MsgTake:
I overheard from the recruiting officer; he said that defeating the Union of Fury wouldn't be easy.
They possess hidden siege weapons that could overcome our fortifications.
We must stockpile cure potions and abolition potions in order to confront them. Will you aid me in collecting both potions? I have a feeling that a battle will break out before too long.
By the by, the stuff the medicine merchant sells won't do for my purposes; you must collect them yourself.
MsgWelcome: Hmmm...in what way might a potion be stronger than a siege weapon?
MsgIncomplete: Hmmm...in what way might a potion be stronger than a siege weapon?

MsgSummary: The Supply Manager of Light has asked you to find {c3}magic alchemy powder, magic iron powder, and blood crystal{/c}. They can be obtained from {c1}field monsters in D-Water Borderland and Adellia{/c}. Hurry, because it won't be long before the manager resumes his journey.
MsgComplete:
My thanks to you; your help truly moves the heart of the Goddess.
Be ready for the sight of our troops returning victorious!
I look forward to seeing the fruits of your excursion into Skulleron.
MsgTake:
It seems our tactics have met with success.
The only preparation left is the Ides Ranger Army of Ezekiel.
The last area is the rear part of Fury territory, Skulleron.
Our strategy will bring us victory by leveraging the Humans' naval prowess and the Elves' Ides Rangers.
The next task set before you is to bring me magic alchemy powder, magic iron powder, and blood crystal.
These items are necessary for preparing magic medicine and crafting mystic weapons.
Are you up to the challenge?
MsgWelcome: It won't be long now 'till we meet again in Skulleron...
MsgIncomplete: It won't be long now 'till we meet again in Skulleron...

MsgSummary:
The Elven recruiting officer wants the {c3}Supply Manager's Curtains{/c}. 
Talk to the Supply Manager of Light. 
Hurry, because it won't be long before the manager resumes his journey.
MsgComplete:
Well done. Take this bracelet as a reward for your hard work.
May you live to see the days of glory!
MsgTake:
Greetings, friend. I look forward to the next battle.
Would you join us in our crusade? Talk to the supply manager - he'll guide you on what needs to be done in the Alliance of Light.
You'll have my trust once you bring me the curtains from the supply manager, and I shall see that you are justly rewarded for your work.
MsgWelcome: Are you giving your all for the Light? The Goddess Etain is always watching us.
MsgIncomplete: Are you giving your all for the Light? The Goddess Etain is always watching us.

MsgSummary:
The Elven recruiting officer wants {c3}2 Supply Manager's Curtains{/c}. 
Talk to the Supply Manager of Light. 
Hurry, because it won't be long before the manager resumes his journey.
MsgComplete:
Well done. Here's a bracelet in commemoration of your hard work.
May your days be blessed with golden light~
MsgTake:
Time is marching on for us, but there are still a great many things that need doing.
Talk to the supply manager and he'll let you know what you can do for the Alliance of Light. You'll have my trust once you get the curtain from the supply manager. I'll see to it that you're rewarded as well.
Never feel that the sacrifices you make for the Light are worth nothing.
MsgWelcome: Are you sacrificing yourself for the Light? The Goddess Etain is always watching us.
MsgIncomplete: Are you sacrificing yourself for the Light? The Goddess Etain is always watching us.

MsgSummary:
The Elven recruiting officer wants {c3}3 Supply Manager's Curtains{/c}. 
Talk to the Supply Manager of Light. 
Hurry, because it won't be long before the manager resumes his journey.
MsgComplete:
Well done. I have a ring to give you, in commemoration of your hard work.
May the paths you walk be threaded with gold~
MsgTake:
The time 'till battle draws ever nearer, but many things still remain to be done.
Talk to the supply manager and he'll let you know what you can do for the Alliance of Light. You'll have my trust once you get the curtain from the supply manager. I'll see to it that you're rewarded as well.
Never feel that the sacrifices you make for the Light are worth nothing.
MsgWelcome: Are you sacrificing yourself for the Light? The Goddess Etain is always watching us.
MsgIncomplete: Are you sacrificing yourself for the Light? The Goddess Etain is always watching us.

MsgSummary:
The Elven recruiting officer wants {c3}3 Supply Manager's Curtains{/c}. 
Talk to the Supply Manager of Light. 
Hurry, because it won't be long before the manager resumes his journey.
MsgComplete:
Excellent work. Take this necklace; a small repayment for your hard work.
I wish that all your days might be joyous ones. Now, however, it is time for me to return to Skulleron.
MsgTake:
Friend, you well deserve the respect you have earned. However, there are still a great many tasks before us. 
Talk to the supply manager and he'll let you know what you can do for the Alliance of Light. You'll have my trust once you get the curtain from the supply manager. I'll see to it that you're rewarded as well.
Never feel that the sacrifices you make for the Light are worth nothing.
MsgWelcome: Are you sacrificing yourself for the Light? The Goddess Etain is always watching us.
MsgIncomplete: Are you sacrificing yourself for the Light? The Goddess Etain is always watching us.

MsgSummary: The Supply Manager of Fury wants {c3} Old Boots, Austin Bread, and Rusty Ax {/c}. You can obtain these items from {c1}monsters in the Reikeuseu district{/c}. Hurry because the manager won't stay here long.
MsgComplete:
Time is a resource we never seem to have enough of. The promised time is not far off...
Here; take this. Go to the recruiting officer in Iris and you might hear some good news.
MsgTake:
Hush...keep this under your hat. There are things afoot right now that should be known only to a few. How committed are you to the Union of Fury? Have you thought of defecting to the Alliance of Light? Do not sway in your dedication. With your strong build and the fire in your eyes, I can tell you're brimful with the spirit of one dedicated to their cause. Will you lend me your aid? 

Our military supplies have dwindled over time. Please gather up some Old Boots, Austin Bread, and Rusty Axes. If you do this for me, I'll reveal to you further details regarding the war against the Alliance of Light. But do not tarry, for soon my work will require me to move on.
MsgWelcome: We've a long way to go. There must be more efficent ways we can use our supplies...
MsgIncomplete: We've a long way to go. There must be more efficent ways we can use our supplies...

MsgSummary: The Supply Manager of Fury wants {c3}Cactus Leaf{/c} to counteract the Alliance of Light's stealth tactics. It can be obtained from the {c1}monsters in Reikeuseu{/c}. Hurry, because the manager won't stay here long.
MsgComplete:
Ah, everything is as I requested. You're someone I can count on!
I'll get you those curtains, so take good care of 'em.
MsgTake:
So, did you talk with the recruiting officer? Did you lose the curtain I gave you? Bah; it's your fault for not keeping a closer watch on it, so don't try to pass the blame somewhere else. Because of you, we've nearly got enough supplies, but time is still short. Honestly, I don't know whether we'll be able to make it. 

I have one more favor to ask of you. The Light knows that we have a powerful sense of smell, and in order to go undetected by our noses, we've heard word that they're concealing their scent with cactus leaves. However, we can overcome their trickery with preparation - that is, to become familiar with the scent of the cactus. They'll never guess that we'll turn their own tactics against them!
MsgWelcome: Elven Rangers can appear anywhere, at any time, so we have to be able to detect their approach as soon as possible.
MsgIncomplete: Elven Rangers can appear anywhere, at any time, so we have to be able to detect their approach as soon as possible.

MsgSummary:
We need {c3}sleep cure scrolls, stop cure scrolls, and slow move cure scrolls{/c} to fight back. They can be obtained from {c1} monsters at Reikeuseu {/c}.
These will be useful in the battles to come. 
Hurry, because the manager won't stay here long.
MsgComplete:
You make this kind of thing look like a breeze, heh!
Here's another curtain. With this, the recruiting officer will have to acknowledge your skill.
MsgTake:
How did things go with the recruiting officer? Hmm...what's that? Not enough curtains? Hahaha!
Alright, we can fix that right up. Just...do me this favor, see...
You know about Proelium Frontier, right?
If the Light receive both "stop" and "slow move" attacks, they ain't likely to survive too long out there - and the same goes for us, tough as we are.
That's why I feel safer when I carry these cure scrolls in my bag.
Go and get me a sleep cure scroll, stop cure scroll, and slow move cure scroll.
This won't be a walk down easy street, so I got you a rifle candle, some fruits, and magic herbs.
Thanks for your continued efforts to bolster our army's strength.
{c5}(the manager speaks aloud to no one in particular){/c}
They can be bought from the medicine merchant, though...
MsgWelcome: This is the Proelium high ground.
MsgIncomplete: Looks like this is a "scroll-ing level!"

MsgSummary:
The Supply Manager of Fury is looking for {c3}Cream Bread{/c}, as well as {c3}Poison Linz and Red Rose{/c} to contaminate the Light's food as well as restock our own food supply. 
These items can be obtained from the {c1}monsters in the Keuraijen district{/c}. 
Hurry, because the manager won't stay here long.
MsgComplete:
Poison Linz packs a wallop. Those Light-side bastards won't know what hit 'em!
Good work, friend.
Go on and take these 3 curtains to the recruiting officer, courtesy of me.
MsgTake:
Have we met before? You're lookin' good; a nice fire burnin' in your eyes. As you can see, we're busy with battle preparations. I'm not at liberty to name our targets, but I know this'll hit 'em like a punch in the face! While their attention is focused elsewhere, I'd like you to get some items for me. 

The Light Forces love the sweetness of Cream bread, and they like the smell of roses, cause they're sissies! You can add Poison Linz to the braed and roses while we fight them. I'd pay a thousand gold to see them keel over at the dinner table after sampling our Linz bread! Oh...and I think it goes without saying, but keep your lips zipped about this here plan, okay?
MsgWelcome: Looks like you're workin' hard! Here, have a Linz sandwich! Ah-haha; just foolin' with ya.
MsgIncomplete: Looks like you're workin' hard! Here, have a Linz sandwich! Ah-haha; just foolin' with ya.

MsgSummary:
The Supply Manager of Fury has asked you to find an {c3}Ax, Large Ax, and Lugs {/c} for building a siege weapon. These items can be obtained from the {c1}monsters at Keuraijen{/c}. 
Hurry, because the manager won't stay here long.
MsgComplete: Things are looking good for us right now. But keep it to yourself; a war's not won until it's over.
MsgTake:
I'll tell you why we've collected all these items.
Do you know what makes our ground forces superior to those of the Alliance of Light? It's our quality siege-engines!

Even the Elves are forced to admit the effectiveness of our siege weapons. It's one of our best technologies.
I need your help with something related to that. Please get me an ax, a large ax, and some lugs. With these, I can make the necessary alterations and upgrades to our siege engines.
Don't ever doubt your loyalty to the Union of Fury.
MsgWelcome: In war, there's no such thing as "too much preparation."
MsgIncomplete: In war, there's no such thing as "too much preparation."

MsgSummary:
The Supply Manager of Fury has asked you to find {c3}faint cure scrolls, silence cure scrolls, and darkness cure scrolls{/c} to defend against the Alliance. They can be obtained from {c1}monsters in Keuraijen{/c}.
These potions will probably come in handy. 
Hurry, because the manager won't stay here long.
MsgComplete: On this eve of war, what is there to be said? You've earned your trust in full with the labors you've done for me. Because of you, our victory is that much more certain.
MsgTake:
Can you talk with the recruiting officer? We've come to be friends, right?
You don't have much experience in war. You're so anxious that it's holdin' you back from saying what you wanna say. Please, bring me a faint, silence, and darkness cure scroll. Certainly you're familiar with their usefulness. I've prepared some potions to aid you in your quest, so make haste.
I know I can get them from the medicine merchant, but those you collect from natural sources are of a better quality.
MsgWelcome: We all must fight as one! This is what it means to be a "Union of Fury!"
MsgIncomplete: We all must fight as one! This is what it means to be a "Union of Fury!"

MsgSummary: The Supply Manager of Fury has asked you to find {c3}red meat, dry firewood, and a hoe{/c}. These items can be obtained from {c1}Landers near the Arena, Adrian, and D-Water Borderland, and monsters in Keuraijen's Aidion Nekria Dungeon {/c}. Hurry, because the manager won't stay here long.
MsgComplete: Even the most perfect of plans can ultimately have unexpected results. The situation can change completely in just a moment! That's why any good plan must take into account many different potential outcomes in order to succeed. You've gotta get 3 curtains and find the recruiting officer in the capitol.
MsgTake:
I have to gather some food for my journey.
I thought what I'd packecd would be enough even if the battle became drawn-out - what a fool I was!
I have to prepare enough jerky, and red meat makes good jerky.
