Hey...could you go get me some red meat, dry firewood, and a hoe? With that, I could last the remainder of the journey. I'm on a schedule here...you think you can make it?
MsgWelcome: Dry meats are great...snap into a SLIM JIM, YEAAAAARGH!
MsgIncomplete: Dry meats are great...snap into a SLIM JIM, YEAAAAARGH!

MsgSummary:
The Supply Manager of Fury has asked you to find a {c3}cure potion and abolition potion{/c} to aid the war effort. They can be obtained from {c1}monsters at Adrian{/c}.
The potions he's given you will come in handy. 
Hurry, because the manager won't stay here long.
MsgComplete: Good work. Through the efforts of the Union members, we almost have enough items. This curtain ought to prove quite useful for you.
MsgTake:
I was talking with the recruiting officer, and y'know what he told me? "The Alliance of Light aren't a bunch of pushovers. Their naval superiority could keep us from victory."
What we've gotta do is prepare cure potions and abolition potions in advance, in order to confront them.
Would you help me collect both potions? I need you to get them without going to the medicine seller.
But don't tarry; it is not long before the battle shall be joined...
MsgWelcome: How might a humble potion stand against human naval power...
MsgIncomplete: How might a humble potion stand against human naval power...

MsgSummary: The Supply Manager of Fury has asked you to find {c3}magic alchemy powder, magic iron powder, and blood crystal{/c}. They can be obtained from {c1}field monsters in the D-Water Borderland and Adrian{/c}. Hurry, because the manager won't stay here long.
MsgComplete:
A great thanks are owed you, friend; your kind help surely moves the heart of the Goddess.
I look forward to seeing the results of your exploits in Astenes.
When you return, be ready to see our troops return victorious!
MsgTake:
We are close to the success we have so longed for.
The only preparation left involves the Ides Ranger Army of Ezekiel.
The last area is the rear part of the Alliance of Light's territory, Astenes~ 
Judicious leverage of our siege engines and assassins will bring victory into our grasp.
I ask that you bring me some magic alchemy powder, magic iron powder, and blood crystal.
These items are necessary for making not only magic medicine, but also synthesizing mystic weapons.
Are you up to the task?
MsgWelcome: It's not too long 'till we meet again in Astenes.
MsgIncomplete: It's not too long 'till we meet again in Astenes.

MsgSummary:
The Deatheater recruiting officer wants a {c3}Supply Manager's Curtain{/c}. 
Talk to the Supply Manager of Fury. 
Hurry, because the manager won't stay here long.
MsgComplete:
Well done. Take this bracelet to commemorate your accomplishment.
For the glory of the Union of Fury!
MsgTake:
Hello, comrade. I look forward to the battles a new day will bring!
Do you wish to yoke your strength with ours? Talk to the supply manager and he'll tell you what's to be done in the Union of Fury.
Once you get the curtain from the supply manager, you'll have my trust, and a nice reward besides.
MsgWelcome: Are you truly a devout of the way of Fury? Our Goddess knows the true heart of all men.
MsgIncomplete: Are you truly a devout of the way of Fury? Our Goddess knows the true heart of all men.

MsgSummary:
The Deatheater recruiting officer wants {c3}2 Supply Manager's Curtains{/c}. 
Talk to the Supply Manager of Fury. 
Hurry, because the manager won't stay here long.
MsgComplete:
Well done. Here is a bracelet to celebrate your contributions to the war effort.
Glory to the Union of Fury!
MsgTake:
So, we meet again. Time is slipping away, as sands in the glass, yet many things remain undone.
Talk to the supply manager and he'll guide you on what needs to be done for the Union of Fury. Once you've obtained the curtain from the supply manager, you will have my trust, and a suitable reward besides.
Never feel that your sacrifices for the Union of Fury don't make a difference.
MsgWelcome: Are you truly a devout of the way of Fury? Our Goddess knows the true heart of all men.
MsgIncomplete: Are you truly a devout of the way of Fury? Our Goddess knows the true heart of all men.

MsgSummary:
The Deatheater recruiting officer wants {c3}3 Supply Manager's Curtains{/c}. 
Talk to the supply manager of Fury. 
Hurry, because the manager won't stay here long.
MsgComplete:
Good job, comrade! Here, take this ring as a reward for your accomplishments.
Glory to the Union of Fury!
MsgTake:
Well well! Looks like you deserve some applause! But there are still things to be done before your standing ovation.
Chat up the supply manager again and he'll let you in on what you can do for the Union of Fury. Get the curtains from him and I'll reward you with something both decorative and functional.
Always remember that your contributions make a difference!
MsgWelcome: Are you truly a devout of the way of Fury? Our Goddess knows the true heart of all men.
MsgIncomplete: Are you truly a devout of the way of Fury? Our Goddess knows the true heart of all men.

MsgSummary:
The Deatheater recruiting officer wants {c3} 3 Supply Manager's Curtains {/c}. 
Talk to the Supply Manager of Fury. 
Hurry, because the manager won't stay here long.
MsgComplete:
Ah, if only all my subordinates were as able as you! Here, take this ring. I acknowledge your many valuable services performed.
The time has come for me to return to Astene. If your work here is done, I invive you to follow me there.
May the Union of Fury live long upon this land!
MsgTake:
Well well! Looks like you deserve some applause! But there are still things to be done before your standing ovation. 
Chat up the supply manager again and he'll let you in on what you can do for the Union of Fury. Get the curtains from him and I'll reward you with something both decorative and functional.
Always remember that your contributions make a difference!
MsgWelcome: After all this, you want to know "why curtains?" Well...it's because I'm redoing the window blinds at my house.
MsgIncomplete: Are you truly a devout of the way of Fury? Our Goddess knows the true heart of all men.
MsgResponse4: After all this, you want to know "why curtains?" Well...it's because I'm redoing the window blinds at my house.

MsgSummary:
Henya Kind is looking for a sister who left for Skulleron.
You have to transfer to Skulleron via Phershi Elneny, a gatekeeper of Huigronn Stronghold, and find {c2}Keidline Kind{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Ah, shame on that old woman. She's too old to be acting this way.

If you happen to meet my sister again, please tell her I'm living very well~

I don't understand why she's telling a strange story to travelers, forgetting to take care of her old body ...I suppose my sister is very old as well~ You must've had a hard time coming all this way. I've got nothing to give you, but just use this as traveling expenses~ There are plenty of marvelous things to look at here, but also many dangerous guys around, so make sure you don't walk around either alone or at night ~
MsgTake:
Hey, sonny~ Why are you still hanging around here? Haven't you heard the rumor?
The Spinterr Resistence's commanding officer, Iskiel, carried out a successful operation~
It means Skulleron, which used to be an hellhole of Union of Fury soldiers, has now become a place we can live too~
We can't walk directly inside, of course, but now anyone can move somewhere else, since Phershi Elneny manages the gate in Huigronn Stronghold. Heh heh!

{c5}(Henya Kind breathes a deep sigh){/c}

I can't quit what I'm doing here and just leave, but... 
My sister left for Skulleron after a long career taking care of the children of the Elneny family, an Elven house. She used to be a nanny in the Elneny house, but she made up her mind to settle down in Skulleron in order to rebuild her life now that the Elneny children have grown to adulthood.
But those children, bless their hearts; they said they couldn't leave their old nanny behind and decied to follow her. Luckily the eldest child, Phershi, is a gatekeeper who deals with moving travelers from Huigronn Stronghold to Skulleron, so it wasn't difficult at all getting her over the district border.
However, I feel like I'm old and sick, too. My sister who left appears in my dream quite a lot these days.

It won't be easy, but can you find out if our sister is living well? It'd do my old heart good to know...
MsgIncomplete: Can't you find the route? Huigronn Stronghold is in the center of the Adellia district~
MsgResponse4: Where did you come? Huigronn Stronghold? That's where my eldest child, Phershi, lives~

MsgSummary:
Keidline Kind's love toward Hyarmen Elnenye is very special.
You have to obtain {c3}10 Nordein Molars{/c} from {c1}Skulleron Man-Eating Wild Boars or Black Hair Man-Eating Bears{/c} and give them to {c2}Hyarmen Elnenye{/c}.
You can find Skulleron Man-Eating Wild Boars in the hills of Pandorashys, and you can find Black Hair Man-Eating Bears if you follow the north path.
MsgComplete:
Oh my, What is this?
This large and thick thing is a canine? It appears Deatheaters are a lot more gigantic than I have expected. Now that strong people like you are now protecting us, I also want to be an elf who can make a contribution to Alliance of Light quickly.

hmm.. This is a special product of Pandorashys. I think it will be good idea we make an ornament with it and sell it.
Thanks. This is a small token of my gratitude, so please get this gold, first.
MsgTake:
How was it in Skulleron? Was it a little rougher around the edges than you thought it'd be?

There are a lot of man-eating animals living around Pandorashys where we're living. These days, more and more fighters who heard about this place are coming here, but accidents happens a lot. They have gone missing, and corpses and bones have been found rather frequently. The Union of Fury soldiers must have taken losses from these carnivorous beasts too, don't you think?

Well, if you'll take the advice of an old woman, I think these man-eating animals might give us an opportunity.

Last time, when we captured one man-eating wild boar and cut its stomach open, we found a handful of teeth inside. Right now, we've only got a few special products exclusive to Skulleron, so if we make ornaments with Nordeins' teeth and sell them, I guess we can make a good bit of money that way.

{c5}(Keidline straightens her curved waist and stand on her feet, holding her staff and pointing in the opposite direction){/c}

Can you see our youngest child, Hyarmen, over there? She's always alone because her brother is busy with doing his job in Huigronn Stronghold, and her sister is also doing a job related to the gate down there. These days she seems to want to try doing something. She is smart, but she's still a young child. I guess she needs a lot of help and guidance. However, nothing in particular comes to mind...

Please, can you help our youngest child who's having a hard time? But don't tell her I sent you....
MsgIncomplete: Hyarmen is young, but she is smart and can stand on her own...
MsgResponse4: I'm worried because I can't decide what I wanna do. But I don't want to just ask my sister or brother for advice... This is an unfamiliar place, so I can't just walk around wherever I want, either.

MsgSummary:
Hyarmen Elnenye wants you to collect {c3}10 Winding Cobwebs{/c}, items for making a Nordein ornament.

You can obtain Winding Cobwebs from {c1}Skulleron White Stripe Spiders or Skulleron Golden Spiders{/c}, which inhabit the edge of the east cape of Ellyuteion Lake.
MsgComplete:
Wow~ You really brought a lot of cobwebs!
I wish you had lots and lots of time to keep helping me more, but I don't think it's good manners to detain a person who probably has a bunch of stuff to do.

That's a pity. I'd better ask even more people to do me a favor. Thanks to mercenaries, I can carry on a thriving business. I won't forget your kindness as long as I live. May the Goddess protect you~
MsgTake:
Haha...are you back for more, mercenary? Thanks to the people like you who come by, I'm also getting accustomed to doing this business. (grin)

We can take out the man-eating animals in the area by asking travelers, and do business by collecting Nordein molars. Basically, this is a two-birds-with-one-stone solution. As the demand increases, I should get to know more and more people. More than this, the real problem that I don't have enough of the cobwebs that I use as a raw material.

According to the remark of a chief of guards who explored near the Ellyuteion Lake last time, there are many spiders inhabiting the eastern shore of the lake. There are dangerous Larvae swarming around too. It is going to be very difficult for me to can obtain these cobwebs by myself. Can you collect some cobwebs for me?

{c5}(Hyarmen fumbles something one by one and picks out several bundles of phials){/c}

I have prepared several grain potions for fighters. If you help me with my job, I'll give this phial to you. Of course, I'll give you a reward if you collect the cobwebs.
MsgIncomplete: It is not an easy task to discover spiders in Skulleron. It is also a wonder they are all living together in only one place.
MsgResponse4: It is not an easy task to discover spiders in Skulleron. It is also a wonder they are all living together in only one place.

MsgSummary:
The high-class Alchemist, Siul, feels uneasy about Faila's hunch.
You have to capture {c1}15 Mirros Golems and 15 Mirros HellTooth Parasites{/c} respectively and find a {c2}Faila{/c}, a high-class Soul Mage.
Go to Mirr'os area. Mirr'os Mountainous area is the district surrounded by three small lakes, southeast of Pandorashys.
MsgComplete:
I heard you've traveled the Mirr'os Hills. Is this correct?
Did you witness the truth behind the HellTeeth and the spiritual energy that's been pouring out?

So...it wasn't just a rumor after all. If my expectation is correct, HellTeeth might also have a hierarchical society, and they might be coexisting with a number of species we hardly see in the more northern reaches of Teos Epeiros.

Were my suspicions correct? Oh dear~! I must report this to Iskiel right away. Please, take this; a small reward for your hard work.
MsgTake:
Hey, you...yeah, you. Come over here a minute, won't you?
Judging by your look, you don't seem to be a normal traveler. Travelers have no reason to come here. At any rate, from the moment I saw you, I knew you were someone who could handle this job I've got. Are you interested in hearing a little more?

Ever since Iskiel led us to settle down here, Faila has felt strangely anxious due to the constant energy emanating from the Mirr'os Hills. That's an excessively dangerous place, and fierce have often been seen roaming around there, so people seldom venture down that way.

The problem is, the most important area for mining the ore called the elementalium that we can only get in Skulleron is the Mirr'os Hills. Maybe those Union of Fury fiends were familiar with these monsters, but now that we Alliance of Light folks have settled down, these HellTeeth monsters seem a lot more organized than we first thought.

Faila seems to feel disconcerted by these HellTeeth. She's already devoted her full concentration to purifying the energy of the district - a kind we're unfamiliar with. Not until we uncover the reality of the HellTeeth will she be able to relax.

Can you head out to Mirr'os? I'd like you to cut down the number of Golems and HellTooth Parasites in that area. If I tell Faila what you're doing, it's likely that I'll be able to help Faila get her mind back under control.

I want you to take this alchemical item I made. You'll definitely find it useful~
MsgIncomplete:
Faila's hunches have never been wrong.

What kind of creatures are living in Mirr'os, anyway? Were my suspicions correct?
MsgResponse4:
These days I feel an intense dizziness, not quite like any I've ever felt before.
I don't think it's solely due to the energies of Viridis'puirr in the north and the Mirr'os Hills in the south....

MsgSummary:
Adjutant Williamson voiced concerns about the fact there are surviving Deatheater forces near the north of Pandorashys.
You have to get rid of {c1}15 Skulleron Deatheater Conquerors and 15 Skulleron Deatheater Fighters{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Well done. Were you able to track any other signs of their troop movement?

No matter how many we eradicate, their numbers keep growing again, just like weeds in a field. It might be a very difficult task to drive out the defeated survivors permanently. From now on, I hope you work your hardest for the Alliance of Light.
MsgTake:
You're the one who talked with Faila, right?
You should know that the Mirr'os area is a very important place that serves as a supply route for the transportation of war materials. At Faila's request, military forces have been dispatched to the Mirr'os Hills. Since we just recently occupied this area, there's plenty of places in need of repair.

I'm an adjutant of Commander Iskiel, Williamson's the name. I have gained the confidence of the Commander since I displayed the full range of the human navy's supply strength in these Spinterr operations. Hahaha~
Anyway, we don't have the time to sit around and yak all day, so I'll get to the point. Have you ever gone to the Puirr borderlands in the north, by any chance?

We haven't expelled the surviving forces of the Union of Fury, and we're just sitting back and taking their provocations without doing anything. I needn't say that this shouldn't go on, but Iskiel just regards them as an insignificant force, choosing to focus his attention elsewhere.

Even though they're a defeated force, if we just leave them to their own devices, they will strike us in a vital point at the worst possible time, just like when we rushed in behind the enemy, to their shock and dismay. You're agree, don't you?

That's why I need you to go take out the surviving forces - 15 Skulleron Deatheater Conquerors and 15 Skulleron Deatheater Fighters - so that they never come near Skulleron ever again. I'll defnitely make it worth your while - it'll be a big help to all our forces in this area.
MsgIncomplete: What is it Sir Iskiel is focusing on?
MsgResponse4: Ah, I see that the number of surviving Deatheater forces have been dealt quite a blow!

MsgSummary:
You have obtained a crumpled paper reading 'Nordein, Rise Up!'
The paper carries a message about the Elven Ranger troops.
You have to find someone who might know more about this.
MsgComplete:
Hmm...you can't produce some evidence, so how do you expect me to trust what you're claiming?
Even your appearance makes me a bit wary of placing trust in you too quickly..

Now step aside. Whoever disturbs Iskiel cannot be forgiven.

{c5}(Windrider fixes his eyes on one place with a serious expression when you turn around on your way down from the platform. Within a moment, Windrider's silhouette twinkles out of view...){/c}
MsgTake:
{c5}(You come across a note in a language you don't understand, but the letters quickly seem to grow in clarity, until at last you are able to read it.){/c}

Our brothers, where are you? Where have all the sons and daughters of Skulleron gone?

Elves and Humans, and even we Nordein have forgotten how once we were hungry - how once, we starved in silence, without even mother's milk, on ground where grass would not grow.

Have you forgotten the shadow of death that hung heavily over the Tyrannus, or our past, where we became one through the power of Isquiron? For what reason did the Vail and the Nordein need to be the only ones to inhabit Skulleron?

Who will recover our illustrious name, trampled down by the Elven Rangers?
Listen to my screams and my lament, Nordein, and rise up! Let us come together again to reclaim our former glory, and trade our ground, which has been tarnished by Pandorashys!
The Goddess will be moved by your explosive potential and the bright readiness in your eyes.

{c5}(the letters of the note suddenly become illegible, fading as though erased by the phantom finger of the Union of Fury.){/c}
MsgResponse4:
This is not a place you may enter freely.
Now stay away from Sir Iskiel.

MsgSummary:
Adjutant Williamson can't seem to conceal his anxiety about the news regarding {c1}Skulleron Vail Summoners and Skulleron Vail Leaders{/c}.
You have to get rid of 15 of each and find {c2}Adjutant General Windrider{/c}.
You can find Skulleron Vail Summoners and Skulleron Vail Leaders north of Pandorashys.
MsgComplete:
You've dealt with the Vail remnants?
Thanks. There are things in Skulleron that should remain unknown for the time being...

First, don't talk to anybody about the document you found. I'll need your help again in the future, not too far from now. I hope the Goddess will be with you~
MsgTake:
Has something happened to Windrider? It hasn't been that long since the two of us met, but the more I talk to you, the harder his expression gets. It's very rare for him to just leave his seat in great haste like that...

After just telling me to check it out through you, he left for somewhere else, saying that he'd return soon. He wanted to ask you to get rid of as many remaining Vail soldiers as you can find.  I thought only Deatheaters had forces remaining here, but the Vail as well? I'd better hurry up with this job!

The place where the defensive capabillity of our forces is short is the north Puirr area, so please head north.

There are many monsters in the Puirr area that are difficult to contend with. Sir Iskiel said the Union of Fury is developing some kind of new weapon in preparation for the war in the volcanic zone. I don't know any more than that at the moment, though.
MsgIncomplete: Has something happened to Sir Windrider?
MsgResponse4: I investigated the Puirr area. I thought this had nothing to do with Vail, but...

MsgSummary:
Adjutant General Windrider told you that much stronger enemies from the remnants of the Union of Fury were discovered in the Puirr area.
You need to take out {c1}Skulleron Deatheater Commanders and Skulleron Deatheater Archers{/c}.
You have to get rid of 15 Commanders and 15 Archers surviving in Virides'puirr
and find {c2}Iskiel Iceblade{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Well done.
When I received a report about your action in Skulleron, I felt that it was only a matter of time until we win the war against the Union of Fury!

Every time someone with your talent appears, it's like our Goddess Etain has showered us with blessing.
MsgTake:
So, we meet again. Recently, I have been constantly scouting the activity in the Puirr area. Currently, most of the remnants of the Union of Fury have been finished off, or are choosing to depart from Skulleron.

The last of the Skulleron Deatheaters I discovered were hiding in Virides'puirr. They're somewhat toughter to deal with than those we've dealt with previously.

The Pandorashys guard force doesn't have enough power available because they've been tied up combating the HellTeeth of the Mirr'os district, as well as an assignment in Ellyuteion Lake.

Now, I need your help. I've reported what you've accomplished in Skulleron to Iskiel. Iskiel's opinion of you - and his expectations of you - seem to have gone up. If you complete this mission, you'll have a chance to meet with Iskiel.
MsgIncomplete: I investigated the Puirr area. I thought this has nothing to do with Vail, but...
MsgResponse4: So, you're the star combatant who's out there fighting to prevent the Deatheaters and Vail from taking back this land?

MsgSummary: A high quality weapon maker, Aica, asked you to bring {c3}10 Elementaliums{/c}, a core material of Elven weapons. You can obtain Elementaliums by defeating {c1}Ellyuteion Blue Wing Pixies and Ellyuteion Undines{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Oh~ You've come back alive?
You even brought these rare ores from dangerous spirits. I suppose I have to reconsider my initial opinions of you.

Hmm...if you're this strong, I suppose another mission or two in Pandorashys won't be a problem, will it? Can you do me a favor?
MsgTake:
What do you think of the greatest harvest ever seen since Pandorashys were constructed?
It's all due to the fact that we discovered an ore named Elementalium. I felt like we had a real uphill battle when I realized Elementalium was protected by the water spirits in Ellyuteion Lake.

Those who are skilled in weapon production like me should know how to handle Elementalium and Fairy Steel in order to make a weapon in the Elven style, but it's easier said than done. As a matter of fact, the amount we're processing is absurdly small compared to demand. This discovery of Elementalium is both Etain's blessing and an opportunity to raise the banner of our certain victory in the war against the Union of Fury.

If perchance this sounds interesting to you, go to Ellyuteion Lake now. I was told Pixies and Undines are guarding ore there. Just make sure you don't get too greedy, and know when to pull out.
MsgIncomplete: You're still alive? Did you go to Ellyuteion?
MsgResponse4: You're still alive? Did you go to Ellyuteion?

MsgSummary:
A high quality weapon maker, Aica, asked you to get rid of spirits surrounding Ellyuteion Lake to secure full-scale Elementalium gathering.
You have to get rid of {c1}15 Ellyuteion Vipers and 15 Ellyuteion Wyverns{/c} and report your result to {c2}Adjutant General Windrider{/c}.
MsgComplete:
I've heard about you from Aica.

It must not have been easy to fight with those spirits. Your spiritual strength is as strong as I had hoped. Sir Iskiel will call on you again some other time. I hope the glory of the Goddess will guide your future forever.
MsgTake:
Ah, traveler! It's a miracle to see you come back alive!

It's a great stroke of luck for the Alliance of Light forces to have discovered Elementalium in Ellyuteion Lake, but due to the mighty curse of the spirits covering that area, we even had to consider a scenario in which we had to give up our claim to the Elementalium.

When we had to marshall our troops to both stop the Union of Fury from moving to regain a position AND secure the supply route to the Alliance of Light's camp, even things we normally found pleasure in became burdens on our minds.

However, we didn't give up. Sir Iskiel demanded reinforcements from Iudex, a concentrated hot-spot of Elves, to secure the Elementalium. We're expecting good news, but I can't stand feeling anxious like this.

Traveler, do you think you could thin out the number of spirits? In the meantime, I'll deliver what you've told me to Sir Windrider. Of course, Sir Windrider, as a member of the Alliance of Light, will give you a reward.
MsgIncomplete: You're still alive? It is very difficult to go to Ellyuteion alone.
MsgResponse4: Your accomplishments in Skulleron have truly impressed me. You're a true gem of our camp.

MsgSummary:
Adjutant General Windrider looks very astonished by the appearance of Cali'puirr's 
{c1}Haras Wyvern Patrolers and Haras Croco Commanders{/c}.
You have to get rid of 15 of each and report the result to {c2}Iskiel Iceblade{/c}. Cali'puirr is located far in the northeast of Skulleron.
MsgComplete:
Just as I thought...the Vail-style buildings discovered in Cali'puirr turned out to be military establishments, secretly manufacturing new weapons to be used by the Union of Fury.

The messenger I sent to Iudex has not returned yet, but the news that Astenes fell into the enemies' hands has already begun to spread far and wide. The Vail must have developed some sort of new instrument of war...

Hmm...what we really need right now is more info, and I'd like you to bring it to me. We have to find a way to stop the Union of Fury from gaining any further advantages!
MsgTake:
I've had difficulty sleeping ever since I visited Virides'puirr.
Due to that shock and fear, I regretted even coming to Skulleron. Say...do you happen to have any news about Astenes?

It may be possible that the reason why Astenes fell into the Deatheaters' hands will be finally uncovered. It is likely we'll find that answer from Virides'puirr and Cali'puirr.

Now that I've reported this to Iskiel, I feel much more relieved. It's more like I finally found what I need to do in the future, and how to best leverage my position to get done what I need to do. 

I think I'll need your help again this time. Please, go to Cali'puirr. It seems that a similar situation to what we saw in Virides'puirr is happening there, too.
MsgIncomplete: Your accomplishments in Skulleron have truly impressed me. You're a true gem of our camp.
MsgResponse4: I hope your endeavors will bring the peace of the Goddess to Skulleron~

MsgSummary:
Adjutant Williamson looked astonished by the news from Virides'puirr. 
You have to get rid of {c1}15 Pihunts Clan Viper Strategists and 15 Pihunts Clan Viper Commanders{/c} 
and report the result to {c2}Iskiel Iceblade{/c}.
Virides'puirr is in the far northwest of Skulleron.
MsgComplete:
Unlike the Vail in Skulleron, I figure the Skulleron Deatheaters attempted to develop their own weapons in Virides'puirr.

However, the Nordein - that is, the Deatheaters - it's obvious they don't have the competence with black magic to do that.
In the end, turning Virides'puirr into a place for experiments just degraded it. Because of this, the Skulleron Vail and the Skulleron Deatheaters couldn't get along with each other. Eventually, they exposed their weak point to the Ares Rangers, which led the Ares Ranger forces to build Pandorashys.

There is still a number of obstacles for us to overcome in Skulleron. Well, go poke around, see what you can find, then report back to me.
MsgTake:
After Sir Windrider returned from Virides'puirr, it seems he's held secret counsel with Sir Iskiel every day. I became annoyed and confronted him, saying 'Are you treating me differently because I'm a human?' I was thoughtless, but he had a justifiable reason for acting as he did, of course.

Things terrible to see are occuring in Virides'puirr... A barren swath of cooling lava swarming with creatures from another world...it was like a vision of hell itself. Sir Windrider is now very busy scouting out Cali'puirr, and I just want to make up for my careleesness, so do you think you could help me out a bit with this?

As a result of my discussion with Sir Iskiel, we decided to dispose of the monsters from the Pihunts Clan occupying that area. I hope you'll do this for me.

Maybe it'll be too much for you to deal with, but we've just gotta be a stopgap, to maintain control over Skulleron until backup forces of Serius arrives. Please do me this favor, and report your result to Sir Iskiel.
MsgIncomplete: I thought Sir Windrider was working only for himself. However, he's really working for all of us...
MsgResponse4: I hope your endeavors will bring the peace of the Goddess to Skulleron~

MsgSummary:
An indistinct sound is coming from the heated abyss. In the area, Pihunts Clan and Haras Clan Leaders can be heard making a disturbing noise.
First, you have to get rid of {c1}Pihunts Clan Ifrit Leaders and Haras Gimis Leaders{/c}. Then, you need to report the situation to {c2}Iskiel Iceblade{/c} within {c4}3 hours{/c}.
You can find the Pihunts Clan in Virides'puirr and the Haras Clan in Cali'puirr.
MsgComplete:
Hey! Can you hear me? What's happened to you?
One of constructions Cali'puirr Vails have made is talking? What are you talking about~!
Give it to me straight! I have no choice....

Hey Windrider~! Now leave for Cali'puirr again~! Go and find out what has happened!

Hey Williamson, Isn't there any message from Iudex yet~!
MsgTake:
An indistinct sound is emanating from the abyss of heat.

{c5}Krrrr...... Fri.....Ha...K....Won.......{/c}

The Haras Clan begins to shake and swarm. A great number of Gimis Leaders begin to cry out; a strange and dreadful cry like nothing ever heard before in Teos Epeiros. It's no longer safe here - you must leave immediately, and report what you've seen and heard to Sir Iskiel.

As you flee, your curiosity about the Pihunts takes you toward Virides'puirr.  The moment you enter, Pihunt Clan Ifrit Leaders give chase, as though they recognize you. The sound is the same horrible cries mixed with curses that you heard from the Gimis Leaders, and your only thoughts are of getting out as soon as possible.

Now, you must meet Iskiel Iceblade {c4}within 3 hours{/c} and report what you've experienced.
MsgIncomplete:
An indistinct sound is coming from the abyss of heat.

{c5}Krrrr...... Fri.....Ha...K....Won.......{/c}
MsgResponse4: You! Why are you acting like an idiot? What has happened? Hey...wake up! Somebody there~!! Go and call a medic!

MsgSummary: Pelelly asked you to go to Ranhaarr and find a person named {c2}Beimon Windsaga{/c} and extract her gate payment from him. You can go to Ranhaarr via Pelelly, a gatekeeper in Arena Stronghold.
MsgComplete:
What the heck? You just roll up to me and want me to pay you money?! Is this your first time in Ranhaarr?

You have no idea who I am, do you? Eh? Pelelly? Never heard the name, I swear.
I don't know what you're talking about~ If you keep spouting off such nonsense, I'll be forced to call the guard! 
How dare you~!

Ah~! I don't know...just take this money and get lost! Now that I've come to a new district, I've got tons of work to take care of~!
MsgTake:
Ah ~ This is soooo boring! I'm sick of just standing around all day and hearing about places I'd rather visit myself! Actually, I can't go anywhere. I have to stand here and waste the best days of my youth sending people here and there.... I know...totally unbelievable, right?

Hey, why are you staring at me so blankly like that? Do you want to go to Ranhaarr too? We occupied Ranhaarr during the war, and I'd like to pay it a visit myself...someday.

But heeeey, this is good~ You said you're going to Ranhaarr, didn't you? If you get there, can you do me a favor? I'd like you to go there and find a guy by the name of Windsaga. That cassanova of a Vail...it's like flattery is his only skill. He was sweet-talkin' and all touchy-feely, like he was gonna ask me on a date. Then he just left for Ranhaarr saying he'd pay the Gatekeeper charge later! He was even with two people as old as my dad! It's just like his schmoozing cost me a whole day's earnings!

Is it possible you could help me right this wrong?
I'll take your money and let you go to Ranhaarr. When you're there, just get the money that rascal weaseled his way out of and use it to refund yourself for traveling costs~ If you mention my name, he won't be able to get out of it!
Yes! I really like people like you!
MsgIncomplete: Oh, do you like me? Is there something you want to say? Do you...really want to go to Ranhaarr?
MsgResponse4: You still have lots more to work on~ You've gotta find a way to use small items more efficiently.

MsgSummary:
Feite Windsaga wants to get {c3}10 Winding Cobwebs{/c}, which you can obtain from spiders near the Ranhaarr.
You can obtain them from Astenes Red Wolf Spiders or Astenes White Stripe Spiders. You can find these monsters in the northern areas of Ranhaarr.
MsgComplete:
You're a young boy who will get a blessing. Anybody who helps a poor old man like me will 
be definitely a target of blessing watching over you. hu hu hu This is a small token of my heart~ Thanks~
MsgTake:
Hey there, young'un! You're not a loser like my son, are you? You seemed to be able to talk with him alright; maybe you two have a bit of chemistry, eh?

My son acted like that in Adeurian, but even though we've moved, he's still doing the same thing.
Now that he can make some money by himself, he ignores me all the time. Actually, he doesn't even try to talk to me anymore... I guess I spoiled him by raising him like he's a prince... *sob~*

*sigh* I have no idea why I've followed him all the way out here. I suppose I wanted to live in splendor to a ripe old age. I should have just stayed in the Arena Stronghold, that's what!

However, I have no choice because I already came here. Now I'm working in a warehouse, but I want to take on a side job for some extra gold.
Can you collect some cobwebs? Stuff like that is great when it comes to making necklaces or ornaments. 
Well, if you've got too much else on your plate, I suppose it can't be helped.
MsgIncomplete: I can't believe I've become a worthless old man, bent with age and arthritic in my hands...
MsgResponse4: I can't believe I've become a worthless old man, bent with age and arthritic in my hands...

MsgSummary:
An alchemist, Thillue, seems to be very interested in the Goblins in the Astenes district.
You have to bring {c3}15 Goblin Bloods{/c}. Prove Clan Goblins are living in the western reaches of Astenes.
MsgComplete:
Oh wow, you really brought that quickly! That medicine I prepared for you must've been super-useful, right?

Now, I can really focus in and take my time~ These days, black magicians are always edging in on our field of study. Well, I can't just let them overtake me and render alchemists useless! I'll show them all sorts of crazy stuff that they can't hope to duplicate!
MsgTake:
I always like going to new places - there's always so many new things you can do!

Goblins in Astenes have different traits from the Goblins we've seen so far.

Do you remember? Most Goblins build a dugout on a riverbank or spacious place and form a tribe and organize in their own structured class system.

However, the Goblins here made their base in the center of the forest. It's also interesting how the Goblins here have a green coloration. All the Goblins we've known are gray or brown colored.

I'm also very fascinated by their blood, actually. The blood of the Goblins we're acquainted with has no value whatsoever...except, y'know...flowing through Goblin veins and all.

But here...there's a tribe called Prove in the west. I want you to lend me your help with them. I'm really interested in getting some blood samples. Nowadays, there's been quite a surge in new travelers in this region, but it's not every day that I come across someone of your caliber.

Here's some medicine I've prepared for you. I hope you find it useful.
MsgIncomplete: The blood of animals holds no more interest to me. But the blood of monsters who form clans and have social classes...that's absolutely fascinating!
MsgResponse4: The blood of animals holds no more interest to me. But the blood of monsters who form clans and have social classes...that's absolutely fascinating!

QuestName: A Friendly Chat with the Naluncas
MsgSummary:
Adjutant Myitees told you to go speak with the Naluncas Orcs. The Naluncas Orc clan are living in the west of Ranhaarr.
If the conversation turns sour, you'd better be ready to put your strength to the test!
MsgComplete:
Hmm...it seems that what General Amaras said was correct! He said they're a clan who holds itself in great esteem.

To think that you were attacked...it made me reconsider the partnership we extended to them. First, let me report this to General Amaras. Wait here a bit.
MsgTake:
I'm Myitees, a faithful adjutant of Commander Amaras, of the Nordein forces.
You there, I'd like you to do something to help us establish our presence in Astenes.

In this area, there is a tribe of Orcs we're facing for the first time. The Orcs, not only strong but very intelligent, speak the same language and have formed a highly developed society where some rise up to lead smaller groups.  It's very organized.

It has already been several weeks since we asked them to serve with us in the Union of Fury, and they promised to give me a final answer.

I'd like you to go to Naluncas and meet the Orcs there. Find out if they're friendly toward us or not, and if you can, bring me their answer on whether they will ally their forces with ours.
MsgIncomplete: Were their forces hostile? I pray our plan does not go awry...
MsgResponse4: Were their forces hostile? I pray our plan does not go awry...

MsgSummary:
Adjutant Myitees needs your help in the conflict with the Naluncas Orcs.
You have to get rid of {c1}Naluncas Orc Wizards and Naluncas White Stripe Mutations{/c}. Naluncas is located in the west of Ranhaarr.
MsgComplete:
Good work, for someone who's still new to the area! When you fight in Astenes, it's for the success of our commander, Amaras!

Go out, then, and show 'em there's more where that came from! At this rate, the day when Sir Amaras will take notice of your accomplishments is fast approaching.
MsgTake:
Sir Amaras had guessed as to their true nature...
They thought we had impugned their honor and harbored great animosity against us!
Now, they've launched their sudden attack. We received a series of reports that they've commenced raids on military transport forces and shipment caravans from the home country!

Currently, we have to allocate a considerable amount of supplies, time for military preparations, and armed forces to fighting against the remnants of humans and elves. Now, with the appearance of these Orcs, we face a new obstacle that could strike our unguarded rear!

I ask you, lend your strength for Ranhaarr! Sir Amaras knows that many with talent, like yourself, will be needed to aid in the conflict with this Orcish clan.

I'd like you to take out Orc Wizards and the Pumas escorting them first! This conflict will not be over quickly, so in all your deeds proceed quietly and with caution. Avoid their leaders and archers as much as possible.
MsgIncomplete: This is no common rabble we face. Sir Amaras' forces are always in need of soldiers with talent.
MsgResponse4: This is no common rabble we face. Sir Amaras' forces are always in need of soldiers with talent.

MsgSummary:
The adjutant Myitees wants you finish off the {c1}Astenes Human Patrollers and Astenes Human Wizards{/c} surviving in Crusian Mountainous area.
You can find them in the Crusian Mountainous area located in the east of Ranhaarr.
MsgComplete:
Thanks to your actions, the remaining Alliance of Light enemies seem to have become dormant.

Sir Amaras thinks well of you too. Thanks to your action, we even discovered Dwarves in the Crusian Mountains - another hidden ally of the Humans, it seems. I can't help but feel excited, seeing cutting-edge talent behing honed in Ranhaarr~
MsgTake:
Our scout discovered abundant strategic resource such as gold and steel in the Crusian Mountains. It's said that Dwarves lurk in that area, but we've yet to see any.

What we HAVE discovered, however, is a sizeable force of Humans - remnants of the forces that once occupied the area, no doubt. You know what we have to do, right? We have to drive the Alliance of Light out of Astenes!

I need you to go to the Crusian Mountans and take out both the Astenes Human Patrollers and 
Astenes Human Wizards. Currently our backup force is on the way, so I hope you can go and dash the morale of the Humans' troops even before they arrive.

If you discover any Dwarves in the area, report it to me as soon as possible.

If it seems to be an urgent case, you'll be given the opportunity to meet Sir Amaras in person!
MsgIncomplete: Did you see any Dwarves? Well...why did you return so early, then? You didn't forget the mission, right?
MsgResponse4: Did you see any Dwarves? Well...why did you return so early, then? You didn't forget the mission, right?

MsgSummary:
You have obtained a paper where Crusian secret promise is written. You're the only one who knows about Crusian secret promise.

You have to get rid of {c1}15 Crusian Bold Miners and 15 Crusian Strong Miners{/c} in Crusian Mine located on the end of east of Astenes and have an audience with {c2}General Amaras{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Ranhaarr has long needed excellent scouts and patrollers like you. Finally, we're starting to get some top-quality individuals here. 
Now, it pleases me to give you an excellent reward, in proportion to your service!

I'd better dispatch troops to have the ample resources from Crusian Mine - and Dwarf workers - in our hands! Prepare a Basilisk now~!
MsgResponse4: What? The existence of Dwarves has been confirmed, as well as their location?

MsgSummary:
The General Amaras is currently trying to drive the Alliance of Light from Astenes.
You must go to a human stronghold in the east of Astenes and get rid of {c1}15 Astenes Human Spearmen{/c}. Also, you must venture to a human stronghold in the south of Astenes and get rid of {c1}15 Astenes Elf Warriors{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Elves, Humans, Dwarves, and even Orcs in Astenes! We need to act more cautiously because there are potential foes no matter where we turn.

Calmly, slowly, and gradually - that's the pace we'll have to proceed at to be successful. I guess I'll need you again when I obtain information about the Elves' high-ranking officers.  Sooner or later, it'll happen.
MsgTake:
The stronghold of the Alliance of Light is gradually weakening under our pressure.

After we surrendered Skulleron, our rear area, to the Alliance of Light, we grieved bitterly, and made plans to attack Astenes, the rear area of the Alliance Light.

The Vail completed their research about Crowley through several alchemists immersed in black magic, and they were able to carry out the tactics.

Because of our army seemed to have only a small force, the forces defending Astenes became overconfident about their capability to defend their territory, but they felt threatened by the incredible power of Crowley and their fear turned into defeat. 

We named this place Ranhaarr after a Nordein hero of the same name. But even with a name as noble as this, the area has still had trouble getting food and supplies, as well as mobilizing enough troops. We attracted the gaze of the Alliance of Light by renaming this district Ranhaarr, didn't we? This city, a symbol implying Astenes is under the control of the Union, represents the desire of every district of the Union of Fury that we'll be victorious in the war!

Now, you need to go eliminate the surviving enemies. Fight for the glory of Ranhaarr! Fight for the glory of the Union of Fury!
MsgIncomplete: I'm not sure if Humans and Elves occupy different territories or not, but it seems there may have been a conflict between them about mining rights...
MsgResponse4: I'm not sure if Humans and Elves occupy different territories or not, but it seems there may have been a conflict between them about mining rights...

MsgSummary: A high class alchemist, Thillue, asked you to bring an {c3}Unknown Blue Material{/c} from Hungkerr Lake. You can obtain an Unknown Blue Material by hunting {c1}Hungkerr Dark Succubi and Hungkerr Curse Succubi{/c} at Hungkerr Lake.
MsgComplete:
You're the one I've been looking for so desperately~ I never imagined you'd bring so many Blue Materials like these!

Of course, this is just the beginning. The path on which I can set my will against the black magic is unfurling by the moment. Please, accept this token of my gratitude in thanks.
MsgTake:
An entire fourth of Astenes was instantly reduced to ashes by Crowley in the Endia Union Base in the south.

Crowley are capable of rotting things instantly by accelerating their natural lifecycle rate. I can't believe the black magic that began spreading among we Vail alchemists eventually grew into something like this, before we were even aware of it...

I can't just watch this awful black magic befoul the science of alchemy! Fortunately, it is very likely that a solution lies in Hungkerr Lake. 

Do you remember the Fluvius River of Adeurian? The potent cleasing ability at the head of that stream has caused Adeurian, which used to be a dreary place, to be overgrown with trees. You've seen it, haven't you?

I used to be absorbed in blood-gathering work, but as soon as I came to Astenes, I was completely astonished by the effects of Hungkerr Lake.

I haven't named the blue material at the head of stream yet because I don't yet know much about it, but the ability of this blue material is even more potent than the effects of the Fluvius~

However, I failed to gather any samples because monsters from the lake's depths frequently surface to scare off those who try to get too close.

In light of what you've accomplished in Ranhaarr, I think you'll be more than up to this. Can you do me a favor and gather me some samples of this blue material?
MsgIncomplete: I never expected I'd face Succubi and Pixies that struck such fear into me. They're too powerful to get close to...
MsgResponse4: I never expected I'd face Succubi and Pixies that struck such fear into me. They're too powerful to get close to...

MsgSummary:
A high class alchemist, Thillue, wants to go to Hungkerr Lake in person.
In order to do that, you have to get rid of {c1}Hungkerr Dark Pixies and Hungkerr Curse Pixies{/c}. You can find Hungkerr Lake in the northwest of Astenes.
MsgComplete:
Thillue must arrive at Hungkerr Lake by now. I'm really inspired by the fact you're doing your best for Ranhaarr. Thanks.

However~! Currently, a Blackmagician Browceun is in charge of an alchemy of us, Ranhaarr. Make sure you don't fall into disfavor with Browceun as much as possible~
MsgTake:
The effect of blue material is even greater than I imagined!
I might need a considerably large amount, but I think this will be also a necessary material when I face off against Crowley. I'd better go there myself and gather a large amount. In order to do that, I'll need to do something about the monsters that seem to rise endlessly from the depths.

{c5}(Thillue stares at you attentively. Thillue looks a bit down, but speaks again, making up his mind){/c} 

Well then! First, I'll need you to open a road for me! I'm sorry to ask this of you, but we have to go inside to gather the material. The problem is, there are too many monsters in the area.

I know you're doing your best to drive away the remnants of the Alliance of Light, too.
However, if my research succeeds, we can expel the surviving enemies from Endia Union Base and cleanse that area again. After that, we'll be able to incorporate that area into the Union of Fury's territory.

I'll talk to General Amaras, so just go there and take care of the monsters first.

Here's some medicine I made; I hope it serves you well on the mission.
MsgIncomplete: It seems the general trusts Browceun more than me....
MsgResponse4: Are you becoming acquainted with alchemists? Siul wants to know.

MsgSummary:
The Black Magician Browceun is curious about an evil spirit who appeared in Endia Union Base.  You have to get rid of {c1}Endia Evil Spirits and Endia Evil Spirit Wizards{/c}, then return. 
You can find Endia Evil Spirits in the Endia Union Base in the southeast of Ranhaarr.
MsgComplete:
I didn't tell you to eliminate the evil spirits, I just told you to investigate them. You'll realize soon enough what will happen due to your indiscretion...

What was once alchemy is being reborn as black magic. The power of Crowley will be reborn more formidable than ever through the workings of those evil spirits!
MsgTake:
In 2011 Virgo, we were reeling from a huge shock. Those Alliance of Light bastards took the province of Skulleron, to our rear. We never expected Humans would attack the rear suddenly by utilizing their naval forces. 

However, we had plenty of opportunities to pay them back. It wasn't long before black magic began spreading slowly but surely. However, the exact time is unimportant - accomplished black magicians well-versed in forbidden arts began to appear, one by one.

On the 17th day of Scorpius in the same year, General Amaras's Nordein forces, which were stationed in Ranhaarr, carried out an all-out attack against Astenes' defense army once more. At the same time, I began the Crowley together with our Vail army in the rear of Endia Union.

Perhaps it's not too ludicrous to state that the current state of the Endia area is the result of my handiwork~
Nowadays, those creatures from another world that have shown up in Endia are likely the work of Crowley.

However, the one thing I know for certain is that we'll be able to know the essence of this new black magic if we analyze those otherworldly creatures.  Why don't you probe that area for the sake of General Amaras?
MsgIncomplete: I didn't tell you to eliminate evil spirits, I just told you to investigate them. You know...I've seen you conversing with Thillue from time to time....
MsgResponse4: I didn't tell you to eliminate evil spirits, I just told you to investigate them. You know...I've seen you conversing with Thillue from time to time....

MsgSummary:
An indistinct sound can be heard, resonating as though it emanates from a pulsing abyss. Nearby, Evil Spirit Stone Golems and Evil Spirit Emperors are making strange noises.
First, you have to get rid of {c1}Endia Evil Spirit Emperors and Endia Evil Spirit Stone Golems{/c}. Then, you have to report this situation to {c2}General Amaras{/c} within {c4}2 hours{/c}.
You can find Evil Spirit Emperors and Evil Spirit Stone Golems in the Endia Union Base.
MsgComplete:
Hey~! Can you hear me? What happened to you?
There's a 'talking place' in Endia Union Base? What are you talking about?!
Stop talking in riddles and just tell me what you're trying to say!

Hey Myitees~! Send a scouter to Endia Union Base, on the double! Go and find out what's happened!

Hey, Browceun! Do you have any idea what they're talking about?
MsgTake:
Strange energies are resonating throughout your body. You don't want to hear it, but the sound ringing inside of your head causes you to tremble.

{c5}Krrrr...... Fri.....Ha...K....Won.......{/c}

The surrounding Evil Spirit Stone Golems and Evil Spirit Emperors begin to shake. The swarm of Evil Spirits begins to rapidly increase in size. The strange noise congeals into an unearthly cry, like none you've ever heard before in Teos Epeiros.

It's not safe to remain here any longer - you have to get out and report what you've seen and heard to General Amaras.

You run toward outside, hardly taking a step without striking down another monster. Evil Spirits fall one by one..... The otherworldly wail, resounding with a horrible curse, penetrates through your head.
As time passes, the air grows more and more dense with Evil Spirits.

All that goes through your mind is, "I've gotta get the hell out of here as soon as possible!"

Get the heck out of here for today, and report your findings to General Amaras {c4}within 2 hours{/c}.
MsgIncomplete:
Strange energies are resonating throughout your body. You don't want to hear it, but the sound ringing inside of your head causes you to tremble.

{c5}Krrrr...... Fri.....Ha...K....Won.......{/c}
MsgResponse4: Hey you! What's up with the the weirdo act? W...wait, what happened? Hey, wake up! Hey! Somebody go and call a medic, on the double!

MsgSummary:
The base of the Elven union in the Endia district was discovered. {c1}Astenes Elf Archers and Astenes Elf Leaders{/c} are the main target.
You can find Endia Union Base in the southern reaches of Astenes.
MsgComplete:
Well done. Endia district was instantly devastated when the Crowley operation took place. It was so deeply contaminated that no form of life has been able to take hold there - it is a veritable wasteland. 
In more recent days, I've sometimes received secret reports stating that unidentified, otherworldly creatures are appearing near there, but we haven't yet been able to confirm it. Browceun the Black Magician remains strangely silent on the issue....
MsgTake:
As a result of your last mission, we're getting a clearer idea of where the Elves' base is.

This time, they are more powerful, completely different from the Elven warriors we're familiar with. Since we've flushed out the leaders, that means this is a golden opportunity to sweep the Elves from Endia district once and for all, doesn't it? Of course, I'm sure you're already well aware of this.

It might take a while for reinforcements to arrive, so this time, you ARE the reinforcements!

In order for our still-weak force to win the battle against the Elves, we need to gather more great heroes like yourself.
Fortunately for us, it's clear that the Alliance of Light's troops look very puzzled due to our sudden attack against their rear.

It also appears that those who have tasted the power of Crowley are sending most of their Rangers to keep themselves informed.
And rumor has it that every day, the steady drumbeat of the Union of Fury rings out over the battlefields of Astenes in victory!
MsgIncomplete: How is your mission proceeding? Driving the remaining Alliance forces out of Astenes is still our top priority; don't forget it.
MsgResponse4: How is your mission proceeding? Driving the remaining Alliance forces out of Astenes is still our top priority; don't forget it.

MsgSummary:
Throw {c3}5 Plain Rice{/c} into the campfire at the feast! 
Plain Rice can be obtained only from {c3}monsters of level 15 or lower{/c}.
MsgComplete: Can you believe it's less than 3 months to the end of the year? I pray that your wishes come true, and that your effort is what makes it possible.
MsgTake:
There are two types of rice: sticky rice and plain rice. Rice is such a common crop that it's widely used by both the Alliance of Light and the Union of Fury as an important staple food. Plain Rice, see, is like the Alliance of Light - one may take Humans or Elves for granted, but they go so well with everything that it's hard not to like them. Sticky Rice is like the Union of Fury - somewhat more exotic, but because of their 'stickiness,' they sometimes get into sticky situations with each other. So you see, even in food, there is the metaphor of distinct cultures!

Our ancestors began a harvest festival in which it was customary to thank the Goddess for the year's harvest, and to share the bounty of the fields with others as a way of inviting the Goddess to bless next year's harvest as well. In this festival, it's customary to throw a handful of plain rice on the campfire as an offering to the Goddess, and as the rice is consumed by the flames, it will carry a wish of yours to the Goddess as well.
MsgIncomplete: Plain rice is distinguished according to the stickiness and the proportion of starch content. The plain rice starch is proportional to 20% Amilos and 80% Amilopectin while sticky rice is mainly Amilopectin of redish brown color. Don't you feel more intelligent now that you know?
MsgResponse4: Plain rice is distinguished according to the stickiness and the proportion of starch content. The plain rice starch is proportional to 20% Amilos and 80% Amilopectin while sticky rice is mainly Amilopectin of redish brown color. Don't you feel more intelligent now that you know?

MsgSummary: Make a wish before the {c2}festival campfire{/c} and pray as it rises to the Goddess on wings of sweet smoke~
MsgComplete: Can you believe it's less than 3 months 'till the end of the year? Here's hoping your talent brings you success in the months ahead!
MsgTake:
{c2}GangGangSwollae{/c}
In the ancient days, Dance played an important part in the lives of the Elves and Vail.  At a village dance, an attractive Elf or Vail babe could whip up crowds of men into such a frenzy that she'd have no shortage of marriage proposals in the coming year. Those were the days...back when the wine flowed freely and the Goddess walked among mortals.  But we can be taken back to those good 'ol days when we see dances performed, from the deliberate traditional dances to the wild, exotic dances. Each dance says so much without words, don't you think?  Even today, a strong tradition of dance continues on.
MsgIncomplete: I pray that your wishes will come true~
MsgResponse4: I pray that your wishes will come true~

MsgSummary:
You have obtained a {c3}Vail Branding-Mark{/c}.
You have to find a person who knows about Branding Marks in Skulleron, an old Vail territory.
MsgComplete:
{c5}(At first, there is a hesitation to engage in conversation. After a time, the silence is broken...
){/c}

You might not believe this, but I understand the language of Alliance of Light. 

I never expected I'd see you folks in Skulleron, but we've been carrying out the operation to attack the rear of the Alliance of Light stealthily, from our base in Skulleron here.
As a basic step for the rear attack, it was a natural recourse for us to learn your language.

After master Browceun left here by General Amaras's order, several of us remained to conduct much deeper research into the hidden effects of Crowley...

Then, the Alliance of Light hit with a sudden attack, forcing us to discard all our research material on the quick, lest it be discovered. However, the problem was, we had to quickly dispose of animals we had painstakingly raised for the purpose of our research.

There are still animals branded with our branding mark wandering around Skulleron....
MsgTake:
{c5}Clink~{/c}

A loop made of metal falls out of a monster.

Judging by its shape, it appears to be a brand used for marking animals rather than an ornament or talisman.

Skulleron has been possessed by the Vail for many an age before now. You have to find a person who might know the use of this unidentified mark.

MsgSummary:
{c2}Browceun's Apprentice{/c} doesn't want people know about the existence of monsters branded with the Vail's Branding-Mark.
You have to hunt {c1}Skulleron Big Ear Gnomes and Ellyuteion Plump Lizards{/c} scattered around the 
entire area of Skulleron and collect {c3}more than 10{/c} {c3}Red Pieces of Lapis{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Truly ironic - we ended up covering our tracks thanks to the Alliance of Light!
You've mostly concentrated on collecting lapis pieces, so you might not know by how much the number of monsters has been reduced.
MsgResponse1:
Did you empty your bag?
Well, don't complain to me when you can't even fit all the stuff I'm gonna give you into the space you've got now! So...I wonder how many monsters you've eliminated....
MsgTake:
{c5}(There is a momentary silence. The Vail, lost in thought, looks warily out of the corner of his eye.){/c}

You want to hear my suggestion? Why not get rid of those monsters we were raising?

It's not small number, let me assure you. Besides, as you well know, I can't just walk freely around Skulleron now.

A secret agreement between the Vail and members of the Alliance...
Think about it. Isn't it amusing? You stop people from accidentally coming across the fruits of our research, and I - I'll make a lapis for you. How's that sound?

I don't know if it's a result of Crowley or not, as it turns out, I can obtain a 'Red Piece of Lapis' from certain monsters that I'll tell you about in a bit.
If I'd only had a little more time, I would've been able to determine whether it was caused by Crowley or not.

Anyway, if you'd only bring me 10 Pieces of Lapis, I'll give you a Lapis that contains an unimaginable ability.
If I asked you to collect more than that, it's possible I wouldn't see you again for a long time, but...well, if you're feeling up to it, collect as many as you can.

The monsters you'll be looking for is 'Skulleron Big Ear Gnomes' and 'Ellyuteion Plump Lizards' that used to be raised for research.

If I can ask for just one more thing, I hope you'll come back with an empty bag when you return. The reward will be even better than you can imagine.
MsgIncomplete: Of course, obtaining a Lapis is probably your primary motive, but it's even more important that we reduce the number of these monsters.
MsgResponse4: Of course, obtaining a Lapis is probably your primary motive, but it's even more important that we reduce the number of these monsters.

MsgSummary: You have to give the {c3}Red Piece of Lapis{/c} you obtained from a {c2}Browceun's Apprentice{/c} to {c2}Narda Watersaga{/c}, a blacksmith of Pandorashys.
MsgComplete:
Oh-ho! Where did you find something like this?
I've never seen this kind of Lapis before.
Give it here for a second. It looks just like a Lapis, but it doesn't seem like much at first glance...

{c5}(Narda examines it attentively. As he looks the Lapis over, he starts to tremble slightly.){/c}

Whoa now, what's this? I think something about it just changed. It's definitely unlike any Lapis I've seen before.

N...now it feels all squishy! Look, its surface is soft, but the inside still seems to be hard...
I have no idea, traveler. I hope I didn't turn it into a piece of useless junk...
Here, I'd better give it back to you before something else happens.
MsgTake:
Here, I condensed the Red Pieces of Lapis you collected into one.

We researchers of black magic under Browceun came to understand that the Lapises formed inside of bodies of the animals we raised for experiments is somewhat different from the Lapises known to the Alliance of Light or the Union of Fury. Of course, this was only after Browceun had already left.

If we apply heat to lapis pieces of the same color and type while casting a certain black magic spell, they all miraculously come together and assume a form much like the original piece.

I'm disappointed, though, that there aren't any blacksmiths around here. The only ones in Teos Epeiros capable of handling a Lapis are smiths.

Does your base have a smith?
Then, take this piece I'm about to give you and see what your blacksmith can make of it. It's just a piece of lapis right now, but who knows? Maybe it'll become more useful once you have the blacksmith check it out.
MsgIncomplete: You'd better get moving.... I wouldn't want my existence to be inadvertently revealed because of you.

MsgSummary: You have to give the {c3}Red Piece of Lapis{/c} you obtained from a {c2}Browceun's Apprentice{/c} to {c2}Narda Watersaga{/c}, a blacksmith of Pandorashys.
MsgComplete:
Oh-ho! Where did you find something like this?
I've never seen this kind of Lapis before.
Give it here for a second. It looks just like a Lapis, but it doesn't seem like much at first glance...

{c5}(Narda examines it attentively. As he looks the Lapis over, he starts to tremble slightly.){/c}

Whoa now, what's this? I think something about it just changed. It's definitely unlike any Lapis I've seen before.

N...now it feels all squishy! Look, its surface is soft, but the inside still seems to be hard...
I have no idea, traveler. I hope I didn't turn it into a piece of useless junk...
Here, I'd better give it back to you before something else happens.
MsgTake:
Here, I condensed the Red Pieces of Lapis you collected into one.

We researchers of black magic under Browceun came to understand that the Lapises formed inside of bodies of the animals we raised for experiments is somewhat different from the Lapises known to the Alliance of Light or the Union of Fury. Of course, this was only after Browceun had already left.

If we apply heat to lapis pieces of the same color and type while casting a certain black magic spell, they all miraculously come together and assume a form much like the original piece.

I'm disappointed, though, that there aren't any blacksmiths around here. The only ones in Teos Epeiros capable of handling a Lapis are smiths.

Does your base have a smith?
Then, take this piece I'm about to give you and see what your blacksmith can make of it. It's just a piece of lapis right now, but who knows? Maybe it'll become more useful once you have the blacksmith check it out.
MsgIncomplete: You'd better get moving.... I wouldn't want my existence to be inadvertently revealed because of you.

MsgSummary:
You have obtained a {c3}Vail Branding-Mark{/c}.
You have to find a person who knows about a distinguishment_mark in Skulleron, an old earth of Vail.
As you try to recall your memory, {c2}A Browceun's Apprentice{/c} occurs to you.
MsgComplete:
Ah, I see you've come again. Ah, what's this? You've brought me another branding-mark?

I thought last time's outing erased most of the vestiges of our prior research...
Of course, I suppose it IS illogical to think all traces of the Vail in Skulleron could be wiped clean when we've lived here so long.
MsgTake:
{c5}Clink~{/c}

A metal loop falls out of a monster.

It's the mark of the monsters the Vail were breeding for their experiments with Crowley...
You wonder if Browceun, that shadowy Vail enemy, is still continuing his experiments somewhere.

You feel a surge of anger, remembering that the Alliance of Light lost Astenes due to Crowley's damage, but it doesn't seem to be a bad idea to call on that guy who might know about new kinds of Lapises.

MsgSummary:
{c2}Browceun's Apprentice{/c} said you can obtain {c3}Blue Pieces of Lapis{/c} from {c1}Mirros Troll Fighters and Mirros Troll Guards{/c} affected by Crowley.
You have to collect more than 10 and give them to Browceun's Apprentice.
You can find Mirros Trolls in the forest south of the Mirr'os Hills.
MsgTake:
By the way, did that Red Piece of Lapis I gave you last time prove to be useful?

{c5}(the Vail listens attentively, interested in what you say){/c}

Hmm...so, there was a hard stone in the middle once the Blacksmith touched it. And once you opened that stone, you obtained a Lapis.

That means...our research has proven that it's possible to create new Lapises. It's even possible that we may find the source of the Lapises made from the 'Tears of the Goddess.' I wish I could research into this more deeply...

I'll let you in on something interesting, in payment for telling me what became of the lapis.
In the middle of our research with Sir Browceun, we implemented one small experiment in the Mirr'os Hills area. It was an experiment on a humanoid monster, rather than an animal sort, like the others.

The subject of our experiments? Trolls!

Unlike with the animals we raised, we sprinkled a portion of Crowley small enough that no one would notice among these humanoid monsters, in their natural habitat. 
As a result, we realized that Trolls hold Blue Pieces of Lapis inside their bodies.

Isn't that interesting? A Blue Piece of Lapis from a human type... I'd like you to collect those pieces and bring them to me. Let's find out what shape these Blue Piece of Lapis will take.

With my black magic and your blacksmith, we can get answers heretofore unknown~ And don't forget to empty your bag before you return.
MsgIncomplete: I don't think an amount this small can be transformed into something you could rightly call a Lapis...
MsgResponse4: I don't think an amount this small can be transformed into something you could rightly call a Lapis...

MsgSummary: You have to give the {c3}Blue Piece of Lapis{/c} you obtained from a {c2}Browceun's Apprentice{/c} to {c2}Narda Watersaga{/c}, a blacksmith of Pandorashys.
MsgComplete:
Looks like you've brought me something unusual again. Where do you keep turning up stuff like this?
The last one changed when I touched it.
It's like...it seems to be a Lapis, but then, it's not.

Whatever happened to the last one?
What? It became a Lapis?!

Hmm... Apparently, Skulleron is a place of many surprises. I never expected to find elementalium, an established Elven presence, or Lapises like the one I'm gonna give back to you now. I feel like I made a good decision in coming here - how about you?
MsgTake:
Okay. Just like last time, what I'm giving you is all the pieces of Lapis pressed into one.

When I chant the spell, the pieces of lapis come together into one piece, and it takes the size or external form of the other pieces, but this process also awakens its dormant, innate function as a Lapis.

This means that a piece of lapis is not just a piece anymore - it'll become an intact Lapis.
The problem is, it needs the touch of a blessed hand who's handled Lapises before, in order for it to become a true Lapis.

You know who you've gotta talk to, right? Go find that smith in your base and let him handle this Lapis Piece.
MsgIncomplete: You'd better get moving.... I wouldn't want my existence to be inadvertently revealed because of you.

MsgSummary: You have to give the {c3}Blue Piece of Lapis{/c} you obtained from a {c2}Browceun's Apprentice{/c} to {c2}Narda Watersaga{/c}, a blacksmith in Pandorashys.

MsgIncomplete: You'd better get moving.... I wouldn't want my existence to be inadvertently revealed because of you.

MsgSummary:
You have obtained a {c3}Vail Branding-Mark{/c}.
You'd better seek out {c2}Browceun's Apprentice{/c} and find a new Lapis once more.
MsgComplete:
It's unusual to me to see such a smile on the face of someone from the Alliance of Light. Have you brought another branding mark this time?

This is the third different mark I've received from you.
These days, I've been meeting a lot more people from the Alliance. I figure it's about time for me to be on my way.
MsgTake:
{c5}Clink~{/c}

A metal loop falls out of a monster..

You recognize it as an identifying brand for the Vail's Crowley experiments....


With the brand in hand, you trace the now-familiar path toward where you can find Browceun's Apprentice.

It occurs to you that you were able to obtain a higher-level Lapis when you harbored some sort of desire and touched an {c3}Imperfect Lapis{/c}. You think this might be your last chance and begin running toward the place where Browceun's Apprentice is.

MsgSummary:
{c2}Browceun's Apprentice{/c} said you can obtain {c3}Yellow Pieces of Lapis{/c} from Skulleron Steel Golems and Skulleron Stone Golems that have been affected by Crowley.
You have to collect {c3}more than 10{/c} and give them to Browceun's Apprentice.
You can find these Golems in the northeast and southwest.
MsgTake:
What kind of Lapis did you get last time? Oh, really? Well-done. How ironic...me, lending my aid to a soldier in the Alliance of Light....

But, the time has now come for me to leave.
My existence has gradually become known to more and more in the Alliance of Light.
I mean, it's fine by me, since I feel like what I'm doing is researching a new kind of Lapis, but in staying here continuously, in territory occupied by the Alliance, it's like my life is hanging by a thread.

Well, our relationship hasn't been what you'd call deep, but in thanks for your help and your company, I'll show to you one last kind of Lapis.

This time, it'll be within a spirit-type monster.
I implanted a small amount of Crowley into Golems, as a trial experiment.
As a result, we were able to obtain yellow pieces of Lapis.

Animal-type Lapises are red, human-type Lapises are blue, and spirit-type Lapises are yellow. You can get yellow from a spirit type - it's like some strange process of cause-and-effect.

I was able to obtain the same kinds of lapis pieces from Iron Steel Golems and Stone Golems that inhabit the northeast and the southwest.

Well, if you're ready, might as well set out. You know how many to get, right? I assume you also know by now that working hard will net you a handsome reward.

There IS one thing you probably ought to know. Golems have paralyzing skills and stunning attacks that you'll have to deal with somehow. The most difficult thing in our research process was the fact that these Golems, especially, were more tricky to deal with than the other monsters we handled.
MsgIncomplete: I don't know if this small of an amount can properly be transformed into something like a real Lapis.
MsgResponse4: I don't know if this small of an amount can properly be transformed into something like a real Lapis.

MsgSummary: You have to give the {c3}Yellow Piece of Lapis{/c} you obtained from {c2}Browceun's Apprentice{/c} to {c2}Narda Watersaga{/c}, a blacksmith of Pandorashys.
MsgComplete:
Ah, so you've got another one for me, do you?

{c5}(The piece of lapis changes to a squishy-looking Lapis soon after Narda puts her hands on it. The hand Narda puts forth certainly contains the longtime wisdom of working with Lapises.){/c}

It does raise more than a few questions, the way you keep bringing these to me out in the frontier....

Well...it's not my place to question how a warrior chooses to live life.
I pray the Goddess guides your path.
MsgTake:
I've given you another combined piece of Lapis.

As of now, we'll have no further dealings. I'm soon headed to a village where a guard of the Union of Fury is stationed. This is a present you've earned through a worthy desire and effort, so I hope it'll prove useful in your future...although we may someday meet on the battlefield....

{c5}(Browceun's Apprentice becomes somewhat agitated. Soon, he turns around. He remains silent like that only a few seconds, but you have a vague feeling you'll remember the sight of his back forever.){/c}

It's time for you to go now. I think my research here is finished, too.
MsgIncomplete: From here on, I won't look back.

MsgSummary: You have to give the {c3}Yellow Piece of Lapis{/c} you obtained from a {c2}Browceun's Apprentice{/c} to {c2}Narda Watersaga{/c}, a blacksmith in Pandorashys.
