MsgSummary:
You have obtained a {c3}Dwarven Branding-Mark{/c}.
You have to find a person who knows about branding marks in Astenes, an old territory of the Alliance of Light.
As you try to jog your memory, you remember a {c2}Marduke geologist{/c} you ran into a while ago.
MsgComplete:
{c5}(at first, there's a hesitation to engage in conversation. After a time, the silence is broken...
){/c}

You might not believe this, but I understand the language of the Union of Fury. 

I'm a geologist from Marduke. Hmm...what's that? You want to know where Marduke is? Marduke is a town east of Adellia.

My hometown, Adellia, is a border area the Alliance of Light must pass through in order to go to the D-Water Borderland. A dreadful wind howling over ochre hills and plains - that's Adellia for you.
It has been too long since I went back to the homeland, so my memory's a little rusty. Why, you ask? I'm a geologist, so I travel all over, helping develop mines in new areas.
That's why I'm versed in lots of languages. I pick up new tongues here and there, you know...I even understand the language of the Union of Fury, as you can hear for yourself. 

Of course, with the Alliance of Light mostly run out of the district, I had to take cover for myself too.

However, there are still animals wearing the Alliance's branding mark loitering around Astenes....
MsgTake:
{c5}Clink~{/c}

A metal loop falls down out of a monster.

Judging by its shape, it appears to be a mark used for branding animals, rather than for use for an ornament.

This place, Astenes, is an old territory of the Alliance of Light. You have to find someone who might know the use of this unidentified mark.

MsgSummary:
A {c2}Marduke geologist{/c} asked you to steal a {c3}Red Piece of Lapis{/c} stolen by {c1}Astenes Iron Wild Boars and Astenes White Monkeys{/c}.
You have to collect {c3}more than 10{/c}.
You can find Astenes Iron Wild Boars and Astenes White Monkeys near the Ranhaarr.
MsgComplete:
Hmm...is this the limit of your skills?
You haven't even brought have of what I've already got stashed away.
MsgResponse1:
Well well, it was a piece of cake, wasn't it?
Not a difficult task for you at all!
Back in the day, I owned waaaaaay more pieces of Lapis than this.
MsgTake:
{c5}(There is a momentary silence. The Dwarf, lost in thought, looks warily out of the corner of his eye.){/c}

Needless to say, the reason why I came here was due to a situation that developed in the Crusian Hills area.

If you Union of Fury jackasses hadn't gone and sprayed your damn fool toxic chemicals around the Endia Union Base, the rest of my life would've been a smooth ride! I intended to enjoy the rest of my life raising stock here. Now everything's been shot to hell.

In the chaos, all the pieces of lapis I collected as capital so far were stolen by crazy rampaging animals!

I don't know why, but those Iron Wild Boars and White Monkeys looked like they'd been driven mad by something.
It's probably because of those toxic chemicals you guys sprayed out everywhere.

That's why I'm telling you. I've got one suggestion for you, Union soldier. Think of it as a job - you bring my red pieces of lapis those rascals stole, and give 'em back to their original owner - that's me.

I mean, there's nobility in it, even - reuniting a worthy owner with the treasure he lost~
MsgIncomplete:
What? You're back already?
The monkeys and boars took a far larger number of pieces than this...
MsgResponse4:
What? You're back already?
The monkeys and boars took a far larger number of pieces than this...

MsgSummary: You have to give a {c3}Red Piece of Lapis{/c} you obtained from a {c2}Marduke geologist{/c} to {c2}Pollekum{/c}, a blacksmith of Ranhaarr.
MsgComplete:
Heh-heh! Where'd you find something like this?
I ain't never seen a Lapis quite like this one.
Give it to me a second here. Hmm...seems like a Lapis, but it feels like it's worthless...

{c5}(Pollekum examines it attentively. As he turns it over in his hand, you can see him start to quiver.){/c}

Whoa-ho, what's this? I think something changed inside it! This is defnitely no Lapis I'm familiar with.

What's this...squishy feeling? Its surface is squishy, but whatever's inside seems to be hard...
I have no idea, traveler. I hope it didn't become useless because I touched it...
Lemme give this back to you before something else goes all weird~
MsgTake:
Well, here's a reward from me.
It's a particularly generous reward, if I say so myself!

{c5}(Even though you receive a piece of lapis, you have no idea if it's actually useful. You even suspect it may be a colorful paperweight.){/c}

Why are you standing there with some dumb look on yer face? Dont'cha like my hum-dinger of a gift?

Now I feel suspicious about you...what kind of person looks a gift-Dwarf in the mouth?

It's a Lapis! How many people in Teos Epeiros can really do much with a Lapis? You still don't know yet? You've gotta find a blacksmith! Those are only people who have the know-how to handle a Lapis, right?
It'll be pretty rough for you if you don't have a smith in your base. I'd recommend going and finding one right now.
MsgIncomplete: Are you still bored? What, do you want me to shoot marbles witih you? Haha...I never imagined I'd be having a leisurely conversation with someone from the Union of Fury!

MsgSummary: You have to give the {c3}Red Piece of Lapis{/c} you obtained from the {c2}Marduke geologist{/c} to {c2}Pollekum{/c}, a blacksmith of Ranhaarr.
MsgComplete:
Heh-heh! Where'd you find something like this?
I ain't never seen a Lapis quite like this one.
Give it to me a second here. Hmm...seems like a Lapis, but it feels like it's worthless...

{c5}(Pollekum examines it attentively. As he turns it over in his hand, you can see him start to quiver.){/c}

Whoa-ho, what's this? I think something changed inside it! This is defnitely no Lapis I'm familiar with.

What's this...squishy feeling? Its surface is squishy, but whatever's inside seems to be hard...
I have no idea, traveler. I hope it didn't become useless because I touched it...
Lemme give this back to you before something else goes all weird~
MsgTake:
Well, here's a reward from me.
It's a particularly generous reward, if I say so myself!

{c5}(Even though you receive a piece of lapis, you have no idea if it's actually useful. You even suspect it may be a colorful paperweight.){/c}

Why are you standing there with some dumb look on yer face? Dont'cha like my hum-dinger of a gift?

Now I feel suspicious about you...what kind of person looks a gift-Dwarf in the mouth?

It's a Lapis! How many people in Teos Epeiros can really do much with a Lapis? You still don't know yet? You've gotta find a blacksmith! Those are only people who have the know-how to handle a Lapis, right?
It'll be pretty rough for you if you don't have a smith in your base. I'd recommend going and finding one right now.
MsgIncomplete: Are you still bored? What, do you want me to shoot marbles witih you? Haha...I never imagined I'd be having a leisurely conversation with someone from the Union of Fury!

MsgSummary:
You have obtained a {c3}Dwarven Branding-Mark{/c}.
You have to find a person who knows about a distinguishment_mark in Astenes, an old earth of Alliance of Light.
As you try to recall your memory, {c2}A Marduke geologist{/c} occurs to you.
MsgComplete:
Ah, nice to see you again, Union soldier. What's this now? You've brought a different brand for me to take a look at?

I wonder when I'll be able to recapture all my cattle that ran away...

Whenever I see you, I think of all the cattle I lost, and all my lapis pieces that were stolen.
MsgTake:
{c5}Clink~{/c}

A metal loop falls down out of a monster.

It looks like a Dwarven branding mark.
The mark of an old Dwarf, living out the rest of his days raising livestock...
You wonder if that old Dwarf you saw before is still around.

It doesn't seem to be a bad idea to call on someone who might know about a new type of Lapis.

MsgSummary:
The {c2}Marduke geologist{/c} said you can obtain {c3}Blue Pieces of Lapis{/c} from {c1}Hungkerr Viper Hunters amd Hungkerr Viper Wizard{/c}.
You have to collect {c3}more than 10{/c}, then give them to the Marduke geologist.
MsgTake:
By the way, was that Red Piece of Lapis I gave to you last time useful?

{c5}(the Dwarf listens attentively, interested in what you're saying){/c}

Hmm...so the core turned into a hard stone after the blacksmith's finger touched it? And once you opened that, you obtained a Lapis? Hahaha, I knew it!

I was useful, just like I thought it'd be. I suppose I'll be able to meet the smith myself, if I escape from here.

Do you want to hear one other piece of good news? You might be able to obtain some pieces of blue lapis this time! A little while ago, before you guys launched your sudden attack here,
I heard about vipers living in Hungkerr Lake.
Those guys were looking for pieces of lapis just like me.

I don't think vipers obtain them like you or me, though.  It's actually more like...pieces of lapis are created inside of their bodies. Of course, I don't know why that is, either.

Please go and bring as many blue pieces of lapis as you can get!

Remember, though, it's totally useless if you secretly hoard pieces of lapis for yourself. Only my secret incantation can change all those pieces of Lapis into a flawless Lapis gem.
MsgIncomplete: I don't think even I can transform an amount this small into something that'll have the properties of a true Lapis.
MsgResponse4: I don't think even I can transform an amount this small into something that'll have the properties of a true Lapis.

MsgSummary: You have to give a {c3}Blue Piece of Lapis{/c} you obtained from the {c2}Marduke geologist{/c} to {c2}Pollekum{/c}, a blacksmith in Ranhaarr.
MsgComplete:
You've brought me something strange again, have you now? Where did you find something like this?

Touching it seems to change it, somehow. It seems to be a lapis, and yet, it's somehow not...
Whatever happened to that thing you brought to me last time?

Seriously...it became a Lapis?
Hmm...there sure are some strange and wonderous things in Astenes...

I never expected to see a Hungkerr treasure that cleanses the environment of pollutants, or a Lapis like this one here. I figure it was a good decision to come here, don't you think?
MsgTake:
Heh heh heh! Quite a marvelous little spell, dont'cha think?
I might go through hell and high water, but I never come out without somethin' useful to show for it!

I mean, take the D-Water Borderland, where I was able to cross over to my homeland, Adellia, in the past.
It's quite a useful place! Where else can folks from the Alliance of Light and the Union of Fury meet face-to-face?

This here? 'S black magic, y'know - the magic of darkness strictly forbidden to the Alliance of Light. While exploring a temple in a border area, I obtained an ancient tome of the dark arts, from which I learned this simple transformation spell.

Well, there's not much else I can do, really! The way I found out the relationship between this spell and pieces of lapis.

If my expectations are correct, the things now occuring in Endia, in the north, are also related to black magic. Well, from here on out, changing this thing into a useful Lapis is your responsibility.
MsgIncomplete: Is there something else you want to know? If that's the case, I've got plenty to yak on about. But you'd better ask now; I ain't gonna be in Astenes forever, y'know.

MsgSummary: You have to give the {c3}Blue Piece of Lapis{/c} you obtained from the {c2}Marduke geologist{/c} to {c2}Pollekum{/c}, a blacksmith in Ranhaarr.
MsgComplete:

Touching it seems to change it, somehow. It seems to be a lapis, and yet, it's somehow not...

Seriously...it became a Lapis?
Hmm...there sure are some strange and wonderous things in Astenes...

MsgSummary:
You have obtained a {c3}Dwarven Branding-Mark{/c}.
You have to find the {c2}Marduke geologist{/c} and seek out a new Lapis once more.
MsgComplete:
Oh-ho, look at you, all smiles there. You've brought another branding mark, have you?
This is already the third loop I've gotten from you.

Heh; nowdays, it seems like I'm always meeting new folks from the Union of Fury. I suppose that must be my sign that it's time to pack up and move on out, eh?
MsgTake:
{c5}Clink~{/c}

A metal loop falls out of a monster.
It seems to be a branding iron for Dwarven livestock.

You collect it, and begin to retrace the now-familiar path to where the Marduke Geologist is.

It occurs to you that you were able to obtain a higher-level lapis when you harbor some sort of desire and touch an {c3}Imperfect Lapis{/c}. It dawns on you that this might be your last chance to meet with the Marduke Geologist, and the thought sends you hurrying on your way.

MsgSummary:
{c2}A Marduke geologist{/c} said you can obtain {c3}Yellow Pieces of Lapis{/c} from {c1}Endia Evil Spirits and Evil Spirit Iron Armor Golems{/c}.
You have to collect {c3}more than 10{/c}  and give them to a Marduke geologist.
MsgTake:
Well, what kind of lapis did the piece I gave you last time become? Oh, that kind, eh? Not too shabby!

Anyway, I'm thinking of leaving this place. With the pieces you brought me, I managed to scrape together a good amount of money for traveling expenses.
I'm worried because my existence is gradually becoming more known to more and more people from the Union of Fury. It's pretty obvious that the longer I stay here, the more dangerous things could potentially get for me.

However, that doesn't mean I'll just take off without some regard for this little friendship of ours.

For my last request, I'd like you to go to the Endia Base and bring some yellow pieces of lapis to me.
Strangely enough, I was able to obtain yellow pieces of lapis from spirits born from the malignant toxic chemicals the Union of Fury made use of. I was able to obtain them most frequently from Evil Spirits and Evil Spirit Iron Armor Golems.

Before I leave, I want to give you one last present. I hope you bring as many pieces as possible - it'd be nice to travel with a nice, big sack of money, heh heh!
MsgIncomplete: I don't think even I can transform an amount this small into something that'll have the properties of a true Lapis.
MsgResponse4: I don't think even I can transform an amount this small into something that'll have the properties of a true Lapis.

MsgSummary: You have to give the {c2}Yellow Pieces of Lapis{/c} you obtained from the {c2}Marduke geologist{/c} to {c2}Pollekum{/c}, a blacksmith in Ranhaarr.
MsgComplete:
Looks like we'll give it another go. Alright, then!

{c5}(The combined piece of lapis takes on a soft texture soon after Pollekum places his hands on it. The hand he puts forth is full of the wisdom of the ages.){/c}

I do think it raises a few questions, you bringing me something like this, and several times, no less.

Well...far be it from me to intrude on the way a warrior lives their life.
I pray the Goddess guides your footsteps.
MsgTake:
This is the last piece of lapis, so I hope you find it useful.

Now, I suppose the time's come for you and me to part ways. I'm too old to keep this kind of thing up.
I thought I could spend the rest of my life reading my book of black magic and tending my cattle. Well, I guess that dream is gone now.

I think that now, I'll spend the rest of my life living a life of quiet ease in a remote village once return to the territory controlled by the Alliance of Light.

You'd best be on your way now. Thanks for everything~
MsgIncomplete: I don't think I'll come back to Astenes again.

MsgSummary: You have to give the {c2}Yellow Piece of Lapis{/c} you obtained from the {c2}Marduke geologist{/c} to {c2}Pollekum{/c}, a blacksmith in Ranhaarr.
MsgComplete:
Looks like we'll give it another go. Alright, then!

{c5}(The combined piece of lapis takes on a soft texture soon after Pollekum places his hands on it. The hand he puts forth is full of the wisdom of the ages.){/c}

I do think it raises a few questions, you bringing me something like this, and several times, no less.

Well...far be it from me to intrude on the way a warrior lives their life.
I pray the Goddess guides your footsteps.
MsgTake:
This is the last piece of lapis, so I hope you find it useful.

Now, I suppose the time's come for you and me to part ways. I'm too old to keep this kind of thing up.
I thought I could spend the rest of my life reading my book of black magic and tending my cattle. Well, I guess that dream is gone now.

I think that now, I'll spend the rest of my life living a life of quiet ease in a remote village once return to the territory controlled by the Alliance of Light.

You'd best be on your way now. Thanks for everything~
MsgIncomplete: I don't think I'll come back to Astenes again.

MsgSummary: You have to give the {c2}Yellow Piece of Lapis{/c} you obtained from the {c2}Marduke geologist{/c} to {c2}Pollekum{/c}, a blacksmith of Ranhaarr.
MsgComplete:
Looks like we'll give it another go. Alright, then!

{c5}(The combined piece of lapis takes on a soft texture soon after Pollekum places his hands on it. The hand he puts forth is full of the wisdom of the ages.){/c}

I do think it raises a few questions, you bringing me something like this, and several times, no less.

Well...far be it from me to intrude on the way a warrior lives their life.
I pray the Goddess guides your footsteps.
MsgTake:
This is the last piece of lapis, so I hope you find it useful.

Now, I suppose the time's come for you and me to part ways. I'm too old to keep this kind of thing up.
I thought I could spend the rest of my life reading my book of black magic and tending my cattle. Well, I guess that dream is gone now.

I think that now, I'll spend the rest of my life living a life of quiet ease in a remote village once return to the territory controlled by the Alliance of Light.

You'd best be on your way now. Thanks for everything~
MsgIncomplete: I don't think I'll come back to Astenes again.

MsgSummary: You have to destroy more than {c1}15 Crazy Crying Gargoyles{/c}, which have been harming villagers, and return to {c2}Catherine Parker{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Ah, you're back~

Did you take care of what I requested?

Weren't you caught by {c2}Creath Question{/c}?
These seem like the kind of creatures that cretin would protect.

{c5}I hesitate for a moment, then talk about Creath Question.{c/}

So, that's what happened...

I never realized that. I just thought {c2}Creath Question{/c} was protecting them.

You know...he's completely reckless. He often gets into conflicts with our religion.

Then, why is it that the religious leaders' nickname for the gargoyles is {c2}Creath Question{/c}?

That aside, you've done very well.
It's not much, but here's a token of my gratitude. Please, take it.
MsgTake:
{c5}(mumbling something~){/c}
Ah~ You're not from around here, are you?

You haven't seen any {c1}Crazy Crying Gargoyles{/c} around here, have you?

Every night, they appear, and make a total mess out of the farms I care for.

I want to find them and take 'em out myself, but...
It seems like a rough guy by the name of {c2}Creath Question{/c} is protecting these monsters.

That's why I've gotta go to you.
Do you think you could do me a favor?

Could you take care of these annoying {c1}Crazy Crying Gargoyles{/c} in my place?
MsgIncomplete: You're still here? You'd better take 'em out before {c2}Creath Question{/c} catches on.
MsgResponse4: You're still here? You'd better take 'em out before {c2}Creath Question{/c} catches on.

MsgSummary:
You have to defeat a {c2}Question Familiar{/c}, reproduced through the research of 
{c2}Creath Question{/c}, and collect {c3}5 Burnt Magic Stones{/c}.
MsgTake:
{c5}(Creath looks at a magic stone he's holding...) {/c}

With the magic stone you brought last time, I got some interesting results from my research.

Do you know what this means? It means we can finally fully reproduce creatures of the ancient world!

Yes! I suppose you already expected, but...

That other {c2}'Creath Question'{/c} is something I reproduced with a magical fragment from a {c1}Crazy Crying Gargoyle{/c}.

The purpose of my research is to reproduce these ancient creatures in such a way that they obey the commands of their creator...

Meanwhile, several of the {c1}Crazy Crying Gargoyles{/c} I reproduced seem to go down to a village secretly at night and cause a lot of trouble.

My goal is to show marked progress in my research and show that the negative reactions of religious people is just a knee-jerk reaction to something they're totally misunderstanding.

That's why I hope you can take care of this false {c2}'Creath Question'{/c} I created, on my behalf.

If you cut off one of their ears, you should find a {c3}Burned Magic Stone{/c}.

Please bring those to me as evidence.
MsgIncomplete: It's not their left ear; it should be located around the right ear. Now, get going!
MsgResponse4: It's not their left ear; it should be located around the right ear. Now, get going!

MsgSummary: You have to give the {c2}Burnt Magic Stones{/c} you've obtained from {c2}Creath Question{/c} to {c2}Lana Fairwind{/c} of the Deities Religion.
MsgTake:
Thanks to your help, I'm now able to once again continue my study of ancient creatures.

However, it's a pity about those magic stones, becoming burnt and useless after I reproduced those ancient creatures with Congealed Magic Stones.

But all is not lost - I believe we can purify these {c3}Burnt Magic Stones{/c} again.

If you have the time to spare, do you think you could do me one more favor?

Worry not about reward - there'll be plenty once the task is done.
At one time, a woman who is now a high priest of the Deities Religion aided me in my research.

Can you take these Burnt Magic Stones to her?
She may be able to purify them, through a ritual performed by the Deities Religious Order.

Hmm...perhaps she will...
MsgIncomplete:
Oh, by the by, if any other of those swabs from the religious order ask you, just tell them it's a personal matter.

It's certainly true that many from the Deities Religion have given me the evil eye, on more than one occasion.

MsgSummary: You have to give the {c3}Congealed Magic Stones{/c} {c2}Lana Fairwind{/c} purified to Creath Question.
MsgComplete:
Ah You have returned already?
{c5}You gave a Congealed_Magic_Stone you received from Lana back to Creath Question.{/c}

This is exactly what I've expected..
I'll have only the same research result again at this rate...

I wonder what has gone wrong.
hm... Anyway, good job.

Here it is. Please take this money as a reward.
Then, This is just between you and me. got it?

Granting that I haven't figured out anything with this research result...
MsgTake:
Ah, sorry; I kept you waiting a bit longer than I'd planned.

But, you know, something strange did happen.

When I purified those Burnt Magic Stones you gave to me, 5 combined to form one piece.

I don't know what happened, but they're purified, so I guess that's what he was looking for.

I don't know what kind of research my master is doing with this, but these days, there are many bad rumors about him floating around.

Whatever the research may be, I hope he finds success.
MsgIncomplete: Please, return these to the master.

MsgSummary: You have to find the owner of the Mandolin and return the Mandolin.
MsgComplete:
Whooooa!

Where did you find this?!

A few days ago, I heard {c1}Julia Dillun{/c} stole it from the religious order, so I was dreading having to scrape together money to buy a whole new instrument. This is soooo much better!

I've never imagined I'd actually be able to get it back!

Thank you very much.

I want you to take this reward. After all, you were 'instrumental' to my success!
MsgTake:
You obtained a musical instrument called a Mandolin. It's not a weapon (unless you're very skilled, or have a flair for the exotic).

Seeing as the name 'Poema' is etched on the neck, you conclude that it must be {c3}Poema's Mandolin{/c}. Brilliant deduction skills!

Apparently, {c1}Julia Dillun{/c} stole this from Poema. But you know what? That was just mean and spiteful.

You'd better give this back to the {c2}Wandering Minstrel, Poema{/c}, in Haldeck Farm 
and listen to her story.
MsgIncomplete:
It's a five-stringed musical instrument with a round resonator and a straight-edged neck.

'Poema' is written on the edge of the neck.

QuestName: You Give Love a Bad Name
MsgSummary: You have to hunt down {c1}Formal Wills{/c} and {c1}15 Sairefons Harpies{/c}, and return to Poema.
MsgComplete:
Oh dear, Did you already take care of them all?

Woa~ You're really amazing.

First, this is a small token of my gratitude.

By the way, I haven't prepared a present yet. What am I supposed to do?
MsgTake:
Well, you found ME, but you haven't by any chance run across a guy by the name of {c1}Formal Wills{/c}, have you?

He and {c1}Julia Dillun{/c} broke the rule of religion, betrayed their fellow acolytes, and escaped.
I'll bet they escaped together to a forest where harpies are staying...

Do you think you could do me one more itty-bitty favor?

I want you to capture {c1}Formal Wills{/c}, the lover of {c1}Julia Dillun{/c}.

Of course, I would feel more grateful if, in the process, you bust up plenty of harpies too~

I'll take that as a 'yes' and start preparing a reward for you right away. Hope to see you soon~
MsgIncomplete: Sorry to have to bother you with somethin' like this again, after you already went through all the trouble to return my instrument to me too....

MsgSummary:
The {c2}Wandering Minstrel, Poema{/c} told you she ordered something from {c2}Reed Miller{/c}, but it hasn't arrived yet, so she wants you to look into it.

Find {c2}Reed Miller{/c} in Arktuis Village, and check on the status of the delivery.
MsgComplete:
You're the one Poema was talking about, right?

I'm Reed Miller, the guy you're looking for.
I already made the defensive item Poema ordered; it's in my warehouse.

Now, just wait here a moment.
MsgTake:
Yaaay~ You're really something else, huh?

I thought it'd take you more time, but the present I ordered hasn't arrived yet.

Maybe it'll be completed by today or tomorrow.

If you're curious about it, why don't you just visit there in person?

If you go to Arktuis Village, you'll probably run into the famous defense item dealer, Reed Miller.

If you tell him you're there on my behalf, I think he'll let you pick up the present I ordered.

I feel good knowing that someone like you is a member of the Alliance of Light~

Well, why don't you go and check it out?
MsgIncomplete:
Whaaat? You're back already?

If you haven't gone there yet, now's the time~

MsgSummary:
You were told the present Poema ordered was already made.
Choose a defense item appropriate for your profession.
MsgComplete:
Alright then, use it wisely!
And if you happen to see Poema again, be sure to give her my best regards!

<Exclusive Use for Fighter, Defender><Exclusive Use for Ranger, Archer><Exclusive Use for Mage, Priest>
MsgTake:
Like Poema said, here are some defense items you're sure to find useful.

Which one of these strikes your fancy?
Just pick it out~

MsgSummary:
You've obtained a Monkey's Skull from Sealakels.
You have to find a {c2}Randy{/c} the pub owner, a famous food lover in Arktuis Village, and ask him if it's possible to make a dish with this skull.
MsgComplete:
Hey, Come on in~

What can I get for you tonight? Hot food? Cold drinks?

{c5}Apart from your order, you show him the Monkey's Skull and ask him lots of things{/c}

Hmm...judging by its size, it seems to be a {c1}Wilieoseu Big Monkey{/c}'s skull...

It also happens to be an ingredient of the famous Monkey's Skull Dish, one of the most expensive dishes served in our pub. Hahaha~

By the way, surely you don't want me to cook with a skull and no other ingredients, right?
MsgTake:
You've obtained a bone that looks like a monkey's skull from Sealakels.

Apparently, the Sealakels cooked and ate monkeys....

Strangely enough, Monkey's Skull is a very popular and very expensive dish among Humans, and even among some Elves. You'd better find an expert chef of the famed Monkey's Skull Dish and see whether or not it's possilbe to cook this skull.

According to a rumor you've heard in the neighborhood, Randy, who runs a pub near the White Sand seashore, seems to enjoy preparing and eating the Monkey's Skull Dish.

Why not pay him a visit there?
MsgIncomplete: It's rather small to be a human's skull, and there's nothing inside.

MsgSummary:
{c2}Randy{/c} the pub owner asked you to do something for him if you want him to prepare the Monkey's Skull Dish for you.

You have to take care of {c1}15 Wilieoseu Monkey Trainers{/c} and {c1}15 Wilieoseu Big Monkeys{/c} then return to Randy.
MsgComplete:
Did you take care of them all?
Heh heh; just like the rumors say, you handled that quickly and with finesse.

Those bastard trainers are a real handful; , so when I went there alone last time, I lost my labor.

Anyway, I feel emboldened because of you. Hahaha
If you're ever feelin' like you want to take a load off and have a drink, come and find me. I'll hook you up with some of the good liquor, my friend~

Ah, I just finished the {c3}Monkey's Skull Dish{/c}! Best eat it while it's fresh! Gyahaha!
MsgTake:
Everybody knows that the Monkey's Skull Dish does wonders for men's stamina and women's silky-smooth skin!

I'd love to make some for you, of course, but I'm kinda running low on my prime ingredient.

I don't know what they're trying to use the {c1}Wilieoseu Big Monkeys{/c} for, but {c1}Wilieoseu Monkey Trainers{/c} capture the monkeys whenever they see one, then train the monkeys to follow their orders. 

These days, it's not all that often you see a {c1}Wilieoseu Big Monkeys{/c} in the wild.

If you're interested in eating the Monkey's Skull Dish, by any chance, can you get rid of some of those trainers?

Of course, those trainers also teach the monkeys to attack anything they perceive as a threat...

Well...it's kinda awkward to beat around the bush, so I'll just shoot straight with you.

If you want to eat the famous Monkey's Skull Dish, please take out {c1}15 Wilieoseu Big Monkeys{/c} and {c1}15 Wilieoseu Monkey Trainers{/c}~

The faster, the better.
Once you take care of them, it'll be a whole lot easier for me to find my cooking ingredient.
Before you return, I'll make the Monkey Skull Dish for you with a last of my ingredients.
Be sure to come back hungry!
MsgIncomplete:
What are you still doing here?

Better hurry before I'm done cooking the dish!

MsgSummary:
You received a {c3}Monkey's Skull Dish{/c} in exchange for what you have done for Randy, but you felt a bit queasy and couldn't eat it.

Following Randy's suggestion, you can give the dish to {c2}Reed Miller{/c} and receive another reward.
MsgComplete:
Hey there, it's you again?

Oh my, this is...
Isn't this Randy's famous Monkey's Skull Dish?
You mean you're just giving it to me?
MsgTake:
Why aren't you eating? Not hungry?

People pay a lot of money for this dish, y'know.

{c5}And yet, you can't eat it...you feel kind of queasy.{/c}

Well well...looks like you've got a lot of strength, except in your stomach! Hahaha!

If you really can't eat it, don't let it go to waste - why don't you give it to my patron?

There's a guy named Reed Miller in Arktuis Village who's a big fan of my cuisine. Give this to him and ask him what you want! Ghahahaha!
MsgIncomplete:
Well, either give it to him, or eat it yourself.
Don't let this famous dish go to waste!

MsgSummary: Choose a defense item suited to your profession.
MsgComplete:
So, what do you think?

Do you like it?

Haha! It might look normal, but none of the stuff I've got on my shelves compares to this! I'll tell you all about it later if you've got the time!
I'll bet you've never seen anything like it in all your days, eh?

Well then, with a clear conscience, this food'll taste twice as good, hahaha!

<Exclusive Use for Fighter, Defender><Exclusive Use for Ranger, Archer><Exclusive Use for Mage, Priest>
MsgTake:
Wow, you're really hooked me up good this time!

You're the one who lent Poema a hand before, right?

Hahaha! I got a good feeling!

I can't just take this without givin' you something, through - that just wouldn't do.

All I've got to offer are armors and defensive items, though, so I'll give you something I've made.

I gave you a gauntlet last time, right?

Well then, how about a good pair of boots this time? Just pick the ones you want to wear~

MsgSummary:
You have obtained a small trunk that the Dwarven explorers are using.

You have to give it to the Dwarven explorer Rolin Silverhawk in the Fedion district.
MsgComplete:
Hot damn, I'm busy!

Hey, hey now, you've got some business with me?

What is this trunk?

You're thinking that just 'cause this is a small trunk and I'm a dwarf, I'm gonna use it? Crikey, I feel victimized by harmful stereotypes!

There's not even anything inside! Why in the Goddess's name are you givin' something like this to me?
MsgTake:
You have obtained an {c3}Empty Trunk{/c} from the Orcs - it's the kind used by Dwarves!

The Orcs have already cleaned out whatever was inside, leaving the trunk empty.

It appears something has happened between the Orcs and Dwarves.

You should seek out famous Dwarven explorer {c2}Rolin Silverhawk{/c} in Frost Woods and listen to his story.

MsgSummary: You have to defeat {c1}Stonehammer Dwarf Explorers{/c} and bring {c3}2 Locked_Trunks{/c} to Dwarven explorer Rolin Silverhawk.
MsgTake:
Tell me then, why would you want to be givin' me an empty trunk?

If you brought it all this way 'cause you thought I'd need it, you done thought wrong!

It's just another piece of luggage I don't need.

While it's true that our expedition has been delayed due to a lack of equipment, tossin' me a giant trunk doesn't help matters much.

What I need right now are excavation tools!

Stonehammer explorers are usually hauling around excavation tools in trunks just like this one.

I was carryin' them like that myself 'til the day before yesterday, but my chest got swept away by the seawater while I was exploring near the seaside.

Can you steal two Locked Trunks from Stonehammer Dwarves, perchance? I just need two.

If you don't have time to do it, it can't be helped...

However, you'll be missin' out on the chance to get somethin' good from me!
MsgIncomplete: Ah, I nearly forgot, but don't bring me a Locked Trunk that just turns out to be full of random junk!

MsgSummary: You have to deliver one Locked Trunk to {c2}Reed Miller{/c} in Arktuis Village.
MsgComplete:
Whaaaaa?!

Y...you again? I asked a favor of Rolin, but it's you who's bringing it?

There'd be solid work for you as a courrier, hahaha!

{c5}(You're growing tired of Reed's antics. You can't bring yourself to hate him, though, because he's made some pretty good defensive gear for you...)
MsgTake:
Hmm...you really brought two, heh.

Actually, I just needed the excavation tools contained in one {c3}Locked Trunk{/c}.

I actually asked you to bring two because a friend of mine needs some of the same tools.

But it was my mistake, for not expecting you to bring 'em so quickly.
I'm actually feelin' a bit sorry - that's a new one!

Anyway, a promise is a promise. If you give this other {c3}Locked Trunk{/c} to my friend, he'll give you a present, I'd wager.

I already let him know a trunk was coming, so go there and see what he might have for you.

If you see me around another time, I'll give you something even better!

This is a man's promise! Yeah!

Now get a move on, you don't have all day!

Oh, by the by, my friend's name is Reed Miller, and he lives in Arktuis Village~

{c5}(You're surprised to hear the name 'Reed Miller', but you've come to realize he's quite a famous defense item merchant in this area, so it all makes sense. You wonder what he'll give you this time.){/c}
MsgIncomplete: Why haven't you left yet?

MsgSummary: Choose a piece of defensive gear appropriate to your profession.
MsgComplete:
{c5}Miller approaches you and whispers{/c}

Hush now...this is a secret to everybody...

I made this special, y'know.
I got something from another place, and added a lot of special modifications myself.

Even Doltin Coper right out there doesn't have a clue about it, heh heh!

It's definitely your lucky day, so go on, wear it with pride!

<Exclusive Use for Fighter, Defender><Exclusive Use for Ranger, Archer><Exclusive Use for Mage, Priest>
MsgTake:
I never expected you'd be the one to bring the excavation tools I requested from Rolin. Threw me for a loop there!

Everywhere you go, you're solving other folks problems, aren't you? You're like a brawler, a detective, and a courrier all rolled into one! Haha!

Anyway, I was told to pay you back with a piece of defensive gear I was originally gonna give to Rolin.

Here, go on and take it~ Business is business, after all~

MsgSummary:
Since the bowstring is gone, there's no way to use this, but...
You've obtained a really great-looking bow.

You should give it back to its owner, {c2}Len Starshooter{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Hush, hush!

If you've come to see me, just wait a moment.

I'm listening to what the voices on the wind have to say.

{c5}After a while in silence, she begins to speak again{/c}

I'm sorry to have detained you so long.

You have to keep on your toes all the time here because you have no idea when the surrounding enemies might make a sudden attack, so I'm trying to sense their movement on the wind.

So you're looking for Len Starshooter, are you?

Well...I'm Len Starshooter.

What do you want from me?

{c5}You slowly offer Len's Bow to her.{/c}

Ah...this is...

Did you happen to run into a Dempnun?
MsgTake:
You've obtained really great looking bow!

Even though the bowstring is gone, you can feel the good vibes from this weapon. It's really a thing of beauty.

You can see the name '{c2}Len Starshooter{/c}' embossed on the lower part of the bow in a tiny script. Could this bow belong to {c2}Len Starshooter{/c}, from the central Beacon Mound?

You might as well check it out - go meet up with Len Starshooter!

MsgSummary: You have to destroy {c1}15 Swordtail Sealakel Priests{/c} and {c1}15 Swordtail Sealakel Hunters{/c} and return to {c2}Len Starshooter{/c} .
MsgComplete:
You've returned safely; that's good to see.

These eyes never disappoint me.

I'm sure the defeat has shattered whatever morale they have left.

I guess they wouldn't dare raise a hand against the villagers in Willieoseu, at least for now.

My thanks to you, traveler!
MsgTake:
If what I think is true, that means if you have this bow...

Did kill Dempnun??

Well...you're certainly a lot stronger than you look.

Even I, probably the best Archer in Willioseu, was eventually defeated by Dempnun.

Well, if you're skilled enough to take out one of their leaders, I've gotta give props to your skill.

By the way, you did make one mistake, though. The Sealakels won't feel any more afraid of us or threatened by us unless we can take out their leader too.
MsgIncomplete:
I received information that the Swordtail Sealakels are advancing toward our area, slowly but surely.
You'd best leave now.

MsgSummary: You have to tell Len's story to {c2}Reed Miller{/c} in Arktuis Village.
MsgComplete:
Hey there, Captain Troubleshooter!

What kind of problem are you gonna wrangle into submission today?
MsgTake:
Thanks to you, the Willieoseu district will finally have a measure of peace.

I'm feeling rather fortunate about it all.

Actually, the folks who suffered the most trouble 'cause of the Sealakels are the citizens of Arktuis Village.

I think this will come as a stroke of good news to them, since most people in Arktuis Village actually live near the Maelstorm Coast.

That's why I'm telling you - if you happen to be on your way toward Arktuis Village, could you deliver this news to a guy by the name of Reed Miller who lives there?

I had something I needed to give him, but that can wait - what's important is that this news gets to him as soon as possible.

So, what do you think? Are you feeling up to the task?

{c5}Reed Miller...again? He's even more famous than you thought!{/c}
MsgIncomplete: Please deliver this news to him as soon as possible.

MsgSummary: Choose a piece of defensive gear suited to your profession.
MsgComplete:
Thank you very much~

I feel so fortunate that you came to our village.

Yes, yes, that's the way! Perhaps it was all destiny that we met like this!

<Exclusive Use for Fighter, Defender><Exclusive Use for Ranger, Archer><Exclusive Use for Mage, Priest>
MsgTake:
What?

You say you took care of the Sealakels in Maelstorm Coast?

I heard even Len Starshooter was defeated by them. And...then you took out a Dempnun?

I must have underestimated your abilities! Well, that's quite a surprise.

Actually, we've been fed up with them for a long time because most villagers are living near the Maelstorm Coast. I really appreciate how you mopped up that mess.

As a reward, I'll give you my final, most splendid present. Don't think of declining - go on, go on! Choose whichever you'd like!

MsgSummary: You have to deliver a {c3}Blackbeard Secret Note{/c} to someone interested in the Deities Religion.
MsgComplete:
This is...

Where on earth did you find this?

This a matter of greatest urgency!

Come closer a moment and let me explain...
MsgTake:
You've obtained a 'Blackbeard Secret Note.'

What is written in the note reads as follows:

'To the Blackbeard First Mate Kuluny,

The Deities Religion is already suspicious of me, and sooner or later, my true identity will be revealed.

I already have a parish of the Deities Religion on my hand, so I'm planning to fly the coop soon.
Chances are, there will be pursuers from the Deities Religion chasing after me.

For the sake of my safety, if I arrive near the harbor, I hope Blackbeard takes me into hiding.

-For the victory of Blackbeard-'

MsgSummary:
Poema turned out to be a secret inquisitor for the Deities Religion.

Just as she said, you have to defeat something called the {c1}Bloody Inquisitor{/c} who have held a parish of the Deities Religion in their foul grasp.
MsgComplete:
Ah, you've returned.

Did you retrieve the {c3}Deities Parish{/c}?

Hmm...looks like you've done everything I asked. Excellent work.
MsgTake:
Heh...didn't expect me to be an Inquisitor, did you?

Do you think you can do me a favor?

I'd like you to go to White Sand Habor quickly and get rid of those {c1}Bloody Inquisitors{/c}, then retrieve the {c3}Deities Parish{/c} they're holding.

This is an urgent matter, so...

I'll explain it to you later, in detail. For now, just go.

I'm counting on you.
MsgIncomplete:
Leave now.

You have to catch the {c1}Bloody Inquisitors{/c} before they board their ship!

MsgSummary: Respond to Poema's question.
MsgComplete:
{c1}While walking deep in the forest alone, you encounter a tiger. You feel it would be almost impossible to defeat the tiger on your own. Which would you be most likely to do?{/c}

<I realize that fighting it one-on-one would be near-impossible, so I climb a tall tree to evade it.><I never show my back to an opponent. I'll make the first charge, though I may die.>
MsgTake:
Thanks again for your assistance.

Ah...time for an introduction - though a bit late.

In reality, I'm a secret Inquisitor of the Deities Religion.

I've been really concerned because some unsavory things have recently happened within the Order recently.

Before I reward you, I want to ask you a few questions, though.

I'm going to give you one among several mementos of our religion.  Depending on how you answer, what I give you will be different, so you'd better decide carefully.

According to your decision, my letter and sign will be different as well.

MsgSummary: You're the type who faces up to the reality of situations and pursues the practical course, rathern than chasing the butterflies of 'dream' and 'ambition.' Listen to what the {c2}Great Priest Apokryphos{/c} of the Deities Religious Order in Apulune has to say.
MsgComplete:
Ah, you're that warrior Poema has been talking about.

I know much about you; our secret Inquisitor, Poema, already sent us a letter detailing your interactions.

And now, you've come to me because you're the type who abides with utility rather than chasing after a dream...

The Order recently decided to bestow upon you one of our ancient mementos in honor of your accomplishment.

There are three from which you may choose.

Once you choose, however, you cannot change your decision.
Therefore, give it some careful consideration before you talk with me again and make your decision.

Let me emphasize that point: once you've chosen, the choice is final.
MsgTake:
Unlike someone who fancifully chases the butterflies called 'dream' and 'ambition,'

You always face the reality of the situation and embrace a the pragmatic solution.

Now, find the {c2}Great Priest Apokryphos{/c} of the Deities Religion in Apulune.

QuestName: A Present of the Deities Religion(1)
MsgSummary: As a pursuer of the utilitarian way, you state your choice to the {c2}Great Priest Apokryphos{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Well, now you shall face my question!

{c1}Your life is a succession of meaningless day. You escape from this routine and have a chance to enjoy a vacation to an uninhabited island. Suddenly, the Goddess appears before you and tells you he will give you only one thing you can take to this uninhabited island.
If you could take only ONE thing to this inhabited island, what would you take?{/c}

Select the answer that you most strongly agree with:

<I need nothing as long as I have the one I love with me. Even an uninhabited island can be home, in that situation.><I love my PC~ I could live my whole life on a deserted island if only I had electricity, my PC, and a high-speed internet line.><I have to survive! Give me so much food that, if I die out there, it surely won't be from hunger.>
MsgTake:
Are you ready to receive a powerful gift from the Deities Religion?

{c5}You hesitate a moment, then nod slowly.{/c}

MsgSummary: So, you're full of ambition... {c2}Lana Fairwind{/c} is someone you ought to talk to, then. Listen to what {c2}Lana Fairwind{/c} has to say.
MsgComplete:
Heeeey, you're the one who did a favor for my master, Creath Question, a while ago.

You're even open to helping a religious order like this? My thanks to you, then.

Poema said I'm to give you a reward....

Before that, I want you to think about the kind of person you are.  And then...

You have to answer a thought-provoking question of mine.

The important thing to keep in mind is that the reward will be different depending on your answer, so you have to decide carefully. Once you select one, you can't alter your decision.
When you feel ready, talk to me again.

Have you given it some thought? Are you ready to answer my question?
MsgTake:
You're always full of ambition and desire for the future, always chasing dreams, eh?

Well, first, you'll have to learn to control your enthusiasm and your desire.

Please go to the Deities Religion's headquarters in Apulune and find the great priestess {c2}Lana Fairwind{/c}.

QuestName: A Present of the Deities Religion (2)
MsgSummary:
As a pursuer of your ambitions and dreams,
You must answer {c2}Lana Fairwind{/c}'s question.
MsgComplete:
{c1}A storm arises one day as you are traveling. As you look out, you see 3 people on the road asking for your help. Which one will you give a ride in your vehicle?{/c}

Of course, the best answer would be handing over the vehicle to a doctor who saved your life before, letting him put a patient in a critical condition on board and taking them to receive further treatment. Then you could just help the attractive person who seems just your type yourself. However, unfortunately, the doctor doesn't know how to drive...

Well then, who would you help?

<A sick granny who is in critical condition.><A person who seems like a perfect match for you, like you've never met before in your life.><A doctor who saved my life some time ago.>
MsgTake: If you think you're ready, come talk to me again.

MsgSummary: You have to give the {c3}Starfumos Invasion Plan{/c} to {c2}Parma{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Hey, how've you been?

What? Someone's trying to lead a force to invade Starfumos?
Hahaha!
I haven't heard a story as far-out as that for a loooong time!
Even if they actually invade, it won't be an easy fight for them as long as I'm here!

{c5}You hand over the document slowly. As he reads over it, the look on his face changes to one of concern.{/c}
MsgTake:
You've obtained a document that includes details regarding Starfumos Village, such as its compliment of armed forces, geographical condition, and supplies, as well as military information such as expected troop routes.

In light of the header that reads 'Starfumos Invasion Plan', you quickly conclude that somebody seems tohave it in for poor Starfumos.

You have to deliver these plans to the person in charge of the village's defense as soon as possible.
You'd better find Parma in Starfumos village and give this document to him.

MsgSummary: You have to collect more than {c3}3 Starfumos Scout Notes{/c} from {c1}Stonepick Goblin Chasers{/c} and give them to {c2}Parma{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Come on in.
Have you collected all their scouting notes?
{C5}You hand over the scouting notes{/C}

Hmm... This is just what I expected.
It seems they've been planning this for the long time.
What's more, according to the documents you've provided, I can now see that they can go beyond a simple invasion and crush us between a pincer attack...
Gotta keep a cool head - we have to think about this.
MsgTake:
{c5}Parma's expression darkened as he read the document you provided.{/c}

Where did you find this document?

Judging by the detailed information presented here, this doesn't seem to be just a joke. It's not a problem I can put off or overlook either.

If what this document outlines comes to pass, I might not be able to guarantee the safety of Starfumos village.

But even knowing all that, I can't request backup forces from Iris right now...

Grrr...this just became complicated.

I'm sorry to trouble you, but could you find out a little more about this document?

Judging by what's written there, it appears that Silverpick Goblin Chasers are still collecting a lot of pretty detailed information.
It seems their reports go back to the Silverpick Goblin Priest, so first, we need to hunt down some Silverpick Goblin Chasers and steal their Scout Notes so that they can no longer report information.

I'd better consult with Aruma Village and the Aumeros Army's chief of guards first.
Please go and take down Silverpick Goblin villians so that the information they've collected can never be used against Starfumos village.
I'm counting on you~
MsgIncomplete:
Are you still here?
Every moment is crucial for us to foil their plans, but you're still loafing around? That's kinda disappointing...
Now, get a move on!

MsgSummary: You have to take care of {c1}10 Silverpick Goblin Fighters{/c} and report to Parma.
MsgComplete:
Hey there, come on in!
Great, I was just about to call you.
Have you taken care of all the Silverpick Goblin Fighters?

Wow. *whistles* You're as strong as the rumors say.
MsgTake:
{c5}Parma seems to remain lost in thought for quite some time, staring out blankly as he talks to you{/c}
According to the current information, it appears that Stonepick Goblin Fighters comprise the main forces of the Silverpick Goblins. 

First, in order to rout their camp, it might be a good idea to take care of Silvepick Goblin Fighters, so can you go now and take care of 10 Silverpick Goblin Fighters and return?

Let's take some preparations for a possible invasion after we take care of these guys.

The quicker you take them out, the better it'll be for all of us.
MsgIncomplete: Take 'em out, then come back to see me.

MsgSummary: You have to defeat {c1}10 Silverpick Goblin Hunters{/c} to the northwest of Starfumos Village and report back to {c2}Parma{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Ah-ha, well done!

Thanks to you, the villagers can board ships without any worries.

In addition, fishermen can hook their lunkers again in relative piece.

You've done us all proud, and that's the truth.
MsgTake:
A small problem came up in the village while you were taking care of the Silverpick Goblin Fighters.

We discovered {c1}Silverpick Goblin Hunters{/c} hunting to the northwest of the village.

I don't know whether these guys are part of an invasion plan or if they're really just hunting, but they've occupied an Aidion Swamp ferry, and we've received reports that some of those villages have been injured too.

Can you go and bust up these brigands?
After you come back, it'd be a good idea to report this invasion plan to Balse, an officer I know in the Aumeros Army.

Anyway, I'll dice the problem out with you more when you get back.

First, go and take care of those devious Silver Goblin Hunters now. And whatever you do, make it snappy!
MsgIncomplete: You'd better hurry up - I heard that the villagers weren't able to board any ships.

MsgSummary: Please give the {c3}Goblin Invasion Plan{/c} to {c2}Balse{/c}, an officer of the Aumeros Army.
MsgComplete:
Oh, you're that warrior I've been hearing a lot about lately!
{c5}You carefully hand over the invasion plans.{/c}
MsgTake:
At present, it appears we've somehow succeeded in scattering the goblin encampment surrounding Starfumos.

Now, we need to keep a careful watch on several groups the Goblins may have formed an alliance with.
It might prove to be somewhat difficult right now, but even so, it's the only real recourse.

At any rate, please find Balse, an officer of the Aumeros Army, and deliver the Starfumos Invasion Plan to him.

Sir Balse is very famous as an army strategist, so he might have a winning idea or two up his sleeve.
I'll secure Starfumos here and support you, so go to Sir Balse, report our situation here, and let him take a look at the invasion plans.
MsgIncomplete: Sir Balse is with the Aumeros Army.

MsgSummary: Choose a piece of defensive gear appropriate to your profession.
MsgComplete:
Well, why don't you try it on? Gotta make sure it looks good and is comfortable to wear/

<For Warrior, Guardian><For Hunter, Assassin><For Pagan, Oracle>
MsgTake:
I've taken a good look over those invasion plans you brought.
At a glance, those goblin monsters seem no more than a trifling thing, but it seems they're a lot smarter than they look, hahaha~  Starfumos invasion indeed!
Well, it seems they've worked hard to design a plan in their own way.
When I look at it, though, it doesn't look all that scary like Parma said, heh!
{c5}Is it because he's an officer? This guy doesn't seem agitated at all. In fact, it almost seems like he's mocking the goblins.{/c}
Anyway, I appreciate all you've done for us, so I'll give you some of the armor our force has been using. It's good stuff.
Choose whatever you please.
Once you choose, you can't change your selection, though, so make sure to pick carefully.
Well, just have a look at these and choose the one that suits you.

MsgSummary: You have to give an {c3}Unknown Necklace{/c} to {c2}Tasti{/c}, a boatman.
MsgComplete:
Ah, hello there, wayward traveler.

Is there something I can help ya with today?
MsgTake:
You picked up a necklace that was lying on the ground.

Apparently, someone must've lost it while passing through here.

To start, try showing it to Tasti, the nearest boatman in the area. Perhaps he saw something that can point you in the right direction.
MsgIncomplete: It's a normal necklace with a cross-shaped pendant.

MsgSummary: The owner of the necklace is {c2}Dugon Hisuren{/c} in Starfumos. You have to return this necklace to him.
MsgComplete:
I...I....don't really like strangers.

I know you're a stranger....

Wait, but...did I...my...

Ne....Necklace?
MsgTake:
Did you pick up a necklace?

Ah, so this is it, huh? I'm pretty sure I know this one.

This belongs to {c2}Dugon Hisuren{/c}, who lives in Starfumos Village.

He's really a poor child.
His sister is poor as well.

Anyway, I'm certain the owner of this necklace is Dugon Hisuren.

I'm sure he'll be pleased if you return it to him.
MsgIncomplete:
Ssssh...this is a secret, but...
Dugon and his sister are half-blood children.

MsgSummary: You have to get rid of {c1}15 Keuraijen Sad Souls{/c} in Aidion Swamp northwest of Starfumos.
MsgComplete:
Have...you..beaten...them all?

I...like...you, t...traveler

I like you, t...traveler~
MsgTake:
N..Necklace?

Ah.... Gh...ghosts!

Ghosts are fo...following me!

I....I'm scared....

Pleas...e ....capture....these gho.....ghosts~

{c5}When people from this area talk about ghosts, they're generally referring to Keuraijen Sad Soul.{/c}
MsgIncomplete: I'm... I'm scared~

MsgSummary: Choose a piece of defensive gear appropriate to your profession.
MsgComplete:
What do y..you think?

D...do you like it?

Since I was young, I have...learned....this...from sister.

Each day, I learned...how to make this...kind of thing....

So....so...I...make..it very well.

Thanks for....finding...my necklace.

<For Warrior, Guardian><For Hunter, Assassin><For Pagan, Oracle>
MsgTake:
Guess what?.... I can m...make something like t...this pretty well.

{c5}His finger points toward a piece of your armor{/c}

You...you're a good p-person, Traveler.

So.....I...I'm gonna make some d...defensive gear for you!
MsgIncomplete: Just pick...whichever one you like!

MsgSummary: You have to show a {c3}Kobolts' Defense Item Drawing{/c} you obtained from Kobolts to {c2}Mutto{/c}.
MsgComplete:
I'm pretty busy now...what do you want from me?

What is this drawing?

Are you sayin' you want me to make you a piece of gear based on a Kobolt design?

Psh...this gear doesn't look all THAT great, y'know.
Do you still want it made?

Well, at least it'll be better than that worn-out gear you're wearing now, though...
MsgTake:
You've obtained a {c3}Kobolts' Defense Item Drawing{/c} from {c1}WedgeRock Kobolt Hunters{/c}.

Even though you aren't privy to the ins and outs of the manufacture of defensive gear, it seems to be a production drawing of a piece of gear that looks even better than what you currently have.

It sure couldn't hurt to show this to any blacksmith who might be nearby...
MsgIncomplete: What's written here is a materials list and refining process pertinent only to Kobolt armor.

MsgSummary: You have to hunt either {c1}Keuraijen Black Leopards{/c} or {c1}Keuraijen Large Black Leopards{/c} and find more than {c3}5 black leopard's skins{/c} in order to produce the Kobolts' defensive gear.
MsgComplete:
Oh, back already, I see!

Now, just let me take some of those black leopard's skins there...
MsgTake:
Let's see here...

Looking at this drawing, I think I might need about 3 black leopard's skins.

Actually, I need a polished black leopard's skin.

I sincerely doubt a fighter like you is really knowledgable in the art of polishing leather.

I have an extra polished black leopard's skin, but I can't give it to unproven talent that just waltzed in here, now can I?

Hmmm..

Here's my deal!

I have some polished leather now, so I'll set to making this defensive gear of yours. In the meantime, why don't you capture black leopards and bring back 5 black leopard's skins?

3 leathers and the 2 leathers I'll have as a commission are what'll be needed for production.

I hope you don't mind; I have no choice. I have to make a living too, after all.
Now, best get a move on.
MsgIncomplete: No, no; I can't use leather than's been worn out!

MsgSummary: You have to find {c2}Penot{/c}, a defensive gear merchant, in the Aumeros Army Fort.
MsgComplete:
Ah, you're the one Mutto's told me about.

Come on in!
MsgTake:
Hahaha, you've really brought me a lot!

Actually, like I said before, only three skins are needed to make the gear you want, but I asked you to find two more skins to cover the commission for my work. 

Now that you've brought them, I almost feel sorry for putting you through that ordeal, haha.

Actually, I already made your defense item.
I left it in the care of Penot, whom you can see right in the front, so go on and claim it whenever you're ready.

Anyway, thanks~ I hope the armor brings you plenty of protection!
MsgIncomplete: What are you still doing here? Can't get enough of me, eh?

MsgSummary: Choose a piece of defensive gear appropriate to your profession.
MsgComplete:
Mutto's really very skilled, so I don't doubt this item will be pretty useful for you.

<For Warrior, Guardian><For Hunter, Assassin><For Pagan, Oracle>
MsgTake:
From what I heard, seems like Mutto sent you on some wild-ass chase, hahaha!

Aherm...well...not that it's any of my business.

Anyway, here's the armor you ordered.

Go on and take it; you're paid up in full.

MsgSummary:
Warune's Hunting Contest - An assignment from Sankaritar, a Hunter

You must hunt down {c1}15 Keuraijen Big Antelopes{/c} to receive a {c3}Sign of Sankaritar{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Wow, have you taken care of them already?

You've really popped up in an unexpected place at an unexpected time - I never saw it coming.

Anyway, this assignment is complete.
Now, prepare yourself for the other two tasks that lie before you.
MsgTake:
Ah, new around these parts, traveler?

You must have heard about Warune's hunting contest, right?
Warune's hunting contest is one of the best festivals held in this area every year.

Here's how to compete in the contest. If you carry out a mission for each of the three hunters here, each hunter will give you a sign. All you have to do is collect all 3 signs from an each hunter and give them to Sir Warune.
Sounds easy, of course, but to actually do it - that's the real challenge, haha!

First, the assignment I'm going to give to you is to find some Keuraijen Big Antelope, hunt 15, then return to me.

You'd better start quickly before the other participants capture them all!

Before you go, you should listen to my two friends' assignments too; perhaps you can kill three birds with one stone, so to speak, haha!
MsgIncomplete: You mean to say you haven't started yet?

MsgSummary:
Warune's Hunting Contest - An assignment from Spike, a Hunter.

After hunting down {c1}15 Keuraijen Big Bisons{/c}, you will receive a {c3}Sign of Spike{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Pshaw! Just as I thought, this year's assignments were too easy!

Well, anyway, this assignment is over now, so take care of the two other assignments and go to Sir Warune~
MsgTake:
I'm always happy this time of year.

The expressions of all those gathered here shows their liveliness!

It's really a lot of fun~ 

Some people are really excited about completing the assignment I'm giving out.

And some are carrying it out with reluctance because their friends or significant others pushed them into doing it.
And some are just getting a kick out of griefing others - you know how these games of sport go.

Ah, too long an introduction, eh? Let me give you an assignment, then.

What I'd like you to do is hunt down 15 Keuraijen Big Bisons.

I don't know exactly where they are either, but it'd be great if you could find 'em all quick-like!
MsgIncomplete: No matter how many times I consider it, this year's assignments are just too easy...

MsgSummary:
Warune's Hunting Contest - An assignment from Zest, a Hunter.

After hunting down {c1}5 Keuraijen Maneating Wild Boars{/c}, you will receive the {c3}Sign of Zest{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Aww...is it over already?

Did you finish all the other assignments?
MsgTake:
A new entrant? Good show!

Lemme get straight to the point. What I'd like you to hunt down is 5 Keuraijen Maneating Wild Boars.

That's it! Now, off with you, 'til you're done!
MsgIncomplete: Do you have the spare time to be hanging out around here? I don't think so!

MsgSummary: Choose a piece of defensive gear appropriate to your profession.
MsgComplete:
Oh, you've collected all three already?

Here is a reward for your victory in the Hunter's Game!

As of now, the victory ceremony has been finished.

The reward I have for you is something that can be found nowhere else - truly one-of-a-kind!

Use it wisely...and of course, congratulations on your victory!

<For Warrior, Guardian><For Hunter, Assassin><For Pagan, Oracle>
MsgTake:
-Warune's Hunting Contest-

After carrying out the assignments of the three chosen Hunters, you shall receive from them a sign-mark.

The person who collects these 3 signs the most quickly shall be the winner of my hunting contest.

This year, the first winner appeared later than my expectation.

I guess this Hunting Contest isn't such a famous festival these days...

Well, the reality of the situation is, most of the Hunters have gone off to the battlefields, and only a few competent youths are left to compete for the prize.

In this situation, I guess I can't really expect much more than this.

Anyway, I'll give a reward right away to the first entrant who has successfully carried out all assignments, so collect them quickly.

MsgSummary: You have to defeat {c1}Silvepick Goblin Spirits{/c} and steal {c3}Talund's Letter{/c}, then give it to {c2}Balse{/c}, an officer.
MsgComplete:
I'm glad to see you've returned safe and sound!

It must have been difficult to pick out a real spirit moving amongst those fake spirits.

But all in all, it seems you captured it more quickly than I was expecting, even.
MsgTake:
It's been a while since I've seen you!

Have you grown in wisdom and power since we last met?

Last time, as a result of reviewing the Starfumos Invasion Plan you delivered, 

we found some unexpected information.

We realized there is an allied union forming, as part of an invasion plan of the Silverpick Goblins!

I hadn't noticed it before, since it was written in an encrypted form in the plans.

But recently, our cryptologists deciphered the code, and we found out all about their union.

The person guiding the whole process was none other than Talund DemonStone.

I assume you might already know the situation very well, but according to the invasion plan, I expect DemonStone's forces might be a tough nut to crack.

However, more importantly, we discovered the fact Talund replied to a backup request previously sent out by the Goblins.

We have to intercept this news before it is delivered to the Goblins' leader, Ballakashi.

Thus, your mission is to find a Silverpick Goblin Spirit carrying out the mission to deliver Talune's reply to Ballakashi and steal Talund's Letter.

About two or three Silverpick Goblin Spirits are grouped together - only one is the real spirit; the other two spirits are just fakes.

The real spirit is carrying documents, each of which contains important information, and the other two spirits are there to assist the real spirit in case of an emergency.

The core of this mission is to see through the illusion and fine which one is the real spirit, then recover Talund's Letter from this real spirit as soon as you're able.

I've got a new mission for you as soon as this one is over, too. I hope you keep in mind that this mission is a really crucial mission for the peace of both the Keuraijen district as well as the Starfumos district. Please be careful - it's better to act slowly but certainly than jump into something you're not prepared for.

Anyway, that's about it - any questions?
MsgIncomplete: Are you still here? You've gotta get moving more quickly!

MsgSummary: You have to get rid of {c1}10 DemonStone HellTooth leaders{/c}.
MsgComplete: Good work out there.
MsgTake:
I've examined the contents of Talund's Letter you brought last time.

As a result, I've found that the main composition of the forces Talun DemonStone is sending are Demonstone Hellteeth leaders.

The next mission that will be given to you is to reduce the number of outside sourceswhich might be heading to Silverpick Goblins as much as you can.

That is, your next mission is to eliminate at least {c1}10 DemonStone HellTooth leaders{/c}.

I hope that you finish the mission safely and successfully, then report your deeds back to me.

That's about it - do you have any questions?
MsgIncomplete: Soldier! Do you have something to ask me again? If you don't have any questions, might as well get moving on your qests

MsgSummary: You have to find a {c2}Starfumos Assasin{/c} and deliver the Forged Talund's Letter to him.
MsgComplete:
Hey...are you looking for me?

Sssssh! Speak quietly, lest our enemies hear us!

If your business is with me, tell me without delay.
MsgTake:
You've worked very hard to carry out all missions I've given to you thus far.

This mission will be the last I give to you.

We have destroyed the backup force of Talund DemonStone to prevent the possibility of reinforcements, and now we will carry out our harassment tactics against the Goblin camp for the last time.

Our highly trained assassin has already infiltrated the Goblin camp, and you have to give the Forged Talund's Letter to him so that this feigned reply will spread throughout the enemy camp.

The most important thing in this mission to be careful, so that our {c2}Starfumos Assasin{/c} who infiltrated the camp won't be discovered by other Goblins.

It won't be easy to track down his location.

I assume he might be hovering around a Silverpick Goblin Priest, ever-ready to execute some of our harsher tactics.

Now all you have to do is give this to him and deliver him an order to make sure it gets into the priest's hands.
MsgIncomplete:
A Starfumos Assasin's personal information is strictly confidential - even my name!

It's better not to ask - in fact, better not even to be curious about it.

MsgSummary: You have to find the great priest, {c2}Lucifera Dilusid{/c}, in Iris.
MsgComplete:
Oh! You must be the warrior who I was told was on their way here.

It's good to see you.

I've already been hearing about your deeds for quite some time.

First, come here and sit.
MsgTake:
Hmm... All I have to do is spread this Forged Talund's Letter near a priest, right?

The tactics of Sir Balse are beyond imagination. He always manages to surprise us.

Anyway, I'll accomplish my mission here and return to Starfumos.

You should go to Iris quickly now.

The great priest Lucifera in the great temple called for you.

It seems he's planning to reward you for putting a stop to the Stafumos Invasion Plan in advance and finishing the Goblin harassment successfully.

What I really wonder, though, is...why don't I get any reward?

I envy you.

I've just got a bit left to finish up here, then, so I'd best get to work...
MsgIncomplete:
Sssssh!

A Silverpick Goblin Priest close by seems to be looking toward this place.

MsgSummary: You have to answer Lucifera Dilusid's question.
MsgTake:
Oh, because there are warriors like you,

We can serve God peacefully in this great temple.

I've heard many tales of your distinguished military services from several priests.

That's why we, the great temple, made a decision to give you a small token of our appreciation.

Before that, I'll ask you several questions about your inclination.

The reward of the great temple will be different depending on how you answer.

All rewards are priceless, but they will change slightly depending on your inclination, so I hope your answers are careful and true.

Also, once you choose one, you can't take back your choice.

When your mind is prepared to answer my question, talk to me.

QuestName: The Decision of the Great Temple
MsgSummary:
You, who have some kind of unique and delicate aspect!

You, pursuing beauty within splendor rather than simplicity.

You have to find {c2}Clitan Sinopis{/c} in Iris.
MsgComplete:
Is this Lucifera's letter?

{c5}You hand over Lucifera's letter.{/c}
MsgTake:
You, who have chosen the left hand!

You, who have in you a unique and delicate aspect!

You, who pursues beauty within splendor rather than simplicity...

I'll give you a reward, in accordance with the will of the great temple.

Please give this letter to Clitan Sinopis.

MsgSummary:
You who have chosen the left hand!

This time, you must answer {c2}Clitan Sinopis{/c}'s question.
MsgComplete:
Are you ready?

Then, I'll ask you a question.

{c1}You fall into a deep pit, and regain consciousness in a pitch-black chamber. In order to stand on your feet in the darkness where you can't even see your hand in front of your face, you put your hand on the ground.
At this moment, how does the ground you are touching feel?{/c}

 
<It is uneven and very squishy; walking on it makes you feel dizzy.><It is very rough; you feel that you might trip and take a spill at any time.><It is a steady, flat, and very strong ground.>
MsgResponse1:
You think so, Are you really sure?

Here is a present. I pray you give your best for the Union of Fury each day.
MsgResponse2:
Oh; I thought that's what you might say!

Good answer.

Here is a present, and may you accomplish great things for the Union of Fury each day.
MsgTake:
I have carefully read the letter you handed me.

Lucifera is both a great priest of the great temple and a sage renowned for the highest virtue in Iris.

In order to give you a fitting reward on behalf of the great temple, you have to answer my second question.

Once you choose one, you can't change your choice, as per the standing rule. 
Therefore, when you're fully prepared, come {c1}talk to me again{/c}.

I would prefer that you answer cautiously, from your heart, so that the reward you receive will be something most fitting for you.

MsgSummary:
You have an active personality, an energetic dispostion, and a power that fascinates those around you with your quick reaction and judgment.

Find {c2}Klelune Decretum{/c} in Iris.
MsgComplete:
What brought a warrior like you here?

Lucifera's letter?

Let me see what he's written...

{c5}You hand over the letter carefully{/c}
MsgTake:
You have an active personality, an energetic dispostion, and a power that fascinates those around you with your quick reaction and judgment.

I'll give you a reward depending on what the assembly of the high-class nobles decides.

Find Clitan Sinopis and give this letter to him.

MsgSummary:
You, who have chosen the right hand!

You must answer {c2}Klelune Decretum{/c}'s question this time.
MsgComplete:
Then, here is my question.

{c1}If the supreme deity were to appear in front of you, what would they look like?{/c}

Well, what do you say?

 
<They'd look like an attractive member of the opposite sex, of course~><I think their form would be that of an animal or beast.><They would appear as simply a voice, without a physical form.>
MsgResponse1:
You think so, Are you really sure?

Here is your reward, then. Remember to give your best each day for the Union of Fury, as always.
MsgTake:
I'm Klelune Decretum, of Iris's assembly of high-class nobles.

I've carefully read over the letter Lucifera sent.

There was some parts I felt suspicious about, but Lucifera is a person who's helped us in many matters, both great and small.

As Sir Lucifera requested, I'll pose to you a proper question so that your decision will reveal the reward you shall receive.

Once you choose one, you cannot go back on your decision, so I pray, answer with care.

When you're ready, {c1}talk to me again{/c}.

MsgSummary: You have to give {c3}5 Hard Hammers{/c} to {c2}Gullveig{/c}, a construction supervisor.
MsgComplete: oh~ Thanks. You are not late, but you are not fast, either. You've retreived them at an appropriate time. Thanks to you, I feel relieved. I hope you find it useful.
MsgTake:
Oho~ You came at just the right time, I tell ya! You're one'a them Alliance of Light folks, arent'cha? Is it okay if I ask you a favor? It's nothing too stressful, of course.

Right now, I'm the supervisor of construction for a guild management office. However, I heard that some'a my workers were attacked by monsters, and those monsters stole all the tools we need for the construction work. First things first, we've gotta take back the {c3}hard hammers{/c} from the monsters. If you retrieve 'em, I'll give you a newly-developed medicine; the stuff packs quite a punch, so they say.

Please retrieve 'em as quickly as possible. I'll be in mighty big trouble if the construction is delayed.
MsgIncomplete: Since I've got no hammers to use, there ain't much I can do except play...

MsgSummary: You have to give {c3}5 Logs{/c} to {c2}Gullveig{/c}, a construction supervisor.
MsgComplete:
Hahaha; you sure do know how to get 'er done! If you have the time, I sure wouldn't mind you droppin' by to help more often. 
There's always a reward in store for helpin' me out.
MsgTake:
You came here to find work, right? Then go on and help the rest of the workers!

What?! You didn't come here to work? Then...you wanna help with something else? I've got a job that seems perfect for you. Might seem a bit troublesome, but there's a reward in it for ya. Feeling up to it?

If you're in, then listen carefully. Right now, me and my crew are buildin' the frame of a new guild management office, but the construction is movin' slower due to a lack of wood. So what I'd like you to do is collect some {c3}Logs{/c} . It's not a hard job, so take care of it as quickly as you can.
MsgIncomplete: What are you doing here! Now go and collect construction materials. Can't you see those workers playing around owing to a lack of material?

MsgSummary: You have to give {c3}5 Rand Stones{/c} to {c2}Gullveig{/c}, a construction supervisor.
MsgComplete: Ah, great work, just like last time. If only I could get you as one of my workers! Gyahahaha!
MsgTake:
Well, look who's back! If you're up for a job, you're in luck - I just got one you'd be perfect for.

Now, just lemme lay it out for you. It's simple enough. You brought me wood last time, y'ken? Thanks to you, the basic frame of guild management office is very strong. However, this time, we don't have enough Rand Stones. No particular explanation necessary here - we need 'em to complete the building. A guild management office needs the majesty of good stonework, dont'cha think?

Of course, it ain't there yet; you can see it with yer own two eyes. That's why we need those stones. I'm puttin' my faith in you on this one; don't let me down~
MsgIncomplete: Grab as many as you can, and I'll give you proper compensation for it all.

MsgSummary: You have to give {c3}5 Hard Hammers{/c} to {c2}Seeker{/c}, a construction supervisor.
MsgComplete: Ah, right on - not too early, not too late. In fact, you brought 'em just at the right time. This is a big relief, believe me. I hope you find it useful.
MsgTake:
Oho~ You came at just the right time, I tell ya! You're one'a them Union of Fury folks, arent'cha? Is it okay if I ask you a favor? It's nothing too stressful, of course.

Right now, I'm the supervisor of construction for a guild management office. However, I heard that some'a my workers were attacked by monsters, and those monsters stole all the tools we need for the construction work. First things first, we've gotta take back the {c3}hard hammers{/c} from the monsters. If you retrieve 'em, I'll give you a newly-developed medicine; the stuff packs quite a punch, so they say.

Please retrieve 'em as quickly as possible. I'll be in mighty big trouble if the construction is delayed.
MsgIncomplete: This is a real problem. I can't believe there ain't a hammer to be found when construction's supposed to be in full swing!

MsgSummary: You have to give {c3}5 Logs{/c} to {c2}Seeker{/c}, a construction supervisor.
MsgComplete:
You've got a strong back for work, just like ya look. I hope you're always willing to lend a hand when you come through. Collecting materials isn't too dangerous a task.

You just keep bringing 'em in, and I'll keep giving you rewards. Sounds good, eh?
MsgTake:
Hey hey~ It's been quite a while! Do you remember me? We've met before, right?

Don't tell me you don't remember me. *sniff* I'll be so sad! Anyway what brought you here?
