I assume you came here to help me, knowing I'm working here, but I never expected you'd come back here so fast. Thanks to you, at least some of our problems can get taken care of. We were already shorthanded, so we were looking for a worker.

The amount of logs and boards we have really aren't sufficient for the scale of the project, so I'd like you to get some more lumber for us. There'll be a big reward, really! I'm begging you~. We're already friends, right? It just wouldn't do for you to turn down my offer! I'll be waiting here for the good news~
MsgIncomplete: You're still hangin' around here? You've gotta go and get me some wood; the construction is already delayed as-is!

MsgSummary: You have to give {c3}5 Rand Stones{/c} to {c2}Seeker{/c}, a construction supervisor.
MsgComplete: Thank the Goddess. Because of you, we'll be able to complete the guild management office by the scheduled completion date. How can I express my gratitude? I know...here's the reward I promised from before!
MsgTake:
So, what's brought you here? If you came looking for work on the construction of the guild management office, I've got a job involving that you might be interested in. You look strong, but I admit, I still have some doubts about your fighting skills.

Hmm...did I offend you? I'm sorry. But this isn't just some easy-street job. That's why I wanted to make sure you had it in you, y'know.

Now that that's settled, I'll count on you from here on out. I have to reinforce the framework of the guild management office with Rand Stone, but we just don't have enough in our stockpile right now. What's worse, there's no available stock we can buy up to get enough, so we have no choice but to get it directly.

This stone can be found where monsters of the D-Water Borderland are roaming around. Perhaps the area has been entirely infested by monsters, so please go to the D-Water Borderland and bring as many stones as possible. Don't worry about the reward; I'll make it worth your while.
MsgIncomplete: We're got only a few days left before the construction of the guild management office will be completed. Please be quick about collecting as many as possible!

MsgSummary: You have to give two {c3}Thin Meats{/c} to {c2}Warrior Kvasir{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Oh yeah! You not only brought me just the meat I wanted, but it tastes so good, too!

I'll give you one of my medicines, which I created with special care.

Here you go! A token of my gratitude. I have an appointment to keep, so go on and take it.

<Kvasir's Medicine><A few Etin>
MsgTake:
I left my hometown, where my friends and family live, and came all this way to repay my master for his kindness. 

However, I was parted from my master around here. I haven't found any traces of him so far, and I'm just waiting for him here.

Sadly, I haven't eaten anything for several days, so please give me something to eat.
If you do, I'll give you a mysterious medicine.

Well, what do you think? Can you bring me something to eat? Let's see...I like {c3}Thin Meats{/c}. That sounds pretty good about now.
MsgIncomplete: I think I've heard that you can get some pretty good {c3}Thin Meat{/c} from {c1}monkeys and leopards in Willieoseu{/c}.

MsgSummary: You have to give two {c3}Broken Cores{/c} to {c2}Assassin Embla{/c}.
MsgComplete:
This was really difficult to get by myself, but I can really appreciate that you've obtained this so quickly.

I'll give you a medicine I promised as a token of my gratitude.
<Kvasir's Medicine><A few Etin>
MsgTake:
Because of my master's request, I abandoned my men and obligations and came all this way.

My master ordered me to do one thing, then wait here until I accomplish it.

However, I haven't obtained the most vital material yet - that'd be {c3}Broken Cores{/c}.

If you don't have any urgent business demanding your attention right now, would you help me out?
If you do, I'll give you some of my handmade medicine. It's very potent!
MsgIncomplete: I think I've heard that {c1}RockShovel Goblins{/c} are stockpiling {c3}Broken Cores{/c}.

MsgSummary: You have to give two {c3}Essences of Witch{/c} to {c2}Pagan Vidarr{/c}.
MsgComplete:
I never knew there were kind souls like you in the Alliance of Light. I really appreciate what you've done for me.

Thanks to you, I've found my master's location and I'll be able to meet with him.

Here you go. This is the mysterious medicine, made with the technique handed down from my master. I hope you find it useful.<Vidarr's Medicine><A few Etin>
MsgTake:
Did you happen to see my master?

Great... what should I do now? Of all the times to run out of essence, it had to be now...

Can you help me by chance?

If you bring me a couple {c3}Essences of Witch{/c}, I'll gladly give you some of the best medicine I've ever made.
MsgIncomplete: Try going to the {c1}Leopardesses{/c} who live near Fedion Lake; they might have what we're looking for.

MsgSummary: You have to give two {c3}Dark Mage Stones{/c} to {c2}Mage Aesir{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Now that you've brought a mage stone, I'll give you something interesting to repay your kindness.

I hope you find it useful...






<Aesir's Medicine><A few Etin>
MsgTake:
Did my pupil happen to beg for something to eat? Really now?

Regardless of what I asked, my pupil is just looking for some free eats? Blasts...I'll have to re-open his education in basic ethics.

Because of my pupil, I owe you a debt of gratitude...that I didn't even incur...
MsgIncomplete: I've heard that warriors in the in Lipiluss district carry {c3}Dark Mage Stones{/c}.

MsgSummary: You have to give two {c3}Manitou Cores{/c} to {c2}Hunter Halphas{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Aaaaaah! My friend. I thought you'd never come back.

And you brought the cores, just as promised!

Here, let me give you a mysterious medicine as a present that symbolizes the deep admiration and trust of our friendship.






<Halpha's Medicine><A few Etin>
MsgTake:
Haha! Why all the curioius looks? Does the fact that I don't seem anxious in your presence strike you as odd?

I received a great favor from a priest of Deities, Religion of your Union. That's why I surrendered and came over here to return that favor. You needn't put your guard up around me; I'm a friendly face now. 

In fact, why don't we formalize our friendship? I'll make a potent medicine with a mysterious ability as a symbol of our meeting.

However, I recently ran out of {c3}Manitou Cores{/c}. Can you bring some to me?

If you happen to pass by here while going about your business, you can hand 'em off to me anytime.
MsgIncomplete: I've heard {c3}Manitou Cores{/c} may be held by the Larvae that live south of the Au Bird Force Base Camp.

MsgSummary: You have to give two {c3}Gold Scissors{/c} to {c2}Oracle Ymir{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Thanks to you, I'm able to pray and receive the blessing of Narsilriel as well. Thus, I'll give you the mysterious medicine I made, as promised.

I hope you'll use it in the pursuit of good. May Narsilriel guide your path!
<Ymir's Favor><A few Etin>
MsgTake:
I'm sorry to have brought you to your senses. I just surrendered to return the favor, so relax your guard.

I'm not a member of the Union of Fury anymore, but I'm serving Narsilriel. However, I think I dropped the {c3}Gold Scissors{/c} used in the benediction ceremony somewhere while I was traveling.

My old scissors may be gone, but could you find me some new {c3}Gold Scissors{/c}? I'll give you some precious medicine if I'm once again able to have my implements of worship.
MsgIncomplete: Try to defeat {c1}CopperPeg Goblins{/c} to the north of Huigronn Stronghold; they may have the scissors I'm looking for.

MsgSummary: You have to give two pieces of {c3}Thin Meat{/c} to a {c2}Fighter Vine{/c}.
MsgComplete:
You've really come through for me, even under the circumstance of you and I being from opposite sides. I'm thankful for your kindness - your attitude shows what it should really be like to have a knight's dignity!

Then I, Vine of the Stardust Knights, will give you the medicine just as I promised.
I hope you use this in the pursuit of a noble cause.






<Vine's Favor><A few Etin>
MsgTake:
You're a knight too, aren't you? According to my master's order, I have to collect strips of {c3}Thin Meat{/c} here. 

However, I'm not familiar with the geography of this place, so I'd like to call upon your sense of knightly courtesy to aid me in my task. Could you collect the {c3}Thin Meat{/c} in my place?

If you help me, I'll give you some potent medicine as a sign of gratitude.
MsgIncomplete: Try to hunt down some {c1}Keuraijen Large Black Leopards{/c} - their meat is pretty tasty.

MsgSummary: You have to give two {c3}Broken Cores{/c} to {c2}Assassin Embla{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Thank you very much. I might've wasted lots of time if I tried to collect them all myself.

Thanks to you, I was able to complete my master's order easily. I'll give you a medicine imbued with a mysterious ability, as my way of saying thanks. Judging by your look, your class seems similar to mine, so if my experiences are any indicator, that potion will do pretty well for you.






<Embla's Favor><A few Etin>
MsgTake:
Are you a coward? Why do you not attack me? Or... do I look like a weakling to you?

{c0}(I'm not so cruel as to provoke a person who singlehandedly came all this way into a fight.){/c}

Ah... you should've told me straight out what your reason was.

The fact is, I left home to perform a favor for my master. My master ordered me to find {c3}Broken Cores{/c}, but I've had no luck whatsoever. That's why I have no choice but to wander around here. 

Is there any chance you might be able to get your hands on some?
MsgIncomplete: Try to capture {c1}DemonStone Trolls{/c} southeast of the Aumeros Army's Fort.

MsgSummary: You have to give two {c3}Essences of Witch{/c} to {c2}Mage Aesir{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Wow, you collected those really fast! I suppose it's because you're well-acquainted with the area's geography.

I shall give you the most mysterious and greatest present I've ever made, as a token of my gratitude! Surely, we're glad that first meetings don't decide the course of the friendship!






<Aesir's Favor><A few Etin>
MsgTake:
If a fight's that you're looking for, you'll have to whittle me down to the very last. You'd best prepare yourself, if that's the case...

{c0}(You're talking like our force is absolutely cold-hearted. I'm just trying to help you, so take it easy.){/c}

Hmmm...it was my misunderstanding? I apologize. We're all a bit on-edge these days, as you yourself must know.

The fact is, I've followed my master as far as here, but my master disappeared all of a sudden without saying anything. That's why I'm trying to collect the {c3}Essence of Witch{/c} in order to locate him. The problem is that I'm unfamiliar with this area's geography, so I have no clue where to gather what I need.

If you know the lay of the land, please, help me. I'll give you a reward, no matter what happens.
MsgIncomplete: I've heard a large amount of {c1}Essences of Witch{/c} disappeared in Mores' Woods.

MsgSummary: You have to give two {c3}Dark Mage Stone{/c} to {c2}Defender Kyllin{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Oh, my dear semi-new friend! I thought you'd never come! But I'm glad to see you again.

And you brought the stones, just as you promised!

Yes, let me give you this Mysterious Medicine as a sign of our friendship!

(You feel tempted to read the label, but not right in front of them)<Kyllin's Favor><A few Etin>
MsgTake:
Hahaha! Why are you giving me such a curious gaze? Does the fact that I'm talkin' to you without being wary make you feel uneasy?

Well, my story is, I received a great favor from a priest of the Deities, Religion of your Union. That's why I surrendered and came over here to return that favor. You needn't be on your guard around me; I fight only for myself now.

Say...that means there's no reason we shouldn't be friends, is there? I'll make a medicine for you, enchanted with a mysterious power.

However, I've run out of the {c3}Dark Mage Stones{/c} I need. Can you some of them to me?

If you happen to pass by here while on other business, you can just drop them off anytime.
MsgIncomplete: You might have luck hunting {c1}Spinterr Elves{/c} in the northeast.

MsgSummary: You have to give two {c3}Manitou Cores{/c} to {c2}Acher Narvi{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Now that you've brought those {c3}Manitou Core{/c}, I'll give you something rare to repay your kindness. I hope you find it useful.





<Narvi's Favor><A few Etin>
MsgTake:
Did my pupil happen to randomly challenge you to a duel, right on the spot?

Sheesh, they didn't carry out my order, and instead just run around the countryside challenging strong people? Guh, looks like it's time for another harsh lesson from teacher.

Because of my pupil, I owe you a debt of gratitude for something I wasn't even involved in.
But, if you bring the {c3}Manitou Core{/c} I need, I'll give you a reward.
MsgIncomplete: I've heard that a large quantity of {c3}Manitou Cores{/c} was stolen by the Elves of {c1}Hecates Force Base Camp{/c}.

MsgSummary: You have to give two {c3}Gold Scissors{/c} to {c2}Priest Seere{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Thanks to your help, I'm able to pray and receive the blessing of the Goddess Etain as well. I'll give you the mysterious medicine I made, just as promised.

I hope you'll use it to do good. I pray the Goddess Etain guides your path....





<Seere's Favor><A few Etin>
MsgTake:
I'm sorry to have brought you to your senses. I just surrendered to return the favor. I'm not a member of the Alliance of Light anymore, but I still serve the Goddess Etain. 

However, I think I dropped my {c3}Gold Scissors{/c} that I use for the benediction ceremony. Do you think you could find some new ones for me?

I'll give you some excellent medicine if you can return to me my implements of worship.
MsgIncomplete: I think I've heard the {c1}NikelSaw Goblin Watchers{/c} in Merukes carry {c3}Gold Scissors{/c}.

MsgSummary: You have to give one {c3}Monster Poison Sting{/c} and one {c3}Desert Crystal{/c} of {c0}Deep Desert-1{/c} to an {c2}Vodro{/c}, an alchemist.
MsgComplete:
I'm very grateful that you've brought this so quickly. Thanks to you, I'll be able to deliver this medicine to people participating in the war very quickly. Please survive this war so I can repay the debt.






<Vodro's Alchemy><A few Etin>
MsgTake:
Hello. I'm {c2}Vodro{/c}, an alchemist. Is there something you'd like to learn from me?

Ah... You must be someone who heard rumors about my medicine from people participating in the war.

Then perhaps it's a stroke of good fortune for both of us. This is a difficult job, but I'm looking for someone who can help me.

The thing is, I've heard 6 Vail and Deatheaters from the Union of Fury surrendered to us a little while ago.

I was told they have medicine which increases people's abilities for short periods of time and made that recipe public to the people of the Alliance of Light. We alchemists who heard that rumor made that medicine right away and verified that the rumor was true.

Therefore, alchemists have researched the medicines and have developed a medicine even more potent. However, we need a final ingredient, and the place where it can be obtained is too dangerous for us alchemists to go, so we couldn't even complete this medicine yet because we can't get the material.

Please, could you help me to complete the medicine? If you help me, I'll give you a free order.
MsgIncomplete: You can find it once you get rid of monsters that appear in the the Deep Desert.

MsgSummary: You have to give one {c3}Deadly Poison of Clean Water{/c} and one {c3}Desert Essence{/c} from {c0}Deep Desert-2{/c} to {c2}Travous{/c}, an alchemist.
MsgComplete:
You've returned well before the scheduled time; that's good to see. Here's what the completed medicine looks like.

Please turn the tide of the war with this medicine and bring everything to a close quickly. I'll be cheering you on from the home-fron






<Travous's Alchemy><A few Etin>
MsgTake:
I'm Travous, a member of the alchemist's association. What do you want from me?

Did you come here to get the newly-developed medicine this time? We're close to being able to complete it, but it's constantly delayed because of a lack of material.

Since you're already here, could you help us with this job? If you can, I think we'll be able to wrap up this job much earlier than expected. We alchemists aren't physically cut out to romp around the countryside collecting material, it turns out.

Could you collect the {c3}Deadly Poison of Clean Water{/c} and {c3}Desert Essence{/c} we need? If you help with this job, we can move forward the completion date of our medicine!
MsgIncomplete: I've heard that the monsters that appear in the second area of the Deep Desert carry it.

MsgSummary: You have to give one {c3}Sparkling Powder{/c} and one {c3}Stable Core{/c} from {c0}Stable Erde{/c} to an {c2}Sabina{/c}, an alchemist.
MsgComplete:
You have brought so many. I really appreciate it.

Thanks to you, now I'll be able to make a large amount of medicines. I pray for your success in war.


<Sabina's Alchemy><A few Etin>
MsgTake:
What is it you're curious about? A new medicine, you say?

If you're talking about that medicine, it's nearing completion even as we speak. However...it's really difficult to get the material. I've asked other people too, but the amount of material is too limited now, so we alchemists can't make enough to meet the supply that the ongoing war demands. You've shown up at a good time. Please help me with this job. I'll give you a sizeable reward, don't worry!

The material is {c3}Sparkling Powder{/c} and a {c3}Stable Core{/c}. I figure you can find them if you go to {c0}Stable Erde{/c}.
MsgIncomplete: I've heard monsters appearing in Stable Erde carry them.

MsgSummary: You have to give one {c3}Monster Poison Sting{/c} and one {c3}Desert Crystal{/c} from {c0}Deep Desert-1{/c} to an {c2}Aileen{/c}, an alchemist.
MsgComplete:
I'm really grateful you were able to bring it in such a timely manner. Thanks to you, I'll be able to quickly deliver this medicine to people participating in the war.

I pray that you survive the war, and hopefully the medicine can help you do just that.






<Aileen's Alchemy><A few Etin>
MsgTake:
Hello! I'm {c2}Aileen{/c}, an alchemist. Is there something you wanna know?

Ah... You must be someone who heard rumors about my medicine from people participating in the war.

Then perhaps it's a stroke of good fortune for both of us. This is a difficult job, but I'm looking for someone who can help me.

The thing is, I've heard 6 Vail and Deatheaters from the Union of Fury surrendered to us a little while ago.

I was told they have medicine which increases people's abilities for short periods of time and made that recipe public to the people of the Alliance of Light. We alchemists who heard that rumor made that medicine right away and verified that the rumor was true.

Therefore, alchemists have researched the medicine and have developed a medicine with even more potency. However, we need a final ingredient, and the place where it can be obtained is too dangerous for us alchemists to go, so we couldn't even complete this medicine yet because we can't get the material.

Please, could you help me to complete the medicine? If you help me, I'll give you a free order.
MsgIncomplete: You can find it once you get rid of a monster that appears in the Deep Desert.

MsgSummary: You have to give one {c3}Deadly Poison of Clean Water{/c} and one {c3}Desert Essence{/c} from {c0}Deep Desert-2{/c} to {c2}Beatrice{/c}, an alchemist.
MsgComplete:
Wow, you brought so many! This'll definitely do the trick!

Thanks to you, I'll be able to make a lot of medicine now. I pray for your success in the war, too.







<Beatrice's Alchemy><A few Etin>
MsgTake:
I'm a member of the alchemist association, Beatrice. What do you want from me?

Did you come here to get the newly-developed medicine this time? We're close to being able to complete it, but it's constantly delayed because of a lack of material.

Now that you're already here, could you help us with this job? If you can, I think we'll be able to wrap up this job much earlier than expected. We alchemists aren't physically cut out to romp around the countryside collecting material, it turns out.

Could you collect the {c3}Deadly Poison of Clean Water{/c} and {c3}Desert Essence{/c} we need? If you help with this job, we can move forward the completion date of our medicine!
MsgIncomplete: I've heard monsters appearing in Deep Desert-2 carry it.

MsgSummary: You have to give one {c3}Sparkling Powder{/c} and one {c3}Stable Core{/c} of {c0}Stable Erde{/c} to {c2}Physica{/c}, an alchemist.
MsgComplete:
Wow, you brought so many! This'll definitely do the trick!

Thanks to you, I'll be able to make a lot of medicine now. I pray for your success in the war, too.



<Physica's Alchemy><A few Etin>
MsgTake:
What is it you're curious about? A new medicine, you say?

If you're talking about that medicine, it's nearing completion even as we speak. 

However... it's really difficult to get the material. I've asked other people too, but the amount of material is too limited now, so we alchemists can't make enough to meet the supply that the ongoing war demands. You've shown up at a good moment. Please help me with this job. I'll give you a sizeable reward, don't worry!

The materials we need are {c3}Sparkling Powder{/c} and a {c3}Stable Core{/c}. I figure you can find them if you go to {c0}Stable Erde{/c}.
MsgIncomplete: I've heard the monsters who appear in Stable Erde carry them.

MsgSummary: If you find {c2}Batan Animus{/c}, whom Karena Chavi told you to find, it seems you might obtain some good information. You can find {c2}Batan Animus{/c} if you go to {c1}Keolloseu{/c}.
MsgComplete: You came here off a tip from Chavi? If that's the case, you must be a beginning traveler, or maybe you came here due to the war. I'll let you let you in on some info about travel, or about the war, if that's your thing.
MsgTake:
It's my pleasure to meet someone nice, like yourself. I don't know if there's anything in particular I can do for you, though...

Hmmm...what should I do?. Ah, all right - there IS one thing I can do. My job is being a gate keeper, so as a  special service, I'll let you use a gate for free. There's one condition, though. You've gotta stop by now and then and pay me a visit! Now then, I'll explain how to use this specifically.

You can transfer between districts by two ways: either by using a gate keeper, or a portal. In order to use a gate, you have to talk to the gate keeper and affirm the decision to be transported. After that, if you decide on a destination and transfer there, the cost will be deducted automatically. If you check the level limit of portals and you meet the level limit, you can use the portal. Once you enter a portal, you can transfer between districts for free.

Oh, and here's my special tip! If you find {c2}Batan Animus{/c} in Keolloseu, I'll bet you can obtain even more good info.
MsgIncomplete: I'll send you to Keolloseu.

MsgSummary: If you find {c2}Batan Animus{/c}, whom Jenia Wendy told you to find, it seems you might obtain some good information. You can find {c2}Batan Animus{/c} if you go to {c1}Keolloseu{/c}.
MsgComplete: Are you here off a tip from Wendy? If that's the case, you must be a beginning traveler, or maybe you came here due to the war. I'll let you let you in on some info about travel, or about the war, if that's your thing.
MsgTake:
Welcome to our Elven village, a place where harmony is ever a virtue. Our clan has helped others since time immemorial, so we allow those who stop by our village to make use of our gate keeper's services for free. Don't feel burdened - just use it at your convenience.

In case you don't know, let me tell you how it works. Basically, you can transfer between districts by two ways: either by using a gate keeper, or a portal. In order to use a gate, you have to talk to the gate keeper and affirm the decision to be transported. After that, if you decide on a destination and transfer there, the cost will be deducted automatically. If you check the level limit of portals and you meet the level limit, you can use the portal. Once you enter a portal, you can transfer between districts for free.

I hope you'll find this information useful on your journey. Here's another tip for you - if you find {c2}Batan Animus{/c} in {c1}Keolloseu{/c}, I'm sure they'll have more useful info that can help you on your way.
MsgIncomplete: Are you going to Keolloseu? Then I'll send you there safely~

MsgSummary: You have to give a {c3}Moneybag{/c} to {c2}Norman Diero{/c} {c0}in the east of Keolloseu village{/c}.
MsgComplete: It appears {c2}Batan Animus{/c} is finally ready to begin that job he asked about a while back. That {c3}Moneybag{/c} you're holding; just give that to me.
MsgTake:
What I have to tell you isn't information like a map to hidden treasure or the location of an ancient ruin, but it might be useful information when you travel or go to other villages.

However, I'm not just gonna tell you straight-out; you know, no such thing as a free lunch and all. Don't give me a dirty look, though - you'll discover the information naturally while doing what I ask.

Here's the lay of things: I asked some of the villagers to do a couple things to prepare to make a piece of armor for me. However, there was something I needed to take care of, so I've put it off. All you need to do is run this series of errands in my place.

It should prove too difficult. If you give this {c3}Moneybag{/c} to {c2}Norman Diero{/c} in the east of the village, he'll give you some material that armor can be crafted from. After that, let blacksmith {c2}Duke Dephill{/c} make an iron plate with that material. If you give the resulting iron plate to a {c2}Mano{/c}, a first-class artisan of defensive gear, he'll give you the completed armor. Then, if you bring that to me, this whole job will finally be complete.
MsgIncomplete: If it's difficult for you to track down {c2}Norman Diero{/c}, just find the warehouse keeper of Keolloseu village.

MsgSummary: You have to deliver the {c3}Iron Ore{/c} {c2}Norman Diero{/c} left to you to {c2}Duke Dephill{/c}, the blacksmith.
MsgComplete:
Who are you? How did you get in here? Wait...you want me to take care of that task {c2}Batan Animus{/c} requested a while back?

Phew... I guess I got surprised for nothing. I was surprised because you entered so suddenly like that! Anyway, you're lucky that Batan Animus let you take on this job.
MsgTake:
{c2}Batan Animus{/c} must have sent you here to pick up the material for the armor. Aaaaanyway, here ya go. You should go to {c2}Duke Dephill{/c} the blacksmith with this {c3}Iron Ore{/c}.

By the way, you must be a newcomer. Are you a traveler? If you are, listen up and I'll teach you how to use the warehouse. Batan must've sent you here to learn about this, too.

If your inventory is full or you want to store something important, you can store it in the warehouse. However, remember that if you retrieve an item, you have to pay 5% commission as a storage fee. 
Also, the number of warehouses you can use is limited, but if you use the Item Mall expansion, you can use up to 6 warehouses in total, so keep that in mind. Next, know that you can give or receive items you own between characters because this warehouse is shared between all the characters on one account. However, you can't store money there, The warehouse is for the storage and retrieval of items only.

Oh, haha, sorry for rambling on there like that. Go to {c2}Duke Dephill{/c}, the village blacksmith. I'm sure he's already waiting for you.
MsgIncomplete: If you ever want to ask about using warehouses, feel free to drop by again!

MsgSummary: You have to deliver the iron plate that blacksmith {c2}Duke Dephill{/c} made to {c2}Mano{/c}, a first-class artisan of defensive gear.
MsgComplete: Well now, you look like a new face! Hmm...what's this? {c2}Duke Dephill{/c} and {c2}Batan Animus{/c} sent you here?
MsgTake:
Last time, he requested an iron plate for some armor, right? Well, here it is. It's not complete yet, though. I made a strong iron plate, so it should be smooth and unpiercable, but it's gotta be finished first. Ask a {c2}Mano{/c} the armor artisan to give this piece the finishing touch. He's without a doubt the best in this village when it comes to skill in making defensive gear. Say...this is your first journey, right? Now that {c2}Batan Animus{/c} let you run an errand, I'll teach ya how to use the forge, so listen up.

Every time you fight with your weapons and armor, their durability decreases bit by bit. Once the durability of weapon reaches zero, you can't attack easily, and once the durability of armor reaches zero, you'll start taking more damage. That's why you've gotta keep them in good repair to use them properly.

If you want to fix your gear, all you have to do is find a blacksmith like me in any village. After you speak to them, if you click "repair weapon," a "forge" window will appear. They'll explain anything you might not understand, I suppose. According to their explanation, just click the equipment you want to fix. If you feel it's bothersome to fix them one by one and want to fix all your equipment together at once, just click "Repair All." The cost is indicated before the the repairs, so you'll always know what you're gettin' into before you spend a single cent - always helpful, right?

Then, can you see "Lapis Fusion"? You might wonder what a Lapis is. According to the legends, Lapises are mysterious stones also known as the "Goddess's Tears." Each Lapis has a different ability, so they're used to reinforce all sorts of equipment. But it doesn't mean you can combine every piece of equipment with a lapis. Lapis fusion is possible from Noble-class equipment onward, so you're better off not wasting your time with attaching lapises to low-level equipment.

Well, anyway, fusing lapises is a blacksmith's job. Similar to weapon repairs, if you speak to a blacksmith and choose "repair weapon," you will see a "forge" window, right? This time, you'd select the "lapis fusion" option. Then you'll see a window where you can fuse a lapis with a piece of equipment, or extract a fused lapis from a piece of equipment.

"Fusion object" is where you put the equipment you can fuse a lapis with, and "Fusion item" is where you put a lapis you'll fuse to equipment. However, you can only put equipment here if it's not currently equipped on you. And remember that a fusion attempt doesn't always result in success. Each fusion has a certain probability of occurring, so the process can end in either success or failure. If you fail the fusion attempt, the lapis will be broken. It's a calculated risk, but the lapis will make you much stronger, so I think you'll find it useful! 

Now, you should stop by {c2}Mano{/c]'s place before you go back to Batan - Mano's really capable armor artisan. I'll bet {c2}Batan Animus{/c} has something else to ask you again, too. I guess you and I will see each other a lot from now on, so stop by anytime!
MsgIncomplete: I look forward to seeing you a lot from now on~

MsgSummary: You have to give the armor {c2}Mano{/c} finished work on to {c2}Batan Animus{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Ah, you're back, and you have the finished armor too! I appreciate you carrying out all these tasks for me. What do you think about all the information you heard in Keolloseu village?

You must have learned things that'll be useful on your travels, I'd wager. If you happen to have something you feel curious about, feel free to visit me again. Oh, and and here's a reward for what you've done for me. You might need this while treveling around, so go ahead and take it.

<For Fighter, Defender><For Ranger, Archer><For Mage, Priest>
MsgResponse1:
Ah, you're back, and you have the finished armor too! I appreciate you carrying out all these tasks for me. What do you think about all the information you heard in Keolloseu village?

You must have learned things that'll be useful on your travels, I'd wager. If you happen to have something you feel curious about, feel free to visit me again. Oh, and and here's a reward for what you've done for me. You might need this while treveling around, so go ahead and take it.
MsgResponse2:
Ah, you're back, and you have the finished armor too! I appreciate you carrying out all these tasks for me. What do you think about all the information you heard in Keolloseu village?

You must have learned things that'll be useful on your travels, I'd wager. If you happen to have something you feel curious about, feel free to visit me again. Oh, and and here's a reward for what you've done for me. You might need this while treveling around, so go ahead and take it..
MsgTake:
Finally, the iron plate's finished. {c2}Duke Dephill{/c} the blacksmith must have sent you on some pointless errand, eh? He's practically right next to me, so can't he just bring it himself? That'd make things a whole lot easier. That way, I can see him every now and then, too. I can't understand why he always gives other people the runaround, hahaha!

Well now, look at me yammering on when you're waiting patiently for me. Just wait a while - the armor Batan Animus ordered will be finished soon, so you'd better take it and return to Batan. 

{c5}(Lots of time seems to have passed.){/c}

Haha, I'm really sorry - I ended up making it more elaborate than I anticipated, so I didn't realize how much time I'd spent on it. Now it's time for you to go back to {c2}Batan Animus{/c} once. Deliver this armor I've poured my soul into to {c2}Batan Animus{/c}!
MsgIncomplete: Please give my best regard to {c2}Batan Animus{/c}.

MsgSummary: You have to give the {c3}Armor of Batan{/c} to {c2}Marcfalane{/c} by using a portal {c0}near the southwest of Keolloseu{/c} to go to {c0}Apulune{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Wait, wait...what is this armor?!

Is this the armor {c2}Batan Animus{/c} sent? Wow...I don't think I deserve to receive something like this...but heck, I'll take it all the same!
MsgTake:
Hey, good to see you again!

Now, the only thing you have to do is deliver this armor you brought to someone in the capital.
In addition, it'd probably be useful for you to know more about the capital.

However, it would be more helpful if you heard an explanation from someone who's actually there rather then from me - you're bound to get better, more detailed information.

My friend, Fight Merit Officer {c2}Macfarlane{/c}, lives in {c0}Apulune{/c}, the capital.

He knows the capital much better than I do, so he'll probably be more informative when it comes to answering your questions. Why not go there for information, and do a little sightseeing while you're at it?
MsgIncomplete: You can go as far as Apulune and return very quickly by using the portal near the southwest of Keolloseu.

MsgSummary: You have to give a {c3}Letter to Macfarlane{/c} to {c2}Batan Animus{/c} by using a portal moving to {c0}Keolloseu{/c} {c0}near the right side of Apulune Square{/c}.
MsgTake:
If Batan sent you my way, you must be a beginning traveler or someone looking to join the army. Well, you've made it this far - this is the capital of the Alliance of Light. I've got some useful info for you, so perk up your ears and listen.

The capital, Apulune, is not only the capital of Humans, but also serves as the center of the Alliance of Light. There are many organizations in the capital such as a Palace containing the Humans' royalty, the Elven Embassy, the Mage Guild, the Stardust Knights, the Merchant Guild, the Apulune Port, and many places where you can buy and sell items you might be in need of, always open in Apulune Square. When I last looked around, there were many items sold very cheaply as well. It might be a good idea to browse if there's something you're looking for.

Ah, I nearly forgot. There are items you can only buy in the capital, including capes that will give you a dignified look, and various things you can use for transportation.

Also, the diplomatic activity is lively because Elves and Humans intermingle here, so the gate keepers are always ready so that people can move around anywhere within the Alliance of Light's territory.

Oh dear...I guess I've talked a bit much, haven't I? Well, here's a letter of gratitude I'm sending to Batan. Please give this to {c2}Batan Animus{/c} when you next see him, won't you?
MsgIncomplete: You might see gate keepers near the right side of Apulune Square. There is one portal in the center, as well.

MsgSummary:
You have to find {c2}Lia Kreis{/c} and ask for her help.
She is in Gliter.
MsgComplete: Material preparation? Delivery? Oooooh...what should I do first? ...Oh my, did you come here to find me?
MsgTake:
Hi there, you seem like a new face! Are you new warrior who's come to join the fight? I'm hoping your participation will be a great help to us. I work as a gate keeper, sending many warriors to other districts in order to save them the trouble of all that travel time. In my case, I'm a free gate keeper for newcomers like yourself, so you don't have to worry about payment. First, though, let me tell you how to use a gate keeper's services!

You can transfer between districts by two ways: either by using a gate keeper, or a portal. In order to use a gate, you have to talk to the gate keeper and affirm the decision to be transported. After that, if you decide on a destination and transfer there, the cost will be deducted automatically. If you check the level limit of portals and you meet the level limit, you can use the portal. Once you enter a portal, you can transfer between districts for free.

Hmm...I dunno how good my explanation was, but I think I covered most of the basics. Also, if you want to learn some other useful information, I recommend going to {c2}Lia Kreis{/c} in {/c4}Gliter{/c}. She seems to be worried about something these days. If you help her, you might get some good information.
MsgIncomplete: {c2}Lia Kreis{/c} will help you out.

MsgSummary:
You have to find {c2}Lia Kreis{/c} and ask for her help.
She is in Gliter.
MsgComplete: Material preparation? Delivery? Oooooh...what should I do first? ...Oh my, did you come here to find me?
MsgTake:
Oh-ho, you're a fresh face around here, arent'cha? At any rate, I haven't seen you before, so let me introduce myself. I'm Roise Stella, a gate keeper of Aridon. Pleased to meet'cha! When newcomers show up and take active part in battles, it's always a great source of strength for us, especially at a time like this, so I'll be rooting for ya. I'm currently giving all newcomers a chance to use a gate for free. Ah, you don't know how to use a gate? Let me explain, just in case.

There are two ways to transfer between districts: gate keepers, and portals. In order to use a gate, you have to select the gate keeper and choose to transfer between areas. Then, the name of the districts you can transfer to and the price to go there will be displayed. After that, if you decide on a destination and transfer there, the cost will be deducted automatically and you will be transfered to that district. 
You don't have pay the price if you use a portal, but there are places that have a level limit to port to, so you you've gotta check the level limit carefully before deciding to use a portal.

I hope my explanation will be helpful to you. Ah, if you want to obtain some more information, you'd do well to go to {c2}Lia Kreis{/c} in {/c4}Gliter{/c}. Something is eating at {c2}Lia Kreis{/c} lately, I can almost feel it.  But anyway, I'll bet you'll obtain useful information from her.  Good luck, and do your best out there!
MsgIncomplete: {c2}Lia Kreis{/c} will help you out.

MsgSummary: Please find {c2}Barren Deiatt{/c} and give him the {c3}Letter from Barren{/c}.
MsgComplete: I saw you were talking with {c2}Lia Kreis{/c} a little while ago... Surely you didn't hit on her, right? Wait... You came to see me because of {c2}Lia Kreis{/c}'s favor?
MsgTake:
Ah, were you directed to see me to get some information? I see... It's true I generally give infomation to new people who come here, but... These days, I've been in low spirits, as you can see. Oops...did I say too much? I'm sorry. 
While I pull myself together, can you hand this letter to a blacksmith named Barren Deiatt?
It's a letter I received a week ago, but...I've kept forgetting to hand it to him. He seems to be really anticipating it, so...please tell him I'm sorry, too.
MsgIncomplete: I hope my letter isn't too late.

MsgSummary: You have to find {c2}Lia Kreis{/c} and show the {c3}Grocery List{/c} to her.
MsgComplete: Ah, you're back. So...{c2}Barren Deiatt{/c} said that, did he? I see. Anyway...I really appreciate your help.
MsgTake:
{c5}(you hand over the letter){/c}Oh-ho! Could it really be that letter? Has it finally arrived? A friend of mine is on the front lines of the battlefield, so these letters are the only way I have to determine if he's still alive. Now, I'll finally be able to hear what he's been up to. Thanks, kiddo. You're a newcomer, right? Anyway, I'd better give you some useful information to repay your kindness. It could be worthwhile to tell you about my profession.
However, I ain't fond of repeatin' myself, so make sure you listen up.

I'm a blacksmith. It's a profession that specializes in making equipment. It's not just people who get exhausted from repeated battle. Every time you fight with your weapons and armor, their durability decreases bit by bit. Once the durability of weapon reaches zero, you can't attack easily, and once the durability of armor reaches zero, you'll start taking more damage. That's why you've gotta keep them in good repair to use them properly.

If you want to fix your gear, all you have to do is find a blacksmith like me in any village. After you speak to them, if you click "repair weapon," a "forge" window will appear. They'll explain anything you might not understand, I suppose. According to their explanation, just click the equipment you want to fix. If you feel it's bothersome to fix them one by one and want to fix all your equipment together at once, just click "Repair All." The cost is indicated before the the repairs, so you'll always know what you're gettin' into before you spend a single cent - always helpful, right?

Then, can you see "Lapis Fusion"? You might wonder what a Lapis is. According to the legends, Lapises are mysterious stones also known as the "Goddess's Tears." Each Lapis has a different ability, so they're used to reinforce all sorts of equipment. But it doesn't mean you can combine every piece of equipment with a lapis. Lapis fusion is possible from Noble-class equipment onward, so you're better off not wasting your time with attaching lapises to low-level equipment.

Well, anyway, fusing lapises is a blacksmith's job. Similar to weapon repairs, if you speak to a blacksmith and choose "repair weapon," you will see a "forge" window, right? This time, you'd select the "lapis fusion" option. Then you'll see a window where you can fuse a lapis with a piece of equipment, or extract a fused lapis from a piece of equipment.

"Fusion object" is where you put the equipment you can fuse a lapis with, and "Fusion item" is where you put a lapis you'll fuse to equipment. However, you can only put equipment here if it's not currently equipped on you. And remember that a fusion attempt doesn't always result in success. Each fusion has a certain probability of occurring, so the process can end in either success or failure. If you fail the fusion attempt, the lapis will be broken. It's a calculated risk, but the lapis will make you much stronger, so it's a gamble that's worth a try, heh heh!

Well, that's pretty useful to know, isn't it? newcomer? Anyway..Please tell Lia Kreis she doesn't have to feel bad about the letter. I'm just satisfied to know my friend is still alive. Oh, by the way, this is a receipt. I got the food and materials she requested, so tell her to check out the receipt to make sure it's accurate. I'm counting on you, newcomer!
MsgIncomplete: I feel relieved, now that I can finally hear his news from the battlefield.

MsgSummary: You have to find {c2}Marie Jernes{/c} and show her a {c3}Cook Catalogue{/c}.
MsgComplete: Hey heh hey...if you've got nothin' for me, just move along quickly. What? {c2}Lia Kreis{/c} sent you here? Ah...you must be that errand-runner I heard about.
MsgTake:
Is this that receipt? Hmm...there seems to be a little less than I'd hope for here, but if I consider the current season,
I've received more goods than what I initially expected.

Did you obtain any useful information from {c2}Barren Deiatt{/c}? I wish I could lend you a hand, but... I really have too many things to do, so it's not easy to help you directly. I'll introduce people who can give you information, though. Could you help me out a little bit more? Please show this Cook Catalogue to {c2}Marie Jernes{/c}.
MsgIncomplete: Her language can be a bit harsh sometimes, but she doesn't do it out of malice, so please be understanding with her.

MsgSummary: You have to find a {c2}Kaff{/c}, a middle-class cook, and give the {c3}High Grade Food Materials{/c} to him.
MsgComplete: What, Who is this? I'm busy. {c5}(looking at food materials){/c}Ah~ {c2}Lia Kreis{/c} sent you here! Come on in.
MsgTake:
Lia told you to give this to me? Aha...a Cooking Catalogue? How fast the time flies!
Anyway, best to give it to me now; I'm preparing all sorts of things at a breakneck pace these days!

Heh...now that I get a good look at you, I realize I haven't seen you before. Now I get it; that's why you were standing around with such a blank look. So Lia Kreis said that if you gives this to me, I'll give you information in return? E...heheh...Lia Kreis is too kind. Anyway, this is what Lia Kreis requested, but well...I'm so busy these days that askin' me to repeat myself is just a no-go, so listen up!

I'm a warehouse keeper - super important job, y'know. If your inventory is full or 
you want to store important things, you can store them in a warehouse. However, if you want to retreive an item, you have to pay a 5% commission. Don't think of it as expensive; warehouse keepers need to make a living too.

At first, the amount of warehouse space you can use will be limited, but if you purchase additional space from the item mall, you can greatly expand your warehouse space - keep that in mind. Also, since warehouse space is shared between all your characters on one account, all your characters can access the things you've stored within it!
However, you can't store money here - this is no bank, after all. Warehouses are meant for storing items, weapons, and armor only.

I'm glad to see you've paid close attention - I pray your mind be as quick in all things! Anyway, Lia is certainly devoted. I can't believe she's cooking every month for someone she's not even sure will come back. Well...I just realized you probably have no idea what I'm talking about since you're new around here, right? I'd like to tell you, but...as you can see, I'm terribly busy. Please give this food materials box to Kaff, the cook. He's very talkative, but he's a pretty damn good cook all the same. You can trust him. Well then, I'm counting on you!
MsgIncomplete: What are you still doing here? Lazy folk never rise to the top!

MsgSummary: You have to find a {c2}Nazek{/c} the first-class magician and give him a {c3}Packaged Dish{/c}.
MsgComplete: I suppose you've come here to learn the ways of magic, right? It's okay to practice your spells and learn the ways of magic here, but just see to it that you don't disturb my studies.
MsgTake:
Oh me oh my... You brought me some High Grade Food Materials again? Every time I get another shipment of these, I feel like they're puttin' demands on my skills as a cook... But anyway, enough of that! I've gotta show my great skill again! Anyway, so why are you still here? Haha...you must be that errand runner {c2}Lia Kreis{/c} sent. How did you feel when you saw {c2}Lia Kreis{/c} for the first time? She's so beautiful, isn't she? I'd buy a poster if she was on it~

Actually, there was a friend {c2}Lia Kreis{/c} had been hanging out with since she was young. But eventually, their friendship ratcheted up a notch and things started to get a bit steamy. The guy is a bit of a pipe-dreamer, though; he has all these ideas of being the greatest mage in the Union of Fury. His name is {c2}Nazek{/c}, the first-class magician . {c2}Lia{/c} makes tasty food with the best-grade ingredients once a month, and sends it to him. But his world is full of studying and he ends up skipping a lot of meals. That's why {c2}Lia Kreis{/c} is all alone, making her food with such dedication...

I do hope they'll eventually get married, and I know I'm not the only one who hopes so. But seriously? {c2}Nazek{/c} is a first-class idiot! I think he still thinks {c2}Lia Kreis{/c} is just a good friend. Blows my mind, it does!

I assume it will take some time to complete the food. Those high-grade ingredients do take a lot of care to prepare, after all. Oh...by the by, do you know how to open a private shop? Of course, you have no idea, do you? Excellent!
I shall impart this useful knowledge to you! If you look at the bottom of right side of the screen, you'll see the icon where you can open the inventory, status window, or etc. If you press an auxillary skill icon there, you can use a gesture or other commands you can utilize via hotkey or a single click. If you press the 'Private Shop' Icon near the bottom there, a window where you can put an item appears. If you put an item here, the item is registered to your private shop. After that, you input a price and a title of sign, you can open a private shop. It's so easy, isn't it? Oh...most importantly, you can only open private shops in the capital, so you'll want to keep that in mind when you're thinking of selling any of your wares.

Oops...did I talk your ear off again? Sorry, sorry; I get like that when I'm all caught up in cooking, you know!

Well, that's about all you need to know for now. But say, errand runner...I already packed this - you know what it is, right? Can you hand {c2}Lia Kreis{/c}'s passionate dishes to that dumbass who just studies all the time instead of paying attention to her? I think you can do it, and if you come through, I'll treat you to something truly excellent!
MsgIncomplete: Nazek...I really envy him~ I'd better ask Marie Jernes to look after me like that, haha!

MsgSummary: You have to give {c3}The Seal of Promise{/c} to {c2}Lia Kreise{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Thank you very much. You've work so hard like this..I should have given him a help by myself...Just because I'm busy, I handed over my job to other people. I'm sorry. Really? He sent this to me? This...

 {c5}(You deliver what he said along with the seal of promise){/c}

Really....? I haven't realized I was a really happy person. Thank you very much. You've worked so hard, and even you brought a very nice news like this.. I really appreciate.

I want to give you a much better reward, but I have only concentrated on a food preparation..so I couldn't care about it. I'm sorry... But this is a small sincerity I prepared with money left. I hope this goods will be helpful to you.

Ah, Could you talk to me again after you receive a reward?<For Warrior, Guardian><For Assassin, Hunter><For Pagan, Oracle>
MsgResponse1: Are you satisfied with a reward? I'm sorry. I should have given you much better one...
MsgResponse2: Are you satisfied with a reward? I'm sorry. I should have given you much better one...
MsgTake:
What's this now? You didn't come here to learn magic, but you brought some food? Ah...{c2}Lia Kreis{/c} definitely sent this. You've heard about me from the folks in the village, have you? I'm glad that they're concerned about my welfare, but this is more like...some sort of soap opera.

Anyway, as you know, {c2}Lia Kreis{/c} always prepares some food to send to me once a month. The folks in the village somehow got it in their heads that I don't think of {c2}Lia Kreis{/c} as anything more than a friend, but...to tell the truth, I've had the hots for Lia for YEARS. The reason for my actions being what they are is because I'm not sure when my studies in magic will be complete, and I don't want {c2}Lia{/c} to worry about me. I suppose that's how I must seem to everyone else. What others think doesn't bother me all that much, but...I feel bad about {c2}Lia{/c}, thinking about how I've acted with her.

Anyway, I'm supposed to give you some good information because you've come all the way to make a delivery for that chatterbox. Maybe that's how you came to meet {c2}Lia Kreis{/c} in the first place.

What I'm going to tell you is a story about the capital. I often venture to the capital frequently to study higher-level magic. Our capital, {c4}Iris{/c}, pretty much functions as the nerve center of the Union of Fury. Narsilian Hall is where the Senators conduct their daily work, including legislation and administration of justice, and all cases pertaining to the Vail are heard here. Also, the capital has the most active community, as well as special items and facilities you probably haven't seen in other villages or cities.

For example, there's a cape merchant, and a merchant selling a vehicle you can't find in other cities. Also, there's a smuggler around, so you can trade items and other things with those from the Alliance of Light. For reference, you'd better remember you can't fight with other forces there. And of course, you can't forget the underground stadium where you can fight enemies from the Alliance of Light in fair, judged matches. If you want to go to the smugglers' place and the underground stadium, just talk to the gate keeper. He'll let you go there once you can pony up the cost.

{c5}(He seems deeply distressed about something){/c} Okay! I've made up my mind! When my studies are over, I'm definitely gonna propose to {c2}Lia Kreis{/c}!
Hey, I know you've been having a hard time, always running errands, but...do you think you could do a little somethin' for me? This is a toy that {c2}Lia{/c} scrimped and saved to buy for me when she and I were young. I doubt she's ever thought that I'd still be treasuring it today, haha. Can you give this to her? Give it to her and tell her that when I return someday...I'll make her the happiest woman in the land!
I'm looking forward to hearing about her reaction~
MsgIncomplete: I'll be the best magician in the Union of Fury, and make her happy without fail!

MsgSummary: In {c0}Hard{/c} Mode, the status points and skill points you acquire per level are {c4}7{/c} and {c4}4{/c}, respectively, and you can use items as high as the {c4}Legend-class{/c}.
MsgComplete: I pray you'll become a great hero of the Alliance of Light. I'm expecting great things from you!
MsgTake:
Hello. I'm a guide for those who want to experience even greater power in combat. I'm explaining this for your convenience. However, I'm only gonna cover it once, to make sure you listen well.

You can select Hard Mode if you reach level 40 in normal mode. The required experience point needed per level is more than in normal mode. However, since you have 7 status points and 4 skill points to distribute, you can make a more enhanced character than what you can attain in Normal Mode.

It's also possible to use much stronger equipment than you could use in Normal Mode. You can figure this out from an item's title. Although you were able to use as far as Dread-class items in a Normal Mode, it is now possible for you use Legend-class items in Hard Mode.

That concludes my brief guide to Hard Mode. Now the only thing left is to reclaim your title as a great hero! Go forth, and become the stuff of legends!

QuestName: Ultimate Mode: Are You TOUGH ENOUGH?
MsgSummary: In {c0}Ultimate{/c} Mode, the status points and skill points per level are {c4}9{/c} and {c4}5{/c}, respectively, and you can use items as high as the {c4}Goddess-class{/c}.
MsgComplete: I pray you rise to the top of the Alliance of Light's heroes! I'm expecting great things from you.
MsgTake:
Hello. I'm a guide for those who have come in search of the ultimate challenge. I'm explaining all this so you won't go in knowing nothing, but beware - I won't repeat myself, so you'd better this sage knowledge in your noggin somehow!

You can select Ultimate Mode if you reach level 40 in Hard Mode. The required experience points per level is more than a normal mode. However, since you have 9 status points and 5 skill points to distribute per level, you can make a more enhanced character what you could attain in Hard Mode

It's also possible for you to use stronger gear in Ultimate Mode than you could in Hard Mode. You can figure this out by reading the title of the item. Although you were able to use as far as Legend-class items inHard Mode, you can use the mighty Goddess-class items in Ultimate Mode.

The most important thing to remember, though, is that your character will be permanently deleted when you die. You can prevent this character deletion through revival via a priest, or with a rune of revival.

That's really all you need to know before starting Ultimate Mode. Now, the only thing left is to see you rise once again as a great hero who knows no equal! I'm expecting the very best from you!
