MsgSummary: You have to return to {c2}Karena Chavi{/c} by using a portal in the {c0}south of Keolloseu{/c} to teleport to {c0}Beika{/c}.
MsgTake:
I nearly forget. {c2}Karena Chavi{/c} in Beika will be worried about you. You've been here quite some time, so go back to Beika now and let her know you're alright.

You can return to Beika safely and quickly by using the portal located in the south of Keolloseu Village.
MsgIncomplete: She's waiting, so go back to Beika now. Don't forget to use the portal located in the south of Keolloseu Village.

MsgSummary: You have to return to {c2}Jenia Wendy{/c} by using a portal in the {c0}south of Keolloseu{/c} to teleport to {c0}Aelbeageu{/c}.
MsgTake:
I nearly forget. {c2}Jenia Wendy{/c} in Aelbeageu will be worried about you. You've been here quite some time, so go back to Aelbeageu now and let her know you're alright.

You can return to Aelbeageu safely and quickly by using the portal located in the south of Keolloseu Village.
MsgIncomplete: She's waiting, so go back to Beika now. Don't forget to use the portal located in the south of Keolloseu Village.

MsgSummary: You have to return to {c2}Daisy Ada{/c} in Suteron via one of two portals in the northeast of Gliter and tell her that you finished all the errands you'd been asked to do.
MsgComplete:
You've finally returned! Did you receive a lot of information from your visit to Gliter? I've heard you gave a big hand to {c2}Lia Kreis{/c}... I hope the errands you ran for her set you on a good path for your adventures to come.

If you ever need to make use of a gate in Suteron, you know where to find me!
Farewell then, for now!
MsgTake:
You came here to receive help, but in the end, it's you who helped me... I don't know how to express my gratitude, really. Did you get a lot of good information from the folks I introduced you to? I should have been a bit more clear with you...I'm really sorry. I hope the information you've obtained from Gliter will be a great help as you move forward in your journeys. I'll send the food to him from now on. Like the others must, I definitely think you'll be one of our great heroes someday.

Well...it's about time for you to find the gate keeper of Suteron; she'll be waiting for your return. I hope luck is with you in your travels.
MsgIncomplete: Now, waiting for that time to pass brings a smile, rather than a sigh~

MsgSummary: You have to return to {c2}Roise Stella{/c} via one of the two portals in the northeast of Gliter and report that you've finished everything that was requested of you.
MsgComplete:
You've finally returned! Did you receive a lot of information from your visit to Gliter? I've heard you gave a big hand to {c2}Lia Kreis{/c}... I hope the errands you ran for her set you on a good path for your adventures to come.

If you ever need to make use of a gate in Aridon, you know where to find me!
Farewell then, for now!
MsgTake:
You came here to receive help, but in the end, it's you who helped me... I don't know how to express my gratitude, really. Did you get a lot of good information from the folks I introduced you to? I should have been a bit more clear with you...I'm really sorry. I hope the information you've obtained from Gliter will be a great help as you move forward in your journeys. I'll send the food to him from now on. Like the others must, I definitely think you'll be one of our great heroes someday.

Well...it's about time for you to find the gate keeper of Suteron; she'll be waiting for your return. I hope luck is with you in your travels.
MsgIncomplete: Now, waiting for that time to pass brings a smile, rather than a sigh~

MsgSummary: Catch 15 {c1}Crow Marsh Tiny Frogs{/c} and report your success to {c2}Muren{/c}.
MsgComplete: Ah, thanks! With this, I can prove how powerful the Deatheaters really are. Now I'll wipe that arrogant smirk off {c2}Losen Piettrei{/c}'s face! Haha~!!
MsgTake:
Oh, hey there. Are you the one who passed the test of {c2}Karantoss{/c}? You know...I think it's true that Deatheaters lead the Union of Fury! Haha! Have you ever visited Gliter? When you were there, perhaps you saw an arrogant Vail named {c2}Losen Piettrei{/c}, a weapon trader. I've known him for over 10 years, but when we talked about military matters, he's always said that the Vail are the greatest and Deatheaters have appreciation for detail; you know, irritating stuff like that. I mean...come on - only physical strength endures in battle. Why talk about detail in war? 

Along those lines, the two of us made a bet. Warriors will bring {c1}Crow March Tiny Frogs{/c} to us, and the first who collects 100 wins. Why don't I do it myself, you ask? I have to sell my wares! Haha! 
We've both got just 15 monsters to go. Can you catch the remaining 15 for me? Do me this favor and I'll see you're rewarded. Now hurry it up!
MsgIncomplete: Losen's too arrogant. If he'd just rein in that aspect, he'd be a fine fellow.

MsgSummary: Catch 15 {c1}Crow Marsh Tiny Frogs{/c} and report your success to {c2}Losen Piettrei{/c}.
MsgComplete: You have my thanks. With this, I can prove the natural superiority of the Vail. This ought to keep {c2}Muren{/c}'s mouth shut, at least for a while.
MsgTake:
You look strong, Vail warrior. That's good - in this day and age, one needs to be. Have you seen the trader {c2}Muren{/c} in Frotainer village? I'm friends with him but...sometimes I don't get the guy. Those Deatheaters, they're so hopeless. They're so rough, so brutish...they don't have the Vails' beauty or our meticulous attention to detail. They think that all it takes to triumph in war is brute strength. But of course, war needs intelligence, detailed strategy, and precision strikes. Deatheaters don't have these. 
Can you help me? {c2}Muren{/c} and I made a bet. The winner is the first to catch 100 {c1}Crow March Tiny Frog{/c}, and the loser has to concede the winner's race as the better one. I only have 15 more I need to get. Can you help me out? Why don't I do it myself, you ask? I have my wares to sell, of course! Who would sell the weapons while I'm off gathering frogs? You look like you've got a strong arm and some time to spare, so I hope you can get 15 of those frogs~
MsgIncomplete: If I win the bet...I wonder if Muren would embrace his softer, more sensitive side...

MsgSummary: Find {c2}Noah Avelune{/c}, the owner of the report.
MsgComplete: I'm sick and tired of you.. I have no intentions to teach you. Maybe, if I do, you won't understand.. Haha!!

MsgSummary: Find {c2}Noah Avelune{/c}, the owner of the report.
MsgComplete: Oh-ho! Are you hear to learn from me? Mmmm...yes, yes indeed! Welcome! My wisdom and knowledge are as high as the sky and more vast than the land. On a completely different level than ordinary folk, heh-heh!

MsgSummary: Deliver {c3}Noah's 100-Page Biography{/c} to {c2}Rakuz{/c} in the Aumeros Security Camp.
MsgIncomplete: Maybe I'll be in trouble when they all come to see me after reading my fantastic biography, heh heh!

MsgSummary: Report to {c3}Noah Avelune{/c} that the job has been finished.
MsgTake: I...I've always wished I could read this again! You've brought the fine 100-page edition too... Have you got any problems with me? That old man...his clothes were so dirty and tattered and I had to read it to him... As soon as I read, he offered to teach me his wisdom and said that I don't know enough about the world. He went after me and got on my nerves... So this time, he told others to return the books to him? I tell you what - I'll take responsibility for collecting those. Poor old fella. How did he lose his mind? Phew.. Anyway, tell the old man thanks. And tell him he doesn't have to send me such touching reading. Anyway, I have to sell my wares, so I'll see you later.
MsgIncomplete: There aren't any customers. Why do I always get weirdos instead of customers?

MsgSummary: Fulfill the requests of {c2}Fighter Vine{/c}, {c2}Ranger Alfen{/c}, and {c2}Mage Aesir{/c} in Starfumos village and be rewarded with one {c3}Ritter's Power Lv1{/c}, {c3}Heliy's Authority Lv1{/c}, {c3}Apostle's Power Lv1{/c}, then bring them to Noah Avelune.
MsgComplete: Hmmmm...good, good! First, I'll transfer the ownership to you since we have an agreement. I'll have to match the material for testing with your job, so tell me which job you are. <warrior, guardian><assassin, hunter><pagan, oracle>
MsgResponse1: Hmm...is that so?
MsgResponse2: Hmm...is that so?
MsgTake: No one knows what I'm about to tell you. I still have great interest in this experiment. I'm not sure whether the report you brought me is truly mine, but at least I recognize some similarities. Anyway, seeing that report makes me want to try it again. If you help, I'll give you the results. First, I need ingredients similar ingredient to the ones I often used in my experiments. I lost all my records and it's nearly impossible to recreate the medicine right off the top of my head - so vast is my knowledge, after all. But that doesn't mean I've given up. In my travels, I found out that there's a medicine similar to mine. It's the medicine that the Union in Starfumos village hands out for friendship. Although I don't know how it's made, their medicine has ingredients similar to mine. Well, here is your mission: go get me some of that medicine. They give it out as a reward for helping them with their tasks. I hate having to do work for them just for some medicine, but for this experiment I have no other options. I'll prepare and you can go and get the medicine for me as soon as possible. I hate waiting, so pick up the pace!
MsgIncomplete: What are you looking at? You'd better get your rear into gear!

MsgSummary: Noah Avelune is about start experimenting. Help him.
MsgComplete: Okay now, what's the best sequence? I'll trust in your luck this time. Anyway, there's no need to worry, since I'll give you whatever comes of this - satisfaction is guaranteed, gyeh-heh! <Apostle, Heliy, Ritter><Heliy, Apostle, Ritter><Ritter, Heliy, Apostle>

MsgSummary: Noah Avelune is about start experimenting. Help him.
MsgComplete: Okay now, what's the best sequence? I'll trust in your luck this time. Anyway, there's no need to worry, since I'll give you whatever comes of this - satisfaction is guaranteed, gyeh-heh! <Apostle, Heliy, Ritter><Heliy, Apostle, Ritter><Ritter, Heliy, Apostle>

MsgSummary: Noah Avelune is about start experimenting. Help him.
MsgComplete: Okay now, what's the best sequence? I'll trust in your luck this time. Anyway, there's no need to worry, since I'll give you whatever comes of this - satisfaction is guaranteed, gyeh-heh! <Apostle, Heliy, Ritter><Heliy, Apostle, Ritter><Ritter, Heliy, Apostle>

MsgSummary: Seek {c3}Mofana Visto{/c} regarding the book printing process.
MsgComplete: What? You came for that?
MsgIncomplete: You don't have to look far to see the vastness of my achievements~

MsgSummary: Seek {c3}Murmuro{/c} in Aruma village regarding the book printing process.
MsgComplete: Oh dear...he sent you here? Uh...I mean...welcome, welcome! The project is going perfectly smoothly!
MsgTake: You have no idea how difficult that old man made this. He suddenly showed up in the village and told me I'd make fortune by selling biographies. I trusted him and put some of the books up for sale. However, people talked badly about me; obviously, not fans of the book. They asked me whether I expected to sell these books for actual money, even! After that, I just chuckd the rest of my back-stock. Now, I'm looking for a job. So...don't ever ask me about that book. If you really want to know about it, go and seek {c3}Murmuro{/c} in Aruma village. He's like the old man, so...you'd better go prepared; that's all I can tell ya.
MsgIncomplete: I'll look for a job.

MsgSummary: Deliver the completed biography to {c3}Noah Avelune{/c}.
MsgComplete: Oh-ho-ho... Those kids did what had to be done! Good, good!
MsgTake: Did she say that? Oh dear... Her views might not be broad enough yet to truly appreciate him. Anyway, his biography's printing process is in the final stage. Oh, these are the proofs of the completed book. I hope he likes it. He has helped me a lot, teaching me the knowledge I needed to do well in the world. Now, my job is to print his biography, so I've gotta give it my best shot! Hahaha, I'm embarrassed to admit it. The present world is about living your life wisely. I hope you learn the same from reading the book. Good luck!
MsgIncomplete: Although my job isn't that related, I'd do anything for him! Haha...look at me, getting embarassed again...

MsgSummary: Fulfill the requests of {c2}Fighter Vine{/c}, {c2}Ranger Alfen{/c}, and {c2}Mage Aesir{/c} in Starfumos village and be rewarded with one {c3}Ritter's Power Lv1{/c}, {c3}Heliy's Authority Lv1{/c}, {c3}Apostle's Power Lv1{/c}, then bring them to Noah Avelune.
MsgComplete: Ah, I knew you'd return soon. Now, let's start our experiment. First, I'll need to know your job. To make sure the reward comes out right for you, I need to test with an item that your job can make use of. So without further ado, what is your job? <Warrior, Defender><Hunter, Assassin><Pagan, Oracle>
MsgIncomplete: Young people these days always want something for nothing. But that ain't the way the world works.

MsgSummary: Noah Avelune wants to start an experiment. Help him.
MsgComplete: Okay now, what's the best sequence? I'll trust in your luck this time. Anyway, there's no need to worry, since I'll give you whatever comes of this - satisfaction is guaranteed, gyeh-heh! <Apostle 4/6, Heliy 1/6, Ritter 1/6><Apostle  2/6, Heliy 1/6, Ritter 3/6><Apostle 2/6, Heliy 2/6, Ritter 2/6>
MsgTake:
So, you're a warrior, are you? No wonder you were so good. Can't be a strong back and arms for this kind of work! When faced with a task, there's no alternative but to complete it swiftly and efficiently!
Anyway, shall we start experimenting? First is...uh...damn, I can't recall which comes first. Could it be that I'm too old? I'll never let knowledge be bested by age! Now see, it's important to mix the medicine in a certain ratio. You brought the medicine so I'll let you set the ratio! When you decide on the ratio you'd like, just tell me. 
{c6}(Do I really have to?){/c}
You betcha! You collected it, so step up and take some responsibility! You young people these days, I tell ya...gotta strike while the iron is hot! Hurry up, and make your decision!

MsgSummary: Noah Avelune wants to start an experiment. Help him.
MsgComplete: Okay now, what's the best sequence? I'll trust in your luck this time. Anyway, there's no need to worry, since I'll give you whatever comes of this - satisfaction is guaranteed, gyeh-heh! <Apostle 2/9, Heliy 3/9, Ritter 4/9><Apostle 2/7, Heliy 1/7, Ritter 4/7><Apostle 3/5, Heliy 1/5, Ritter 1/5>
MsgTake:
So, you're the keen and cunning type, are you? That's good by me; you should enjoy this!
Anyway, shall we start experimenting? First is...uh...damn, I can't recall which comes first. Could it be that I'm too old? I'll never let knowledge be bested by age! Now see, it's important to mix the medicine in a certain ratio. You brought the medicine so I'll let you set the ratio! When you decide on the ratio you'd like, just tell me. 
{c6}(Do I really have to?){/c}
You betcha! You collected it, so step up and take some responsibility! You young people these days, I tell ya...gotta strike while the iron is hot! Hurry up, and make your decision!

MsgSummary: Noah Avelune wants to start an experiment. Help him.
MsgComplete: Hmm...what's the best mixing sequence? Be proud of yourself; you're my colleague in the history-making first test! Gya-ha! Let's mix, shall we? <Apostle 1/6 Heliy 2/6, Ritter 3/6><Apostle 1/9, Heliy 6/9, Ritter 2/9><Apostle 1/5, Heliy 4/5, Ritter 0>

MsgSummary: Find {c2}Saturn Crowa{/c}, the owner of the report.
MsgComplete: This is...what? You...I think you have the wrong person - I'm not who you're looking for.. Just a man with a similar name....

MsgSummary: Go and tell {c3}Noah Avelune{/c} about {c2}Saturn Crowa{/c}.
MsgComplete: Who are you?! Why are you back? What more is left?
MsgTake:
It's true that my name is {c2}Saturn Crowa{/c}, but I don't think I'm the person you're looking for. 
{c5}(I want to hear in detail about the testing on the upper and lower vest){/c}
That...uh...that is... {c5}(Saturn's breath quickens){/c}. Damn. The documents that I've burnt... Why are they still here? It's all my fault. Not much I can wiggle out of now. Yes...as you thought, I'm {c2}Saturn Crowa{/c}. Although our experiment was a failure, it embodied a great vision. The research and testing went smoothly, yet the results weren't what we were expecting. When, with all our investments, we had nothing significant to show for it, I was very disappointed and embarrassed. Thus, I got out, leaving my friends behind. That's the weight that rests ever upon my heart. {c2}Noah Avelune{/c}... I left him there. I should have gone with him to the end, be it sweet or bitter. I still dream of him often. If I have a sin, it's leaving my friend behind all by himself, just to serve my own interests. 
I still worry about my friend's well-being. I don't know whether he's alive, so how can I be forgiven? If only I could verify my friend's well-being, I'll answer all of your questions. Perhaps he's dead by now. Anyway, I have to get back to work...
MsgIncomplete: Your appearance has caused me to remember the regrets of my past...

MsgSummary: Return to {c2}Saturn Crowa{/c} and tell him {c3}Noah Avelune{/c} says hello.
MsgComplete: You're really sure? He's truly alive? Oh God...thank you, thank you!
MsgTake: {c2}Saturn Crowa{/c}... The name sounds familiar, but I can't quite place it. Is he looking for me? Ever since you came, my memories have been flaring up. I suppose maybe I once had a friend like that. However, I'm happy with my present life. I like telling you about all my great achievements. Of course, all the funny looks I get don't bother me - I just smile and go on with life! Folks say I'm crazy, of course. But eh...let 'em think I'm crazy! Gyeh-heh-heh! I'm fine with that. I don't want anyone to hinder my freedom. Go tell this guy that {c3}Noah Avelune{/c}, the great lord of knowledge, is alive and ready to be worshipped! Now get out there and go to it - wouldn't want ya to get bored! Gya-ha-ha!
MsgIncomplete: I must truly thank you. It's been a long time since I've enjoyed communicating with someone. If it's knowledge you crave, I'm always available. I'll regale you with stories of my great achievements! Hahaha!

MsgSummary: Fulfull the requests of {c2}Fighter Vine{/c}, {c2}Ranger Alfen{/c}, and {c2}Mage Aesir{/c} in Starfumos village and be rewarded with one {c3}Ritter's Power Lv1{/c}, {c3}Heliy Authority Lv1{/c}, and {c3}Apostle's Power Lv1{/c}, and bring them to {c3}Saturn Crowa{/c}.
MsgComplete: Sorry to ask so much of you, but now we have to start experimenting. Tell me your job, so I can start testing on the right sort of armor. <Warrior, Guardian><Assassin, Hunter><Pagan, Oracle>
MsgIncomplete: I'm nervous, since it's been a long time since I've done this. However, I promise the results will be worthwhile.

MsgSummary: Saturn Crowa is starting an experiment. Help him.
MsgComplete: So, how should we go about this? Just relax; my skills won't let you down. You just need to decide which medicine to use in the process, since this armor is for your use, after all. Let's give it a go. <Half of Ritter><1/4 of Heliy><Whole Apostle>
MsgTake: Fit for a warrior, right? I'll try my best to make something that'll be useful to you. The sequence in which the solutions are applied is a big factor in the success of the process. Different sequences have been proven to show notably different results. Someone like you needs strong armor, so how about you make the final choice? I treated the medicine so that it only reacts with the armor. Select one of these and pour it on the armor. Then, I'll decide the sequence that follows. Let me know when you've decided.

MsgSummary: Saturn Crowa is starting an experiment. Help him.
MsgComplete: So, how should we go about this? Just relax; my skills won't let you down. You just need to decide which medicine to use in the process, since this armor is for your use, after all. Let's give it a go. <Half of Ritter><1/4 of Heliy><Whole Apostle>
MsgTake: I think we can make something that'll be good for you. What we need to do is mix these 3 types of medication  in a certain ratio. The sequence, however, can be tricky - different mixing sequence result in totally different outcomes. This isn't an experiment on which we can perform infinite tests. Can I trust your luck? I have my own ideas about the sequence, but I'd like you to pick the first one - it's your armor, after all. What I mix and add will depend on what you select. Let me know when you've made your decision.

MsgSummary: Saturn Crowa is starting an experiment. Help him.
MsgComplete: Have you chosen a sequence? Whatever the method is, I don't doubt the results will be great. From my experience, when you think about the results too much, there's a good chance you'll fail. Whatever you chose, choose it with no regrets. Now, make your selection. <Ritter, Heliy, Apostle><Apostle, Ritter, Heliy><Heliy, Ritter, Apostle>

MsgSummary: Find {c3}Vanity Arien{/c} and bring the items {c3}Saturn Crowa{/c} kept with him.
MsgComplete: So, are you the one Abel spoke of? It's first time I've ever seen Abel cross the paths of so many villagers with a smile on his face. You've surely accomplished something great.
MsgTake:
Did you like the reward? Different testing methods have been used for each armor part, and different sequences as well. It reminded me of when I used to conduct such experiments with an old friend, {c2}Noah Avelune{/c}. Ah well...my mind tends to wander like that. When this experiment is over, perhaps I'll repeat it one day, with my friend. He probably doesn't remember me, but that's probably the punishment I deserve for deserting him. I'm simply thankful that he's alive. I feel as though I ought to hide my true self from others. If someday I ignore you, please understand. To achieve solidarity with a friend who threw away his past life, I must discard mine too. Well, let's start. This experiment shall long be remembered in the great annals of history - the last experiment of {c3}Saturn Crowa{/c}!
Go to the warehouse keeper, {c3}Vanity Arien{/c}, and bring me the items. I have made an order for vests for the experiment. Her speech is a little rough, but she was pretty helpful last time I was there. It was my first time making a request of her and she gladly worked with me on it, so pass along my thanks to her.
MsgIncomplete: If I start a new life at this age, people might laugh at me. Let 'em laugh - I'll still praise the Goddess for this unforeseen chance.

MsgSummary: Deliver the {c2}Luggage{/c} to {c3}Saturn Crowa{/c}.
MsgComplete: I'm always being a burden to her. But because of her, I could live in this village without problems.
MsgTake:
When he showed up at first, his face looked as though he carried the burdens of the world. It was back around the time when I had first started as a warehouse keeper. No one wanted to approach him, what with that gloomy face. I tried making conversation with him, but he was always reluctant to mention anything about himself, so I just ended up telling him my stories. To tell you the truth...I never knew 'til today that his name was {c3}Saturn Crowa{/c}, heh. However, now that he's about to leave, I know I'll miss him, but it's great to finally see him smile. Not much I can do, huh...
Oh, here is the upper vest and the bags Mr. Crowa has requested. Tell him that I'm glad to see his smile. I suppose he found something that could make him really smile. Whatever it is, it must be special.
MsgIncomplete: I suppose Mr. Crowa was the first man who ever sat and listened to me talk about my troubles. Sometimes quiet listeners are the biggest help.

MsgSummary: Eliminate 20 {c4}Araky Woods Poison Spiders{/c} and report to {c3}Saturn Crowa{/c}.
MsgComplete: You're quite able-bodied, aren't you? I finished preparing for the experiment before you got here. {c3}Vanity Arien{/c} has left enough upper armor that it's become difficult to just test yours. I have to treat all of these at once, and you can choose whichever you feel suits you, since you should know best from your experiences. Would you select the ratios and input sequence now, please? <Heliy 1/5, Apostle 1/5, Ritter 3/5><Apostle 1/3, Heliy 1/3, Ritter 1/3><Ritter 3/7, Heliy 1/7, Ritter 3/7>
MsgTake: Damn. Even to the last, I have burdened others. While you were visiting her, I tried to visit {c3}Noah Avelune{/c}'s place. Sadly, the road was too narrow. There were also monsters around, so my trip was unsuccessful. The {c4}Araky Woods Poison Spiders{/c} were the most threatening of all. It's quite embarrassing. I had to run from those spiders - if they're in my way, I won't be able to pass through. I'll prepare the experiment for the upper vest, so would you go eliminate them? Killing off about 20 should make the journey much more bearable.
MsgIncomplete: Ack, I must be bothering you all the time. I apologize.

MsgSummary: This is the last experiment of {c3}Saturn Crowa{/c}. Receive the reward he has for you.
MsgComplete: The reaction was truly successful. Now you just have to find armor that'll suit you. Thank you so much. All you've done for me has brought the glimmer of joy back into my life. Well, choose the armor you'd want. This is my last, greatest work. Hahaha! <For Warrior and Guardian><For Assassin and Hunter><For Pagan and Oracle>
MsgTake: When this experiment is over, {c3}Saturn Crowa{/c} will be gone forever. Haha... Thank you - I really owe you a lot. Although I'm ready for my departure, I'll stay in Starfumos village for a while. When I'm done repaying them for their kindness and mercy, I'll leave. I'm so excited that I'll finally get to meet my old friend again...it's like being a kid again, haha! If we meet again, I'll have a new identity, rather than as the scientist {c3}Saturn Crowa{/c}. We'll both know it, so don't be surprised! It's been a long time since I was able to laugh like this, true and free. Thank you.  Let me check over a few last things for you.

MsgSummary: This is the last experiment of {c3}Saturn Crowa{/c}. Get rewarded by him.
MsgComplete: The reaction was truly successful. Now you just have to find armor that'll suit you. Thank you so much. All you've done for me has brought the glimmer of joy back into my life. Well, choose the armor you'd want. This is my last, greatest work. Hahaha! <For Warrior and Guardian><For Assassin and Hunter><For Pagan and Oracle>
MsgTake: Hmm...this looks like fun; you seem to be pretty talented in your field. Haha...It's been a long time since I've gotten such joy from research and experiments. Thanks. Because of your help, I've been able to step forward into a new life without having to look back. The Goddess has yet to give up on me. Well, it looks like my last piece of work is nearing completion. Now I have to clean up the medicines. Once I'm done with the clean-up, come talk to me.

MsgSummary: This is the last experiment of {c3}Saturn Crowa{/c}. Get rewarded by him.
MsgComplete: The reaction was truly successful. Now you just have to find armor that'll suit you. Thank you so much. All you've done for me has brought the glimmer of joy back into my life. Well, choose the armor you'd want. This is my last, greatest work. Hahaha! <For Warrior and Guardian><For Assassin and Hunter><For Pagan and Oracle>
MsgTake: When this experiment is finished, the {c3}Saturn Crowa{/c} of the past will be gone. Haha...when was the last time I ever felt this unburdened? I want to enjoy that luxurious life again.. Thank you. The armor testing is in its last stage. I don't know how much my armor will help you, but think of it as a symbol of my deep appreciation for all you've done. I think the medicine has soaked into the armor, so let me go check on it. I'll talk to you in a bit, then.

MsgSummary: Hunt down at least 15 {c1}Genetick Vipers{/c} and report to {c2}Aksen{/c}. {c1} Genetick Vipers{/c} can be found on the way to the Genetick Black Magic Research Institute.
MsgComplete: Hmm...not bad. When I first saw you I didn't think I could expect much, but honestly, you've surprised me.
MsgResponse1: Thanks a million! With your help, I'll be able to keep them under control for quite some time.
MsgIncomplete: For those kids, I'd do anything. I'm really grateful for your help.

MsgSummary: Receive a reward from {c2}Aksen{/c}.
MsgComplete: Just go on and pick whichever of these you feel is most suited to you. The other ones are military equipment - it'd be kinda problematic for me to just give it away. Thanks again for your help. <For Warrior and Guardian><For Assassin and Hunter><For Pagan and Oracle>
MsgTake: Thank you. The truth is I hadn't thought about getting help from others. You've really helped me, and I want to thank you on behalf of the boy, so I've got a reward for you. To give you the army's items - that's obviously a crime. But I'm out of the army now, and I've got no qualms using their equipment. So, talk to me when I'm done with this.

MsgSummary: Catch {c1}Genetick Vipers{/c} and take at least 10 {c3}Viper Fangs{/c} to {c2}Aksen{/c}.
MsgComplete: Hmm...not as many here as I'd like, but this'll do.
MsgResponse1: Oh yeah! With this, I can save him! I'm so grateful; really, I appreciate all you've done.
MsgIncomplete: These kids...their pain sometimes makes them cry, but when I'm with them, they smile. I want to help them heal the wounds, both on their body and in their hearts.

MsgSummary: Receive a reward from {c2}Aksen{/c}.
MsgComplete: Just go on and pick whichever of these you feel is most suited to you. The other ones are military equipment - it'd be kinda problematic for me to just give it away. Thanks again for your help - I'm sure the kid would thank you too. <For Warrior and Guardian><For Assassin and Hunter><For Pagan and Oracle>

MsgSummary: Receive a reward from {c2}Aksen{/c}.
MsgComplete: Just go on and pick whichever of these you feel is most suited to you. The other ones are military equipment - it'd be kinda problematic for me to just give it away. Thanks again for your help - if we meet again in the future, I'll owe ya one. <For Warrior and Guardian><For Assassin and Hunter><For Pagan and Oracle>

MsgSummary: Hunt down at least 15 {c1}Genetick Poison Mist Zombies{/c} and report to {c2}Berper Yacon{/c} in Huigronn Castle.
MsgComplete: About 15, eh?  Hmmm...it's not bad, but it's also not close to what I was hoping for.
MsgResponse1: Oh yeah! You really put on quite an impressive display. I think I'll listen to what you have to say after all.

MsgSummary: Get rewarded by {c2}Berper Yacon{/c}
MsgComplete:
It looks a little dusty but it's good for fighting, so don't worry. Also, when you come back next time, please be stronger. Then, we can have a challenge even greater than this one was!
<For Warrior and Guardian><For Assassin and Hunter><For Pagan and Oracle>

MsgSummary: Take at least 7 {c3}Hoes{/c} to {c2}Berper Yacon{/c}. {c3}Hoes{/c} can be obtained from {c1}Genetick Poison Mist Zombies{/c} to the west of Huigronn.
MsgComplete: Hmm...these quantities are a bit less than pleasing, but you did try hard.
MsgResponse1: Oh-ho! On a scale of one to ten, you score a 10.75! Great!
MsgIncomplete: My fighting strategy is to take on the enemy with insight sharper than a sword, a fist harder than a mace, and kicks swifter than arrows!

MsgSummary: Get rewarded by {c2}Berper Yacon{/c} for {c3}Hoe{/c}.
MsgComplete: Hmm.. This will do. Anyway, good job. If you want to know about power someday in the future, you're welcome anytime. Now, I have to go farming. Before I go, though, be sure to pick whichever of these best suits you. <Reward for Warrior and Guardian><Reward for Assassin and Hunter><Reward for Pagan and Oracle>

MsgSummary: Get rewarded by {c2}Siren Dearna{/c} in the Asteria Corps camp.
MsgComplete: Are you the person that fighting fool has taken a liking to? He told me to give you an item that looked pretty good. Anyway, I have all the money so here, take it. Not only is he a fighting fool, he's also a gifting fool. You really lucked out! Pick any one of these you like. <Reward for Warrior and Guardian><Reward for Assassin and Hunter><Reward for Pagan and Oracle>
MsgIncomplete: I must rush out for some hot-blooded training!

QuestName: The Boy Who Dreams of Adventure
MsgSummary: Eliminate at least 15 {c1}Kalado West Wind Harpies{/c} and report to {c2}Ruth Merdi{/c}.
MsgComplete:
I guess it was a failure after all. You took out a lot of them, but there's no signs of them leaving. 
Bleah...should I just give up?
MsgResponse1: It was a success! Ever since you came, they've all gone into hiding!
MsgIncomplete: I hope that things go well so I can leave this place.

MsgSummary: Receive a reward from {c2}Ruth Merdi{/c}.
MsgComplete: Heh...I dusted the armor before you got here. Look, it's like it's brand new, teehee~ Thank you so much. Rather than dreaming of adventure, I should be satisfied with the current situation, at least for now. Be careful with your trip, and goodbye~ <Reward for Warrior and Guardian><Reward for Assassin and Hunter><Reward for Pagan and Oracle>
MsgTake: Haha...an adventure was a big dream for someone like me, huh? And you worked so hard to help that dream come true. You did a lot for me, so I brought something for you. This used'ta be my parents armor. Both of my parents were soldiers, and they left behind some nice stuff. Just wait here and I'll go get it. Talk to ya in a bit!

MsgSummary: Bring at least 7 {c3}Magic Alchemy Powders{/c}. You can get them from {c1}Kalado West Wind Harpies{/c}.
MsgComplete: {c5}(It can be cured to certain level.. However.. Maybe in this condition..){/c}
MsgResponse1: {c5}(It's enough. I don't see any problems with curing){/c}
MsgIncomplete: Since my parents died, no one has ever worried about me. It feels...nice, somehow...

MsgSummary: Receive a reward from {c2}Ruth Merdi{/c}.
MsgComplete:
Thank you so much. This was my parent's armor~ They were soldiers, y'know.
It was a bit dusty so I buffed it a bit~ Looks just like new, doesn't it? Teehee~ Thank you so much~ Now, I can dream of greater things! It took me a while, though. Anyway, see ya later! <Reward for Warrior and Guardian><Reward for Assassin and Hunter><Reward for Pagan and Oracle>
MsgTake: Wow, my leg's looking better! But I'm still not supposed to walk around yet. There's a doctor in the village.. He told me that it's difficult for my legs to recover. My injuries will get better in time, but I wonder if I'll be able to run again. But what can you do? Maybe I was fated not to be an adventurer. I'll have to finish studying. Learning can be a great adventure too, right? But I can't just let you go unrewarded, so stay here a second while I grab something good for you.

QuestName: The First Step of an Adventure
MsgSummary: Receive a reward from {c2}Ruth Merdi{/c}.
MsgComplete: Thank you so much. This was my parent's armor. It's old, but it's still pretty good. Pick one that suits the kind of stuff you like to wear. Now, I have to prepare to travel. I hope the Goddess blesses you! Byeeee!~ <Reward for Warrior and Guardian><Reward for Assassin and Hunter><Reward for Pagan and Oracle>

MsgSummary: Take the {c3}Resignation Order{/c} to {c2}Pai Johns{/c} in the Asteria Corps camp.
MsgComplete:
{c5}(Dressed like a laborer?){/c}
Who are you? Are you after me?

MsgSummary: Hunt down at least 15 {c1}Kalado Harpies{/c} to the north of the Asteria Corps camp and report to {c2}Pai Johns{/c}.
MsgComplete: Guh...you're pathetic! When I was your age, I could break rocks with my molars! Is that the best you can give me, soldier?!
MsgResponse1: Excellent work, soldier! However you're doing things, keep on doing them that way!
MsgIncomplete: Heh... They wanted to test the young soldiers on purpose. You heard right; it's something odone on purpose!

MsgSummary: Receive a reward from {c2}Pai Johns{/c}
MsgComplete: Look...just take this and keep things hush-hush. Don't worry about the rest. But, uh... Anyway, chose what you want from among these! This is from our country. Of course, making no reports to the authorities is a fine, fine idea. <Reward for Warrior and Guardian><Reward for Assassin and Hunter><Reward for Pagan and Oracle>
MsgTake: Hohoho...you are not ready for the test! Come again next time, after you grow up a bit! And remember...if the authorities ask about me, tell them I'm following their order. I...I'm in the middle of completing my mission and ON~LY the high authorities know about this! Haha...let me give you something to remember me by - something that speaks well of me, of course! Wait here while I go get what I was gonna give you.

MsgSummary: Hunt down at least 10 {c1} Kalado Tatoramo {/c} in the north eastern area of Asteria Corps camp and report to {c2}Pai Johns{/c}.
MsgComplete: Haha! Oh, nice try but not good enough!! Hahahaha!!!
MsgResponse1: Huh... Good... Good...  Very good! Veeerry good! How can you be so good?! Ha! Ha! Ha!
MsgIncomplete: What a day for bad weather... Hmm... Hmm.

MsgSummary: Get rewarded by {c2}Pai Johns{/c}
MsgComplete: Look... Here it is and please keep it to yourself, Don't worry about it anymore. But.. Anyway! You got what you want! This is from our country... the authorities don't have to know about it. Bye.<Reward for warrior and guardian><Reward for assassin and hunter><Reward for pagan and oracle>

MsgSummary: Hunt down 10 {c1}WedgeRock Tatoramo{/c} and {c1}WedgeRock Tatoramo Trainer{/c}, respectively in the north eastern area of Asteria Corps camp and report to {c2}Pai Johns{/c}.
MsgComplete: Alright... Good job. Oh dear~ Are you tired? Then go take a rest.. I gotta rest too. I used up all my savings... Hahaha the government tells me to rest... so I rest. What can I do? So.. Soldiers.. No, you did a great job. Farewell, I must go pack my things. Pick the one that suits you. <Reward for warrior and guardian><Reward for assassin and hunter><Reward for pagan and oracle>
MsgIncomplete: Hmm... My loss... Carry the one, divide by five... Armor value.. Phew..

QuestName: The number one threat facing Willieoseu
MsgSummary: The situation is that travelers and traders going to Willieoseu are being attacked by the brown bears in Cornwell forest. {c2}Farm Owner Astin{/c} requests you to eliminate {c1}Cornwell Forest Brown Bear{/c}. You'll find the brown bears in Cornwell forest quite easily at the south side of the Astin farm.
MsgComplete: Wow, that was pretty dang quick. The grape shipment is not quite ready to go just yet. Gimme a few minutes.
MsgTake:
We thank you for eliminating the mountain rams and delivering the grapes. Through your help, our vineyard runs smoothly. 

If you got some time to spare, can I make another request? Your job was so nicely done in the past and we've been gettin more orders. We received an order from Haltek farm but those {c1}Cornwell Forest Brown Bear{/c}s make it durn impossible. Those bears also attack travellers at random. 

Before you showed up, people were dying pretty quick in those woods. I swear those things are just goddessless killing machines. Please think it over.
MsgIncomplete: You're really something. You never turned down any of my requests. Not too many people like you these days.

MsgSummary: Astin farm is short of labor so delivery has to be made to {c2}Bar Attendant Daisy{/c} at Haltek farm. The road for delivery is past Cornwell forest and take the south western portal towards Willieoseu.
MsgComplete: Delivery was a little delayed. Don't worry. I've heard that brown bears attacked the convoy and delayed the delivery. Business was down since no tourists were around but because of you there are travelers visiting our shop and we've been doing right since. This is the delivery charge for the grapes. Please accept my thanks.
MsgTake:
Sir, could you make the grape delivery to Haltek farm since you have killed those brown bears? Our vineyard is short of labor. Please, do me a favor. I'll tell you how to get there.

If you follow the road to the south western direction you will see the portal which leads to Willieoseu. Use the portal to pass Willieoseu and walk a little towards the east and you'll see Haltek farm. You can hand over the grapes to {c2}Bar Attendant Daisy{/c} in the bar there. 

When you deliver the grapes please give em my apologies. Thanks.
MsgIncomplete: If you're unsure of the way, ask some travelers on the road.

QuestName: The number one threat facing Willieoseu
MsgSummary: The situation is that the travelers and traders going to Willieoseu are being attacked by the brown bears in Cornwell forest. {c2}Farm Owner Astin{/c} requests that you eliminate {c1}Cornwell Forest Brown Bear{/c}s. You'll find the brown bears in Cornwell forest quite easily at the south side of the Astin farm.
MsgComplete: Sir, you have great abilities since you have eliminated the brown bears without injuries. Through your help we can make deliveries easily and travelers can travel safely. This is my little appreciation so please accept. This isn't much but hope this would ease your travel.
MsgTake:
We thank you for eliminating the mountain rams and delivering the grapes. Through your help, our vineyard runs smoothly. 

If you got some time to spare, can I make another request? Your job was so nicely done in the past and we've been gettin more orders. We received an order from Haltek farm but those {c1}Cornwell Forest Brown Bear{/c}s make it durn impossible. Those bears also attack travellers at random. 

Before you showed up, people were dying pretty quick in those woods. I swear those things are just goddessless killing machines. Please think it over.
MsgIncomplete: You're really something. You never turned down any of my requests. Not too many people like you these days.

MsgSummary: Astin farm is short of labor so delivery has to be made to {c2}Bar Attendant Daisy{/c} at Haltek farm. The road for delivery is past Cornwell forest and take the south western portal towards Willieoseu.
MsgComplete: Delivery was a little delayed. Don't worry. I've heard that brown bears attacked the convoy and delayed the delivery. Business was down since no tourists were around but because of you there are travelers visiting our shop and we've been doing right since. This is the delivery charge for the grapes. Please accept my thanks.
MsgTake:
Sir, could you make the grape delivery to Haltek farm since you have killed those brown bears? Our vineyard is short of labor. Please, do me a favor. I'll tell you how to get there.

If you follow the road to the south western direction you will see the portal which leads to Willieoseu. Use the portal to pass Willieoseu and walk a little towards the east and you'll see Haltek farm. You can hand over the grapes to {c2}Bar Attendant Daisy{/c} in the bar there. 

When you deliver the grapes please give em my apologies. Thanks.
MsgIncomplete: If you're unsure of the way, ask some travelers on the road.

MsgSummary: Take {c3}Rice Supply{/c} to {c3}Chief Duster{/c} at Haltek farm and hear the rest of the story.
MsgComplete: Why do you have those marked goods with you? No one really that our village supplies the military. Where did you find them? You'd better speak up.

MsgSummary: Deliver {c2}Rice Supply{/c} to {c3}Supplier Lanuth{/c} at Arktuis village seaport.
MsgComplete: So, you're the one Duster told me about. I've heard about you through messenger. You're in charge of the delivery and defense of those lost supplies. Also, I'll give you another assignment to test you. Wait here.
MsgIncomplete: By now, the ship to the capital is ready for departure so you best leave immediately. So far, only rice have been found but there is a good chance three different goods that were taken are still out there. So, get me the rest.

QuestName: Be all that you can be
MsgSummary: {c2}Supplier Lanuth{/c} needs 2 {c3}Ritter's Power{/c} to be sent off to the front lines. Collect Ritter's Power and take it to {c2}Supplier Lanuth{/c} in Arktuis village seaport.
MsgComplete: Oh dear. Your abilities are beyond my expectation. You have completed the mission in a given time. How long have I been waiting for someone like you. I would like you to do me a favor with sending messages to Sir {c2}Luferth Ladcliff{/c} at Stardust Knights in the capital Apolune and your stories are included in the letter. You'll hear good news. Go.
MsgTake:
The assignment for you is to look for the most important things the military needs. Try collecting the goods on the list I gave you. Those medications are used by high officers of the Stardust Knights. If there's a problem with the assignment, you'll be penalized. 

Then, let's go back to our main subject. What you have to bring is... There are people in Arktuis village who were formerly members of the Union of Fury that integrated into our society. Have you heard of the medicine made by these people that increases body strength ten-fold?

I hope you understood your mission. You must bring two doses of this drug called {c3}Ritter's Power{/c}. It's not long till our ship departs so bring those drugs to me as soon as possible. 

As I have mentioned before, this mission is to test you. Keep that in mind.
MsgIncomplete: What I wouldn't give to have enough of that medicine so every single foot soldier had one...

MsgSummary: Deliver {c3}Message from Lanuth{/c} from {c2}Supplier Lanuth{/c} to the vice chief of Stardust Knights, {c2}Luferth Ladcliff{/c} in the capital, Apolune.
MsgTake: Deliver my message to {c2}Luferth Ladcliff{/c} as soon as possible.
MsgIncomplete: {c2}Luferth Ladcliff{/c} is at the Stardust Knights HQ in the capital, Apolune. Show him all due respect when you see him.

MsgSummary: Answer the question of {c2}Luferth Ladcliff{/c}.
MsgTake: I have been well informed of your abilities from the letter that Lanuth sent me. However, I can't completely trust you. Thus, I will test you. The results of the test will decide your reward. So, choose wisely.

MsgSummary: The reward prepared by {c2}Luferth Ladcliff{/c} is with {c2}Aran Melos{/c}. Select the armor that best suits your job.
MsgComplete:
Are you the one sent by Sir Luferth? I have received the message. The knight's gauntlet is ready. 

I have some questions for you. Is this your first time answering these kinds of questions? All others who took these gauntlets answered the question. That's why I've asked. You don't have to sate my curiosity. 

Then, please use it wisely since I have made it with my own hands. <For fighter and defender><For ranger and archer><For priest and mage>
MsgTake: So, you have selected the first answer. I have to reward you appropriately with one that matches your answer. There is a trader called {c2}Aran Melos{/c} who sells armors in Apolune square. Go see him and he will give you a gauntlet.
MsgIncomplete: {c2}Aran Melos{/c} in Apolune square is a supplier of armor to our knights.

MsgSummary: The reward prepared by {c2}Luferth Ladcliff{/c} is with {c2}Aran Melos{/c}. Select armor that best suits your job.
MsgComplete:
Are you the one sent by Sir Luferth? I have received the message. The knight's gauntlet is ready. 

I have some questions for you. Is this your first time answering these kinds of questions? All others who took these gauntlets answered the question. That's why I've asked. You don't have to sate my curiosity. 

Then, please use it wisely since I have made it with my own hands. <For fighter and defender><For ranger and archer><For priest and mage>
MsgTake: So, you have selected the second answer. I have to reward you with something that matches your answer. There is a trader called {c2}Aran Melos{/c} who sells armor in Apolune square. Go see him and he will give the gauntlet.
MsgIncomplete: {c2}Aran Melos{/c} in Apolune square is a supplier of armor to our knights.

MsgSummary: The reward prepared by {c2}Luferth Ladcliff{/c} is with {c2}Aran Melos{/c}. Select armor that suits your job.
MsgComplete:
Are you the one sent by Sir Luferth? I have received the message. The knight's gauntlet is ready. 

I have questions to make. Is this your first time joining a group such as this? All the others who took up these gauntlets were members of the Stardust Knights. That's why I've asked. You don't have to answer my curiosity. 

Then, please use it wisely since I have made it myself.

<For fighter and defender><For ranger and archer><For priest and mage>
MsgTake: So, you have selected the third answer. The only people in our order of knights are those who chose the third answer. You're mind is right and diligent as a knight.  I have to reward you appropriately!! There is a trader called {c2}Aran Melos{/c} who sells armor in Apolune square. Go see him and he will give the gauntlet.
MsgIncomplete: {c2}Aran Melos{/c} in Apolune square is a supplier of armors to our knights.

MsgSummary: Take the {c3}Wine Supply{/c} to {c2}Chief Duster{/c} in Haltek farm to hear the rest of the story.
MsgComplete: Your abilities are admirable. It's hasn't been long yet you have found the rest of the goods and allowed me to avoid delaying the shipment.

MsgSummary: Deliver the {c3}Wine Supply{/c} to {c2}Supplier Lanuth{/c} in Arktuis sea village.
MsgComplete: You returned! The rest of the supplies have arrived. Pretty good timing I'd say.
MsgTake:
Perhaps you've lost a little work but some extra help brought me all the remaining supplies so you need not concern yourself with it any more. If you do this one last job, we don't have to see each other for a while... which is quite fine by me. 

Well, it's getting late. Don't you have a ship to catch?
MsgIncomplete: This is rather unusual but I owe you some thanks. Our soldiers won't go hungry because of you.

MsgSummary: {c2}Supplier Lanuth{/c} told you to visit the vice chief, {c2}Luferth Ladcliff{/c} in the Stardust Knights HQ in the capital of Apolune.
MsgComplete: So, you have brought the goods that were stolen by the monsters... It appears I must acknowledge your abilities.
MsgIncomplete: You'll able to reach Apolune when you board this ship.

MsgSummary: {c2}Luferth Ladcliff{/c} wants some medication called {c3}Heliy of Authority{/c}. Find Heliy of Authority and take it to Luferth.
MsgComplete: I think I must have overestimated you. I have to reward you since you completed the mission. Did I give you the gauntlet last time? This time I'll offer you some armor. It should come in handy.
MsgResponse1: You have found enough. Your abilities must feed you but not enough to become a Stardust Knight. Try harder. Wasn't your dream to become a knight?
MsgResponse2: You have found more than enough. It's even well more than enough. It's wonderful that you have found so many in a short period of time. I want to continue working with you. Wait, would you consider joining us? I'll write a reference letter.
MsgTake:
I was going to call you. Do you remember {c3}Ritter's Power{/c}? 

The medication worked well. So, I want to assign you with a mission. This time, get as many {c3}Heliy of Authority{/c} as possible. Once you return, I'm going to distribute it to all my knights. The more the better... However, better little than none at all.
MsgIncomplete: Go and see {c2}Assassin Embla{/c} in Arktuis sea village.

MsgSummary:
Select job in order to receive armor from {c2}Aran Melos{/c}. 
Choose the armor that suits your job.
MsgComplete:
Well, make a selection. Pick one from the following three. 


<For fighter and defender><For ranger and archer><For priest and mage>
MsgTake: You are quite trustworthy... I can always make time for talented people such as yourself. However.. It's not right to keep asking favors to soldiers with a mission to complete. I hope to see you improve your skills. Speaking of which, I have prepared a reward for you that you can receive from {c2}Aran Melos{/c}. I hope the armor saves your life. Take care.

MsgSummary:
Select job in order to receive armor from {c2}Aran Melos{/c}. 
Choose the armor that suits your job.
MsgComplete:
Well, make a selection. Pick one from the following three.  

<For fighter and defender><For ranger and archer><For priest and mage>
MsgTake: You are quite trustworthy... I can always make time for talented people such as yourself. However.. It's not right to keep asking favors to soldiers with a mission to complete. I hope to see you improve your skills. Speaking of which, I have prepared a reward for you that you can receive from {c2}Aran Melos{/c}. I hope the armor saves your life. Take care.

MsgSummary:
Select job in order to receive armor from {c2}Aran Melos{/c}. 
Choose armor that suits your job.
MsgComplete: Well, make a selection. You are free to pick anything. Think of something that will suit your job. No refunds or exchanges. <For fighter and defender><For ranger and archer><For priest and mage>
MsgTake: You are quite trustworthy... I can always make time for talented people such as yourself. However.. It's not right to keep asking favors to soldiers with a mission to complete. I hope to see you improve your skills. Speaking of which, I have prepared a reward for you that you can receive from {c2}Aran Melos{/c}. I hope the armor saves your life. Take care.

MsgSummary: I think we have a situation in Haltek farm. To find out the problem go and see {c2}Chief of Security Alpenia{/c}. He is in front of the central well in Haltek farm.

QuestName: Where in the world is Sandra Seon?
MsgSummary: You have to find the missing {c2}Sandra Seon{/c}. He was last seen in the {c0}Fedion Area{/c} where the Angry Looking Brown Bear has appeared.
MsgComplete: Who are you?! How did you know that I'm {c2}Sandra Seon{/c}? Anyway, I have a mission to complete so get lost! You're just going to get in the way!
MsgTake:
Two days ago, monsters increased their attacks on convoys carrying goods to and from the farm and we have gone the Fedion area to fight these monsters at their nests. However, they were too strong for us. We had to retreat. 

However, {c2}Sandra Seon{/c} was in the heat of the fighting. By the time we retreated we couldn't find him. We could not afford sending rangers to search the area and we had to escort our injured troops back to the village for medical treatment. 

I know it's not right to make requests to you but please help us find {c2}Sandra Seon{/c}, he deserves better.
MsgIncomplete: The place where we lost {c2}Sandra Seon{/c} is near the area where those {c1}Fedion Angry Looking Brown Bear{/c} appeared.

MsgSummary: Help {c2}Sandra Seon{/c} and kill {c1}Fedion Angry Looking Brown Bear{/c}.
MsgComplete: Since you offered to help, you should really have given it your best shot. I'd you like to kill more... People have no sense of duty. Regardless, thanks. Take this letter to {c2}Chief of Security Alpenia{/c} and tell them to get the bar ready.
MsgResponse1: You have killed enough. My job is a little easier. Wait here. I'll give you a letter saying I'm still alive and kickin ass. Deliver this to {c2}Chief of Security Alpenia{/c}.
MsgResponse2: You have great abilities. Barely not a single scratch after killing all those monsters. You certainly made my job easier. The rest, I'll do myself and head back to the farm.
MsgIncomplete: They are strong and smarter than most so be careful. If you make a single mistake, you'll be torn up pretty bad.

MsgSummary: Take the {c3}Message from Sandra{/c} to {c2}Chief of Security Alpenia{/c} in Haltek farm. After delivering the message, choose one armor that {c2}Chief of Security Alpenia{/c} offers.
MsgComplete:
Did you really find him? Really? Is he alive? What has he been doing all this time?

{c5}( You handed over the {/c}{c3}Message from Sandra{/c}{c5}.){/c}

{c5}(With a relief in his face){/c} That's Sandra for you, never quits in the middle of a task. Thank you for doing the job. What we can offer you is a little gold and some armor of our unit. It's not much but please accept our offer. Thank you. 
<For fighter and defender><For ranger and archer><For priest and mage>
MsgTake: Take this message to {c2}Chief of Security Alpenia{/c}. Tell him that I'm doin fine and I'll be back once the mission is complete. Also, I have included your efforts in the letter. When {c2}Chief of Security Alpenia{/c} reads it, he should reward you. Well then, see you later.
MsgIncomplete: I'll be waiting for a reply so take the letter as soon as possible.

MsgSummary: Take the {c3}Message from Sandra{/c} to {c2}Chief of Security Alpenia{/c} in Haltek farm. After delivering the message, choose one armor that {c2}Chief of Security Alpenia{/c} offers.

MsgIncomplete: I'll be waiting for a reply so take the letter as soon as possible.

MsgSummary: Take {c3}Zod's Wallet{/c} to {c2}Chief Duster{/c} in Haltek farm and ask where Zod is.
MsgComplete: You are back. I don't have any requests this time around. Something on your mind?
MsgTake:
Though I love spicy food, this food is terrible. 

It's made of frogs. 
The motive for making this food was from traveling in a harsh wilderness when I had nothing but water. However, Water couldn't fill my tummy and I became nearly mad with ravenous hunger. It's then when I saw this frog. One thing suddenly passed across my mind...

The saying {c5}Hunger makes the best spice{/c} reminded me.

The frog was in my hands and I took out some sauces to cook it over a fire. However, even in my delirious state I realized something- The frog that I was about to eat could contain poison. However, I wasn't very rational since I was far too hungry so I did it anyway and the food tasted good. As I have said before, my tummy felt bad. However, the first taste on the tip of my tongue was nothing better in the world. I will develop and perfect this type of food. This is to find out all tastes in this world. 

 -{c2}Zod Bizarr{/c}-

It's first time hearing the name.. I don't know who he is but he seems like a cook. But, this looks like the diary or a wallet of his. I must hand it over to him when I get to the village.

MsgSummary: Hand over {c3}Zod's Wallet{/c} to its owner {c2}Zod Bizarr{/c}. Zod Bizarr can be easily found in Arktuis sea village
MsgComplete: Who are you? I don't know why you came but welcome if you came to taste my food.
MsgTake:
Zod? I don't know how you came to know him but let me give you some advice... don't ever eat what Zod offers you. This is for your own sake. Zod is a nice guy and all, but he's too much into cooking and you'll never like his food. Just go ahead and see if you think I'm kidding. 

So, you want to know where {c2}Zod Bizarr{/c} is? You can find him in Arktuis sea village.
MsgIncomplete: If you don't want to pray to the goddess of porcelain all night, take my word. Don't eat that slop.

MsgSummary:
{c2}Zod Bizarr{/c} says that in order to make his special dish he needs {c3}Apostle of Ability{/c}. 
Apostle of Ability is carried by the {c2}Pagan Vidarr{/c} near Arktuis sea village.
MsgComplete: What took you so long?! The food could have gone cold and spoiled if I didn't put a towel over it. Anyway, give it a try. My special food has yet to be sampled by the villagers. It's really special.
MsgResponse1: I expected you'd get this much, guess you're easy to read. I made enough so I'll give you the best food you've ever had. What's the name, you say? The dish's name is a se-ca-ret. Heehee. It's more mysterious that way.
MsgResponse2: I wasn't expecting that many! This would be enough and I don't have to worry about potion for a while. Thanks. You've probably got tired from bringing so much. So eat and save some energy! You'll be strong. This is the fantasy of my food! The food name is se-ca-ret! Teehee. It's more mysterious that way.
MsgIncomplete: Hurry back soon! I have to put the last ingredient in before the food set in too much and hardens.

MsgSummary: {c2}Zod Bizarr{/c} has kept an item with {c2}Agatha Hill{/c}, the warehouse guard. Select the armor that suits your job.
MsgComplete:
Welcome. What can I do for you? You came for that thing which {c2}Zod Bizarr{/c} asked me to hold on to for him? You've probably did something inane for him. He's not exactly who I'd call a generous person.

Well, pick one from here



<For fighter and defender><For ranger and archer><For mage and priest>
MsgResponse1: Anyway... Say, you okay? Is your skin naturally a shade of green?
MsgResponse2: Anyway... Are you alright? You're swaying back and forth.
MsgTake:
How's my cooking? This had to be the bestest food you probably have tasted ever before. Right? Right?! 

{c5}(It's true that the taste isn't like anything I've ever had before but why is the room spinning and changing colors?){/c}

Your look tells me everything about how much you enjoyed it. Sorry, I didn't have any left for a doggie bag. Oh, that reminds me I also got another surprise for finding my wallet. Visit {c2}Agatha Hill{/c}. He'll give you something I had him hang onto for safe keeping. It's not absolutely super but should be good in a pinch. 

Take care! Next time, I'll treat you to this recipe I've been working out with Tatoramo eggs served with Pixie scales and Abel er... Apple sorbet!
MsgIncomplete: Get going. You don't have to stay if you didn't care for my hospitality. You'll regret it one day when I open a nice restaurant.

MsgSummary: Find and order {c2}Rios Demian{/c} to return back to base.
MsgComplete: {/c5}...Dead body... I hope it's not Rios Demian's body... {/c}
MsgIncomplete: One man can do many things, but one man cannot do everything. True power comes from caution and knowing ones limits.

MsgSummary: Hunt down at least 15 {c1}Harpy Wind Wizard{/c}s and report to {c2}Cyrus Bearwolf{/c}.
MsgComplete: Did he... He didn't make it, did he? Dammit, it's all my fault...
MsgIncomplete: {c5}I have never met you before today, but I will not forget who you are and how you lived.{/c}

MsgSummary: Take 10 {c3}Gold Magic Silk{/c}s to {c2}Chris Celina{/c}.
MsgComplete: Wow! How could you, like... You must be pretty amazing, for sure! This fabric is the absolute best for making dresses! I can make such great clothes because of you. Thank you. This isn't much, but here's a little appreciation for your hard work...<Reward for fighter and defender><Reward for archer and ranger><Reward for mage and priest>
MsgTake:
So he's really dead... I thank you for finding his body. I considered him part of my family. You see, I believe we become more powerful when we care for each other... That's why the lives of the soldiers in my command are important. It's regretful to know he is no longer among us. I should have been more careful when I accepted his offer to volunteer for the mission. Anyway, can't really change the past. Still, how can I thank you? I am in the midst of fighting a war and so I cannot not reward you personally. 
Ah, have you tried visiting Huigronn and met the Celina sisters there? One of the sisters, I think her name is {c2}Chris Celina{/c}, is currently looking for {c3}Gold Magic Silk{/c} to be used in making elegant dresses. I heard her usual supplier is powerful warriors who come across it in their travels. With your ability, it would be a piece of cake. I believe that the reward she'd offer will be of a great help to you. My most humble apologies for not rewarding you myself. However, I'll tell you where to get the item. If you go to the South Eastern area there are monsters known as {c1}South Eastern Wind Harpy{/c}. These monsters often carry this {c3}Gold Magic Silk{/c}. If you get her these items, she will bestow a great gift. Good luck and may fate smile upon you.
MsgIncomplete: I apologize for not giving you more of a reward.

MsgSummary: Take 10 {c3}Gold Magic Silk{/c}s to {c2}Chris Celina{/c}.
MsgComplete: Wow, this fabric is the best for making dresses! How did you manage to get this thre-Say, y'know you look pretty strong. Heh, I think we'll get along great...
